column10: Review Text

After turning up after a night shift and a 4 hour drive. Check in was smooth, given key card to the room, small and all looked well. Until I tried to shower before a nap, shower blocked ok these thing happen. I head downstairs to let reception know, the young lad on reception told me it will be sorted ASAP, thank you! After a quick beer in the bar unfortunately only bottles available, that I could of got in the garage next door for the fraction of the price but couldn‚Äôt take it to the room. After returning to the room all of my towels had been used to mop the floor and the contents of the blockage of the shower were left in the tray! Hair and scum everywhere.After walking down to reception for the 3rd time this time to get fresh towels. When I finally managed to get a shower I realised the top of the shower door was loaded with the past guests soap and flannel!! Was such a shame great location and a nice room for the price, attention to detail won‚Äôt go a miss, again a great shame as we are heading back to seven sisters a lot over the next few months. So any tips on other hotels won‚Äôt go Amis

Myself and my daughter booked this hotel as it was the best value for our needs. I had no expectations as this was a 1st for me.  We got to the hotel at lunch time where the staff were more than happy to take our luggage whilst we went off sightseeing. We returned later in the evening and decided to eat at the hotel, very nice food. I was very impressed with our twin room, beds slightly too close for my daughter's liking but .... How comfy were those beds. It was amazing. Nice and clean good size towells that actually fit the larger frame. I slept like a log. The shower was good , nice and hot. Breakfast had a good choice of hot and cold items with plenty of tea,coffee and juice. We stayed 2 nights and on the final day we left our luggage again whilst we went to Westfield. Thinking we'd shop all day and just pop back for our bags, however we'd had enough just after lunch. We walked back to the hotel and they very kindly let us stay in the foyer with all our bags for over 3 hours until we got a taxi to catch our coach. A really good experience

I was away for work and just needed a place to sleep, I wasn't expecting much to be honest. I've stayed in these express type hotels before and am usually underwhelmed.  Its actually a great little hotel and exceeded my expectations. The bed was super comfy, there was a spacious bathroom with a powerful shower, and a decent TV with a little chaise lounge / sofa to sprawl on. Free tea and coffee making facilities and a fairly decent room service menu.  Great friendly staff, and a little bar/restaurant downstairs. And spotlessly clean! Very reasonably priced. Cant work out why this is only a three star.  Would stay again.

Overnight stay for 2 days in London. Chose the location as we would be driving to Epping and getting the tube in and this was conveniently located.We wanted to make the most of our 2 days so I contacted hotel in advance to ask if we arrived early could we store our bag and go out for the day, they said yes but would put a note on system to try and get us an early checkin. When we arrived we were able to check in straight away.My wife is a wheelchair user and the lovely lady on reception came to a lower counter and checked us in and checked all was ok and if we needed anything to ask.We had booked an accessible room which was huge and met my wifes needs perfectly after a quick cuppa we hit London!!Coming back in the evening we stopped in the bar for a couple of drinks which were reasonable priced for a London hotel and the bar was comfy and the staff friendly.The bed in the room was very comfy, it was a cold day and it took me a while to work out the heating even though it had instructions but once on the room warmed up quickly. The allocation of Tea and coffee in the room was a tad stingy but they let you get more which was fine.Did not hear any noise and after a great nights sleep, buffet breakfast was lovely especially the sauasages.Didn't have to check out too early so did not need to rush, took bad to reception to be stored while we hit London again, different staff member on reception but again very friendly.Didn't have to wait long to collect bag that evening and staff member wished us a safe journey home.Hotel is a short walk from Stratford Station but if you are feeling lazy you can hop onto a DLR to stratford high street which is even closer!! However if you do the latter note that trains run every 10 mins on that section and you could probably walk and be at the hotel before the train if you have just missed one.Would definitely come back in future

I just wanted to say a huge thank you for helping my wife 30th birthday to be so enjoyable. Visiting the hotel  for the second time this week was nice experience especially on Black Friday and the hotel was very busy.However still the food was absolutely delicious, all the staff were friendly Especially Mayra for helping me get in the right room and Hayate for the lovely breakfast and nice worming welcoming this morning.I will definitely be back to holiday inn westfield Stratford City agin.

column9: Good location, great for the Olympic park
column10: Easy walk from the train station. Rooms at the back of the hotel are very quiet. Great to have breakfast & wifi included in the price, makes it on par with other budget hotels, but this is better quality. Friendly & helpful staff. Breakfast was great - hot & cold buffet, bags & disposable cups for take out. Wifi was good, no problems. Good location for the Olympic park (we attended an event at the Velodrome which was an easy walk & the Orbit) & Westfield shopping centre (spent far too much here!!).

We were here for the London 6-Day race at the nearby velodrome and were impressed right from the start of our stay. Our welcome at reception (sorry can't remember the name but very pleasant young man) on arrival was brilliant and our room on the 5th floor in superb clean and bright condition. We are familiar with the Holiday Inn Express breakfast and it is the main reason we use this chain. It was just as we expected which, for us, means plenty of choice but just as much as you want i.e. not paying for masses of stuff you don't really want. The location was fine for us having researched beforehand the route to the nearest tube station at Stratford. This station served well all the areas we had intended to visit during our stay e.g. The Velodrome, Canary Wharf, O2, Emirates cable car, Thames pedestrian tunnel to Cutty Sark and Greenwich Observatory, the West End, Green Park, The Palace, and Westminster. We had worried before our arrival at what the atmosphere in Stratford would be like given the tragic stabbing a couple of weeks before, but we were actually surprised at how open and friendly local people we met were. The icing on the cake for us was finding that many of the riders and support staff for the race were also staying at the hotel and we actually met an old friend who we had not seen for many years who was working as mechanic to some of the riders. We also met the winner of the mens race, Elia Viviani and GB womens star Laura Kenny to cap an excellent stay.

I was here for one night having stayed at most of the hotels in the area. I must say from the get-go I did not have any major expectations being a 3 -star hotel. However, I left impressed with the good customer service on arrival and throughout. The front of house staff, bar staff and cleaners were friendly. I was given one of the newer rooms on the 5th floor which was cosey, clean, a little spacious and soundproof. There was some tea and coffee facilities, iron & ironing board and menu for room service. I ordered Takeaway for dinner but had the Hotel food for breakfast which came with the booking. It was Buffett style -  the standard English breakfast, cereals, hot drinks, juices and some fruits. It was quite busy (I came down half an hour before breakfast ended) so I took my food to consume in my room which tasted fine. The staff were very helpful during breakfast seeing to some visitors specific needs. The only thing I will note which was is not a major issue is that were only two lifts and it often took a couple of minutes to get one, but aside from that, my experience was great. For a 3-star place, this hotel offers great value for money considering the service, the comfort beds + pillows and warmth experienced. I will definitely return if prices are reasonable.

After a 36 hour journey from Sydney, the last thing I needed was a mess around. Unfortunately,  there are two Holiday Inn's in Stratford...make sure you're going to the correct one.Loved the room with a king size bed and the morning breakfast.Don't waste your time with the IGH awards - points system is a waste of time

We stayed here for one night as we were going to an event at the O2. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfy and a decent all you can eat buffet breakfast is included in the room rate. The hotel ok, is local to the Westfield Shopping Centre, and is about 10 minutes walk from a Jubilee line underground station. It's ok to use as a base, if you're visiting London.

Stayed for 3 nights the room was perfect large bed very comfy,, staff were great and very helpful,, as were the house maids kept the room spotless plenty of  clean towels and reasonable prices at the bar..bathroom excellent and would highly recommend this hotel central to the eastend of London and would certainly stay again.,

column9: Great customer service and a good value
column10: The staff was very helpful in providing directions and assistance with other matters.  We really enjoyed the breakfast (hot and cold items), and it is very convenient to Stratford station.  Newspapers provided as well.  We very much enjoyed our 2 night stay there.

Had a great experience at the hotel. We arrived early and they held our luggage in a secured area whilst we toured parts of London. Rooms were very large by London standards and very quiet at night. Short walk to transit station. Felt very secure and the free breakfast was plentiful and good. Would stay again.

I booked this hotel about 3 weeks prior to the Prudential Ride London that started just around the corner.I could not get a single night booking (fair enough) so opted for 2 nights and was quoted ¬£200 for the room on their reservations line for a 2 night stay which given that they advertise rooms at ¬£50-¬£60 a night was still a bit inflated. I was very clear that this was ¬£200 for 2 nights however I did not receive a confirmation email as promised but I did have a booking reference so was not too bothered.On arrival I was told that the room was ¬£400 for 2 nights which I queried and assured them that I was quoted ¬£200. I was then told it was ¬£200 per night but handed a check in form with ¬£100 per night on this and then told that the second night was ¬£300 which made no sense at all. I spoke with the manager who then confirmed that regardless it was still ¬£400 so take it or leave it (my words not hers).Having trained up for this event for 9 months and standing there with my bike and kit I did not have much choice so reluctantly paid up.No complaints about the hotel and facilities, the room was compact but well fitted and comfortable and they even put on breakfast for competitors at 4.30 am on Sunday morning (had to be at the start by 5,20 am). On another occasion I would highly recommend this place as it is a stones throw from the Olympic Park and probably at more reasonable rates.Definitely feel ripped off and my charity ride costing twice what i had bargained for.

Our stay was pleasant. Breakfast was the same daily, but it did have vegetarian options which we appreciated. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from a huge mall and the train station which was great for us! The convenience was awesome.The maid didn‚Äôt really do that good of a job with cleaning so we did most of the cleaning ourselves. They‚Äôre a bit stingy with the towels so you really have to keep asking if you need extras.

Stayed here with friends for Ride London and it was perfect for our needs. The staff could not have been more helpful and breakfast was served early so we could all eat before cycling. We had our evening meal here and it was good value.

Booked here months ago as was due to participate in the RideLondon 100 cycle event.  Unfortunately had to defer, but still travelled south so didn't waste the room.Great check-in from Jana on arrival and all the staff were fab throughout our stay.  We frequently would arrive back at the hotel and ask for a large glass of ice and they were more than happy to oblige.  Included breakfast was sufficient and we ate here on one evening and the food was good.  Will definitely be trying to get into this hotel next year when I participate in the event.

We've stayed here several times and although Stratford is out of the city it's on the Jubilee, Central and dlr train lines which run every few minutes into the centre of London. There is also a huge Westfield shopping centre just 10-15mins walk away with loads of restaurants. The dlr high street station is just a few minutes walk from the hotel and it goes to London City Airport. The hotel itself is clean and welcoming and there is a buffet breakfast included which is fab! Definitely recommend staying here.

The room is quite clean and comfortable. Staffs are lovely and check-in process did not take long. The hotel is not far from train station (about 5 minutes walk) and the mall is right at the station. The this is in the morning hotel does not have enough space for guests for breakfast if we come like 9 am. but all other things are good.

I would like to express my deep gratitude and extend my thanks for all the helpful information Marco have given me. It is really because of Marco that we decided to make these 12 days worth of bookings.

Met the most hard working and smiling staff in a hotel ever. Was working all on his own with a trainee and could not smile enough or help. Made our whole family welcome acknowledge the fact I was a member let us check out and e extremely helpful. Mazz was his name on duty 27th july 2019.

column9: It's a hotel, erm... that's about all I can say.
column10: There is nothing wrong with this place. It's a hotel that is situated in a place that was close to where I needed it to be. The front desk staff tried really hard and that is to be commended, the room in which we stayed had the requisite number of beds and it also had an ensuite bathroom. The bathroom was useful for using the toilet and for washing, the beds proved adequate for the purpose of sleeping.One great point was the breakfast service. This started early and that suited us because we needed to be out early, the range of food was good and quantities plentiful. Breakfast was included in the price of the room.This review would not be complete if I didn't mention one irritating point that upset me. When I booked the room they said that tea and coffee making equipment was provided in the room, however, there were only two teabags and four UHT milks provided. I'm sure everyone would agree that this is a woefully inadequate provision for an English hotel?So in summary, it's a hotel close to somewhere nearby, the service is adequate if you're not keen on tea.

Walked in and booked 2 rooms after a horrible experience at the Stratford Hunsens Olympic Rooms.  The two ladies at the front desk were great. Understood our problem and made sure we were able to book the 2 rooms. Unfortunately they were booked solid after our first night, otherwise we would have stayed 6 nights. Highly recommend and will keep Holiday Inn in the top of my preference list

column9: Best Hotel Experience I ever encountered
column10: Originally booked across the street from the Holiday Inn Express at the Stratford Olympic Rooms, Stratford Olympic rooms was a DISASTER and had to evacuate due to strong toxic orders and filthy conditions.  At around 9:00pm on June 28th, went to the Holiday Inn Express and was greeted by an exceptional front desk representive.  I explained my situation and need for immediate shelter for me and also for my daughter and her boy friend ( by the way, I was assisted by two representatives, don't know their names, but they were wonderful)  The representatives were able to book us for the evening, which was a God sent.  Unfortunately, they were unable to book us beyond the evening due to the hotel being full for the Red Sox-Yankees baseball game.  They connected with other local Holiday Inns, but they were also booked, they referred us to the Travel Lodge, across the street, and they were able to find a a convenient location after our night at the Holiday Inn.  The rooms were great.  Clean, comfortable.  The breakfast the next morning was very good and again  the morning staff was very helpful..The Holiday Inn and the staff made what could have been a complete disaster a very positive experience.  Based on this experience, I will go out of my way to stay at Holiday Inns and Holiday Inn Express again.  Thank you

We did enjoy our four night stay here. The hotel is very clean and tidy. The breakfast was ample. The restaurant food was really good quality. You are close enough to Stratford but far enough away for it to be quiet. In our room the blackout curtains were very good quality and did the job. Our only criticism was the double bed felt really small. Would I stay here again? Yes üòÉ

Very clean and comfortable, a spacious shower, much more preferable than the tiny plastic cubicles in alot of hotels.I was on the second floor facing the busy main road and didn't hear any traffic which I thought I would, I slept between 3pm-6pm and didn't get woken up by the traffic.Fantastic location, 10mins walk to Stratford Station, a tesco is 2 mins up the road & a 7/11 opposite the hotel.Would highly recommend & would stay again.Breakfast is included in the price.

The room was great. Spacious, clean and quiet. Location is ok. 20 min from Stratford central station. Breakfast was very  poor. Service was nice. An ok choice for a night stay as it is business oriented.

column9: Brilliant hotel, fantastic location and breakfast included
column10: I arrived at the holiday inn express and was greeted by juiletta. She was very receptive and greeted me with a smile. I asked for a room on a higher floor and facing the back of the hotel (the front faces the road) and she quickly found me a room to suit on the fifth floor (room 516). She informed me that being an ihg member I could check-out later than non-members (at 2pm) and the breakfast was included in the rate and could be found on the ground floor. I was also given the WiFi code too which is another win for holiday inn (free WiFi!!!!)I walked into the room and was amazed at the fact that it had functioning air conditioning (Bare in mind this is supposedly only a 3 star hotel!!!). The room was clean and well presented, bathroom clean and well presented and had an ironing board, an iron, hairdryer and in-room safe!! Speechless!!! Had a good nights sleep as a range of pillows of varying hardnesses are provided to cater for different preferences. Went down for breakfast in the morning and the range is fantastic! Croissants, toast, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, juices etc. You even have the option to take your breakfast away in a paper bag.All in all a fantastic hotel!! I will definitely be returning!! I usually stay in the travelodge nearby but after seeing this hotel for cheaper I can honestly say that travelodge are WAY behind the competition. Take my advice and stay here!!! Free breakfast and WiFi (travelodge don‚Äôt offer either)!!!!

A great room with everything you could want. A warm welcome on arrival and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was really good and little touches like free news papers and hot drinks throughout the day made it a great place to base yourself when in London.

Stayed for a weekend whilst visiting London. Good location for site seeing Central London and also close to Westfield Stratford.  Great staff, nice rooms with comfortable bed and good breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

Booked primarily based on location. Only a 5 minute walk to Stratford station and a 2-3 minute walk to Stratford High Street DLR.When we checked in we were allocated a disabled room, we prefer a normal shower rather than a wet room and after asking at reception we were promptly given another regular room. Room itself was great, comfortable bed and pillows. Air conditioning worked well. Huge shower and nice modern bathroom. Very much appreciated the free breakfast which also included cooked breakfast.Would stay here again when I visit London.

Our second two night stay at this hotel.Room was clean and comfortable, with a great shower, tea and coffee facilities, safe and iron & ironing board. Very friendly staff, easy check in and able to leave luggage after check out for collection later.Nice breakfast with good hot and cold options.An easy walk from Stratford stations, Westfield# and the Olympic stadium.Will we use this hotel again? Definitely

column9: GREAT PLACE FOR AN OVERNIGHT STAY
column10: Booked this hotel as we required accommodation in Canary Wharf area.Situated in an easy to get to place with trains a few minutes walk away and for those driving in there is ample on-site parking.Receptionist was very friendly and cheerful and checked us in early. On arrival to the room we noticed that the carpet was not very clean and asked to be moved, which was no problem at all and because of the inconvenience we were offered a complimentary drink from the bar!The facilities were clean but basic but just what we needed for our stopover, we didn't require anything 5star or plush.It was the hottest day of the year so far and we did have a little difficulty in sleeping due to the noisy air con, which we eventually turned off.The Holiday Inn Express rate included breakfast and there was a big selection of cereals, fruit, yogurt, hot buffet, coffee, teas and breads. Some folk had plates piled high with the full English! We had what we wanted and were set up for the day.On check out the same chirpy receptionist asked about our stay and wished us a lovely day.Recommended and if in this area of London again we would definately return to this hotel.

Stayed 2 nights with my 3 and 5 year old boys on my own as my husband was working in London but was not staying with us. The staff were really excellent. Lovely bloke called Mo on reception who was really helpful, very pleasant and very efficient. Also a lovely young woman called Hashin (?) who was in the restaurant at breakfast was so sweet and watched one of my boys whilst I took the other to the toilet. Both members of staff were really kind, interacted really lovely with my children and seemed to understood the challenges of being on my own with two very lively boys. On the day we were due to checkout, my husband joined us and brought the boys to breakfast. Hashin noted my absence and checked very politely as to where I was! We both very much welcomed this vigilance. I think this hotel is possibly used mainly by people on business. We stayed here because it was very good value and the location suited us to visit friends in East London and get into London quite easily. Everything in the room worked (and I think they put us in a quiet area of the hotel) and it was dead easy. On site parking was very limited but following advice we got there early and it was very handy being able to get stuff from the car to the room etc. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough. xxx And the breakfast was lovely too xxx

This is a great hotel, located a short walk from Stratford station and shopping centre. Rooms are clean, comfortable and well maintained. Breakfast was very nice with plenty of choice. Would certainly stay again.

Great hotel. Location is great if you can walk 10 min to Stratford although the key is to take the bus, and there are plenty, to Stratford, or in the opposite direction to the City. Great stay and reasonable rates. Breakfast is adequate.

column9: Comfortable and not expensive. Good location
column10: The hotel is located in the residential neighborhood Stratford. Excellent location. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Stratford station, where you can find everything you need. Or 2 minutes by bus. From there you can take the Jubilee and Central Tube lines, to central London. Helpful and nice Staff at the reception. Good regular hotel room. A little bit too small for 3 people. English breakfast has quite a lot of variety. Enough to start the day. There are fruits, but not vegetables. Coffee from the machine is ok. Food (dinner) at the bar was good, and reasonably priced.We had only one issue: At the first 2 days the room has been poorly cleaned. After we complained, it was ok during the next days.The room price is very reasonable, comparing to very high prices in the center of London. Good price for value. We will certainly return.

I loved the location of this hotel. Within walking distance to bus and metro station. In the area were shops,plazas,restaurants, malls,casinos,laundromat,parks. We didn't want for anything, it was all right there.I will stay here again.  Free buffet breakfast and the room service menu food was absolutely delicious.

A very clean an nice hotel with friendly staff in which I have enjoyed staying in.  I think if I was to return to London I‚Äôd prefer to stay closer to the o2 Arena so I‚Äôd probably choose the Holiday Inn at Greenwich  ext time purely for location reasons.  I would recommend anyone to stay in the Holiday Inn.

Nothing much to say, you will get what you paid for, worth every penny.Good staff great service.Good room, specially availability of charging and switch outlets.Food is good nothing special nor anything to complain for.When not sure what to choose. Book here.

Great location close to Westfield Shopping centre and The Olympic Park. Room was great and you couldn't hear traffic outside lovely comfy bed and pillows lots of extras and nice buffet style breakfast

column9: Excellent staff, fab location, comfy bed and great food!
column10: I recently stayed overnight for a conference and had a really enjoyable stay. Upon arrival I was greatly very nicely and checked in straight away. My room was spacious with a giant bed and a selection of pillows which I then spent more time that I should getting the mix right. This led to an incredible night sleep though and it was so quiet, especially given the great location. The breakfast was plentiful and lunch was incredible. There were even lots of alternatives for Vegans which was so nice as still quite rare in some chain hotels. The Conference Team were always on hand refreshing our water and we were well looked after. I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay, for business or pleasure. The Team really were delightful and nothing was too much.

very pleased with our stay here, pleasant staff, rooms adequate big bed. Can recommend the breakfast included in the price, would stay again. Westfield close by also with plenty of places to eat.Drinks reasonably priced also.

I was greeted by a new team member on training who gave me all the required information always with a smile and even offered me an extra key even though only for one. Getting into the room I was surprised to be offered a choice of soft or firm pillows on a bed which was lovely and comfy nice view out of room, very clean, no noise. The lunch the following day was probably the best I have had in any hotel.

Hi, I had a meeting at the hotel and stayed the night before.  I was greeted with the biggest smile and given all the information needed without having to ask for it - that is why I voted for Edita.The breakfast and lunch are worthy of a nomination too as they were high level of presentation and the hospitality was at a different level.Thank you all for a great experience.Alina.

On my visit I have noticed the friendly staff members, always happy to help, nice breakfast and lunch. The rooms are very clean, nice layout, I had the chance to press my evening outfit as an iron and ironing board were available in the room.A great experience!

Easy and fast check in, staff were friendly and efficient. Room was fab and my bed was oh so comfortable. Great shower. Breakfast was plentiful and very tasty. Close by to great restaurants and of course shopping!  Thank you Holiday Inn Express.

Lovely room and excellent food! I really thought it was a nice to see a nice building. The reception area was nice and the staff we so welcoming and very smiley. The inside of the room was very professional and stylish.

HiI love unashamed three star accommodationsSo cleaver this hotel - super service, great rooms and comfy beds, nice breakfastAnd, close to the  Olympic Village, Transport nodes and Stratford CentreI so enjoyed my four day stayWell done and thanks!

column9: Recommended for a short stay in london
column10: Close to many London attractions. The staff were fantastic, friendly and superbly helpful. All areas were clean and the room was clean and very comfortable.Breakfast was good quality and continually replenished. EVERY member of staff I dealt with, made it a pleasure to stay here.

column9: Superb hotel at a budget price
column10: From arrival to leaving, everything perfect. First time in this hotel, for visits over last 15 years have always stated with a competitor, tried this because much cheaper, happy I did, far superior. Professional, polite and friendly staff. Easy walk to Stratford station where it is easy to connect with anywhere in London.  Loads of bars, restaurants a walk away and the hotel has a good bar and food too. Lovely clean room, beautiful bathroom. Excellent WiFi. Amazing breakfast which is INCLUDED in the room rate. The whole hotel is in good condition and impeccably naintained. Cannot fault the enjoyable atmosphere of this hotel and the professional, friendly staff. Wish we had been there before and for sure will return

column9: For a basic hotel remarkably good
column10: Stayed one night for business with my only complaint being that it‚Äôs a bit of a walk to the Tube...10/15 minutes. Despite that it‚Äôs clean and the staff are well trained and friendly. A good breakfast spread and efficient and friendly service. Not too expensive either.

Room was clean and quiet, breakfast was substantial and tasted fresh with a good selection of hot and cold food. The best value hotel within 30 minutes on the tube of the west end & Waterloo. Free wi-fi and tea & coffee in the room. What more could you want for ¬£35 per person?!

Overall the staff were friendly, room was not too small and beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was fairly basic, but adequate. For me it would have had a higher rating had there been toiletries of the necessary standard - the soap and shampoo were squeezy bottles attached in the bathroom. I particularly missed having conditioner - when travelling for work for a couple of days I pack light and hope not to have to take shampoo and conditioner with me.

This place is such a great location for a trip to London, in Stratford shopping centre basically. Friendly and efficient service, a great breakfast and very comfy beds! My go to place to stay when in London

I was working in London on Friday and decided to stay as had ticket for the evening game West Ham v Fulham and planned having a few beers before and after. Hotel is tidy with nice rooms; I was on floor 6 which was very quiet. No parking but Stratford International was a brisk 20 minutes away which cost ¬£9 for 24 hours. Hotel is walking distance to Westfield with many restaurants and also London Stadium. Ye OldBlack Bull at nearby Broadway has a good range of beers and busy on match days. The breakfast is very good, both hot and cold options on serve your self basis.

column9: Clean, comfortable and friendly with a great breakfast
column10: Stayed here for a 2 night midweek leisure trip to London in February 2019.  Check in is published as from 3pm but we arrived at 1.30pm, expecting to leave our luggage in a storage room, but we checked in and directed to our room with no quibble at all.  Was pleasantly surprised when we entered our room as usually stay in Premier Inns and did not expect it to be as good.  However our room was spotless, spacious, very modern and I did actually say Wow upon entering.  The bathroom was sparkling with complimentary washing toiletries.  There was an ironing board, iron and normal hairdryer (not the attached to the bathroom wall type so common in most hotels) as standard and kettle with good supply of tea, coffee, milk, sugar and sweeteners.  Breakfast, which is included in the price, was superb.  Advertised as continental so expected quite a basic fare but there was a great choice of cereals, fruit, yogurts, toast, jams, egg, bacon, sausages, pastries etc. Very impressed!  The hotel is located on quite a busy road but our room was located at the back so didn‚Äôt pose a problem, overlooked a primary school so extremely quiet during the night time hours.  The nearest Train station is Pudding Mill Lane on the DLR but Stratford Westfields is only a 10 minute walk in the other direction and has the underground as well as the DLR.  I seriously would not hesitate in booking into a Holiday Inn again if this is the standard to go by - superb.

I was greeted on a Monday eve with a big smile and warm welcome My booking was checked and confirmed and details on meal times and services explained Mariana was a lovely host in the restaurant when I ate there Mon and Tue eve. Food was hot fresh and very tasty. The room seemed recently refurbished to a great standard, the bed was comfy and very clean, there was all I needed (kettle, coffee, iron and board, hairdryer, shower gel) The working desk area was perfect for my catchup work in the evening.The bathroom was spotless and bed made while I was out in the day.

column9: Stay here with work whenever I can.
column10: Cannot fault the hotel.  Room was clean and comfortable, staff were friendly and the breakfast was really good.  The only real negative is the location.  Unless you're working, Stratford isn't the nicest place in the world, so be careful when walking around.

A nice hotel near Westfield mall Startford (10 min walk). The room was newly renoveded so is was very good. Typical english breakfast that was decent. The only thing to complain about (if I must?) was that the restroom was very cold.

column9: Great alternative to access London ExCel
column10: About the Hotel: Recently renovated rooms, like new. Clean and neat, shower pressure was excellent and no problems with hot water supply both mornings and evenings. The breakfast was above average for Holiday Inn Express. The food in the restaurant was very good, I can recommend the burger and chips. The staff are friendly, respectful and helpful.About the location: Use the DLR at High Street (5 min walk) to access London ExCel or Canary Wharf or London City Airport or any other connection.

My second visit and if in future I visit London again..this will be my home.It has all....fantastic modern rooms with all facilities required for a good stay...very comfortable beds...excellent housekeeping and above all very friendly and helpful staff. The restaurant serves delicious food and even when we placed a late ordered we were served with a smile.One word describe it all...Excellent.Salvu (Malta)

Myself and my boyfriend arrived at the ‚ÄòHoliday Inn Express‚Äô in Stratford on Saturday 19th January for one night. We were greeted to find out that I was awarded guest of the day which was displayed on a board on reception - this entitled me to 2x free drinks and 1000 IHG points and was a very unexpected but lovely surprise to our stay.Our room was spacious and contained a king size back. A hair dryer, iron and iron board were also available in our room as well as the usual tea and coffee facilities. The bathroom: The bathroom contained a very nice shower, towels and hair, body and face wash as well as water flannels. A sign on the wall displayed ‚ÄòForgitten something? If you have forgotten a toothbrush, toothpaste, cosmetic pads, razor etc. Please ring reception and we will be happy to supply them‚Äô - this is a lovely touch to the stay if you ask me.The view: We stayed in room 616 which was on the top floor and looked out of the window to see London Stadium tucked away and the ArcelorMittal Orbit as well as Westfields shopping centre all of which is only a 10 minute walk away.The staff: The staff really made my stay. They were forever smiling and friendly (especially the receptionists) On arrival, our room was spotlessly clean - Thank you.The Food: We did not eat in the Holiday Inn Express on the evening as we ate out however we had breakfast which is included in the price when you pay for your accommodation. The breakfast was delicious (so much so I had 3 plates, whoops!). The breakfast food available was a full English, fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, toasting machines and hot drinks including latte, Americano, tea, hot chocolate and a mocha all to a high standard. Thank you so much for our stay! We will see you again very soon I‚Äôm sure. B x

I often choose to stay in Stratford when visiting London, the area has gone through an amazing change and has become really nice. This hotel is also quite close to the station, with only 15 mins to central London. The hotel has a big lobby and bar, with very serviceminded and friendly staff that makes you feel welcome. Rooms are going through refurbishment, which makes them even more nice than they already are. Rooms are clean and spacious, with great beds. I prefer them compared to the neighbouring Travelodge. Breakfast is included and its quite good, with bacon, eggs and sausages. But I really miss cheese and ham, which I think are essentials in a good hotel breakfast. But overall, this place gives a great value for money and I definitely want to come back

We were warmly received by Vanessa at the Reception. Stayed in one of the new rooms on the 6th floor. I enjoyed every bit of my stay. The room was more than standard. Shining bathroom. Sparkling clean with a massive television, safe, tea and coffee making facilities, safe, iron and ironing board, hairdryer. I was super comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. Nothing to fault. Various options full english, cereal, hot drinks. This is included in the room rate. It was too good i had both üòÅ If you are stuck for time, there is the option to grab and go. Service was faultless. There is the dinner option as well but i didnt try it. Its a 7 minutes walk from stratford station which is super convenient. Theres is a Tesco express 5 minutes walk from the left of the hotel. Currently, there is some refurbishment going on but I am definitely coming back and referring Holiday Inn Express to the world.

Good location - 7 mins walk from station , spacious rooms and friendly staff. Restaurant is open from 6 pm till 10 pm and wifi is available at good speed. If you have meetings around Stratford staying at this hotel will be advisable . They have provided reading lamps .

We spent three nights at the hotel and would definitely stay again.  The hotel is in a convenient location with good facilities.  Breakfast was included in the price and offers a buffet style of hot and cold food.  Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  Staff were friendly and efficient.  Looking forward to going back in the future as it is a good base for exploring London close to bus and rail links.

My husband and I had to come to London on a personal business and we stayed for 2 nights at this lovely hotel, it's an hidden gem! We have stayed in different hotels in the same area before, but we were really impressed with this one. We had a warm welcome from the receptionist, the room was large and airy! There were some upgrading works taking place during the day but that did not bother us as it was so quiet at night. The room had all the amenities as described on the website. The breakfast was scrumptious and what's more it's included in the price. We would have giving it 5 stars but the only complaint we had was that the water temperature in the shower was not hot enough for us, otherwise we will return again and highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed overnight and was impressed by the location to blackfriers train station which was in walking distance. The hotel was quiet and the rooms clean, warm and plenty big enough.The rooms weren‚Äôt terribly well lit and with no socket near the mirror. It was harder to use a hair straightener when getting ready to go out but these were the only negatives. The staff were polite and efficient. When confirming that we hadn‚Äôt had time for breakfast, we were given some lovely fresh fruit!We would definitely stay here again!

This was our second stay at this hotel. It ticked all the boxes for us. Good family accommodation, with a decent breakfast and wi fi. The location is great for shopping at Westfield centre and for the Olympic park stadium. Transport links really close at hand. Although refurbishment work is in progress this was not obvious and it didn't bother us. This is a great staff team, and a credit to Hilton. I left a significant amount of money in my room which was returned to me..thank you . We will definitely use this hotel again.

I stayed in the hotel for a night on the 19th of December and all the process from the check in to check out was spotless!The team was constantly smiling, interact with me and the rest of the guests.I strongly suggest this hotel.

column9: Excellent HI Express hotel in a great location
column10: 3 nights here in a refurbished room which was very pleasant. Every single member of staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Customer service appears to be paramount here. We had a plumbing issue in our bathroom which was resolved to our satisfaction very quickly. Close to DLR and Underground and of course, the huge Westfield shopping centre. We only used restaurant for breakfast and the bar is open until 1am which is great for a drink when you return to hotel in the evening. Would certainly stay again.

Hotel in the process of refurbishment, but it's not a problem, certainly in the night.  I had a refurbished room on the 6th floor.  Clean, well laid out, with a large, very comfortable double bed, large TV, tea, coffee, etc.  Good bathroom with shower.  The only drawback for me was the constant hum of the aircon in the night.Breakfast was buffet style with a good choice.  While not luxury it is reasonable good quality; nothing to complain about, especially as it was included.  Well placed with a 10 min max walk to the station and the 15 minutes or so on the underground to Central London.  Parking a 15 minute walk away at Stratford International Station for ¬£6 for 24 hours.Was allowed to check in early for no extra cost.All in all a good place to stay at a reasonable price for access to London.

Decent stay. However the bed is very firm and the too small (I am used to a king). Also the room very hot and air con didn't work/make any difference. Breakfast was ok. Decent selection of hot food. However, went to get more food and not only had our nearly full cups of coffee and juice been cleared away but someone else sat where we were!!

Ideal place to stay for a visit to the 02 as it is only two stops on the Jubilee line, also has the bonus of the Westfield shopping centre close by.we used it for a one night stop, only 10 minutes walk from coach and rail stations mainline and underground.. Breakfast was included and there was both hot and continental

I stayed here for 2 days in October, 2018. The room was good, but lacked basic facilities. One of the receptionist was rude and wouldn't answer clearly to anything I asked him. He would give a blunt reply to anything that we ask. And for water I had to go down to reception and drink. Breakfast was above average. But everyday, the menu was same. There was no change to the breakfast menu. If we are staying there for a longer time, breakfast would be a concern.

Good price for what you get. 10min walk from the tube station and westfield shopping centre. Breakfast and basic but fine. The staff on the front deak were extremly helpful and friendly. Happy with our stay

Only stay overnight after watching the cycling in the Velodrome but I will highly recomend this hotel to any traveller looking for a good place to stay. We could not fault it from friendly Staff in the Reception, to the hardworking staff that keep the room clean and the Staff working in the kitchen, even the Asian Lady  (Chinese)? helping during breakfast.The room has coffee maker although bring your own tea bag if you like something strong. Just be aware the double bed is a bit small in size for 2 people ( will in our case anyway ) but as we are only staying for one night it's ok. Room is clean, lovely shower gel not that horrible smell I had in a hotel in France, they even add a little touches ( note) if you forget some toiletries essentials, they will provide it.Breakfast is great, good selection, even got vegetarian sausages. Good location from the Straford train station, just 10 minutes walk either follow the High St or Jupp Rd using the overpass. Not far from the Olympic stadium and football stadium. Ideal hotel all round for anyone looking for a great place to stay with excellent services. ( There is a room in the lobby  5th floor with ironing board/iron, not sure if all floors have this.

column9: Good hotel not far from transport links
column10: I spent three nights here and was very impressed.  Staff were very kind and helpful, breakfast was excellent.  I had my meals in the Intu centre about ten minutes walk away.  I thought this was the holiday inn above the shops but it isnt, and is some distance away so make sure you are booked in correct hotel.  Standard design new hotel.  Wifi signal was poor in my room  but no other grumbles.

I've stayed with friends 3 times in the past year and would highly recommend it. Excellent value for money, friendly staff and the breakfast is reasonable. Most importantly, the room facilities are looked after well and my sleeps were completely uninterrupted. I forgot to bring toothpaste but the staff were happy to give us some. Also, there was no iron in the room but there was an ironing room on the floor above so it wasn't a massive issue. Some of the other guests could have had a lesson in manners when at the breakfast buffet but that's no fault of the hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights whilst we were visiting from Manchester and doing our touristy bit. I am a West Ham fan and we picked this hotel as it is a 10 minute walk from the London Stadium and I had a stadium tour booked. Likewise it is a 10 minute walk from the Stratford tube station and Stratford Westfield shopping centre. The hotel rooms are perfectly serviceable and clean. The staff were always keen to help you and check that everything was OK. Breakfast is included with the cost and it is a help yourself buffet style. All the food was good and set us up for a busy day. There are even ‚Äòtake out‚Äô coffee cups so you can take some caffeine with you as you start the day. I would recommend this hotel and we will be using it again in the future.

It's about ten minutes from Stratford station, and you reach London's center in less than half an hour. A reasonable trade off when you consider the price.The room is minimalist, but the mattres is perfect and the space is ok.Plus, the breakfast is really very good.

We stayed 4 nights in hotel and we hd good experience with Holiday Inn. Location is really good - Tube is very close to the hotel and you can easily reach all parts of London from Stratford station.Hotel was good- rooms are large enough,  cleanless is OK (it could be better in some parts), staff is nice, breakfast is OK... only thing I didn‚Äôt like is that there isn‚Äôt toilet brush in bathroom.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 days as our base to explore London, and liked it a lot.  A 10 minute walk to the Stratford Tube station, and from there 20-30 minutes to central London.  More like 60 minutes (walking plus Tube) to sites on the other side of London, for example the V&A Museum.  Breakfast was included and very good.  Our room was clean and quiet, and fairly spacious although there was little space to unpack/organize clothing.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Bottom line: we would definitely consider staying there again.

The Holiday Inn Express in Stratford is a very conveniently located hotel. With the Underground, Bus terminal and the Mall located so close (8 minutes walk) it is just ideal for any tourist.  There is also a Tesco Express a block away, if you want to pick a sandwich or any snack. Unfortunately the daily breakfast doesn't offer a wide variety. Same items all through your stay. For drinking water one needs to walk to the reception to pick a pitcher or two.The hospitality, cleanliness, and quality of sleep is good. Overall, it's location will force me to think twice to book anywhere else.

Perfect location for Olympic Park and Stratford Shopping Centre - just a 10 minute walk left from hotel and through the bus station or up the steps into the shops. Parking is available at ¬£20 per night which is really convenient and safe. Bus stops directly outside! Room comfortable and clean, shower room a little tired but clean! Good selection of breakfast items but nothing ever really hot just warm.

The hotel is great the staff are very helpul at the front office .The rooms are well kept credit to my housekeeper.This is a suggestion...you need to improve tje breakfast menu add more options. Will be back.

Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 5 nights, out of those 5 night, twice we arrived back at the hotel to find that our room had not been serviced after 4pm after leaving the room before 10am, so no excuse that we were inside the room and they were unable to service it. On enquiry at the front desk we were informed that the rooms were only serviced every second day and then only the bath room. Very disappointing!! On our departure we were informed that this is not the case but a shortcoming in the housekeeping department that would be investigated. Very disappointed in the housekeeping issueüáøüá¶

Stayed 3 nights fr a birthday treat to London the hotel is a typical holiday inn express ! The room was standard size but no place to hand clothes but a couple of hangers Breakfast included in room rate which every morning was extremely busy abit of a bun fight ! but overall the food was ok The location of the hotel Which is about 10 minutes walk from Stratford tube station is ok but it really depends on where you need to be in London,I personally thought it was abit out of the way particularly for west end ,staff were pleasant enough and I would stay again

Good location for Westfield shopping and all types of transport links.Nice staff and good breakfast.Quite a small car park and expensive but the Westfield car park close by.Would stay again.Rear rooms may be best.

column9: Good location, need to improve breakfast menu
column10: Hotel is very well located next to Westfield and Stratford underground. Makes a perfect sense for a business traveler as it has many options for eating and shopping  next door.The only complaint one can have is the breakfast menu which could be improved.

I travel to London a lot and this has proven to be the best hotel from a convenience, price,  quality and cleanliness perspective. Price is always unbelievably good value. It's less than 10 mins walk from Stratford train station which in turn is only 10 minutes train ride from London Liverpool Street. It's always fantastically clean and the breakfast is simple, effectively done and free! Reception staff are always welcoming. It's a 10 minute walk to Westfield, with an abundance of shops and restaurants. This hotel really shows how great Holiday Inn Express can be.Can't recommend enough if you are staying in London

Booked a room with two double beds as per photo on website. Got a TINY room with a double bed and a sofa bed, which had definitely seen better days! Dipped in the middle and was very uncomfortable. Aircon didn‚Äôt work so room was very hot all the time. The bathroom was in need of a good clean. The shower cubicle seal looked like it hadn‚Äôt seen a bottle of bleach in years as it was covered in black soap scum. Parking was ¬£20 a night. Bit steep. Staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Very handy for tube into central London.

Hotel staff really friendly, helpfullüëç. Room for 1adult and 2 children was allright. Little storage for clothes. Clean but basic. Wifi good. Breakfast was good but buffet room was to small so it was crowded sometimes. From hotel to underground about 10min walking. For visiting the centre of London it was about 30min with the underground. Good stay in Holiday Inn Express.

We stayed for 11 nights and I was happy with our very clean room.  The hotel offers a fantastic breakfast with plenty of seating.  It's located close to a bus stop.  The staff was very courteous and accommodating when we had questions.Only cons for me was no washcloths.  If I had asked there might have been some available but I used the paper towels provided.  Wifi needs improved.  If I visit London in the future I would consider staying at this hotel again.

This is the second time I have stayed here and although it is not in the centre of London it is only a 5 min walk to Stratford Train Station. The rooms are clean and have everything you need for a short break. The staff are very friendly and the complimentary breakfast in the morning is a bonus. We'll definitely be back.

We stayed for three nights to allow participation in the Prudential RideLondon cycle sportive.The location was perfect for our requirements with a  short ride to the start of the sportive near the Olympic Park. The location would also be good for the Westfield shopping centre. Our rooms were clean and tidy and the hotel was tolerant of a lot of bikes (in bike boxes) being brought into the hotel.What struck us most was the standard of the staff as everyone we met was excellent, very polite and welcoming.

I stayed two nights, either side of the recent Prudential RideLondon-Surrey 100 cycle sportive.The location was perfect for my requirements - mainly a very short ride to the start of the event which was from the Media Centre in the Olympic Park.On arrival, the only downside to the property is the small car park - which was already full at 2.30 on a Saturday afternoon.  OK, car parked in neighbouring ticketed bay while I checked in and unloaded my stuff. Hotel not phased about bikes in rooms. Then I went and parked in Westfield's car parks - about 15 minutes walk away and substantially cheaper than the hotel's ¬£20 per car per night charge (I think my two days cost me about ¬£16 at Westfield).Room was fairly standard HI Express fair, with bed, sofa(bed), desk, open hanging space, tea/coffee and kettle, mid-sized TV and a WC/shower 'corner'.All very clean and generally in good condition, as you'd expect from a fairly recent building.Staff on front desk and bar/restaurant I found to be very good. Helpful, cheerful, on hand if you needed them.Talking of bar/restaurant - a couple of nicely poured pints... there was a choice of lagers and Guinness on draft plus plenty of other options in the fridges.I ate here on both evenings - I was on my own and find if night one isn't bad it's easier to just stay put on another occasion.  Because of the event the hotel had arranged a buffet for Saturday dinner with a combination of great carb-heavy food for the cyclists. And very reasonably priced too at ¬£14.The second (post-ride) evening I'm not sure I could've gone out even if I wanted to! 100 miles down all I wanted was some good comfort food and there was plenty to choose from on the regular menu.  Again I felt reasonably priced and certainly tasty and good quality.Overall I would stay here again for another event in the area - though it's not somewhere I would make a special trip for but then it's not that sort of place!

The hotel is comfortable with secure car parking available. There is a bar area with evening meals available which are fine. Breakfast is a little chaotic as it is everyone for themselves but not a real issue. Best thing is the location for the Olympic park which is a 10 minute walk as is the Westfield shopping centre which has a number of restaurants, shops etc. Excellent access to overground and underground links into central London within walking distance or about ¬£6 in a taxi.

Stayed here for one night as went to the hockey‚Äôs World Cup. The hotel is about 40mins from kings cross station in a taxi and about a 15minute walk to ththe Olympic Park. The hotel was very clean and modern.  The room again was very clean, nice comfy beds.  Breakfast was a buffet style; cereals, toast, hot food. Selection of drinks. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed in the Hotel for one night as we were going to the theatre in the west end.  Nice and clean b budget hotel.  The breakfast which was included in the price was good and set us up for the trip home.  The only issue we had was the parking, limited space and we got boxed in. The duty manager Andrew was very helpful in guiding us out.

Decent, clean room. Food in bar fine. Breakfast included and plentiful. Staff professional. Fine for a business trip. Easy walking to Westfield etc. Vending machine in reception for any forgotten items.

column9: Excellent experience for a very last minute stay
column10: Checked in at 2 am without any reservation on a bank holiday weekend, the first impression wasn't too nice thanks to a loud group of guest, clearly drunk, outside the hotel and inside the lobby. Receptionist was very kind and immediately found a room for me. Room was immaculate clean, spacious for a single, sound proof so I could have a very good rest. Breakfast was included in the price and it was buffet with a wide choice, from continental to english. Little note of disappointment...when paying for the room I was told and pre charged a certain amount and I realized once at home  I was actually charged 10 pounds more....Overall I had a very pleasant experience and I would definitely come back, maybe booking in advance :)  Hotel is just round the corner from the Westfield Mall, the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and the West ham stadium.

We stayed here for 3 nights mainly to be close to the Olympic stadium so we could walk to and from the Foo Fighters concert. Clean, comfortable hotel. Good breakfast with lots of options. Easy access to Olympic Park and stadium plus lots of transport to other areas such as Greenwich.

I admit I'm a club member so this influenced my choice of hotel for a one night stay. The hotel isn't that old and it still has the new feel about it. I had a reasonable sized room and it was comfortable, clean and well maintained. Breakfast was included in the price rather than an optional add-on and the food was well prepared and plentiful. there is a well stocked bar and restaurant area too. The road outside is extremely busy but you wouldn't know it once you are inside. It's a short drive to Stratford international and around ¬£7 by local cab.

The positives: it gets the basics right. Comfortable bed, clean rooms, a hot shower. It's close to Stratford Station which puts you reasonably close to the rest of London. The cost is right as well. The staff was great.The less than positive: spotty internet, making it a challenge to work in the morning; the breakfast is just so-so (by morning three, I was skipping it.) The rooms are definitely budget-range.Otherwise, not a bad place. Fix the internet problems and it would be four star. I'd stay again...but I'd stay somewhere else as well.

Stayed here for one night after seeing a concert at Olympic Park. The hotel is a good location if you are going to visit Olympic Park. The hotel itself is clean and basic, and always includes a breakfast. Breakfast is nothing special very basic, you can take it away too which is handy. Our room had a walk in shower which got water everywhere. Otherwise was fine. You can park at the hotel but it is tiny we were very lucky to get a space. It‚Äôs also ¬£20 a day which is ridiculous considering the price you pay to stay. Would stay here again if going to Olympic Park.

The hotel was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was really good, although the variety might have been more.  It surprised me that a British hotel had only one type of black tea.I would recommend this hotel if you want to go shopping, as the big Westfield shopping center is only at a few min walking distance.

The HIx at stratford is excellent.  A 10 minutes walk gets you to the underground, national/international rail, and the DLR. Also walking distance to Westfield and its shops and restaurants.The location actually means its a little quieter than those at Westfield itself.Staff were very efficient and helpful. The room as large, quiet and clean. Breakfast was OK, and very very busy!Will definitely stay here again.

column9: One of the friendly hotels, I have stayed ten nights for businesses and leisure.
column10: I have stayed here for the first time. The staff was very warm, welcoming and friendly, good value for money, excellent customer service friendly staff good food rooms clean and comfortable, location 5 minutes from Stratford underground and DLR, you also have the Westfields shopping center next to the station. In fact, we were informed that if we become a member of the hotel we may have some discount for the next time stay at any Holiday Inn in London. I would have no hesitation in staying in this Hotel again.

Pretty good hotel with a good range of choices for breakfast. The room rates were slightly confusing as the price was different depending on the day. Also the fire alarm went off a couple of times one night, but at least I know it works.

The usual HIE, but with decent evening meals.  Staff very helpful and its close to Stratford station , but cheaper than the Olympic park hotels.  Only 10 minutes walk from Jubilee line, but with no train noise.  Its worth considering.

So pleased we book Holiday Inn Express, excellent staff and very helpfull, very clean and comfortable rooms & great decorations. amazing selection of breakfast items. Ideal location for Stratford shopping mall plus underground. we will be back..

column9: OK for one night but poor ventilation
column10: Typical Holiday Inn Express - good room, comfortable, clean with friendly staff. Only problem was that the room was blisteringly hot so we turned the temperature down as low as it would go and turned the fan on full. After an hour it was even warmer. Reception advised that turning the temperature down would do nothing (it didn't) and the only thing to do was to turn it off completely. It didn't get any warmer but didn't get any cooler either.The only remaining option was to open the window which helped a bit but then we had all the traffic noise. Reception delivered a large fan which moved the air about but also added to the noise level. Result - poor nights sleep from heat, road noise and fan noise.Why can't these hotels just make the ventilation systems work? What's the point in having individual controllers that go down to 15degrees if absolutely nothing changes the air temperature.

Stayed for 2 nights. On the plus side staff are pleasant and try their best. The hotel is a good price and close to the Olympic Park, train station and shopping centre. On the negative side the breakfast was average at best and the room wasn‚Äôt hoovered. It‚Äôs ok for one night or two

Good basic hotel located 5/7 minute walk from Stratford tube station in east London. A massive Westfield mall is located next door to station and Olympic Stadium and Aquatic center next to mall. Convenient access to London as various tube lines and trains pass through or start from this station however a very busy location with trains leaving full from station. Planning travel times is something to consider. I selected this hotel over other similar ones as it included breakfast which other charged 10 to 20 pounds extra per day.  Would rate breakfast as good overall with both hot and cold fare available. Coffee was terrible however so I started drinking tea  and had my coffee fix at a coffee bar later in the day. Staff fantastically friendly and accommodating. An ice bucket in the room would have been practical as I had to ask for ice every day, which was gladly provided.  Overall a very good rating of 4/4.5 is fair for this type of hotel outside the center of London.

column9: Great value for money and a great stay!
column10: This is the second Holiday Inn Express I have stayed in and they were both surprisingly good! The rooms are modern and very clean. The staff are friendly and the breakfasts in the morning are excellent! I will definitely be booking with them again.

Stayed here for two nights during the C2C festival. Conveniently close to the O2, but also very easy to get into London centre. Room was spacious and modern, loved the bathroom and huge shower especially. Breakfast in the morning was fab, good choice and quality. Would definitely stay here again.

We booked a one night stay here to visit the London Stadium as away fans.The walk to the hotel from Stratford train station is not far, about 15mins, just be sure to get your bearings when you leave the station. We took a wrong turn , and spent some time negotiating the Westfield centre .Check in was very quick and easy. The lady on the desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and got us a room on the 6th floor. I imagine the views of the old Olympic Park would be great, but we were facing the other way, so only had a view of the high street ! As expected from this chain, rooms were clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable ensuring a good nights sleep. Breakfast, again, as expected , a decent buffet selection.We‚Äôd recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the London stadium due to its proximity to the Olympic Park, decent value, nice rooms and friendly team.

This hotel was avery pleasant stay for the weekend to downtown London. They offered you a great service and a top international breakfast. With a good parking space, clean rooms and helpfull people make our stay enjoyfull. We recommend yhis hotel to everybody !

Stayed in this hotel during February, my booking was approx 12 days but on 4th day hotel water lines chocked & hotel staff shifted us to Stay bridge suites West field a 5 star hotel without any additional charges for all remaining days. During our stay at Holiday inn express we found staff very cooperative. Rooms at Holiday inn express were quite big even much more bigger than few Holiday inn in London. Hotel is only 400 meters away from underground. Cleanness was up to satisfactory mark. Bus stop just next & opposite to hotel. Must stay next time in this hotel. Breakfast was average & sleep quality was also ok.

Right next to the Westfield Shopping Centre with ample parking and only few minutes walk to Stratford Station. We booked this to leave our cars there and catch a train to Twickenham for the Rugby. Hotel has clean rooms and a bar that was open past midnight on that Saturday. What more could you want?

Checked in late on a Saturday and the receptionist was friendly and efficient and check-in was very quick. The room was a good size with a large bed and a well stocked bathroom.Breakfast next morning was a buffet which had all the usual staples.Very convenient to the rail/bus network.No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

We stay ower weekend  in this lovely hotel,they providing with everything what you need ; good location to local shopping shop with nice restaurants ,not fare away from train station .Staff is weary polite ,hotel is very clean .thank you we will be back

Good location about a 10min walk from Stratford station. There is very limited parking available on site. The hotel itself is clean and tidy, the staff are helpful. The free breakfast that is included is good, lots of choices. The rooms are OK, nothing special but they are fine for the price you pay. The view from the room is usually of a car park or a street, so I wouldn't choose this place if you are after a city view. But overall good hotel, I would stay again.

column9: For our Son's admission at Kings College
column10: Efficient and effective ....Smart staff specially Aehmad n Kirtan full of practical advice...Breakfast is a bit repetitive but healthy and nutritious to say the least....lot of options to order food from nearby eateries...overall a Efficient feel to the place..served our purpose well.....rail links are nearby n so is Westfield shopping Mall n Olympic park

Hotel located near to Stratford shopping centre and stations.Room was clean and tidy. Staff were friendly and helpful.Breakfast included with lots of choice. Hotel was good value for money would stay again.

Stayed for one night.  Thought I had booked the holiday in at Westfield shopping centre.  My mistake.  It was only one stop away on tube so no worries.  Staff are very welcoming.  The bed is soo comfy.  No bath but not a problem,  the shower is great. Breakfast is buffet style and there is plenty of choice.  I will definitely stay here again when in London.

Our London trip we was there 4 night it was very good,nice location,staff are very helpful. Highly recommend for London visitors!! If I will plan to visit London again I gonna book this Hotel for sure. Breakfast,lunch & dinner fresh & taste food. Price is reasonable.I like there service

Great stay in hotel. We know the area well, so the hotel was in a great location for what we needed (Olympic park and Westfield shopping centre are only a 5 minute walk away). The staff at hotel were friendly and very helpful and went out of their way to answer questions. Room was good, cosy for 3, but clean and everything provided. Breakfast was good and plenty to keep you going. Great rates for the room and location.

Been here a few times.Staff are nice, rooms are clean and comfortable. Well priced. For cheap parking consider the Westfield centre which is about a mile from the hotel. Didn‚Äôt eat at the hotel but between the hotel entrance and the local Tesco there is a great pizza shop only ¬£4 for a pizza. Anyway! Back to the hotel! Great bacon, hugely improved sausages since I was last here too! All good.

column9: Great stay for a young family....
column10: Recently stayed here for 2 nights for a wedding. 1st time away with a new baby and the staff could not have been more helpful. Some of the best customer service I've ever experienced in either chain, independent or boutique hotels. Top marks to Julian and his team. Very good quality rooms, comfortable  spacious and convenient. Highly recommended.

column9: Nice stay in London Stratforf, with the city center accessible by direct connection
column10: The hotel is situated near the Olympic Center of London, in the Stratford neighborhood. It has very good access to both local public transport and shuttle to Stansted Airport. The Center of the City is accessible by metro in approx. 30-40 minutes with a direct connection. The rooms are modern furnished, and the mattress is very comfortable. The staff from the reception is willing to help in every situation. The bartender, even if he is a new member of the staff and still in training is very nice and polite.At breakfast, a larger variety of food is needed. Only the typical British breakfast is available. There is no minibar in the room, only facilities to prepare coffee and tea.

column9: Unable to sleep due to small bed.
column10: When you go to a hotel like this it's for one thing and one thing only! SLEEP! Im 6.1 so hardly a giant but I found the bed unbearable and even tried to sleep on the floor. I'm back at the hotel tonight and will be taking a double duvet to sleep on the floor. One question?! WHY ARE THE BEDS SOOO SMALL!!!

Room was basic but adequate. I wouldn't like to try and sleep in that bed for more than the one night, it was so hard. They give you a choice of hard and soft pillows and the room was very clean. But that mattress !!! Breakfast very good with a good all round selection.

column9: Excellent hotel for a good price
column10: As every holiday inn hotel, very simple but clean, spacious, and great location.Very close to Stratford station, just 10 mins walk.Big rooms with nice bathroom. Cleaning service every day.I left the card of 'still inside the room' few times as they change towels and bed sheets every day, and i didn't really need it, as i was staying for a week.Breakfast is included in the price and it's very good for a small hotel like this one.Bar on ground floor is opened most of the time.They have a nice option of lunch and dinner there, not very expensive.I had a Cajun Chicken burger with avocado for dinner once and it was amazing.

Stayed here for couple of days during the event, it was good. room was clean and perfect. small in size but enough. breakfast was good with some option but after 4 days had the same breakfast, it start to feel bored. my suggestion is need to change the menu every 3 days :)price wise quite expensive though.

Location wise it's about a 10 minute walk from Stratford underground station. A smaller DLR station is closer. It's also about a 10 minute walk from the Stratford Centre and high street.Checking in was excellent, the young lady on 16th December, was so polite and helpful. One room we had was 118 if that helps indentify her. Also very good to be able to check in at approximately 1115.The rooms were clean and spacious enough including the bathroom.Breakfast was included and also very good for a smaller hotel.Overall if we need a hotel in Stratford again, we would choose here.

Clean business hotel in a convinient location.Modern hotel with simple restaurant and limited parking availability.Friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms and fair pricing.Good location in between city center and Stansted airport.

Stayed on Friday night for a work do.  Excellent service, rooms clean, tidy and comfortable.The staff team could not have been more helpful.Wonderful service, great breakfast.Check in and out was extremely smooth.

column9: Clean, tidy, and just what you need
column10: Stayed for a week in London with my mother and have used HI Express in the past so decided to go again. Unfortunately on arrival they had given us a room with a double bed instead of 2 beds but this was quickly rectified by the staff and instead we got a larger and better room with what we had originally booked. Breakfasts in the morning were filling and had good continental and cooked choices. 5 minute walk to Stratford station with quick access to the tube to central London.

+ most important: clean+ very friendly and helpful staff+ big room+ 5-10min walking to the next tube station (Stratford) with many connections+ good breakfast buffet included (nothing special but full English breakfast: beans, sausages, scrambled egg, two types of bread, muffins, croissants, several jams, yogurt, cereals, fruit, ...)- somewhat outside the city (tube zone 2/3)- relatively small queen-size bedAll in all, I was very content with our stay at the hotel and fully recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a London city hotel!

Booked on the Holiday Inn Express own website for 3 nights.Arrived at a busy reception and was informed that my booking had been cancelled as my CCard had been refused. I told them this was nonsense. They said they had tried to call me to pay in advance to secure the rate, and as I could not be contacted at that attempt, the booking was cancelled, having just driven 317 miles, to say I was not amused is an understatement !!Eventually, the Manageress accepted the booking (event thought I had a confirmation), and an investigation into why my card was (so called) cancelled. I was then asked, " has anyone mentioned the parking charges" ? No - I was then informed it was ¬£20.00 per night to park my car - it just gets better...Later the Lady Manager (who was trying to help) told me why the fiasco had ensued, my advice to anyone is do NOT under any circumstances use the Holiday Inn own site to make a reservation, use one of the third parties.Holiday Inn Express is becoming the Ryanair of the Hotel trade, take care when booking and read all the small print.As a goodwill gesture, some of the parking charges were refunded.Oh, and I paid with the CC'd that had allegedly been refused............

Stayed for weekend, check in was quick and staff was Very friendly and helpful. Room has very comfortable bed, enjoyed freshness and cleanliness of room. Breakfast was great and services was high standard too. Its a Perfect city hotel.

column9: Decent base  for working locally or exploring London, with good transport access
column10: Spent around 10 days here as our base while working at the World Para Games. The hotel follows the standard set up of most Holiday Inn express hotels, decent rooms, buffet style breakfast included. We where on a high level floor, but there are two lifts as well as stairs. Our room was facing away from the roads, so no real issuses with noise at night.There is a bus stop very near to the hotel, Stratford High Street DLR and Pudding Mill Lane DLR are around a 5 minute walk and Stratford Underground about a 15 min walk. Westfield Shopping Centre and Stratford Shopping Centre are also 15 min walk.There is a Tesco express on the next block to the hotel.

The hotel is located to good transport links, has limited car parking available at a price. The staff are very attentive and helpful.We only ate breakfast there which was average. Options were cereals, breads, pastries, fruit and some cooked items - bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages, qourn sausages, beans.There seemed to be a good selection of other food available however it seemed a bit overpriced. Did not eat to be able to comment on quality.Room size is good, has adequate facilities, a good sized shower/toilet room with a powerful flow from the shower and a good temperature.The first room we were allocated to had a sewage smell which seemed to get worse. When this was  highlighted to reception staff they accommodate a move to another room and were very helpful.The bed was very comfortable with a good selection of hard/soft pillows. Heating/cooling unit seemed a bit temperamental.Room did get a bit stuffy but we opened the window frequently.You could hear noises from nearby rooms ie phones ringing.The room was generally clean however more attention to detail required ie headboard, pics, ledges had some dust.When the window was open you could smell smoke from the smoke area and hear chatter which is not good when you are trying to sleep. The smoking area ( in the car park ) would be better placed moved away from the building.5/5 for staff however issues noted above make it a 4/5 overall

This hotel cost 140 pounds mid week for 1 person.  ($260 approx) including breakfast. It‚Äôs in the middle of nowhere close to nothing and the rooms look like hospital rooms especially the bathrooms. It wasn‚Äôt particularly clean and had a grotty feel. It was so bad I checked out and went back to London. Never again

column9: Fantastic Hotel in a Good Location
