column10: I booked this Holiday Inn for one night whilst visiting the O2 arena, as the hotel we normally stay in was too expensive.  It was really reasonably priced for London and we were concerned that it might not be to a good standard. We found the hotel easily when exiting Stratford Station. On arrival, we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who checked us in.  The room was really nice, large enough, a very comfortable bed, a nice bathroom with shower and really hot water - I like it scorching and had to turn the temperature down.  Due to time constraints, we ate in the bar, nice choice of foods.  I had the Cajun chicken burger and chips, which was delicious, a large marinated breast in a brioche bun and my husband had a regular burger with chips, which was massive and he said very tasty.  Both were ¬£11 each, very reasonable.  Again the staff were great.  We had a drink in the bar when returning after our concert and believe the bar in open to residents until 1am.  Free buffet style breakfast was served in the bar the next morning which was excellent.  Choice of cooked items, toast, pastries, fresh fruits and cereals.  Our overall experience was fantastic and we wouldn't hesitate in returning to this hotel.

I booked a room here for one night.First impressions very good.I was welcomed by friendly staff. I signed in and went up to my room on the 5th floor.  It was a lovely room very clean and tidy and the bed was so comfortable in didn't want to get up.The shower was awesome nice and hot just how I like it.  Please be careful the shower tray did get a little slippy.The room had a easy to use heater so you can adjust it for the perfect nights sleep. Breakfast is a help yourself buffet. From cereal, toast or full English. Tea and coffee. And the orange juice it cold. The hotel has a good bar shame.All in all a good clean friendly comfortable hotel.  My double room cost me ¬£80 good value for money.If you need somewhere to stay near Stratford this is the place.

column9: Great Service, totally functional - and great staff!
column10: I usually spend my time at the Holiday Inn or Staybridge Suites - but thought I would try this place out for a week or so.   I'm pleasantly, surprised!  The place is neat and clean - and yes, while it can do with a bit of a makeover, it's perfectly fine and functional. The staff are excellent, great at what they do - and things are made easy by the great team here. Downside? Well, there isn't that much to do around the place re dinner, but the meals here are simple, clean and well prepared - so it's just right for me (and if you really want something exotic, then there are apps available to order out).  The No25 bus takes me straight to work and is around 50 yards from the front door - so transportation for me is brilliant. Well worth a stay here if you're out and about during the day.

column9: Great comfortable stay but dining needs improvement
column10: This hotel is in a great location for Stratford, The Westfield and the Olympic Park. The rooms are as you'd expect from a Holiday Inn Express, really comfortable and the staff attentive when needed.But the dining needs improvement. Breakfast each morning was good, but the eggs left not very much to be desired and the coffee not so great. I also ordered lunch at this hotel and the food is expensive for what you receive. Often running out of milk and juices, staff don't seem too attentive to this and need to keep requesting.

This hotel has a great location with excellent transport link.  Stratford High Street DLR station is only a 2 minute walk away.  The room was comfortable with a very spacious shower.  We stayed here as we were attending an event at the Lee Valley Velodrome and it was on 15 minute walk through the Olympic park to get there.  The hotel is a great base for exploring the East end of London such as the O2, the olympic park, Westfield shopping centre or the Excel Centre.  Staff were friendly, breakfast was well stocked.  I would definitely stop here again.

Very comfortable room and exceptionally quiet. Good value for money and so close to the Olympic Park. Good quality breakfast. Staff on reception very helpful, especially Antoinette!Would definitely use this hotel again. Thank you for a great stay.Alyson & Greg

We booked a room here for the night as we attending an event at the Arcelormital Orbit at the Olympic Park and needed somewhere close.  This is about a ten minute walk away from the park so the location was perfect. The room was clean and had everything that we needed.  There were tea and coffee making facilities and the bed was comfortable.  After the event we had drinks at the hotel bar, which were reasonably priced.  The breakfast in the morning was self service buffet style and there was hot and cold food available and plenty of it.  The breakfast was included in the price of the room and was good value.  The parking was an extra ¬£20 for the night and is very secure.  In all very good value for money, clean and great location.  Will definitely use this hotel again - if not fully booked!

Stayed here after visiting the Olympic Stadium, easy walk. Room was compact, very clean including the bathroom. Staff at reception friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise. I can recommend this hotel for a casual stay.

The hotel was lovely if a little basic. We were only staying in London for one night and it did the job. One bit of helpful information I can give is if you are on foot from the tube station go over the footbridge outside the Westfield centre near the bus station before following instructions from google maps! It was clean and the staff were friendly. Would definitely stay again.

Clean basic hotel. There was a problem upon check that was quickly resolved.Not a full English breakfast but some hot food available. Free newspapers and magazines. Only given enough for 2 cups of tea per 24 hours, had to ask for more at reception. Sound proof rooms, did not hear other guests. Most of the staff were polite and friendly.

Stayed here for a meeting in London, I use IHG hotels a lot and I have to say this is a great holiday inn express.This was my first visit to this hotel and I was very impressed, I found the staff very helpful and polite I had no problems with breakfast as mentioned by some people. This hotel also has a restaurant open in the evening which I thought was good especially after a long days travel it gives you another option instead of going out looking for somewhere. I noticed you could get a fixed 3 course meal for I think about ¬£18 which is great for London.I will certainly be staying here again.

I stayed here while my sister was moving to London to attend Queen Mary University. The hotel lobby and rooms were nicely designed, not old fashioned. The room was clean, spacious, and really all your needs were available. However the WIFI was slow when it did connect. The breakfast buffet was really good! The location was perfect for us as it is a 10 minute walk to Westfield Stratford City (great shopping mall), Stratford station (for underground tube,DLR, and trains) and the bus stop is right in front of the hotel. This made getting around the city was quite easy. The only thing I wish the hotel and or website would have provided was options from Gatwick Airport and not just from London City Airport.

column9: Great place to stay in London
column10: Only a few minutes from one of the best connected railway stations in London, but not charged out at "full London prices". This is clean well organised hotel near to Stratford railway station, the shopping centre in Stratford and the "Westfield" shopping centre if  you like that sort of thing. There are local restaurants and of course Brick Lane is not far away.

This was Holiday Inn Express was ideally located for us, and I like that they have a (paying) car park.  The staff were all very welcoming and helpful, and offered us a late check-out. This is a modern, purpose-built hotel with good noise insulation. Very comfortable, and definitely a hotel I will use again.

Stayed for a week - on business trip1. close proximity to London Tube station (Stratford Station)2. Complementary breakfast was part of my package. Though breakfast did not carry a wide variety, it was certainly value for money!3. Staff was very courteous and helpful during my stay4. Rooms are not very spacious but fit the purpose of a short business trip* Stayed from 3rd Oct-2016 (for 1 week)

column9: Bringing son to Queen Mary University.
column10: Few bus  stops away from QMUL or about 7 pounds by uber. Free Wi-Fi. Clean decently spacious room. Friendly staff. Convenient location, near to Stratford subway too. Room is bright enough and water is reasonably strong.

Good, comfortable, clean hotel. We've used this hotel a few times before and always found the reception staff helpful, friendly and efficient. The breakfast is OK, but the staff always seem swamped with the volume of people consuming the food and cannot keep up with replenishing the food.The hotel is situated in the newly regenerated part of London close to Stratford station with its superb public transport links. If you don't fancy the walk from the hotel to the station, use the bus. There always seemed to be one in sight so there was no waiting.

Wow what a lovely hotel beds was  comfy breakfast was lovely the staff work really hard they do as much as they can for u once outside u can see London airport over the rd not the dearest drinks we bought a pint of Stella ¬£4.60 nice bathrooms ironing boards hair dryers had 3 lovely nights here I will go back after easter

column9: Last minute nite stay at the his hotel
column10: We spent the night at this his hotel on the spur of the moment after a night out in London/Spitafields. For what the hotel charges, this establishments is great value for money.. The bonus is a great breakfast that is complementary.

Sorry. The location and price are good. But a hot summer night with broken air con is no fun. The rooms are little tired but perfectly reasonable. I'm afraid my bathroom had a 'smell' to it. I'm fairly reasonable but I was glad to get away from this hotel after two poor nights sleep.

Stayed here for w/end whilst going to World Para Athletics. Nothing was too much trouble, room was very clean & comfortable. Food was of an excellent standard, from breakfast to evening meal. All the staff were most helpful & friendly, they are a credit to the company. I would definitely stay here again & have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others.

column9: Excellent modern HI Express in convenient location
column10: This is one of my favorite HI Express hotel to date. The location is great for a walk to the Olympic park (and a swim at the aquatic centre) or a visit to the Westfield shopping centre with its excellent choice of restaurants.The staff were attentive and recognised my membership status, i was explained the amenities and the quickest route to the Olympic park.the rooms are modern and convenient and i am glad that after having been booked in other hotel chains to be back at the HI brand. The room have exactly what you need and i always get a comfortable sleep. I like the idea you can request your rooms not to be cleaned and to be offered points in recognition. i liked the reminder on the mirror that breakfast was included and the new no nonsense WiFi is a winner to. it might not be super-fast, but good for some internet browsing and catching up with emails.There is an ironing room every other floor. The idea for a ironing room is great as you know you can always iron your shirt, but having one on every other floor is the only let down!It is a 5-10 minute walk from the train station, which is just the right distance for a brisk morning walk to wake up.

Handy location close to Stratford centre and the Olympic Park. The rooms are comfy and have a kettle TV and shower gels/soaps. We had a family room which has a double and a sofa bed, the mattress on the sofa bed was similar to memory foam, which was firmer than I'm used to but the beds were comfy. We had one with a view across to the Olympic park, The car park is only small and I believe costs around ¬£20 a night, spaces can't be reserved and I'd recommend if you're staying on a weekend parking at the Westfield Centre which does reduced rates for long weekend stays (we paid ¬£13,50 from Saturday lunch to Monday morning). The breakfasts are quite extensive for this type of hotel not just continental but also bacon, sausages and scrambled egg. Lots of choice for coffee and tea too. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Excellent place to stay if you are doing RideLondon as the hotel starts breakfasts at 4.30am and allows the bikes in the hotel. They were really accommodating throughout

column9: Good hotel for a long weekend.
column10: Needed a hotel near the stadium at Queen Elizabeth Park and this fit the bill very well. Pleasant staff, good breakfast with hot and cold options. I have a mobility problem so also hired a mobility scooter for the weekend and our room was very spacious so plenty of room to house the scooter. The room also had disabled shower facilities which were fine apart from the drainage being rather poor, so the whole of the shower/wet-room floor flooded.  Proving a floor scraper would have helped...we just had to lay all the towels down so we could get to the toilet! Other than that a good hotel.

I am in Stratford for three nights on a business trip and have to say the staff here are amazing! The food is good quality and the rooms clean and well looked after! It was my birthday while I visited and the bar staff made a point of bringing my food up to my room with a birthday card and some  chocolate! The attention to detail was truly amazing! For a budget hotel this felt like 5* treatment! Hats off to you holiday inn express stratford! It goes to show that it really is the people who make the experience! Thank you for a lovely visit and I will be sure to book in with you next time I am in London!

A very nice, clean environment with all the facilities needed only down side was that good was not available until 1800hrs. Close to Stratford High street DLR, Stratford Train,Tube & DLR station, Stratford International Train & DLR station. The Olympic park is easily accessible so is Westfield shopping centre. Top tip if you want food Tesco is down the road and Travelodges cafe bar is open to non residence and a lot cheaper.

column9: Great Location for the Olympic Park
column10: Great location if you're attending any functions at or near the Olympic Park, Great room sized, nice shower, tea & coffee available in the room. Probably the first hotel that I've stayed at that actually has plenty of easily accessible sockets including next to the bed. Great value for money. Only downside, could do with more variety for breakfast, and a quicker turn-around than 15 minutes to deep-fry some sausages. We stayed in a family room, so we got a queen bed and a sofa that opened info another bed, it did the job for 1 night. Would stay again if going to the Olympic Park

column9: Great hotel perfect for Olympic park.
column10: Booked as we had tickets for the para athletics at the London stadium. Very close to Stratford tube station and very easy to find. Arrived at 11am hoping to leave our bags while we went sightseeing but the lovely receptionist checked us in to a room that was ready after making sure we were ok with a room overlooking the road which we were! Great service. Room was basic but clean and had everything we needed including a window that opened and air conditioning.Just 10 minutes walk and you are at the stadium, Olympic park and The Orbit. Prices and service at the bar when we returned was good and we had a good night's sleep. Breakfast was great and was a bonus to have it included in a London hotel. Plenty of choice including cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries and cooked options. Nice to be able to take a coffee and muffin away too. Perfect hotel for Olympic park and the staff are a great asset :)

Stayed here for the World Para Athletics.  Location was great, Room was fine, staff were friendly and breakfast was a good selection of hot and cold food.  This place did all the things you would want from a hotel.  A little walk from the tube but overall was impressed.

Spent 3 wonderful nights here.Great room, great breakfast, friendly staff.Wifi was brilliant. Highly recommended, close to all amenities easy to travel to all the London sights.Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in London

I've visited a lot of hotels in and around London over the years and the holiday inn express is one of the best I've stayed in. From the moment we arrived the staff where friendly and helpful and made our whole staff even better. We arrived at 10:00 on Saturday morning and asked to leave our bags there for the day and come back and check in later. The lady on reception said she could check us in now if we wanted which was great. Then offered us breakfast for free which was lovely as been up and on the road since 6am. They also gave me a free drink as was my birthday. We had a room on the 4th floor (427) lovely and clean, super comfy bed, with a choice of pillows. Tea and coffee also for when we fancied. Breakfast was included in the price and added bonus of being offered breakfast on the Saturday. Was really nice. Choice of cereal, hot and cold food, toast, yogurt. Good choice of fruit juice and coffee.The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the London stadium and Stratford shopping area with the underground access. Bus stop near also if needed .Will be back here for sure as the way we where looked after was second to none. Thank you.

column9: Not The Ritz but a good place to stay for the price
column10: About 10 minutes walk from Stratford rail and Westfield, on major bus routes, 15 minute walk to the stadium, this is a more than adequate place to stay. The rooms where clean and quite, all staff encountered were polite and helpful. Does provide value for money.

column9: Walking distance from the station, great rooms, average breakfast
column10: Visited London for business. Stayed in this hotel for three nights. Average price for the area, very good room and clean. Service excellent. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment; not bad, but jut average. There is plenty of room for improvement there in terms of variety.Recommended for a business trip, but not sure for other purposes.

Really lovely, modern and clean hotel. Staff were very friendly and hotel well maintained. Enjoyed the selection at breakfast. Very close to Westfield and the Olympic Park and easy enough to find from both stations. Would certainly stay again.

My friend and I stayed here for 1 night. Great room, good service for check in, breakfast included in a cheap rate. Very close to Westfield and Stratford tube so perfect for people who want to be close to shops and restaurants and travel links. Quiet and peaceful area.

It was a Holiday Inn on a major high street.Everything was just as expected - breakfast was better than expected. Staff were great.Great location for Westfield and tube for O2. Will definitely be back.

column9: Very good for what it is
column10: This is a basic hotel with modest facilities, but very good for its type. I wanted a comfortable but inexpensive London hotel for a one night business trip. Central London was stupidly expensive in early summer, so I took a chance on this one. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and the restaurant for dinner and breakfast was fine, not gourmet, but fine. The location is within easy walking distance of the Westfield shopping Centre and the Olympic Park, so great for those, otherwise it's not great. But it's also walking distance of Stratford Station and that offers pretty good access into London, avoid the rush hour unless you don't mind pretending to be a sardine. Overall, this is a very good hotel for the price they charge and I have to say the staff were really working hard at being attentive and giving good service, so a special mention for them.

We stayed here, as watched a concert at Olympic park. Perfect location, within walking distance to stadium took us about 10/15 mins. Within walking distance to tube station, and Westfield mall took about 15/20 mins. We enjoyed our stay here, staff were friendly and welcoming. Room was nice size, but did notice few small dead bugs on window ledge. But, aside from that nice and clean, with comfy beds. We were overlooking back yard store, so heard bottles being emptied into bin about 8am. Breakfast was nice, constantly being restocked. But, nice and quiet aside from that. Would stay here again.

Arrived before 9 in the morning and not only did they allow us into the car park so we could go out for the day, they gave us our room and told us to help ourselves to breakfast.  So 2 breakfasts for the price of one and a very comfy room.  Will be back when in area.

column9: Modern hotel super easy access to the Olympic Stadium
column10: My friend and i stayed here whilst having a weekend in London combined with attending the AMAZING Depeche Mode concert . We found it easy to get transport from central London via the tube , and absolutely everything you could want in terms of shops , restaurants etc nearby . The hotel was very clean , included breakfast (which was very busy) and staff were good. I have given an average score , because we ate in the restaurant and the pasta was horrendous (out of a tin standard) we wished we had walked back up to the shopping area and got a much better meal.The atmosphere was great because of all the Depeche Mode fans from all around the world staying there - and it was good to see security on at night .I would rather stay here than the travelodge next door , but it would probably come down to price for me if i stayed again.

column9: great staff, good location and great breakfast (travelling from gatwick)
column10: Arrived here early the friday before last and was pleased we were able to check in early as we had had an early flight from dublin.room was fine, good size and a great shower. facilities very clean. staff were very friendly and welcoming.myself and my brother had booked in as we were attending the Depeche mode concert in the London stadium, the hotel is only a short walk away.Location wise we travelled from Gatwick airport, i phoned the hotel the day before who advised to get a train to London Bridge and a tube out towards Stratford. The tube is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. This was a great tip for us.Breakfast each morning there was a good selection and it sets you up for the day, nearby there is a tesco should you need anything and sometimes it comes in handy. It was a great location for the concert and it is very handy if you are visiting for a West Ham match. Unfortunately this was also the night that there was a terrorist attack at London Bridge so we stayed in the bar that night, staff made sure all guests were safe. The bar shuts around the 1am-1.30 mark. the next day we had breakfast before heading for home and staff kindly looked after our luggage. As London Bridge was closed we used the tube to get to Victoria and from there you can make your way to Gatwick airport. Leave yourself a bit of time when going to get your flight.All in all it was a very pleasant stay and it was great that breakfast is included in your stay.The staff were very friendly and i would highly recommend.thanks.

column9: Good location for the Olympic Satdium
column10: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of June whilst attending the Depeche Mode concert at the nearby Olympic stadium.The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Stratford tube station and 15 minutes from the stadium.Check-in was quick and we were allocated a room on the 5th floor away from the lifts, as requested.The room was a decent size and modernly furnished. Tea and coffee were supplied.We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was buffet and of a good standard.I'd certainly stay again if I were attending an event nearby.

This was just what we needed. A great price, clean and a great breakfast. The majority of the staff were very friendly. The only down side was the check in as the lady on the desk dealing with our check in was not very friendly and made us feel like we were keeping her from being somewhere else, needs to work on her customer skills.

column9: great hotel, easy commute for sightseeing
column10: Really nice welcome from staff at check in and throughout our stay. All you can eat breakfast is included and really nice. Very easy commute into central London and other areas from Stratford travel interchange, 10-15 mins walk. 15 mins walk to Queen Elizabeth Olympic stadium.  Westfield shopping centre 10 mins walk - massive mall with cinema,  plus smaller 'ordinary'shopping centre with supermarkets and market stalls.

Two night stay was memorable. So comfortable and excellent staff. Nothing was too much trouble and so pleasant and helpful. Hotel was conveniently placed for the Olympic Park and Aquatic Centre as well as the large Stratford Shopping centre with numerous restaurants and designer shops.

column9: Hotel, Close to Westfield Stratford Mall
column10: A Hotel, which is Close to Westfield Stratford Mall, just a walking distance. Complimentary Breakfast is great. Service is nice. Rooms are clean. Quite affordable. Another best thing its close to stratford tube station.

column9: Lovely staff, good position, expensive parking
column10: When arriving at the hotel I was aware of the high parking costs, but I was not expecting the very courteous staff, lovely room, great wifi and pleasant breakfastFor business people like myself who need the car to travel it makes me question to stay here again considering that everything else was lovely, shame really.

I stayed here just a few days after staying at the Westfield Holiday Inn, so let me be the first to say I imagine several comparisons are being drawn here...It wasn't as plush, and actually cost more for the night - but that might have been more about timings than anything else.The twin room was fine, but the bathroom was shower only, clothes hanging space was just that, and not a wardrobe and annoyingly there were no plugs near the bed so charging phones and using my laptop meant I had to sit up, which was a tad annoying.The room was functional though. Plump pillows and a duvet too.  TV etc etc.Worked for the night and breakfast was a buffet that had enough to suit a variety of tastes.  I got the impression staff had been told to say hello to everyone as the cleaner we passed on our way down in the morning said hello, but I got the felling she didn't really want to or mean it. It's the thought that counts, right? We all have bad days, and TBH not in a horrid way it made me smile.Parking was a bit annoying as I checked if it was available and was told yes,only to find on arrival that it's ¬£20 for the night. I was later told by someone else that if you park around the corner you can do so free until 8.30am (check that though). The nice lady at reception halved our parking as my mum has a disabled badge though - which was thoughtful.Centrally located and good enough, but not in a hurry to go back...

When I booked this hotel originally I was going to cancel the booking as I thought it was a fair distance. I'm glad I didn't as its a hidden gem not far from Westfield shopping centre and the underground. Hotel was immaculate breakfast very tasty and plentiful staff very welcoming. I have booked to stay here again so well done holiday inn express top marks!!

column9: Nice hotel with chilled relaxed atmosphere
column10: Excellent stay with very comfortable bed and very tasty breakfast Quiet rooms and staff are very helpful. 10 minute walk to Stratford underground/overground and DLR is only 5 minutes away. Olympic stadium (WEST HAM FC) is within walking distance along with Westfield shopping centre. Will definitely stay again when in area

column9: Nice Little hotel, Spotless clean, basic breakfast, good location 5 minutes walk from Stratford  or mile end stations
column10: Lovely Rooms , small but spotless. All mod cons, modern bathrooms.About 30 mins from city centre via under ground, two stops 5 mins away. Stratfort centre very big and great shopping very close.Near to roman road and petticoat lane markets. Lovely Bar and food served till 10 pm. good value for money.

A good and affordable hotel close to Stratford station, home field of West Ham and Westfield shoppingcenter. Breakfast wasn't lile at a more expensive hotel, but acceptable. Rooms were clean. No complaints.

Holiday Inn Express in Stratford is a comfortable and easy place to stay about 10 minutes walk from Stratford Station.  There is nothing much in the immediate area but the Olympic Park and the extensive transport network offered by Stratford are within walking distance.The hotel looks like a Holiday Inn so there is nothing to be surprised about from either exterior or interior.  This is not a luxury brand but it is a comfortable and familiar environment.Check-in was fairly quick and friendly.  Check-out was rapid and simple.  A debit card was fine for pre-authorisation.  The room is large enough and had enough space to spread out a bit.  The bed was comfortable, easy to sleep on, and in good condition.  The shower area was ok, a little bit cramped but designed reasonably so there was little splash.  The shower area was not the most attractive but it was functional.  The TV had quite a few channels though defaulted to a section of foreign language options which was a bit odd.Breakfast was ok.  It was fairly busy throughout but there was a steady supply of food and enough space in the dining area.  The spread was ok with cereal options going as far as tasty granola, and hot choices including reasonably well scrambled eggs.  A coffee machine has a range of options.Wifi worked throughout the hotel and was pretty fast most of the time.Holiday Inn Express is not going to be confused for luxury but it is a decent enough place to stay not far from Stratford Station even if the immediate surrounds in this part of town are somewhat barren.

Good location as it is near Stratford station which is accessible by bus or 10 min brisk walk. Breakfast needs to be improved in terms of variety. We stayed for five days and had the same breakfast buffet.

The hotel is clean and nice, it is relatively far away from the center (30 minutes public transportation), but it is easily accessible by public transportation though. The only minus point is there breakfast, they could improve it a bit, may be add a bit of cheese.

Old-fashion hotel but good location, specially for West Ham United fans. Rooms and hotel in general was clean and tidy, service was good, maybe a bit noisy but in overall I was happy to be there for 4 nights.

column9: Great place to stay for London marathon
column10: Three of us stayed at this hotel for the marathon. The room was very clean and bathroom also clean and shower good. They supply hair and body wash but if you forget anything it can be got from reception ie toothbrush/paste etc.  They put on a special marathon buffet the night before and also provide an early breakfast from 5.30 am the porridge made especially for the event was lovely.  There is also a coach from the hotel which leaves at 7.15am and gets you to the event in plenty of time.  Travel to London is good via dlr station which is about 100 yards from the hotel then tube to where you wish to go we used this Friday evening  as going to the theatre and again on Saturday whil going to expo.  The hotel also provided shower facilities for entrants upto 6pm on day of the marathon which I really appreciated! The staff are very friendly and helpful also.  We would stay there again.

Visited to watch a West Ham United home game. Stadium is 10 min walk from the hotel. This is a great place to stay, decent rooms, good shower and free excellent breakfast. Parking at the site possible. Staff is extremely helpful, which makes the stay just perfect. Thank you for a great weekend overnight stay üëçüèª

column9: A nice week in HIE Stratford
column10: HIE Stratford is old-fashioned hotel-simple and small, not as the hotels I used to stay in China.But with 7 nights over there, I was impressed by-FoodI had dinners nearly for the whole stay so tried most of main dishes, which really surprised me who is from China.Fish & Chips- I had twice on first evening and last evening.Cod-it reminded me what I had in Italy in 2012.Chicken course-with noddle?! And the sauce is just like what we make at home.Pizza-I thought I couldn't finish it but in 15 minutes, done!In a word, delicious! I am curious who is the chef?-HospitalityThanks for all the girls/ladies in front desk and for cleaning service, who help me so much!Special thanks to Andrien in the restaurant and Mo in the bar!I wish I could go back again and I am missing them now...

column9: Rooms ok but overpriced terrible food
column10: Stayed a week room ok but very stuffy. Staff friendly enough but very expensive.Ate dinner one night not impressed at all and we both had terrible upset stomachs following day.Worst part was breakfast, in a word shocking dry hard scrambled eggs tough fatty bacon cold beans. Certainly not recommended whidh I'd gone to premier inn

My wife and I usually stay at the West End whenever I travel to London but this trip was on a budget so I looked at hotels in East London. I booked this hotel on the holiday inn website for less than $100 per nite so my expectations were not very high especially since I had never been to East London.What I got was a lovely budget hotel with a reasonable big room, big bed and settee. The breakfast met my basic expectations. The fantastic sausage ruined my diet.The hotel is less than a kilometer away from a big shopping mall and a major railway hub.I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

The hotel is quite good and the breakfast more than adequate 4 stars definitely. Only think don't like is exhorbitant car parking charge of 20 per day nicely located sound. proof .big plus as we other budget hotels can be noisy

A  seven minute walk from busses, the tube and the Westfield mall - a great and BIG mall that offers you all that you need when it comes to shopping and restaurants. The tube takes about 20 minutes to the heart of London. Staff is friendly. Rooms nice, quiet and tidy. Quite cold though. Comfy beds. There is an electric waterboiler for tea and coffee.  I would have wanted a little fridge for some cold drinks. Breakfast is ok if you like scrambled eggs, beans, sausages and white bread. They only had cheese for the bread  one day out of three. Everyday they offer nutella, butter and jam. Fresh fruits are available too. And ofcourse coffee, tea and juice.

2 nights, double bed, 5th floor, ¬£180.I stayed here for the weekend with my partner. Upon arrival I was informed that we'd booked a twin room instead of a double, a lady at reception offered to and switched us to a double room which was nice. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Serve yourself buffet with sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, toast, beans, fruit, cereal etc. Very nice and good to fill up on before a day exploring. Great location, was quiet and only a short walk from the bus/train/tube stations and very close to the shopping centre also. Very happy with our stay and would reccommend it.

Good location and close to the shopping centre. Safe and quite area. I went to this hotel by myself and love the service and especially breakfast is so rich. Sometimes it could be a bit noisy close by the street but Love it overall!

We stayed on sat 11th march for one night.From the minute we walked in we were greeted with a warm smile and when we asked for our room early we we're sorted out with no hassle.The room was large with a big bed sofa bed and shower room well kept and great for a one night stay.We went out for the night getting back about 12 o'clock midnight.The bar was still open with a few drinkers but no worries over noise we went straight to bed.The free breakfast next morning was great .cereals fruit breads yogurts etc cooked items bacon sausage scrambled egg tomatoes beans as much toast as you want tea coffee juices all in all top class .A really top hotel good service and breakfast great value.Barry M

column9: Avoid if you like your sleep!
column10: We booked this hotel as it is fairly well located for the O2, which we were attending for an event, and the price was extremely competitive for London. Unfortunately I did not sleep for the two days I was there due to shockingly poor noise transfer. You can hear literally everything. We discovered we had a twin room with adjoining door to next room, but there were gaping gaps under the door. The first morning, we were awoken by the cleaners doing their rounds nearby.  Although the door to next room was locked, we were awoken at 6.45am on the second morning by a Spanish couple having an argument. Don't think about staying in the twin rooms unless you are completely comfortable with your roommate as they cannot even use the bathroom without it sounding like you are in the same room as them! There was no drinking water in the room although the bar were more than happy to give you a jug of water to take up. Breakfast is a buffet style but was very disorganised, with items not replenished at the same time.  So if you wanted the full English, you'd invariably be waiting for one or more items to be cooked at any one time. One good thing is that they provide you with paper bags to take items away should you wish. They also provide take away cups for hot drinks so if you are not a breakfast person first thing, you can still take some for your journey home or day out. The hotel also provide a small selection of magazines free of charge. The beds was comfortable enough but there were several areas of wear and tear in the room which looked very tired. On the whole, this hotel was clean enough and value for money in London but not the best place if you are a light sleeper (which I am not, by the way)!!

We spent 2 nights in the Holiday Inn express with breakfast and WiFi included in a very competitive price the hotel was perfect for what we had planned a few trips to the East End & one trip to the O2 .The hotel staff were very friendly nothing was too much trouble rooms were very clean with decent television channels should you need to spend time in your room very comfy beds as well would certainly recommend this hotel should you need to be in the East end or visiting the O2 , just a tip the transport links are brilliant a stones throw away from Stratford tube station  and also on quite a few bus routes we used the 25 a few times it stops yards away from the hotel .Would certainly stay here again should the need arise .

Room on the 6th floor was large, clean and standard equipment but a bit cold. Heating was set at 24 but room was a maximum of 21. Breakfast was good. The hotel is a short walk from Stratford station and great shopping center.

IHG member.   Spending a weekend in London found this IHG hotel by far the best price and fully inclusive of breakfast and free wifi.  From booking in, through drinks at the bar, and checking out... what friendly and informative staff.    A most comfortable spacious rooom (626).I cannot fault this hotel, probably the best Express Inn I have stayed in.....I wonder if people realise they are franchised.The only downside is that although well served by tube and bus it is almost an hour to central London.

Type of traveller. Carnivore with no allergies. Driver. Light sleeper. Severe back problem. Not tolerant of people. Hates poor service. This hotel far exceeded my expectations and I'll return as soon as able on my next London visit. I chose this hotel as it was comparable with costs for the time we needed of hostels in London. We chose to pay only a few pounds more than a neighbouring hotel as the holiday inn offered breakfast.Check-in was efficient and friendly and we were acknowledged as new members straight away which was nice. Free late check out offered which was another lovely touch. The first morning down for breakfast I was shocked by how busy it was because it was so quiet in our room and we'd not been disturbed in the night. So many hotels you struggle with doors banging and being able to hear through rooms. I didn't find that here. The room was a generous size. Well appointed for a few nights too.Surprisingly I find there's too many little touches that made this hotel great to list... breakfast options & times, location, price, staff, rooms, shower, little member extras etc etc etc. Four minor gripes are...window didn't fully block out noise. Air con didn't air con properly (even when instructions followed). Someone shifted our 'no maid service' sign off our door handle. No stairs for guests to use. Would recommend to guests / members.

column9: Visit London for a family wedding
column10: Basic hotel just a short walk away from Stratford Station and Westfield shopping centre. Rooms are decent and efficient. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is included with which the hotel separates it self from much of the competitors in the same price category. Although the hotel is not located in the centre of London the excellent transport opportunities make it a perfect "base" for exploring London.

We stayed here for an early valentine's and were very happy with the hotel itself. Didn't eat here and although a free breakfast was included which is great, it was really too early to go to as we were there to relax and sleep in, would have been nice to be served til 11 at least. Only complaint was that the Fire alarm went off about 3 times on our first morning there which was awful and not the best way to be woken up. But thankfully it seemed to be a fault and we weren't actually evacuated which would have been even worse! (Although obviously not if it were to be an actual fire) location is not the best if you don't drive and can't walk far, buy there is a shop over the road for snacks which was handy.

Clean comfortable room, very friendly and accommodating staff, nothing was too much trouble. Great location too and very reasonable rate for the area. Free breakfast but alas we missed it (too much of a good night) ! Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Brilliant staff hotel close to ground and shopping centre. Breakfast good lots of choice.  Definitely recommend this place. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideal position for attending the matches and plenty of pubs and restaurants locally.

Review score takes,into account this is budget accomodation in Stratford London (there is full service Holiday Inn in Wesrfield shopping centre-just minutes away). This "Express" accomodation is less "busy"-but nicer than expected. Reception very helpful. Room overlooked grassed area at back- clean & warm with good shower (separate handset)(although loo roll quality could do with upgrade!-seriously). Buffet breakfast quite comprehensive with continental & warm items. Only limited evening menu but reasonable & chef very helpful. Staff very pleasant. Possible to travel by bus from Marylebone but takes over an hour. Stratford underground & bus station only minutes walk away at Westfield shopping centre. Under half hour by bus to 02 & longer to Greenwich (worth a visit). (Convenient parking available on site at cost-but not able to book).Would use Holiday Inn  Express again if in area.

Good marks to the staff at this hotel for allowing us to check in very early when the moronic security firm at the National Gallery refused to let us check in our cabin-sized case.  Evening meal and breakfast surprisingly acceptable - much better than the travelodge-standard offering I had expected.  Not far to walk from Stratford station, which is very well connected, being on the main railway as well as two underground lines and the DLR. The journey on the Jubilee is surprisingly quick, given how far out Stratford is.Room fine, though a loud hum from the building-site across the street on the east side was clearly audible despite the double glazing.The only really odd feature of our stay was that, for the first time ever in 40 years, our meal wasn't added to the room and paid for at check-out as in every other hotel I have stayed in.  I asked when ordering the meal to have it put on our bill.  We duly ate our food and retired to bed.  After i had been in bed for a hour or more, I was woken up by someone in reception wanting me to pay my 'bar bill' - so I ha do shove some clothes on and my shoes to go down and pay.I assume this to be some species of eccentric American hotel etiquette of which, never having stayed in any other US chain except a Best Western, I was quite unaware.  I don't blame the staff who, as I said at the outset, were all very polite and welcoming (though the majority of them appeared to be from Romania, which simply says something about the pay in the hospitality business).  But I assume they were acting on orders from above and terrified of the risk two old men in their 70's would skedaddle owing for two beers and two meals.  Incidentally, talking of beers: it wouldn't be a bad thing if the Holiday Inn people could bring themselves to stock proper beer instead of lager. Lager is not (yet) compulsory in the Common Market, and, indeed, we are on our way to escaping from it.  If they can't keep a draught beer, then let them be very brave and buy a crate or two of the hundreds and hundreds of craft beers being brewed by micro-breweries such as the East London Brewing Company of Lammas Road E10.All-in-all, though, I would stay here again if in the area.

I stayed here for a weekend so I could take my son around London. I noticed at the booking process that there was parking available for an extra fee.The hotel is located just shy of 10 minutes ( and felt like a lot less; even with an 8 year old in tow! ) from Stratford Station, pretty much a straight road, and you cant miss it when you reach the station, ( or the hotel - dependant on what form of transport you use to get theren).The hotel itself had lovely decor down stairs, with plenty of seating space, and the dining area where free breakfast was offered. I was welcomed with a smile and recognised as a member of the club they are connected to, and offered free wifi and complimentary late check out.. which I was very happy with - It's always nice to feel like a valued customer!I booked twin room for two nights. The guest room seemed bland in comparison to the lounge / reception area, but the room was clean, tidy, and had plenty of storage solutions (plenty of space to hang coats and store children's extra bits and bobs) and work space, (which was extremely useful for me to do coursework as well as office work!). I also noticed the hotel offered joining rooms at this point. The bathroom was clean, and made good use of the size. *Note For Review Purposes that you may not get a bath in your room.The only downsides I found were; - poor lighting in both the bathroom and guest room,- I could only find one plug socket.. which is not very useful when you need to charge a few things ready for the next day!- and it got really cold in the middle of the night.. which is not their problem so much as they do offer air con/ heating in room, but me trying to figure out the machine at 3AM without waking my son up is kind of hard to do.. Sometimes you have to clutch at straws for cons..I noticed the hotel offered a room for you to iron your clothes near the lift (on my floor), and a vending machine tucked away on the ground floor next to the lifts with a few basic necessities, drinks & snacks. The Breakfast is what you expect, and although I never considered to ask; (something I would normally do) I noticed no dairy alternatives on display, and I don't eat pork, so breakfast was limited, but there was enough variety for me to venture off course from my usual. * I mention for review purposes *Check Out was nearly quick and simple - a slight mishap, but the staff dealt with it efficiently and was more than happy to help - and a goodbye with a smile.I would recommend this hotel for families, business stays or weekends away with friends. I found it to be good value for money and would consider staying there again.

An average clean hotel. Room a little on the small size but adiquate.Bed comfy large and clean. Staff on reception ok bar staff ok food not up to much but there are a lot of places to eat in Stratford.

Had an event at the Olympic Aquatic Centre to attend and the hotel was ideally situated for that being a short 10 minute walk. Also same distance to Arcelor Mittal Orbital Tower. Accommodation was good for a budget hotel and breakfast was substantial. Cliental varied and interesting.   Shame about the fire alarm being set by someone smoking in the room but staff handled it very well and good to know the alarm is that sensitive.

column9: It is confortable and it has a good service
column10: I stayed there for a week and the time there it was confortable and without any problem, the attention of the personal it was great and the breakfast was also good. The only small problem it was the location it is quite far from the cool things to see, around that area there isn't too much things to see or go.

Hotel is clean and receptionists were always very helpful.  Room was spacious but internet was weak at times.  Bfast was typical of this chain of hotels.  Within 10 mins walk from Stratford underground & international train stations. Overall a good business hotel even though price is on high side.

column9: Great location with easy access to the underground
column10: We have stayed here for one night, during boxing day. It has a great location, close to Westfield and underground connection straight to London city centre. Good breakfast, clean, with parking place (¬£20 per night) and friendly staff.

This budget hotel is located close to the Olympic Park but provides easy transport links to central London. The main tube station is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and from here almost anywhere in central London is not much more than a 20 minute journey away.We arrived almost two hours before the published check-in time but as our room was ready the reception staff were very happy to let us have immediate access. The room has plenty of room for two with a compact shower room.The buffet breakfast was a lot better than I was expecting with a good range of hot and cold items all the items I tried were excellent. I will definitely stay here again when in London.

Got in from long trip to the holiday Inn first we got greeted from a rude lady who then asked another lady to deal with us which was strange as we just walk through the door. But the other lady was lovely helpful even let us take champagne glasses and cooler upstairs very nice, a little bit annoying on the room however I wrote down when I booked I wanted something special in the room as it was mine and my other half a anniversary or just a kind gesture but nothing she even asked me what room I'd like when I get there. But room was clean comfy beds, standard buffet breakfast nothing special, we heard alot of bangig and running around whilst our stay but i did see a few looked like students. If your just staying over night decent place.

Booked to stay here as we were going to the O2 and this looked a reasonable distance from it. As it turns out the location was perfect: a short walk to the station and then 4 stops on the Jubilee line takes you straight there. Room was comfortable, nice large shower with good pressure and hairdryer was powerful.Only small downsides for us were the people being noisy in the hallway at 7am on a Sunday which woke us up (though not the fault of the hotel), and I thought breakfast could have had a little more range (fried eggs would be a nice addition!). Staff were very friendly and helpful. We'll stay again if we go to an event at the O2.

column9: Easy access to London Stratford Westfield
column10: Good value comfortable accommodation near to stratford facilities of Westfield and travel connections.   Friendly check-in.     Small breakfast and bar areas with light breakfast option available and included in room rate.

column9: Good location but no parking facility
column10: The hotel was really good in it's ambience and the rooms were decent in size. They advertise as they provide parking but they charge ¬£20 per night. But there is a street beside the road where you can park much cheaper with pay and display.

Stayed here for two nights whilst visiting London for the AC/DC concert at the Olympic stadium. Firstly, the hotel has great transport links, it's a 5 minute walk to either Stratford international or Stratford high street station and not much further to the behemoth that is Westfield shopping centre & the Olympic park.The hotel is bright, airy and has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The room was exactly what we had booked & paid for; comfortable beds, good shower room and tea/coffee facilities. The beds were comfy, we had a large TV & air conditioning and the breakfast was tasty & plentiful, what more could you ask for?  Staff were friendly, check in/out was quick and we really did have a restful stay despite being on a very busy road. Thank you Holiday Inn express!

The hotel is ok, nothing special. Very basic. Location of the area is ok, around 5 - 10 minute walk from Stratford station.  Close to the shopping centre too. Downside is it takes an age to get anywhere because of the tubes being always busy!

Needed to spend 3 nights in London and found the prices unbelievable- ¬£300 a night for a Premier Inn for example ! Anyway, through IHG I booked this hotel at about ¬£155 a night inc breakfast. Room was fine, spacious shower for example and obviously HI Express standard. Bed was comfy. Well handy for transport, about 10 mins walk away to Rail, Tube, Buses. I landed at London City and got a Black Cab - ¬£20.Staff were friendly and from lots of different European countries. They even have an EU flag outside! I took the offer to not have the room serviced and got 250 extra points a day + 400 points instead of a free drink on my IHG card.....Breakfast was OK...nothing to write home about but perfectly adequate and included in the priceIF I was visiting again I would stay there again

I have said this time & time again, if you're looking to take pics in a hotel & flick it up for the gram, this is not the hotel for all of that. If you're looking for a hotel that's clean, room service every morning or on call when you need them, friendly service and MOST IMPORTANTLY conveniently located to a majority of all the major places and tourist attractions, THIS IS IT. This hotel is an 8 minute walk from the biggest shopping wall in the UK, Westfield. This is my 2nd time at the hotel and I have never been disappointed in the amenities or with the staff. I had a package coming from Sweden & they accepted and held it for me upon arrival. Checking in and out is always quick and easy. No hassles. Thanks again guys.

Trying hard to think of a positive about this hotel, the staff were pleasant and helpful. Other than that all downhill, not easy to find way on tube with all the changes, we eventually took the underground to Mile End and got a bus along to hotel. We were charged ¬£160 for a twin room per night including breakfast ( if you can call it that), best thing about breakfast was the orange juice which was really good, sausages hard and over cooked, powdery scrambled eggs, bacon mostly fat covered, no cups for tea or coffee and had to ask for them, cudnt find butter for toast or rolls which were solid as in hard. The beds were quite uncomfortable and hard, rooms cold during the night and tv not easy to work with no instructions. After staying in holiday inn at kings cross on Friday night which was fabulous, this was a big big disappointment. Wudnt recommend it at all

column9: Nice stay easy to get to.
column10: This was our second stay at this hotel. Can walk to this hotel from the train station. Took us about ten minutes. Ideal for the shopping centre as well. We were at the back of the hotel so it was quiet. Our room was a bit cold. Put the heating on for a bit but didn't make any difference as there was a draught coming through the gap in the window.  Room was clean and beds lovely and comfortable. The breakfast was the same as the last time we stayed, bacon, sausage,beans and scrambled eggs. If you are a vegetarian this is a poor selection for a hot breakfast could only have beans and egg. The continental part of the breakfast was okay. We would stay here again but would go else where for breakfast so I could get a decent hot vegetarian  breakfast.( Only reason I have given average is because of the choice of hot breakfast. Last time I reviewed this hotel I was a meat eater so gave it very good)

Had a relaxing stay here. Staff were very good and the room I was in was a good size and clean. Can get a little noisy at night as it is on a main road but all in all it was a good stay. Must say that the food in the restaurant was very cheap and very good. Would stay again

Return every year when attending WTM. Good value for money hotel. Would recommand this when you are attending a fair at the Excel. Friendly staff and good value for money. Rooms are ok. Bathroom need an update.

We stayed in this hotel when we went to see cycling in the Olympic park. It is located in a very good place about a 5 minute walk to the centre of Stratford and Westfield. The staff are very friendly and approachable. There was one little problem that we had where the staff tried to add on money for a dinner even though it was included in the package, but that was solved quickly. The rooms were average for a one night stay. Beds were comfy and the room was clean. Breakfast was delicious and had a wide range of things to eat and drink. Although it is on a busy road, you cannot hear the cars. Overall, it is a good hotel to stay in if you are staying in London for a short amount of time.

column9: Weekend stop over in Stratford London
column10: My wife and I stayed in Stratford after going to the London (Olympic) Stadium to watch West Ham. We booked in advance via IHG; we were checked in early and made most welcome. The room was very comfortable with good linen and amenities. Later we ate in the bar/restaurant and the food was very good and reasonable cost. We slept well and the cooked breakfast was lovely. The staff were all friendly and helpful - this was a very pleasant stay at a fair price.

I have given this hotel two stars purely because of the parking situation. There are about 10 or so spaces at this hotel. I was booked to stay there for a week as I was working in the area but when I arrived the hotel car park was full, I called the hotel whilst waiting at the gates to the car park to ask if there was another car park or other parking aviliable and was advised to could try and park along the road (no spaces either) or I could go and park in Bingo which is approx a 5 minute walk away and would also cost ¬£25 a night for that privilege too. This hotel needs to update their website and state there is limited parking. After approx half hour or so of my driving about trying to find somewhere close to the hotel I decided on cancelling my whole reservation but was then advised someone had left and a parking space was aviliable so luckily I could park overnight. However I did check out the next morning and am now in a different hotel with plenty of free parking spaces.I would like to say though the room was nice and clean and the staff were pleasant. Breakfast was limited but it is an express so this is the norm. A better selection of fruit would be nice though.

column9: Good value - very friendly staff - very small car park
column10: For the price (around ¬£65 Bed and Breakfast for two) this hotel is difficult to beat.The room was very clean and bright with a comfy bed, decent TV, no bath but an excellent shower with double sized cubicle.All the staff were most friendly and helpful, and the hotel was very clean and shiny.Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of cereals and cooked offerings, as well as fruit and plenty of drinks. We were very early to breakfast so very few other guests were there - could be some waiting for toast and hot drinks at peak times I would imagine.To say there is a car park is a bit of an exaggeration. We arrived at  2.00 pm and it was full - it really is very small. On the upside the hotel is a ten minute walk from the massive and cheap Westfield car parks - we parked there for much less than the ¬£20 per day at the hotel. Wouldn't be great in bad weather of course, and Stratford High Street is not the most desirable of areas, but we had no problems. Car park C is closest.All in all I would be happy to use this hotel again, although if the price were similar would prefer a hotel in the Westfield complex.

column9: Usual expectations of Hotel Chain at this location
column10: Only really worth bothering if you need to stay near Olympic Park or the Shopping Centre.Rooms are fine - reception staff a little distracted, and breakfast staff very officious, if you arrive after 9.29 - don't expect to get any breakfast. Oh, and they charge ¬£20 for parking per night in the on-site garage.

Nice clean hotel. Slightly longer walk than advertised to Westfield and the station. One tube no change to Covent Garden show area. There is building work so do as I did and ask for ear plugs if you want a lay in.

Its a reasonable hotel and close yo train...bus station. Also close by restaurants. The staff is v supportive, just ask and ready to help. A bit far from main city but easily accessible by train . bus.

column9: Corporate, good hotel. Don't bother with the food.
column10: Nice standard corporate hotel. Small but smart well designed rooms. Good check in and out. Polite staff on reception. DLR and tube nearby. 20 mins into city centre. Bars and restaurants nearby in the Westfield centre. No real life outside of hotel. Breakfast standard average fair and included. Restaurant food not good. Firstly it was cold and sent back, then it was average at best. I wouldn't normally eat in hotel but it was late so had to. Shame. All in all I would stay again as location and price isn't bad at all but wouldn't bother with the food.

column9: Modern Inn with Great Disabled Person Facilities.
column10: Immaculately clean, warm and friendly hotel. Lovely comfortable beds. Food well presented, reasonably priced and very tasty. Great disabled fascilities with new wet rooms fully functional for wheelchairs. A short walk to the large shopping malls. Only one down side to this hotel,  there is only a few parking places, so you have to arrive early in the day to ensure your parking. Plus it is ¬£20 per night.

I had picked this Hotel because it had a parking .. they have a parking but it has few parking spots .so had to park my car at the Shopping center 10 minutes walk.Next I had booked for a twin room , I was told that there was no longer any twin rooms and had to go for a double one.. Then told it was a disabled room , Once in the room noticed it was a communicating room and the room was on the road side.Could here the next door guest as if in the same room !! and being on the road side and on the top floor could still here the traffic. Overall I had a bad night sleep .. I was doing the L'Etape London race on the following day !The Hotel is clean as for the restaurant the food is nice and staff friendly.

Everything is very good here including desk service on arrival and satisfying client demands.But I gave it a 3stars cause it has the same repetitive breakfast every morning,which can get tiring.otherwise everything is excellent.

column9: Poor dingy rooms, inconvinient location, below average brekfast
column10: Stayed here for 7 nights on business trip. The room and bathroom were small but clean. The room was very dark with a shade of blue which was very depressing. The TV, carpet, desk and all interior was old and in need for an upgrade and the wifi was very weak. There are no restaurants /supermarkets in the immediate vicinity and the stratford mall/ station is 3 bus stops away. If you want to stay in the area, i would recommend a couple of other hotels next to it and across the road for similar price points.

Nice hotel in Stratford. Room is medium size and s very convenient and the bathroom is big, however slippery. It is located near Stratford center. The staff is helpful. I really like it. I do Recommend it.

column9: The helpful and friendly staff made our stay
column10: Our room was not overly big and the mattress was a bit hard for my liking. However the room was clean and all the staff we met were very nice and helpful. This was a good value for money hotel. It was just around the corner from the Westfield shopping centre and easy to commute into central London from this location.

column9: Good value Hotel with excellent transport links
column10: Stayed for four nights recently as a base for exploring London. Room was ok size wise, extremely clean and well equipped with toiletries, hairdryer, tea & coffee making facilities. Breakfast was fairly typical hotel fare with the cooked options being sausages, bacon, beans and scrambled eggs. Other options included croissants, toast, muffins and cereals. Be warned that the breakfast is a bit of a free for all and can be extremely busy at times. Hotel is situated a 10 minute walk from Stratford tube and bus stations, which means excellent links for central London. Overall for the price this makes a good base for exploring and we would stay again.

Hotel was clean and friendly. Had disabled access room. Short walk to Strarford Westfield. Meant to book Westfield but booked this instead. Prefer Westfield for access to shops, restaurants etc. Buffet area was very small but breakfast adequate.

Stayed here for two nights with family and the hotel staff are really friendly and always smiling. The rooms are well kept they are not big  but that was expected as its a Holiday Inn Express and the bathroom is small but manageable.   The price included free breakfast and had a great selection of food.If you want to go to Westfields shopping center its a under 10 minutes walk or 2 minutes on the bus.

I've had some varying experiences at some of the budget chain hotels but this was a really pleasant surprise: everything was of the highest standard. I only stayed one night and the room was great - clean, a good choice of TV channels and a very comfortable bed.  There was tea and coffee-making facilities and the wi-fi was the best I've had in a hotel. The air-con was good and the room was well sound-proofed.I regret not eating supper at the hotel - I hadn't checked the menu and went off to eat some dodgy "food" in a pub nearby (tip: don't eat or drink in local pubs). When I returned to the hotel bar for a couple of beers, I realised my mistake as I saw several people eating what I wished I'd had - and the prices were very reasonable. (The price of drinks was reasonable, too)The breakfast - and the hotel generally - reminded me of the Ibis Budget hotels in France. The breakfast was simple and fitted the bill. And included in the price.The staff were great - all polite, cheerful and helpful.The whole visit was pleasant and I could find no fault. I recommend this hotel without reservation.

Stayed here for 4 days by mistake .... hubby meant to book the Holiday Inn over at Westfield but we decided to stay here for a change , also for the free breakfast! Walk from Stratford Railway Station to HIE took about 10 mins , wasn't too sure about the area but we walked it every day without event. Not a huge room but it did have a sofa bed to sit on in the evening after doing a lot of walking. Although the hotel seemed very busy we managed to get good sleeps with no disturbances. Our room was at the back so no road noise either. Nice breakfast area with plenty of tables , breakfast the usual hot fare of sausages, bacon, scrambled egg and beans . Plenty of croissants, bread , muffins , cereal and fruit too. The coffee especially was very nice. Staff were efficient but not overly friendly, helpful nonetheless. Previously we liked being right at the shops and eating places at the Holiday Inn and would try and book there again but would probably be happy to book HIE if we were looking for a quick, cheap holiday and the price was right. Nothing wrong with the place at all just not attached to the Westfield !

I liked the staff at the reception was friendly, and location is close both to DLR and Metro. Its close to shopping center Westfield Strattford, and the stadium, extremely large rooms and bathrooms as for London standard.In the room there is hair dryer, and teapot for making tea.The negatives is noise from construction across the street, breakfast was not especially good but eatable.

Great location 8 minutes walk from Stratford station, good size room clean with tea and coffee maker.  Full breakfast included excellent range, can't complain about anything really, good stay.Free phone calls to local national and mobiles from the room which was an added bonus and access to an ironing room fab!!

Brilliant location, stayed here for the AC/DC concert. Came for two nights and enjoyed both.Easy to get too and well within walking distance to the Olympic Park, Stratford shopping centre and transport, as well as friendly establishments.The staff are friendly and the hotel clean with a big breakfast and lots of seating. The only downside would be the lack of barstaff around after a concert or event near by.

Stayed here for this years ride London Surrey 100, the staff were very welcoming and helpful, we were aloud to take our bikes to the room and breakfast was put on from 4.30am for the riders. The hotel is also only a 5 minute walk from Stratford high street and is very convenient for the Olympic park and Westfield. (Don't get confused with the holiday inn Westfield)

column9: You know what to expect at a HI Express
column10: Booked here at the last minute to visit our son who lives in Hackney Wick - it was a lovely 25'ish minute walk to his through the Olympic Park.We used the on site car park, it's pretty small & I'm not sure where else we could have parked had it been full.Pleasant greeting at reception & free drink voucher as I'm an IHG rewards member.Room was as expected for HI Express, apart from the double bed which was smaller than the beds I've had before, with the usual choice of firm/soft pillows & a fab shower.Breakfast was incredibly busy but the choice was pretty good.Parking was quite steep at ¬£20 a day, but the receptionist told us it was cool for us to leave our car there until 5:00pm on our check-out day - which was excellent.I'd probably only stay here again due to it's location.

column9: Better than some of the posher hotels
column10: We stayed here as a family for an event at the Olympic Stadium.  Having firstly got confused thinking I'd booked the Holiday Inn, Westfield (!) we had a 15 minute walk to the HIE, Stratford. We were warmly greeted and quickly checked into our room which was comfy and clean but a little tired in places, hence the 4/5 rating. Of note, the towels were lovely and fluffy, the shower easy to use (a particular bug bear of mine in hotels) and a satisfying inclusive breakfast. The waiting staff were very quick to replenish the breakfast fare and to clean the tables for the next incumbent. We were very impressed and will use this hotel again

I booked a family room which turned out to be a double bed with a double sofa bed, which was reasonably comfortable considering. Staff were very good during my stay, helpful and very professional, breakfast was good with plenty of choice. We had an evening meal only 1 night which again was good only 1 disappointment was when i went to order my sweet/pudding they had run out of Eton Mess and that was at 7.30pm. Excellent location for the olympic park and westfield shopping centre and transport network. Would recommend this hotel highly.

I used this hotel for a 1 night stay on a buisiness trip to London. I was very impressed with the room, standards of cleanliness, facilities, attitude of all staff and the food. I had an evening meal on arrival and expected the usual mediocre, average standard of fast food. Not at all, the fish was well cooked, tasty and well presented. Breakfast was also of good quality, well laid out and with plenty of choice. Reception was efficient and helpful. All in all a very good experience.

Stayed here again for a couple of nights. Wonderful welcome when we checked in and we were both happy with our room and s much needed air conditioning system which was SO needed because of the extremely hot weather. All the staff we came into contact with during our stay were lovely and it is not many hotels you can say that about nowadays.Dinner in the hotel was good and service excellent. Bar prices also very reasonable we felt. One wee chink in the hotel's armour might be the quality of food at breakfast. Not bad but certainly could be improved.All in all we really enjoyed our stay and if in the area again would certainly return to the hotel.

column9: Nice hotel near train and tube stations.
column10: We booked this hotel as it was near bethnal green and shoreditch where we was meeting friends. Good close access to tube station at Stratford. Friendly staff at reception and easy check in. We found rooms spacious good buffet breakfast included in price.only negatives poor lighting in bedroom and no mirror to do make up, and very poor quality toilet paper.

column9: A little more care and respect would make it so much better
column10: This hotel has a lot of plusses. We were friendly greeted at arrival. For London standards the room size is ok. We had two adjacent rooms. A double and a twin. The DLR is closeby and takes you to Westfield where you can change for the underground. As we planned a lot on the Central line this was very convenient. There is a Tesco Express one block down. Unluckily there is no fridge in the room and no icemachine in the hotel.The drainage of our shower could have been better. The quality of our beds was good. They gave us a room at the back and we opened the room during the night and had no problem with noise. There is a rather big school on this backside of the hotel so probably during the schoolyear more risk of noise.The only real minus was the very strict policy on breakfast hours on monday. We arrived 9h25 at the buffet (which is meant to be open until 9h30, 10h30 during the weekend) and staff was already clearing out. We saw around 12 people arriving after us, so the need for longer hours is clearly pointed out by their guests. The staff even took something of the shelves in front of a small kid. Unbelievable. What I really cannot accept is that there were no croissants left in the buffet and some twenty minutes later we see a member of staff parading through the room with a croissant in her hands. They keep the restaurant really clean but that's real poor client service. The orange juice is not of good taste and the water has a chlorine taste. When you do not drink coffee you don't have good options.I parked my car in Westfield shopping where you pay 6,5¬£ for 24 hrs during the week and 9,5¬£ during the weekend. I found it convenient having to do the 15 minutes walk back to the hotel just to unwind after a long cardrive from Belgium. At the hotel parking costs 20¬£.All in all good value with shopping and public transport nearby. Not sure if hospitality is everybodies ambition.

Was picked up from the airport early morning arriving from London Derry. Was disappointed as was ushered in from back door which was least impressive and learnt that the front was equally unassuming.How ever the reception staff was very nice and helpful.The location is very comfortable right near the tube station but still without any hustle and bustle.There is a bar attached but no restaurant for lunch. You can grab some snacks from the shop next doorRooms are small but cosy and well appointed.The room allowed to me was facing the main road but was not noises.The staff very friendly and helpful.Toiletries are bare minimum unlike other three star hotels in Europe this hotel provides for tea/ coffee provisions in the room therefore a boon for those who are used to bed tea.Over all good value for money

column9: Nice hotel in busy area -- clean, modern and good price
column10: Was very impressed with this efficient and well run hotel. I'd been in the area ten years earlier and it was difficult to get something modern, safe and affordable. This Holiday Inn Express was perfect for my needs. Great staff. Very nice buffet and dinner service.

This hotel has good connection to the tube & nearby malls for shopping. Rooms are good though small , breakfast is very good , no lunch & dinner does not have variety. No room service for food , no water bottles in room , but house keeping & laundry is good. Overall it is a good hotel & I stayed there with family for 6 nights !

Stayed here a few times with a few family members. The room was immaculate and the bed was very comfortable. I always love holiday inn hotels and have stayed in a few. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is right beside Westfield, however it's just out of the madness of the main part of Stratford. If your looking for a moderately priced vital that is clean, comfortable and close to the city, this is the one.

Well situated near to the Olympic Park, the impressive Westfield shopping mall and, frankly the future. This area of London is developing rapidly and is an exciting look into the future. The hotel is ideally located, clean, smart inside and has friendly staff, who left a good impression. The food surprised - well presented and very good. The breakfast area needs to be bigger. The buffet area is too small and at peak times over crowded. This should be addressed and so prevents me from awarding the highest marks. All in all, very adequate and the staff excellent.

My family come down to London to see us every xmas. We stayed with them at this hotel and was great. Rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. Staff helpful. Breakfast topped up well, and hot. Great variety. Great local amenities with Westfield a 5 minute walk and for half the price of the holiday inn at Westfield.

column9: Nice, clean, comfortable and friendly staff
column10: It's a nice, clean, comfortable and near to amenities. The rooms are big. The staff is friendly and that's pleasant surprise for London! Though they could have better breakfast. The breakfast menu is very limited, and having some more hot food would be nice.

Bit more an adventure getting to the hotel from London on trains but was a comfortable, more affordable experience. Rooms are comfortable with the amenities you would expect.The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They have a dinner service which had a nice variety of food and is served in the great room at a reasonable rate. ¬£46 for 2 sirloin steak dinner with adult drinks and a kid's chicken nuggets dinner. Breakfast is included with room and offers a variety of food to get you started. If you are staying near Stratford I would recommend!
