Stayed at holiday inn express Stratford for 2 nights was just average usually I stay at holiday inn Stratford west field mall which is much much better than this one had to stay here as Westfield holiday inn was fully booked. There's a lot of difference between the 2 properties room wise breakfast wise I mean was really let down was not upto my expectation. Parking: was too expensive should revise rate for parking

I had a great stay for 5 nights on business. I wouldn't say the location is great as there is nothing but a Tesco's nearby. However it's about a 20 minute walk to Westfield and other restaurants. In terms of accessibility it was perfect for me as there is a bus stop across the road and 4 stops later you're at Bow Road for the District line and Hammersmith & City Line given great access to everywhere needed. In terms of the hotel the staff are lovely. Really helpful and accommodating. The rooms are clean, spacious and contain all the usual amenities you'd expect from a Holiday Inn Express. What is nice is they have a decent bar/dining area which was conveniently showing the football. Overall I couldn't fault the hotel during my stay, the only reason for the 4 out of 5 is because of the limited options close to it for food. The Just Eat apps is great around here though.

I stayed one night only in this hotel as I was on a flying visit to London.  The room was fine and the bathroom adequate (shower only no bath).  The bed was extremely comfortable and a nice touch was the pillows labelled soft and hard. The hotel was quiet.  Breakfast was a help-yourself-buffet but there was most of the things you would expect.

column9: Good location, nice hotel, quite expensive for their facilities
column10: The hotel is Ok for medium expectation. It has a nice lobby and restaurant, clean and quiet rooms, ironing facilities and several other standard facilities (Wi-Fi, Led TVs, coffee / tea maker in rooms etc.) Access to location is very easy, from Stratford International or Central just keeping right on High Street (bus station remains on left) are around 5 minutes walking.  As street references, before Hotel on walking side there is a London College and a Travelodge office. On opposite side there is a red building named Poland House and face-to-face with Travelodge is an Olympic building. Hotel's entrance is on the cross with Carpenter's street on right side. Hotel has a contract with a cab (taxi) company so prices are sensible lowest (12-15 pounds vs. 22-25 pounds). Overall it is a 3 star hotel (an old building renewed) with small rooms without real closet (just an opened furniture), small bathrooms without any kind of special stuff. There is a parking place behind the hotel (exit from reception) for ~30 cars with 20 pounds per day. As well  there is a dedicated smoking area which is good if you'll like to drink your beers with a cigarette.If do not consider London prices, normally one night with breakfast to this hotel shall be not more than 50-80 Euro but for London a decent price may be 130-150 Euro.

Many thanks for an enjoyable stay, it was made particularly nice by the excellent warm friendly staff. A special thanks to Artiom for all his assistance and I would not hesitate to return to this hotel again given the warm friendly atmosphere created by Artiom and his fellow staff.

column9: Not worth the money. Far better available for cheaper.,
column10: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in June, so we could watch a concert at the Olympic stadium. It's location is very good with a 2 minute walk from the DLR and 10 minutes to the stadium or Westfield shopping centre. Apart from the location, this hotel was disappointing and appeared to be poorly managed. We paid nearly ¬£200 for our second night (the price was raised I presume because ACDC were playing at the stadium) breakfast on our first morning was a disaster. No where to sit, food running out and not being replaced and no one managing huge amounts of people. On the Sunday morning, 7.30 am, the cooked breakfast consisted of baked beans. The rest turned up 10 mins later. The bedroom was ok, but the bed was small and the handle on the window was broken. In the morning the toilets near reception, resembled a school disco. They had obviously not be checked since the evening before. There are no frills hotels, that offer a better quality and service for a lower price.

The hotel is ok for a couple of nights.  Very handy for the Olympic Stadium for gigs.  Staff very friendly.  Breakfast not much to write home about, other than its included in the price of your room.  Rooms seem quite quiet even on a busy gig night.  Only noise seems to come from the constant traffic outside.  Shower was excellent.  My only major complaint is the bed...it was tiny!  I don't think I've slept in a bed this small since I was a kid.  My hubby and I were hanging out each side of the blooming thing.

We stayed here over the Bank Holiday weekend. It's 0.7 miles from the Train/Underground but is an easy walk. The rooms are clean and comfortable and come with shower gel/shampoo, handwash, towels, tissues, hairdryer, TV, tea & coffee making facilities (although it would be better if they had a bigger supply of coffee and milk in the room as there's only really enough for one drink each - based on two people).The location is quiet so we got a good nights sleep.Breakfast is a self-service buffet and there's plenty of everything and it's all fresh. Continental breakfast, full English, cereals, porridge, toast, fruit, yoghurt, croissant, tea, coffees, juices - everything you need to set you up for the day.

With HIE you know what to expect, but this one does deliver just a little bit more. The staff are very welcoming, helpful and positive. The breakfast is excellent, and security is good.Rooms are pretty standard, but very clean. Access to the Olympic park is simple as is central London by bus every few minutes.

We were delighted with this hotel as we had tickets for the Euro swimming comp at the Olympic pool; which you can see from the hotel which is just a 8 min walk away. For a 3 star hotel it was excellent although we did not eat there so we can't comment on food. Our room as at the end of the corridor on the 2nd floor; it was quiet and clean. The bed was comfortable (although we are used to a bigger quilt), the bathroom was well appointed and the room was a good size with a sofa/bed-settee. Lovely big, white towels and 2 pillows each (not always the case in London). The staff were helpful especially when I needed help to print off some documents.

Nothing to write home about really. Parking ¬£10, is in a locked enclosure which is good. Resturant is OK too I had a Thai noodle dish which was great the breakfast was less impressive, toasters were more like warmers! The rooms are just basic HIEX with small TV. WiFi is free & fast. It's fairly modern and Ok for a short business stay. There's not much to do around there and the main shopping area is to be avoided!

On main road but not noisy. Nice clean room, comfy single beds, tea and coffee facilities, shower, hairdryer, Free wifi, ironing room provided on our floor. Breakfast self service some hot choice (bacon, sausage, beans, scrabbled egg, toast, continental -  fruit, pastries, croissants, yoghurts, cereals.) excellent value, short walk to the station/underground.

We've got what we've paid for. Hotel location is handy for shopping - Westfield mall is just 10 mins walk away. Good connection of trains from the station which is also around 10 mins walk away - once you get to know train lines it's pretty easy to get around. Clean room, good breakfast, good service. The only downside - no iron/board in the room.

column9: One of the Better HIEs I've Stayed In
column10: The hotel is absolutely fine for a Holiday Express, in fact, compared to some of the other ones I‚Äôve stayed in, it‚Äôs way better, especially when it comes to breakfast. I actually enjoyed my breakfast here, unlike some other HIEs.And I was really impressed that when we asked the manager (I think he was) one night about the laser we saw in the sky in the evening, he went away and a few minutes later came back with a print-out of a news article about it.  So he‚Äôd taken the trouble to look it up and come back and tell us about it. I think that was a nice thing to do.

GOOD* Recently refurbished so everything feels slick, new & modern. It's still a HI Express but definitely feels a cut above others I've stayed in and especially compared to the day before at Glasgow Riverside Express (hence the hashtag)* Room overlooks park area (not wastebins)* Evening restaurant in-hotel with a goodish selection. I had a nicely cooked salmon fillet on asparagus (...restaurant facilities is where the brand does actually vary a lot)* Ironing board in a neat glass room in the floor lobby...keep your stuff nice and pressed while waving at the passing guests* Location suited me; out of the city centre but within spitting distance of the Olympic Park and close to a DLR station (Stratford High Street) so I could get to Liverpool Street within 10-15minsNOT SO GOOD* Very busy at breakfast..well it is London and a good example of the brand so I suppose occupancy rates are always high.DOTARS LITTLE EXTRASBathrobe - noShoe horn - noComplimentary mineral water - noDidn't expect them as it is a HI Express but hey my reviews follow a rigid model so thought I should include them for completeness

column9: Of a standard you would expect, with more
column10: I had stayed at a Treavelodge nearby and new this location would work well for the London marathon. It is of a standard you would expect from a new Holiday Inn, with the usual room and dining set-up.However, this had a nice seating area for food which doubled as a bar and worked well. It was also a tad more plush then you would maybe expect. What set this place apart from previous stays at similar hotels were the staff who were excellent, from check-in to bar and breakfast employees.

Stayed at the hotel in a family room with my husband and 3 year old. My parents and sit and uncle also had double rooms. We stayed two nights to run and support the London Marathon and the hotel was fab. Ideal location to for the marathon start and to get around the capital. Rooms were really clean and spacious for the type of hotel, staff all friendly and attentive and buffet breakfast a welcome addition and offered a broad choice, all well cooked and regularly replenished. Brilliant. Will certainly return soon!

Although this hotel is in a lovely location for the Westfield shopping centre, the Olympic stadium, the Orbital, Stratford bus & train station I found this was the main thing in it's favour. There is no safe in the bedroom (although there are 8,yes just 8, in the foyer for guest use), only 6 coat hangers in the closet area and no drawer storage.We had an evening meal in their restaurant. The menu was simple but sufficient if you were only staying a couple of nights but would be tedious after that. We both ordered steak, one rare and one medium but there was no difference in the cooking.My friend decided to eat hers anyway (she wanted rare) and both had lovely flavour,Breakfast is complementary and plentiful. The cooked breakfast was not very appetising though, the scrambled eggs were 'powdery', the sausages were chipolatas, bacon was overcooked and left warming so was rubbery and only had baked beans-no tomatoes. Cereals, croissants, yoghurts & fruit were very fresh and hot drinks from a machine so made up for the disappointing cooked breakfast.I would not stay here again out of choice.

This hotel is located just 10 min walk from Stratford station where you can have great shopping at Westfields. The hotel includes breakfast and wifi. The rooms are clean and the staff nice and helpful. To get to London city just get on the underground at Stratford and you are at Oxfors in ca 15 min.

If you want a service par excellence, with 5 star chef, then this is it... Yes for real - Syfur is service personified, can you believe this man made me one of the best vegetable curries ever, he did off menue and with skill, dedication and attention that I've not had staying in central London. Give it a go, be clear about your expectations (talk to the team) and you will not be disappointed.

We stayed here for 2 nights from the 7th April, and couldn't have picked a better hotel.  The location was brilliant, 10 minute walk from the bus and train station, with the Westfield Shopping Centre right next to it.  The staff were extremely friendly, the room was immaculate and breakfast was fab, with a great selection of hot and cold food being served.  We will most definately be staying again and would happily recommend the hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay.  Many thanks for an extremely pleasant first stay in London :)

Great location (near tube and train stations,also close to Westfield shopping centre),super breakfast (including cereals,fruits and many more; also typical British breakfast),nice and helpfull staff,small but cosy room with nice bathroom :) Everything OK!!Highly recommend ;)

Stayed for one night with my boyfriend and everything was perfect. Great location to get around in London, very helpful staff too. Room was lovely and had a lot of space and very clean with everything you could need. Would definitely visit again.

The hotel is practically minutes away from the Westfield shopping Centre which is a good looking building lots of things to do there and Stratford Stations also across the road from Gala Bingo, which is a plus in my view

Quick and efficient check in, room small but every thing you needed and very clean. 5 minutes from Westfield and Stratford train and bus station. Free breakfast was a bonus and was really tasty. Coffee was also lovely. Would have no problem staying here again next time I return to London.

Stayed last weekend with my husband.  Great location for Westfield and Olympic park.Hotel nice and clean, staff attentive. Found room to be surprisingly quiet considering we were overlooking the road.

I'm not used to sleeping in expensive hotels. I thought this one was really expensive but it was really nice to sleep here. it was not close to the city centre so that was a shame... but the breakfast was great! i would prefer to sleep somewere cheaper. But the beds were nice, everything was clean and the breakfast was lovely.

One night whistle stop visit. Booked due to close proximity to the park (10 mins steady walk). Hotel was clean, friendly staff and had ample amenities. Was delighted to secure parking at the hotel (about 10 spaces on first come first served basis) as not clear where other parking was available. TV, free wifi, and a complimentary buffet breakfast made it a great choice. We arrived back after the restaurant had closed, but the hotel allowed us to order in pizza to eat in our rooms....a nice gesture.

First time at this hotel and it really was spot on. A short walk from Stratford Station, reception area spacious and doubles as the bar and restaurant area. Greeted by very friendly staff and recognised as a PC member, small problem with my key card was sorted by brilliant staff ( I had my key the wrong way round!), probably enjoyed a laugh at my expense and fair play. Room was spacious, clean, had I all I needed and the shower was huge compared to some Holiday Inns I have stayed in. Didn't eat in the evening but enjoyed a pint later in the bar. With breakfast thrown in on the price it was great value, a really good selection to choose from hot and cold food. I am staying here again in April and looking forward to it. Well done a great hotel hotel.

column9: Decent choice for Stratford - great staff - small family rooms
column10: Stayed here as a family of four. The family room we were given was not very spacious. The pull out sofa bed was not big enough to fit two people comfortably. Staff were efficient and helpful, explaining to us the hotel facilities, breakfast times etc. upon arrival. We requested more duvets and pillows to the room and they were brought up within minutes. Excellent staff really so well done.The hotel is situated about five to ten minutes from Westfield shopping centre in Stratford. It is right next to the Travelodge. This is NOT the standard Holiday Inn hotel which is located on the Westfield shopping centre premises. However, both hotels are in close proximity to each other. Location is fine, quite close to Stratford station for public transport.WiFi worked okay but wasn't the fastest.Breakfast was included in the rate. Busy at times but never had an issue finding a place to sit. Not bad food but quite a small selection when compared to the likes of Premier Inn.Overall, not a bad stay at all. Staff were great and location is just fine. But the room was too small to fit us all (a family of four) comfortably I felt. A larger room with two proper double (or one double and two single) beds would have been better.Not great value for money either. (About ‚Ç¨800 for a five night stay)3*** seems about right.

My fiancee and I stayed here for one night to visit the Olympic park and Westfield. The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable. If there was a critisism, the heating /air con was noisy, even when we turned out off. The breakfast was the usual holiday inn express standard- but it was included. The location was great-just a 15 minutes walk to Westfield and the olympic park(it was in a good location and the walk was pleasant). The staff were excellent. I would stay here again and commute into London.

Clean, tidy room for two adults and two kids (double bed + sofa bed) was perfectly comfortable.Breakfast on the Sunday morning was a bit manic with hundreds of people vying for the food and tables. To be fair, the whole situation was kept under control with staff efficiently clearing tables and replenishing stock.Parking is minimal (a handful of spaces) and felt quite pricey (¬£20/day).Shame about the midnight evacuation for a fire alarm, otherwise a great place, reasonably priced.

For a one night stay for a nearby sport event it was ideal. Friendly efficient staff and spotlessly clean double room. Free Wi-Fi throughout. Strangely since it is on the High Street there are very few restaurants in the nearby area, though plenty at the Westfield Shopping Centre which is approximately15min walk. There is a basic bar menu; burgers, pizza, pasta etc for those wishing to eat in. For convenience I used the ¬£20 /night locked car park, alternatively could use the cheaper 24 hr Westfield Shopping Centre Car Park. (Park B).

We stayed here for one night, it was our first experience of a Holiday Inn Express hotel and we were very happy with the experience.  Had no problem checking in or out and we were dealt with efficiently.  We had a room on the top floor, the lifts worked, the room was more than adequate, clean and pleasantly decorated.  A shower only, which worked fine and plenty of hot water.  We had a peaceful night, followed by the complimentary breakfast which was varied and plentiful, including porridge.  Plenty of room in the breakfast area and had no problems finding seats. Good value Hotel.

column9: Pretty good for a budget hotel
column10: Stayed for 1 night for business purposes. For a budget hotel room was good, breakfast was ok, plenty of choice but hot food just sat under a lamp for ages. Evening food menu very limiting but restaurants approx 10 minute walk. Approx 10 minute walk from Stratford train & bus station. Staff were friendly although didn't seem to be enough on, I had to wait 10 minutes in check in & nearly 15 to order dinner & drink, maybe I just got there when staff were on breaks.

On third floor, room spacious and clean, check in quick, have food allergies and when at breakfast, the manager asked if was ok and explained there was no soya milk, he sent the chef to buy some and said he would prepare anything I wanted as most on offer was contains gluten . Fab service, great stay and already planning next visit.

Holiday Inn Express is now my favourite budget hotel. Stratford was just another example of how they do things right. A great welcome from Giuseppe, the extra bed made up for us and free breakfast thrown in.We were close enough to DLR and tube/overground to get to the sights and sounds of central London.

We were looking to stay near Stratford and all the hotels were fully booked, we managed to get a Family room for 4 at a very good rate, the rooms were very clean and looked fairly new. The breakfast is included in the price and was good. There was plenty to choose from, cooked, pastries and continental. We were lucky and found parking close by it was a Sunday so parking was free. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Spent four days here and it was very comfortable indeed. The staff were really pleasant and very helpful. The room was clean and had a lovely comfortable bed. The breakfast had lots of choice and my only gripe was the bacon had white gunge on it which is a sign of poor quality. Would definitely return

Great stay No complaints other than no fried eggs, and they use rehydrated scrambled eggs. 1 Staff member really did her best to do every thing she could to improve our stay nothing we asked for was to much trouble ... wish I got her name but she was on reception both Saturday and Sunday long frizzy Auburn hair ... great girl takes her job seriously and is glad to help

This was my first time staying at this particular hotel. Reception staff were very courteous and helpful. The room I had was a good size, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good with a good selection. Evening food was good with a varied selection , which would meet most tastes.I use IHG a lot and have stayed in most of the groups brands around the world. Holiday Inn Express is a great brand offering quality at an affordable price. I shall be using this hotel again, quite a lot this year as I will be in the area for work this year. As an IHG Gold member, you get my vote !!!!

column9: Value for money stay in a convenient location
column10: I stayed from Jan 14th-18th and for my first visit to London, I had nothing really to complain about during my stay. At 80pounds a night, I was told it was a good deal - especially since breakfast was included. Although the size of the room was small, I understand that's really how hotels are in London - and I was thinking "small" relative to other hotels I've been in India and other parts of the world where I've paid the same price;  but a comparison like that is not right (especially when I start converting pounds to rupees and thinking "oh gosh! I could have got a villa in a 4 star hotel at that rate!"). The best part really was the location - a short walk from the Stratford tube station; my husband and I found it so convenient to just walk over to the station, visit all the different parts of London station to station - and then get back at night to the hotel via tube again. I loved it! I even used the tube from Heathrow airport to the hotel - a tube ride just over an hour long and then a 15 minute walk to the hotel itself. The breakfast spread was good- again, I haven't experienced any other hotels in London but I've been told that breakfast being included for that price was a good deal! The staff were also friendly; and our rooms were made up promptly by the time we got back in the evenings. Plus free wi-fi as well. A nice stay overall - and I would definitely come back again.

column9: Great location, great staff... great hotel
column10: We stayed here because we need to be in two different locations for training courses in London. To be honest we weren't expecting much from a relatively low-priced, out of town, express hotel. How wrong were we! The location is fantastic - easy to reach by car (and outside the congestion charge zone), 5 minutes walk from the DLR, not much further to Stratford station with rail & bus connections to everywhere. The staff were fabulous, room was clean and tidy, breakfast was significantly better than expected, wi-fi worked and was free, housekeeping was good... Really difficult to find anything wrong with our stay! The only slight hiccup was the size of the car park - we were OK but I know some guests were turned away - but I guess that's expected in Central London.Overall, a great stay - highly recommended!

I had to visit London to go see a friend in Hospital. Another friend found me this hotel which as it turns out was an excellent location for my weekend requirements. The bus to the hospital stopped right across the road. The staff were lovely, very friendly and helped with directions. There was a Gala Bingo just 5 minutes walk away for evening entertainment.

If you're looking for a 5* hotel with great decor to take pics in;this isn't it. If you're looking to be close to all the attractions such as Westfield Mall, London Bridge , Hyde Park, etc, this hotel is an hour away from it all.  Rooms are clean, made daily, breakfast is included in my package,staff very helpful and friendly, so far I'm enjoying my stay. The housekeeps are nice as well. I have no complaints.

Great place to stay , near the mall and very clean . Would have loved to know more about Adrea though . She always had this great morning smile to start your day and she never stopped cleaning . Would have loved to stay longer but had to return to work . Lobby staff very helpful, train station like a block away ,bus stop right there to take you as far as you want .

column9: clean, cheap, good breakfast, nice staff
column10: We have stayed here twice now. The rooms are quite nicely styled, good looking, well presented and clean. I think it must be newly refurbished as it all looks and feels new and clean and fresh. The staff are cheerful and helpful. Everything in the room worked well and the breakfast (which is included in the price of the room) is limited to a few hot items- sausage, egg, and beans and the usual yoghurts/fruit/juices/cereals/rolls/bread/pastries,  is plentiful and good quality and tasty,This hotel is on a busy and noisy road so I would suggest a room facing the Olympic park and higher up if possible. I would definitely return and recommend it.

Stayed for 1 night with my boyfriend recently, was an easy 10 minute walk from Stratford Station/Westfield and is a really modern and clean hotel. Rooms and all areas look pretty much brand new, comfy beds, bathrooms were spotless and was a great shower. Staff could be a bit more welcoming/friendlier, as they were quite blunt and rude, but other than that it was nice and would stay again. Breakfast was also good and included in the price!

We stayed at this hotel for a few days in December. The room was clean and tidy, and a bed was very comfortable. Friendly reception guys, tasty breakfast (but the same variety of options every day). It is located 7 min walk from the Stratford station. Perfect location if you want to go shopping at Westfield shopping centre. We enjoyed our stay here.

I enjoyed my 3 days visit here. The breakfast was awesome! I was put in a room for the handicapped. And although I initially complained I loved it! Very spacious room and bathroom. And very clean too. The rooms are sparsely furnished! I was on a smoking floor and each time I stepped out of the lift the smell of cigarettes hit me. My tv also didn't work well in the 3 days I was there. I eventually found a Christian radio channel on the tv and that kept me entertained so I really didn't miss TV. The staff was as awesome as the breakfast! Very helpful and attentive. And the hotel is only a 5 minutes walk to Stratford tube and bus station with connections to almost everywhere in the UK. Bus 25 to and from Oxford street  picks and drops you right in front of the hotel! Awesome location, awesome staff and awesome food. Not forgetting very reasonably priced rooms. I think it deserves 5 stars but keeping a star for the cigarette smell, non functional tv and sparse furnishing. Will definitely come here again!

Quiet location near the Stratford tube,I stayed for 2 nights for a trip to London for work,very friendly reception staff,great steak&buffet breakfast. Had an early start for my flight&gentleman on reception pre ordered my cab&early breakfast request..Good value for money.

column9: Need more variant for breakfast. Worthed for budget hotel.
column10: I went to london n stayed at this hotel last month for 4days. 10 minuted walk to bus station and tube. The room is clean,  staff are very friendly and helpfull. Free wifi and good connection. Breakfast was included but always have the same menu while i was there for 4 days. Only have bacon and  saussage that i couldnt eat that. So i just can eat scramble eggs n croisant. The croisant taste is soft, I love it.For budget hotel its worthed. But just need more cycles or variant for breakfast.

Clean and modern, the staff were very friendly,10 minute walk from stratford bus and tube station. Breakfast was buffet and had a lot of choice. Near the olympic park and Westfield shopping centre with many popular restaurants

column9: Very good quality for a budget hotel!
column10: Located only a few minutes walk from the nearest tube & bus station, this hotel is clean, tidy and well cared for.The staff were welcoming, the room was clean. The inclusive breakfast was better than usual Expresses! Expresses aren't meant to serve bacon however, at over ¬£250 per room, per night I think someone somewhere has made an exception and it was GREAT! The croissants were delicious, the bread was also better quality than other Expresses I've been to. This is a good hotel and would visit again!

Stayed here for four nights with work. Was really happy with it. It's clean and modern, and very well connected. You're a few minutes walk from the train and bus station. And it's a good location for getting to Westfield too. The staff were always friendly, and breakfast was good. Thanks to Guiseppe for going out of his way to be helpful when I forgot my toothbrush! Would happily stay here again, and would recommend it to people. m

When i normally stay in Stratford for work i stay nearer the Westfield shopping centre so I had a 10 minute walk (easy walk) down the hill from Stratford underground and rail station. On arrival the reception staff were very efficient and sorted my room. As it was extremely windy I decided to eat in the hotel. There was an Indian buffet on offer and for ¬£11.95 there was a reasonable choice and it offered good value for money in the area, After a good nights sleep the breakfast was better than the average Holiday Inn express. A good overall experience and nice and handy for transport into central London but a more reasonably priced stay.

Affordable hotel located about 10 minutes walk from Westfield mall and underground,  DLR and bus stations. Good breakfast but it can be varied. I got bored seeing the same food and arrangements everyday. WiFi was excellent. Room spacious and clean. Wondering why there were no safe and fridge in the room.I had a three course dinner (which was surprisingly affordable ) in hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The front desk staff were darlings.  The helped with receiving my online shopping deliveries, giving directions and booking a cab to Heathrow. Not sure if my IHG membership  was recognised though.

This was a close run thing as my overall score might have been a four.Stayed here for one night. There are good points including a convenient location just 10 minutes easy walk from Stratford tube, bus and railway station. The same time to Westfield Shopping Centre and a few minutes beyond that to the Olympic Park. Close to the hotel are restaurants and shops. The room was spotlessly clean and slightly larger than other 'Expresses' I have experienced. The shower was excellent and the bathroom well lit.Breakfast had a decent offering, was well stocked with some additional choices I've not seen elsewhere in similar properties such as bacon and a choice of muffins. The staff at breakfast were cheerful and polite.What was not so good was the complete lack of warmth and a welcome at check in. It isn't that difficult to make someone feel welcome and at the same time explain the basic facilities of the hotel. As an aside there was no recognition of the highest level of IHG loyalty.The other negative is the noise from outside. I was in a room that faced a side street and even with the window shut the traffic on the main street which appeared to be pretty constant throughout the night kept me awake. I'm not sure what level of glazing the windows have but I suggest its inadequate.So a mixed bag on this occasion.

Good recent stay here. Easy helpful check in. Rooms ok, comfy bed and pillows with choice of soft or hard. Reception/lounge/bar double up for breakfast area which was a little crowded. Breakfast was not much to write home about but filled a hole. Only hot food was bacon sausage beans scrambled egg. Tea coffees orange juice. Was a short walk (10 minutes) through a housing estate to the Olympic stadium. 10 minute walk from Stratford station if you know the way. Pity as the locals had never heard of this hotel and took us 45 minutes!!!

column9: hIEX London Stratford.  Great staff great location
column10: I have now stayed at this hotel over a dozen times in the last 3 years. Yes it is basic and without frills however the staff are absolutely fantastic, whether it is 11pm at night or 6am in the morning. The rooms are always clean and the breakfast buffet well presented. This should be the model for all HIEX hotels!  Well done!!!!

column9: 1 night stay for rugby league at olympic stadium
column10: party of 16 in 8 rooms.superbly placed for the olympic stadium and the westfield centre, a few minutes walk from stratford international station.staff were very friendly ,plenty of choice for breakfast.hotel was clean throughout,room was fine , would definetily stay here again,

I confused it with holiday inn Stratford city Westfield, was quite disappointed with the room size (small) with surprisingly comfortable double bed, basic bathroom but fantastic breakfast buffet! The staff are very helpful but told me once I made the booking they couldn't reschedule me to holiday inn Westfield as they are in no way affiliated...but it was for one night and it was comfortable enough!

column9: Ideal Hotel in a very good location
column10: The Hotel is close to the Westfield Shopping Centre and the Queen Elizabeth Olympic park, I have stayed here a few times, I'm just disappointed by the breakfast offerings as Bacon, Sausage and Scrambled Egg and beans doesn't constitute a cooked breakfast according to their partner hotels. I still will stay here again that's for sure.

I often stay in this chain of hotels and have to say this was better than usual.  The restaurant & bar were large with plenty of seating and a good choice of meals. The staff were friendly and efficient.  The usual free breakfast you get had extra food available from what I'd normally expect.  The room was large and clean and quiet considering it was close to a main road. The location is ok and about 8 mins walk to the nearest Tube station.

column9: Great holiday in a central location
column10: I stayed overnight in the Holiday Inn with a friend whilst in London. The location is great, just a 10 minute walk from Westfield Stratford City and Stratford International Station. You are also only 30 minutes away from the centre of London by tube and the transport links are great. The breakfast was very good with a mix of hot and cold food, fruit and beverages.I would advise any light sleepers or those who do not want any noise (my room was on the main road and I heard sirens at least 3 times in the night) to request a room away from the main room.

This was a very affordable hotel, with more amenities than the price would suggest. There is a free buffet breakfast with plenty of food for everyone. The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable. We had dinner there in the evening but we weren't really impressed. The choice of meals was poor and the service was not great.

column9: Perfect for short stay in a very good location in a Clean & Comfortable hotel...
column10: Right in the middle of Stratford High Street with access to everything you might need in a short stroll away...very clean neat comfy rooms n beds to make it a worthwhile stay...only factor is the swing in prices from time to time based on events in nearby Excel, Olympic parks...Very good reception, bar, breakfast buffet area with decent options with something in it for everyone...The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from Stratford underground station & Westfield Shopping Centre & Olympic Park...If you get a room facing the road side it might be a bit noisy & disturb your sleep but otherwise it is prefect...They can consider upgrading the lift and parking space is extremely limited & pretty expensive as well...

On arrival the brilliant reception staff made us feel very welcome and managed to get us checked in early, allowing us to go straight out to London to start exploring. We did struggle a couple of times getting into our room with the key card, but I think that was more an issue with us and not the doors/keys themselves. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff throughout the hotel were polite and helpful. Unfortunately during our stay we had some noisy residents shouting outside of our window which kept us up, though once calling reception they spoke to them and got our issue resolved promptly. Breakfast was also nice, a small buffet with a selection of hot and cold breakfast foods. Once we checked out they also allowed us to store our luggage in a cupboard and gave us tags so we could come and collect them later on, letting us make the most of our time in London without dragging cases everywhere with us! Overall a great stay for a fab price!

column9: Hits all of our needs, clean, friendly, convient
column10: Was expecting a bit of a bog standard chain, but I am pleasantly suprised, got checked in early, lovely receptionist, the room is clean, spacious, well appointed. A really good find. cannot recommend it highly enough. Its not a trendy hotel, but it is stylish

The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from Stratford underground station. If it's not raining, you can easily arrive by public transportation (I arrived at Waterloo train station, and from there it's a short underground ride to Stratford, and than a walk to the hotel).The staff was very friendly and helpful (when I thought whether to give this hotel 3 or 4 stars, the staff tipped the balance for 4 stars). Very helpful at helping with ordering a cab on check-out, and very informative.The room was nice. It was clean. The only downside is that it didn't have closet space. I only stayed one night, so I didn't unpack anyway. But for people staying more nights it might be a problem.Breakfast was a good. But, than, I'm partial to Alpen muesli and Wheetabix. AI can't really give a bad review to any hotel that have those for breakfast.There is no safe in the room, but the front desk have safes for your use.It's a good hotel. Less expensive than hotels in London (certainly a good value for money). Perfectly located near the Olympic Stadium and Westfield mall. Certainly a hotel to consider when you are in London.

column9: Perfect for a low cost business trip
column10: We stayed for 3 night and flew into Heathrow. It is about 1hr 30 minutes on the tube with one change at Holborn. Stratford has good transport links to all over London. The hotel itself was cheap and clean, it had everything u would need but it is definitely nothing special. Breakfast was included but was average at best. Nice cheap hotel in London

column9: Clean, tidy and does the job
column10: Location wise was ok - a short walk to the Stratford high St (DLR), probably a 15 min walk to the Westgate centre and Stratford's main tube station. Rooms were clean though and had everything you needed. Staff seemed a little over-keen (took about 15 minutes to check in, mainly because the staff wanted to tell us a million things - including when our wing was built etc... - 90% of which we didn't care about). But breakfast was included (and was pretty reasonable quality) so that was a definite plus. The only thing which really harmed our experience was a fire alarm at around 6am (on the weekend), which we couldn't get back to sleep after. The Management did pop a note under the door apologising for the disturbance but would have been nice for them to have done a bit more (maybe a free drink, discount off the next stay etc...). Other than that was pretty good if not amazing.

Stratford is not the smoothest or most exciting of areas but if you are going to be there for an event at the Olympic Stadium this is an ideal place to stay.  The bedrooms are clean, comfortable and quiet.  There is an adequate if not cordon blue place to eat downstairs and the hotel is only five minutes walk from both the DLR, five minutes to London City Airport, and the stadium itself.

We've had several stays in IHG brand hotels recently and unfortunately this was probably our worst.  Nothing to fault regarding staff who were all very friendly and helpful (a lower rating wouldn't be fair to them) - I think it's just that the hotel itself is disappointing.  We only stayed one night and had just come from another IHG hotel which was excellent (and cheaper) but the difference in quality was marked.  It was the first time we had stayed in an Express and the quality of the fixtures and fittings were surprisingly very basic.  Small niggles included poor lighting in the room and a small bed.  There was a pillow choice of 'soft' and 'firm' but a better description would have been 'flat' and 'flatter'.As IHG members we received free wifi and although we obtained a connection, nothing actually happened, literally.The biggest issue, however, was the noise.  I'm quite a heavy sleeper so a little noise doesn't tend to trouble me at all but at around 3:00 the external noise gradually caused me to wake and ultimately led to a very uncomfortable night.  At this time of the night I wasn't going to see if there was another room we could move to but this issue alone would prevent me from staying again.

column9: Fine for one night. Good location.
column10: Stayed here mainly for the location when attending a Rugby World Cup match at the Olympic Stadium. Room was clean, check in was fast, so no complaints there. Bed wasn't the most comfortable but as we were only there for one night it wasn't too much of an issue. Breakfast was OK, but the cooked stuff wasn't the best and was almost cold by the time I'd got back to my table to eat it.We were driving so had hoped to park in the hotel car park, but it was full. There is a Gala Bingo just up the road where you can park overnight for ¬£10 so we went there.Overall as good as I expected for a holiday inn but the price was quite high considering it's a budget hotel, but that's probably down to the fact it was fully booked for the Rugby.

The hotel is a ten minute walk from the main Stratford tube station along well lit roads / pavements. It is close to the Westfield shopping centre so lots of eating opportunities. Rooms are clean and well laid out, although the bed could be more comfortable. Staff are polite and helpful.

The hotel is good, close to the underground station @  Stratford. The westfield mall is close by for shopping and food,The supplies provided by the hotel is mimimal, one soap for hair, hand and body. For face you need to carry your own.They are rigid about the early checkin, though it was pre-ordered at the time of booking. The front desk is not very friendly.My room 605 had a issue with the AC and it was producing a loud noise, which was reported but they couldn't fix it as it middle of night and I couldn't change a room then.Guest should be made to feel at home..

Stayed her as we went to the 02 to see Micheal McIntyre. Hotel clean and welcoming, must admit I thought we were staying at the one at the Westfield centre so be warned as their are 2 in Stratford üòÅ. Room nice had everything we needed and the breakfast was a nice touch although finding a table was tricky. Would stay again.

column9: Clean and comfortable but noisy and not as close to the Underground as it looks.
column10: Standard Holiday Inn Express, clean and comfortable and friendly staff.  Very noisy from noise outside, though, and a bit of a walk to the nearest Tube station.  Breakfast was good, reasonable selection.  Piecrust Thai restaurant opposite is excellent.

Stayed here for a night after completing a Charity walk in London. The rooms were comfortable and clean.but the best feature of this hotel was breakfast the choice on offer was great considering that it was free. The location is excellent for getting into central London with great public transport links. The Hotel is also veey close to the Olympic Park and Westfield shopping centre.Will most definitely use this Hotel again.

stayed there 3 days handy for the tube and trains  ¬£90 a night good prices for london    free breakfast rooms nice no shower gels and shampoo got an intresting viewporsche dealership only 25-30 mins from the 02

column9: Apocalyptically bad - avoid like the plague
column10: I've just checked into this god-forsaken hell hole and to say it's poor would be a tragic understatement!  The rooms are tiny and extremely basic at best, someone obviously got confused between a double room and a twin room, I'm sure you'd easily find a more comfortable piece of granite to sleep on than the beds provided and the entire 6 floor hotel has a grand total of 2 irons, to which you must kart your clothes to specific floors to use?!?!  For the price it's appalling, if the rate was ¬£90 per night there's be no cause for concern but having to cough up nearly ¬£100 over that is a joke.If you're considering this hotel, do yourselves a massive favour; ditch this pit of misery and doom and check into the local homeless shelter or park bench and I'm sure you'd be much more comfortable.

Well sitated just off A12 so handy for North Circular. I had a good deal @¬£86 for a twin room with breakfast - but offset somewhat by the ¬£20 parking charge. Room was clean, modern and spacious with comfortable bed and good sized en-suite. No wardrobe or staorage drwaers so OK for a night or two but not longer. Breakfast room was extrememy crowded and food was quite diverse in range but not great quality - though perhaps I was unlucky in  getting the stuff that had been out a while. Reception was quick and efficient and staff were friendly, polite and professional.

column9: Clean, great transport links and free breakfast!
column10: The rooms are fair sized, comfy double bed and sofa bed in my room. Free Breakfast and WIFI. Great location to transport links and Westfield Shopping centre. Well recommend - the second time I have stayed here.

Stayed here for 2 nights ,location wise it's pretty good 5 minute walk to a major train station and 20 minute walk to Stratford centre Rooms are clean but the bed was the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in Over the course of the weekend one lift was broken which caused huge problems during busy periods Some of staff are friendly some are surly

Stayed for one night on business. Have to say the check in, bar and restaurant staff were excellent. They have an evening special in the restaurant, the main menu is reasonably priced too. The room was good, well appointed and very comfortable. My only complaint was the noise in the night. Groups of lads on nights out on the same floor which was a bit daunting. Maybe allocating business and solo travellers on a separate floor to people on leisure breaks. The breakfast was ok, small plates and a limited offer. But in with the price. On balance not a bad hotel for the money.

Good location.. Found the staff a little lacking, they watched my husband and I carry four huge suitcases back and forth and didn't help at all. Also had to change rooms as was given a dirty smelly room the first time.

We stayed for just one night and were very happy with the location, welcome, and room.Clean and had everything we needed.Short walk to station, Olympic stadium and Westfield shops.We had our dinner in the hotel, which was ok.Breakfast looked good, although we only had cereals.

column9: good location for the tube and dlr
column10: we have just had three days here for a break and a bit of sightseeing, the hotel is handy for Stratford trains and tube,about 10 mins walk, its also similar 10 mins to walk into the town centre, a tesco is 2 mins walk, but be aware it closes at 11pm prompt, so if you need any stuff make sure you get to the shop on time.the hotel is relatively new so all the rooms are clean and fresh,they are also a good size for a budget hotel.Breakfast is freshly cooked, but the only hot things are chipolata sausages, beans,bacon and powdered scrambled egg, you can also have toast, cereals and the usual continental stuff.Good friendly staff,clean hotel and handy for central London

Booked HIEX Stratford as a last minute getaway hotel. We wanted somewhere with good access to Central London attractions and parking as this would work out cheaper than the train.The location was easy to find with Google Maps GPS. The parking was limited but still had a number of spaces - the majority of occupants seemed to have commuted via other means. This suited us as we wanted to leave the car at the hotel of the duration of our stay. It did say online that the parking was charged at ¬£20 which was fine, but it wasn't clear that this was per night! As a result we had to pay ¬£40 in total. An unpleasant surprise but still cheaper than the train (if we wanted to travel at a human time day).The room itself was what you'd expect and well presented. The shower was very good and the bathroom door was cleverly designed to double-up as both the main bathroom door and a toilet door when pulled fully open. Hard to explain but you'll see what I mean.The only quibbles would be the gap under the bedroom door lets through loads of light from the corridor so we blocked that. Also the vents for the windows can be adjusted to a closed position to reduce external noise. This does work but only to a degree. On the welcome letter it mentioned that HIEX would gladly supply you with bits you might have forgotten including earplugs to account for the regional noise (it's next to the Olympic Park). As the hotel is currently next to a building site, we requested earplugs but alas the main desk staff had no idea where they were or if they even had any.Breakfast was included though and there were certainly a good range of options including cooked and continental. Most importantly, the bed was very comfortable and restful with pillow options on hand.Would we stay here again? For the price we paid, a resounding "Yes!".

column9: Great place for business or leisure
column10: Great placeNew hotel, close to DLR, near Stratford Westfield shopping mall.  Great access to Central London by Tube. And docks by DLR.Friendly staff and good breakfast.Internet was a bit sketchy but generally worked.Good restaurants in the area.Stratford is a bit out but will definitely visit again

column9: Conveniently Placed Hotel For Stratford City
column10: Nice hotel, with modern features and a spacious room. The room was modernly decorated with an en suite bathroom, comfortable bed, desk, television etc. Only 5-10 mins walk from Stratford station and Westfield shopping centre also. Reasonably priced for the location too and would recommend.

Pleasant hotel, dinner menu limited.  Breakfast has limited choice but is very busy with people falling over each other.  Rooms are pleasant.  Bit off the beaten track but Westfields is in walking distance just.  Bus stops outside and trains up the road make it more accessible.

Hotel is ideal for exploring London with the underground & DLR so close by. Staff really friendly, rooms clean and spacious, breakfast plentiful and great value for money. I would high recommend, it is also really close to the Olympic swimming pool and Westfield.

Good value for money. I stayed here for the Fleetwood Mac concert. It is a little walk about 5-10 minutes from the Westfield Shopping Mall. Please don't get this hotel confused by the other Holiday Inn which is located at the Westfield Shopping Mall.Very close to the O2 arena about 10 minute taxi ride which will cost you ¬£20 each way. But honestly if you're going to the O2 use the underground as you'll get stuck in typical London traffic and it's much cheaper.The room was a good size and a variety of choice for breakfast

stayed here with my daughter who was doing the 10k Olympic stadium run. Service was very efficient and friendly. We had a twin room which was a good size and well equipped. Breakfast was delicious and staff all very helpful

Come here for a training course which was located in the hotel, everything is clean and tidy, with the staff consistently buzzing around cleaning up after guests, food is great the asparagus soup was amazing, the only problem I had was to decide whether I sleep on the firm pillow or the soft? The hotel is located a couple of minutes walk away from the Olympic Park.

column9: Clean hotel in a good location
column10: I stayed with my young daughter after an event at the Olympic Stadium. Easy access to Stratford even for someone of my poor navigational skills! Felt safe walking back to the hotel even at night.Room was spotlessly clean and had all the usual amenities.Breakfast, which is always the highlight of any hotel stay for me, was  OK. Sausages, bacon, beans and scrambled egg for the hot choices (would have liked fried egg/mushrooms/tomatoes). There was also Croissants, muffins and toast, Cheese slices and tinned grapefruit segments, and cereals. Staff were very helpful and efficient.Overall, pleased with our choice,but would prefer a nicer cooked breakfast.

Hotel that is very handy for the Olympic Park and shopping centre.  Rooms were nice, well appointed, free wifi.  If staying at the weekend you can park for free after 6 on Saturdays right next to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Would stay again.

column9: Good quality hotel, comfortable and nicely furnished
column10: A great hotel and not far from central London, around 8 miles out. I stayed there in the week on a business overnight trip. Reception was pleasant and efficient and the hotel is fairly new, so everything is nice and fresh. Bedrooms are very comfortable, with everything you need, bathrooms are good and have lovely showers. No bath, but that suited me as it was very hot outside. Restaurant was good and fairly well priced for London. Breakfast had everything that you would want to eat, cereals, hot and cold food and plenty of it. The only slight criticism I have with this hotel is that the car park is ¬£20 to park overnight and its a tiny car park with about 10 spaces. Other than that, it was great.

column9: A nice hotel close to Westfield shopping centre
column10: The room was spacious and clean.  The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and there was a good choice of breakfast. I would definitely stay again and it's excellently positioned for a trip to Westfield shopping centre and connecting DLR or underground only 5 minutes walk.

Very comfortable three night stay here this week. It was warm in the room but the air conditioning was good enough to cool it down to a more comfortable temperature. Rooms are excellently proportioned - a large double and a double sofa bed as well as a good sized bathroom. Plenty of towels and refreshed as often as you need them. Had some concerns regarding breakfast after reading other reviews - can say this turned out to be unfounded - the breakfast is more than adequate - and in fact better than a lot of other hotel breakfasts. There is plenty of choice to set you up for the day. Hotel also held luggage for me on the final day which is always appreciated. Very handy location - ten minutes walk to Stratford Station and another 5 minutes to Westfield and the Olympic Park. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

column9: What it says on the label
column10: what you expect from a chain, good bed, facilities, breakfast and a new shinny lounge area for business (or pleasure) meetings. Fold down chair in the disabled room was broken and didn't stay in the right position, luckily it was a good day so I was able to stand for a shower. Was one of the hottesst nights of the year and being on the top floor was a bonus for getting fresh air in. Can't do much about London noise. There was some marks on the ceiling by the door that might have been a leak but nothing too distracting. Helpful staff, good location, what I needed for one night stay in London.

Stayed at the holiday inn Stratford last time which was fab and would recommend to anyone but to our disappointment we got there and were told we'd booked the holiday inn express in Stratford !!!! You need to make this clearer having 2 hotels in the same area ! So we had to drag our luggage 10 mins away to basically a horrible drab part of town and small pokey room . To say I was miffed was an understatement üò° My poor boyfriend had booked it and thought it was the same one we stayed last time . There's no mirror over the desk/ dressing table to do your makeup which was bizzarre and the breakfast was carnage and the worst I've ever had so we ended up just taking a croissant upto our room the second day . View from room was awful and only one plug socket on one side of the bed !Won't be staying there again .

column9: Excellent quality hotel in a great location for London
column10: I'm a business traveller who works in central London. I've been struggling to find a reasonably priced, clean and high standard hotel within easy travel distance to the city centre until now. The room was furnished to a high standard, it was very clean, very quiet and the staff were very helpful. I didn't have any food on this occasion although breakfast was included in the rate. At ¬£82,50 a night, I will be back next time I'm in London for sure.

Probably one of the best express I've stayed in around the world. Great service and very comfortable room. The food was average but fast. Breakfast was poor however. Car parking is around ¬£20 per night so also very expensive! I would say it's still good value overall compared to the main holiday inn nearby.

Pretty nice hotel, good value for money. Located in approx 10 min walking from Underground station and approx 5 min from DLR station, bus station is 3 minutes walking from the hotel - it allows easy access to any destination in Central London.Breakfast is good and included for free, staff is nice; there is large shopping center and some traditional pubs in approx 10 minutes walking - all you need for nice stay in London.

Stayed here for a 2 night weekend family stay. Arrived around 1pm and the reception staff were very polite and helpful during check in. Room was on the 2nd floor and seemed a bit smaller than ones we have stayed in before in HI Expresses. Bed was very comfortable and the shower was nicely powerful. Breakfast was the usual fare but was very busy and I think the layout made it a bit chaotic. Had a late drink in the bar each night and was ok. Free wifi was included. 2 minute walk to the DLR and about 10 minutes to Westfield. Not a lot in the immediate area but good place for staying if exploring East London. Staff were excellent throughout the stay (including the under pressure breakfast staff) and made us feel very welcome. Might want to review the layout at breakfast to make it run a bit smoother but other than that great.

So-so hotel. Room is decent for London; nice shower. Service leaves a bit to be desired. Impossible to get through to front desk/reception via phone. Seems to be an issue with HIEX in general. Quite frustrating to always have to go downstairs every time I need to book a cab, etc.

Two family rooms booked for the 5 of us , good level of accomodation two adjacent rooms . Only short walk to the fantastic Olympic park , unfortunately a massive amount of construction work in the close vicinity . Lovely breakfast that was included in the price and great if you were there before 8am after that we struggled to get a table for the five of us together , most only sat 2 or 4 ! Parking on site was secure but a tad expensive ! The last point was to commend the front of house staff , so informative and nothing was too much trouble .

We always enjoy staying at Holidays Inn Express and it didn't disappoint this time either. Room was clean, spacious and had a kettle plus tea and coffee which is always nice. The breakfast was nice, could do with a bit more choices but then it was free so can't complain. Great location, 5 minutes walk from Westfield and located on a busy high street.

We stayed here as we were attending a concert at the copper box in Stratford. Stratford as you would expect is much cheaper than central London and I believe we had value for money. Holiday inn express is a no frills hotel but it was comfortable, and clean. Tea and coffee in the room which we appreciated as you can't take that for granted these days. Staff are pleasant and accommodating.Overall we were happy customers Thank you

Nice enough Holiday Inn Express, stayed there for 3 nights on business.  Handy for Westfield shopping centre and I enjoyed a run around the Olympic Park.  Hotel is a 5 minute walk from Stratford station.The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean, we paid over ¬£150 per night, it's not worth more than ¬£85, prices were inflated due to the IFSEC conference.

Stayed here for one night while visiting London. Bit further out of London centre that we are used to, but easy to get to on the tube and DLR. Staff very friendly and polite, very attentive during the breakfast which had a good choice and was self serve. This hotel is located near to the Olympic park which is a great place to visit and then easy to get to Westfields shopping centre which is within walking distance. Would recommend this hotel and will use again.

Stayed at this hotel June 6th when we went to see Take That at the O2.  Good location only a short walk to the bus/train station and Westfield shopping. Comfy beds and lovely breakfast. Would recommend as good location for commuting into London.

A good stay for business. The hotel is well located, near to Stratford station. There was parking though I didn't use it. Room was good, up to the same high standard of HIX. Breakfast was ok - though I don't tend to have any of the hot options at HIX, the other options were good. Only downside was the price of the room, which despite being charged to my company was still on the high side - but then this is London, it is to be expected.

column9: Hotel is ok, food is terrible
column10: We stayed here as it is an ideal location for working in London,   Stratford is a nightmare for parking, and this hotel only has a limited number of car parking spaces, so make sure you book for parking, or you will have trouble parking,  the rooms were ok, clean and what you would expect from holiday inn  , I ordered the fish and chips.  And is probably the worst fish I have ever eaten,   I'm sure it was frozen and then dropped in a deep fat fryer,   Took one bite, and ended up walking out to nearest chineese restaraunt ,  service was good, and to be fair I would stay again, but would recommend not to eat here,

column9: Good value hotel, handy for O2
column10: This is a good value, basic hotel which I found to be spotlessly clean. I had booked a room for my friend and I so we didn't have to rush home after a concert at the O2, I am very glad that I did! It is easy to find from Stratford station, just straight down the High Street which is a bustling road and not at all threatening at 1 o'clock in the morning! The staff were very helpful and stored our baggage the next day whilst we went and explored Portobello Road Market. Breakfast is included in the room rate and was very enjoyable. A good selection of hot food, bread, croissants, cereals and fruit with good quality strong coffee (much needed) and juice.I would definitely stay here again for any London trip as Stratford Station is easy to get to from any point of interest in London.

Stayed here for 4 days as my son was attending Arianna grande concert great location the 02 just 2 stops away train station a 4 minute walk london city right at hand hotel was very clean and comfortable great beds breakfast was great with great selection! Very friendly location is perfect shopping centre westfield right beside it train station 3 minute walk bus stop.out side the hotel, very very professional and pleasant staff I will be staying again! Would recommend to anyone!

column9: Decent Hotel, handy for getting into London or Docklands
column10: Yet again, another work stay doing nights and the usual comfortable room I've come to expect from this hotel.Trying to sleep through the day is a bit of a problem and, whilst the hotel its self is fairly quiet, outside noises can intrude, especially from the Primary School at the rear.Semi-decent breakfast provided, the only meal I tend to take in the hotel.Niggles?Sorry, HiEx, but showers are not my thing! At my advanced years, being able to wallow in a bath is coming to be a necessity, not a luxury!!

Fast and friendly checkin. Good size and clean room. Included breakfast is always a plus. We were overnighting before traveling on the next day which was fine as well connected for tube. DLR and the javelin service to St Pancras from Stratford international. I can see it could be a good base for leisure travellers. No negatives

I would love to comment on my stay at Holiday Inn Express. I had a good stay and what made it even greater was the staff at the hotel. Excellent customer service team: Bartor, Mehwfsh, Ana, Nayid, Anntoonette, Yana and Dayna. Excellent team and very professional as well.

I guess the right summary of my experience is: it should not have been less since it would have been terrible. The room is already a bit older which is visible. The breakfast is good but dinner in the restaurant was not impressive. Staff was great and I had a good sleep.

column9: Great for a short break!! Hopefully cheaper next time!!!
column10: Myself and my wife stayed at the hotel over marathon weekend (25-26 April 2015) as it was nicely located for the DLR to Greenwich.  We paid for the privilege and the room price on this occasion (¬£150 for the night) cannot really be justified but you have to grin and bear it in London on marathon weekend.  The hotel is reasonably basic but was very clean and the room was comfortable and quite spacious for London with a decent TV, a nice sofa and a good bathroom and shower. The staff on reception were very friendly and I was impressed to be offered a free newspaper. The hotel did well to cater for marathon runners that weekend, providing a marathon buffet for ¬£12pp which was perfect for us and opening breakfast early with plenty of cereal, toast and bananas, which I thought was a nice touch.  I wouldn't usually have chosen to eat at the hotel but if you want to, it has a nice area to sit with a widescreen TV and a decent enough bar. The hotel is ideally located for the Westfield shopping centre, being an easy 10 minute stroll and access to Central London is simple by hopping on the DLR which is nearby. If we were visiting Stratford for Westfield or the Olympic park we would definitely stay again - although I would hope that the price would be a lot cheaper that the ¬£150 we had to pay for this night!!!!!

This is your average hotel in a pretty boring neighborhood. It satisfies all the standard requirements but there are some things that really needs to be improved: The breakfast - not lots of options other than the standard scrambled eggs, almost no veggies at all! Rooms - the toilet had a weird smell and the rooms are quite small. Our room was facing a school that was very noisy. No gym - Would definitely make the visit more please tell with a gym. All and all, friendly staff and clean rooms, but I'm not really impressed by the hotel. There's much to be improved.

Don't expect any fancy frills, but this is a solidly good, clean hotel, well-managed and well-maintained.  I've now visited twice, and don't intend to look elsewhere for my regular short visits, where price is an important factor for me, but not at the cost of staying somewhere grubby or properly uncomfortable.So - the experience.My requests for a quiet room have been honoured both times; reception staff are well-trained and unfailingly courteous.  The rooms are spotless - as I say; no frills - the pile of the carpets is so short, it feels more like a flock-sprayed floor, but it's clean and warm underfoot - what more do you want?  There was a strangely uncomfortable sofa in my room - my guess is that it is more directed at extending the number of beds than offering lounge-in-front-of-the-telly comfort to single travellers.  There is a basic, and rather frugal, supply of coffee/tea options, but I'm sure if I asked for extra, I would be given it.  The bed is firm, but there are no hollows in the springs, and the sheets are good quality and nicely smooth.  The pillows are unimpressive - they come labelled 'firm' and 'soft', but they feel universally unforgiving to me!  The whole gave me a decent night's sleep - I was a little warm, but not so much that I wanted to turn on the air-con, or open the window to the local traffic noise.The TV was basic, but better than you will find in many comparable hotels.The shower room is fine - large, walk-in shower that supplied plenty hot water in the morning.  Lots of towels, and the bath sheet was a good size - just a bit too abrasive!  I suspect it may not have been rinsed fully before drying, as tumble-drying is normally enough to get a towel fluffy, without any need for fabric conditioner.  The others were softer, so it may have been just one from a poor batch.Breakfast is free, and it's undoubtedly plentiful, if uninspiring, fare - hard scrambled eggs, beans and soggy but cooked through bacon, and a reasonable selection of 'continental' choices - but the small breakfast room can be a bit of a scrum when busy, and they don't provide trays!  I had to make three trips back and forth (the third to get the butter I'd forgotten) from my table, so by the time I settled down to eat, my 'hot' breakfast was pretty tepid.  They say they don't mind if you take your breakfast to your room, but I can't see how that might be practical.  But I'm quibbling, really - I left having slept well, breakfasted well, and the price I found on line was pretty reasonable, for a room within easy reach of central London.One last thought - the hotel is within easy reach of the large shopping mall in Stratford, where there is a variety of restaurant and fast-food options - I can't see why anyone would choose to eat in the hotel, as the prices look a bit eye-watering.Oh - and what really impressed was that they had found, and held on to, my phone charger from my visit the previous month.  Well done!

Reasonable cost and we were allocated a room on the top floor at the back so it was very quiet. You could open the windows which was lovely. Twin room fine for size , downside no safe in the room although there were some by reception. Helpful reception staff. Top tip , if you are tired after walking round sightseeing or have lots of shopping your Oyster card covers the regular bus service to and from the tube station at no extra cost  !

Stayed in a family room with my 3 children, my brother and his family were given a disabled room which had a travel cot, sofa bed and double bed, and still left plenty of room. Hotel clean and modern, check in quick. Parking available ...¬£20 for 24 hours ... But is on a first come first served basis. Westfield 7-10 mins walk, as is Olympic park. Very quiet and probably the best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel. Breakfast was hectic but we did go down at 9am on a Sunday morning, their busiest time. Saying that there was a good choice of food and the croissants were delicious. All in all would thoroughly recommend.

This is your standard Holiday Inn Express with the new look rooms. Worthy of note are: just a 10-minute walk from the Stratford tube station (use the footbridge over the line having turned right out of the "town exit"; turn left at base of ramp on the order side and keep straight on), a friendly reception team, 5 (yes, 5) usable power sockets in the room, an evening meal service; and its location in a quiet largely residential area.

Stayed here for one night for a show in london and to go shopping at Westfield lovely clean hotel good service good breakfast lovely warm rooms ideal location for the shopping centre and the city centre will def use again

My boyfriend and I stayed here last summer for a weekend away in London. Lovely hotel with brilliant service. Our room was clean and comfortable with everything we needed. Breakfast was nice and filled us up for the busy day we had ahead. The hotel was a 5/10 minute walk from stratford station where you could catch a tube ride into Central London which took around half an hour. We also loved being so close to the Westfield centre as it offered lots of places to eat and shop.

We booked the hotel because it was close to Strtford Station and Westfield, we were really happy with our room and the hotel facilities, the staff were really frindly, the hotel was immaculately clean and the breakfast was great, continental and cooked which pleased us very much. Would definitely stay here again. thanks to all the staff who made our stay so pleasant

Good balance between location, price and quality. We've always enjoyed our stays at holiday inns. Very clean, modern bedrooms and showers. Friendly staff as usual and inclusive continental breakfast :) Walking distance to Westfield stratford city shopping centre for dinner and the tube. A bus stop 2 mins from the hotel.

Very good location that is 10 minutes from westfield and the tube.I f you are taking a car would suggest you park at Westfield for ¬£6.00 for 24 hours as the hotel is ¬£20.00.Good clean warm room, very comfortable beds.We paid ¬£70.00 which included breakfast .Breakfast was excellent with very good choice including bacon ,sausages and egg.Staff were lovely and helpful.

Arrived early and we were greeted by very friendly and efficient staff and as our room was ready we were able to check in and enjoy the rest of the day in the Olympic park which is literally on the doorstep of this hotel. In fact all the staff we encountered were the same from our room maid to the breakfast staff. Our room was cleaned to a high standard with a comfy bed a nice large on ensuite and good temperature control. One big plus for any woman was a hair dryer right next to the mirror and plug sockets in the right places which is so not the case in most hotels! The breakfast was very good hot and cold which was replenished without any delays. This hotel was excellent value and would stay again if we wanted to stay in this part of London.

Had travelled to london for one week sand stayed at this place for one week.The hotel is pretty good and staff are very friendly and ambience is good.Rooms are clean and well maintained.Complimentary breakfast has good spreadWalking distance from Stratford High street station

This is just what you expect from a Holiday Inn, staff are friendly, facilities good. Location is very handy, just a short half hour tube ride into central London and you have Westfield Stratford local for your shopping, AND food desires.

column9: Great quality for a great price!
column10: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night with a friend as we were going to a concert in London. Room was very clean, tidy and spotless. Nice clean bedsheets and towels, and temperature in the room was perfect. The en suite bathroom was nice and big and also spotless. I also liked the tea and coffee making facilities in the room. I did try the hairdryer in the morning but it didn't seem to want to work?The free breakfast in the morning was great! Good quality food and a great variety too!The room was ¬£60 for a 1 night for 2 of us, and I think that is great value for what we got. I will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know!

Stayed for two nights really nice hotel, friendly staff, room was very good standard just needs more plug sockets! Breakfast was included which was good, have a wide variety of options hot or cold couldnt fault it. Really good value for money overall would defiantly recommend.

This is a good value for money choice when it comes to London. Good location as far as getting to the city center (5min walking to tube station) and great if you fly in/out to Stansted or City Airport. Close to one of the biggest shopping malls in London.The room was very comfortable and clean with tea/coffee facilities (no fridge). The bathroom was specious and nicely done.Free wifi in the hotel and complimentary breakfast. The staff was very efficient and eager to accommodate our requests (we had our checkout very early in the morning and staff was ok to provide us with a 'quick breakfast' at 4:30am).Recommended.

Not a bad place by any means, busy location not too far from Westfield shopping centre and bus/train stations. Room was decent, everything you expect from a holiday inn. Food was above average, only real negative was my room was above a smoking area. Word of advice, book car parking in advance.

column9: Lovely hotel close to Stratford station
column10: Friendly welcome to the hotel. We stayed in a twin room which was clean and reasonably sized for two people. The hotel provided wifi through out and breakfast was included. Great stay for a trip to o2 with the Stratford station 7 minutes walking distance. Also great if you'd like to visit the Stratford Westfield shopping centre.

Picked this hotel as it looked good value for money (booked through Booking.Com); easy access to public transport and because I quite like Stratford.  Arrived about 10pm and they confirmed they had received the advanced notification of late arrival.  Nice easy check in and all the details about food/drinks etc. were explained to us.  Room was really spacious and we had requested a double bed and a room on a higher floor - both of which we had. One of the things I am known for is the 'how clean is the bathroom' as I have been know to check straight back out of somewhere if it is not clean enough.  Pleased to say everything was spotless and towels and bedding were fresh.  Breakfast was amazing and really were spoilt for choice - in the lift they even have a chart to show when breakfast is quiet/busy.  We ate at various times and it was always fine.  Over all a great weekend and they even charged my phone for me as I had left mine at home.  Thank you

column9: It's good for what you get
column10: I much prefer the posh Holiday Inn above the Westfield Centre however this place is always clean and tidy.  It's relatively new and the Breakfast is reasonable.  If you want a reasonable place to stay at reasonable price this place is fine.  It's always clean and staff seem ok.

I stayed in this hotel for one night as my usual accommodation was full due to the Brit Awards in the O2.It was easy to find. ,about 10 minutes from the train station, and the reception staff were pleasant,and quick with registration etc. I had asked for a quiet room and was given one in the back overlooking the car park..
