It was quiet. The room was clean,functional and had a soft but comfortable bed.I had a drink in the bar/restaurant that night after returning from dinner elsewhere with friends. It was fairly busy around 9 pm with lots of guests banging away on laptops etcetera and obviously using the free wi fiBreakfast the next morning was the usual buffet that you get with this price of tourist hotel .It was mostly from tins ,coffee from multi beverage machines etcetera but as part of the deal I could not complain.

Polite and helpful staff, bedroom clean and well appointed, plentiful choice for breakfast and only a 10 minutes walk to Westfield, Stratford Station and Stratford International Station. This hotel was perfect for a couple nights stay in London - no frills - just comfort and value for money.

We stayed here as a family during the February half term. First time staying at a Holiday Inn Express. Check in was quick and efficient. We were given a room on the 3rd floor. There was plenty of space to store clothes and the room was a good size and very clean. Only down side was that the bathroom smelt of smoke. Wasn't to bad at first but next morning the smell was quite strong. Was advised the staff were investigating this. We were moved to another room on the 6th floor. Don't think this was a family room. Room was smaller and when the sofa bed was pulled out the bottom of the sofa bed touched the back of the chair that was tucked under the desk. We had to climb over the sofa bed to get to the window. Not ideal but would rather put up with that than a room smelling of smoke. This room was also very clean. At the back of the hotel so very quiet. Breakfast was a busy time when we went down at 8.20am. Hot buffet was bacon,sausage,beans and scrambled egg. Considereing what we paid to stay here and that the breakfast was included I thought it was good. As previous review said never asked for room number and people were just helping themself to the toast, yoghurts, fruit etc and taking them out with them. This hotel is central for buses and the underground. Would stay here again.

column9: Friendly staff but breakfast buffet let it down
column10: Just stayed one night at this hotel. I normally try and book at a Premier Inn but the Holiday Inn Express offered a good deal and included breakfast. Staff were friendly upon check-in and the room was satisfactory. The only aspect that was poor was the breakfast buffet. Firstly, it was VERY busy and a free for all trying to fight your way to the food. At no point was I asked to prove I was actually staying in the hotel. Therefore, in theory, people could just come in for a free breakfast! Secondly, I noticed a very long black hair in the scrambled egg that had just been brought out. Not nice! Thirdly, I couldn't actually find anywhere to sit so had to take a seat at the bar. Credit to the member of staff who asked if I was okay sitting there and he did show me to a table as soon as one became available.So overall, a good hotel in a central location with helpful staff unfortunately let down by the breakfast.

My wife booked this for my birthday present along with the LION KING. Excellent value, comfortable room, great shower, good breakfast.. All good so far and then the staff.... they really could not do enough. Nothing was too much trouble, when we asked for more milk for drinks in the room they were quick to provide this and told us to help ourselves to more Coffee, Tea etc from the Breakfast Area. Always a smile and cheerful greeting.. Excellent all round service..

Ideal hotel for exploring London, excellent helpful staff, good breakfast included in the rate too. We booked here on Monday of half term and were only able to book 2 singles but as it was where we wanted to stay we took it. Upon turning up we were immediately moved to a family room (though officially there weren't any). Superb staff, couldn't be more helpful. We stayed in a Travellodge in the City the weekend before for a similar price and it wasn't a patch on this place. Hotel is new, modern, clean. Small bar at the reception which seemed to get well used as did the in house food. It's a 5 min walk from Stratford and the massive shopping centre here so would advise go here for food if not eating out in London. Overall? Couldn't have been better for me and my family.

Stay in holiday inn and express quite often and usually I am quite impressed. Firstly yes this hotel is near to the Olympic park but it's not in the nicest of areas, and being on the main road can be very noisy. The food is standard burger and chips which is OK but the breakfast for me was poor. The sausages where really cheap and tasted of nothing and the scrambled eggs where tasteless mush. I always look forward to a good cooked breakfast so was really disappointed. I came down at 6.50 so I could beat the rush and had to wait ten minutes while they restocked the bacon, sausage and eggs. Silly little things that would stop me using this hotel again. Staff where really good and accommodating and the room was comfortable so not a bad experience.

Holiday Inn do well on their 'welcomes'. Always polite and ever apologetic if there is a queue. No different here. You get what you get with Holiday Inn Express, but it's clean and welcoming, with a good breakfast for the modest price. This one has the added advantage of being on the edge of the Olympic Park, if you have the time to look around.Liked the notice that said if I was experiencing too much noise .... ear plugs are provided free of charge!

we spent here one night on a weekend in January. Room was really big, tidy and comfortable..we left the baggages before check in and after check out for free..breakfast was also good and very rich! Highly recommended for the position..10 minutes by walk to Stratford station

My husband and I took my 7 year son to London for the night. We checked in at around 4 pm when we got to our room the second bed wasn't made up at all and no bedding was in the room. When we called down they said housing staff had gone home and someone would be up later once we had gone out to make it up. The room it self was clean and tidy no issues there.The bed was made up when we arrived back from our evening out.Hotel was quite at night and when we ordered a take away staff where happy to get us plates and cutlery to take back to our room. The free breakfast was fine. Nothing exciting but did the job. Only problem I found was it was busy at breakfast times and staff where not very quick to replace hot breakfast when it was running low and clear tables when people where leaving. The 5 min walk to stratford high street train station. And then one stop along to stratford main station for the shopping.

We have just returned from a long weekend stay.The staff are polite and helpful.The rooms are clean and well appointed "although the beds are a little small" but comfy.We found the rooms to be quite, we had room 616 on the top floor.Tube station approx 5min walk and the location is perfect with lots of shops and eateries.The breakfast was very good, good quality with good selection.Parking is available on a 1st come basis at ¬£20 per day "just 15 spaces"We will stay here again.

Excellent customer service from front desk staff. Majid was brilliant. Rooms are very cosy and comfortable. Extremely clean and rooms come with breakfast included. ¬£80 for a night is a bit expensive but what can you do its london. Would reccommend to anyone that wants a comfortable stay around stratford.

had to stay here to do with work, not very pleasant really, i suppose would be ok for an over night stay if you didnt want to venture out, view from room a very dodgy boarded up block of flats, gangland style, had to get taxis everywhere as one member of staff and several more taxi drivers told me not to walk around, even during the day! its a shame as its near the new shopping centre and the olympic village which has a nice park etc, maybe will be better in summer when its not dark at 4pm.rooms are ok, but no bath, food very basic and repetetive if your there longer than a couple of days, but adequate, drinks quite reasonable, breakfast included but not much left if you venture later on,all in all wouldnt choose to stay here if a choice was involved as theres so much reasonable and much nicer accomodation more centrally located in london, unfortunately have to venture back with work, so watch this space!

I never write reviews but was so impressed with this hotel I thought I would make the effort! We had a queen room which was a perfect size and in excellent clean condition with nice decor. Staff were lovely, food delicious. Only about a 10 min tube ride to Liverpool street and the tube station is right next to hotel. Can't praise it enough, will definitely come back. We got a dab deal too, only ¬£94 for room and breakfast.

I stayed here over the weekend for a shopping trip. It is within 10 min walk to Westfield Shopping Centre & Stratford Station. Staff were so helpful as my friend forgot to actually make us a booking. They charged us reasonable rates that you would expect to pay. Rooms were clean and spacious, the hairdryer did not work and the reception staff got me another one with no fuss at all. Very accommodating hotel with pleasant and professional staff - esp Bartosz who joked with us and went out of his way to help us. I would stay here again - no problem at all!! Breakfast was basic but nice - esp for being free.

We stayed here for my friends 30th birthday as wanted to be close to Westfield shopping centre in Stratford, this did not disapoint in any way! its so close to Westfield and the the tube station and bus station is only a few minutes walk! Hotel was very clean and room was well equipped with everything we needed, I love Holiday Inn's as they do exactly what it says on the tin, for all the length of time u actually spend in a hotel room! Holiday inn prices are so hard to beat Beds were super comfortable, clean room, fresh towels a plenty, breakfast lovely and plenty of selection! and last but not least every one of the staff went out of their way for any request or query especially Bartosz, lovely gentleman couldn't do enough for us! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in london just outside the city but with great transport into right at your doorstep! :)  many thanks :)

column9: Great for o2, fantastic value for money
column10: Was very pleased with the hotel itself which was very nice and the location which was very close to Westfield and stratford shopping centres, the underground and DLR. The rooms were very nice and similar style to premier inn. We had a decent view of a school so not noisy due to staying at weekend. Noticed the hotel provided ear plugs if the room was too noisy though. Along with free essentials like toothpaste if you forgot.The breakfast was very good too, and free! Fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, beans, toast, croissants and muffins. As well as fruit juices three different kinds, a coffee machine with all different coffees and tea. We stayed there to go to concert at O2 arena which on the jubilee line at stratford underground (10 mins walk) took around 8 mins once you arrived was right outside the back of the station (3 stops away). I recommend an Oyster card and using the underground it's the easiest way to get about to most attractions using the jubilee line. Our room 413 was very good.

column9: Poor Service!! Money Missing From My Room!!
column10: I statyed at holiday inn express on saturday 17th Jan, after getting back to my room, I left my cash, train ticket and receipts on the end of the second bed.The next morning when I woke up, I noticed there was only ¬£20 left from the ¬£270 on the bed 6 hours prior.As I was getting clothes on to rush downstairs, you could faintly here a police siren, at which point the 2 Portuguese cleaners that had been camped outside my room for the last 10/15 mins said to each other "policia, policia". this seems a bit odd to me. Anyway as expected I rushed downstairs to report this and spoke to the duty manager. she took down my details, said there was nothing that they could do, until they check the computers, to tell them who had been in and out of the room.It is not monday, and I have still not heard one word from this hotel.On top of this, the food I ate on the saturday was under cooked, the chicken in the chicken burger was pink, and the 'toasted' bun was somehow soggy.I will not be booking into this hotel or any other holiday inn!!

we have just got back from our weekend in London, the Holiday Inn Express was clean, tidy all the staff that were working, were friendly, helpful, cheerful, and very welcoming, the breakfast was ok, but overall it made our stay very relaxing,,we would highly recommend and would happily stay there again.

We were a bit dissapointed with this hotel. The staff were not rude but not friendly or welcoming. For the price you can definitely find better and more hospitable service elsewhere in Dublin. We stayed in many hotels and had vastly superior service and room quality for the same price. We arrived to the hotel at about 1 p.m. and as we were invited for a dinner somewhere else we just wanted to have a lunch in the hotel but the restaurant was not open for lunch only for dinner. I just wanted to iron my clothes but there is no iron in the room, I had to go to another floor to find a small room with iron and ironing board. I found it very inconvenient. No safe in the room. In the lobby you can find a locker and use it as your own safe but I do not think it`s a great idea. I was not very impressed with the breakfast either. The room was small but quiet as we requested room not facing the street on the higher floor.Good location within short walking distance of shopping centre and metro station.Overall it was fine, but I probably would not return.

We stayed for one night on New Year‚Äôs Eve with all the London hotel prices being quite exorbitant on the day. Price wise this was the most reasonable for location we required. All the usual facilities were there and of the usual standard and the staff were quite helpful. Stratford High St DLR is within 5 minutes flat walk away and the main Stratford station about 10 min. Parking I believe was being charged as a 'first come first served' ¬£20 a day. It didn't sound too promising and hence we didn't take a chance. We certainly paid a ridiculous amount of money for the day but not a bad option on less busier days perhaps when the price will reflect its actual value which is 3 star.

This was a pleasant surprise. Stranded in Stratford late on a wet weekday, I was ready to accept any overpriced hotel room available. Imagine my pleasure when HIE came to the rescue. A thoroughly comfortable and well appointed double room, a full range of TV and digital radio channels, free WiFi, free breakfast, a superb shower and even a choice of pillows. Good job people...a very nice stay indeed.  If I was forced to make one small suggestion...lose the sausages. Or, at least, source some decent bangers made with proper meat.

How come when you go nearer to London centre Often the price goes up but the quality goes downRubbish Internet.  Food awfull. Frozen pizza etc.Grubby place.  Terribly expensive parking. Staff unable to speak English. Can't say I would go back

Though this hotel is located bit far from Heathrow airport, it is very near to the London City airport and the Stratford Railway station, from where you can get good connectivity to the rest of the city. The rooms are good. Bathrooms, though bit small, well maintained and modern. It had all the facilities (Laundry, coffee maker etc) in the room. Wifi was bit slow and free for 24 hrs only it also needed some registration etc. The staff was helpful. Though we checked out early, they accommodated our request to keep the luggage in a safe room. The complementary break fast was nice with lots of options. Bar counter looked good, though I didn't use it. Overall a nice choice to stay if you are on a trip to London!.

Incredibly unhelpful staff. I am a company secretary for a very loyal client of Holiday Inn. We called the Hotel in Stratford as the Hotel had incorrectly accepted a parcel for the hotel down the road despite having no guest staying there under that name. Then after calling twice and speaking to a male with a very strong French accent who did not understand what i was saying i was also put on hold and disconnected.When i did get through they refused to deliver said parcel down the road to the correct hotel. I believe this to be a shocking experience and most certainly will ensure we do not use this basic hotel in future. Big mistake from your rude and amateur staff.

Stayed for 3 nights with husband and baby. Rooms clean and comfortable. Enough space for the 3 of us- there was a sofa bed in the room also. This hotel was ideal for travellers as the DLR, train station and bus station is all within walking distance. I spent a lot of my time at Westfield shopping center which is within 10minutes walk away. Car parking was expensive ¬£20 per day however, it is a gated parking so was secure. Breakfast was good for the price. Wifii although free, is extremely slow. Overall good value for money.

column9: Clean and friendly excellent location and service
column10: Could not wish for better service Wonderful breakfast free wifi friendly helpful staff and great location for underground/bus station and Westfield shopping centre - clean rooms and good comfortable beds

Comfortable stay easy accessible from the train station a short walk (the big shopping center is at the station )Evening meal was a good portion size not much choice but as it was a work trip and was paid for There are lots of eating places within easy reach of the hotel Good WiFi network access

My 12year old nephew and I had a twin room which was immaculately clean and very comfortable. Our check-in was fast and efficient!  The receptionist was welcoming and helpful!  The location is convenient for rail and underground links (8mins stroll to the station) As novices in London we were able to get around travelling on the Central Line with ease!  Also just 3mins from the DLR (Stratford High Street )we travelled to the Excel for the Lego Exhibition in 10 minutes.  Another added bonus is 'Westfield' Shopping Centre is just on the door step!  Breakfast was included. It was adequate and hot but the serving area is too small, especially when busy.

We were just staying a couple of nights and were out and about, so this was perfect. Very clean and breakfast was good, with several people keeping it tidy and clean. Close to the Olympic park so we had a walk round to see the changes. Close to Stratford station too.

Needed an hotel in Stratford, so I chose this one because all other were full. Good choice. Especially given the very very low price (for London).Medium size room, minimal, but clean, comfort and well maintained.Nice and well kept public areas.Fair breakfast, fair selection and reasonable quality.Very helpful and attentive staff !!!

Booked through booking.com for one night as we were going to a gig at the O2. Handy for the tube, Westfield centre and the DLR. We were given an accessible room which was ok as they are a bit bigger but the walk-in wet room shower just resulted in wet feet after we'd used it.It got really hot in the room but the air conditioning wasn't working properly, only the fan setting. We opened the window but this was very noisy. There were only 2 teabags on the hospitality tray which was a bit disappointing.Breakfast was very poor. Basically, it's served in the foyer of the hotel and it's chaos. The buffet is behind a wall at the back; you have to make your own hot drinks and fetch your own cutlery, as well as collecting the food so in a small space people are falling over each other. The pastries, fruit & cereal looked ok but the hot food was limited to microwaved scrambled eggs, sausage bacon and beans. No mushrooms, no tomatoes...not good news for a vegetarian. Another veggie issue was the yogurts, billed on the 'menu' as 'natural yoghurt', the yoghurt available was Muller Light which is not natural (full of sweeteners and preservatives) and contains pork gelatine, so unsuitable for vegetarians and anyone who doesn't eat pork.

A very warm welcome from friendly polite receptionist,explaining procedure and direction to room, she went out of her way to lend us her umbrella when pouring down with rain. Rooms were suitable for us, beds comfy, bed linen and towels all nice and clean. All facilities in bedroom and bathroom were fine.Breakfast was very good, a wide selection to choose from. Very near to  station and underground. Within walking distance to Westfield shopping centre. The only fault I would say was noise from main road, but were not too bothered by this. Overall a pleasant and enjoyable stay. Will definitely stay again.

Nice hotel in reasonable location close to Westfield and travel links in to central London very close to the Olympic Park . Rooms ok but quite small . Breakfast could be warmer , cold scrambled egg is not the best ! Good value overall .

Stayed here whilst in Stratford on business. Very clean and bright, helpful staff, decent food served in restaurant. There were a few issues with the main course coming out the same time as the starter, however this was rectified. Highly recommended.

column9: Everything you need for one night stay in East London
column10: Clean modern hotel with everything you need in well designed compact rooms. We were only staying for one night after family event nearby. Very convenient for Westfield shopping cater and the Olympic park. Price included a help yourself breakfast which had a very good variety and choice to suit all tastes. Car parking limited but we managed to get our 4 cars in to the car park on a Saturday and we were under no pressure to move out on the Sunday. Staff all very helpful and polite.

column9: One of the better budget hotels
column10: I stayed here after an event at the O2 because I had an early flight the next morning from London City Airport, and it was ideal in every way.  It is a short walk (less than five minutes) from Stratford High Street station on the DLR and not that much further from the main Stratford station, as well as being very close to Westfield, the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and all of its attractions.  From the DLR it is less than 15 minutes to London City where the station is part of the main terminal building so it is a really easy way to get to an early flight.The hotel is very much a chain one and in that sense you get what you pay for, but compared to many it is much better value.  A good buffet breakfast is included in all the deals (certainly not the case in other similar chains) as is free wifi, which again is not always offered.  Room was very comfortable, decent size with double bed and sofa, desk and plenty of power points so good for working, plus bathroom with walk-in shower.  Staff efficient and friendly, and all in all a convenient and pleasant experience.  My room was at the back and on the 6th floor hence pretty quiet too.

Travelled here on business in September 2014.  Hotel staff were very friendly.  Room was dated but spacious.  The shower was an odd configuration being one and the same with the toilet with a wrap around curtain and emergency ropes all over which I trigerred several times in error.  Served a complimentary breakfast.  I would give the hotel 3 stars but the trip advisor website doesn't accept anything thatn a one star....not sure why.  We were going to the EXEL CENTER every morning and the staff would have a taxi waiting for us every morning.  Some noise from the streets but not a big deal.  It was good value.  Hotel is within walking distance to the Stratford Mall with ample choices for shopping.

We stayed at this hotel in September as we were in London for a Ben Howard gig and we were using the HS1 train line. Our twin room was spacious, the beds were comfortable and the shower room was clean and larger than others I've encountered. Staff we friendly and when I realised Id forgotten my tooth brush the lady on reception was happy to give me a complimentary travel set. Breakfast was a bit of a scrum but there was hot and cold food and plenty of room to sit and eat.It was easy to catch the train the Hackney for the gig and on our check out day we only had to walk a few hundred yards to the DLR (which was fab, through docklands etc, great journey) which took us to our next destination, the Tower of London.

Stayed here for two nights - the first time at a Holiday Inn Group Hotel - and the last.  Nowhere in their advertising does it state that the rooms only have showers in the bathrooms - we prefer a full bathroom.  We were given a "better" room at the back of the hotel - Glad I was not in a "worse" one.  Very small with hardly any storage space but the bed was quite comfortable.  Breakfast on the first morning was of a reasonable quality but the food was lukewarm and cold plates did not help this.  We went down for breakfast at 8.45pm and there was no hot food left and we were told that they had run out!!! There was no bread or croissants either.  The staff were very good and pleasant and very apologetic - we left the hotel very disgruntled and hungry.  I complained to their head office and was given 5000 points then 2000 points as they obviously thought that I would stay in one of their hotels again. The points would not even cover a cup of coffee!!  I was told that being as the breakfast was complimentary we had received value for money - I think not!  Their attitude was that they were doing me a favour in allowing us to stay there -  we have stayed in better Travelodges which can be very good value and at least they have a bath in their bathrooms.  Very poor customer care from "above".  Very surprised at their attitude as running out of food is completely unacceptable in any hotel.

Stayed with my husband for 1 night. Good hotel with free wifi. Options at breakfast was very limited and occassionally noise from the streets can be heard. Walking distance to the Stratford mall. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

column9: Great staff, not very great hygiene
column10: Hotel is located near to DLR and Stratford main stations, which is very convenient.All reception and housekeeping staff are nice and friendly. I didnt have breakfast so I cant comment on the bar/restaurant. In my room, there was noticeable dust on the sofa and over the headboard of the bed. Also, there was dirt on the bedside lamp cover.I also happened to see a 20 cm diameter spider web with an actual spider on it above the main entrance corridor of the hotel :)But all textiles are clean and the bathroom was also clean and well-sized.Overall, it is an OK hotel instead of great, only because of the hygiene issues.

column9: Good business hotel close to Excel
column10: Perfect hotel if you are attending a fair in the Excel. It takes you 20 minutes with the DLR. Should not pick this hotel for a leisure weekend in London. Westfield is close by (10min) so if you have time left... go shopping! The hotel is a bit dated but you have all facilities you should need during your business stay.

Good hotel, with free wifi and typical english breakfast. Nothing special is located outside the hotel. 5 minutes walk to a small supermarket. 10 min walk to resturants and shops at  Westfield shoppingcenter and easy access to airport and London by subway and busses.

I have 2 luggages and taxi cost GBP 40 to reach Holiday Inn Express London Stratford from Paddington Train Station.This is the right location if you are looking for a place such Westfield, make sure you spare some free time. It is walking distance to reach Wesfield @ Stratford with its almost 250 shops and fabulous food court.ExCel Exhibition Hall is a DLR away, believe it is 6 or 7 stations away from Stratford High Street DLR station. This Stratford HIgh Street is three minutes walk from HI Express Stratford.Tesco Express is located on the same row, one minutes walk from hotel lobby to the right.Very convenient and thumb up for this excellent IHG Hotel. They know what we need, and what we do not need.

Stayed here for two nights on a business trip and found the hotel overall very good. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows that was soft and hard so good choice of pillows.  The bathroom i couldnt fault as the shower was great and the three paronamic mirror was great for when i was doing my hair in the morning. TV was larger than other hotels i've stayed in but i didn't really use it as had my laptop with me. WI-Fi had quit a strong connection. There was little things in the room that really kind of made it a good stay. The breakfast was OK, had a good variety and my favourite had to be the orange juice! My only CON is that even though all my windows were closed i could still hear the road and being that it's in busy london, all i could hear all night was loud traffic and engines.

We stayed here last week for 2 nights as this was quite a good location for us;quite near the places we wanted to visit.The room was spacious but dimly lit.Bathrooms however were clean with a spacious shower space ,a large mirror and good lighting.We had a sound sleep as it was much quieter as we were on the 5th floor this time.Breakfast was okay but the place gets crowded even at 7am so we decided to bring ours to the room the next day.Negative points- car parking costs 20¬£/night.Not a very warm welcome at hotel reception on arrival.We were all standing for our turn to be attended to and although there was another receptionist there, she did not signal or greet us to help the other receptionist who was busy attending to a guest.I had to go to her instead and asked for some help.She answered my questions but I was quite surprised at the poor hospitality shown by this lady and was a poor reflection of Holiday Inn in my opinion.Tired guest who arrive from distant travels deserve better treatment.A smile would be good place to start with.Otherwise it was a pleasant stay overall.

This hotel is located a short walk from the Stratford High Street DLR station.  There isn't anything of any particular note around the hotel, but if you are looking for a quality hotel in the area I would say you can't go far wrong.  The rooms were adequate (although no biscuits with the hospitality tray! :) ), the bar area was comfortable, the restaurant food was reasonable and adequate and the complimentary breakfast was nice.  The hotel staff were knowlegable and friendly.

We accidently booked this hotel, we wanted the Stratford City one. We called them up and they said it can not be cancelled due to being prepaid. We complete understood this and ask would it be still charged even if we didn't stay there and they said yes.On the same night we arrived, Majid a very friendly receptionist said he could not find our booking! He investigated this and found that it had been cancelled. He spoke to the person who cancelled and that person was the same person I spoke to on the phone initially. I think her name was Agita, her curly redhair was covering her name badge. She assume that I wanted to cancelled the room when I called then later accused me that I did. I reminded her of the conversation and she did a great "sigh" and said, "So you want to stay here or what." Then walked off. Poor Majid was left on his own and ask her to return for help, she returned and said I will book you a new room which I asked to have a simular room which is gladly did and said it very spacious. When I arrived at the room, it was a disable room! Overall the parking is ¬£20 per night, really close to Stratford and breakfast was great.  That one person let the hotel down but a credit to Majid and Ian who tried their best to tell me to Irnore her.

The hotel is very good. Rooms are spacious. Bathrooms are clean. Breakfast is good enough for one. The staffs are friendly. The hotel is located in Stratford area. Nearest metro station is around 0.5 km away. 10 minutes walk. Convenient is using Bus service. Just opposite to the hotel. No. 25 bus goes to the Oxford Circus within 45 minutes. There is also a DLR station near the hotel. The day before our departure one bad incident happened. A boarder of the hotel, perhaps drunk, without any reason knocked our door at 12:30 am in the night and used abusive words. According to him he was feeling disturbed because of us. But I don't know why. The hotel reception phoned us also without verifying what happened. We then argued with the reception. How they call us without verification. If any boarder has a problem he can ask Reception to solve it. Why he would attack a room directly. Then where is the security?  Anyway, we loved the hotel despite the incident above. We highly recommend this hotel.

in walking distance to the station and Westfield.usual HIE set up.new bathroom.big shower.bed was surprisingly comfortableget room in the back, not facing road.overall quite acceptable.breakfast was good

From the outside this looks like a fairly new hotel, but clearly it cannot be. I busily adjusted my stylish aircon/cum heating system only to discover that it responds zilch to my temp settings. Result: a pretty hot room during an unusually warm period in October. They have wifi included in the room rate, it's one of the reasons why I tend to book hotels in their chain. This place has a bizarre system that doesn't recognize your smartphone/pc etc, so you need to re-login all the time. Mightily annoying. The breakfast is included in the room rate, too. It's basic, but it does the trick. Given the rate I paid during my stay, I thought I paid way too much for what this establishment is. I ended up in a room with two small single beds. Terrible. They had soap spenders in the bathroom that basically disintegrated when you looked at them. The most pointless contraption I have ever seen. Location wise, well, I wanted to stay close to Stratford station for reasons to do with my travels. You can't beat this place, except perhaps for the better (and even more expensive at this time of the year) Holiday Inn at the Stratford Westfield shopping centre. Unlike others I experienced zero noise issues, likely to do with the fact that my room was at the back of the property. No complaints here. I suspect, for what you're being charged here, you should be able to get a better deal, given their room rates, elsewhere in London.

The air conditioner is centrally operated. This means that an overheated room in winter cannot be cooled down as all settings are set to "hot". Do not book if you find overheated rooms unbearable. Staff okLocation noisy and prone to police sirens.

column9: Noisy and terrible food if they're bothering
column10: spent a week here. Got little sleep due to noisy occupants and wafer thin walls.Food was worst I have ever experienced anywhere. I ordered a chicken burger one evening and couldn't tell if it was chicken or the meat bought by mistake. This evening they're not doing food !?!?!! But tbh that's probably a blessing.Room is ok.

I stayed here just for 1 night on business.  The hotel is located on the high street, about 10 minutes walk from Westfield Shopping Centre and a stones throw away from Olympic park.  Although located on a busy road, I wasn't disturbed at all by traffic although I kept my room window closed.  The air conditioning in the room worked brilliantly.  The room was spotlessly clean, although a little dated, and the bed was extremely comfortable.  Although no iron in the room, there was an ironing room on the same floor located by the lifts if required. The bathroom, although spotless, was showing signs of age and again was a little shabby - damaged tiles and chips on the basin surround, also there was only a shower and I prefer a bath, but that's my personal preference.  I didn't sample the breakfast here as service doesn't start until 6.30 and I had to be at a meeting before then, but the helpful receptionist did say that if required, the kitchen crew would be happy to provide cold options.  I did eat dinner in the restaurant and this is where my confusion began....... Firstly the "restaurant" consisted of chairs and tables in the main foyer of the hotel.  Food is ordered at the bar and you are then issued with a table number which you place on your table.  The choice was limited and I naively assumed that, as the website describes the restaurant as "award winning", the limited choice would be superbly cooked and well presented. How wrong I was.  I chose "Posh Fish & Chips" described as served with a crab cake, minted mushy peas and tartar sauce.  What arrived looked about as appetising as the  inner sole of my trainers.  I assume the chef had "Gone to Iceland".  I think the only thing on my plate that could be described as fresh would be the slice of lemon garnishing it.  The batter coating on both the fish and fish cake was dark brown and like biting into cardboard.  The fish cake left an unpleasant aftertaste but the fish was surprisingly succulent.  The chips were also good but not sure where the mint was in the minted mushy peas.  None of the waitresses asked if everything was ok with my meal (to be fair, it wasn't just me, no one else was asked either).  On the plus side, WiFi was free and was speedy in all areas of the hotel.  There is a car park adjacent to the hotel for customers only, but a word of warning - it's fairly small and is on a first come first served basis.  On the whole this hotel was good for my business needs, but I wouldn't choose to eat here again.  It's location is great for shopping and as a base for exploring London futher as it has good transport links.

Just stayed one night and had a nice enough stay; despite the hotel being located in the high street, we slept well. The room was quiet, clean and with the typical comfort of a holiday inn express. The lighting is in my opinion not bright enough. Breakfast was ok, very busy, hard to find a clean table but you get what you pay for and for ¬£ 90 it was quite good. Staff was friendly enough but too busy to interact.the free WiFi worked very well and a bonus.

I didn't do a lot of research before booking the hotel so I was unsure what to expect.I ended up having a great stay. We arrived to a room that was conditioned for handicapped people and asked for a change, which was no problem.The rooms and the hotel in general is very clean, they have a very nice breakfast buffet and the staff is very friendly and helpful.The location is a bit far from the center of London and you have to walk like 6 blocks to get to the underground but it's a nice and well lit area, near a shopping mall. Plenty of places to eat nearby.Really nothing to complain about.

My friends and I stayed here in August for 'Secret Cinema Presents: Back to the Future', and it certainly did the job! The breakfast was very nice - not too extensive but enough - the rooms were clean and comfortable, if not slightly soulless. Don't be swayed by that - it felt safe, and the staff were superb. They were aware of the event we were attending, told us how other people had travelled there, and even made lovely comments about our 50's outfits when we came down later! A good price for a nice hotel. Recommended.

Great location and brilliant staff. However for an express location minimum ¬£90 a night not worth it. Down the road you can get bed and breakfast for cheaper with same value. So decrease the prices and you'll get better reviews.

column9: Average Holiday Inn Express, Good Staff
column10: Stayed for four nights in July while visiting a physician in Canary Wharf.  The hotel is located about and 8 minute walk from the nearest train station.  It is not a dangerous area, but it's quiet and slightly isolated so if you plan on arriving late at night it might be worth getting a cab.The hotel itself is very clean and very nice.  The rooms are small (normal by standard English hotels, but small by American standards), a room with two beds means two twin (single) beds.  It was ideal from my Mother and I, but it's very close quarters if you aren't close to the person you are sharing with.  There is very little room for hanging clothing etc.The bathroom is tiny but well laid out and very functional.  There is an electric kettle and tea and coffee supplies in the rooms.  The whole room was spotless and the staff cleaned every day and were very friendly.The AC and heating works by inserting your room card in the slot when you enter.  While this is obviously environmentally friendly it does mean the room was VERY hot when you entered it in the Summer and you really had to wait for it to cool down.  I would assume the opposite is true in the Winter.  The room we were in was at the end of the corridor on the third floor and there was absolutely no noise to be heard at night.  We had an excellent night's sleep.Breakfast was excellent, well laid out and plentiful.  We ate the restaurant one night and considered the food expensive and average.  It was ok, but nothing to rave about.The hotel is about a 15 walk in Stratford itself and the nearby Mall (great shopping).  There are some good restaurants around the mall.  Another thing to note is there is another Holiday Inn Express located directly beside the Mall and nearer to the main Stratford train line (as opposed to the DCR line that this one is near).  This is a main hub train station so if access to public transport is main need for you then you should consider that hotel instead.The DCR train station that this is located near works well for London City Airport but Heathrow is a full 90 minutes with three train changes away (not fun with with suitcase - not all tube stations have elevators).  London City Airport is about a 30 minute drive in heavy traffic.

Checked in late due to going straight to Invictus Games Opening Ceremony, not eaten so ate in their restaurant when got back, was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised, thoroughly enjoyed chefs special.  The car park was a secured gated one, it was ¬£20 for 24 hours so we used it all the next day which made it good value.  The room was OK, bed was comfy and clean, slept very well, would use again to go shopping in Westfield Shopping Centre as it's not too far away.

Very nice time here.Evening meal was very nice even though the prices were a bit high for the meal itself. Breakfast had a slightly larger range, plus the toasters actually toasted the bread rather than scaring it with a little heat.The room was very nice and more welcoming than others I have stayed at. Along with the staff being very friendly.

good value for a family staying over in London.  20 mins on the tube from the city center and a short walk from the  main Stafford station. Taxi is quite expensive due to the one way system so a walk is preferable.the  hotel is as you would expect for this chain but the breakfast was a little better than normal.will continue to use.

Basic room for money- checked in for two nights, however the hotel staff thought my booking was for 1 night only which made me a little stressed on arrival.Bed was comfy and breakfast was all self service (coffee from machine), breakfast was ok.

This hotel is in a good position, handy for the station and Westfield Shopping Centre.  The room was a reasonable size and bedding and bed of a good standard.  Breakfast was acceptable, but the dining room was very busy - we took our breakfast on trays to our room and ate, which was ok but probably not suitable for everyone.  The staff were really kind and helpful.  Would stay again, but felt that it was a little pricey - especially the Saturday night price.
A really quite hotel , very clean , breackfast very good with hot and cold food, not far from rail station(10 min walk) and Metro station.Very wonderfull hotel to stay with friends, staff very sweet.

Stayed 2 nights and found the hotel very clean and the staff were very pleasant and helpful its about a 15 min walk to westfield shopping centre,taxis are easily booked and cost about ¬£5 to westfield the room was very spacious and it was a joy to stay here.

The rooms was nice and clean. The sofa bed is not the most comfortable, but my teenager slept OK. Water pressure no great.  We enjoyed our breakfast.  Each and every staff member at reception was very nice and helpful, showing us how to use public transport to get to attractions , etc.  Libby was working when we checked in. She was really wonderful helping us and lending us a UK adaptor so we could charge our gadgets. WiFi is good. 10 min walk to tube station and  to big shopping mall with lots of food choices.

A clean and relatively new hotel, but very noisy due to being on a main road.  The room we were in on the 4th floor overlooked the car park at the back of the hotel and was above the restaurant kitchens, which meant we could hear all the staff and their conversations when it was break time.A 10minute walk to The Westfield shopping centre and a 10minute walk to the Olympic Park.Breakfast is a bit of a circus, not enough staff to clear tables, replenish foods and plates/utensils etcClose to a bus stop, the DLR station, the Tube station and the overland train station.

column9: Basic, cheap stay in the centre of London
column10: This hotel is perfect if you want a nice clean, cheap and comfortable stay near the middle of the city of London.  The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable.  The only minor criticism was breakfast which was a little basic.  No major complaints.  Staff were efficient and friendly.  No noise even given that we stayed on a Saturday night!

I had the pleasure of visiting friends across the City and decided to stop over.  That way I did not have to rush and meant I could visit Westfield the next day, for some retail therapyThe hotel was just as one would expect from Holiday Inn and I enjoyed my stay as a result.  Functional, entirely fit for purpose and well located for my needs

The website suggest great things...I was there on business the room was cramped and very noisy with mould on the shower ceiling......There were also horrid smells from the kitchen, more like a burger wagon than hotel. Food was average but definitely not value for money, on a positive note they did let me watch The Great British Bake Off in the bar! Not as close to the Olympic park as advertised either....

It's a lovely hotel but we made the mistake of going down for breakfast at the busiest time-9.00.  I don't understand how a hotel can run out of cups and glasses! Had to wait ages. When cups were brought out people crowded around to grab them and they ran out again. The poor woman kept saying they were waiting for more to be cleaned. Never experienced this in a hotel before. The buffet was in a small area so it was difficult not to bump into people. Shame as staff were lovely and room comfy. I'm sure if I had gone down at a quieter time this would not have happened.

Stayed two nights to visit Central London. Good base and convenient location-easy bus route to visit the Tower of London and the Shard. Hotel was clean and efficient. Breakfast included and was perfectly adequate unless you are a very fussy eater. Had room on first floor at front and had no problem with traffic noise at all! Helpful staff. Parking available at hotel if not full(¬£20 per night)or in Westfield (¬£5 per 24 hours) which is an easy walk. Plenty of places to eat in Westfield Shopping Centre. All in all, a pleasant experience.

column9: Good choice for a short stay
column10: Rooms: good. The beds were comfortable, bathroom was clean and neat, the desk was good enough, and so was the television (and WiFi!): basically that's all we needed (note: no minibar included).Breakfast: okay. It was pretty much standard (nothing fancy), but still much better than most of the hotels in (Greater) London are offering - at least, as far as I have been experiencing. Staff: very good. Staff was very helpful and very friendly.Location: the hotel is just a 10-minute walk from Westfield Mall, the Olympic Stadium and Stratford Tube Station, which in turn is about 15-20 minutes by Underground (Central Line) from the inner city. As such, it is a good choice if you want to have your share of rest and peace after a long and tiring day, either for business or for leisure activities.In general, I would recommend this hotel for your stay in London, if you are willing to stay out of the inner city. City Airport is not too far away (via DLR), and if you come via Gatwick Airport, travelling via London Bridge and the Jubilee Line is your best option.

This was great! & not overly expensive either!Again only stayed the one night ( as we were down in the capital for an event we'd come to 2weeks prior to this visit, for Secret Cinema) but I have to stay a lot more comfortable than the hotel we'd stayed in before at a Hilton Hotel, in Olympia in London.The room layout was a whole lot better, the bathroom was better laid out, loved all the mirrors, really good lighting as well for doing make up & breakfast thrown in too for free which we didn't get with Hilton at Olympia so definatley learn t that any Holiday Inn Express is way more better value for money.Staff were lovely, chatty and eager to learn about our stay & the purpose of our visit which I appreciated & thought was nice

column9: Good for sleeping, not so much for eating...
column10: Title says it all really, good, clean and comfy room but mediocre dinner and awful breakfast! I've never had a salad garnish served as a 'slice' of lettuce before and the morning (reconstituted) scrambled eggs were inedible! This HIE is a typical short stay city hotel but if I'd had to pay the advertised 'rack' price of ¬£275 I would not have been happy! Good value at the offer price for B&B but not so much for dinner. Full marks however for friendly reception staff.

Had a lovely warm welcome when I arrived close to midnight for a two night stay. The gentleman that booked me in explained the way the hotel worked and directed me where I could legally park my car.My room was very well appointed, clean and the shower was massive. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were graded, soft or firm!Breakfast was alright on the fried front and more than adequate for the continental taste; could fill your boots if required. Car park was a bit small but that's to be expected in London. All the staff I had contact with were courteous and helpful. The position was great for me, just over a mile to the start of Ride London in the Olympic park and on a bike superhighway road straight to The City. Yes I'll stay again and will be booking for next year.

The most important thing for business travellers: I had great fast wifi the whole day long in my room. You have to pay something if you transfer too much data, but the price is acceptable. The room had a nice working desk at the window and otherwise was really nice with a TV with HDMI and USB slots. The only thing I didn't appreciate so much was that the water faucet only gives you a few rays of water, maybe good for nature, but not so good if you have a limited amount of time to wash.The breakfast was standard good, not bad and not extraordinary. It was, despite being at a road, very quiet with a thickly carpeted floor, so I slept very well on the comfy bed. It is about 15 min. walk from the huge Stratford shopping centre and you should not mix it up with the Holiday Inn that is inside this shopping centre. I didn't mind the walk though, there are a lot of nice, also upper class restaurants in the shopping centre and the walk back to the HI Express was a welcome one. There is also a tube station at the Stratford shopping centre and Canary Wharf, or business city, is very close, both by tube or taxi. I can highly recommend it for any business traveller who has business in Canary Wharf

We stayed here recently for a night away. It is a beautiful and clean hotel. Staff were helpful and kind. The location of the hotel is perfect. Close to the shops and tube station. Price was reasonable and rooms were nice. Brilliant location to Stratfield Shopping Centre and Olympic Park. Breakfast was pretty weak but it was free! Would recommend if price was right.

Stayed here just after the games in August to soak up the remaining atmosphere of London. Price was reasonable and rooms were very nice. Brilliant location to Stratfield Shopping Centre and Olympic Park. Breakfast was pretty weak but it was free! Would recommend if price was right.

We stayed at the Express Holiday Inn for one night at the end of July. As soon as we arrived the staff were very friendly, helpful and happy to chat to us. Our double room was clean, tidy and had everything we needed, although we could have done with more coffee, sugar and milk but I'm sure these would have been available if we'd asked. The location of this hotel is very handy for getting to Westfield Shopping Centre and the Olympic park, just 15 minutes walk away.I have a couple of minor criticisms. The hotel parking is very limited so it's best to arrive early and get a space. The hotel is situated on a main road and therefore it is very noisy outside at night. We were unable to sleep with the bedroom window open as it was too loud. The breakfast choice was nothing more than ok but sadly, the juices we're disgusting. They tasted very watered down and had no flavour at all.

column9: Nice staff, good location, beds too firm, small car park, food below par
column10: We stayed for one Saturday night in late July 2014.We arrived later in the evening and got a nice welcome. Check-in was speedy having booked everything via their website. We had to drive and parked the car in the hotel car park which is small - maybe 20 spaces including disabled spaces. There were only two spaces left and it is first-come first-served. If you didn't find a space I'm not quite sure where I would like to leave my car locally as the area behind the hotel isn't great.The room was on the first floor; small but sufficient with two single beds as ordered. The bathroom is the same compact design as their hotel in Limehouse. Again small but sufficient. My only criticism is that there is a metal shower tray which is quite slippery when wet - a shower mat would be helpful to avoid slips. The beds are firm to the point of being a bit uncomfortable. The room had air conditioning which helped cool the room down. Our room was facing away from the road so rather than leaving the air con running overnight we opened the window. There was a bit of noise from the air con plant but it was okay.The breakfast selection was okay but the cooked option of sausages (okay), scrambled egg (a bit watery and lacking flavour) and baked beans was a bit limited.Checkout was again speedy and pleasant.We tried to walk to the Olympic Park for a walk but the route isn't obvious and we ended up driving to Westfield to park. I wouldn't recommend exploring the side streets behind the hotel looking for a route into the park - it doesn't look like the best neighbourhood.So a pretty good stay, thanks.

If being closer to central London is not a priority then this hotel is convenient to Westfield mall for shopping and eating. Transport links are good with trains, buses and underground nearby. Rooms are very basic and beds quite hard. Breakfast can be congested if the hotel is full. You get what you pay for‚Ä¶.3 stars.

I used to travel a lot but in London it was my first stay. The hotel was quiet and clean, Wi-Fi for two devices. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was located 30 min from the city center but it did not mind to me.What‚Äôs concerning breakfast ‚Äì the same menu every day so it was quite misery especially for my children. Fortunately the shop was just round the corner. Anyway I had a worse experience in the hotel. During check in I had to pay deposit (for two rooms) where receptionist explained me that after check out this money will be released and send back to my account max till one week. From my check out passed 3 weeks and I have not received any money. So I decided to check it out and I sent two mails to get some explanation what is wrong. Of course up to now I have not received any money and mail as well. So I strongly believe this way I can get some info concerning deposit money.Despite my bad experience at this hotel I can recommend it.

Been there numerous time for business trip.  one of the best location when travelling to London.  Located right beside the huge mall with lots of eatery.  And just next to Stratford station which is convenient.  Pricing is reasonable also compare to Central London.

Stayed a couple of nights in a quite small but comfortable room that was quiet and clean. As others have noted, breakfast is basic, and you should be aware that the advertised free WiFi is very limited. The hotel location is OK, but the surrounding streets do not offer much more than small convenience stores and a bingo club. More shops and restaurants are available near Stratford station, a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The Stratford High Street Station on the Docklands Light Rail is a couple of minutes away from the hotel and provides access to central London in 30-45 minutes.

IF you get a good rate then this hotel is OK. When booking don't get it confused with the Holiday Inn above the Westfield Stratford shopping centre, this is a good 10-15 minute walk from the Stratford Shopping centre and transport links!Reception was pleasant and no dramas, the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are compact but not too small and for someone travelling alone like I was it was big enough.The comfort isnt that great. The bed is hard and lumpy and the pillows, although identified as firm and soft options, all felt the same to me! The duvet is a joke really, not very thick and not that inviting either, I am sure this could be addressed.There is comfort cooling in the room although it never felt as though it really cooled the room, VERY noisy when on highest fan setting. The small TV 'hangs' on the wall, you cant straighten it and you cant really turn it to view so the only real option is to sit on the bed and watch it!The shower is large enough (1.5 size?) and powerful enough although I had an issue with drainage so the tray filled with water. I reported this to reception and the problem was fixed when I arrived back later that day, so no complaints there... other than surely this could be checked by the cleaning team? There was a lingering 'drain' smell after this issue that didnt go away whilst I stayed, surely again the cleaning team could address this?!Breakfast is a very UNDERWHELMING affair! I know it is 'Free' but seriously, all aspects of it are poor and quality is economical in my view!The scrambled egg was anaemic, the sausages poor quality, the beans were clearly cheap catering beans.. so I opted for toast... the bread was thin and poor quality. Even the orange juice was from concentrate and didnt taste nice at all. I chose bananas, they were fine!Dont even bother with the wifi, its poor, slow and intermittent.The best part about this hotel is the friendly and helpful staff. I got a very reasonable rate so on that basis I have marked it at average, if I had paid more I would not have been happy.

Stayed here for one night on business. It's a holiday inn express express so you should be getting something that accords to your needs.The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful but after that not much positive to say.1. The drains did not work properly in my room and water build up in the shower tray and the sink and took some time to flow away.2. Room was dated, needed an uplift3. Breakfast was limited and pathetic, this really was poor. I would not say most of the fresh stuff was that fresh. You could see people just standing looking and thinking, is this it?The hotel is quite isolated and not much around it. I'll not stay here again.

column9: Ask for a room at the back of the hotel
column10: never had any problems staying at the holiday inn express. They always give you a good sized room and bath room and really helpful staff.We were very lucky that we had a room at the back of the hotel so didn't hear any traffic, we all had good night sleeps.I think they should offer you more for hot food at breakfast, but I know this is a country wide thing, and that they need to say the same for all of their hotels.Car park at the back is really secure if a bit expensive and on a first come basis.Overall really happy with Holiday inn

Just short of ¬£200 b&b, for a budget hotel is ridiculous!!That out of the way it's clean, nice sized rooms and this one has its own meal offer in the evening. Breakfast is the standard HIE experience so miserable sausages to accompany beans and scrambled eggs. If you pay ¬£200 surely they can afford a better sausage?!Bar open late into the evening without the staff glaring at you to go to bed and in a reasonable location close to the station/Olympic Park.Just can't get over ¬£200/night!!!!!

column9: Sleepless Night Hotel, a more accurate name
column10: The service is average with a nice and committed staff. Breakfast limited, food quite average, fairly good size room but not very confortable but above all, NOISY, Very very NOISY.The price, as expected in London is quite high but the value for money is a rip-off.I won¬¥t ever come back !!!!

column9: Told to leave room at 10pm at night
column10: Well placed and generally ok for a short stay it was spoilt when after an error the staff made in booking in resulted in me having to leave my room at 10 pm for another sub standard room. I asked if it was necessary and the European male abruptly said it was necessary as the Hotel was fully booked. No marks for trying to resolve it, being helpful or even reasonable. I had to move all my belongings. I wasn't convinced they were fully booked either. So right or wrong the manner and attitude was poor . You really can't deal with customers like that. Food only average. Accommodation  only average.

Last time I stayed in Stratford I stayed at the Holiday Inn which was next to the Shopping centre. That was great but I thought I would save the company a few pounds and try this one.Located just down the road from Stratford Station it is equally as good as the Holiday Inn for a short business stay. Rooms are clean and the staff friendly and welcoming.I didn't eat the at the resteraunt in the evening but the standard breakfast was OK and the bar was well stocked.Would certainly stay again when in London as its a 30 min tube ride into central London.

Given the place 5 stars based on the fact that you get what you pay for, they fulfilled everything I'd expect at this price and level. Room was clean, smelt nice, and tidy. Perfect for what I needed, don't expect much for breakfast it is what it is and is okay, certainly nothing wrong with it. Staff were nice, only small thing is the lack of iron. They do operate a same say laundry service if you are desperate

column9: Really good value in an underestimated part of town...
column10: I have been coming to Stratford in business for about 7-8 years now and been following the amazing development in this part of town. They sure have done a great job with the heritage from the olympics! Staying in Stratford is so much prefered from central London, where you get fark less for money. This hotel has a good location close to Stratford station and its standard is much better than the average in London, in spite of being a Holiday Inn Express. Staff at reception are friendly and serviceminded and the lobby with its bare is quite a nice area. Rooms are recently renovated and perfectly comfortable. Good beds, which provides a perfect sleep...For this trip I brought a new delegation from my swedish office and all of them were new to the hotel and Stratford. They all loved it!!!

this hotel was surprisingly good and I would recommend it for travelers who want reasonably priced accommodation in London and are prepared to take either the tube or a bus to get to the city center which is about 30 to 40 minutes away - quicker by subway of course, but then you miss out on the sights.  I did have a problem in that my room had an adjoining room separated by a door and I could hear the woman next door who was chatting until 11.30 pm.  Luckily she was not there on the 2nd night and I had a good sleep.  breakfast was good also, by the standards of such accommodation, and the front desk was always helpful and smiling.  One last thing, if you're staying longer and need food or supplies, there's a mall located nearby with some reasonable restaurants.  the hotel itself serves snacks, a limited menu and cold beer!

The hotel rooms were decent and neat. Basic necessities available. Free breakfast and wifi was a plus. The hotel staff were nice generally but it depends on who is on shift. I stayed for 6 nights and throughout my stay, I was fortunate enough to get nice staff who were helpful. Though there was no room service, they kindly allowed us to order takeaways and even loaned us their meeting room for a brief while as I had some work matters to settle.Though it was at the east end, there was a Tesco express less than 5 mins away and the huge Westfield shopping just 10 minutes away.Perhaps the only downside was the distance to central London. Taking the tube was fasr, but if u were taking a cab or a mini bus(privately engaged) it would take an hour at least to reach central London because of the jam.I didn't travel with young children so the basic amenities were sufficient for adult and teens. However, if u are travelling with young children, I am not sure how child friendly it would be.Also, there were only 2 lifts. One broke down on our last 2 days of stay, and so it was pretty inconvenient with tons of luggage.Oh, there is no gym and pool too. so its really a basic hotel where u just sleep in.

The stay was comfortable with decent rooms. The staff was cooperative and the free breakfast was good. The location of the hotel is very good as it is walking distance from Stratford tube station and the Westfield Shopping centre.The towels given were not clean and the iron was not working properly.

Stayed here for one night for a trip to London. If you book here you really have nothing to worry about, the hotel is lovely, and the rooms clean with comfortable beds and a very powerful shower.  I had a room on the top floor and the view overlooks the Olympic Park.  The surrounding area seems really nice and it is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest bus/train/tube station and about 15 mins on the tube into the centre of London.  There are only a couple of reasons why I have given a rating of 4 and not 5. The parking is a little expensive (¬£20 for 24 hours). I know this is London and parking spaces are at a premium but it just seems a little excessive.  The hotel is quite large (6 floors) and there are only 16 parking spaces, but I went on a Bank Holiday weekend and it wasnt full, so if you are driving, I am sure you would be ok - it is also very secure.  The second reason, and to be honest I am being overly picky, was there was no bacon for breakfast. There was however plenty of choice, the hot breakfast being sausage, egg and beans, with plenty of cereals, toast, muffiins etc. The question I always ask myself when doing these reviews is would I stay there again.  The answer for this hotel is definitely yes, it is one of the nicer ones I have stayed in in London.

I picked this hotel due to location to Westfield shopping centre and also the good tube connections to other London locations and wasn't disappointed.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was spotless with a fantastic shower, great water pressure. My only complaint is the lighting, a lot of modern hotels do not have adequate lighting over mirrors and the lighting is generally dim and Hotel Inn Express is no exception, hotels need to realise women need good lighting for applying make up etc. The breakfast was as expected, typical buffet style but it was slightly manic at the time we ate, guests are warned of the busiest periods so we could only blame ourselves.  I would use Holiday Inn Express again.

Having anticipated a noisy, busy hotel I was very pleased to have a room facing a small park which meant the night was far more peaceful than I expected. The hotel was clean, comfortable and just fine for our needs for a weekend stay while attending a wedding.The breakfast was quite good with hot freshly cooked croissants and a choice of cereal. We didn't want hot food, but there was a limited choice as is usual for HIEX.The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Not the greatest part of town but the hotel was nice and not too far of a walk from the train station and Olympic Park. The front desk was friendly, free WiFi and breakfast. Overall, a fairly good stay but not sure I'd stay that far from the city center again.

Stopped here during a working visit to London.  Room was as you would expect no problems with check in and out and for once the breakfast was better than normal of a holiday inn expressClose to straford station and 30 minutes from London Centre.  Train very full so travel before 8:00 if you don't want to feel your in a cattle truck

Me and my fiance stayed here for one night as we needed a base in London that didn't cost a fortune. We were so pleased, we will probably never stay anywhere else. Location was fantastic being a short walk from the train station. The area it is in isn't the best part of Stratford, however the shops/restaurants are only a few minutes walk away. The room was clean and spacious with a fantastic air con system and a lovely shower. We both slept really well. We found the bar prices very reasonable & the staff friendly and helpful. We weren't sure what to expect at breakfast but we were both pleasantly surprised, more then enough to keep us going & my fiance said the scrambled eggs were the best he has had in a hotel. We will be back.

Good location with easy travel links. Excellent price for London area. Breakfast included - a little limited but really includes everything you need. Free Wi-Fi in all areas. Very clean. Room well sized for type of accommodation. Comfortable beds.

We actually stayed at this hotel in April 2013. We were looking for an inexpensive weekend getaway in Stratford before I had to return to my island home and I was thoroughly impressed. The location was amazing, the hotel was beautiful inside and out, the staff were very friendly and accommodating and breakfast was wonderful. We loved it so much we stayed there twice in one week! Though the room we got the second time needed a little attention, when I visit London again I will most definitely spend some time at this hotel again. Loved it!

We stayed for three nights during May and couldn't have been happier with the hotel.  We arrived very early and although they did not have our room ready they had a room for our luggage.  I asked if we could get a cup of coffee as we had been up for quite a few hours travelling to London already.  To my surprise they not only gave us coffee but a completely free breakfast as well. How's that for service?The room was perfect for us, basic but clean.Close to a major underground and also a short walk to the newly opened Olympic  Park which was a great bonus (see review)All in all a great place to base our trip to London.

The hotel is just 15 minutes walking from the Stratford station. And, although it is at only tree zones from city the trip takes 30 minutes.A great shopping mall (Westfield) is near  the Stratford station offering a great alternative of places to eat and shopping.Breakfast at the hotel was plentiful and the room was quiet. The bed was comfortable and clean.Desk attendants (and all other employees) were friendly and very professional.Unfortunately there was no wardrobe in our room.We can recommend this hotel with no doubt whatsoever. A great quality/price relation.

I stayed in thiw hotel in March 2014 . It is close to tube station and in the area of London that totally changed after Olympic games. The room was clean and comfortable, hotel staff wery polite.Shame there was not more space to park, but its the same everywhere in London

I booked this hotel, thinking I was staying at the Holiday Inn at the Westfield Shopping Centre in Stratford.  This hotel is a fifteen minute walk from the shopping centre, but offers incredible value for money.  Everything was clean and the room was spacious.  I wanted to take the shower home with me!  Breakfast was very crowded for a Sunday morning, but the staff kept everything well stocked and spotlessly clean!  If you're driving, my hot tip would be to park at the Westfield Shopping Centre for a tenner for 24 hours, with ultra high security, then walk to the hotel. Would I stay here again or recommend this hotel? Absolutely!

Firstly, Stratford is far from the CBD but a short walk away is the Startford Station with underground, trains. Secondly, free breakfast was absolutely horrible but the free wifi is very fast. Thirdly, there is a difference between ecologically friendly and being lazy!

I stayed there for a night and I had a wonderful time. The toom was clean, had wifi. Unfortunately the breakfast wasn't that brilliant. The selection could've been better considering where it is located.

Perfect service, fine wifi, fresh breakfast, so what I can say more? :) it is about 10 minutes walk from underground, there is a really big shopping mall Stratford, lot of restaurant close to hotel (5-10 minutes walk or you can get bus). One minus, hotel is not so close to the airport, so one hour by underground and then train.

We must have ended up in an un-refurbished room as it was extremely tired and doesn't match some of the new flashy photographs on their website. There were a number of dirty areas and scuff marks all over the room. Parts of the shower were missing, but still functional.You aren't far from Stratford station and the shopping centre. It's easy to get to central London from here too. There's a handy Tesco express just down the road a little.We constantly smelled cigarette smoke in our bathroom. We mentioned this in the morning, received an apology but no more. We really did find it most unpleasant!It was good enough for a bed for a night but not longer.

The hotel is what you would expect from a Holiday Inn express - clean, modern streamlined and functional.I have only given it an average rating due to the airconditioning in the room not working making it unbearably hot.The legs/ castors on the bed were not aligning properly, so as soon as you sat on the bed it shot away from the headboard, which is attached to the wall leaving a gap for the pillows to fall down and not very comfortable to sit up in bed.The mattress was very firm with little give in it. (I wwas wishing HI do a matress menu as well as a pillow menu!)There was a bit of a wait to check in due to the only staff member visible covering the bar and reception.You should also be aware that although it is only a 10 minute walk from the train/bus and tube stations it is also a 10 minute walk from everything else.  There are no restaurants or other amenities nearby other than a small cornershop/off licence opposite.

column9: Clean, new build, excellent location for Olympic Park and shopping complex.
column10: Excellent base for Olympic village and tube station Central line direct into London. Great value for money and service.Self serve Breakfast more than adequate.Staff friendly and interested in guests.Thank you for enjoyable stay

column9: Worst night ever in a hotel
column10: The hotel itself is in a good location for rail station and Olympic Park. Room was clean and well appointed. Breakfast excellent. Staff polite and efficient. But, and it's a big BUT, no-one in my family got a wink of sleep all night.  When we arrived the room was at 22.5degC.  The air conditioning was not working and within minutes the room temperature had leapt to an unbearable 24 deg. A member of staff came to examine the thermostat and stated that the aircon was switched off as "it is not summer yet" and it was not possible to switch the aircon on. We were told there were no fans available and to open the window.  Overlooking what must be the noisiest street in London - no hope of any sleep there!  By the morning the temperature was at 25degC.  Myself, my husband and my young son had endured a night of hell.  Not ideal as my son was competing in a national sporting event that day and was completely exhausted.On checkout I reminded the Receptionist of the awful night we had suffered. She led me to believe we had been refunded the cost of the stay.  Unfortunately I must've misunderstood her as on arriving back home I discovered we had only been refunded 20% of the room rate. Frankly I would rather have paid the full rate and had a good night's sleep!Apart from enduring a tortuous night of no rest in an airless oven the hotel was great. But a good night's sleep was all we really wanted.

Stayed here for three nights. Great location as only a short walk from the tube station. We were staying for a festival at the O2 so it was a fantastic location. Room was good and clean. Staff were friendly and helpfull. Would stay again.

column9: Clean comfortable and good location for Westfield and Olympic Park
column10: Stayed here for a night while attending the Sports Relief evening at the Olympic Park. Hotel looked new so assume it WS built for the Olympics, check in was efficient and we were soon entering our room on the 1st floor. Room is basic but clean and comfortable, view from the window limited but overall fine for a night. Aircon a little noisy overnight but plenty of hot water for nice shower. Breakfast was included which was nice. Buffet style - nothing to get excited about but it was fine and free!So overall it was fine for a night if you need to stay in this area.

This hotel is one of the best hotels in London, it's easy to get to Central London from here with DLR and Stratford station only minutes walk away.  As a priority club member we got put on "the nice side" which was overlooking the local school and car park. I wouldn't have minded if the room was overlooking but it had a faulty window. The bathroom is nice and spacious it's only downfall is the mirror which is behind the toilet. They supply a face cloth that is similar to a brand of kitchen paper towel.  The bed is so comfy and the room was cleaned every day with fresh linen on the bed and fresh towels for both me and my partner. I do think this hotel could do with having room service put within the hotel so that you do t have to trek to the bar to get food or drinks.I will be staying her again on my next trip to London,

We stayed for 4 nights for business. Check-in was quick and receptionist friendly. The room was good and within our expectations: it was clean and comfortable. It had a LCD screen with a good selection of TV programs. Bath-room was OK. A nice desk and comfortable chair was available for work with laptop, and WIFI worked well. The breakfast was in general good, with more than sufficient selection of different food. The croissants were delicious. DLR transportation is within 10 minutes walk. I can recommend this hotel, as it was good value for money.Only some minor things to complain. Not much or no restaurants to be reached by foot. Honestly speaking, the street is a bit noisy - I woke up each night with some traffic noise. The coffee at breakfast tastes horrible.
