I stayed here with my partner and his sister and brother in law for 2 nights in March. Check in was nice and easy and we were allowed in our rooms as soon as we got there which was around 1pm. The rooms were nice, bathrooms are lovely and shower is really spacious. Beds are comfy and got a nice full nights sleep. The breakfast on both mornings was good, it was busy in the restaurant though and had to wait for a table the one morning. The choice is cereal, yogurts and fruit, bread, croissants, sausage, scrambled eggs and beans. Both mornings there was no sausage but within minutes it was filled back up. We had drinks in the hotel bar on an evening when we got back which was around 12am and it was nice and chilled out. To get to London we used the tube. The walk to the tube was around 7-10 minutes. There is also a DLR closer and the train station is with the tube, so lot's of ways to get into London. We paid aprox ¬£8 each for a day tripper which got us around and about London and to the hotel which is in Zone 3. It was around 7-9 stops into the main parts of London depending where you are going. There is a big Westfield where the tube/train station is so if you fancy shopping this is ideal. The hotel is also by the Olympic stadium. We ventured into Stratford high street on the one evening and regretted this more or less instantly, we all felt uncomfortable with the gangs and the people hanging around. We walked in a bar and walked back out because it looked quite rough. This is obviously not the hotel's fault but I just wanted to make people aware that socialising in this area would not be the best. There were no issues walking from the tube station to the hotel, it was literally only when you went to the High Street. I enjoyed this hotel.

Lovely hotel, staff very polite and friendly, rooms lovely,clean everything you need.  Free breakfast very nice. Will definitely return. Stayed for the weekend with my daughter & staying here made the weekend all the more enjoyable

Hotel was strictly average even by business standards. Staff was okay but at most of the times seemed confused. But staff did help when required. Breakfast buffet was strictly average. No Indian food. Nothing special to mention. Rooms were okay, free wireless was provided as part of the package which worked fine. No excitement in this hotel.

column9: Just what you need for a short stay..
column10: Stayed here for 6 nights with my husband. The location is very quiet, with a market just across the street and very close to a big shopping center called Westfield. The fact that it's not located in the center of London is no problem at all. You can easily  use the underground station which is a 10 min walk from the hotel, and it can take you there with a maximum time of 30min. Using the tubes is very easy.  You can get an Oyster card directly from the airport, it will make your stay easier. It was a very good stay. The room was comfortable and very clean, with a small TV, tea and coffee facilities, as well as a hair dryer. But we had a minor issue with the shower 's plumbing and the lack of q-tips.Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was so British  but with limited options and it was the same every day. The most annoying is that if you come a little later than 8 you can't find a place to sit. The buffet room is also tiny. But a positive point is that you have access to an unlimited supply of hot drinks such as tea, hot chocolate, cappuccino, or other.Apart from that, it s a very good hotel with a good value for money and free wifi. I would highly recommend it for anyone who s not looking for a romantic or a fancy stay.

I stayed for 2 weeks while on business trip in London.It s clean.But - the beds were the worst I have ever slept on. The matrac was so soft that actually, when I sat in the middle of the bed, both ends went up. I dont suffer from the back pain but these two weeks were the hell for me as I had a terrible back pain. Once I got back home - all went away.The breakfast. The choice is: the cheddar, the youghurt, the scramled egg, the jam and the fruits. After a week I started buying myself my own breakfast as I was that bored of these. I would appreciate at least a little bit of a ham for a change!Tbh, it was not the only Holiday Inn I ve stayed in but this one was the only one dissapointing.

column9: Great Hotel in London's East End
column10: This hotel was extremely accessible to the tube and bus network and in particularly Westfield and The O2. The reception team were extremely funny and very helpful.The hotel was clean and comfortable. The kettle in the room was a bit dodgy, but once reported it was all fine.Would recommend.

My self & 3 other people stayed at the hotel last night and it was nice enough stay however we expected a full breakfast as this is what was paid for, we went for breakfast at 10am. The selection was poor. We all wanted a nice full breakfast for the drive home. There was scrambled egg, beans (which were cold) croissants & cereal. I approached a member of staff and asked about bacon, sausages etc as you generally get with a full breakfast and I was told they don't do bacon?! And sausages weren't cooked! This was annoying to say the least! I have got to say I will not state in a holiday inn express again. Somehow they knew our room number and we were brought some sausages as we were leaving in some small dry rolls - these were not eaten! Too little too late!

I went to this hotel in the month of January 2014, for a short holiday with my family.The hotel is  situated in a good position, at walking distance from the wonderful Westfield center and at a strategical point for transports. The underground station, the bus station and the train station are all situated ‚Äúunder‚Äù the Westfield center. The bus stop from/to Stansted airport is there, too.The staff of the hotel was kind.The breakfast room is situated near the entrance, and they offer a wide range of products, both sweets and both salted.The room was clean and well furnished. The only fault was the water closet that was not perfectly working.I would certainly suggest this hotel to my friends.

column9: Good size room and nice breakfast
column10: Spent a night here on a recent trip and was amazed with the size of the room, it could actually accomodate family of four. Breakfast spread was pretty decent too.Wifi worked well throughout the stay. Short stroll to Stratford Centre malls and transport connections. Overall it was better than I expected.

Hotel is on a very busy dual carriage way leading into Central London but you dont hear very much from the rooms. Ideally placed for a trip into London or shopping at Westfields Stratford. Great for families...free breakfast included in price car park a bit costly at ¬£10 per night. Would stay again no problem.

column9: What you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express
column10: We were visiting family in the area and stayed two weekend nights using my Priority Club points. The hotel was chosen for location which was fine. The rooms were very clean and well maintained the reception staff were friendly and helpful.  As Holiday Inn Express chain goes this was an excellent example - however I remember why I choose not stay in this brand. The room had a shower only with no toiletries - only soap dispensers in the bathroom -  breakfast was a self-service buffet canteen style as you use a tray.

column9: You get what you pay for
column10: I consider the service quiet fair. Nice people at reception. Clean rooms though the batrhom is small and lacks of suplies such as shampoo and soap. They expect you to shower with the same you wash your hands.... Food; you can have a bufet though the quality of the food is very poor.

First stay for some time at a HIE. Great staff, brilliant room, breakfast was more than adequate. ¬£20 to park was steep but little other choice and the rain was teaming down.We didn't, like the pillows but the bed was comfy.

Holiday Inn Express is always good for value for money  - with breakfast and internet always included in a pretty reasonable price. This hotel is no exception.  The location is reasonable  - about 10 minutes walk from Stratford tube station and the fantastic new Westfield shopping centre that is right by the station. The hotel is fairly new and the rooms are excellent  - clean and comfortable. The breakfast is pretty decent for one that has been included in the price and I would have rated this hotel as Very Good except for the completely inadequate restaurant in which the breakfast is located. The buffet is set up in a really tiny room at the end of a small restaurant. There are not enough seats so you often have to wait to sit down and once you have, you have to struggle through the rest of the people trying to get into the tiny room at the end of the restaurant where the buffet is located. I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and the situation has always been the same. Today I ended up deciding the free breakfast was not worth it and went out to get breakfast elsewhere. If they would fix the breakfast situation, the hotel would be truly outstanding value for money.

Friend and I stayed here and it was wonderful!! Literally opposite the shopping centre Westfield and three mins from tube station on central line. Would def stay here again. The only issue was the internet didn't quite work at the start but was soon fixed by the friendly reception staff.

column9: So easy to get to and great value for money
column10: My first trip to London, we were going to see a concert in the O2 and i found it impossible to find any hotels on this that would be recommended for this purpose. I can reassure anybody who is going to see a concert in the O2 this hotel is perfect. It is less than 10 minutes on the tube to Northern Greenwich which is where the O2 is located. It is on the opposite side of the city so you wont be waiting for ages to get on the crowded tube when concerts are on. The Inn itself is lovely, clean, comfortable and the staff are very friendly. There is FREE wifi in the Inn which was a brilliant bonus because most places charge you.The breakfast is FREE, which is a great bonus and you also get the choice of a continental or hot breakfast. I don't know of any other place I have stayed that would offer you a free hot breakfast. Ok its not the full Irish but a breakfast is a breakfast and it fills you until lunch what more could you ask for. The rooms were clean and tidy, ok they are basic but a hotel room is a hotel room all you want is a nice comfy bed, a warm room and a hot shower and this place has all of that.To get to the Holiday Inn is very easy you can go on the central or jubilee line directly to Stratford. If coming from Gatwick Airport like I was the train takes 20-25 mins to London Bridge and there you switch to the Jubilee line and it takes another 20-25 mins to get to Stratford and the Inn is a 5 min walk around the corner.There is a massive shopping centre 5 min walk from the Inn, beside the tube station which was a massive bonus for me I love shopping :) Im guessing over 200 shops I couldn't go around to them all I didn't have the time, but all the big names you would expect to see in any shopping centre. Loads of choices for different meals everything you would want under one roof.This Inn was perfect and as it was our first trip to London we didn't have a clue where anything was. We will definatly be staying here again any time we visit London. It so easy to access

Stayed here with my 9yr old twins for a family get together, I was paying for my niece's room, which was no problem even though they had not arrived yet. We went out for a meal nearby, and returned for drinks in the lobby bar. My children were quite loud and boisterous, but again no problem to the ever smiling receptionist. The rooms were spotless, plenty of space for four of us in a double with sofa bed, bathroom gleaming and everything you could need was available, including cartoons on tv for the kids. Breakfast was plentiful, with hot and cold buffet options available and a never ending supply of coffee (handy for the hangovers). The location was ideal, close to Stratford International, and of course, the splendid Westfield! All in all, a value for money hotel that I recommend.

Hotel location is very good for the city center and the stadium. The rooms were nice spacious and clean and the breakfast really "British" scrambled eggs with sausage beans and much more!!! Nice decor in modern style! advised

column9: Not bad for a budget hotel in London
column10: This place was ok, kind of far from central London (about an hour by bus, or 30-40 mins by train). We were able to get a train straight there (with one change) from Heathrow and to Gatwick airports. We were put in a disabled room, which was fine, but it smelled a little bit like urine, and it had dangling cords everywhere, which (naturally) I pulled and set off an alarm.Its probably a 5-10 min walk from stratford underground station, and there is also a bus right outside the from door that goes to the city. Buffet breakfast was one of the highlights of the hotel, and what was even better was that you can take it back to your room.Not romantic, or fancy, or modern but definitely does the job.

While usually avoiding chain hotels, this was a comfortable exception, booked by my friend. Handy location from Standsted, only 5 min walk from the bus stop. Hotel is basic, but spotless, with a kind service. Versatile breakfast. Price-ratio very good for LDN.Westfield, big shopping centre is place for a shopaholics. Also intresting Moroccon&Lebanese restaurant nearby. Underground to the Oxford street takes around 20min.Plus; they said that children under 16 stay for free!

For the room charge we paid - couldn't fault this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Nice sized room with lovely crisp linen and towels, not a spec of dust. We were on the high street side but we slept really well and the traffic noise did not affect us. Lots of choice at breakfast, ok only a limited amount of hot food but was constantly being replenished. Well done HI Stratford - made us very comfortable!

If you want a reasonably priced room in this area of London, this is not bad at all. The rooms are fairly spacious and the hotel is well maintained. The bathroom only has a shower and an all purpose soap/shampoo/body wash dispenser. But the towels are large and thick! I've had a lot worse in smarter more expensive places.  Breakfast is ok but you eat it in a canteen atmosphere, some of us had to virtually sit in reception. If you need to be here on business this is fine and only 6-7 minutes walk from the Westfield centre with restaurants and shopping

column9: Well connected Holiday Inn Express for Olympic  Park and London
column10: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, Stratford for a 3 night business / leisure trip in October 2013. The hotel is conveniently located just a five minute walk from Stratford Station (train, underground, DLR and bus depot), and particularly well connected to Central London by the Central Line Underground.Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and welcoming and the check-in process was efficient. The request for a rear facing quiet room was also met. The room was spacious, clean and well serviced. The beds were comfortable, with nice duvets, fluffy pillows and afforded a great night's sleep. There was also a double sofa bed in the room.The bathroom was also very clean and spacious and we had a room with a very effective shower. Shower gel, shampoo and hand soap are available in dispensers.Tea and coffee making facilities were in the room and a nice coffee lounge was available near the lifts on our floor, offering further supplies of tea and coffee and a comfortable place to sit.The breakfast was fairly standard and comprehensive, with a small supply of hot items (scrambled eggs, sausages and baked beans), cereals, bread, rolls and toast, cheese, sliced meats, fruit and yoghurt. More than enough to set one up for a busy morning in London!Would I return or recommend this hotel to my family and friends? Yes, highly likely!

column9: Reasonable Hotel for the price paid
column10: The front desk staff are pleasant and friendly. The room was just nice for 2 average sized person. I was pretty shocked to see no toiletries provided. When I called to request for them, I was told to go down to obtain them. Well, I guess maybe due to the hotel rate we paid is too low and they dont have such service to provide to hotel guests. Correct me if I am wrong.

In general, staying at hotels in vibrant Stratford gives much better value than in central London 15 minutes away. This place is situated 10 minutes walk from Stratford station and the surroundings are quite ok. Rooms are recently refurbished and in very good condion. Very comfortable beds, which gives a good sleep. Did not get a very good sleep though, since it was a lot of road work going on both day and night.Staff are mostly good and some quite excellent in their service towards guests. Breakfast is very ordinary and basic compared to its sister hotel at Westfield in Stratford. Overall, Holiday Inn Express London Stratford is a good choice if on a budget and still want good value...

column9: Wonderful Stay but Failed at the Last
column10: I booked this hotel having previously stayed at the nearby pricier Holiday Inn. There was no real difference between the two (except the location and here the breakfast was included). The room was clean and comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly.I had an accessible room and once accidentally pulled one of the alarm cords. I received an immediate call to see if all was well.The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice.My stay was for four nights with earliest check in 2 pm, latest check out 11 am. Pretty standard. I assume that like me most people plan their travel arrangements round these times.It was a little disconcerting therefore when there was a knock on the door at 10.15 a..m. yesterday, my day of departure, and I opened the door to find not the cleaner but a member of the office staff saying the cleaner wanted to come in to change the room. She went away when I pointed out I had till 11 a.m. to vacate, agreeing that yes, that was another 45 minutes. I packed and left as quickly as possible feeling that I had been pushed out. This gave a very poor impression and spoiled what had till then been a very pleasant stay.

Me and my friends stayed here for the NFL at Wembley in September arriving in London at Kings Cross you have the option of catching a tube to Liverpool Street and changing here for a second tube to Stratford International taking 19 minutes or you can catch the High Speed Sprinter train which is direct and takes 6 minutes without the hassle although unfortunately you cannot use your Oyster card on this service and it costs ¬£5.70 but is easier if you have heavy cases / bags.The hotel as mentioned by others is a 5-10 minutes walk from the station along High Street.Check in was no problem and I was given a room at the back on the 5th floor so no problem with traffic noise although there is noise from a nearby school during 'playtime' mid morning and probably lunchtime and mid afternoon.Breakfast was the usual self service HI Express offering with cereal, toast, croissants, scrambled egg, sausage and beans (although the sausages seemed weird and a bit mushy but edible) and then tea, coffee, orange or apple juice for for drinks.As my mobile battery had died I couldn't use my London Underground app so we asked the Desk Clerk the best way to get to Regent Street and he told us a cab would cost around ¬£25 which wouldn't have been too bad as there was 3 of us but this actually cost us ¬£50 taking about an hour.We later found out we could've got a direct tube to Green Park and a little walk which would've been over ¬£40 cheaper and about 30 minutes quicker so my comment is that if on the front desk it would be helpful to have some local knowledge to help out the customer. The room was fine and after I left my card in the slot one morning and went for breakfast I returned and the maid was happy to let me back in the room.There are a few fast food vendors near the Stratford Station which were still open around midnight on the Sunday i.e McDonalds, K.F.C and across the road a chippy / kebab house for if you return late from a show e.t.c e.t.c

My mother,  had booked a room for my wife and I for 25.09.13. It was booked via booking .com,On the receipt that I printed it clearly states ....Your booking is now confirmed.When I arrived at the front desk to check in, the member of staff stated that I needed to produce the credit card that the purchase was made with. I explained to him that I did not have the card and that my mother had booked and PAID IN FULL at the time of making the reservation. I was Not notified that a credit card was to be produced and nor does it state anywhere on the booking form that I need to provide the credit card, instead it quite clearly states.. ....Your booking is now confirmed and the bank statement shows that funds have been taken out and that the room was paid for.At first the member of staff gave the impression that it would not be problem, but then quickly changed his mind and said we MUST pay in full either with another credit card or in cash.I again explained the situation, stating that I did not have the credit card or the cash but he rather rudely and in a condescending manner implied that was not his problem and tough luck on meI said that we could call my mother and she will tell him anything he wants to know about the booking transaction, he said ok, and then refused to let me use the hotels telephone. I asked twice for it and he refused, stating ‚Äúthat I should make some effort ‚Äú. I told him that my phone was a Croatian mobile and I will be charged over 1 pound a minute, he shrugged his shoulders and said he didn‚Äôt careI then called my mother on my Croatian phone, started to explain to her the situation, and at this point he walked off, went into an office and closed the door and totally ignored me. When I finished the telephone conversation, he returned and stated in a very rude manner that I must pay in cash or leave. He embarrassed and humiliated both me and my wife. I offered to leave my passport for security, but he refused. I asked to speak with a manager and he said that he was the manager, I asked again to speak with somebody in a senior position and he refused, where as he a desk clerk and not the manager of the hotel. He then advised me to call booking.com, I asked for the hotel phone to do so and again he refused. In the end I was forced, to pay again in cash although it was paid for 6 months before, The company was in possession of funds belonging to my mother for all this time and are accountable for the this interest. You cannot simple charge people twice for the same product and nor can you keep the money for 6 months.In all I am hugely disappointed in the way we were treated, your staff showed no compassion, no understanding  and no diplomacy and showed absolutely no evidence that he wanted to help, which is exactly what somebody who works on a help desk is supposed to do.

column9: Good value accommodation, reasonable location out east
column10: I obtained my room through Hotwire, where you don't know where you're staying until after you have booked and paid, for ¬£68.16 including VAT, and including breakfast.  The hotel is not in the fashionable Westfield shopping centre, but on Stratford High Street, and I reached it by taking the tube from Central London to Bow Road, and taking the bus from there.  Stratford High Street DLR station is closer, but does not have a service into Central London, and the 25 bus is phenomenally frequent 24 hours and stops close to the hotel.  There's roadworks outside the hotel at the moment which makes for a lot of slow traffic and many bollards etc. Anyway, check-in was easy and efficient and I was allocated room 225 at the back which was a reasonable double room (for single occupancy), choice of pillows, plenty of TV channels and a good breakfast in the morning.  Last week in London I paid ¬£72 for a tiny room without private facilities near Southwark Bridge in a livery hall, and no breakfast and a battery radio where I had to check in no later than 1800 so the HIE was a definite improvement.  Spotlessly clean, friendly front desk team, good breakfast and no murmur when I didn't come back for my baggage until after 2000 after a lecture in Covent Garden to make a journey out to stay with my parents.  (Their house is very comfortable - but not rated on Trip Advisor!)

The front desk staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The free breakfast was delicious, and offered an excellent array of choices. The room was very clean and of a good size.The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk to the Stratford Station, which offers underground, above ground and light rail transportation service. It only took us about 15 minutes to get to central London via the tube. Bus service is also available. There is a very large indoor shopping mall next to the Stratford Station. The food court in this mall is the best ever-offering a lot of delicious ethnic foods We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to London

Big, comfortable room, spotlessly clean, free Wi-fi once you got the code from reception, breakfast included - plenty of choice, close to Stratford transport links and shopping - seemed expensive for one night but maybe not for London.  I did find the traffic quite noisy throughout the night - my room overlooked the main road.  However, overall the stay was good.

Good accommodation, and very kind stuff (lovely girls, thank you very much for your help!!!). There are a perfect beer (Stela! :D) and delicious food in the dinning room. It¬¥s near of a huge metro station and 10 minutes from one of the bigest mall of the country! Easy to get to Excel Centre. We love it.

I stayed here with some friends and it was very convenient for the station and stratford centre. The reception was busy and had a good atmosphere. We checked in without a problem, and the rooms were fine, spacious and clean. We had a drink in the bar which was friendly and went out for some food,which wasn't far from the hotel. The only problem is that our room faced the main road, which being busy all night meant that you could hear the traffic noise throughout the night, which was not great for sleep quality. So if you are thinking of staying, ask for a rear facing room. Other than that, the stay was very good.

june 2013:Got a  very new room in the newer part of the building. it looked nice, modern bathroom with shower, air conditon, comfortable sofa, and soft bed. relatively big, espescially considering the small size you find plenty of places in london.internet NOT included and was not cheap, but with your phone as a wi fi spot and a UK SIM, you will be fine ;)Very friendly cleaing staff, good reception, comfortable bar facilities to a reasonible prize level.room rates are high, but it is good looking all over the place. note there are no fridge, else than that, your needs are nicely covered.can be recommende, for good standard and acceptable service :)Martin

Stayed here for 1 night while attending event at ExCel exhibition centre and was very satisfied. Conveniently located close to DLR (overground, underground and national rail only a little further away). Good rate and pleasant, helpful staff. Rooms clean, bright and relatively spacious; the large walk-in shower was a particularly good feature. The excellent buffet breakfast nicely concluded a good stay. I was impressed.

column9: Very impressed for a short business stay
column10: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and can definitely recommend. Location is on high street Stratford and about 7-10min walk from Stratford underground. On check a nice touch, due to being a priority member, received a free alcholic drink or extra points. Chose the free drink :-) . Wifi is free throughout - other hotels take note ! Rooms are very clean, feel fresh, functional with tea and coffee, flat screen TV, bathroom with shower. Restauant area is fine with really good food for snacks and evening meals served quickly. Breakfast is relatively limited for each offering, but suffucuent - toast, pastries, hot food, fruit, fruit joices and hot drinks. Safes available and vending machine with travel items and food/drink.Staff are very friendly and very professional. Only down side was the fact it was London Fasion week and the rate for every hotel had doubled so I had to pay c¬£200+ per night for this hotel which was double the normal rate, but in line with every other hotel that week.

My son and I stayed here as we were going to see Neil Young @ the O2 but then the gig was cancelled. Still we took advantage of shopping in Westfield and eating there. In that sense the hotel is well-placed being less than ten minutes from the Centre and the tube. The hotel maintains the usual Holiday Inn standard of cleanliness, good service and a decent breakfast all for a sensible price. We‚Äôll stay here again ‚Äì let‚Äôs hope we have better luck with the concert!

The staff are all very friendly and it is a clean hotel, but housekeeping needs looking at. Our room had a few issues, our daughters room had a very nasty mark on the wall told reception but nothing done, no communication. Breakfast set up now that's another thing room where food is, is far to small not a good lay out.

column9: Excellent value for money in London
column10: Stayed here for 2 nights earlier in the month for a summer trip to London. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly on check in, rooms were an excellent size and very clean.Location is 20 minute from Stratford tube station/ Westfield.Really good value for money in London

I stayed at this hotel for the Ride London - Surrey cyclosportive.  Recognising that this will have been the first time that the hotel was full of cyclists and bikes the did a great job.  Opening up for breakfast at 5am was very much appreciated.  I thought the food was fine and there was plenty of it.  But, the noise in our room from the road was relentless.  It's a main road into London and was busy all night. I didn't get much sleep.Get a room on the other side of the hotel unless you are a really heavy sleeper.I have to say that the staff were super friendly and helpful - much appreciated.As this looks set to be an annual event they do need to think about bike storage.  We kept ours in our room and that was great (as everyone else seemed to be).  But if they had been wet the hotel would have ended up with a few oil stains here and there however careful people tried to be.  Maybe provide super size bin liners to cover rear wheel and drivetrain and insist people use them?In summary - fine for the price.  Take your ear defenders!

We stayed here to ride in the London-Surrey 100 Sportive. The staff could not have been more helpful, with bikes all over the place; clearly the 16-place car park was never going to suffice, so we parked at Westfield (15 mins walk), and stored our 2 x ¬£1500 Bianchis in the bedroom (as did all other riders. What they'd do if all the bikes were soaked and oily after bad weather, I haven't a clue!). Bedroom bike storage is very handy for pre-ride bike prep. It was obvious the staff were taken aback by the 20,000-strong field, and the place suffered as it tried to cope with an overwhelming tide of cyclists.I asked for a quite room and didn't get one: the traffic noise from Stratford Hight Street was truly awful, and 3hrs kip before a 100-mile ride ain't good. Second night after a severe complaint, we were moved to a much nicer room in the newly-built extension at the back, and slept OK.The staff were really good, and did their best, but even the kitchen was overwhelmed by the amount of food that hungry cyclists need to consume, and closed early. Breakfast was barely sufficient, though to their enormous credit on the day, they did open up at 5am.Really great staff, hit-and-miss rooms, very average food, decent location.

First stay in the city that wasn't with a premier inn, purely booked for the value, ¬£95 for one night. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Stratford station and 5 minutes to the high street DLR station. The hotel was very smart we were given an accessible room on the 6th floor, the only difference was the bathroom didn't have a bath or shower it was a wet room! We didn't ask or need an accessible room so I can assume we were just given it in terms of vacancies. The room I would compare to a premier inn, nice size, bed slightly smaller but a choice of pillows, tea coffee making facilities, tv and air con. Room and entire hotel were very clean.Breakfast is free and its a buffet style, just continental, no other choices but was good all the same, one little niggle was the orange juice tasted like water and my other choice tropical juice was warm.Check in and check out were very quick.All in all a great hotel and great value for money, would stay here again.

column9: Handy for the Ride London 100 Cycle Event Start!
column10: Booked this as it is near the Olympic Park where the Prudential Ride London 100 cycle event starts from. Receptionist was very helpful. Room was large, clean and comfortable. Close to Westfield shopping mall (10 minute walk, as is the Stratford railway / tube station for links to rest of London).Buffet self service style breakfast was a bit hit and miss, with not a lot of choice, but what was there was fine. Praise to the hotel for setting up an early 4am breakfast for the cyclists on the day of the event, very much appreciated.

I had to chose this hotel due to last minute business travel. Like other express hotel this hotel has no frills but fulfills your basic needs. This Hotel is close to Stratford station and Westfield shopping center which is 15 minutes walk. My only disappointment was with the breakfast which had same fixed menu on all days which made mornings very monotonous. I guess they can do so more options with b/f menu. Right for those looking for economical accommodation, there is not much for families and children to do.

Stayed here for one night in July. Staff extremely friendly. Hotel clean and rooms are ok. Not overly spacious but good. Location is ok - only a 10 minute walk from Westfield. 'Free' breakfast is ok - don't expect anything amazing but can't complain. Would stay again.

Before considering this hotel, just know - you are a 5-10 minute walk from a tube station, and you are about a 20 minute tube ride from central London. We had no problem with the location, as it was a lot cheaper than staying in the heart of London. This hotel is quite a good value - however, it is not like the HI Expresses of the US. The internet is a surcharge, and the rooms are unbelievably small. However, they are very clean and modern. Also - they only provide a dual-acting shampoo/body wash in the showers, so if you want better toiletries, I suggest you bring your own. Breakfast was great, with a lot of selection. Overall great hotel for a good value.

column9: Close to the bus and tube stations
column10: W enjoyed the proximity to the public transportation. We stayed here two separate times on our trip. The first time was perfect the second time the shower didn't drain well and the cooling system didn't work too well but it was a heat wave during our second visit.  They have a nice free breakfast along with free wifi.  We had to change rooms due to the shower problem and thought we left our converter in the room. We asked when we checked out and they didn't find that we had left it but they gave us one of theirs!  Now that's good customer service.

Stayed at this Hotel on 1 June 2013.  I booked it as I was going to the O2 for the Barbra Streisand concert.  The location was ideal.  A member of staff booked a taxi to go to the O2 which took about 15-20mins during fairly heavy traffic. The rooms were clean and adequate for a short stopover.  Freeview tv, very comfortable beds, bathroom fairly small but a good shower and soft towels.  Breakfast was included in the price.  Cold meats, cheese, cereals, pastries etc.  Scrambled eggs, sausages and baked beans were available.  All self-service but good.  Staff were excellent and very helpful.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. The hotel is next door to the Olympic Village, which will be open to the public at the end of July 2013. The rooms are nice and clean and have air-condition. The staff is most helpful and nice. We enjoyed the free buffet breakfast. As for the wifi connection ‚Äì because I am a priority club member we had connection to the internet free of charge. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Stratford tube station (central, Jubilee and DLR lines), Stratford International railway station and the Westfield Shopping Centre, were you can find almost everything including several buffet restaurants serving all kinds of food. Next to the hotel there are bus stations to the city. Be ready to spend about 30-45 minutes on the bus, but the road and the sights are interesting. Of course if one takes the tube it is faster, but keep in mind to skip the tube at rush hours.

column9: Nice new hotel, 20min walk Stratford station
column10: Nice hotel, perfectly designed.Good: large shower, iron room, nice restaurant, large room, air conditioning Bad: bed not strongest, surrounding area not the nicest, no ice machine, reception also manage bar

column9: Excellent for the price, just what we needed!
column10: This stay was exactly what we expected. A nice clean, quiet hotel with a good solid breakfeast at a very good price. We've always been happy with Holiday Inn. We went for this hotel because hotels in the city centre were too expensive, and this hotel is only about 20min from the centre by metro. Easy! And it was easy to get from and to the airport  too!

On arrival we had a lovely greeting from the lovely receptionist Nana , she made us feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble . 5 stars to her !!  Our room was cleaned to a high standard and quiet. A 2 minute walk to the tube station and 1 stop to the O 2 , perfect. Breakfast included which again was to a good standard, did hear a few complaints from other guests but its not the Savoy !! . Overall well done to all the staff , will return if we have another concert at the O 2.

column9: Not your typical Holiday Inn Express
column10: As we approached the hotel the neighborhood seemed a bit rough but we found it was nothing to worry about. The hotel had a restaurant with a limited menu. The food was good and reasonably priced. We enjoyed a beer at the small bar and were pleased with prices and service.The room was clean, quiet and comfortable but more than expected. Wireless Internet access is provided and fairly reliable. We enjoyed the breakfast included in the rate and found the croissants especially good. We found the local shopping mall with a great selection of dining options just a short 10 minute walk away. Too bad we foulnd the mall at closing time. The Stratford train/bus staion was at the entrance to the mallOverall we enjoyed the experience and will return next time we are in the area.

I used the hotel to go to the festival although it is quite a walk away about 30 mins.  The hotel is comfortable and everything you would expect from this chain.  The area is a bit surprising (category:unpleasant) as you feel you are in the middle of nowhere but be assured it is fine. Train/tube/bus 10 mins away, massive Westfield shopping centre 10 mins so it is quite well located.

The hotel was ideal but priced higher than i would expect due to exhibitions being on. Room was comfortable, breakfast OK. I would stay here again if i was in this area as it is handy for getting around the east of London

Room are simple but ok.Service is also ok, except that was no water in the hotel during (+/- 4 hours) not possibel to take shower or brush the theeth.... Breakfast poor!!! For me is too expensive for what it's!!!

Despite location oursite centre of London, it's a good hotel for short stay city trip to London.6-7 mins walking distance from overground rail, easy access to centre.Pleasant facilities, cosy bar-restaurant area, kind staff at front office and bar. Vending machine with snacks close to entrance. Spacious coridors, good quality rooms; comfortable double bed, sofa bed, working desk, coffee/tea facilities, bathroom with toilet, shower and sink. Some traffic noise, mainly sirenes. Fair dishes on the menu, even 'local' supplied meat. Will return for next visit

Stayed here on the eve of the London marathon. Good breakfast that morning and a nice lounge  and bar area. I think we were lucky to get a car parking space so that's a bit of a lottery. 10 minute walk to Stratford and of course Westfield and the Olympic stadium. 5 minute walk to closest DLR station.

It's not as luxurious as its namesake (Holiday Inn) up the road at Westfield - but its got comfortable rooms, a decent lounge/bar area - and although the breakfast is fairly basic, its good value for money.A 3 minute walk to the DLR - and then an easy 10 mins to Excel makes it an ideal spot for that area.

column9: Everything you expect, nothing short of excellent
column10: With a big chain of hotels you sort of have a vague idea of what to expect anyway, and this particular example was no exception. The staff were very friendly, the room was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was much more wholesome than I expected, plenty of choice and well stocked considering the number of people that were there. The location isn't perfect in terms of transport if you have got a lot of stuff with you, it's a five minute walk from Stratford High Street station, which is a long way with a heavy bag but in London you're never far away from everything. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Make sure you book as early as possible to get a decent price, as being in London in summertime is a challenge pricewise. This hotel is well situated, not very far from the Olympic Village, Westfields Shopping Centre, and the O2.Good connections from Stratford, DLR, BR, and the Underground. All is clean and bright, friendly staff, decent breakfast, although it does get quite busy in the morning. The room is fine, but we did have to be moved due to a power failure in the room. Its a bit noisy with all the comings and goings, but a pair of earplugs should suffice. So why go to the City and West End and pay twice as much, this feller will do the bizzo.

Clean rooms, efficient service and helpful staff. 5 minute walk to Westfield shopping centre, Olympic park, tube, rail and bus stations. Excellent transport links and considerably cheaper than staying in central London. Have stayed twice and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Other than not having our booking when we arrived, our two night stay was excellent. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming, they handled the booking problem very efficiently, the breakfast staff especially the lady that welcomed us were excellent and the choice of food was good. The room was very clean and well decorated and the hotel is in an ideal location for the tube and train services, I have walking problems and a 2 minute walk to the tube was brilliant for me. A definite hotel we would use again, hopefully next time we will get to see more of the Olympic village as it is closed off at the moment.

This hotel was very clean and nicely decorated.  Upon check-in the hotel staff were friendly and even called a cab for us.  Breakfast the next morning had a good selection of items.  There is a tea/coffee service in the room.  The location wasn't as close as I imagined.  It is about a 15 minute walk from Underground/Tube station and 10 min cab ride to O2.

I stayed at holiday inn express London Stratford whilst attending a course nearby. At the end of a tiring day's work it was nice to receive such a warm welcome from Reception staff at the hotel. My room was well appointed and extremely clean and comfortable. I was even given a choice of pillow type in my room to ensure a good night's sleep. There is a good selection of evening meals available & my order was served quickly by a very pleasant member of the team. The hotel is located next to the Olympic park, close to the new Westfield shopping centre and only a few minutes by train to central London. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

The staff here are lovely and always willing to help. Nice hotel perfect for cheaper option on a London Break. Good access to public transport and the amenities of Startford. Breakfast was excellent. Good for families and couples on cheap break.

The hotel was chosen as part of a superbreak deal and we were quite plesantly surprised, on arrival in stratford we were unsure what to expected due to the extensive works for the regeneration of the olympic park. The hotel its self is of a high quality and the staff are hard working, polite & friendly.The breakfast is of a high standard continental style with plenty of choice available. Rooms are basic with no wardrobes but there is plenty of storage space for clothes and cases. Well spaced bathroom and shower allowed the 2 of us to get ready at the same time in the morning. Even although the hotel is on the main street there is no distrubance from traffic or the construction works that are going on around. all in all well worth the moneay an a hotel we would use again

The Hotel Staff: These people worked very hard to accommodate us, and always had a smile to offer, a helping hand where needed. A huge thank you to everyone who made us feel so welcome in London.On booking this Hotel we already knew it wasn't a 4 star with greatviews, rooms and facilities, and were fully aware that others travelingto our congress were at much more plush Hotels in the London area. Wehad read up on various sites about the Holiday Inn Express in Stratford, some had painted a rather rough picture for anyone wanting to stay there, so we were prepared for any eventualities.On entering the Hotel, alarge front desk greeted us, and everyone was exceedingly friendly.Something we were again not prepared for. The Weather was shocking, highwinds, rain, and it was desperately cold too, we were too. A wheel hadbroken on one of our suitcases, and this had to be dragged almost to thefront door, so it was with delight we were greeted by such friendlypeople. Without any fuss, our room keys were issued, we got two. ManyHotels are starting a regime of onlyhanding out one key, which we find totally unacceptable, and realizethis is to cut down on electricity costs, again another plus for this hotel.Our Room:The elevator taken, we arrived at our room, opened the door and waited....It wasn't plush, it was a good size however. We had asked for a roomwith a view of the Olympic stadium, what we got however was a wall. ***** We had no firdgeThat didn't really bother us, we were looking to stop traffic noise at nightwhich we had heard about from reading other reviews. The Traffic noise,such as it is, isn't that bad at all. Yes it is on a main thoroughfarethrough Stratford, but it wasn't that bad, even in the rain.Our room showed signs of wear almost everywhere, but the bed was clean, andthoroughly comfortable when sleeping, again another plus. The one thingwe would add here is that the room was very cold. We were never surethat the Thermometer actually worked having asked about it. We'd triedadjusting it several times, to no avail. A window seal was not tight and wind came in, even ifslightly, but that made a difference without any real heating, on such ablustery and very cold and rainy stay.The Bathroom:The above said, it wasn't by any means a bad room for the money paid, agood bang for your buck frankly, but the bathroom was a differentmatter.There was no toilet brush, no bar of soap, no hand towels, no hair hat for the shower, only an all-purpose liquid. The only asset the Bathroomsported was 4 towels and two hand cleansers, one of which was broken, the piece lying by the sink.The sink leaked a little, and it was frankly cold in there too. Thankfully the air flow for reducingcondensation wasn't working, we feel that this would have made it evencolder. Overall on the Bathroom except for the very hot water which was ablessing in disguise, we weren't very impressed.Rooms are made up in the afternoon, which we found strange. We thought they mayhave forgotten us, but that all became clear when we were in the roomlater and a gentle knock at the door signaled the cleaning lady.Breakfast:We had read there was NO bacon, but that wasn't any real issue. Sausages /Beans / Scrambled Egg were the order of the day, plus two breadtoasters and the usual fruits and cereals on display. I found itparticularly odd that there were no tomatoes or ham on the menu. Noteveryone wants sausages and beans. Certainly my better half didn't eatowing to this because of dietary issues, everything contained fat orsugar, except some yogurt.....Coffee was great however.....On the last day, a Sunday, we came down as usual for our breakfast, andthere was nothing there. (Picture included). This was from 6.30 to 7.00 am on that Sunday. We had agrinding day of travel ahead of us, a broken suitcase, and many milesto travel in subways, with no real breakfast.... I made do with 4 slicesof toast, my better half had just coffee and yogurt. It wasn't the best start.Overall:Would we stay there again? Absolutely. It wouldn't take much to repair someviews we had of the Holiday Inn Express of Stratford, if we needed theEXCEL conference center again.Travel times were drastically reduced,owing to the location, it was easy and super quick to get there and backvia the DLR which is basically across the road about 1000 feet. Themain Stratford station is about 10 minutes walk, people are exceedinglyfriendly everywhere, if you need anything, ask anyone, just abouteveryone will help, at least that is what we found. The General location:***** NOTE: When going to the Holiday Inn Express in Stratford, make sure thatyou go to 'Stratford High Street' Station, this will save you a small hikefrom Stratford Central...Clean streets spawn a multicultural populous with no distinctions that wesaw. A great and formidably low priced Shopping center towards Stratfordstation, and a huge Shopping complex just above it. You could if youwanted purchase, just about anything while there.Cockneys on the Trains, both drivers and guards made any journey a fun one, even if delayed at times. 2, 8 foottall policemen who pointed out a pub to us made one day in Londontotally unforgettable, they must breed these people somewhere! A must:Covent Garden... We saw a wonderful opera singer there at the 'Crusting Pipe'.a coffee/food house located inside, well worth a visit if you havemusical tastes. We missed out on Don Carlos at the Royal Opera House,but were very happy to read a nonplussed review of it while waiting forour last plane that day. So we didn't miss anything from what we saw. Wealso didn't miss the 193 steps to get to Covent Garden via the subway,we took the lift!Except for the torrid weather - Unforgettable.

Booked on line , was great value and included breakfast.  About 7 mins walk to Stratford train/tube station & Westfield shopping centre.  As we were on a budget flying Ryanair to stansted,  we tried the bus which was so easy and only ‚Ç¨11.00 return. The bus stopped outside Stratford train station and as we passed the hotel before we reached stratford station we knew which direction to walk when we got off. On arrival at the hotel. We checked in with ease. The reception staff were great very helpful and willing to offer advice and information. As there were two of us, we booked a twin room . The room was fine a little on the small side but fine. Crisp, clean white sheets the only thing missing was the number of towels could have done with another bath towel.  The next morning this was rectified as I meet a nice girl from housekeeping who obligied me with the additional towel. Location,  is great a bus or tube ride from the city centre and minutes from Westfield shopping centre. Would highly recommend and will definitely stay again.

column9: Friendly staff, good prices and small beds
column10: This hotel has a wonderfull staff, good locaion 5 minutes away from the underground and children younger than 18 years old are for free in the parents room. Priority club members have wifi for free and reasonale buffet breakfast is included in the price. Beds are too small for two persons and we are not that big or fat. There is also a nice shopping mall close to the station.

column9: If you're looking for a nice hotel in an area without the buzz of London City Centre, choose this!
column10: My partner and I stayed here for 5 days and had an amazing stay. We loved the fact that the Westfield Shopping Mall was right outside the hotel. This shopping mall really has everything you need: supermarkets, shops, restaurants, food courts, cinema, bowling alley, etc. At times you just want to stay close to the hotel to grab a bite and there were plenty of choices right outside our door. Yes, you have to travel a bit to reach London's city centre, but it really wasn't a problem for us. Stratford station is a 3 minute stroll from the hotel and it takes about 20 minutes to get to the Houses of Parliament (Westminster station), so not bad at all.The hotel itself is really good. We got upgraded to an executive room which was really spacious. The room is clean and comfortable. We really appreciated the 2 bottles of complimentary water and the chocolate bar that you receive every day. Also, the fridge is empty, so you can get some groceries and stock them up in your fridge.If I'd ever go back to London I would definitely go back here and I would recommend my dear ones to do so too.

I was travelling with friends and we had a great stay. The room was very clean and spacious and the bathroom was fantastic.  We stayed whilst visiting the O2 as well as sightseeing and found the location great. For all we were slightly out of the City centre the transport links are great and we paid approx ¬£30 for a taxi from the O2 which was much better than fighting the huge queues for the underground. The breakfast was lovley and staff were very helpful. Would highly recommend to all

I stayed in this hotel for more than one month on a business trip in April-May 2013. It is a very comfortable hotel and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone reading this review. Where to begin from, the staff at the reception desk and the house-keeping is very friendly and helpful, the check-in is quick and easy, the lobby and the corridors are neat, the lift is located nearby, the rooms are just the right size..not too big and not too tiny. In the room, apart from the regulars, there is a coffee/tea kettle with supplies, a huge study desk and chair, a full length wall mirror, hanging rod, hair dryer. The bathrooms are good. This may be of importance to a few choosy ones like me, that the bathroom is well lit, shower pressure is really good, and the bathing area has many shelves to keep stuff, but there is no wardrobe in the room. Breakfast spread is quite good. But the items remains the same everyday.Since this is HI "Express"..so, ofcourse, there is no room service, or fridge in the room or gym.The hotel is located at half min walk from bus stop, 1 min walk from Tesco and some restaurants, 8 mins walk from Stratford Bus Station and Stratford Underground Station. Westfield Stratford City mall is just 10 mins walk from here.Overall, I have had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. Totally recommended for families or solo travelers,

We stayed for several nights in April 2013 and are glad we did. Got a great rate by booking online a few months in advance. The rooms are a bit small with the sofa bed for our 11 year old daughter, but that is a minor issue as the room was great value and kids stay free. Breakfast was good, and it's only a 10 minute walk from Westfield Stratford/Stratford tube station (there's also a bus stop about 50m up the road and plenty of buses to Stratford as well). Only 15-20 minutes into London central areas by tube. Would happily reurn.

Hi , I had a lovely stay for 2 nights at the Holiday Inn , I stayed for a business trip, The staff were very friendly and courteous , I had 2 evening meals which were excellent , I recommend the Angus Beef Burger meal ( This was the best Burger I have ever eaten ) 10/10. Good value for money. The rooms are spotless , very clean , plenty of space , comfortable beds , I stayed in room 113 which is at the back of the hotel , it was very quiet , a good nights rest is assured. This hotel is very convenient for day trips into London and business trips , I will certainly come back to this hotel many times. Thank you, to all the staff you are a credit to the company.

column9: A decent holiday inn, good service, location not bad
column10: We stayed for 2 nights for London Marathon 2013. Our note on Expedia that we needed a baby cot got lost instead the hotel was told sofa bed was needed. Staff were happy to sort though & move us to a room with a bit more space for it too! As the official hotel chain of the marathon they were very accomadting with a carbohydrate rich buffet for ¬£14.95 each, early opened buffet with runner friendly food plus we were able to pull the car into car park to unload all the kit. This was very useful as we actually left car at the 15-minute walk away Westfield centre (¬£5 per 24hours instead of the hotels ¬£20 per night!) and wouldn't have fancied dragging the suitcases down the hill! Location isn't bad, good for Olympic park & 15-20 mins away from Stratford centre/ Westfield/ train station. There's also a tesco express very close for any bits needed for a trip into the city! Staff were accomdating for our 1 year old in the restaurant & breakfast buffet was decent for our variety of tastes & needs. Beds soft with good pillow choice, nice smart room, stylish bathroom with big nice shower. Would recommend if in area, but not especially cheap & other than Westfield, Olympic park & tube into London there's not much else & its all a small walk.

Stayed here for two nights.Location is OK-ish - a 10-15 minute walk from Stratford Westfield.Rooms OK - if a bit sterile - but mine wasn't cleaned until 3.45pm on Day 1.Reception staff friendly, but there weren't enough of them, during busy periods.In my experience, Premier Inn Stratford is cheaper, better located and has better service.

We had a pleasant one night stay here.  The reception were helpful and printed out directions to a nearby attraction.  The location was convenient for bus stops - we used our bus passes.  The bedroom was fine and the shower very good.  The bed was comfortable but seemed small - usually king or queen sized beds are the norm.  The breakfast was adequate but wasn't the full english- just beans, sausages and scrambled egg.  The orange juice seemed diluted.  Bacon, tomatoes,mushrooms would have been great!  But for the price in London we have no complaints.

Stayed here whilst on business. Staff were excellent and could not have been more helpful. Room and bathroom were spotless and very comfortable. Evening meal meny choice was not very wide but ok and food was good. Close to train station but in spite of that my room was quiet.

Booked a night here as my daughter and i were going to the O2. Staff were excellent, reception kindly let us check in early which we really appreciated after our journey. Room was spotless and looked out to the Olympic stadium which was nice, Westfield shopping centre was 10 minute walk. Easy to get to O2. Only slight criticism would be lack of hot choices for breakfast, bacon would have been nice!! Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend if going to O2 or Westfield.

I booked a family room as my granddaughter and daughter were going to O2 to see One Direction. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The room was very clean, fresh towels every day. Food was excellent and lots of it. The hotel was situated near the O2. The Westfield shopping centre was great plus plenty of transport to get around and see the sights.  A great stay would definitely stay there again.

Same poor breakfastExtra charging for wi-fiVery soft mattress. If stay more than one night need orthopetc!No wardrobeNo cottons budsNo daily change under-sheet (like rooms to let!!)Near to underground station

Having stayed at Golders Green where I lost, (was stolen), personal property not keen when PA advised I was back at another Holiday Inn.Stayed for 5 nights. Pleasant staff. Russian ones difficult to understand and be understood by. Once I had got my door key/TV/Blocked shower drain sorted had lost one day of , 'Time To Relax', as per corporate statement. Got used to the Flag post clip 'clanking' all day/night. Even less relaxing!!. Noisy heating and switching on and off throughout the night. Good shower - eventually. Good breakfast but cannot understand why there is NO Bacon on offer.Unfortunately, was booked out on my last night of stay. Did not find this out until 23:45hrs!!!!. Extremely frustrated to find only offer was another Holiday 2.1 miles away driving. Not, 'less than a mile, sir', where I had no alternative, but to pay for parking. The rate was much higher. Totally no extension of goodwill on rates. Even though I would be giving a sixth nights stay capital to Holiday Inn.Would I stay again - Not if I was paying. I will look to take my goodwill and money elsewhere.

I booked 2 rooms as I and a friend were escorting a group of teenagers to a convention at Expo in October.booked online no apparent problem but went to check address for one of the party to find were booked into a different holiday express in central London miles away from where needed to be. Emailed holiday inn shoes only response was if I wanted to cancel would need to contact the hotel directly.No apology.No explanation.Was also wrong advice as needed to cancel through their booking line which I did. To add insult to injury not only had they taken a deposit, which as I cancelled a week before I could of understood they may not have refunded, they charged me the full cost . I have contacted them by Email with no response.my advice is avoid the Holiday Inn Group

Spent one night here as we had got tickets to see a show, hence the hotel was booked and paid for by someone else.As i checked in i needed to pay 20 POUND for the parking onsite.I was informed that as i was paying for the parking with a different card than the one that paid for the room that the other card would be refunded and my card charged for the room.Now, i work in a top class hotel and have never heard anything like it. How hard is it to just charge me the 20 POUND for parking and leave the booking as it should be ( a present).I had to get the person who paid for the room on the phone to sort it out.The hotel itself was really good and the bed was very comfy. Breakfast was as expected.As a whole the hotel was good, just the person on the front desk being awkward.

1) Location is easy to reach2) Breakfast OK3) Short walk to the Westfield Centre4) Easy to go to Excel by DLR5) There is not enough hangers !!!! Nowhere to leave your jacket!!!!6) The mattresses were super soft impossible to sleep and rest, after the first night you will        have back pains!!!!!!7) No Sampoo, No cotton buds.8) You wil have to pay for WiFi  1,5 pounds per hour.

column9: I wish I stayed at home
column10: Well my husband and I came here as a little honeymoon break. We really both wish that we didnt bother and saved our money and stayed at home. The room was ok, we couldnt really hear the traffic outside but the noise from the other guests opening and shutting the doors was unreal. We could hear people talking as they were walking past our room.Also the room was quite clean but the window had been left open and was freezing when we went in. The beds were sooooo soft it felt like we went straight to base of the bed when we sat on it. The good point was that there was a choice of pillows.  The breakfast was very very poor. The hot choices was scrambled eggs, sausages and beans which would of been fine but the eggs didnt even taste like eggs we think that they might of been the powered type of eggs the sausages were of poor quality and the beans were dried up. The toaster seemed to take forever  to cook. On the brighter side they did bring out warm croissants which were nice and they had some muffins there to which wasnt to bad.

This Hotel does not have much to offer. The meals offered are very basic bar style and the rooms whilst of a good standard are nothing special.The car park is very small so if you need parking check it out before booking. On the upside it is only a short walk to the Westfield Centre and all the public transport you want.

the hotel location is easy to reach and the breakfast was good,they have nice food in the restaurant as well. rooms were clean and modern. they have an easy access to parking place,  just the water in the bathrooms was not warm enough.

column9: Disappointing better off at travel lodge
column10: Once we checked in we had to wait over ten minutes for the lift as he rooms were on the top floor. Even though we were on the top floor the noise from the traffic is annoying and you will not get a peaceful nights sleep. The breakfast is average with a toaster that took over 5 minutes to warm the bread and if you're expecting bacon Forget it!!! Sausage egg and beans until you explode but if you want bacon, hash browns , black pudding etc forget it.Overall disappointing stay but close to Stratford train station and bus station

Stayed here for 2 night on a weekend with family. This hotel is ideally located (10 mins walk) from the Westfield Shopping Centre and Stratford railway station and underground. We flew into Stansted and the National Express bus (¬£14 return and takes 50 mins) drops you off outside Westfield. The hotel itself is all you would expect from Holiday Inn - good clean rooms, a more than adequate breakfast with ample choice and extremely friendly and efficient staff. Excellent value for money and would most definitley use again on our next visit.

column9: Holiday inn and Holiday inn express in Stratford London are not the same
column10: Stayed for one night at the hotel w my children. When I booked i thought I booked the hotel inside the Westfield shopping center - This one is a 15 min walk from there and the train station. Staff very friendly and helpfull and we enjoyed our stay anyway. Rooms and breakfast basic, nice and clean.

Great location in the centre of Westfield Stratford. Clean, modern rooms and great views across Olympic Park.We added breakfast on arrival - to take advantage of offer. Good breakfast spread and choice.Tube into central London short walk away. Good option for weekend shopping trip to Westfield and central London.

This hotel is pretty new so you can expect a clean and attractive hotel at a reasonable cost.  I had food at the hotel as there wasn't much local.  The food wasn't bad - typical bar menu; curry, pizza, burger and a couple of other simple meals.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again, tube station was convenient and I had all I needed in the hotel.  Only problem for me was the wifi wasn't free, you had to pay and it wasn't cheap!

Stayed for a week with the family and experienced good service by the hotel staff.  Breakfast was good and they have got nice menu for Lunch and DInner as well.  Super convenient for linking to other locations in London through the Stratford station and Startford High Street DLR.  Westfield Mall and Stratford Centre in the vicinity are additional positive points.

column9: Basic hotel - ok for business stopover
column10: Stayed for one night on business.  Near stratford tube station and obviously aimed at the olympics park for location.  Hotel room was modern, albeit cold.  Staff were friendly and basic breakfast included.

Wife and I stayed there for weekend in London. Hotel clean and tidy. Very quiet inside despite busy main road outside. Parking is a bit of an issue, but then I suppose this is the London way ........!

Recently stayed at this hotel while attending an event at the Excel.  It's well placed for this as it's an easy run down the DLR to the Excel and isn't as expensive as some of the hotels in the immediate vicinity of the exhibition centre.  I enter London through Kings Cross station and it was a pretty straight forward tube journey from here to Stratford (one change if I recall correctly).The staff I dealt with were pleasant, the room was fine and the bathroom clean which are the main things I look for.  I didn't eat here but on arriving back at the hotel after they had stopped serving food they seemed happy to help other guests arrange takeaway meals.The only thing I mark the hotel down on is the breakfast, it's nice to see it included in the price (so many of these hotels charge extra for it) but it was horrid.  Scrambled eggs weren't nice, beans cold and sausages indifferent.  Still, I didn't visit for the food so was still fairly happy with my stay.

column9: It was oke, nothing more, nothing less.
column10: We stayed in this hotel during the holidays. There was little decoration going on, except a xmas tree hanging from the ceiling (yes hanging).The hotel seems to be clean, no stains visible, or dirty carpet. The staff did a little bit trouble for letting us ( my family with 2 children, total 10 persons ) sleep on the same floor. We had a handicap room, this is a big room to stay in, but i would prefer to stay in a 'normal' room because we did not had a normal shower, not a cabine or something, but the whole badroom was the shower. Not so enjoyable to stay in. And also, the room had a verry bad smell, there was clearly something wrong with the drains, did not understand that the maids didnt smell it.The room had all the basics, tv, koffie and thee.The breakfast was not bad, simpel and basic, little bit tired of it after 4 days. The fruit on the other hand was not oke.Would not immediately go back, but if you have no choice, it woudnt be the worst.

column9: A clean, modern hotel within easy reach of Stratford
column10: The Holiday Inn Express, Stratford was built in time for the London 2012 Olympics, so still has a clean, tidy appearance. My friend, visiting from the USA, and I booked a twin bed room and were lucky enough to be placed on the 5th floor at the back, looking onto the Olympic Stadium. TIP: On check in try and ask for a 'rear room' as these look onto the park (slightly obscured by a building) and then cuts down on the traffic noise from Stratford High Street.The breakfast was a typical continental/full English buffet, included in the price. However on the Sunday morning the staff were a bit lapse in ensuring there was enough cutlery and one of the two toasters didn't work.Otherwise, a very nice hotel. Only picked it as it was cheap but I'm glad I did!

Stayed here for two nights (November) based on a work activity hence the location (Stratford).The hotel is a five minute walk from the underground / overground station so ideally placed.Fortunate to be given a room on the new refurbed wing.  Modern, clean and tidy, the decor was good and the double shower was superb!  The only downside of the room was the mattress... or lack of it ;-)  Noise on the second night from the corridor etc was a little annoying but this is no fault of the hotel just the inconsiderate people who were also staying at here.Breakfast was ok, continental options plus sausage, scambles egg and beans.  I ate both nights in the hotel and was very pleased with the quality of the food, the service and price.  Service from all staff was excellent.If I work in this area again then I will stay here without doubt.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights alongwith my family. Very conveniently placed and the rooms were clean and service was excellent. Only breakfast could have been better if more options were included. Overall a wonderful place to stay in. I will definitely stay with my family again.

Stayed at the holiday inn for 3 nights and couldn't fault it. Its only a short walk to Westfield Stratford shopping centre and the tube stop is also at Westfield. Only 15 mins into central London by tube. Room was clean and comfortable with tea and coffee provided. The bathroom looked new and the shower was nice and powerful. Breakfast was fine too. I would definitely stay here again

column9: Great value for money, friendly staff
column10: Great location, really friendly staff especially Eta on reception, who changed rooms so 2 could be adjacent. Breakfast great surprise all for 70 pounds. Better than travel lodge! Clean and modern throughout.

A good HI Express. Great location with good access to most places. Staff very polite and helpful. Bed was much softer than one would expect, wouldn't want to spend too many nights in that! Parking is available, but very expensive. Breakfast on a Sunday morning was not a pleasant experience, with coffee machines spewing out something more rem. of soap water.

What a delightful hotel. Easy walking from Stratford along the main high street. Good lighting all the way. Staff friendly on arrival and  check in easy. Rooms at the back are quieter, but unless you really need a twin room have a double. Single beds are very narrow and springy. Rooms nicely furnished. Brilliant TV - first hotel with digital news. Bathroom good with generous sized shower. Meals in restaurant are ok - nowt to write home about but the staff do care and the price is right. Bit repetitive if you were there for more than a couple of nights.   On the plus side it's convenient and well presented. Breakfast standard buffet -coffee and orange juice good start to the day. Check out easy so overall ten out of ten for a budget hotel.

column9: Nice hotel, shame about the bed
column10: The HI Express at Stratford is a great location, only a few minutes walk from the DLR and Jubilee Underground, with great access to Central London.  The hotel itself has been spruced up for the Olympics and is very smart with very helpful staff.  The area is a bit of a desert in terms of restaurants and facilities - the HI Express provides an excellent complimentary breakfast.  The rooms are very well organised and smart with a great bathroom with modern fixtures.My only average rating reflects the most important element of a stay, the bed.  We stayed two nights, and I'm very glad it was only for two and no more.  We discovered during our first night, that the bed was ridiculously soft and bouncy.  This meant that my partner and I both suffered badly from aching backs, and also that the slightest movement by either of us could result in the other person being catapulted on to the floor.  Talking of floors, the boxspring and/or mattress were so bad that we ended up moving the mattress and sleeping on the floor.Following calls to the front desk, we discovered that the hotel didn't have any form of board for the bed, and that apparently this 'newer' mattress was the standard for the IHG chain.  Now I'm no real expert but I don't recall waking up and feeling like Herman Munster after sleeping in any North American establishment within the IHG group. After much pleading the following morning, we toured the hotel trying to find a better mattress for the second night, and ended up in another room with something slightly more acceptable. I have to say the staff couldn't have been more helpful.This is an enormous shame as I really liked this hotel and the great staff who work there.  I wouldn't stay here again because of the likelihood of having to endure a night on a rack.

Been in worse Holiday Inn Express as location was surprisingly near tube and DLR connections!! 5 minute walk was a 5 minute walk. Reception team very friendly and efficient. Room comfortable but could be cold . Good sleep and very quiet . Breakfast fine , excellent coffee. Good base for attending Excel.

column9: Nice clean new hotel in the redeveloped East End of London
column10: Nice typical Holiday Inn Express - you know what to expect if you have stayed in any other HI Express worldwide. This is one of the newer ones - larger shower, now double size (still no bath), new higher spec black tiles with the new squeezy combined shower gel/shampoo so no need to take your own if you're not fussy!Breakfast is very nice (and included in the room price unlike many other London hotels) and now includes hot food such as bacon, scrambled eggs and baked beans as well as fruit and cereals. Two self service hot drinks machines and plenty of seats/tables available. The fruit juice didn't taste watered down either - bonus!Main gripe - the bed! As other reviewers have mentioned it is very low and the mattress is waaaay too soft - come on Intercontinental you can do better than this! Also I could not tell the difference between the 'firm' and the 'soft' pillow either!Plus points - its about a 6/7 minute walk from Stratford tube station. You can get to central London (Holborn station) from Stratford tube station in 15 minutes. Stratford is not as far from the centre of London as it looks on the tube map. Top Tip - when arriving at Stratford tube station to get to the Hotel follow the exit signs for Stratford town centre NOT the Westfield Mall (unless you want to go straight to the Mall of course! PS its an amazing Mall if you like that kind of thing). There is another Holiday Inn (Staybridge Suites) right in the Mall so don't confuse this hotel with that one!Turn right at the bus station as you exit the tube station to get to the hotel. There is currently some construction taking place here (Nov 2012) so just follow the diversion signs to the right. Its actually a short cut back to the main road!There is a handy off license (Spookily named Annunaki!) across the road from the Hotel which is open until Midnight (you cannot purchase alcohol from there after 11pm) for any essentials you might need.

good position (5/10 minutes on foot to the underground station, 20 minutes by underground to arrive in London downtown).Very clean, very good breakfast.Room space sufficient for a short holiday.Helpful and kind staff.A terrible bed, mattress too soft!

Stayed here back in April and have to say it was a lovely hotel. Nicely situated, very close to the Olympic stadium, at which time they were still building it so we got to see all that. Close to Westfield shopping centre too. Room was quite small, double bed and a double sofa bed squeezed in so for 3 of us it was a very tight squeeze to get about. Luckily we didn't spend too much time in the room! Breakfast was a slight downfall, had to wait to use the toaster for about 15mins, of which time we had all finished our breakfast! Bathroom stunning, small but adequate. Bath would of been nice but no room. Had interactive wall in reception which was a great help with planning our days out!

I am no fan of escalators so I try and avoid the tube if I can so I booked the extra trip from Victoria coach station straight to Stratford which added a couple of pounds on to my trip from Dorset. It also gave me a lovely drive right through the city at night and drops you just off of Stratford High St, at the station.
