Or about 1hr by bus Route 25 to Oxford Circut, depend on the traffic. It is a bit far from the centre of happenings. Other than that, really good value for money.

Liked:+ Location. But cannot fathom why the hotel doesn't advertise that the NEW High Street DLR station is now working...about 100m away, which is a sight closer than Stratford or Pudding Mill Lane Stations. It also has trains straight into London City Airport. And no, Stratford Station is certainly not a 5min walk from the hotel (as stated in one of their web-reservation sites), especially with all the roadworks going on. If you have no bag, you may get the walk done in 15minutes.+ 'Complementary' breakfast with the exception of the pseudo-scrambled egg. Great Coffee, freshly ground!+ Their limited Dinner menu, with a decent quality/cost.+ Friendly Reception staff, who actually spoke English.+ Cleanliness: dining room, reception, public areas and bedroom (more on this later)Didn't like:- Bad mattress...no support- Noise from the road. It will go on all the time...I was on the 3rd floor.- Fluctuating water temperature in shower, at ALL times of the day and night - from cold to the limit you set on the thermostat.- Dodgy quality TV reception (satellite), worsening with rain.- Housekeeping service - had to chase them around in the afternoons, sometimes after lunch to get the room done as their priority are the checkouts.- This has nothing to do with the hotel but as interested partners in hosting the world next year, perhaps they can pass the word out:   No decent pubs serving proper pub grub around, all the way into the centre of Stratford. They are all so run down...hope their respective owners pull their fingers out of their arses in time for the Olympics...I am not a Londoner (or Brit for that matter), but seriously think that London deserves better calling cards than this. That said, you can purchase a mean curry and rice if you know where, or try asking a cab driver...they'll usually know the best spots for grub are.

Invited to an Olympic test run 'London Prepares'.  This hotel within walking distance of Stratford Station and the shuttle bus terminus for the Olympic park. Hotel parking ¬£20/24hours but very limited. Rooms very new and comfortable with all all ammenties, internet reasonable priced ¬£1.50/1/2 hour. Breakfast typical of a HHE, basic but wholesome. Did not eat in the evening - but evening meals available. Bar very basic but OK. Service very good staff very friendly and helpful. Room rate was reasonable but check for 2012/Olympic period rack rate >¬£275!

column9: Decent Accommodations in the London Stratford Area
column10: We recently stayed at this Holiday Inn at the tail end of a month long vacation in Europe.  Primary reason for selecting this hotel was price.  While living up to the Holiday Inn Express promise of a clean and reasonably featured hotel, it was a bit out of the way.  With the underground station a 10 minute walk away, this wasn't a huge deal but there wasn't much locally to do.  There is a cool looking local pub called the Builders Arms was just up the street, unfortunately for some reason it was closed the weekend we were there so cannot comment, but there is a pub worth visiting called the Edward VII...great food!  Anyway the hotel was good, main issue was one of the lifts was broken and stayed that way for our entire 3 days stay.  Obvious result was delays in the lobby. We took the stairs when we were impatient, but for those with bags, kids etc it was a pain.  Seemed odd that an technician couldn't be arranged...maybe because it was a long weekend? Included breakfast was standard fare.  Dinner is available for an extra charge, menu looked Ok but we didn't eat there, instead went to the Edward VII.

Having stayed in this hotel once before i expected the sae kind of service. I was wrong.My mother in law boked the htel room for us. She booked a double room with a cot for our 11 month old daughter. When we arrived we were told that there had been a mistake and that we were booked in a twin room with no cot. We were told the cot would not fit in the room. So after waiting in the reception area for 30 minutes we were shown a double room which was a smoking room. This was dismissed straight away as it had a horrible smell of stale smoke. So finally after an hour of waiting we were given the twin room that they had origanally booked us in which the cot did fit it. On the thursday afternon we arrived back to the hotel to find that no room service had been. No clean towles,bins not emptied,no tea or coffee ect. So called reception and asked for some new ones. We rang twice in half an hour and in the end my husband had to go down and get it.Then to top it all of the fire alarm sounded at 10pm Thursday night. Unsure of what was happening i called reception 3 times for the phone to go unansweres. i left the room and went to see what was going on.I went from the 5th floor to the ground only for the doors to be locked. I then had to run back up the 5 flights of stairs to tell my husband that we should leave the hotel. Wrapping my daughter in a blanket we left the hotel to find guests and staff all stood outside. We were out there for about 40 minutes. It was freezing and not one memeber of staff came to see if we were ok ( more my daughter than us) No one told us what was going on . Thankfully the police let us sit in there car. When it was safe to go back in there wasnt any staff around to appolagies. I would not stay at this hotel again.

column9: very nice room, beautiful hotel, breakfast overwhelmingly busy
column10: The first and only thing I would love to see changed in this hotel is the logistics around breakfast. On a busy sunday morning the staff comes into action as soon as something is completely gone from the buffet, but because it is so busy that means that immediately there is a huge queueThe room is great, the bed was fantastic, the carpark was 10 pounds a day and they charged me 10 pounds extra because I wanted to leave my car for some hours. That was not very friendly. But anyway, even then it was not very expensive to stay here.

If i was paying full price i would have complained, but i didn't want to ruin my holiday.  I have stayed a many Holiday Inn's and i am part of their Priority Club Program,  i am a GOLD Member.The room was a great size and was very much to the standard of a Holiday Inn Express however the staff and the breakfast cleanliness was not. As a gold member you can normally check in to a hotel anytime after 12noon provided they have a room ready. When i arrived i was not greeted as a PCR member and was told i was to pay 10 pound per hour early check in. This was soon corrected and a room found for me. At Breakfast the drinking glasses were all very dirty. ( they had dry pulp on the inside.... you could feel the pulp when you ran your finger on the inside of the cup). This was not a problem for me until i asked the breakfast staff for a clean glass. Only to be informed that they were all clean and washed in hot water, when i showed the staff member the pulp inside she replied with "there is nothing we can do about the pulp and they have been washed in hot water". (I know how the glass washes work and every glass is supposed to be polished after they come out). The girl on breakfast then told me i could drink from a coffee cup and that she has never gotten sick from drinking out of the glasses. (what happened to customer service?Breakfast was ok the eggs were horrible. There was also a very random vibrating sound every 10 mins coming from somewhere in the room. I couldn't be bothered pointing it out as i knew the staff would reply less than satisfactory. Lucky im a heavy sleeper. After that i shortened my stay and went elsewhere. The hotel itself was comfortable and compliments to the dinner chef when i stayed, i had a very enjoyable lamb shank.

I've actually stayed at this hotel on many occasions including a couple of years ago and more recently, back in October last year through to April this year for four nights at a time during the week and I have seen the hotel go from what it was prior to the refurbishment to how it looked in April, which was pretty good considering the amount of refurbishment that has taken place.After reading through some of the reviews, they are mainly positive, which is good, as this hotel deserves to be credited.  The hotel is a ten minute walk away from Stratford Station and if you do stay during the winter period, then it can be quite a treacherous walk from the tube station to the hotel.  From my first stay, the staff were really friendly and accommodating.  In this regard, two members of staff stand out and these are Stella and Joel.  I have seen reception crowded and the staff being bombarded with requests for information and also guests wanting to check in and they dealt with everything admirably.I have never eaten at the hotel as due to my work I am either late arriving back at the hotel or I order a take away from the menus that are available from reception, which nobody seemed to mention in their reviews.  However I have seen some of the food being delivered to other guests and it doesn‚Äôt look that bad at all.  3 courses for just over ¬£15 seems quite reasonable to me.The facilities are what you expect from the HIX brand and I have stayed in many, with most of them being in London.  I just haven‚Äôt had time to review them all!  However, this one stands out as one of the best I have stayed in while working in London.  I get the train down from Leeds, so don‚Äôt use the car park.  If there are indeed only 10 spaces and the charge is ¬£20 per night, then this is quite exorbitant and as some other reviewers have pointed out, you wouldn‚Äôt really want to leave your car anywhere else but a secure place overnight.The internet charges are quite steep as well and I have seen these rise over the time I have stayed at the hotel.  I now use a dongle as it‚Äôs much easier, or failing that, your phone if it‚Äôs just browsing that you‚Äôre after.  There is a convenience store over the road which has the basics of what you might need (they have had enough money from me over the months!), but if you are after something more then there is always the shopping centre opposite the bus station where there is a Sainsbury‚Äôs and a Morrisons and a host of other shops.I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I am working on the East side of London as it‚Äôs ideal.  And if you do book in advance and can be fairly certain that your travel arrangements will not change, then you can pick up a room for about ¬£62.00 on an advance rate which I once did.  Bargain!

Not a very good location, a good walk from the nearest station (Stratford).Rooms are standard layout for this hotel group, however the walls are very thin, I could hear a telephone call being made in the next room including the replies!Ventialtion is poor, however the staff did provide a fan.At the time the hotel was being used by large parties - so very busy especially at breakfast.

We stayed here for 4 days as a start for a 5 week holiday taking in Europe. The Hotel is within 5-10 minutes walk of the Underground and provided us with a great opportunity to get some 'impromptu' exercise.   We did have nice weather though so I wonder whether this would be handy if it was freezing or raining!   The rooms were comfortable although they do not provide a mini fridge. This was initially a problem as I require weekly medication that MUST be refrigerated. Reception staff were brilliant - explained the medication issue which was then promptly stored in the bar fridge until we left.  Teh downstairs breakfast area/dining was fabulous and having a couple of kids with us made it easy to eat then get them to bed at a reasonable time. All the staff were great - very friendly and nothing was an issue. Managed to get checked in earlier than the usual check in time which was handy given we arrived at Heathrow at 6 am after flying from Australia. There weren't too many convenience stores around to purchase snacks for when relaxing in the room  but I gather this will change given it is the perfect location to stay for the upcoming Olympics.

This hotel is clean and perfectly comfortable.  It is NOT a five minutes walk to the station but it is a reasonable 10 minutes walk.  Be aware that the wireless internet connection is NOT included with the room.  It costs quite a bit and if you are staying for more than a couple of days, you would be money ahead to invest in a phone dongle that you can just connect to your usb port.  You can also use the free wireless at the Pizza restaurant across the street from the station (beside the cinema).Beware of booking a "standard" room, because you are likely to get a handicapped room which is slightly larger but has no shower curtain in the bathroom.  On the other hand, you can bathe sitting down, if that's your thing.The beds are soft, like American beds, rather than hard British-style beds.  The hotel is staffed by non-English speakers, but that is to be expected in London these days.  Breakfast is edible if you stick to the toast and cereal.  Despite the published menu, they do NOT serve bacon.  It's strictly congealed eggs and greasy bangers.  But you can make your own toast, or eat mediocre croissants with all the butter and jelly you like.  It is at the future Olympic site, so there is construction everywhere.  It happens 7 days a week.  But unless you are planning to sleep in late every day, it shouldn't bother you.  This is not a good hotel if you are driving your car as the parking is excessive.  (But no more excessive than any hotel within the Olympic Park area.)Overall, it was a very decent experience.  Not exciting, but perfectly adequate.  I recommend it for someone on a budget.

We booked the hotel to visit the Take That show, the hotel is located near a station so it was ok. The hotel is over-priced being that you can not get room-service, no lunch and no amenities in the room. We requested a safe but there was none. Internet is chargeable even at the lobby!!!!!!The staff we encountered were good and friendly.The problem we had was the room allocated was leaking in the bathroom and had a (smoky) smell it being in a non-smoking room,  i would especially like to thank Stella who resolved our problems quickly and the check-in experience was fantastic. We might return if the rates are lower, but all in all, thanks for a lovely stay. Thanks Stella.Symone & Jan

column9: Great value hotel, rip off parking fee.
column10: This hotel is ideal if visiting for an event at the O2 , as its about a ten minute walk to the station and  then less than ten minutes on the tube to the O2. Easy to drive to just off the A12 but its ¬£20 to park for the night! The hotel price is good and offsets the car park but ¬£20 in this area is outrageous. Room was clean and set up ok for a family of 4. Breakfast was poor but if you are there Saturday night/Sunday morning just have some toast and take a ten minute drive to Brick Lane for a great choice of foods from around the world. Others have said the hotel is badly located but it is actually ideal for getting around, obviosly not to mention what will be happening right there in August next year.

I stayed here with my family with two small children and a grandparent, along with extended family in a separate room.  The rooms were reasonably sized although by no means large, and were very sparsely furnished.  A basic tea / coffee set with hotpot is available, but the amenities don't stretch much beyond that.  The area is quite far from the main part of London, and the hotel itself is most obviously set up to take advantage of the upcoming Olympics.  Despite the distance from the main area of town, only a small carpark is available if you are driving.  Although we had a decent time there, I somehow expected more out of a Holiday Inn hotel.Verdict: reasonable but would recommend other choices first.

I have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The bed was quite okay but there was noise from aircon throughout the nights. It made me hardly to sleep. And the breakfast was so poor. Only scrabbled egg and sausage served in hot plate! I promise that I won't stay in this hotel while I visit London next time!

I recently stayed in the Holiday Inn Express at Stratford London.I just happen to have entered the room and switched the bathroom light that, the whole thing burst and glass pieces were sprayed on the floor. I was so scared that I went straight down and mentioned it downstairs to the receptionist at the time and asked if I could be moved to another room.He told me that there was no other room available at the time and that after his maintenance personnel checked the room, I could go back in safely. He came back in 10 minutes and told me that it was a simple electrical fault which happens all the time and that the electrical connections were all normal now. I was so taken aback by the relaxed attitude. I have never seen a light burst in front of me ever. And to mention that electrical faults such as these happen all the time, just did it for me. I went upstairs back to the room. I had to find a housekeeper myself to get the room cleaned again.Later that evening, I checked out. Also, I was so disappointed to find that there were no parking spaces available and had to park at the local Bingo car park.All in all, I was so disappointed with my stay and the callous attitude of the staff.I did not make a fuss at the time, as I am not that sort of a person but felt I should let someone know as this is a serious health and safety issue and also that staff should be a bit more caring.On a good note, the hotel was clean and the room well decorated.I can promise you that I sure will not be staying at this hotel again.

Anyone who frequently stays in a Holiday Inn Express will know what to expect from the rooms, this one is no different.  The hotel is modern and positioned beside a busy main road.  An issue with the aircon system meant there was a vibrating noise throughout the night. (as if next door had a mobile phone vibrating on the bedside table).  The hotel advertises a car park which is true it does have but what it doesn't say is that there only around 10 spaces.  It's a first come first served basis and if you don't get a space you are rather limited to options.  Personally I wouldn't like to leave my vehicle parked overnight in the area.As with many Holiday Inn Express hotels Stratford offers a small bar menu on an evening.  Overall the food was enjoyable and the service swift.No doubt the hotel will be extremely busy in coming months as it overlooks the Olympic Stadium.

We stayed at this hotel for one night over the Whitsun Bank Holiday Weekend.  It is quite a long ride by tube out of central London and a good 10-15mins hike from Stratford station when you have luggage and kids in tow, but the price is very competitive when compared with somewhere closer to central London.The hotel itself is very nice - all new, so very clean and welcoming.  Our family room was also clean and adequately equipped, with a choice of firm/soft pillows.  Reception staff were helpful and allowed us to leave our luggage there several hours before check-in.The breakfast was something else altogether.  The buffet area is cramped when busy.  Whilst waiting, supplies of trays, coffee cups and bread all ran out and took a long time to be replenished.  There was no bacon at all and they were serving sausages instead which also ran out.  I was told there would be more in 5 mins so I waited, then I was told they'd be another 5 mins.  Eventually they were brought to our table, but the sausages were so awful, my dogs would've turned their noses up at them.

We stayed here during the Easter Weekend on our 2 day visit to Alton Towers.  The hotel was very busy owing to the long weekend break.  The staff were amazing in accommodating us right thru the 2 days.  Breakfast time was a stampede, but the staff coped with it quite well.  We were a large group of 5 families with children and all of us felt well looked after and had nothing to complain about.  As an inprovement, I would suggest the staff get more support atleast during breakfast time in their busy days.

I have stayed in this hotel at the end of March this year with family and friends. First of all let me say that the hotel is very cozy and nice, the refurbishing is all done, so no construction noise and posted in previous reviews. Second, in my opinion it's location is great. The Stratford train/tube/bus station is just 8-10 minutes away, 5 minutes if you walk lively. There is a small shopping mall just opposite to the station, and at the end of the year a huge mall will open right besides the station, so that will be great. so like i said, easy and quick access to any part of london, mind you, there is also a bus station right in front of the hotel, but i would not recommend you take the bus from the central area to the hotel, because it will be a 1 hour journey at least, so take the tube instead, much faster. All in all, the hotel is perfect for a weekend get-away, or even a longer visit to london. one more thing, if you do decide to visit london and stay at this hotel, if you arrive in london via luton and you travel in a group of 4-5-6 people, i recommend you hire one of those private taxi's, instead of taking a bus to central london and then the tube to stratford. Besides the fact that you don't have to walk around dragging you luggage along, if you are a group of 5 people, it will cost you almost the same and bus+tube, so better choice all around (not applicable if only 2-3 persons).

column9: Decent Holiday Inn Express, Excellent Value for London
column10: I stayed here overnight with my daughter while visiting this side of London. If you know HI Express, then you know basically what to expect, but this is a better one overall. Our room was spotlessly clean and, despite the hotel being right on a major road, incredibly quiet. My only gripe about the room is the usual one about the low level of lighting even with all lights on! Beds were softer than some (way too hard!) ones we've had elsewhere which helped lead to a good night's sleep.The staff at reception were friendly and helpful, and the public dining/seating area was modern, comfortable and again very clean. Breakfast was one of the best I have had at HI Express over the years; all the usuals plus fruit options I haven't always seen and more conserves than standard (lemon marmalade!). The serving area wasn't huge but it was big enough to go round without too many problems even when busy.The immediate area round the hotel is not great (quite run down + lots of building going on with Olympics/regeneration) but it's easy to get into central London and cheaper than being more central. There's quite a big shopping centre next to the station with another being built at the moment!Overall, I would happily stay here again.

column9: Reasonable hotel and location, badly let down by breakfast
column10: Stayed in this hotel for a short weekend visit to London.  On the positive side, it is a short walk from the centre of Stratford and the transport interchange which allows bus, rail, underground or DLR travel.  It is around 20-25 mins to Westminster on the Jubilee Line.  The hotel itself is fairly new already but has just been refurbished.  The check-in was smooth but nothing special.  The room was fine, the sofa bed had been set up for our little one and the shower room has a neat feature whereby the door can shut on the toilet allowing the shower/basin to be used by someone else.  The main bed was quite soft, the sofa bed seemed more comfortable to me.  Our room was a little noisy as it overlooked the main road and several emergency vehicles seemed to pass during the night!However, all the positives were undone by the breakfast.  Holiday Inn Express are making a big deal about their breakfasts now having hot food.  Well, ours didn't, in fact I think we'd have grounds to report them to the ASA.  As we arrived just before 9am, the last of the sausages and bacon had been finished by other guests.  In the 15-20 minutes we were there, these were not replenished at all.  For a time there were no mugs for tea/coffee, there were no small spoons for drinks or yoghurts and the fruit juice was without doubt a mix of at least 80% juice 20% water - and that is being charitable.  In addition, tables were left strewn with dirty plates and cups - not clear if it was self-clearing or not!  We are staying in another HI Express next month, I hope this experience is not repeated!

Just had 2 nights b&b in this hotel. Suited us fine as a base to visit friends nearby and to have a day in city centre. Stay closer to city centre if you are on a purely sight seeing holiday as the surrounding area is under regeneration and not very interesting. Very clean hotel, provided all the essentials. Pleasant stay nothing fancy!

column9: Not the best place to stay for a good nights sleep
column10: The hotel is very average although good enough for somewhere to stay at a reasonable price. The rooms are clean and have a lovely shower area. We stayed at the hotel as it is only 3 stops on the tube to the O2 (as we were seeing Peter Kay) which only takes about 15 mins so it is good from that perpsective. However, my sleep was very deprived which ruined the next day as I was so tired. The beds were a little uncomfortable and the noise from the road was very loud form cars, buses etc.  to people walking past. You can literally hear peoples conversations word for word on the street below. Better sound proofing could go a long way. The breakfast is also not great.

column9: Average at best, but dissappointing breakfast and entrance
column10: We stayed in this hotel pre Christmas in December 2010. A trip including 2 nights in this hotel, which was reasonable priced for London standards.The hotel location is fair since the walking distance to Stratford station (Underground Julilee and Central line, DLR) and the Stratford shopping centre.During our stay a lot of construction works going on for the 2012 Olympics, but not nearby the hotel, it's closer to the station.The check-in was very good, since we got a room immediately (even before noon!). Maybe it helped since I am priority club member. The room was on the 4th floor and very spacious. The bed was just renewed (matress) I personally didn't find it comfortable for sleeping. Also the room to outside did not properly close, so the room had "fresh" air all the time. The bathroom was spacious also, showergel and shampoo is provided for, as well towels replaced every day.The only item to complain in the bathroom is the not so constant temperature of the warm water. During my showers, it was flucuating to "very hot" and "ice cold" and back to my desired temperature. It was frustrating, sometimes. Anyway we were in London for the town, not the hotel, so the rooms in this hotel are very well ok.I must ask your and the hotel's attention for the breakfast, through!It was located in a large room (size of 3 hotel rooms, walls removed) and very warm inside. Food was available in the hall, where some tables were positioned (see photo).Variaty of food was limited or out of stock, refills took too long.Another item which I didn't like was the WiFi internet which is charged for. Nowadays this should be very common. In several countries it's normal to find WiFi for free in bars and even 2* hotels. Why can't Holiday Inn (Express) not make such arrangements? Even if that needs to be charged for, raise your hotel room fare with GBP 0.50 per night to get out of the investment, instead of charging these high fares for just 30 minutes.I conclude that this hotel is convenient for shopping, quietly located in outer-London but easy to reach. Room spacious, breakfast not good. Pricing is average but for the service we got maybe a bit expensive. I think it's a hit or miss during your future stay and I would recommend you to consider other hotels.

We've (family with 2 kids in two rooms, one to the street, one to the back yard) visited London for the first time and used HIE by friends recommendation - well done, they didn't lied !!!!! Hotel is very nice, clean & proper, , staff is always friendly and very helpful for all purposes, rooms are spaciousness, breakfast with various choices, hot/cold, fresh fruits (!!!!) - absolutely o.k.; location near to Stratford station (abt. 5 min to walk) is marvellous, bus stop(s) directly near the hotel, small supermarket right across the street. Noise from the street bearable during nights and normal for such a big city, back yard rooms without any noise. During our stay some works go on in the hotel, due to re-fresh the internal look of the hotel tzo Olymics 2012, but the work stops in the evening and over the weekend, didn't disturb, honestly - and to be honest: who'll stay in London only in the hotel ??????? We'd choose HIE again at any time !

column9: Shockingly awful staff with no customer service skills at all, even after my colleague's room was robbed.
column10: I stayed in this hotel for work and it was absolutely awful. By far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in in this country. Firstly the hotel was a building site, apparently being revamped for the olympics - but God help anybody who stays there, the customer service is shocking.Whilst we were at work, my colleague's room was emptied of her stuff, even though she was still checked in for another night. When she asked reception what had happened to it they said the maid must've removed t by mistake and it would be in lost property. After checking, it became apparent that all that was there was a pair of jeans - absolutely everything she brought with her had been stolen, either from the room by the maid, or from lost property. They even took her toothbrush and underwear. Reception were not apologetic or helpful at all - they said they didn't know who had cleaned the room and we would have to wait until the next day at 9am when the maids came in for work. I said this was not acceptable and the reception manager got very agitated. I asked him to provide a toothbrush, toothpaste and other necessities for my colleague from a machine in the reception with petty cash as it was the least he could do and he was rude and said no initially, until we asked him several times when he at last gave in.We had a lot of children staying in the hotel with us that night, almost 200 and the hotel were unable to cater for them. Becuase of the building work (they didn't tell us about) there was dining available in a conference room on the third floor. The food was served from the kitchen on the ground, pushed through the building site on a trolley wth clingfilm on top and brought up in a lift. It was cold and there was not enough to go round - the chef was constantly running up and downstairs to make more and we had a queue of hungry kids all the way down the corridoor for over an hour.The food provided was unacceptable, we had paid ¬£10 a head for a healthy meal and drink for the children but were told firstly that a drink was not included (even though we had paid for it) and it took four of us to demand that the children were at least served some fruit squash with their meal.THe 'healthy meal' was some inedible mince, chips and vegetables which were stll frozen in the centre - we know because we checked. Or, for the vegetarians, dry pasta with a scoop your own sauce that looked and tasted like cheap tomato soup, served in a bowl on the table so it went cold quickly and was not replaced throughout the servce. It was absolutely disgusting.  Many of the kids went to bed hungry and some went out to buy pot noodles out of their own pocket. The previous night I was told that there was no vegetarian option and when I said to the reception manager "what happens if one of the children is vegetarian?" he replied simply "then they shall not eat this evening, we have nothing for them". I could go on forever about how bad this hotel was but the main thing is that I would never in a million years stay there again and my company has now struck it off our list of approved accommodation, so hopefully they will lose a lot of business as we are one of the biggest corporations in the UK.

Hi this hotel is an extraordinary good one, if consider how much you pay and how much you get. I had already stayed in this hotel chain in scotland, thus I knew it.It is quite near the "underground Stratford" station, with the Oyster card it is just 2.4 pounds, and considering you will pay this twice a day, you save much more money staying slightly more far away from the city centre.Rooms are BIG, breakfast is good, even with some hot food.I definitely reccomend it !Riccardo

Stayed here for 2 nights as my wife was working nearby I had nothing on so went with her. I was unable to work though as unlike other Hi expresses there was no free wi-fi in reception area for priority club members.The heating was broken I reported it in the morning and was not offered a room change or a heater, the reception girl just said well no one else has complained!  so had to stay in a freezing room all day. When my wife arrived back from work in the evening how ever she made a complaint to another member of staff and was offered a room change or a heater, we took the heater as having spoke to other guests we realised the heating was broken in all rooms. Breakfast was a joke, no vegetarian yoghurts. I wanted to warm a croissant on top of the toaster but the breakfast guard screamed at me saying it would cause a fire, I argued with her that it wouldn't as I do it all the time at home, but she said the cabinet they was in will warm them and I should come back later as it takes some time, I went back an hour later and they were still cold but now also had rock hard bottoms! So I opted for toast instead, this soon went ice cold too though as they had the air-con in dinning area set to low.Twice staff entered our room with out even knocking on the first day, on the 2nd day staff kept knocking very loudly even though i had the sleeping sign on the door, i was trying to catch up on the sleep I had missed on the first night from being too cold and had booked a late check out, but they still knocked several times so I still had no sleep.I was not asked how my stay was on check out so did not complain any more but I did fill out a questionnaire that was put under our room door, it had no where on it to put contact details, but i did add my email address so the manager could write to me with at least and apology but they haven't. i was gutted as this hotel was built for the 2012 Olympics I thought the standard would be high but it was far from it.

column9: A bit like the curate's egg!
column10: Close to tube station/central London via Central Line - good, new rooms - good, service -good. But very aware of the building work which means reception is a bit like the clerk of works office (but with wine bottles!), and breakfast in the meeting room is rather third world. Cleanliness throughout the hotel public rooms suffers from the building work, understandably in some respects, but this is not reflected in a discounted price. The surrounding area is a mixture of Newham grot and Olympic gloss!

column9: Amazing value only 20 mins from Oxford St
column10: About a 6 minute walk from Stratford station the hotel is undergoing refurb. I stayed in a refurbed room and was quiet, clean and spacious. Amazed how well connected it is. Free breakfast was adequate.

I am also a hotelier and stayed in this hotel because it is very close to excell london. But unfortunately it was not good experience as last season in another holiday inn canning town!..Very huge refurbishment took place and restaurant was closed, so we took our breakfast in meeting rooms and you may guess that it was not functioning as a proper restaurant such as ambiance etc. One of the lift was out of order and we have waited long and long times for car to arrive our floor, poor staff was waiting and suffering also a lot...Vending outomats , ice mashine were also out of order, after long complaining sessions on last day elevator and vending machine id fixed...And finnaly it was very bad holiday inn experience and since an old holiday inn staff it was totally un exceptable...Sorry guys in very busy exhibition period you should not have right to run hotel with construction atmosphere and with many o.o.o facilities!...

My partner and I stayed here for four nights and had a great time. The place was spotless, rooms comfortableand, great breakfasts and extremely friendly staff.  Hello Harry! Sure there is some building work going on but neither of us found it in the least disruptive. Thanks to evetyone for making us feel so welcome!! Hope to return soon.

column9: Terrible customer service - tried to charge me ¬£30 more than the amount I booked the room for!
column10: Booked a 3 person room at this hotel for ¬£60 in total.  When I tried to check in, the guy at reception told me that it is ¬£30 more for the third person even though it does not specify this anywhere on the reservation confirmation and actually states 3 persons on the confirmation - ¬£60 in total.  I had a print out of the reservation confirmation but the man told me that it doesn't matter - ¬£90 in total.  I asked to speak to the manager but the manager wouldn't come over to talk to me.We were so angry that we didn't stay and decided to get a taxi home which is why I have not rated other aspects of the hotel eg cleanliness, as I don't know.
hotel in great location, nice friendly staff, the duty manager Arun Sharma helping us with tickets, directions etc., i would stay here again.

column9: Not quite what it looks like in the HI website
column10: We chose this hotel for its convenience to the O2 Arena and stayed for 2 nights. The walk from Stratford station takes around 15 minutes and is fairly straightforward. In that area of London there is a lot of building work going on for the Olympics and this hotel is also being extended. Although this is mentioned on the website the picture of the hotel doesnt show this. As we stayed at the weekend it wasnt too much of a problem as no work was going on but I would imagine that it may be different during the week. Breakfeast is mainly continental but with the introduction of a couple of hot items it is a little better than it used to be with this chain. We had a meal in the hotel on one night which was standard pub fayre but a little pricey.

column9: stay away till it is renovated - no ac - no lift - little hot water - food stinks
column10: At first this place seemed like a nice place to stay for a business trip although it was a bit far from the office. but after the first morning breakfast every thing started going down-hill. the aircon stopped working and the staff was in no rush to get it fixed. hot water in the sink worked only 50% of the times.  They gave me a fan after 2 nights and after discussing the situation with 2 managers. Oh a few general  things to know about this hotel-- the food at the hotel is mediocre at best-- there are very few eateries near this hotel-- there is no clock is the room so come prepared if you need to be some place on time-- the walk from the underground station is at least 18 min.

column9: A good place to stay with a proper budget
column10: Its a very good place to stay specially when you are thinking of your budget in mind. The service is really good & the staff is really helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Express by Holiday Inn and recommend this hotel to others.

I stayed for three non-consecutive nights for business and what started off as terrible first impressions only got worse. I arrived on a Sunday evening after a horrendous journey to find that the car park indicated by the large sign on the side of the building was not there. I enquired at reception where I might park and was told to "leave it on the yellow lines, it'll be ok"! Needless to say I didn't, but parked down the road then spent most of the night worrying about my car as the hotel is in what could generously be described as a dubious area. The check in was poor the first time, but was better than the second time when I was left waiting at the reception desk for almost 15 minutes at which point I was checked in by a woman talking on the phone and I don't believe she actually said more that two words to me. I was absolutely amazed to find that while there were multiple pay tv channels there was not even basic digital tv. The food was overpriced and of poor quality. My chicken ceasar salad (according to the menu with anchovy fillets and parmesan shavings - though I could find none!) was essentially bland overcooked chicken on a bowl of soggy iceberg lettuce swimming in ceasar dressing. The cheeseburger I ordered the following night arrived minus cheese accompanied by cold overcooked chips, I didn't bother complaining after witnessing the man at the next table trying to complain that his hot chocolate fudge cake wasn't hot and being brought a mug of hot chocolate and told it was ok he could eat the cake anyway! The bed was not comfortable, the window seal came away from the frame, you had to practically break your finger in order to close the window and the builders with diggers in the hotel car park started work at 6:50 am - all in all not a pleasant experience.

Great location near Tube - rooms small, staff very helpful and friendly, breakfast fine, but food made later at request - great! Not in the best area  - but that will improve as they build for the Olympics.

I was visiting our offices in the vacinity of London Liverpool Street Station, and needed somewhere out of the city (so cheap),but still close enough.  15 mins walk from tube/national rail station, good service when I got there and even a view of the olympic park (from the second floor, through the adjacent tower blocks.Would definately recomend this hi.express.

column9: Hotel fine but front desk service disgraceful
column10: The hotel is fine - what you would expect from Express by Holiday Inn.  Not in a particularly nice part of town to come back to late at night but I know the area and that didn't bother me particularly.  The rate was great at ¬£58 (including continental breakfast) for a fairly last-minute booking.  I booked the hotel and my husband had to check us in as I was going to arrive late - I rang reservations to check this would be OK and they said it would be as long as he was named as an additional guest (which I did online) and he had my credit card - we arranged this and he checked in fine, paid the ¬£58 and got a receipt.  On checkout, the receptionist asked for an additional ¬£35 on top of the ¬£58 already paid as she insisted that there had been a third person staying in our room!  We said that this was not the case, but she was having none of it.  She went off for several minutes to talk to someone in a back room, then came out and demanded information from me to prove that the rate I had paid was the one I had booked - I had a confirmation printed from my e-mails but because I had printed in the wrong view it did not have this.  I insisted that there had only been two overnight guests, and she finally, after several more minutes of pouting and general rudeness, said that she would not be charging me an additional ¬£35 as if she was doing me some kind of favour.  I was not at all impressed and this would put me off staying there again.

we have stayed twice in the holiday inn express.The best bits about is the location, the polite staff-i(ndika - night manager and sudhaker ) , the breakfast  and assistance .Overall it was a good experinece - the 2nd visit was slightly marred by loss of airconditioning - but we were given a fan -that did help and a apology was given -accepted!Rooms are average for HIexpress and it would help if both the lifts work! rather than one .as its Priced reasonably for the facilities . i would stay here again!

column9: Would return without hesitation - if the location was better.
column10: As has been mentioned, the surrounding areas are slightly run down, and if you're thinking of staying here it would be an idea to acquaint yourself with the area beforehand, and to buy an Oyster card. We arrived before midnight but felt apprehensive when the cab driver advised us to be extra careful - especially late at night. It wasn't the best of introductions to the area, but like most stations in busy cities, it did have a few dubious characters wandering around. But please remember this was only at the station itself, which is within easy reach of the hotel. The cab fare was approximately ¬£7.00 from the station to the hotel, so good value, especially when travelling with heavy cases late at night. But if you're not averse to the few dubious characters, it's easily walkable to the hotel and is also on a bus route - one stop from Stratford station. The check in was fine and we were allocated a top floor room overlooking the main and very busy road. This wasn't a problem to us as both lifts were working fine and even if you're a very light sleeper, the double glazing drowns out most of the noise. But if you like to sleep with the window open, it would be advisable to ask for a room on the other side. The room was large and clean, as was the bedding and the bathroom. No faults at all with the housekeeping - it was exemplary. The only minor negative point was a stain on the cover of the sofa but as we only used it to put bags on, it wasn't a problem. The bed tended to lean towards the middle, but was comfortable after a hectic day spent in London. The bathroom, which is in fact a shower room, was spotless, as were the towels. We always take our own toiletries but there are dispensers for hand and body wash near the sink and in the shower, and a vending machine near the foyer if you forget anything like toothpaste. The nearby shopping centre in Stratford should cover just about anything else you may need.As has been mentioned in previous reviews, there was no hot food available that weekend, but the receptionists are more than happy to order a take-away for you to eat in your room, providing it's not overly late. The take-away menus, although of limited choice, can be found near the vending machine, and one meal was ample to feed two of us, and at approximately ¬£10 including delivery, good value for London. The continental breakfasts are standard but adequate enough to start the day off. If, as we did, you find yourself slightly disorientated with the area, just ask. The girls on reception were a credit to the hotel, and if they couldn't immediately help with directions to various places, they Googled the areas and handed us printouts, which was a very kind and helpful gesture. I can't recommend highly enough the benefits of buying an Oyster card on your arrival in London, especially if you're staying for sight-seeing in London. These, topped up with ¬£30 each, was more than enough for us to traverse across the city and further, and to have credit available at the end of the stay. Much cheaper than taxis. There's a bus stop a couple of minutes away from the hotel, and it's only one stop to Stratford station. As it was a weekend, there were various disruptions due to works being carried out, but at no time did we find this a problem. There's alternative routes to be taken and the station staff were very helpful. If returning from London to Stratford, and need a bus to the hotel, go to platform C at the bus station and get on any red bus - it's as easy as that, and where your Oyster card comes in handy. It's also handy for the DLR and buses. Should you wish to travel out to Beckton to the smaller shopping outlets, it's one stop from the hotel to the station, and a bus (I think it was the 252 or 262 but please ask - the local people were also more than helpful) takes you directly to Beckton Triangle (with it's Next and Boots clearance stores) or Gallion's Reach shopping centre, and which takes under an hour. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and the hotel staff. The only downside was the distance from the city to the hotel, especially if you need to return more than once in a day, (but who'd want to?) and the lack of cooked food at the weekend.  If you prefer to travel by taxi to and from the hotel it might work out cheaper to book a Holiday Inn that's more central. If not, then I'd recommend this hotel if you're travelling by car, or for a long weekend providing you don't mind the DLR and frequent tube changes.. If we could have picked this hotel up, and dropped it to a place nearer the attractions, it would have been near perfect for our needs. Our stay cost us ¬£159 for 3 nights B&B, but look around for any offers at the Holiday Inn site.Thank you to all at the hotel and I hope this has been of some help to any readers.

Stayed here with 2 of my friends for a weekend in London.  Only a short walk from Tube so handy for touring around (10 min).  Around ¬£25 for a cab out for the clubs in Leicster square when the tubes had finished for the evening.  Rooms nice and clean.  Staff friendly.  Bar in the reception area.  Lots of food for breakfast  - cereal, toast, croissants, yoghurts.  No hot food though.  Can't comment on the restaurant as it was closed over the easter weekend when we stayed, which we thought very odd.  Good Value all round.

This was my first ever experience in any Lodge/Inn, we went out for a trip to see London attractions with our family, booked 3 rooms, (5 children in total, various ages)Hotel was extremely clean,room was lovely, shower room was really nice,  breakfast was nice, got good value for money, parking was available just outside the hotel at ¬£7 per night which was reasonable, had no problems at all and enjoyed our stayStratford station is just minutes away, theres a nice takeway/cafe at the station, easy access to tubes/town centre, nice quiet Residential Area

This hotel was actually very nice although hard to find at night if you had to walk. The area was run down but once you got out to the underground it was ok. Breakfast was good and had a lot of options. The room was nice, clean and quiet. Overall a good hotel to stay in and value for money for London.

Myself my wife and 4 children have just returned from London. we stayed at the express by holiday inn at Stratford. For the price of the accomadation which included a continental breakfast the hotel was very clean, we booked 2 rooms which included a double and sofa beds which were very comfortable. The rooms were tidied every day and towels changed. the best thing about the hotel was the location, close to a tube and bus station. Overall we felt very safe in this hotel.

Really pleased with our recent visit to the Stratford Holiday Inn. We arrived on New Year's Eve at around 12:00 and were allowed to check in, even though normal check in time starts at 2:00. We had requested a room at the back of the building (not facing the busy highway), but were told this information was not on their booking system. I found this rather peculiar since I had booked directly with the hotel website. In the end, the reception staff accommodated our request without too much persuasion.The room was clean and compact; no complaints. I did notice that instead of providing a complimentary shampoo/shaving cream/ sewing kit, etc. in the bedroom, you must now request it from staff. Cost cutting I suppose. Overnight, the room was quiet and we had a restful sleep (no outdoor noise or sounds from neighbouring rooms) - a real feat considering it was New Year's Eve!The one drawback to this hotel is its location in East London. It takes about 25 minutes to travel by underground to Westminster station (central London), plus approx 10-15 minutes to walk to the Stratford station. That said, I feel it is not unreasonable as long as you only take the trip once a day. However, if you like to do a bit of sightseeing and then come back to your room and relax before heading out again, you'll find this hotel's location inconvenient. Access to London via the Stratford station is flexible, with the Jubilee, Circle and DLR lines, as well as  Overland trains operating from this station. There is a bus depot outside the Stratford station. Depending on what underground ticket you purchase, it may include buses, which would cut down on your walking time to and from the hotel.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------We arrived at the hotel & had problems with our travel agent, The hotel manager took care of it while we went out for the day. We stayed at the hotel for 11 days and were very comfortable.  Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable.  The back side of the hotel is quiet at night.  The Stratford tube and train and bus stations are about 4 blocks away, with cabbies available for aroound 5 pounds to the hotel, with tip if you're too tired to walk. There is a mall accross the street from the station with restaurants and movies. We walked half the time and always felt safe, even at 10:00 pm. We felt it was a longway out when we got there , but with the transportation system we within 10-15 minutes of anywhere in London Center for siteseeing.  Would definitly stay again.

It took forever to book in as they had lost our reservation, despite giving confirmation details to them. There is parking available but at a cost of ¬£12. The bedroom was ok. Comfortable bed and basic facilities available.The bathroom was a let down. There was no bath and it was rigged up for disabled customers, which posed a problem. There was a very sensitive emergency cord hanging in the middle of the shower which, when knocked, alarms reception. If you accidently knock this, expect many calls from the reception desk!Overall, I was disappointed with what we got for the money...

Stayed at the hotel for one night on business. Booked via last minute.com - free parking included. On arrival it became clear that parking wasnt included. I was advised that I could park in their carpark at a cost of ¬£12- but unfortunatly there weren't any spaces available.The rooms were clean and spacious, with a standard buffet style breakfast. Ive also stayed at the Express near the MIllenium Dome, which I would recomed over this one. Free parking for a start!I probably wont book with Express again though - they've put their prices up recenty. Some of them by an additional ¬£50 per night.Used to be a good hotel chain offering good value for money, a touch up the range from Premier Travel Inn.However..You can now stay at a Hilton Hotel for the same price!

column9: Great Hotel for the Price, Friendly service
column10: It's the staff at this hotel that make it outstanding.  Very helpful and extremely friendly.  If they didn't have the answer to a question, they got it for you.The rooms are quite small compared to American hotel rooms, but then again, that's usual in England.  Breakfast was good and enough to get you through well into the day.  Locations is a little out of the way, and not in the greatest of neighborhoods, but we felt safe walking there at night.  The subway was just a couple of blocks away and there is a good shopping center just outside it.  The bus will take you right in front of the hotelI recommend this hotel for a fairly inexpensive and very welcoming stay.

Over the years I've stayed at this outer London hotel on many occasions and have not been dissapointed.I can undersatnd many of the more negative comments reference the location, and the surrounding area, but that said you do get what you pay for in London.If you're an overseas visitor I suggest  taxi from the train station particularly at night.Personally i found the staff to be excellent the rooms are always clean and the continental breakfast is first class.It is though on a main road, and it's busy all night. Light sleepers I suggest a room at the back. If you're travelling by car, make sure to book a space.At night try the Pie Crust cafe across the road. Don't be put off by the decor. Whilst it looks like a run down cafe put your pre conceptions behind you. It serves some excellent thai food. You usually find an ecletic mix of clients.

Parking was terrible.The area is run down and unsafe, even the 10 min walk to the tube or bus station is very scary. The room was very basic and extremely noisy. I had hardly any sleep as I was constantly awoken by the sound of emergency vehicles and lorries. The website did not mention the hotel is situated right on the edge of a very busy dual carriageway. A friend staying on the opposite side of the hotel was kept awake all night be generator noise.The staff were unfriendly and non English so they had difficulty understanding what I was saying.Breakfast was disappointing.I would avoid like the plague.
Just okay. Nice shower, especially for Americans not used to Europeanshowers, this one was just like home. Breakfast was decent and the staff was friendly. I've had worse and I've had better...

We turned up just before 2 and asked to bok in the trainee receptionist very rudely told us to sit down.  When we were finaly allowed to check in she was rude again to the other staff in front of us.The room itself was ok the bed was comfortable.If you stay here  fri sat or sun they do not do food instead you are shown to an area where take away menus are and you have to order in??????????????????????????????????When asking for drinks we asked for a single shot but got a double and charged for a double they don't listen to what you say.We advised the hotel when we got there we had prepaid through last minute.com and  showed them the paperwork but on checking out they tried to charge me again and when i asked for an invoice to show no money had been taken off my card all i got was i can't do that so i insisted they did and got a plain bit of paper with a quick note scribbled on it.This may all sound petty but the rudeness of the staff was awful and did not seem to understand english.

When I got to my room there was a customer satisfaction questionnaire on my pillow.  Unfortunately, it had already been filled out by the previous guest!  I read with disappointment that the kettle didn't work which was bad news as after a long journey I was gasping for a cup of tea!  Anyway, the kettle did actually work if you applied pressure to the plug (loose connection!).  Good value, new, clean, nice continental breakfast.  Nice property but my night's sleep spoiled by the pillows which were thin and hard.

column9: A bed, and that's about it.
column10: There are very few hotels in this rather gritty part of outer London, so I guess we ought to be grateful for this one. Having business calls in the area, I've stayed here several times.Good points: straightforward, comfortable rooms.Bad points: Totally inadequate secure parking - the broken windscreen glass in the streets does not inspire confidence. Did I say gritty? - the area is grim.Grim welcome, too. Joyless. Not many smiles, staff seem put-upon.Crummy breakfast: there is some fruit, but apart from that it's self service stodge: flabby bread and wizened little pastries which look as if they've been microwaved from frozen. Low grade machine beverages. No eggs, bacon, ham or any kind of protein or wholemeal. Evening meals are available and in my experience very poor quality.I've been in several rooms and they all have icky looking stains on the sofas. Real off-putting.Stay if you have to, but don't expect to enjoy it.

Great Hote.  The staff were brilliant.  They could not do enough for you.  We just walked in and booked the hotel and they were very friendly.  After coming back from the theatre we were hungry and they recommended the Cafe opposite, which does not look much from the outside, but we would recommend it to anyone.It made our weekend,

column9: Clean hotel, nice staff, but to many things out of order and no quick fix
column10: Ok, I know that this is a cheap hotel, and you have to have this in mind when evaluating. But we experienced many things that were out of order, and they were only partially fixed during our stay.When we arrived, we noticed that the water went out of the sink very slowly. We had to remove the plug entirely in order to be able to use the sink at all. The electric kettle was only working if you were standing beside it keep pressing it down towards the table. The light bulb in the toilet would not turn on. At night we discovered that the TV remote control did not work, so we could not set the alarm clock to wake us up in the morning. We used the alarm on our cell phone, but unfortunately, it was set to Danish local time (without us thinking of it), so we got up 1 hour earlier (ok, I know that this is our fault and not the hotel). Instead of waiting an hour for the hotel to open breakfast, we went to the city to get an English breakfast. When we returned, we told the clerk about our problems (and that the cleaning staff had taken the bed linned from our extra bed (for our son) without putting a new one on (even not in the room at all). They would come up and have a look at it. It took a long time, we were about to go to bed, so we called them on the phone, and they were in our room after 5 min.They brought an extra kettle, swaped the remote (to one that worked better, but not good) and gave us an extra linned for the extra bed. Regarding the light bulp, the maintainer was not around, so they could not switch the bulb. They said that they could transfer us to another room, but we did not think of the problem to be that important and desided to stay in the room rather than packing all our stuff together and then unpack it again. We forgot to look at the sink problem.In the next morning during breafast, both the coffee machine and the juice machine was out of order. The staff open up the door to a meeting room, where you could get coffee, but no juice. So our son had to start the day with a glass of coffee milk to drink - they could not fix the juice problem and had no backup for this.  )-:Why were there so many things not working, and why didn't cleaning staff or anyone other notice the problems with the bulb and slow draining water by themselves? It should be an easy thing to find out when turning the switch and no lights come up and when cleaning the sink.... strange.The hotel is most likely staffed less than needed.Sad, because these small things should be easy to fix and would to me give the hotel a much better rating.Bad parking facilities, but ok, this is probably a general problem in London.Regards, Larshttp://lars.eberhardt-bonnesen.dk

Value for Money!Clean Rooms & Friendly staff.Breakfast looked good but i was in a hurry!Parking may be a problem because you have to book it direct with the hotel.Overall, very good. i woudl deffinitely return.

column9: Good place to stay in London
column10: Good to have a room with a kitchen with everything you need and the in house ‚ÄòPantry‚Äô for drinks, snacks and basic meals for the room or you can order from an extensive room service menu. Good location in Westfield Shopping Centre but still manages to be quiet. Lots of bars and restaurants and easy access to the Underground system. Most of the staff are very friendly, special mention to waiter Stephan.

column9: 2nd visit,  enjoyed as much as the 1st
column10: Another enjoyable visit.Room was comfortable,  good bed.Breakfast was nice, good food and relaxed atmosphere. Shame one of lifts was out of order but not a big deal. Also shame the shopping centre doesn't open until 12pm on a Sunday Friendly staff as normal

I stay here on business semi-regularly and each time I am amazed by the attentiveness of the staff, the reception staff are so friendly and welcoming it makes this hotel feel like a home away from home. The rooms are large, comfortable and spotless and include cooking facilities. The views from the 11th and 12th floors are beautiful and in the summer I like to sit on the small balcony on the 12th floor and have a glass of wine. The free breakfast is delicious and varied and the room service is great, although maybe a little slow. I‚Äôd like to give a special thank you to Aristide, he noticed I am a regular and went above and beyond to make my stay extra special, thank you so much! I stay here whenever I am in Stratford and recommend this hotel to absolutely everyone!

Opted to stay a bit further out from central London & my conference in the City and Staybridge provided me with easy link to Underground at Stratford and a couple of stops up the Central Line. Impressed with the room and kitchenette set up which was great value for the price paid. Did not use it during my stay of two nights but would have done if I had stayed longer..reception has a food section selling selection of frozen meals. Nice touch having coffee nespresso machine in the room. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices and the social every evening in the 12th floor lounge was a nice touch with snacks and drinks laid on.Hotel sits inside the Westfield shopping complex so everything is handy and there are plenty of food choices for dinner along with casino, cinema and West Ham football stadium etc...Worthy of note were the hotel staff who were all friendly and helpful especially during the hotel social evenings...

We always stay at the Stratford Staybribge when going to the O2. It has so many things going for it, a sensible price (for London), friendly staff, a good breakfast.good location, social evening, 24 hour coffee machine and Nespresso coffee in the room. The addition of fresh orange juice that you squeeze yourself was excellent.I have already said staff are friendly, and one lady at the breakfast counter remembered us from 12 months previous. Also Ariistide was great and helped us .Each visit I email when booking about a softer pillow, but again, these could not be provided and this is now becoming a bit of a joke with us.Despite this I will certainly return again.  Thank you Aristide.

I have to say I was a little nervous, I didn‚Äôt pay a kings ransom and thought it was ‚Äúto good to be true‚Äù. Excellent hotel with added bonus of kitchenette and lounge plus Westfield Shopping outside your door. Deserves 6 stars, my favourite touch was the ‚Äúmake your own fresh orange juice‚Äù at breakfast. Perfect location on the edge of Olympic Park and only meters away from Stratford International. Friendly staff, good buffet breakfast, fresh fruit and the staple full English. Also lots of communal areas and 24-7 tea and coffee. Well done Staybridge.

column9: Fantastic hotel, particularly for business travel
column10: Welcomed by friendly, helpful staff who really do go above and beyond. Varied and lovely breakfast. I've never seen another hotel do anything like the 'social' nights, when theres free booze on tap and free nibbles!

Beautiful rooms, spotless hotel, attentive staff, good breakfast, comfortable sleep. Will definitely be returning! There was a fire alarm on the Monday morning but it didn't phase us or affect our stay because we had has such a good time üòä

column9: Impressed enough to look to re-book soon
column10: First time stay at the Staybridge and primarily chose it for its convenient location.  The room is spacious, comfortable and well equipped.There were a few niggles with the room which we have notified the hotel about, but won't list them here as I don't want to detract from the overall impressive quality of the stay.One of the issues was that the Microwave in the room didn't work, and this was known by the hotel maintenance team.  So my tip for the hotel is to equip reception with a list of rooms where key devices don't work, and to advise residents at the time of arrival as this would enable the client to indicate whether this would prove an issue.  Small details, but they can make the difference between a good and an excellent stay.Having mentioned that, the matter was resolved as there was a generally available microwave near reception.  Receptionist (Aristide Nounsi) dealt with the issue impeccably and was kind enough to provide a complimentary bottle of wine for the inconvenience.

Shopping at the Westfield Centre, swimming at the aquatic centre nearby. Great location and facilities exactly what I needed for an overnight stay at Stratford. Would highly recommend Staybridge Suites London and will definitely stay again.

The hotel is situated by Westfield shopping centre so conveniently located if you wants shops and also plenty of restaurants and cinema etc so things to do. This is also by the Olympic Park where West Ham now play.Our room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. We had one minor problem which Aristide was very quick to arrange for help which was impressive service. Breakfast had plenty of choice and the option of collecting your breakfast on a tray and taking to your room if you prefer. The hotel is next to a Holiday Inn and they share a bar area.We were also near a tube stop so nice and easy to get on to London on the central line.Wife definitely wants to come back for more shopping!

I have been here twice in last one year. The service and staff is very nice.There was a false fire alarm during my stay and hotel staff handled it quite well.I would like to give special mention and Thanksfor the pantry staff - Lisa and Mariafor reception staff - Aristide and Francis

We hated this hotel and barely survived the night.  It was one night too many.  The room smelled, the rug had 2 wet spots and everything was totally parsimonious.  There were just 2 tissues in the box and 2 towels.  The breakfast was adequate.  The staff in the morning was not very helpful when we couldn't get our phone to work. One side of the hotel overlooks a giant construction site and if your windows are open it is quite annoying noise.  The other side faces an airshaft (or so I was told by a friend).  It i not in the center of London but it is close to public transportation and a huge shopping mall.Overall I would never stay at this property and am shocked by the other reviews.

column9: Neat, clean, great service and convenient
column10: The room was great and had everything we needed! The bathroom was clean, there was a fairly large kitchen and lounge area which was a nice addition. Nice spacious room. There was somebody cleaning almost every day and the staff at reception, reception and cleaning were all friendly and accommodating. One of the best things for me was that this hotel was connected to a mall which had some awesome restaurants, great clothing stores and convenience stores to buy groceries and meals. It was also walking distance from the train station and only took a few minutes to get to central London. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody looking for accommodation in the London area.

column9: Lovely Stay Shame About The Noise
column10: We really enjoyed our stay for 3 nights at the Staybridge Suites Startford. Comfortable suite accommodation with a decent kitchen, spacious areas for the bedroom and the lounge. We we‚Äôre lucky to catch an evening social where cheeses and cold cuts are served along with wine from 7 till 8. This social is run Monday to Wednesday.Also included a wonderful breakfast that is included in the rate. Our only negative our room 1110 11th floor was directly under the reception/breakfast area on the 12th floor. Early morning moving of furniture over hard floors above disturbed and though tbh we were offered a switch of room we had already unpacked for our stay and resisted the inconvenience. Staff really lovely throughout would stay again just have knowledge of noise issues in that particular level and position of the hotel room.

Lovely hotel, excellent service. Great breakfast with so much choice and very fresh. Great location for shops eating out and train station. Clean hotel and area. Room spacious, modern with great shower.

Last week I stayed at the hotel for a trip organised by my company - for our Fam trip - And I absolutely loved it! The room was big, very clean and modern. The breakfast and reception area are fantastic. I ended up staying 2 nights with my partner, which was the best idea since there is a lot to do around the area. The guest services coordinator Daniella and her team took good care of us and showed us great hospitality! They are a fantastic asset for the company. Thank You and keep up the great work! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, from a family/group of friends to a business person.

Excellent! I've stayed 50+ nights this year. Great location next to the Olympic Park with good sports facilities. Cooking facilities in the room, but lots of local restaurants close by if needed.Free laundry for long stays very useful.Guest nights in the 12th floor lounge always enjoyable with great service.Good for Central London as 10 mins from St Pancreas.

Great location for Stratford (Westfield), very close to car park B. The staff are very friendly and helpful (speak multiple languages). Our check in was swift and smooth, we even had a choice of room.When we entered out suite I was very surprised as to the facilities the room had; Fridge, microwave, kettle, coffee pod machine, dishwasher and twin hot plate with equipped kitchen.Bath room was good size with a great shower, bed was comfortable but it would be good/nice to have a choice of pillows (like in another cheaper brand of hotel) as I found them too soft.  Breakfast was great choice of cereals, pastries and of course a cooked breakfast.  The area was set out very well, and particularly liked the gluten free choices being available. The breakfast room has a good view over the train station and into docklands.  This hotels has restaurants and bars close by but no noise (unless the window is open), 30 seconds to shopping centre, 5min walk to the tube/train and a bit more onto Stratford high street.The only downside and what stopped me awarding 5* was some of the attention to detail in a 4* hotel and for the price we'd paid was...door seal in shower was missing and located behind the bathroom door, a wine glass was missing from the glass shelves and these had not been dusted as regularly as they should have been. Although the pantry was a nice idea it is very expensive. That said I would stay here again if I could get the right rate.

Excellent hotel, clean, great location. Tube, train and bus stations all a short walking distance away.Great breakfast. generous service of the highest level. Manager Aristide T. Nounsi's reception was wonderful as was the service throughout our stay. We also commend the excellent service we received from receptionist MIhaela and Lisa from the dining hall.

Great location and excellent too floor lounge and mini store. Good laundry facilities. But the King beds are not King size even by British standards and we had two days in a row of cold showers. All management did was tell us we would be happy to know that later in the day it was hot.   Complete fail in customer service

Had a great time. The location makes it easy to drive to via the M25 and then use the tube or DLR to get into central London. The rooms were well equipped and the breakfast buffet had a great choice. Liam in reception is a credit to the company

column9: Great hotel and facilities, fab location
column10: I‚Äôve stayed here before and it‚Äôs great find. Lovely staff, fab location, superb brekkie and the room has pretty much everything you need. My only point of feedback would be better choice of pillows. The bed was super comfy but I struggled with the pillows provided.

Everything was super during our stay. The location is a perfect spot to travel to central London or for example the football in Tottenham. The only thing is, that they maybe have to rehab the bathroom. We were at this hotel many time before and we will take this hotel at our next trip to London. Staff is friendly and helpful too :)

Good size room, exactly what we were looking for in a serviced room.Located metres from the Westfield mall and minutes away for the tube station. (The jublie line ends at Stratford, got our Oyster card and travelled daily into the city with no problems).  The DLR also ends at Stratford station, went to Greenwich within 20 minutes.The Hotel reception is on the top floor (12th) rooms are below.  Our airport taxi could not find the entrance to drive up as there is none, should tell the taxi to drop you at  "The Cow pub", and walk 20mtrs to the hotel.

Lovely room , great location and friendly staff.Brilliant breakfast, help yourself with lots of choice including vegan milks.Handy for shopping, restaurants and cinema. Lots to do in the area with good transport links.

Let me make it short and sweet.... You can not fault this place.... From Gym to room service to location and EXCELLENT service.... 10/10I would stay here again if i come back to London and it is right by the London Stadium

The fellows at the concierge desk have been absolutely wonderful in guiding us to all our tourist destinations and answering our miriad of questions. They are all so good at their jobs..always with a big smile!

Very nice hotel in north east London near Stratford City tube station (Jubilee and Central lines at minimum). Provides quite easy access to most anywhere in London you would like to go. Get an Oyster tube card for convenient access and payment for underground tube system. In a mall complex with many restaurants and shops. Room was spacious and clean. Complimentary breakfast was all you could want and well stocked. Staff was very friendly and very helpful with any request. They prepared breakfast go bags for our very early departure. Only negative was concierge desk not staffed at 6:00 am for our early departure. Answered the desk phone myself to make car arrangements. Very modern and good value for easy access to London without the big city prices. Would highly recommend.

Hidden in the heart of East London. This aparhotel boasts a modern look, close proximity to the Westfield Shopping Mall, a handful of restaurants and the London Underground. To top it all, the staff are quite customer centric. Special mention of Mr Aristide. Make sure you ask to be attended to by him. His warm smile üòÄmakes you feel welcomed, his desire to go over and above to support your unique needs makes one feel special and appreciated. I will certainly be back again. But for now, home here I come. Most Special 1

column9: Modern room, friendly staff and magnificent views
column10: I really enjoyed this short stay. Staff at the reception and breakfast were really friendly. i liked the fact that they offered a variation to the hot breakfast on the 2nd day. Loved the room and the views, esp.from the breakfast area.

Amazing apart Hotel! Very convenient; the Stratford tube station is a five-minute walk, getting you to anywhere in London in a 20 to 30-minute ride.The staff were friendly and helpful, who let us leave our cases in a secure area as we had arrived before check-in time. We stayed here for two nights on a long weekend visit to London. We had a one-bedroom suite which was immaculate and included all the comforts of home that you could reasonably wantThe room was spacious and included a fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, bedroom with a king size bed, and a pull-out sofa sleeper in the living room/kitchen area, with two flat-screen TVs. AC worked well, and the shower was excellent. The hotel is located on the northeast side of central London adjacent to the Olympic Park. The breakfast was included and had a great selection of both cooked and continental choices, we would certainly stay here again,
