We stayed here with a couple of people to visit the Olympic Park and watch world swimming championship. The staff are so friendly especially Lisa looked after us every morning at breakfast. Always so nice and cheerful. Our room were specious and airy and clean. I can‚Äôt fault this place. We had a great view over the Olympic park.

column9: Inner work as soon as I arrived
column10: I found the staff hotel manner refreshing and welcoming,Sal mentioning things said in previous visit I had spoken to him about and Stefan the kitchen manager showed me the breakfast buffet and checked to make sure everything was OK, indeed breakfast was most complementary. As was an early start, very much appreciated. Personally I would recommend based on all experiences had so far.

Overall a good stay and would definitely return.  Kitchen was well equipped, bed a little hard for me, location really good and cleanliness was quite good. The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch and there is plenty of variety.  Only one real gripe and that was the toiletries.  I realised too late that the bottle which should of contained shampoo was actually bodywash and the conditioner bottle contained shampoo!

A fantastic hotel with fantastic staff. From Dan and Vanadio on concierge, Paulina and Mihaela on reception to Stefan, Olga and Emiliyana at breakfast. Everything was superb. The quality and speed of room service was excellent by Jordan and Jack. Breakfast was varied and had all options you could possibly want. Already looking forward to our next stay in October! Well done guys, keep up the good work!

Same we had to change rooms after the tv stoped working at midnight, not the best that they put my heavily pregnant wife far away from the lifts and could have given me a tray in the breakfast room instead of tell me to go down 3 floors to collect mine from underneath the coffee machine that I thought it was just a tidy way of displaying the tea and coffee accessories

column9: Looking for a superb venue ? Look no further !
column10: I spent 2 nights at the Staybridge Suites when I was a guest of West Ham United at their game on Saturday . Now I‚Äôm a people person , and the staff at Staybridge are without doubt some of the most friendly , attentive employees I‚Äôve ever met.  At breakfast I struggle as I have Parkinson‚Äôs but I need not have worried . Olga and Stefan were both friendly , helpful and exactly the type of people I would hang out with , even though I‚Äôd never met them before . 10/10Thanks guys !

column9: Room ok, let down by check in experience
column10: The bathroom was clean, albeit a little dated.... really wanted a shower, and a little put off by the shower curtain!Overpriced for Stratford in my opinion but room well appointedAlso, we arrived at 2:55 for 3pm check in and had to wait until 5:30 which totally messed up our evening.... we were offered (which we took) a bottle of wine, but not happy about waiting so long

Had a Really Great time. It being August the hotel was very busy but all the services were up to par. The staff were efficient and genuinely friendly..I especially want to point out Lisa and Stephan of the breakfast staff who were especially patient  and nice with me and my toddler.Front desk staff also nice.

I don‚Äôt have words to express my disappointment with this hotel. I booked this hotel nearly 25 days ago for 10 nights which was prepaid. I later also paid for upgrading my room for a larger room as I and my husband are travelling with an infant. I just reached the hotel after long hours of flight only to find out they have overbooked the hotel and there is no room available for us!!! So its midnight here and we are extremely tired and the room which we have already paid for is being given to someone else !!! I have stayed in so many hotels but have never experienced such unprofessionalism anywhere. They have accommodated us in a standard room in another hotel which is not even par with what we booked at staybridge. No kitchenette, fridge not even water. Please check if they are actually giving you a room before booking with them. Kindly resolve this issue asap Staybridge!!

Great hotel for a longer stay, as all the rooms have kitchenettes, so it's easy to prepare some food if you feel like it. Also, the rooms are larger than in your average hotel thanks to the additional space of the kitchenette. The hotel is eco-friendly, because they use larger bottles with toilettries and not the mini sizes with shampoo and shower gel. I especially liked the socials three evenings a week, because you could talk to other guests or just sit comfortably in the huge lounge sipping free wine and nibbling on delicious snacks, at the same time admiring the vista of London in front of you (huge floor-to-ceiling windows spanning one of the walls). The staff is friendly and helpful (especially breakfast staff). Breakfast dishes are tasty, including warm and cold ones. My husband especially liked the variety of fruits.

column9: Overpriced. Poor facilities and rude and sarcastic staff
column10: Phone in room - useless. Apparently you have to turn the phone on. How many hotel phones do you have to turn on?Internet - asks for surname and room number. Doesn‚Äôt work. Apparently you have to put a code in but it doesn‚Äôt tell you that.Staff- rude, sarcastic and unhelpfulWon‚Äôt be staying here again

We stayed in this hotel on our trip to London and Paris.  It was a lovely and comfortable hotel.  We were helped many times by the Guest Service Supervisor, Paulina!  She was gracious and very caring about our special needs.  We had to leave early, and this kind lady made this transition possible.  The hotel was new, clean, and perfect.  We were able to maneuver around the city because of all the help we were offered.  They had the most awesome breakfast that we had experienced on our entire European holiday.  We would stay here again and again.  Thank you, Paulina!

This hotel ticks so many boxes if needing a base when visiting London. Agreeably the hotel is a little further out based in Stratford, but super easy to reach, & takes around 20mins max on the tube.Situated in Westfield shopping area, & touching the Olympic park, this is another great reason to book.Also if traveling by car, Westfield offers affordable parking, day & night. The hotel is apartment living, but with all the facilities you would get in a 5* hotel. Hotel staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, the lounge/dinner areas are very nice and have amazing views overlooking the capital. The suite rooms are spacious, and have all the facilities for families, groups or single travellers who prefer to stay in & cook. The kitchenette is ample sized & provides everything you need to rustle up a family meal, or meal for one using a microwave! A separate bedroom & en-suite provides additional privacy if more are staying, offering comfy beds and good sized bathroom with great shower. Breakfast was good, lots of choice & catering for all dietary requirements. Monday‚Äôs through to Wednesday the hotel offers a ‚ÄòSocial‚Äô which is where during the hours of 7-8pm they put on free snacks, hot & cold, soft and alcoholic drinks! A super nice touch. Booking in advance could save money, but nevertheless this hotel is definitely worth staying at.

I have stayed frequently at Staybridge Suites  and always feel as though I am coming home. All staff are friendly and ready to help. The rooms are reasonable size, clean, and have self catering facilities. Breakfast is included in the tariff, as is a  self service laundry. Will continue to book here when visiting London

I really love this hotel.I have been visiting this same hotel for the past 4 years. it is in a good location. All their staffs are amazing as well. Had a good service from reception team, most especially Paulina, she was really nice and helpful.The wifi just really bad duri9ng my recent stay.

Have used this hotel many times. The hotel has great staff and a fantastic location ... this visit however the internet simple didn't work.If you need transport I'd recommend getting the concierge to arrange it as the company they use is fairly decent and competitively priced.

Stayed here for the Prudential Ride London event, a large room with kitchen facilities was just what was needed along with the ability to keep my bike in the room.Check in was  prompt and seamless, courteous and friendly staff.The room was spacious and very clean, the shower was amazing.Breakfast was excellent, plenty of choice and all fresh.This hotel is great to access all the local amenities.Check out was fast and efficient

Had a 2 night stay over at Staybridge Suites,London-Stratford city, and this is best hotel i have stayed in and over the years i have stayed in quite a few. Warmly greeted on arrival by Aristide and other staff members, hotel was clean , food was excellent. I found it convenient  for all local amenities. When i went to Aristide or Mikaela to ask any questions, i found both of them kind, friendly and very knowledgeable, also nothing was to much trouble for them.On checking out Mikaela was very efficient, explained my bill to me in detail to confirm everything was correct, she also wished us a safe journey onwards and said" look forward to seeing you again".so in my opinion  '  I WILL BE BACK ! . Iris Stewart

column9: What an asset to the Staybridge Stratford
column10: Had a 2 night stay.Arrived earlier than expected but did paperwork early and was warmly welcomed by Aristide Nounsi.guest services manager.He was polite and professional and made us feel like he was concerned to make us feel comfortable while we waited.Coffee and water was offered.Unfortunately our room was a little delayed but we were well compensated for our wait.The whole reception team were excellent and at breakfast were greeted by them by name to check if we had a restful night.What a difference this group of people made to a situation that was outside their control.We are looking forward to returning to this hotel again and would like to thank the whole team for their consideration during our stay.The one bed suite offered a perfect location and comfortable stay.

column9: Quick stop but will be back
column10: Good location everything handy parking was ¬£10 for 24 hours. Shopping and Queen Elizabeth park on your doorstep as well as underground. Rooms have kitchen and comfortable beds was great for 1 night but will be back for longer

column9: We just love staying here for business meetings
column10: This hotel is brilliant for business travellers and families, The suites are well equipped, roomy and have dishwashers, fridges, tea, coffee, etc.  We just love these suites and they are a very reasonably rate.

We have stayed many times at the sister Holiday Inn located on the same site, but this was our first ever stay at a Staybridge Suite. We were upgraded and couldn‚Äôt believe the scale of the accommodation. We didn‚Äôt need the kitchen facilities as we ate in the nearby Westfield shopping centre, but everything was so clean and well equipped. Breakfast was good. Not so many options as at the Holiday Inn, but that works for us. We were on the 11th floor. It is quiet. The lifts work efficiently. NB The air con was a tad cold for us, so remember to check it when you first get into the room as it takes half an hour to moderate. Will stay here again.

The Staybridge Suites at Stratford City is a very pleasant home away from home.  The comfortable rooms are self contained and well stocked with all necessary amenties and appliances. Breakfasts are great, and all of the staff are friendly and helpful.  The train station with two underground routes is almost right beside the hotel, so you can easily get to any location in London and beyond.

column9: Great find, close to the Olympic Park
column10: We stayed here for a night when we came to watch the Anniversary Games and the Olympic Park and it is one of the best hotels we‚Äôve stayed in.Highlights were as follows:Quiet room. Good aircon, gave a nice temperature throughout and was very quiet overnight. Bathroom very nice and kitchen area a big bonus compared to a normal hotel room. Friendly staff. Big plus was the 12th floor lounge area with the complimentary tea & coffee and the views over London. Perfect location for Olympic Park, when you step out the front door you‚Äôre prettt much stepping onto the concourse to approach the stadium (3-4 minutes walk to entrance). There is very easy access from St Pancras, took 7 minutes on high speed overground and Stratford International Station was 4-5 minutes walk away (with luggage). With it being part of the Westfield complex, there were plenty of restaurants and shops in immediate location and the atmosphere was always very good.An excellent stay all around and, provided the prices are sensible, we will definitely be back next time we visit the stadium.

Very difficult to find and get to had to walk through a shopping centre to find my hotel and also had to pay my own parking no parking offered with stay. Food was very poor ordered room service food very basic

I stayed here before running the London 10K and really enjoyed my night here. The staff were great from check in to check out and seemed to enjoy working there.Location is great as it‚Äôs bang in the middle of Westfield Stratford less than 5 minutes from the entrance of Stratford Train / Tube (Jubilee / Central)/ DLR station and with it being in the shopping centre that means there‚Äôs no shortage of food options if you don‚Äôt want to cook yourself.I stayed in a standard suite and it had a mini kitchen (including hob, microwave and toaster) and a decent size fridge. The bed was comfy enough and the shower was good. Although I got a disabled room somehow and cba to ask for a new room so ended up having to sit down to wash). My only qualm was with the tv. It‚Äôs a decent size and has  freeview and a selection of international channels. It just didn‚Äôt want to sync with my iPhone on the screen mirroring option. My phone could find other rooms just not this one.Breakfast was good I just couldn‚Äôt have a lot due to the morening exercise

column9: Well deserving of the 5* rating I gave
column10: Getting to Stratford from Heathrow was easy - Buy oyster card from self service machine at underground station and change line once. On arrival follow signs to Westfield. You will see the Holiday Inn (occupying the lower floors of the same building) on exiting.I had a warm greeting from Maria and was offered a chocolate. I explained that I booked a deluxe suite for a night and a standard for the next two and asked if I could stay in the same room if possible. She said she would try (the hotel was running full). Our deluxe king (there are no twin single beds - only at the Holiday Inn) suite was spacious with a seperate sitting room and kitchenette - pristine and everything was in order. Beds are very comfy. Wifi worked well enough to stream videos. Housekeeping super efficient. Nespresso in room with 4 capsules.Breakfast is included with a decent spread of hot and cold choices.Social evening 7-8pm mondays to Wednesdays with free snacks and drinks.4 washers/dryers in a laundry room.Gym has cycles and a resistance machine but you can use the holiday inn gym if you must use a treadmill.Room service good.Bird e-scooters for hire at Olympic Park.Central line you to Oxford circus in 30mins. My advice is pay a little more for the deluxe suite - it has a seperate sitting room which makes for good personal space for a (snoring) father and son.Overall i would readily come back to stay and it deserves the 5* i am giving. Keep up the great work guys!

I enjoyed my stay very much. I hope I will be able to come back in the future and visit London and Staybridge. I would like to mention especially that the breakfast team was wonderful. They have always tried to fulfil my request,such as getting fried eggs. Ioana, Emiliyana, Lisa Andrea were always extremely helpful From the reception team Maria, Natalija and Francesco

column9: A great place to stay for work or pleasure!
column10: I stayed here for a month for work and was amazed by how easy it was to get around to central London. The location was perfect on top of a Westfield with many bars and shopping to be visited. The highlight of the hotel, however, was the weekday social drinks Monday-Wednesday and Aristide and the rest of the team had great service!I will be telling all my friends and colleagues to be staying here whenever they're in London!

Can't get enough of weekday socials at the hub on reception level 12! Aristide and all the other staff have only ever been warm and welcoming in the evenings. I've had a wonderful time, looking forward to next week!

This hotel was conveniently located to the Olympic Park stadiums, the mall, and a lot of restaurants. The rooms were very clean, staff was extremely friendly, and they had a large complimentary breakfast on the 12th floor with a patio. You could even squeeze your own orange juice!

I love to stay this place know as Stay Bridge in Stratford centre London. I enjoyed lot in social hours. It's best place location is very best centre in Westfield Shopping Centre, very convenient place to travel any where in London.

Excellent hotel, local to Westfield shopping centre and restaurants and tube station. I always get a good welcome and the welcome drinks and snacks on Tuesday and Wednesday evening are a great bonus. The hotel has a gym and I like walking in the Olympic Park 200m from the entrance.

column9: Beautiful rooms... not so great breakfast
column10: We stayed 1/06/19 as we were seeing Muse at the Olympic stadium. We got there and had been given a complimentary upgrade to a one bedroom suite which was absolutely beautiful. View from the window across London was amazing. Only little gripe was that the hotel doesn't have a bar so you have to go to the holiday inn located in the same building. Breakfast the next day was not what I expected for the cost of staying in the hotel. Boiled eggs were overcooked, scrambled eggs were all stuck together from keeping warm, but there was a nice selection of food, though it would have been nice if fried eggs were on offer. Getting back to the hotel after the concert was an absolute nightmare due to the stadiums ridiculous crowd control, and the route to the hotel was shut off which we were unaware that this would happen so we had to walk all the way around to get back to the hotel, concert finished at 2230, it was gone midnight by the time we got into the hotel which is less than a 5 minute walk away. Though this is in no way the hotels fault, just something to bare in mind if staying here after a big event. All in all it was lovely

This was a great experience. The hotel was easy to find, a short walk from Stratford Railway Station and right next to the London Stadium. The staff were friendly and helpful allowing us to book in early. The room was fantastic with a great kitchenette and bathroom. It was also very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice and again the service was excellent. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel especially if attending an event in the Olympic Park.

A great day and night shopping at Westfield shopping centre, hotel great location on the edge of the centre, easy check in room on 9th floor, mini kitchen in room, staff friendly, good choices for breakfast staff a little laid back for breakfast, normal get shown to a table not this time, we  will be back

Another brilliant stay - we stay at this hotel multiple times throughout the year and it never disappoints. Also a special mention to the guest services manager Aristide who takes absolute brilliant care of me and my daughter each and every stay. Brilliant sized rooms and perfect facilities - even got some sun during our visit and spent sometimes on there balcony with a beautiful view over the Olympic park and London!! Cant wait for another visit !!

First time I stayed in a Staybridge Suite location and very pleasantly surprised! The location of this one is ok right in the middle of the Westfield mall and I had actually stayed before in the Holiday Inn here which is in the same building.Large rooms with kitchenettes make for a brilliant place especially when on an extended stay. The breakfast was a bit basic but that might be seen as expected for the room price. Overall very good value for money and would stay again.

column9: Must stay for the right budget
column10: Stratford is indeed very convenient to the City and WC area. Great connections, great shopping, and easy to get to and very lively place. The hotel is great and airy. Great view of Olympic Park and West Ham Stadium. The suites were great and bed very comfy.

It been a very wonderful stay at StayBridge Stratford. I enjoyed every bit of it. From Peanut butter to Heineken to Playing on Wii.All of the staff is very helpful and proactive. I‚Äôd like to name most of them to the best of my memory.FrontdeskFranchessko : If i have spelled it correctly. He helped me in check-in. Thanks for the guest of the day wine and cookies.Maria : Speaking to her has been a delight always. She been very helpful regarding all / any of the things I requested. Specially, arranging water bottles, housekeeping etc.Catalin : Very Energetic and a Very Helpful Human. F&BAndrea : She‚Äôs been my best friend on the breakfast table. She knew that I‚Äôll be asking for Peanut butter. Hence, she ensured Peanut butter is right there around 8:30 am. Such a wonderful act of delight. That, reminded me of my mum, who always ensured breakfast is right there on the table every morning.Lisa : Real English women. All the conversations with her were really amazing. Be it breakfast or Socials. She always used to inform about the upcoming social plans well before. I also asked for some shopping tips which were really helpful.I‚Äôm not able to recall all the names, but breakfast & Social times have been a delight. Made some good friends.HousekeepingThank you for ensuring a clean room. I had request certain things a few times but Maria helped in sorting those out. Overall, I always had a clean linen, a clean room with my empty water bottles being trashed always [ :( ] Clean utensils, even if I have left them dirty in the sink. Kudos for that!!!Thank You!! For a wonderful stay! Going back with lot of Wonderful memories and looking forward to have some Great ones sooner than later.

We were there the second time this year for 4 nights and we will come again. We didn't miss anything.The connections to the public transport are ideal, there are restaurants for all tastes and the shopping possibilities are great. Only point deduction: For the second time there were difficulties with the WiFi - but you do not always need that.

column9: going downhill and uncaring staff that dont communicate
column10: Always had decent stays here but other have mentioned its going downhill. The guy in the breakfast room is fantastic first off......but the quality etc has gone down. Then we had people coming in for interviews/ meeting and I had requested the rooms be adjoining  or very close. They asked me to come down that morning and pre pay to guarantee the room never had to do that before but ok. So pre paid and they even wrote the room number on the receipt a few rooms away so ok. Then we came back to get the key as its wasn't ready when I paid and they gave the room away !!! then had to scramble and give us a room on a completely different floor which was a headache going back and forth.There were some others issues like having to be re keyed 5 times etc. Its a shame as we love the location but may have to re consider for out next visit.

I am begining to consider if this hotel is really worth all that money per night.What you serve is not breakfast...things have gone really downhill in that department. Before there used to be done nice omelette or scrambled eggs,  but through out our 7 night stay...absolutely nothing although I stopped going for breakfast after the 1st 2 mornings.However, clean rooms as usual, the major reason I pay all that money is the proximity of this hotel to the mall and ofcourse its cooking facilities and free laundrette But I think it's still overpriced

I spent the Easter weekend here with my sister, we stayed in Stratford as our brother lives near here, even though it‚Äôs away from the touristy places it‚Äôs still only a 25 minute tube ride away from central London.The hotel is easy to find from the bus stop at the shopping centre and handily at the doorstep to all of the shops. The check in process was speedy and our room was immaculate. My mum had stayed here previously so we knew what to expect but found it exceeded our expectations. We found the kitchenette really handy for snacks and if you want to save money instead of going out for dinner.Downside to the room would be that the free option for the WiFi was very poor, I know it was free and there is an option to pay for fast WiFi but I thought this could have been better.Breakfast was good, it was always quiet when we went down and great views wherever you sit.The staff were all lovely and always said hello in passing.  I would definitely stay here again.  The only thing I would say is that my brother warned us not to stay out late at night because it‚Äôs quite dangerous in the area with homeless people sleeping within the shopping centre and the surrounding area is not great, this put us off slightly but we were never out too late anyway.

column9: Great place to stay in East London
column10: This hotel offers a home from home experience.  All rooms have a kitchenette which is well equipped for short breaks.  The staff are always very friendly and go the extra mile to assist guests in any way they can.

column9: One of the greatest hotels I have ever stayed in London
column10: The room was very comfortable especially for a longer stay and the staff was very friendly. Leaving the message that the stay would have been better if there was a humidifier equipped in the room immediately before checking out, they gave me a letter that promises me o prepare it when I have a chance to stay again, and actually I have already finished another reservation on this same hotel for spending summer holidays with may family.

I was very impressed with this hotel. I arrived early and they were very obliging in storing my case while waiting for my room to be ready. The staff were all very helpful.Liked the pantry that you could buy (amongst other things) microwave meals and drinks from.The breakfast was excellent. A good selection of food available.I would definitely stay here again.

The Room ,   Kitchen facilities location and staff were all excellent. The Only was the  problem wi fi connection which kept disconnecting on all our devices . I stay at many other hotels including IHG ones where this does not happen

column9: Clean, comfortable, quiet hotel with friendly staff and service
column10: Stayed here for two nights and was very impressed by this no-thrills hotel. The room was clean and quiet and the WIFI was super-fast. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was quite decent. Location-wise if you are arriving from the tube or train station you will not see see any signs to the hotel. So I just followed the signs to Westfield Shopping Centre and asked the mall reception for directions which was quite straightforward. Being next to Westfield there is of course an abundance of shopping and dining options.I used this hotel as I had some meetings in the East part of London. It is not by any means close to the typical central London sightseeing spots so it is not a natural 'base' for first-timers visitors to London.

column9: Absolutely surpasses other hotels in the area
column10: Stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Stratford City for 5 nights with the sole intention and purpose being to venture more around east London whilst at the same time feeling you ain't left home and have the  comfort in the evenings rather than just having a  bedroom in a standard hotel.The One Bedroom Suites are really comfortable, they are big enough and have cooking facilities with hob, microwave oven, dishwasher and fridge freezer. The sofas and televisions in each room made it just a lovely relaxing way to relax in the  evenings after strolling around different boroughs of London.The washing machines and dryers made things much easier as it saves bringing many clothes. The gymnasium in the Staybridge Suites are ok but if you want more cardiovascular equipment then just nip downstairs to the Holiday Inn and they will accommodate you.Breakfast is complimentary each morning, although limited choices when it comes to fresh fruit but it was fine all things considered.A large open private terrace on the 12th floor for you to unwind and have a drink and take in the London skyline with views of the 02, Canary wharf and orbital slide directly opposite you. The underground and overground trains are in walking distance and gets you quickly into the capital.  There is also the Olympic Park on your doorstep and the Olympic stadium currently home ground for West Ham United, if you love ya footie and don't mind the rivalry of the hammers you can take a tour of the stadium. There is a vast range of designer clothes shops and established eateries situated on your doorstep in Westfield. The area of downtown Stratford is walkable with all local high street shops.Highly recommended, much better to book the one bedroom suites as they are bigger and have separate lounge areas.

column9: Great staff, superb suites and close to everything you could need.
column10: I stay at the Staybridge for about a week a month when I'm working in Stratford. Every time I come, the staff are welcoming and friendly. The rooms are always clean and are of a very high quality of fittings and furnishings. The small kitchen means I can cook if I don't fancy eating out, but there is a huge range of choice of restaurants on the doorstep in Westfield. I'll often go to the social events Mon-Wed, which give free food and drink for an our and it's nice to socialise there, particularly if I'm travelling alone. Overall, I can't fault the hotel and staff. Recently left my laptop charger when I checked out and the staff tripped over themselves to sort it out for me.

Clean and comfortable, right next to Westfield Stratford. Many restaurants, shops and supermarket are all around the corner and 5 minutes walk to Underground. A good place to stay. WiFi is not very good, compliment breakfast has limited choices.

I arrived at Staybridge less mobile than usual. Upon arrival Marco quickly arranged a room for me near the lifts which helped me greatly.The socials on Mon Tue and Wed were great fun and very generous.Our room was clean and the small kitchen gave us independence to eat in.A great location when working in this area of London

Great staff, welcoming atmosphere and awesome location. The rooms are amazing as well! Very pleased with the suite, perfect for working and relaxing after a long day. Loads of restaurants and bars on the doorstep, can‚Äôt fault the place.

Warmly greeted by the reception staff. Simple check in process and easy to find your room . We had a King Bed Studio which was clean spacious and had a good view over to the Greenwich Dome . The bathroom had a decent rainfall type shower. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Stayed a few times and always enjoyed it. Good for shopping and the kitchenette enables us to eat when and where we want . Good breakfast in the hotel which avoids going out or wasting food we would have to buy in quantity for breakfast and not finish. Comfortable room.Opted for upgrade when booking which unfortunately wasn't available on arrival but staff didn't seem to understand the process of responding to upgrade offers - so some uncomfortable confusion.

This was a return visit after 12 months. So many staff  genuinely remembered us and made us feel welcome, even the security staff. The breakfast was varied, the bed comfortable, and staff always have seem interested the clients.

It was a great stay as usual. Warm hospitable staff, great location and other helpful features. However, rooms cleaning needed to be a but more 'focused', breakfast could have a little more variety and a much needed treadmill at the gym.

A perfect stay from start to finish. Great location. Rooms well thought out and immaculate. Lovely breakfast with eco friendly ideas. All the staff were friendly and welcoming, great eye contact and friendly chat.

Brilliant ,location suites were spacious and clean .Excellent facilities well equipped kitchen ,and large shower .comfortable large bed.staff were pleasant polite and very helpful .short distance to train station and underground

column9: Talk about going above and beyond...
column10: I've stayed with the Staybridge Suites many times for work and they always look after me well, make me feel comfortable and welcome. On this occasion I was talked into playing netball after work by some colleagues, and ended up with a severe knee injury, unable to walk, alone, and in need of a trip to A&E. The Guest Services and Concierge staff were wonderful. They took care of everything, lifted my spirits and went the extra 10 miles to make sure I was looked after, safe and comfortable. They really saved the day and I can't thank them all enough.See you again soon once I'm off the crutches!Ms C Dodsley.

column9: Ok..but overpriced with no good view any more
column10: I see that  wear  and tear is becoming a problem. A remote  control doesn't  work and the batteries in it have been round  the  block.The carpet needs a deep clean..and if you can  work out the microwave instructions..good luck.Someone needs to come  in..and reset it.The rooms  need to be checked  prior to o occupation ...they charge enough. I put detergent  down the toilet  as the bathroom  was stale...plus the night light. is out.

We have stayed at this hotel several times.  It is comfortable and the views across London are great.  Stratford is on the central tube line, so can get straight into London.  Fabulous breakfast.  Friendly staff.

I stayed at Staybridge Suites Stratford  couple of time when I was for work trip in London. Hotel is really clean and has anything that you need! Breakfast was good as well. Rooms are comfortable and big enough. Staffs are very helpful at hotel. The location is amazing especially if you like to do shopping. Hotel is in middle of Stratford  shopping center! There are lots of restaurants around as well. There is tube station very close to hotel that you can go anywhere very easily!

The welcome is friendly and efficient and the check in quickThe evening social is a nice touch getting together the guests and staffThe breakfast is full of different types and choicesIt is always a pleasure to stay at this hotel

I stayed here on a work trip in February, convenient location near to stratford station and international. Great views of Olympic park. Very welcoming friendly staff, clean and comfortable room, nice quiet nights sleep!

I was really quite presently surprised by this ‚Äòhotel‚Äô. Location is excellent less than 20 minutes by tube from Oxford Circus and right next door to Westfield shopping centre. The rooms are very well equipped with everything you‚Äôd expect from a hotel (large comfy bed, giant TV, en suite, desk) but also includes a kitchen with hob, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, Nespresso machine, pots, pans, plates, bowls, cutlery and even a sink! The en suite has includes an enormous shower. The best thing was just how lovely and quiet it was. Thinking about food, the complimentary cooked breakfast was a big surprise. Similar to Holiday Inn Express but with much more choice. For dinner you have more options than I can list, room service, restaurant and bar downstairs in the Holiday Inn, or go out to one of the many restaurants literally a few steps away in the shopping centre. If you don‚Äôt fancy any of those options you can always cook for yourself. There is a shop in reception with ready meals, drinks, etc but better value would be the Sainsbury‚Äôs just across the road from the station. The staff were great too and couldn‚Äôt be any more helpful. I‚Äôll be back.

I stayed in a suite at the hotel on Friday night, the room was spacious, well presented, well stocked, clean & tidy. The hotel staff were helpful and polite. Breakfast had a wide choice dependant on your taste! Will hopefully stay again.

Perfectly located from London city airport and inside the Westfield stratford shopping mall. Clean, spacious rooms and very friendly personnel. Breakfast is great. Only point is that the free wifi is not so strong, but perhaps it is good to switch off once in a while!

Having stayed at this hotel years ago we visited again last year this time for a football trip and had 8 rooms booked. Took a while to check everyone in but reception was very welcoming and the rooms are clean and spacious.The hotel is in a great place, right in the middle of the shopping complex, with plenty to do around and a 2minute walk to the train station.Will definitely return again.

Second visit  to the Staybridge Suites at Stratford in 6 weeks and this one was just as good as the first, it is a 'Home from Home'.  Welcoming reception staff ,who show a real interest in making your visit just right.   Breakfast is great and all the waiting staff are friendly . A special mention must go to Andre, who looked after us brilliantly and made us feel very welcome, he is a real asset to the company and I hope we will be back in the future.

We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel and it was great! The room was very spacious and clean. The gym has great views of the city of London. The hotel is in a convenient location next to the Stratford City Mall and the Olympic Stadium. Even though, the hotel is not walking distance from the city center, the underground station is about 5 minutes away from the hotel. Also, the stratford city station is part of the "center line" which takes you to the center of London in about 20 minutes.

Staybridge have got their offer just right.  We always feel welcomed, comfortable, relaxed when we stay here.  The choice and quality of breakfast is good and the area to eat comfortable and large enought that finding somewhere to sit is usually no problem.  One suggestion - update the room electrics so hat they have more easily accessible sockets and add USB points.   Home away from home. Will be back.

Have recently returned home from a weekend away in Stratford for the Netball Quad Series. We have used Staybridge suites on different occasions and we had yet another amazing stay. Breakfast is always to a good standard and was very tasty. We enjoyed using the pancake machine during breakfast time. Rooms are very modern and has everything you need. A massive shout out to Guest Service manager Aristide who is a credit to the hotel and helped fix the problem we had with the WIFI not working during our stay. We look forward to returning again very soon.

We were a group of three couples staying over the weekend. My husband and I had stayed here previously and as a result suggested it when we were looking at booking a hotel for this stay. Staybridge Stratford did not disappoint - the rooms, quality of breakfast and staff were all great. The location means there is no road noise but you have everything Westfield, the Olympic Park and Stratford has to offer on your doorstep. Although not in the city, the proximity and frequencies of the transport systems make the journey short and quick. Like us, both of the other couples would stay here again. Thank you to the staff for their friendliness, and a special mention to Lisa who brings a true touch of the East End and was lovely to chat with at Breakfast.

Customer care was faultless.Effictive, helpful and prompt to deal with any clarifications.Rooms large and well kept. Check in and check out was fast, friendly and accurate. Felt secure within such a busy area of London.

column9: Comfortable stay, very much like home
column10: Throughout my stay, I felt welcomed. The staff at the reception, the chefs, the housekeeping, everyone was very friendly. I felt right at home. Never had any issues with service. The 24x7 coffee was just the added bonus that made me want to stay there forever! Not to forget the overall ambience, the proximity to the mall (food!) and basically everything you would want in a home.

column9: Christmas in London can be nice
column10: A very nice hotel, my room with the view on West Ham United Stadium and 'City' in the background awesome. Very friendly staff both at reception and all those preparing  breakfast (especially Stefan). A well equipped gym room.

It was real nice pleasure to stay at this hotel.The location is good (good connection to the center and shopping possibilties are next door).The welcome I got from Aristide at the reception desk was great! Very helpful and very friendly.Anyway all the staff I met was always nice!The room I got was great so that my stay there was cool!!!

column9: beware what room they give you.
column10: On the whole very good. However, I was not informed at reception how the lift worked with having to put your room card against a reader to be able to reach your floor. My room was under the fitness room. The problem being when guests decided to use the equipment at 5am it sounded like they were coming through the ceiling. Whoever thought that putting a gym over rooms clearly has no idea that sounds tend to travel through a floor and not rise up through ceiling. Apart from that the staff were very friendly and the room comfortable, yet once again in a hotel the bathroom sink was not suited to wet shaving. The breakfasts were good.

I generally love staying here but rarely get to as it's always full. I've stayed a few times and its been great. However this time the windows were all open, which was unusual. I suddenly realised, the person before me left a foostie6 smell. Couldn't get rid of it! Such a shame! Not normal.

The second year staying here for the annual visit to London for work in January. Easy to get to via train with Stratford station 5 min away from the hotel. Hotel is adjacent to a large mall and watering hole and restaurants. Facilities are basic with a small gym, staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast spread is simple, decent and sufficient. They also organise social evenings where there‚Äôs free flow of snacks and drinks for 2 hours (6-8pm).A service apartment, there‚Äôs cooking utensils as option, and it‚Äôs a comfortable size room. Compact bathroom with the basic toiletries but suffice my travel needs. It‚Äôs a value for money business hotel without frail.

Having never used Staybridge before but travelling as a family to do some Christmas sale shopping we decided to give it a go!!   The staff were a little.... chilly.  I didn‚Äôt feel particularly welcomed.  However once checked in we went to our room.  A well equipped kitchenette, a lounge area, a good sized bedroom and bathroom awaited us.   The sofa was made up for the children and there was plenty of room for them   My husband and had the bedroom.  After a hard days shopping it was lovely to have the opportunity to hit the local marks and spencer food hall and stay in for tea!!   The breakfast was basic - be warned the cereals were left in the boxes level of basic!!!!  Staffing was basic too but slightly increased on the Saturday - as was the choices!!!I would recommend for space afforded and cleanliness AND facilities!!!

We stayed here when Brighton and Hove Albion played West Ham.  The property is absolutely gorgeous.. So stylish and luxurious.  We didn't manage to get up for breakfast, but the dining area looked great.  The night time views across London were amazing.

Whenever we get the chance to visit London I would always choose to stay here. A really welcoming, relaxed atmosphere in a great location outside the city centre but with all the amenities you could want very nearby. Always get the best nights sleep and look forward to a gorgeous breakfast in the morning! Would highly recommend the Staybridge Suites in Stratford.

column9: Excellent place - convenient with lots of amenities
column10: We loved this place. Very close to the tube, and the kitchen was very convenient and allowed us to eat out a bit less; particularly because there is an M&S very close. Tube station is also very close and the room was clean and comfortable.

First class accommodations. Friendly, caring staff. We are return customers. We will always stay at this location when visiting London. Train station for overground and underground is attached to the property, as well as a shopping mall.

Ideally situated with great transport links to the East End and Central London but without paying Central London room rates. Westfield shopping centre on your doorstep.Friendly helpful staff. Room was very clean, comfortable and well serviced with its full kitchen- if you wanted to cook at ‚Äúhome‚ÄùBreakfast is available but manage your time when you go - can seem a bit chaotic but through the chaos it‚Äôs great and can give you a good start to your day.Give this place a go- you will return - we have!

Bed v comfy as is the seat at the end of itShower is very nice and the bathroom overall is niceThe extras like the laundrette and den etc are nice however my card didn‚Äôt work to get into the gym. I didn‚Äôt mind tho, I‚Äôm a fatty so only wanted to have a look - not actually do exercise hahaBreakfast was really nice and I love the fact that you can get hot drinks throughout the day for free although it would be nice to have a hot chocolate option on the machine.Location is amazingViews from various windows of the hotel are niceOverall, a fantastic stay and I can‚Äôt wait to go back

Clean comfortable and friendly staff.Throw in breakfast and 24hr parking for ¬£5 signing up for smart parking its a no brainier.Also direct access to London.Was a first visit definitely won‚Äôt be our last.Very very impressed.

I stayed in Staybridge Suites, Stratford for 25 days between Nov 2018 and Dec 2018. The strategic location of the hotel is ideal for business travellers like me to get the London Underground / Tube. Even for weekend, the Westfield mall with its many shopping and restaurant options is a nice place to relax. Also the hotel's complimentary breakfast really powers up the start of the day. Daily housekeeping and laundromat services are good and economical.

Great family vacation, i love the Staybridge suites. Amenities,  service ans proximity to the mall and vantage communities just great. U should see how well my kids sleep...it's simply home away from home.

I loved staying here! Breakfast was delicious and the staff was very nice. Wonderful position with many shops and restaurants nearby. The room I was in was lovely! I would surely recommend staying here to anyone.

Extremely comfortable rooms. A nice atmosphere in the hotel, and the complimentary breakfast is extremely welcome. The staff are excellent, extremely helpful, very pleasant to deal with and exceptionally amenable. I would certainly stay again.

Very comfortable, friendly and spotlessly clean hotel.  I would not hesitate in booking here again. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we were greeted with a slmile and a greeting from every staff member. A very relaxing stay.

column9: Hotel that has thought of everything
column10: Stayed one night whilst watching the World Cup cycling. Room very well designed with kitchen, lounge and bedroom with everything you could need. Very nice touch to also have an area which was always available to grab coffee, tea etc. Variety and quality of breakfast also very good and staff friendly and helpful throughout stay too. The reason for a very good assessment rather than excellent is due that at various points our keycard couldn't open our door, the gym or operate the lift, which got a little frustrating.

Very nice hotel and great location, I would recommendRoom was good, we had a one bed suite with a kitchen and lounge. Room amenities were good, we'll stocked kitchen  and comfy bed.Breakfast was good with a good choice of food and friendly staff. Coffee was very nice despite coming from a self service machine.Ethos of the hotel was good,  simple things like a pantry, free tea/coffee, tv lounge  and simple approach to things.

Stayed for one night with my wife as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary in London.The room was excellent loads of space and excellent accessories, and the view from our suite on the 10th floor was stunning.Had the complimentary breakfast in the morning which was very good as far as buffet breakfasts go.The location right in the middle of Westfield shopping centre is excellent, and less than a 5 min walk for car parking and the tube.Will definitely be staying again when we next visits London.Also a special thank you to the young lady who sorted the flowers for the room, my wife was delighted with them.

We booked a studio suite in Stratford  as our son and partner live nearby. This hotel is very well located and accessible. HS1 is just a10 minute journey from St Pancras and the hotel less than 10 minutes from Stratford International and even closer to the tube station.There is a very good M and S foodhall close to the hotel which enabled us to stock up on supplies.Our room was spotlessly clean ( including the sink overflow). It was spacious and comfortable. We really liked the public area and after checking out spent an hour or so there with with our son relaxing and chatting. The breakfast has good choice and we enjoyed it. All the staff we met here were outstanding - friendly and helpful.We had hoped to book a suite where we could prepare food and entertain our son and his partner. We did manage this but the suite we were in was not best suited for 4 people. We mentioned this to the receptionist and he very helpfully took us to view a 1 bedroomed suite and said that the hotel could assist if extra chairs, pans etc should we choose this for our next visit. We fully intend to return.

column9: over rate-this is not a 4 stars hotel!!!
column10: excellent location indeed but it s far from 4 stars; first the beds are all 1.50 (which could be limiting for 2 people) and the pillows are not that comfortable; as for breakfast , you get orange juice in a carton - something like tropicana and not fresh one; and only one type of marmelade (strawberry one) which again limits your choice; i found the holiday inn next door much better in quality ; it could be a good 3 stars

My fourth stay at Staybridge Suites in Stratford. I've reviewed twice before but last time time was a couple of years ago so as a reminder, here are the positives:- great for Xmas shopping stay over in Stratford as hotel is within the shopping mall- welcoming staff- small onsite gym- generous sized rooms with kitchenettes - lovely breakfast with heaps to choose from, continental and cooked- a stone's throw from Stratford tube to get to the O2 and central London - prices are usually reasonable when all others are sky high when O2 events are onI have only one negative on this stay, and that was being given the accessible room. It is great for someone with accessible needs but I hated the bathroom and felt like I was showering in a hospital room. But otherwise, a fabulous stay as always.

This was our second stay at the Staybridge, and we were again very impressed with the hotel and its staff, The location, comfort,  breakfast and staff are all spectacular. We stayed whilst attending the O2 which was only 2 stops away on the jubilee line, The social guest gathering held Monday to Wednesday was nice. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and everywhere was spotless.Breakfast was very good - not the most extensive I have had - but a large range of juices and milks (including Soya) are  available from the fridge still in the original cartons was very good. Again the breakfast staff were lovely. 24 hour coffee  is also available. No bar or restaurant facilities on site but within a stones throw of Westfield and the Olympic park mean plenty of choice. You can also use the Holiday inn bar that adjoins the hotel. Great views across to the park and London skyline.I have given 5* because of the above which override the 2 points I do not like.:-Pillows are still too hard for me with no soft option, I raised this last year and was told to email before arrival, which I did, but the pillows on the bed were the same as last year i.e. hard and further replacements were the same. This is not a cheap hotel and I do feel that a pillow option should be available, I am aware that lots of people would find the pillow fine.Finally, a Nesspresso machine in the suite is always welcome, but why provide only 4 pods and 4 milk jiggers for the total stay, this penalises the longer staying guest and again, bearing in mind the hotel price andmarket seems very mean.

Really impressed with the suite and the facilities. The breakfast selection was superb with a fantastic view of the Canary Wharf skyline, ArcelorMittal Orbit, O2 and Olympic Park. The complimentary evening drinks and nibbles were a great bonus too. For London accommodation the price represented good value.The only downsides: we couldn't alter the heating temperature in the room despite following the instructions and the windows don't open; we couldn't connect to the free WiFi despite the receptionist trying to help.

Just back from a two night stay and there are so many positives about this place. Convenient car parking in the Westfield shopping centre, which also has lots of places to eat or stock up with essentials for your room. The staff were all very friendly, polite and the most customer oriented staff I have ever encountered, a credit to your company. I hope they are treated well. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. Had everything we needed to look after a baby so that was very convenient. Breakfast was amazing. Again I think the best hotel breakfast I‚Äôve ever had. A couple of high chairs were available. A couple of tiny niggles, the travel cot provided was broken but it was replaced the next day. Also it only had a loose sheet, but we had brought a fitted one to go over it. However there was plenty of room for it in the suite which was great. Lastly the grout in the shower was starting to brown. However overall we were really pleased with our stay and we will look to stay in a Staybridge suite again.

Had a lovely stay here. Staff were very friendly and helpful only thing was that the bed was not comfortable and with my wife being pregnant , she didn‚Äôt get much sleep. Apart from that, all good. Would stay again

A great day and night shopping at Westfield shopping centre, hotel great location on the edge of the centre, easy check in room on 9th floor, mini kitchen in room, staff friendly, good choices for breakfast staff a little laid back for breakfast, normal get shown to a table not this time, I will be back

column9: The best thing was the breakfast!
column10: The Holiday Inn had only one room left so they recommended the suites hotel with a much nicer room for the same price.  It was nice but i couldn't turn on a light!  I had to get somebody to show me the master switch.  When I check out I couldn't go back to the room to get my luggage without someody coming with me with a pass.  Odd.  I never received an invoice which was also strange. The breakfast came with the deal and it was very good.  I didn't like the area, a vast mall, but I was there for business so that didn't matter too much.

column9: It's how all hotel rooms should be
column10: Spotless, no tight squeezes, kitchenette, expanse of bed, great big shower with nice toiletries, huge telly, comfy armchair and decent sized fridge.  Add the welcoming and helpful staff and what more could a business traveler ask for.  Downside was wi-fi that refused to connect and no sky telly but otherwise will be back with pleasure

Really nice room. Clean. Good Wi-Fi signal. Good location. Nice breakfast,though was disappointed that no baked beans on one of the mornings. Overall great! Love the Staybridge Suites brand.  Recommended.

I am lucky enough to have stayed here three times this year and I absolutely love this hotel. All of the staff are the most friendliest you will ever meet and so customer focused. It is hard to single out people but Stefan was wonderful, you will not meet a nicer happier man! This is like a home from home, great location, very clean, quiet and amazing views of London. The rooms were great and the breakfast was super, the all day tea and coffee is a nice touch.

column9: Absolutely terrible. Not suitable for business travel
column10: I arrived at the hotel at quarter to midnight having a confirmed and guaranteed reservation though a corporate travel agent. The hotel staff informed me that my room was given away (!) to a nearby Holiday Inn and there was no room left.Staybridge Suites didn‚Äôt start looking for a room for me until 40 min later and this took 3 hours, due to the city being full that night. In the mean while I was offered a very low standard hotel 2 hours drive away as a replacement. Staybridge charged me for the nIght even though the room wasn‚Äôt available to me and I agreed to use my credit card as the guarantee at the replacement hotel. Staybridge was supposed to resolve the payment issue ‚Äúfirst thing in the morning‚Äù. The resolution didn‚Äôt happen until the week later after I brought my corporate travel agent into the picture! Considering I arrived for business with sharp time schedule and deliverables, surviving the day after on 3 hours of sleep was a miserable experience. The way the management didn‚Äôt follow up on this (no sms the day confirming that I have a room, not reading messages left by the reception staff) to bad handling of this matter after that (providing wrong invoices at the check out, not ensuring the funds exchange with the replacement hotel as promised until escalated, claiming to not being able to find my email address after the check out) makes it to be a very unprofessional behavior. I recommend everyone to stay away from this hotel and not risk the valuable business or holiday time.

Previously booked our Suite on Booking.com for two nights, including breakfast, for two nights. Easy to get to using the Tube, quick walk through Westfield Shopping Centre, also signposted throughout in Westfields. Great location. Reception on 12th floor using the right hand side lifts. When arriving we were greeted by two friendly staff, whom were lovely & offered us lots of information regarding our stay. Lucky for us, we were staying on the 12th floor not far from the Reception, other rooms are located on the floors below. We were staying in suite 1210. Our suite was lovely & clean, we were pleasantly surprised how lovely the suite was, with lots included; Kitchenette - sink, fridge, microwave/grill, two hobs, dishwasher, utensils, cutlery, dining set. Bathroom - shower (absolutely fantastic shower, great water pressure & massive), sink, toilet, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, hand soap, lots of lovely fluffy towels provided. Wardrobe with safe inside, iron & ironing board. MASSIVE comfortable bed with two pillows each, lovely big Samsung flat screen telly with freeview, coffee machine with instructions, desk, hairdryer, a helpful mini tablet with can instruct you on how to get about London & site seeing. The list could go on. Lots included in the suite. We had two lovely nights sleep, with views of the Olympic park & the o2 in the distance. Did not get woken by any outside or inside noise.Each morning, there was a lovely breakfast laid out which guests helped themselves to. Hot breakfast - sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, baked beans & hash browns/potato cubes. Also a pancake machine with available toppings, coffee machines - mugs or takeaway cups, toaster, fridge full with different milks, orange juices, apple juice, pineapple juice, cranberry juice, fizzy drinks, porridge, fruit, fruits salad, cereals, croissants, bagels, pastries, granola, water - still or sparkling. Lots of available seating to use, the Den - a quiet room with comfortable seat, there is also a balcony when the weather is good, television with the news & weather streaming all day, computer for guest use, mini shop for essentials, food & drinks. The breakfast staff were very attentive & friendly, removing plates, glasses, mugs, bowls & replenishing them very quickly. Topping up anything that was running low. Overall, we had a fantastic stay & will be using Staybridge Suites again. Very impressed. Thank you for a lovely stay.

I always enjoy coming here. The bathroom has been recently remodeled and the water pressure was out of this world. The rooms are very clean as well as the hallway. There was a terrible smell in one of the elevators throughout my stay. Breakfast was basic and became monotonous after a few days as nothing varied.This hotel is right in front of Westfield Stratford city with a number of good restaurants just a few steps away. I will definitely be back again

Always like this hotel, friendly reception, gym on 12th floor, snacks at 7pm in bar. Rooms are comfortable and I always get a suite which I do not make the most off. Suites have kitchen lounge bedroom and bathroom.

column9: Breakfast Staff Made The Stay Perfect!
column10: Obviously the rooms were clean, smelled good, and comfortable, but the morning staff made the stay just that much more.  Stefan and the crew were engaging when needed and also gave us our space.  They found out we were staying for a special event at the Copper Box Arena and went the extra mile making sure that we had a snack to take with us.  They checked in with us each morning to see how we were doing and just made us feel that much more welcome.  So grateful!

column9: Good, but I probably prefer the Holiday Inn...
column10: For ease of those new to this hotel, the reception is in the top floor, with rooms down below - might seem a bit confusing when you go to the top of a hotel for reception. On the top floor, you'll find the gym, laundry room and restaurant/bar. The room itself is perfectly adequate, comes with a small kitchen (I didn't use) and a decent offering as a bathroom.  The main plus point is the nespresso machine with complimentary pods (4)...you can buy more if you need. For food, there's a pantry next to the reception desk, however, it's quite expensive, so may be worthwhile popping into one of the many supermarkets in the area.I didn't eat evening meals here, though on a Monday - Wednesday there is a 'social' event where you can get some nibbles and some complimentary drinks - that's a big plus after a day in the office.Breakfast offering was adequate for me - yoghurt, granola, fruit compote and scrambled eggs - couple of coffee machines too for that fresh cup of coffee in the morning top it off. The drawback to me was the gym, and how woeful it was - it wasn't until my second use that I realised I could have used the gym in the Holiday Inn, which whilst just as woeful, had free weights.  Don't expect to be able to do much of a routine here - though, do ask to pop into Holiday Inn if you want weights.I had the same issue as the Holiday Inn, in that my card was not preloaded with access to the gym (still don't understand why). Between the two offerings, I'd choose the Holiday Inn.  Shall keep this place in mind should I find myself down for a couple of nights again.

We have just stayed for our third visit in three years. Everything about this property is top class.  Great friendly staff, lovely rooms, clean and hygenic rooms. We had a deluxe suite which had plenty of room, arm chair, cooking facilities, large HD TV and very comfortable bed. The staff service rooms each week day but you must ask for a room service at weekends. The service staff are both helpful and friendly. The standards in this property are set high and have been that way on each of our visits. Breakfast on the 12th floor each morning is a delight and a credit to the breakfast staff. I did notice this visit the fruit salad bowl was full of melon that no one wanted and lacking in more popular types of fruit. This is a minor criticism of what is a fantastic place to stay. Overall outstanding.

Everything about this hotel experience was superb and we will definitely use the hotel again.The staff are friendly, the breakfast is so good with lots of choices, having a kitchenette in the room is a great idea.The toiletries are plentiful, huge towels, an iron and ironing board in the room were all positive along with a nespresso machine and free top ups from reception.The only negative is merely a niggle, there are not enough glasses and mugs when the breakfast room is really busy and the poor staff are rushed off their feet trying to please the guests that get irate by this ( they just need to be patient!). Being encouraged to take away coffee and food to your room or for later is such a good idea as guests don‚Äôt feel like thrives for taking a banana from the buffet for later!We stayed for 4 nights and each night was a different price but averaged to ¬£120 per room per night which is an absolute bargain which added to our delight for choosing to stay. The location is great for me as I hate the tube so we got into central London using the DLR and ferry very easily ( the tube would be even easier).Thank you so much Staybridge, other hotel chains should learn from you.

column9: Great stay, Great Value for money
column10: me and my hubby stayed here for 1 night as we were attending a show at the O2.The location was fab, staff were friendly, room was well equipped (including a dishwaher), breakfast was good and the entire place was clean. Early check in and late check out was much appreciated.Rooftop bar/terrace was lovely- albeit fairly expensive (1 x gin and tonic and 1 x beer was ¬£19)gym wasnt great but it was better than nothing and I didnt expect for it to be massive as most hotel gyms arent.It was a great price and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and will now make it my go to hotel when visiting the o2 (instead of the really pricey hotel at the o2 I usually stay at)

We stayed here for a night on a trip to London. We didn't actually stay long in the room as we had booked a meal and a show so were back quite late and left the next day.However we were really happy with the room, everything was clean and tidy, the room had air conditioning and a coffee machine. The shower and bathroom was really clean and decorated well. The rooms seemed to be sound proofed as we didn't have any noise to disturb our sleep.Hotel was in the perfect location so we could get the underground.  Would definitely stay again if wanting a night or two away in London.

It was very nice, clean rooms, the staff was very polite and friendly, it is very handy because there is a shoppingcenter nearby and a underground rail station so getting anywhere isn't a problem. I enjoyed my stay

Lovely room with all the facilities you could want in the room and in the hotel. Nice also to know that the check out time was 12 noon which means no early get up. Would definitely recommend- easy access to transport, shopping and amenities.Only problem was that the tv was not working in the room- but I am sure if we had mentioned this it would have been sorted swiftly.

column9: 5 star experience at not 5 star prices :)
column10: This hotel really has it all - most importantly consistently friendly and helpful staff.  Location is superb with under 5 minute walking access to 2 different stations (20 mins to most touristy places) and  right next to a new Westfield Stratford mall which closes at 9pm.  Plenty of shopping and food options (food court and regular restaurants.)I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the breakfast - it is complimentary and I was expecting a few croissants and cereal, but this was a full on hot (and continental options) breakfast .  Loved it!The rooms are clean and well maintained - the kitchenettes are well stocked, so you can cook basic meals (and I did have one room with an oven!). So - if you are planning to be on holiday in London, this is an EXCELLENT option to be your base.  It's not as far out from the center as it looks on the map and the pricing is very reasonable.  100% recommended!

I stayed at Staybridge Suites the 2nd time. The studio I was staying at was well furnished and well maintained. They provide all necessary items for a nice stay.Breakfast was not extraordinary but never the less very good. Staff is very helpful and welcoming.

We stayed for 2 nights & used as a base for Christmas shopping. Suited us well, approx 7 stops to central London on tube, which is a 5 min walk away. Westfield shopping centre is on site & parking directly underneath, very cheap too at ¬£16 for both nights! Beds comfortable & room had a small kitchen area with all amenities you‚Äôd expect. Modern, clean & tidy. Rooms sleep 2 adults, wanted to book again with third adult but would need to book 2 rooms which made it costly so didn‚Äôt book. Would absolutely stay again if only 2 of us though. Breakfast was included & a great choice from fruit, cereals, a pancake maker to make your own fresh pancakes & a full English option. Breakfast was busy though & we struggled to find a table, so had to sit in the soft seating near reception but no big deal as others were too. Highly recommended.

Stayed here for a week. Its service appartments with full kitchen set up, washing area and gym. Serves buffer breakfast and evening drinks. A nice and comfortable stay. Best part is it is very near to Westfield mall and stratford underground.

Great hotel,great location! Staff is super friendly. Room could have been a bit cleaner dust wise. My television did not work and although I mentioned this to reception, they did not come to fix it. No biggie since the weather was too nice to stay inside. Breakfast is ok for a quick bite.

So we stayed in Staybridge Suites for 4 nights. It was me, my husband and our 9 year old boy and we had an amazing stay. I was pretty impressed from the start - while I was trying to book the hotel. I was a bit confused about their child accommodation and so consulted them online thrice. I had a very good experience and everything was as expected when I checked in.The hotel is practically on the Westfield. So shopping and food was never an issue. Tube was just below Westfield. Uber pick-up point was also nearby. The environment was happening but not overcrowded. Most attractions were 30-40 minutes away by tube. So location was 5/5. The stuff were friendly and really tried to make our stay comfortable. We were in a one bedroom suite. The sofa bed was nicely made for our son and we slept well. Considering standard room sizes in Europe, this one was rather good. The nespresso was a nice touch.Well, there were a few issues including missing luggage and missing housekeeping in two different occasions. However, I will ignore them because we overall had an awesome stay and they responded sincerely while I followed up on the issues. We will definitely consider coming back when we go to London again.

Overall, the hotel is what you can expect from a 4 star category. Staff is courteous and flexible. A special thanks to Florin, the night shift receptionist, who found me a room at 2AM after my flight was cancelled and had to return to the hotel. He really dug deep in the system to find me the cheapest rate and also waived a night's accomodation due to late check-in.

We stayed here for the night as we were attending an event at the Olympic stadium. Check in was easy and the room was ready an hour earlier than the agreed check in time which was really good. Our room was spacious and clean - brilliant air conditioning which is really needed with the current weather! This would be a great place to stay for a number of days as it has a good size fridge, dishwasher and very useable kitchen. The breakfast at the hotel was really good. Every need was catered for - fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, cooked breakfast, pastries, toast and pancakes were all available - along with a range of fresh juices, tea and coffee. The hotel is in a  great location - right in the heart of the Westfield Plaza. Lots of restaurants and shops to keep you entertained. We would stay again at the hotel without a doubt

Ideally located in the Westfield Centre with good transport links from Stratford Station or Stratford International,  can't really fault it. Rooms are clean and comfortable enough and a good choice at the buffet breakfast. The check in was quick and staff great. No complaints and would certainly use again!

Fantasic Location, great, friendly staff and a delicious breakfast. Next London trip this is our hotel!! Spacious rooms, great view over the olymic park and a clean gym with all you need for a workout.

Visited here for 2 nights to attend a concert in the Olympic stadium. Perfect location as it‚Äôs a 5 min walk. Loads of restaurants & shops around right outside hotel. Parking is really cheap in mall which is attached. Finding a space can be tricky. We had a room upgrade which was nice. Bed comfy & everything you need in room. Staff friendly & helpful. Breakfast was standard staybridge breakfast, something for everyone

Stayed there for a few days as a base to visit a few galleries in London city. It turned out to be a better place than expected. Very easy to get in and out of London. It was a lovely quiet haven to return to after each busy day in the city. There are facilities to cook if you fancy staying in, with supermarkets near by in the shopping Centre to get anything you want. We are out locally every evening in the super local restaurants . The restaurants locally close up early so this is not a night life area. There is a casino nearby for gambling but it‚Äôs not a spot for going out in as such. The staff were lovely and helpful. The place really does feel safe and secure. I would recommend this hotel especially if you are in a shopping spree! There are no twin beds only doubles. So just beware of this before you book if you not happy to share a bed ! Also thee is now swimming pool. This was not a problem for us as we wouldn‚Äôt have had time to use it anyway. Overall I was very happy with my stay in this hotel and would go back for sure, now that I know how to find it from Stratford station. The first evening it took us quite a while to find it even using the directions on google maps. Thanks to all the staff there and hope the girls enjoyed the brandy we left for them.

Stayed here for gigs in Victoria Park which is a short walk away, location is superb right in Westfield & minutes away from the London / Olympic Stadium, we have stayed twice and will definitely be back, welcoming staff, great room with little kitchenette, comfortable bed & good shower. The breakfast was fab too with plenty of choice.

The suites are part of the holiday inn each suite is fully equiped with a small kitchen with all the usual features tv hairdryer iron etc etcIt‚Äôs in the middle of Westfield shopping centre so plenty to shop eat and drink

Stayed 2 nights as was attending Foo Fighters concert at London stadium. Easy to reach, as transport hub 5 mins away. Room clean, spacious with awesome air conditioning !  TV stations poor, even free view stations were unavailable, this is ok for short stays but longer stays would be a problem. Would have liked individual toiletries as the large ( refillable) containers were half full. Breakfast is good.View was awesome ..we were on the 12th floor and overlooked the city.Would stay again..

Good reception. Room was spacious for London. Very clean. Shower cubicle was very large with waterfall shower head. I wasn't keen on the toiletries being large bottles that were part used; I prefer small bottles so you know previous guests haven't tampered. Nice to have a little kitchenette. Location great with plenty of bars and restaurants in Stratford Westfield. Breakfast selection was good, cold and hot foods and the pancake machine is brilliant! Again I don't like sharing large jars of things with other guests, for example bottles of Tropicana and milk are available but Nutella and jam are gloopy and I would prefer individual servings.Would return.

column9: If you like big box retail, sloppy maintenance and dishonest management, look no further
column10: Stayed for just under a week on a business trip. The hotel is located in a giant mall, so if that's your thing, you'll find yourself with no shortage of shopping options, as well as grocery stores for saving money on meals (this is, after all, an extended stay hotel). All told, it's an unremarkable IHG property which is ranked far too high on the list of overall London hotels for what it is. Here's what it is/offers:- It's not cheap. Our corporate (ostensibly discounted) rate was around $200/night.- It has a breakfast that is plentiful in options, but somehow resoundingly underwhelming. Your mileage will vary in accordance with your level of pickiness.- There are occasional evening happy hours with free food and drinks.- It's an extended stay property, so there is a kitchen (fairly well-stocked) and laundry facilities (with absolutely atrocious dryers that take, no joke, three hours to fully complete a load). Fair warning: staff at the hotel did not know what dryer sheets were and don't have any in the pantry (though they do have laundry detergent pods). So make sure you make a pit stop at a Sainsbury's to pick some up.- The corridors are carpeted. Guess what that means for ease of rolling heavy bags.- Bed sheet thread count is somewhere in the double digits.- The TV channel options are indecipherable. There seem to be about a thousand overall channels of which about five work.- Wi-fi will annoyingly ask you to log in anew every day.And so on and so forth. I'm as picky as the next guy, but, honestly, the hotel is just fine. What was NOT fine was an episode we had and how the hotel management chose to treat it. This is what happened:Since we were staying for a fairly lengthy period of time, we made full use of the available drawers so as not to live out of our suitcases. What do you normally expect when you pull out a drawer? I usually expect it to be protected by some kind of stopping device so that it doesn't fall on my foot. Apparently, the fine folks of Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City don't agree. Both my wife and I managed to fall victim to the vicious left night stand drawer (two drawers, both unsecured, one hit each). Ouch. Well, mistakes happen, right? We notified the staff and were assured it would be fixed.Would that it were so. As we were checking out, I felt that familiar stinging feeling of pressed wood digging into the top of my foot at high speed. Apparently, maintenance did fix the night stand, but only halfway. So, the top drawer had the stoppers installed, but not the bottom.I mentioned this to the guys on the reception desk (who, by the way, credited me 14 GBP back in my pantry purchases for the trouble while being very adamant that I mention their names in my Tripadvisor review). Honestly, the 14 GBP didn't do very much for me, as my stay was covered by my company, but I didn't feel like pressing the issue and I was happy to leave it alone until the day manager, Eddie, caught up with me at the elevator. Here is what Eddie said to me, pretty much verbatim:"I overheard your conversation with my colleagues and would like to apologize. I am the day manager here.
