I know it won't help what's already happened, but could I maybe offer you some points in compensation? Ten...twenty thousand? (Thanks!) They will be posted right away!"Cool. Twenty thousand points comes out to about $100 by most travel websites' valuations, which seemed perfectly fair to me given the situation. Unfortunately, the points had failed to post "right away". I checked for a few days and then wrote the hotel a note. I was told that an "investigation" with IHG needed to take place before receiving a second e-mail showing a total of 3,000 points in two separate transactions being pending. When I asked what happened to the original promise, the responding manager told me Eddie didn't have the authority to make the offer, but he would graciously extend his "token" offer to 5K points (which have since posted).That's about it. I will leave you to draw your own conclusions about this incident. I will draw my own and stay elsewhere next time.

I stayed here for my first solo trip to London and it is quite amazing. It‚Äôs right next to Westfield which is one of the biggest malls in Europe with a band in the courtyard every weekend and a diverse amount of food in the area. Within all of that, I met a fantastic person named Lisa which is hands down one of the nicest most genuine people in all of London working in the kitchen. She definitely made my trip being very relatable and Mom like. I would definitely book this hotel again.Thanks

My partner an I recently stayed here and I have to say that absolutely everything was amazing from the room itself to the staff and service we received. It is ideally located for a festival we attended in Victoria Park. The facilities in the room were such a bonus and I'd like to give a special thanks to the cleaning staff as the hotel and room is spotless and also to Stefan, (breakfast staff) as he was incredibly friendly and helpful each morning. His customer service was second to none. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great room, delicious breakfast and amazing welcoming service. Thank you Staybridge Stratford!

I like to start off by thanking you for my Bank holiday bonus on the Rolling Stones Weekend, When Bookings As IHG Platinum Member ( I Never Expected 1 Night Free in Homerton hospital hackney from yourself Nicholas. Wow what a fantastic experience, Here‚Äôs the deal Folks if your looking for Great night out like me and my wife was then book no further here is the place to stay.  As pointed out by operational manager it was my fault. That either Something Ate or drank at the hotel.  I‚Äôll like to point out we only purchased drink and food from the hotel so I will leave you to do the maths.  Because it gone midnight time I started throwing up & collapsing on the bathroom floor then disaster struck I ended up messing myself it was not a pretty site in fact it was something like out of Horror movie. My wife find me collapsed on the bathroom floor. She was so distressed she could not use the phone in the room to get me help.  After working out how to call the front desk the Night manager came to the room where he told me I‚Äôll get help.  I laid for 2 hours of the floor but again this was pointed out by the operational manager Nicholas this was my fault. We called 999 3 Times from my mobile phone to be told we are having trouble finding you we was right in the heart Westfield shopping centre Stratford. Not only did the Paramedics help me they also cleaned and wash me down because of the state I was left in. Once put in the Ambulance the Crew try to put line in, I had 10 ml of morphine and an anti-sick drug to help me.  After being in hospital all night , My wife and me returned back to hotel via taxi to be greeted by staff saying you‚Äôre in time for breakfast I was quite shocked by the comments and the remarks I pointed out I‚Äôve been up all night no sleep and been in hospital all we wanted to do was sleep we asked was it okay to return back to our room to be informed the cleaners do not start till 9 AM so Our room 1212 would still have sick and human waste on the bathroom floor, and would not be suitable for us to return too, staff said we have a spare room you can go into and once their room was cleaned we could collect our belongings.   It was it so lovely the operations manager Nicholas called me in room 1210 so asked if we could have a meeting at 1:30 PM to discuss what happened to me I couldn‚Äôt believe it really the hotel knew we been up all night and all we wanted to do was recover and sleep with this too much to ask I asked yourself.  At midday the cleaner who could not speak proper English started putting our belongings into a rubbish bag when I asked her to stop she said you have to leave and then she said do you still want this I went to the front desk and complained and insisted somebody came to the room I said we are still paying guests till 2 PM I do not expect to be treated in this manner by any one.  There was lady being checking in at the time I was polite and very firm to the staff at no point was I rude to her or to the lady checking in.  This whole Experience could have been avoided  1. Once room was ok to return too 2. Hotel Porter to remove items to new room 3. Store items so we could pick them all up 4. Treat everyone with respect The General manager gave my wife and me two large bottles of water he also went on to say under the circumstances he feel we should have a complimentary night as a way of saying sorry he also pointed out he would have to talk to the operational manager first but as I found out afterwards the operational manager Said No only was happy for if we paid to stay on or we used our points. He said we give you till 4 PM , it was disgusting how we was treated.  it was pointed out in the meeting by myself and Nicholas as No point was I Rude or using  abusive language, as Nicholas pointed out in a very rude and unprofessional email to myself Day later. and on checkout I told valine I would not pay for an overseas call to Rome as it was made when my wife and me was in hospital. At No point did I intimidate or refuse to pay the outstanding bill. There was New member of staff who was in training asked us to return to the hotel in the future which my wife and myself refused.  We left with our belongings up on top of a wheelchair and one walking stick normally we would eat lunch at hotel before asking for taxi home.   I Think if the Hotel would have just left it, you would never know about this incidents.  On Wednesday day after returning home The operational manager decided to take it upon himself and send out an unprofessional email.  it was disgusting behaviour to see how someone in this high up position was talking to me.  You may Be able to bullying or threatening staff into doing things by emails  but how Disgusting to talk to me in this manner.  Nicholas went on to say it was my fault for the incident at the hotel he basically called me a liar and he said myself and my wife was banned from returning to the Hotel IHG Stalybridge holiday inn I (my wife) We Would Never step foot back here again why you employ people like this.  I will be talking to creation card who is part of Barclays Bank to find out if they have a different reward card with a different hotel group altogether why pay ¬£99 to be treated like this, You may take ¬£10.000 a night from Rolling Stones Weekend to our ¬£348 for 3 night stay.  And then laugh about it in a jovial manner.   It‚Äôs a shame your staff was being jovial about my wife in manner which is not acceptable behaviour,  she heard them from the lobby. I know you will hit back at me probably trying to point out it was all my fault,  either by TripAdvisor or privately in an email.  I think you need to go on training course on how to treat all your guess correctly.   Maybe it was not intentional but I think you should learn to treat disabled customers with the upmost respect Nikolai.    We booked this stay after I had open surgery 3 months ago, after all what gone on in my life and my wife life. A small break away, we last stayed after returning from 4 days in Paris in September 17 and it was great stay So we came back.

My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night after attending a music festival at Victoria Park (one tube stop away). The location was great. Located just around corner from Stratford tube station, whilst being walking distance from the London Stadium and Olympic village. The hotel is also within Westfields shopping centre which is excellent. Our room was perfect and neither of us could fault it. It was a good size with a hairdryer, cooking utensils, lots of mirrors, a mini fridge, a good shower, plenty of towels  and decorated to a really high standard. Breakfast is also included and it was lovely. Lots of choice, including lots of juice and self-serve pancakes, with continental and bacon, sausages and a fridge full of a huge range of juices (Tropicana). In addition to this the view from breakfast was lovely, looking out over the city. You can see he O2, the Olympic stadium etc. Finally, the staff were really friendly, chatty and helpful. On checkout they were more than happy to hold our bags for us, free of charge, so we could go and do some shopping! Overall we had a hugely enjoyable stay and would really recommend this hotel, whether it be for a short stay or a longer stay!

We arrived at the Staybridge Hotel on Sunday. Trains to Stratford were all in time and the hotel was easy to find. Easiest way is over the footbridge and follow your nose.Go to the 12th floor to check in.If you come later in the day, skip the hotel restaurant in the Holiday Inn as it‚Äôs not that great and very expensive. Lots of restaurant near by and don‚Äôt be afraid to get on a tube and go anywhere in London as it‚Äôs so easy to get to.Room was great! Clean and equipped with a small kitchen, and comfy bed. Grocery store nearby and a shopping mall and casino if you are into that sort of thing.‚ÄúFull English‚Äù Breakfast on the 12th floor reception area is well with going for, although it can get busy so be a little patient. Good coffee and tea and sparkling water available 24/7 for free and comes with a great view.While some of the staff were great, some were less than helpful and the check out experience was a totally missed opportunity to have us come back. IHG‚Äôs mission statement would be worth sharing with the front desk staff as it is a good one and if lived might generate lots more repeat customers.All that said, great all round experience if you are looking for a clean, safe, comfortable hotel experience.

column9: Wished we could have stayed longer!
column10: Really enjoyed our one night stay here, it‚Äôs a great hotel in a brilliant location if you like shopping or football!  Even if you don‚Äôt it is very convenient for central London and the dockland area.It seems strange that the reception is on the top floor and the suites on the floors below, but you can soon get used to that!We had a lovely welcome and also an upgrade which was great. The reception area is light, bright and modern as are the lounge and dining area which are on the same floor.Our one bedroom suite was lovely, very spacious with lounge, kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom, bright and clean and it really was a pleasure to stay here.The breakfast next day was very busy but there was plenty of space to sit and the buffet was delicious with plenty of choice and was replenished regularly.We also liked the fact that you could get coffee and water from the dining area 24/7 as well as ‚ÄúThe Pantry‚Äù where you could buy snacks too.Would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay here again.

column9: A weeks stay visiting Canary Wharf
column10: I stayed for a week checking in on a Sunday evening to attend a training course in Canary Wharf. I decided to try Staybridge Suites as it gave me flexibility over dining as I needed to study in the evening to get ready for my end of week exam. I found the accommodation to be in excellent order and the location is perfect for Canary Wharf. There is a nearby Waitrose and Marks and Spencer and plenty of bars and restaurants. You are a few minutes walk from the mainline rail, tube or dockland light railways. The service in the hotel for breakfast and evening socials was excellent. I was helped throughout my stay by the charming and most helpful Anna Chiara who made sure my stay was perfect. I would recommend this hotel highly and certainly stay again if I'm in the area. Ciao

...well that's what the IH group pf hotels intended for this property, and they're not far off. From the decor, to the food, amenities, staff and last but not least, the Social Evenings which for 3 nights a week included snacks, soft drinks as well as alcoholic beverages like lager and a selection of wines. Hearty breakfast aside, if you decide not to use the kitchen to cook, there are numerous eateries on your doorstep. Westfield shopping mall is situated right in front of the entrance.The TV in your room has connectivity with Apple Air but you'll find yourself tempted to visit the Vue cinema once in a while, then the bars knowing you don't require a designated driver to walk you to bed! How convenient. And if you didn't feel like stepping outside the building, the Holiday Inn, also part of the IH group, is located 3 floors below (you'd need to descend to the ground floor lobby to use a different elevator to access its reception) and has a Bar and Restaurant on the third floor. For smokers, designated smoking areas are either outside in front of the building or on  the third floor balcony of the Holiday Inn. Food and beverages can be charged to your room which is convenient in case you've forgotten to bring your wallet or purse with you. Note: expenses when charged to your room account/bill attracts Reward Points.Teas and coffees are complimentary throughout the day in the lounge area which also has a designated TV room at the back that is sometimes hired out for private events/meetings.The gym is adjacent to the laundry room which has an observation glass in between. Equipment is adequate however due to limited space there is no bench press or free-weights. Fortunately guests residing at Staybridge are able to access the Holiday Inn's gym on the third floor necessitating using the lifts again via the ground floor. The Holiday Inn's gym is situated next to its treatment rooms which I found to be very hygienic. I booked a Sports massage and received a very satisfying treatment by a qualified masseuse. Treatments had to be paid for by cash or card separately at Holiday Inn.The gym in Staybridge overlooks West Ham stadium whereas Holiday Inn's gym is facing Westfield mall.The breakfast buffet was quite comprehensive. I found it a challenge to resist a heavy breakfast at times, tempted with desserts that meant having to spend more time in the gym, which itself is tricky if you wake up late and don't want to miss breakfast. Fortunately trays are provided for guests to help themselves to breakfast in their rooms. I did find myself doing this a few times so I could finish my exercise followed by a late breakfast. As well as a fridge there is a microwave included in your kitchen plus an oven and hob if you decide to reheat the food...or indeed cook...which I did on one occasion with food purchased from the vegetable and poultry section in the nearby supermarket. Delish...but I digress.We were booked in a suite which included a separate double bedroom with a spacious ensuite bathroom. Both rooms included a TV. Separating the kitchen and lounge is a practical workdesk with power-points, handy when you're working with your laptop. The rooms are well furnished. For a change of scenery or if you're meeting anyone, a stroll up to the lounge can be useful. Wifi is available throughout the building.The Staybridge Stratford is overall a good property. Areas of improvement could be advance warning of Exit routes as it can be quite disorienting during alarm activation of knowing which way to go if you're at the opposite end of the main elevators...speaking of which, if you are allocated a room further away from the lifts, then the walk can feel tedious.Parking is available underground but needs to be paid for as this is not part of the hotel. Overall I enjoyed my time at Staybridge. It's location is ideal being close to transport links, shops and restaurants and above all staff were very welcoming.

This is not for everyone but it is my go to place in London, well actually about 20 minutes out of the city by tube.  If you want a hotel with a lush bar and super restaurant then this is not for you.  However, it‚Äôs right next to a major shopping mall with a really decent food court, Waitrose, and a Marks and Sparks.  Good sized rooms with windows that really open.  Proper kitchen facilities and dishwasher aimed at people on longer stays.  Nothing like fresh air to cheer you up rain or shine.  If you can‚Äôt get a booking then you can try the Holiday Inn next door until there‚Äôs a vacancy but the rooms are smaller and the windows are firmly shut. Stayed here more than 20 times over the years and never been disappointed (except when they‚Äôre full).  Also super handy to London City Airport by DLR, beats LHR/LGW.

A very good hotel, situated behind the main road in Vauxhall, a couple of hundred yards from the London eye. One of the best rooms I‚Äôve stayed in. This hotel doesn‚Äôt do evening meals, only breakfast. Unusually there is a kitchenette in the room, so you can make your own dinner, if you don‚Äôt want to eat out. Novell idea for this type of hotel. I would recommend this hotel and when I visit London again, I will try to stay here.

Fantastic location, wonderful greeting by professional staff. Invited to a guest night offering nibbles and alcohol from 7-8pm. This was a nice touch for a drink before heading off to a concert as was the upgrade to a larger room. Great selection at breakfast too which was included in the price. The room was very quiet which was perfect. Bed slightly hard for my liking the only negative I can say. Highly recommended.

I have just checked in to this hotel and had a delightful check-in experience from Natalija, Mizan and Mariya - 3 smiling faces who cannot do enough to please their guests. Room is excellent too - 5 stars!

We stayed at one of the suites at Straybridge London- Stratford for one week in April 2018 and must say that we were thoroughly impressed by the property and the staff. It is hard to find anything wrong with this hotel. The kitchen in suite comes equipped with a fridge, diswasher, induction, chimney and any utensils that may be required. The bedroom is quite spacious and has enough storage space. Conveniently located inside the Westfield mall in Stratford and adjacent to the Stratford tube and train station, this is a centrally located hotel with plenty of restaurants in the vicinity and easily accessible by public transport. The breakfast buffet has a wide range of food options to choose from and also offers the option to carry your breakfast as takeaway in case you are in a rush. There is arrangement for complimentary light refreshments in the evening on weekdays. The facility also has a fitness center accessible to all guests.

column9: This hotel is a one off.
column10: What a weekend at the upside down hotel! I have never quite felt like I did staying here, amazing. All of the staff are the most friendliest you will ever meet and so customer focused. It is hard to single out people but Stefan was wonderful, you will not meet a nicer happier man! Mariya on reception was great and Lisa serving breakfast was lovely. This is like a home from home, great location, very clean, quiet and amazing views of London. The rooms were great and the breakfast was super, the all day tea and coffee is a nice touch. I usually stay in central London but I will definitely come back to this hotel as I loved it so much, I want to move in!

This has honestly been the best stay I‚Äôve had in London. Where to start? The room were clean and plenty facilities to accommodate. The breakfast was amazing and the service has been the best service provided in London. I‚Äôd like to thank Andre for helping us out during our stay and making it a great stay . We will come back for the accommodation, service and great location

A great choice for clean, comfortable, friendly accommodation. Rooms/suites are very well equipped and large comfortable bathrooms. Great location for shops, restaurants and transport links. Buffet breakfast excellent and staff very good. Highly recommended.

What a great stay at the Staybridge. Suites were clean, service was efficient, breakfast selection is suitable and vast choice! Great transport links, and most of all we enjoyed the stay. I loved how it was close to everything convenient in Westfield.The only thing I would say is, the clocks need to be changed! But other than that, I can‚Äôt fault anything else.

My husband and I have stayed here a few times now and it‚Äôs our favourite of all the places we stay in this area of London. With its welcoming, comfortable environment we highly recommend it.Great accommodation with everything you could possibly need as well as a Nespresso machine plus the added bonus of breakfast included.The best suites are the Olympic park view side which have great views of the city in the distance.The staff are friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast staff.The only negative we could add is that the clock in our suite hadn‚Äôt been put forward an hour and that the shelves that house the glasses were dusty. Other than that everything was great and we will definitely stay here again.

column9: Am excellent hotel with great transport links
column10: I've never stayed at an IHG property before, but now my loyalties may have changed! This is an excellent hotel worth friendly staff who are efficient at reception and during the free buffet breakfast. The room itself was cosy, and spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed. Unfortunately the bathroom seemed a bit basic by comparison, although was still serviceable. The view I had was not the most picturesque, but if you know what to expect you won't be disappointed. Since it is right next to Westfield Stratford City shopping is easy, and there are plenty of places to eat. Getting into central London is also incredibly painless with transport links less than 5 minutes away. I did not have a chance to check out the facilities, but may do in the future as I will definitely return.

column9: Loved hotel but bad experience at check-in
column10: The hotel is in a very convenient location - in the vicinity of the Westfield shopping mall and just across the pedestrian bridge to the Stratford train station.  The mall has all kinds of restaurants, shopping, grocery store, and a large movie theater. We could hop on the train to go into the city for tourist attractions. The hotel itself is very clean and the suite very spacious. Thr concierge were friendly and helpful. The breakfast people were also very friendly. The only bad experience was the reception check-in person forcing us to upgrade from a king studio suite we had booked to a one bedroom suite because we had our young daughter (8 years old) with us. He claimed that it is "against the law to have more than 2 people in one bedroom"(??!) and she needed her own room. He would not let us check in if we did not upgrade. He initially wanted to charge us an extra ¬£36/day for the upgrade, but lowered it to ¬£20/day after we argued about having to upgrade and a line had formed behind us. So we were forced to accept the upsell, which seemed dishonest to me.

Have stayed here routinely and they deserve a shout out for being so friendly and conscious of their guess from previous stays.Rooms are spacious and reasonable with a location near the Olympic venues that make it a different place to go if you are looking to see a different part of London.  Transportation links are really good from here.Highly recommend.

I went to London on 03/ 09/ 2018 the hotel we stayed in was amazing. the perfect location. it was right in the middle of a mall all the shopping  you want. Casino underground station every kind of restaurant you can think of.  the hotel was very clean. free breakfast every morning. I mean a full breakfast.the staff was at your beckon call. I  will stay there every time am in London.

I booked the staybrude suits through booking.com for ¬£104 a night cheaper than the premuir inn in Stratford and this included breakfast. Lovely room with a small kitchen, desk comfortable bed and nice bathroom with a shower. Bed lovely everything very clean lots of extras like Apple tv a nespresco coffee machine smelled in the bathroom and an iPhone thing that you could take out in London for free to make calls and use the internet. Breakfast fantastic so much choice.. Lovely latte machine fresh bread cereal and hit selection. Will definatly book this hotel again I'm a nurse so I also found out I woukd have got a 15% discount through the hotel win win üòÅ

My husband and I stayed here for one night whilst in the city to see a show at the theatre and do some shopping; we were very impressed by this property and will not hesitate to stay here again - hopefully for longer.Primarily, the location is excellent- right in the middle of Stratford shopping centre and with all the rail, bus and tube links you need to access central London, airports etc.The staff were very friendly and accommodating and even managed to get us a room when we checked in early.  The room was very comfortable, extremely well appointed - especially if you‚Äôre staying for a longer period as it has cooking facilities, fridge, dishwasher etc!  The bed was comfortable, bathroom and shower excelllent and everything spotlessly clean.The included breakfast with all stays is really great, and good quality too.  I believe complimentary snacks are available week nights also, which would be great if you were there.  There is also a den/communal relaxing area that is welcoming.We couldn‚Äôt believe the facilities and inclusions on offer in this property, especially given its location - it really is great value for money and we will definitely use it again in the future.

column9: Great stay and will go again.
column10: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel as we were wanting to go shopping at Westfield and then out in the evening and I am glad we did. I decided to book with them direct over the phone and evetything from then on was great. We were given a warm welcome and everything was explained to us in regards check in check out, breakfast times etc. The breakfast in the morning was great and you could just help yourself to anything from a full english to a continental.  I especially liked the Pantry they had on site were you could get a beer for your room, crisps, sweets etc etc.  The free WiFi worked perfectly and could stream youtube with ease. I will be staying again. Lovely views of london also over breakfast which was great.

This must rate as one of our most favourite hotel stays. Right from the start the booking process was very simple and we felt valued as loyalty programme members. There was a very warm welcome when we arrived at Reception and when we got to our room there was everything we could possibly need for our 2 night stay. Breakfast the next morning was superb, almost felt like being at home where someone has already shopped for all your favourites. Staff too were all very friendly and we definitely look forward to our next visit.

We stayed at the suite. It was really nice. Only in the toilet there is no lock. My daughter stayed with us. So it was awkward. Breakfast was really nice. We enjoyed a lot. Excellent atmosphere and staffs are really attentive.

We stayed 2 nights with my wife and 16 month old daughter.The roomeas spacious,clean with all the things you have at home.The breakfast was a fantastic experience with lovely,polite,happy and smiling people ready to help.Stefan,Antonela,Mayra,Ioana we thank you from the bottom of our heart.I can talk about you for hours.With regards to the location its in Westfield shopping center and everything is within walking distance.Cental and Jubille lines make down town London 20 mins away.See you soon!

column9: Best staff and hotel ever. Mainly staff!
column10: The staff here are willing to go above and beyond for customer satisfaction! I speak mainly of Valerie, Ionna and Greg! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I‚Äôm definitely coming back here next time I‚Äôm in the UK. Well done!

My husband & myself had our 2nd stay here approx a month ago - our son has bought a flat close by so it‚Äôs a perfect spot. It‚Äôs clean, welcoming & parking is brilliant in the shopping centre. The staff are all very friendly, especially a lady called Lisa who was working in the dining room on both occasions that we went to breakfast.We will certainly return here - everything on hand as well in Westfield

Worst experience of our lives!  Terrible check in service, foreign girl with limited english who just wanted to hand over keys and bolt, after taking our credit card details for the deposit.  The location of the property was ideal for our stay and the views of the Olympic Park etc were magnificent. However, the property was dirty (including the linen) and trashed, we took photos of all the evidence.We phoned the agent who promised a cleaner etc within the hour, who obliviously never showed, Check out was to leave the keys on on kitchen table and leave the door on the latch which we thought was very unsecured. Luckily we never received any extra charges for previous damage done.  We booked through booking.com and are surprised that they associate themselves with such a poor property.

column9: Big room, but air conditioning didn‚Äôt work!
column10: Seeing as this was a four star hotel I expected to have a room where I was not freezing all the time, I booked a one bedroom suite and spent most of the time cold, I alerted a member of staff who got the duty manager to come to my room and informed me it would be fixed, all throughout the night it was freezing, when I informed the receptionist at checkout she didn‚Äôt really care, would not stay again! The room was nice and big that‚Äôs the only positive to say.

I stayed in this hotel for a night. Well located (i.e. 4 metro stops from Canary Wharf) and directly in the middle of a shopping zone (Westfield shopping mall in Stradford City).The rooms are furnished suites with fully equipped kitchen (e.g. pans, dishwasher, plates, mugs, cutlery, etc).  Great hotel for business purposes (iron and ironing table provided)The breakfast included in the price is delicious with endless possibilities and fresh products.

column9: Always a pleasure to stay here
column10: If you visit London Staybridge Suites is the place to stay, the rooms are superb just like having your own apartment with all the kitchen appliances, dishwasher, microwave etc.If you are an IHG rewards customer you can secure a good rate for the room.

column9: Fine room but I prefer Holiday inn
column10: Holiday inn and Staybridge suites are operated in the same tower and belong to the same network of hotels. The hotels are similar but the suites sre designed to providd more "at home" experience with laid back decor and staff atmosphere. I'm not sure why but Holiday inn appeals more to me but I would definitely recommend this stay.

column9: Excellent stay, good alternative to the hotel
column10: Lots of space with really comfortable bed, nice walk in shower and kitchen which was equipped very well.Good breakfast included with a pancake machine.  Can take coffee, muffins away for an 'on the go' breakfast.Imagine it is very busy during the work week, it was quite busy on the Saturday night as well.Would recommend to all - great place with very helpful staff.

I stayed for 2 nights with my daughter and we were made to feel at home from the minute we arrived. I have previously stayed here on a number of occasions. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the location is perfect for shopping and for traveling around London, thanks to Stratford being a London transport hub. The rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed. The hotel facilities and social nights on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday are first class. The staff were friendly and welcoming across the board, especially Andre and Valerii at reception who were so helpful and demonstrated fantastic customer service skills. I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel and it‚Äôs staff highly enough. Thanks for another great stay.

column9: The place to stay in Stratford
column10: I visit and stay in Stratford about twice a year having studied here in the eighties.I usually stay at the Premier Inn, which is fine but I decided to stay here instead due to the great offer.It is ideally situated in the middle of all the shops and far easier to find than other hotels in the area. Good directions to it.We arrived before the check in time but managed to get a room due to the very welcoming and friendly reception staff.Nothing was too much for them and they provided lots of information on the suites.As for the room itself it was large, well appointed and extremely clean. I particularly like the details about leaving guests to lie in if they are staying for more than one night in regards the the chamber maids.I had an excellent night's sleep too.I didn't eat here as there are too many tempting restaurants nearby.I will certainly stay here again.

the stadium bar was a great place for a quiet drink and nice meal. The staff were exceptionally friendly . I was looked after by Jack who is a credit to his employers. He couldn't have been more helpful

column9: Exceptional visit with 1st class guest services
column10: The first thing to note about the hotel is the approaches. The location is superb, 7 min from London Kings Cross and set Inn the heart of Stratford.  A shoppers paradise, football lovers dream and if you like to eat out you ain't be disappointed.  The rail links are great. upon entering the hotel we were given a warm welcome from Sal, who directed us to the lift to reception.  We were warmly greeted as guests of the day and were given a prompt and thorough check in delivered with great personality and smiles from Mariana? And Anna, who both made a great impression and continued to be very accommodating throughout the early evening in the very well appointed self service style Bar/pantry/ breakfast area, where you are made to feel right at home.  As we entered our room, 1125,  we were extremely impressed wth the size, immaculate condition and how well it has been finished and appointed throughout, perfect!  On top of this we were greeted with a bed covered in roses wth accompanying towel swans/chocolate and wine, these small but important touches certainly helped my husband points on valentine's Day.  This combined with the exceptional service with personality was critical to going the extra mile, the team at Staybridge certainly love and breath this.  We then enjoyed drinks and nibbles at the bar before retiring for an excellent sleep on a very comfy mattress in a well air conditioned room.  Breakfast was great,  enchanting setting with a homely feel and great views over the London skyline, full and continental option available.  Check out at 12 was brilliant, the ladies were very engaging, their name's escape me as i may have been suffering from dehydration ;) but they delivered 1st class service with 5 star smile and left me smiling.  I'd like to thank the whole team on behalf of my wife and I for an amazing stay.  We are planning our next visit already and be sure to stay with work when traveling in future.  Thank you.

column9: Good value for size of room
column10: Stayed here one night with work. Not sure if I would pick Stratford to stay in of an evening otherwise admittedly as I live in Greater London.Paid about ¬£170 and got a decent sized room, with separate kitchen diner. Could buy in food and cook if you wanted.  Clean and in good condition. Breakfast not included.Hotel well located at Stratford Westfield. Right by station for getting into London, and just outside the Olympic Park. I went to the Olympic swimming pool the next morning as very convenient.

column9: Perfect & Memorable Stay - Impressed by Staff
column10: I would not shy away to say this - I had an amazing stay at staybridge suites - Stratford. The credit for this goes to the wonderful staff members - MD,Anna,Georgiana who have always been approachable, helpful & friendly. I never felt I was away from my home/country due to the comfort levels I experienced while being here. The rooms were perfect - Apple TV, High Speed Wifi, Kitchen to name a few. The morning breakfast + socials were a big hit too :). I don't have anything to say for any improvement areas as such. Great job Team IHG - StayBridge Suites,Stratford.

Nice clean, new style rooms... intrigued by the kitchen in the room.  Lovely bathroom, nice amenities.  Breakfast was a bit hit and miss, and quite noisy. Recommended for a quick overnight stay and very close the the Westfield shopping complex

I stay here regularly on business and can't fault the place. Of special mention are the excellent staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home, especially MD and Valeric. I'd definitely recommend. Steve.

We had a lovely stay for just one night and were made to feel very welcome. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Lisa gave me lots of advice about places to visit and sights to see. Very informative and very useful. Will definitely stay again. Thanks to everyone x

I stayed at this hotel with my wife for one night at the weekend. This is the second time we have used this hotel. The check-in process was very easy and Anna who served us was a credit to the hotel, friendly, polite and informative. The room was easily one of the best we have stayed in. This includes numerous hotels in London that rate very highly on this sight. We stayed in one of the two roomed sweets and wanted for nothing. Very spacious well equipped and with a bath and shower in the ensuite. Being on the 12th floor the views were impressive but due to the aspect we couldn‚Äôt see any of London‚Äôs iconic landmarks (you may get this on the other side) We had breakfast in the morning which had a vast array of food to choose from and took it back to our room, though the restaurant area was very pleasant, spacious and again with amazing views (12th floor again). We checked out and this time it was Maria‚Äôs turn to represent the company and again she was a credit to them. I would say that all staff we had dealings with were very well trained and very friendly and polite. We will definitely be back and anyone considering a stay in London should have this hotel on their shortlist. if you are including shopping at Westfield its a must!!

Stayed here two weeks ago. We arrived at mid day and our room ready for us ! The staff were really friendly,showed us were the coffee machines were,and it was free                                                                .24 - 7.In the evening we went to see a show and the staff printed out a map for us showing what tube station to get off at.    The hotel is right opposite Olympic Park,we could see it from our room,good to walk around,lots to see,you can 'RIDE THE SLIDE' if you dare, 175 M in a tunnel !!

We have stayed here a few times when we go and watch West Ham play at the stadium. The rooms or suites are really nice and have some great views across the city.Great location for both stadium and shopping. Breakfast is buffet style with a good choice. We wouldn‚Äôt stay anywhere else in Stratford.

Enjoyed a lovely stay at the Staybridge Hotel Stratford.The Suites were lovely and the staff friendly.Breakfast was very nice with a small selection of cooked food as well as hams cheese and muffins. Also a selection of tea coffee and juice.Will be back again soon

I stayed four nights at the Staybridge Suites, Stratford. I booked a studio suite which has a more than adequate floor space for a single person and I would not have felt cramped if staying with my partner.Great layout, the door to the corridor open into the kitchen area, meaning when in the sleeping area you could not hear anyone on the corridor outside. The kitchen was a great size, well equipped with nice touches such as a non stick frying pan, after all who wants to buy a bottle of oil just for a couple of nights stay? Plenty of crockery, cutlery and glassware. A whole selection of cooking utensils, a combination microwave/grill, hob, dishwasher, coffee pod machine and even tea towels, kitchen roll, washing up liquid and dishwasher tablets.The bedroom area was spacious with plenty of hanging space and hangers, ironing board (although the iron wasn't great). Bed and pillows were the comfiest I have experienced in a hotel for a good while. Room temperature was perfect and I had no need to alter it, in fact I didn't even look for the thermostat, again unusual when staying away from home. The bathroom had a huge shower cubical and plenty of storage space. Basic toiletries were provided (soap, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner). Unexpected room servicing every day, however the whole suite and hotel was exceptionally clean and tidy. The reception/lounge area in the main hotel was a lovely surprise with free tea and coffee available all day and a great view over Stratford City. The evening social hour was another vey welcome surprise with free wine and a selection of snacks and gave me the opportunity to relax with colleagues some evenings.Breakfast choices were good, fresh fruit, yoghurt, porridge, toast, pastries, cheese, cereals and a selection of hot food and paper takeaway bags were provided for those in too much of a rush to eat at the hotel.My only problem was an issue with connection to the wifi, multiple members of staff attempted to help with no avail and unfortunately the company they use to provide IT support were not at all helpful, one evening we made six attempts to speak to someone about the issue and they cut us off. The staff at the apartments could not have been more sympathetic and apologetic and this was an issue that was out of their control.I am so pleased I tried the suites out on this trip, I will definitely be back, the best serviced apartments I have stayed in to date.

Stopped over here on a Saturday as I need to be in Olympic Park early on a Sunday. Fantastic location, loads of great restaurants nearby but actually much nicer to cook in the studio! Fully equipped kitchen, small but perfectly adequate when cooking for two. Every member of staff we met was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic and the views are brilliant! Proper hair dryer  in the room and the showers are huge! Everything very clean. So much nicer than staying in a hotel, would definitely reccommend

I have stayed at the Staybridge Suites a number of times over the past year.This week when I went to check in it turned out that I had mixed up my booking dates and had a booked the day before I arrived. The staff, MD and Anna, were extremely helpful and understanding in resolving my error and rebooking for correct period and amending billing so that I was not charged as a "no show" for previous day.Well done - service like this is why I continue to use the Staybridge Suites and other hotels within the IHG group. :).

My husband and I stayed at Staybridge Suites Stratford from December 22nd-January 2nd. Stratford is located in and around a shopping plaza called Westfield. Westfield and the hotel is a 36 min tube (train/underground) ride to Hyde Park. You can get there by the tube, taxi, uber, and bus. Because you are surrounded by a mall, you have access to many restaurants and several grocery stores. The hotel comes equipped with a stovetop, microwave, fridge, sink,dishwasher, counter space, and the basics needed if you are wanting to make a basic meal or heat up leftovers.Check in was quick and easy, as I had already paid for my room in advance on hotels.com. The concierge was very nice and helpful as we entered the hotel he gathered our luggage together and brought it up to us in our room. The hotel seems small when you first enter, but is quite spacious. The lobby has seating, a business center, snacks to buy, and is where breakfast is served in the morning.The room was nice, with a comfortable bed, good size bathroom, and amazing view of the city.  Because it was Christmas time and some places were closed for the holiday, we enjoyed time in our room. We bought some food from Marks and Spencer and didn't even turn the t.v on that day. We ordered room service a few times and what we ordered was very nice. It came exactly how we wanted, was warm or cold when it needed to be, and was a decent price based on the amount of food you received. One place that this hotel shines is in their breakfast. Lots of seating, tons of options, and friendly and accommodating staff. I am a vegetarian and just had to ask and they would make me Linda McCartney sausage to go with my breakfast every morning. The options available for breakfast were incredible. Pancakes, eggs, beans, hash browns, mushrooms. bacon, sausage, cereals, toast, bagels, muesli, porridge, yogurt, fruit, juices, milk, etc. If you can, make sure you take advantage of this amazing breakfast. Yum! I felt safe at this hotel, and had so many options for shopping and eating, that you could practically just stay there the entire time. Of course we wanted to do some sightseeing, so we used our oyster cards which we bought with a London Pass and would head into central London every day. You can get the Jubilee and Central lines into/from central London at this station. From the hotel you take the stairs, escalator, or elevator to the ground level and you can get the tube right there. There are also many bus options available on the other side of the mall, or taxi's are usually waiting right there as well. The tube takes roughly 36 min to get into central London. The bus takes around one hour and fifteen minutes, taxi's/ubers can do it in round nineteen minutes, but plan on it taking longer. Average cost in a black cab from Hyde Park to the mall entrance/tube entrance is roughly 40-45 pounds. If you are in a wheelchair, have the cab driver take you around to Hitchcock Ln and you will have a flat entrance without having to wait on the elevator.  Also keep in mind-when telling the driver that you want taken to Westfield Mall-there is more than one. So be sure that you say in Stratford City. The hotel can arrange a lift for you. Just speak with the concierge and they can set something up at a flat rate. We had a ride to St. Pancras station and to Heathrow. This hotel is really amazing. If I had to name one downside--and it really only has one in my opinion--is that it takes a while to get into central London. My husband and I enjoy the tube, so it was not a big deal to us at all. Again, the room was nice, staff was amazing, and breakfast was amazing. The mall gives you so many options for food and shopping, if you are going to London to shop and eat---definitely look into this hotel. Ps. On Christmas Day we received a card under our door from the staff wishing us a Happy Christmas. It was a nice touch. Whether you celebrate it or not, it is the thought behind it that was really endearing.

Compared to staying in normal hotels, the Staybridge is in a league of its own.  The room was very spacious and well furnished with a kitchenette, digital assistant and nespresso coffee machine.The check in service was very efficient and friendly, and there was an interesting social held with complimentary food and drink.The breakfast was very good as well, including proper orange juice from a carton opposed to a watered down mix as you sometime get from the machines elsewhere.I could not recommend more highly this is definitely the hotel which I now check availability for first when required to stay in London.

The best dealing with reception I‚Äôve ever had as an IHG Spire member, thank you Georgiana.  We stayed as a large group for NYE, rooms in superb condition, bathrooms especially spacious. Breakfast good.  Location to tube system and shops superb.

I use this hotel quite regularly for business. Park in Westfield (¬£6 per day) and then an easy tube in to the city. Rooms are spacious, clean and modern. Breakfast spread is great. 24 hour pantry of snacks also a nice touch.

column9: 5* Innovative hotel - staff v professional - location ideal
column10: Innovative hotel:Lounge, breakfast, chill out room (like a living room at home) were all perfect, including stunning night and daytime views over South East London, including  Canary Wharf, Shard, O2 arena and the Olympic Park.  Those views were possible because the communal areas are on the 12th floor, facing South East.Our 'Deluxe Studio Suite' was spacious, with more than one chair to sit on!  Our room, 1212, had the views described above.  Kitchen facilities in the room were amazing.  Window opened - another plus point.Staff v professional:Reception, breakfast and cleaning staff were all attentive, polite and working hard to provide a 5* level of service.  All took a pride in their jobs.Location Ideal:From St Pancras, we could use our Oyster cards to get to Westfield (Stratford International) in 7 mins.  Trains run approx. every 15 mins.  From there it was a five minute walk to the hotel.We came to London on the train, arriving at St. Pancras.  The idea was to explore Westfield shopping centre and Stratford, look at the Olympic Pool, see an evening football match at the Olympic/London stadium and check out the casino at Westfield.  We did all of those.This hotel turned out to be the perfect place to stay.  We would return and recommend others to stay as well.About usMarried couple, aged 63.  We're used to independent travel and exploring new areas.

a beautiful hotel. very neat and quite beautiful. i loved the shower. it was exaclty how i like it (big, modern and also very clean).nice and helpful staff. the location of the hotel is perfect as it is basically in the mall (stratford mall), with a lot of stores and restaurants around.if you need a nice place to stay for business or even for vacation with your family, this is a wonderful place to stay.added bonus is the kitchenette did i mention the hotel was neat and quiet?

Loved this hotel, it has everything you could want and more. Lovely room fitted with a fully working kitchen and great views. The breakfast is great, and the service there is great! Defiantly recommend a stay here, but it‚Äôs on the slightly more expensive side

We stayed here whilst attending a gig at the London Stadium and while it was really expensive you cannot fault the convenience if you wanted to stay over and be in close proximity to the venue. We booked an one bedroom apartment which was really lovely with all mod cons including a fully functional kitchen, a separated sitting area, spacious bathroom and a really comfortable bed and we could quite easily stayed here for a month. One problem after checking in though was when we went to our room we was given a small double room by mistake (not what we had paid for) so after going down to reception again it was quickly sorted out but in my opinion it should not have happened in the first place. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we was given a complimentary drink and snack for the mistake they made regarding our room. Breakfast was satifactory nothing special with a limited choice but we did have this fantastic view overlooking London and there was also an unlimited supply of hot drinks which was available during our stay. We would certainly recommend these Suites and would stay here again just a shame its so expensive when a concert is on.

This was our first stay at a Staybridge and we weren't sure what to expect. The hotel isn't well signposted from the car park however we discovered that parking in row 107 in carpark B was ideal. Once we got to the top floor of the hotel and entered the reception, we found it to be very welcoming and homely. Receptionist was very friendly and explained everything including the free hot drinks in the kitchen at any time. The hotel has a complimentary laundry should you require And has a very good 'chillout' zone with games and books (to be enjoyed with a complimentary cuppa) Rooms were generous with a kitchenette and expected amenities. We did have issues with the heating as it wasn't heating the room up at all and when we switched off the heating... the room actually heated up. Would have liked an extra blanket / pillows to be stored in the wardrobes. Breakfast was a basic spread with a fancy pancake maker and fizzy drinks (*who would dare*) A lovely touch was that the hotel placed a personalised Xmas card on the Christmas Tree which was a nice gesture. Did use the laundrette and found that the dryer wasn't very good at drying and took 3 attempts. However was ok. Overall a good experience and would definitely book again if in the area.

We stayed for 3 nights December 2017. We booked here to do our Christmas shopping as the hotel is right in Westfield shopping centre. We have visited this hotel on many occasions and have never been disappointed. We were ungraded to a One bedroom suite. The suite has a separate bedroom and lounge area, the bathroom is a good size with a decent size walk-in shower which was so powerful.The room is very modern spotless clean. The bedroom is big with a tv,the bed is very comfortable, plenty of cupboard space. The lounge has seating with a good size tv it‚Äôs open planed with a kitchen that has microwave  fridge and all cooking utensils.We could not fault anything with the room. Breakfast is included and is excellent. We find the staff all very friendly and helpful. This hotel is very good value and will definitely be returning

We stayed at the Holiday inn Staybridge Suites London- Stratford City over the Christmas break. The staff were extra nice, warm and friendly (possibly due to the festive season). The environment is clean, the room was cosy and comfortable. The bathroom a little small but nice, it has a shower not a bath, so if you are planning for a soak, look elsewhere.  You nee¬£ to go with your own bedroom slipper as they don‚Äôt have any complimentary ones. The kitchen was quite equipped with pots, fry pan ,kitchen roll, washing up liquid etc. The fridge is a fairly good size and you have a 2 electric burner. You also have a microwave/oven/grill combo. I particularly enjoyed the Nespresso machine which has 4 complimentary pods. We had complimentary breakfast with a fair variety. Basic really. Limited hot options. Great view from the 12ft floor while enjoying your meal. Rates ranges between ¬£120-140 for a studio apartment. On website was showing ¬£82 which excludes Vat. Overall, good value for money. I will definitely stay there again.

We stayed here as a couple and the service was terrible. There is clearly no communication between the hotel housekeeping department and the front of the house. I sent my laundry on the 22nd December and was hoping to collect it on the 23rd December @1900 hrs (as stated in the paper) so that I will be able to check out early the next morning. However, as I waited from 1900 hrs till 2350 hrs, nothing came. I was told by the front staff that the housekeeping usually keeps the laundry in the room and that they have no access to the housekeeping rooms that keeps my laundry till the next day when they come back again.I waited till 1100 hrs the next morning for the laundry to arrive but yet it is still not here. Hence, I called the front office again and they asked me to go up to collect it from them instead. I went up and was attended by Andre' and he REPLIED THE SAME THING: TO WAIT FOR MY LAUNDRY IN THE ROOM. WHAT KIND OF 4 STAR HOTEL ASKS THEIR GUESTS TO COLLECT THEIR OWN LAUNDRY? I had no choice but to feel angry and betrayed as I was asked to go up to collect it myself. In addition, Andre' is very rude and he just brushes me off like I am one of his subordinates. Apparently, the blonde front of office staff whom I did not manage to get her name do not communicate the information to Andre' hence he has no idea what transpired in the phone conversation. That doesn't give Andre' a reason to be condescending in his tone with me especially since it is Xmas eve.For the same amount of money, you can get a smaller hotel room BUT WITH BETTER SERVICE in central London.The hotel is a 4 star hotel yet it does not have basic amenities such as a business centre for the guests to print out itineraries for their tour. When asked, front of office staff asked me to send the document to guestservices and they will print the document to me. When I sent it over, they told me that they cannot open the file.They had to direct me to Level 3, Holiday Inn to print it out. Just to let you know, Holiday Inn and Staybridge Suites are in the same building but different lifts access the hotels. Therefore, I had to take the lift to the Ground floor, change lifts and proceed to Level 3 to Holiday Inn to print a document. Staybridge Suites is known to have a well stocked pantry where they overcharge their guests for simple treats like Coke, cup noodles and biscuits. However, the only thing that they don't have is ICE. Apparently the ice machine broke down since the end of November yet nothing has been done till Xmas. Therefore, I would strongly recommend for guests to avoid this hotel as it is getting too complacent after all the wonderful reviews put up here. I have been staying annually in this hotel since the London Olympics and the service had been impeccable till I arrived this year.

column9: Simply amazing service, kudos for such an awesome service guys!!!!!!
column10: Well i want to congratulate the entire management and staff of this hotel on doing such an amazing job. The staff is very courteous, polit and extremely helpful.Pros- Wonderful location- Nice and spacious rooms- Wonderful centrally heated rooms- Excellent room cleaning service- The views from the rooms are majestic- Closeness to the underground tube station- Clean rooms- Courteous and helpful hotel staff- Wonderful dining area on th 12th floor- The suites have an inbuilt kitchen and wonderful service- Amazing service by the house keeping staff- Breakfast is niceNow some individual mentions -1. Stefen at the 12th floor restaurant is amazing. He is motivated and positive and always ready to help. I think he did a great job.2. Lisa, Antonella and Andreeda are amazing in there service on the 12th floor restaurant, they were always ready to help.3. MD and Mariya at the reception were great and helpful4. Vanadio at the ground floor is nice and helpful, always smiling and helping.5. Marco was helpful in resolving queries so well done.Overall the entire staff was simply fantastic. Will definitely come over and stay at this place next time and also recommend to other people.Cheers guys!

Stayed there for a trip to the theatre, 10 minute walk to Stratford station so easy access to central London. Staff  were helpful room was clean and plenty of good quality toiletries. Wi-Fi ok breakfast was good. Plenty of restaurants and bars close by.

Stayed here as a family with a 1 year Old.Great location, can get to any part of London using the train station which is a 2 minute walk away and is situated within Westfield (Stratford) Shopping centre.The room had its own little kitchen, sink, pots, pans, cutlery etc, very well equipped.The breakfast could be slightly improved if more  hot food was available otherwise no complaints. My son loved the Fresh Pancakes which get made in front of you using the ‚ÄúPancake Machine‚ÄùThe customer Service was also excellent, big smiles and staff always willing to help when you need it, great example was when we left my sons Favourite toy in the room, the staff were helpful in keeping it safe for me to pick it up the following day. Would definitely return!

A nice hotel, breakfast included with many options. Located right within the Westfield Mall. Shopping and many restaurants to choose from. Also right across from casino too. Choose this over the Holiday Inn which is in the same building.

Stayed here at the weekend, the location is fab with nice shops and restaurants at your door and none of the frantic madness of central London to deal with.The room was spacious and comfortable although the bed was hard.    We also had a really annoying green light which lit up the whole room all night, I believe this was because it was an 'assisted' room but for someone who can't sleep with light I found it awful so be aware!The breakfast was fantastic, wide range including hot food and lots of juices.Highly recommended just avoid the assisted rooms (we had room 902)

We stayed for 3 nights, whilst attending the tennis at the O2. A good location for this, as only 2 stops away on the Jubilee line  Being in Westfield the choice of restaurants in the immediate area and transport to the rest of London was great..We were really impressed with the hotel and found It a much better option than the Holiday inn that it shares the  building with. All the staff were magnificent, and a big thank you to Georgiana, and everybodyThe room was excellent, with a good sized bathroom and good views of the London sky line. We did not use the kitchenette, other than the coffee machine. A big plus that a proper Nespresso machine was in the room..Also,a good breakfast was supplied,(Soy milk was  available) and coffee is also available for 24 hours a day.We arrived on a Wednesday and went to the guest social that evening which was really generous with complimentary wine and hot and cold food available . I understand that this is organised every Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, so we were sorry only to have been able to take advantage onceOur only gripe was that the pillows were too hard for us, but this is a personal taste and those supplied were of a good quality. We asked for replacements for the 2nd and 3rd nights but these were not much better, I have been assured that they will remedy this on future visits. The matter was well dealt with on check out.We were on the 8th floor ( the lowest) but well away from the lift as requested , sadly, the guests above us were noisy- not the hotels fault..Despite the pillows I would have no hesitation in staying again and have given a 5* rating. I am really looking forward to finding a reason to return. Thank you to everybody concerned.for a magnificent and enjoyable stay

A lovely welcoming hotel, from the concierge on the ground floor entrance to the reception staff on the 12th floor, everyone was extremely friendly & helpful. A fresh and clean suite with everything we needed for our overnight stay. So easy to park the car in the Westfield shopping centre & only a couple of minutes walk away. From the hotel it was a five minute to the underground station and only 2 stops to the O2 arena. Breakfast was very well stocked and plenty of room to sit. Would definitely stay here again.

I'd never stayed in Stratford before for my commute to the O2, but this worked really well. Just a short walk to all the transport links, and felt safe and busy even late at night. Hotel works more like apartments, so for an extended stay, it is ideal - ie limited room servicing to essentials (towels, bathroom, empty bins, etc) and but you can ask for more.Wonderfully equipped kitchenette, great breakfast choices (including the option to take away or return to your room), and exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. I will definitely return‚Äîeven if it is just for a shopping trip to Westfield rather than business.

Hotel was nice and great location. Only area that lacked was the cleanliness of the bathroom. When moved shower door, line of mildew (i.e. under shower glass needed to be cleaned). Also found blonde hair in cubicle (neither of us are blonde).

column9: Staybridge deserves the tag line ‚ÄúWelcome Home‚Äù
column10: Thanks for memorable stay in my second home. This is all because of the staff who works there to make your stay unforgettable. MD the person whom i will call ‚ÄúProblem Solver‚Äù had made my visit pleasant. I recommend everyone to book stay at least one time and then you will automatically book it second time... its true Staybridge is home away from home. Thanks MD, georgia and other staff... All my buddies go for this hotel...

What a great place to stay. We booked adjoining rooms as we had teenagers with us and this place is difficult to fault, incredibly good value, excellent location, first class rooms (they even give you essentials such as dishwasher tablets, washing up liquid et), so convenient for shops, restaurants and public transport, also thanks to all the team. Can‚Äôt wait to return!

Gave a four on the hotel itself but only a 2 on our stay. Our 2nd night was ruined by a woman with a big gob in room 1102 who never stopped arguing with her bloke all night. Poor man. Check in was good and room also very good. Would definately stay again. Rate also comes with a nice help yourself breakfast

Got here at night and ohh my the Beauty with all the lights. Clean, spacious and beautiful rooms, great location and a beautiful view. It‚Äôs near the Westfield mall which operates almost 24 hours, transportation is no problem . Value for money indeed üëå

Location, location, location. Westfield mall, Stratford Station, everything you need is right out the front door. Was a pleasant surprise when we arrived as we didn‚Äôt look up the location that closely when we booked it.

column9: Fantastic Hotel in an Amazing Location
column10: The hotel is located in a fantastic location. Even though the hotel is located in the East of London, it is conveniently located a mere 400m from Stratford Station, which is connected to the Jubilee Line and Central Line, as well as the Overground. This makes it easy to travel to Central London for the day. Additionally, as the hotel is essentially located within Westfield Stratford City, a massive shopping centre, it is also easy to spend the day shopping a stone's throw away from your room without having to step foot in Central London at all. Not only this, but it is also an easy walk to the Olympic Park, West Ham's home stadium, as well as the Aquatic Centre, all of which are attractions that was easy to visit while we were staying there. As for the hotel itself, the staff were fantastic and went above and beyond to make their customers feel welcome. My mum and my aunts flew in from Singapore and reached the hotel at around 8am, while I joined them much later. Upon my mum and aunts reaching the hotel, the staff were attentive, and as the rooms were not yet available, and seeing that they were tired, offered all three of them a complimentary breakfast at the restaurant, seeing as they could tell that my mum and aunts had taken a long flight and were tired. This made their first day in London so much better as they were able to recharge, and explore the city with much more energy. The free breakfast that came with the rooms was also excellent, serving a wide variety of cooked items, and cereals and yoghurt, with some items being changed daily. There was also a pancake making machine that made fresh pancakes with a mere push of a button, and the pancakes made were delicious too! The rooms that we were given were also fantastic, and had a great view of the East of London, and came with tea making facilities, and coffee in the form of a Nespresso machine. The rooms also included a small kitchenette that was fully equipped with cooking utensils that one could use to make a proper meal during their stay. While we did not use the kitchenette, the stay couldn't be more enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in London while on holiday.

Stayed here few times, really spacious hotel, well they are all apartments so plenty room, good location, part of Westfield shopping centre in Stratford so good links to underground,restaurants,bars!!

Stunning room with everything you can expect from a hotelThe breakfast was simply delicious with so much variety and choice. The beds are so comfy! Didnt want to get up. Totally recommend this hotel well done all

We used this facility twice for all-day team meetings. The meeting room itself was very comfortable with soft seating in the room as well as a good sized table and chairs. Service was good and A/V support was quickly provided when called for. The food service is less appealing and the lunch pre-order menu is limited. On a tighter budget this did not matter. We would use this facility again for similar meetings.

column9: The bathroom has been nicely upgraded
column10: Am an IHG platinum member, so my room was upgraded. Thanks for the nice gesture. Nice improvements to the bathroom, i enjoyed the bath and the shower pressure. Location is the best thing for me here especially if you love shopping. Right next to Westfield.Breakfast was had the same items throughout, nothing changed.

If you are looking for a hotel where you can feel so welcomed...go to this hotel. Excellent breakfast. Big rooms (to be London). Just perfect. We were so confi at breakfast time. Antonella is a very good server. The other servers are so good too. The only downfall is that that our room had some stains on the carpet (room 1132). Choose this hotel, just excellent.

column9: Good but they do not knock your dor before getting in
column10: The hotel is in a very good location, near the best shops in Stratford and the Queen Elisabeth Ol√≠mpic park. Good bead and sheets.Good kitchen area.Very silent. The breakfast is ok  not excelent.The cleaner could be better they do not clean behind the doors.And the worst thing about this place is that they break in to your roon without asking, neither a nock on the doors.

We stayed here as we were attending an event at O2 arena. Easy to park in the car park close by. We received a warm greeting from the Concierge on the ground floor before taking the lift to reception which is on 12th floor. A great welcome at reception and a quick check in. The room was up to the usual high Staybridge standard. There was a small sitting room which included the well stocked kitchen.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom spotlessly clean.  We were only there for one night so didn't use the kitchen other than the fridge to keep the wine cool! A selection of snacks, meals and beverages are available at reception.  In the morning we had breakfast, which was included in the rate, from the well stocked buffet. When we checked out the Concierge said goodbye, he gave a greeting every time we entered and left the building,  a nice touch.

column9: Good hotel located on a mall and on a transportation hub
column10: We stayed at this hotel three days on a family location. The hotel is on the 9-12 floors above Westfield Stratford city mall. There are also train and underground stations at this location so it is very easy to reach and use as a hub. The rooms are nice and spacious. Only double bad that cannot be separated (we traveled with two grownup sons).  The staff was very efficient and helpful. Breakfast (included) is very good with a wide selection. WIFI is free.

column9: An alternative to the Holiday Inn
column10: Having stayed at the Holiday Inn next door on a dozen occasions I then did a five week stint at the Staybridge Suites.  Overall it was a good experience but the advantages of having a small kitchenette did not outweigh for instance the fact that the hotel breakfast is a lot better than that in the Suites!Both places provide a good night's sleep as there's no traffic nearby and little other noise to be heard once you are a few floors above the shopping areas.And  have never stayed long enough in the hotel section to establish if they refuse to let you use your towels for more than one day.  That was maddening throughout the five weeks, I had to pin Postits to my towels begging the staff not to wash them after one shower, but no the planet died a little more, as towels were replaced in military style whether I wanted clean ones or not.  Frustrating.So a narrow win for the Holiday Inn over their Staybridge Suites sister next door. The latter is still a good option, though make sure you take plenty of Postits if you agree one person's private towels do not need replacing every day.....

Our Stay at Staybridge Suites was very comfortable. We had booked for 11 nights. The hotel staff specially Mr. Mizan was very hospitable and took care of us very well. Its truly a home away from home. To top it up, with professional and courteous people around you truly feel taken care off. The location is perfect with the central station nearby.

column9: Great place, we've had such a great time!
column10: Great hospitality, central train station nearby huge Westfield shopping center right in front of the hotel.The city center is just couple of mins away by train so you don't feel like you're out of the city.In addition Annas, the reception guy was so kind and helpful (ask him for cookies) üòú

stayed here for 15 days business visit this Aug. Location is perfect on red line and multiple train lines where ever you want go. Its inside the westfield mall which is huge, comfortable with all shopping and eating options , open late must for business travel.Rooms are comfortable ,modern,well maintained and cleaned daily.Complementary breakfast is good and complimentary social weekday hour for the drinks on the house is great.Check in is quick and warm , specially the front desk staff  Lucas He is helpful and welcoming . Also the staff at breakfast in morning helpful and welcoming.Keep up the  good work,

We have now stayed here twice. Once in a 1 bedroom deluxe suite and once in an Executive suite.  The location is excellent being adjacent to the Westfield Shopping Precinct, close to train stations and the former Olympic Park. The Fast train will have you in Kings Cross Station in 7 minutes.  This is a lovely property. The suites are spacious, have everything that you need and the beds comfortable. The rooms are pretty quiet but the higher floors are quieter. There are pleasant lounge areas on the 12th floor, a mini shop, meeting room and large breakfast area with great views over the Olympic precinct and surrounds. Breakfast is included and should not be missed. The best thing about this property are the staff who are very helpful, great to deal with and generally nice people. Greg on reception was exceptional. Rooms on the Olympic Park side are quieter.  This is a good alternative to stopping in central  London.  The precinct includes numerous restaurants and food outlets and ladies the shopping area is 2 minutes away from the hotel. Rates are normal for London but can leap up when events are on at the neighboring sports stadiums.  Only minor grievance is that the lifts are at one end of each floor which can mean a very long walk to your room.

Another amazing stay at the hotel, superb staff who go out of their way to make sure you have an incredible stay, thanks to Lucas, Sarah and MD (all true ambassadors for the brand) the room was amazing 1034 just a few little niggles, a small TV for such a large room, re-arrange the layout of the bed to include a mini-couch would be amazing, plus an additional chair for dining in and a small wardrobe not idea for 2 on a long stay..  Light switch a bit muddled but we got their in the end.  Yes will be back again as in a superb location and near to everything that you need.

Attached to the Holiday Inn within the Westfield complex this is a convenient location for shopping, the Olympic Village and business nearby. Good quality accommodation. The breakfast is considered to be complementary and of quite good quality but a bit limited when compared to the Holiday Inn next door. After a week it is lacking in variety. The really good thing is the provision of nibbles and complementary drinks on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings. When not complementary I found the drinks to be expensive with a pint of lager over ¬£6 and a large glass of red wine in excess of ¬£8. The room has a small kitchen with sink, fridge, dishwasher and microwave but the coffee machine only has 4 capsules, they are not replaced and there is no 'instant' alternative. You are invited to buy others if you use them up. Unlike in the hotel I think you are expected to do your own washing up even if all you use is a coffee cup, mine was untouched for four days.

This was our first time at Staybridge Suites. It certainly won't be our last as it was home from home. Beautiful accommodation, fabulous service all round. Reception staff couldn't do enough for us and Stefan (the supervisor) at breakfast was amazing along with all his staff. What a team. Cant wait to return. Ian & Joanne Ashby

column9: A bit far from the major London attractions, but worth it!
column10: This hotel is a dream come true for travelers who like a little more than a standard hotel room. Here are the deets: Room: updated, modern decor, clean, quiet, spacious, and well-equipped kitchen facilities. Staff: friendly, professional and competent.  View: Spectacular. Just like looking at a Richard Scarry Busytown book. Amenities: Great for international travelers. Breakfast and social hour had a great variety of foods and beverages, free laundry facilities (you have to pay for detergent), and a gym.  Location-super convenient to shopping, groceries, public transport. Wheelchair accessibility: Great. Only potential downsides to this hotel: about a 30 min ride in to major London attractions, and the rooms are not cheap. But these are minor compared to all the positives. Glad we found this place and will stay again.

column9: A home away from home, in London
column10: If you're staying in London, for more than a day or two, you should consider the Staybridge Suites Stratford City. Located at a very vibrant mall, and right next to the Stratford tube station, it is so convenient.  The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped.  The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the facilities are sharp, clean and beautiful.  Excellent views too!  This is where I will stay whenever I am in London.

Excellent location with comfortable bed, great services and friendly stAdd. I like the area and the location that the hotel nearby to Westfield mall and also near central London with a distance of 6 miles.I received an excellent welcome and kind reception as I'm Spire Eliet Ambassador member specially from Ms Georgiana at front desk reception

I have just stayed at the hotel for three and a half months while on business. This is my third long stay at this hotel in the past 18 months and never disappoints.  The hotel has a homely feel, The staff (Georgiana/ Stefan/MD and their colleagues)  always make me very welcome, and nothing is ever too much trouble for them. A great buffet style breakfast is served every morning with a variety of hot and could options. Social evenings are held on Mon - Weds, giving guests the chance to socialise over wine, beer and snacks. The studio room I stayed in was spacious with a small kitchenette. I had great views of the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those on long business trips, and a great base for tourists. The shopping mall is on your doorstep, the Olympic Park across the road, and there are good rail and tube links.
