Excellent Rooms with Kitchenette * Offers some good view of London from the hotel* Being within Stratford Mall area makes it very convenient for shopping and commute (Stratford - London Tube)* Breakfast offered is far better than some other similarly prices options (like Holiday Inn in same area)** Stay - October 2016

Recently spent three nights at the Staybridge and it was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Staff was welcoming and helpful throughout our visit. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The bed was very comfy, and the room temp was easily controlled. Lots of hot water for the shower, and plenty of soap, shampoo and towels. The breakfast offered a lot of variety. Location was perfect, sitting in the Westfield Mall, and adjacent to tube, DLR, bus, and overground stations. I would not hesitate to return.

A really well positioned hotel for events in the Olympic Park and right next to the train station. Lots of places to eat in the shopping centre in which it sits (and therefore pretty good for shopping too).  The hotel itself is as you would expect. Nice size rooms with kitchenette. Comfy and bright decor. Good offering at breakfast and very helpful and friendly staff. We've stayed here a few times now and will definitely go back.

Ok so the room was booked with Bookings.com and it was a good rate @ 120.00. We stayed one night 10th Sept. On arrival to check in, the reception was impressive. Checking went slowly as I think we were seen to by a new member of staff. I requested if there was a chance of late checkout and she replied the hotel was busy so check back in an hour. I mentioned it was my husband's birthday weekend but she didn't seem inspired enough to ask a senior colleague for assistance to see what could be done. So I was a tad miffed with her lack lustre approach.We got to the room, which contained the comforts of home. Microwave, dishwasher etc but I was surprised at first to size of the room. The pictures within Bookings. Com made it appear larger than what it was. The room was was clean with a view of the cinema and city. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept really well. The shower was superb.The only issue I had was the fact I had mentioned on Booking.com that it was my husbands birthday. Which you assumed they would share with the hotel. I spoke to another member of the reception team. A friendly young man, I wish I had taken his name as he was wonderful. I explained the scenarios of no late check out and no extras in the room etc. He instantly applied a late check out to our booking and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine, apologised for the inefficiency of Booking.com and even looked towards changing the room but the hotel was fully booked.Checked out today and updated  Georgina Chifu with our experience. She was fantastic and presented my husband with another bottle of wine. She advised we contact the hotel direct for special occasions, as they take pride in making a fuss of their guests.I do have two rooms booked for my 50 th birthday in Jan. So I will ensure the hotel is advised directly. Booking.com almost ruined what turned out to be a fabulous time, thanks to  the young man on reception yesterday evening and Georgina on checking out. They have a fantastic professional approach.The breakfast was fabulous too. So many choices of cereals, cooked or fresh fruit. Couldn't fault it üëçüëç

column9: Thank you to all the staff
column10: I have recently been staying at the Staybridge Suites Stratford and have found all of the facilities to be excellent and only out done by the welcoming attitude of the staff. In particular MD whose memory with regards to guest preferences and helpfulness has to be experienced to be appreciated. It is clear to see why he has a platinum award for customer services.Even though I stay on business the staff make you feel that you are one of the family and make the experience more like a vacation than a business trip.

Stayed here last night, it was awesome. Big comfortable room, excellent bathroom facilities and if that wasn't enough a small kitchen and complimentary breakfast on the 12th floor with magnificent views.I'll definitely be returning, thanks everyone for making this hotel so good.

This was our first time staying in this hotel, but it definitely won't be the last. The staff in reception are all so welcoming and friendly, the complimentary cookies on arrival went down a treat!!I had mentioned our stay was to celebrate my husband's birthday, so it was a lovely surprise to find a card and bottle of wine in our room.The room itself is lovely. Very clean and lots of little touches to make it extra special. Really comfortable bed, amazing shower and everything you need in the kitchenette. We were so tired tonight we opted to grab an M&S curry and cook it in our room, so much nicer than having to go out to eat. There's even a dishwasher with tablets so I wasn't left doing the washing up! The hotel is situated in Westfield shopping centre so very handy if it's shopping you want. It's also a quick tube journey into the centre of London.

This is a really good hotel. Parking in the multi storey car park next door/below the hotel was cracking value at ¬£16.00 for two days, although it was very busy when we arrived at 5.00pm on a Friday - took a while to find a spot, but was virtually empty when we left at 10.00am on the Sunday. Check in very easy. Polite and helpful staff. Room was very clean and large with an excellent shower in the bathroom. Kitchen area was a bonus. Breakfast was included and very good with lots of choice of both hot and cold items. Room service very good, quick and good value.The hotel is in a shopping area/centre, which is much better than it sounds - it is covered but not enclosed and has a feeling of being outdoors even though you are undercover - it is pleasant with lots of bars, restaurants and shops on your door step. The hotel is only a minutes‚Äô walk to the entrance of the tube station which provides links to anywhere in London.Without hesitation, I would stay here again. Many thanks to all the staff you should be proud of your hotel.

An Excellent place to stay with good service. Staff is very supportive. Quality and variety of breakfast is pretty good evening for vegy. Worth to stay with close proximity to central London. good bars and restaurants all around within boundary what else you want ;)

Have stayed here twice now and cannot fault anything. Staff are great, very friendly. Apartments very very well equipped, clean and spacious and also very quiet. Free breakfast is great as is the complimentary tea and coffee. Would not hesitate to stay again

column9: Excellent Location, Home away from Home
column10: It's been 2+ weeks and my stay is the best experience I have ever had in any hotel / serviced apartments till date in London. (Being my 4th visit to London on a business trip, I always prefer to stay in and around Central London). The facilities provided is absolutely great. Staff is always welcoming, extremely courteous and always make you feel special. A special mention to Sara, Lucas, MD, Greg, Maria and Antonella. You guys are the ones make a difference to the guests in Staybridge, Stratford.Staybridge Suites offer self-serviced accommodation with a fully fitted kitchen and sitting areas. Breakfast is complimentary to all guests, is excellent and caters for both vegetarians and non vegetarians. 3 days a week evening socials from Monday - Wednesday is a great concept and always refreshing to have an hour to relax, meet and greet people after a busy day of work. This is why it's "Home away from Home".This particular Staybridge is located inside the heart of Westfield in Stratford which offers a fantastic range of restaurants and eateries to suit all budgets. Westfield has its own food courts and restaurants, they offer other food options such as M&S, supermarkets like Waitrose, and plenty of shopping. Location to Stratford station is just 5 minutes and gives you over ground as well as underground options.Staff is extremely friendly, courteous, with a positive energy and ever smiling (names already mentioned above). Overall its' been a perfect stay and I am sure my stay would be made more special in the coming days / months.

column9: Fabulous location and great for transport into London
column10: We visit London every year for an exhibition in Olympia and for the last 5 years this hotel has been our best choice which we return to each time.  The Staybridge Suites offer self-service accommodation with a fitted kitchen and sitting areas, much better than standard hotels.  But this particular Staybridge is located inside the heart of Westfield in Stratford which offers a fantastic range of restaurants and eateries to suite all budgets, as well as secure underground parking at very affordable day rates.  If you park by the second set of escalators in Parking B, then you will literally come up infront of the hotel which is really convenient!  Westfield has its own food halls and restaurants, and the shops also offer food options such as M&S, supermarkets like Waitrose.  Location to Stratford station gives you overground as well as underground options, we take the overground across London which is a lot faster than the tubes.  We also venture direct on Jubilee Line to Borough Market which is a really recommended trip, and overground to Camden Road.  Staff are very friendly and if you are there during the week then you can attend free nibbles between 5-6pm.  Breakfast at the Staybridge is excellent and caters for people who want Soya alternatives, and it features a 24-hour gym.

I have stayed at the Staybridge suites twice this summer while working in London. While the rooms themselves could do with a little modernization, the staff is great to deal with and the facilities are in good conditions. They have a small gym on the 12th floor with all the essentials but you can use the holiday inn gym as well if you want to use their treadmills. If you plan to use the laundry (always on the 12 floor) remember you can buy cheap cubes of laundry soap for one or two pounds the pair. Just pop these in their washing machines, choose the program and job done. Location wise the hotel is unbeatable: Westfield shopping mall has everything you need, you can go for a run in the adjacent queen Elizabeth park and hop on a train/tube ride to London if you need to. Will definitely come back!

column9: It's all about the customer experience
column10: I have stayed a lot of generic hotels up and down the country, and quite a few in Stratford (East London).  On this occasion I chose to try out the Staybridge (personal recommendation).Being a business trip, the hotel selection is based on; location, price and availability.  This time the Staybridge ticked all three boxes.  Knowing that the hotel (or should it be called an apart hotel) caters for clients usually staying for longer periods I didn't really know what to expect.Well... 'First Impressions Count' as they say and this time they did just that.  I was greeted very warmly when I arrived at about 9:30 in the morning to ask if I could leave my bag with them for my stay that night.  To my surprise I was asked if I would like to leave it in the room as it was ready.  After completing the formalities I was given the key and directed to the room (not expecting to have access to my room until the afternoon it was a great start).When I got to the room, I was impressed with the facilities on offer.  Not only was the room larger than your standard generic mid priced hotel room, but it was fitted out with a little kitchenette area.  Normally this would be ideal for preparing a ready meal to was down with a bottle of something, but on this occasion I had other plans so I can't vouch for the functionality if the appliances but I'm sure they're all good.Anyway, what I did use was all good;Bathroom - very clean and well equippedBed - very comfortable (and big)TV - what can you say lots of channelsInternet - the free wifi is more than adequate for watching films on YouTube, a bit of surfing and checking your emails.  So there is no need to by the premium pack.Coffee making facilities- a good selection of premium coffees As I said in the title, 'It's All About The Customer Experience'.  You can have a problem at any hotel but it's not the issue that you remember it how it is handled by the staff!  While I was just dropping off to sleep, I was awoken by the sound of dripping water.  After switching the light on, I discovered that water was dripping from the ceiling onto the bed.  After a quick call to reception a member of staff came to investigate.  He was quickly followed by the Duty Manager who immediately took control of the situation and arranged for another room to be made available.  I was compensated for my inconvenience and also given a late checkout if I needed it up until 2:00pm.  It turned out that the sprinkler pipe in the ceiling had sprung a leak, not a common problem I'm sure (or they wouldn't stay in business very long).  Going back to the title of this review, it shows that even if something goes wrong, if it is handled the right way it doesn't become a problem!  Because of the way the staff (even those who weren't involved with the nighttime events), treated me... as a valued and respected customer, the Staybridge will be my first choice net time I'm stopping over in Stratford.

Love this hotel great for family , friends and couples Great spacious rooms Very clean rooms and surrounding areas Good location for food & shopping Highly recommend this hotel Parking is also reasonable too

I stayed here for almost half a year in 2015 (precisely 6 months) and I am staying currently from 23/July/2017 to 26/08/2017 almost a month and the stay is the best experience i ever had in any hotel till date. Facilities which you get  in a room is truly fantastic. Staff is always welcoming, very courteous, always make you feel special. I would prefer to meet MD, Maria Ioana and the one who has always made the difference and encouraged me to come back is Gregorio (He is an asset to Staybridge), Mate you are the BEST and staybridge Management should know this.Evening social from Monday - Wednesday is a great concept and always refreshing to have an hour after busy first 3 days of work. Also meet and greet people (perfect saying home away from home)There is always a room for improvement - Room cleaning staff need to give attention to detail. It just need management attentionOverall I had perfect stay in 2015 (for 6 months), now I am staying here for almost more than month.

Spent one night here for our anniversary in August 2017, absolutely loved it. Staff were friendly & great location for the Olympic stadium & Westfield Stratford. Would definitely stay again when in the area.

column9: Relax and cozy stay in London
column10: This hotel was recommended by our friend 2 years ago and we have stayed with them every time we are in London since 2015. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is super-convenient, where you can do pretty much all your shopping and meals there. Their staffs are friendly and helpful, and we really feel like we are at home. Staybridge Suites is our first choice every time we visit London and we will definitely be back again!

I have stayed here for a week in one bedroom suite with my family. I was here on business trip. The location of hotel is quite good and near to restaurants, mall and tube. The rooms are comfortable. Stay is super friendly specially Sara who I used to meet in evening while have complimentary snacks.The breakfast buffet is small and nice, since I was vegetarian I was having roughly same breakfast every day. Hotel provides complimentary drinks on Monday to Wednesday which is Anu e touch. Overall a very nice hotel and would love to stay here in future

Brilliant location, great attention to detail. Went to social event hosted by Stefan which was relaxed, fun and excellent quality of food and wine on offer and complementary- always makes it taste better.  Apartments have everything and more. Reception extremely helpful. Cannot recommend enough and thank you Stefan for making my daughter and I feel very welcome.

I stayed here for almost half a year in 2015 (precisely 6 months) and I am staying currently from 23/July/2017 to 26/08/2017 almost a month and the stay is the best experience i ever had in any hotel till date. Facilities which you get  in a room is truly fantastic. Staff is always welcoming, very courteous, always make you feel special. I would prefer to meet MD, Maria Ioana and the one who has always made the difference and encouraged me to come back is Gregorio (He is an asset to Staybridge), Mate you are the BEST and staybridge Management should know this.Evening social from Monday - Wednesday is a great concept and always refreshing to have an hour after busy first 3 days of work. Also meet and greet people (perfect saying home away from home)There is always a room for improvement - Room cleaning staff need to give attention to detail. It just need management attentionOverall I had perfect stay in 2015 (for 6 months), now I am staying here for almost more than month.

Spent one night here for our anniversary in August 2017, absolutely loved it. Staff were friendly & great location for the Olympic stadium & Westfield Stratford. Would definitely stay again when in the area.

column9: Relax and cozy stay in London
column10: This hotel was recommended by our friend 2 years ago and we have stayed with them every time we are in London since 2015. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location is super-convenient, where you can do pretty much all your shopping and meals there. Their staffs are friendly and helpful, and we really feel like we are at home. Staybridge Suites is our first choice every time we visit London and we will definitely be back again!

I have stayed here for a week in one bedroom suite with my family. I was here on business trip. The location of hotel is quite good and near to restaurants, mall and tube. The rooms are comfortable. Stay is super friendly specially Sara who I used to meet in evening while have complimentary snacks.The breakfast buffet is small and nice, since I was vegetarian I was having roughly same breakfast every day. Hotel provides complimentary drinks on Monday to Wednesday which is Anu e touch. Overall a very nice hotel and would love to stay here in future

Brilliant location, great attention to detail. Went to social event hosted by Stefan which was relaxed, fun and excellent quality of food and wine on offer and complementary- always makes it taste better.  Apartments have everything and more. Reception extremely helpful. Cannot recommend enough and thank you Stefan for making my daughter and I feel very welcome.

The hotel is located a short walk from the Stratford Station, with connections to Pancras Station/King's Cross station and metro stations. The bus stand is close by too. The hotel is located in the Westfield Mall in Stratford, which has a number of shops, pubs and eating joints.The staff are friendly and prompted printed-off some tickets that I wanted. The rooms are spacious and the place has an in-house free laundry as well (washing machine and drier). The breakfast spread is quite varied and as a vegetarian, I had good options.The room came with a complimentary smart phone with data facilities and unlimited call facilities to some countries, including USA and India. I didn't use it as we had already availed of a pan-Europe data sim earlier, but I guess others might find this very useful.Though the hotel is at some distance from London Central, with train connectivity, you actually don't feel it.

I do stay regularly for work and very unusually after a very busy time I was allocated a room I was often allocated. I noted a problem with wetroom drain in accessible room the very next morning after check in. I have no idea why the person who caused the problem had not alerted staff out of politeness- but t it hadnt happened   As expected the wonderful supportive front of house team - worked wonders and fixed the drain problem. ( someone had sprayed shaving cream down the drain- go figure)

All the staff were excellent again, suite superb as usual and location perfect for the Stadium. The hospitality and care afforded us when we came back in the pouring rain with 6 friends competing from Canada was 2nd to none. Thanks again. Judith & Jeff

Easy access from underground and in the westfield. Breakfast is good. Enviroment is good and perfect service from Mizan.  Easy checkin and friendly services.in Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City.10B Chestnut Plaza | Westfield-Stratford City, London E20 1GL, England

I had to stay in London for four weeks on business and I stopped here for the first time.It was the best business trip  in forty years. The suite has everything, including a fully fitted kitchen  and there  is a fully equpped laundry on site, so no more lugging washing back home at weekends and no living off junk food for a month. The safe held all my papers and the breakfast, like everything else was generous and relaxed. The staff created a warm, relaxed and truly helpful atmosphere. A really clever set up.

column9: Comfortable and clean suite next to Olympic Park, shopping centre and restaurants
column10: I stayed here 2 nights. The reception is efficient and rooms/bathrooms are clean and functional. Buffet breakfast on 12th floor is of good quality. Staff friendly and genuinely seem to want to look after you.

This is an excellent hotel / home from home. Very well appointed, clean, tidy, and welcoming, and the staff can't do enough for you! The rooms are clean, spacious, and very well appointed. Ours even had a mobile phone in the room that you could take out and about to use as a travel guide, and was available to use for local and international calls - 4G too!Breakfast is great too. Good selection of teas, coffee and juices, as well as hot cold food. You can also drop by the lounge / breakfast area later in the day for complementary tea / coffee. I highly recommend this hotel, and can't wait to come back!

column9: Excellent place to stay in London
column10: Excellent find in London. Rooms are specious and have everything you need and more. Hotel is very clean with excellent public spaces. Very nice stuff.  Great location - Train, tube and bus stations are two minutes away. 20 minutes to central London. Many restaurants and  shops just as you step out of the hotel.  Highly recommended!

Excellent location and outstanding accommodation for a visit London, very high standard of customer service and well maintained , great underground , rail connections and the DLR to London City Airport.

Excellent time. Really enjoyed my stay. Neat and roomy suite. Felt like home as I was able to do home cooking in the kitchenette. Nice, cordial and highly responsive staff.  Though expensive but was worth every pound.

All the staff were amazing and made us feel so special. It was our mums 70th birthday and they treated her like a queen. They made her guest for the day in a frame on the desk and put treats in her room. Thank you so much, especially Georgiana at reception who was so lovely. The rooms were beautiful they even had a small kitchen, a coffee machine and a dishwasher. You could help save some money by preparing lunch in your room rather than eating out. Will definitely be going back for a shopping spree with my daughter.

If you need to stay in East London then you can't beat this hotel or location. The suites have everything you need, and there is a small laundry, and gym on-site. Staff are great and remember your name! Stratford tube station is a seven minute walk, and Stratford International station is a five minute walk. Will be back for sure!

I've stayed at Staybridge Suites Stratford for countless times now, and this latest stay has by far been the longest - 22 nights! This hotel truly feels like home. Everything is great - cleanliness, comfort, amenities... this is really a place one can stay very comfortably for a long time.What really makes a difference though is the wonderful service staff! Sara and M.D. at the front desk were real delights. They're friendly, personable, and professional! The entire concierge team at the ground floor has been just terrific! They greet you warmly each time, and never fail to make you feel that you're in good company of friends and family.

Excellent Transport Links makes this an excellent location. In walking distance to the London Stadium in the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Good for food and shopping in Westfield Stratford City. Very good rooms well laid out.

Very friendly and obliging staff.All the essentials taken care of at a good price making it very good value for money.Location attached to mall and public transport also made the trip more comfortable

The customer service was superb! From the moment we checked in, through breakfast and the day we checked out. Very kind, approachable and helpful. The breakfast is complimentary and they have a wide variety of freshly cooked and baked foods.

Great location excellent staff especially MD who was very helpful. The rooms Are very nice with kitchens and the location is excellent for shopping and for railConnections. The public spaces make it ideal for business as well as family visits.

This is the second time I have chosen Staybridge Stratford to stay for long periods in London. The staff are very friendly and helpful; they do their level best to keep me with my family happy during our annual holiday. Very appreciated and great place to stay ...

very comfortable extended stay option with great public transport links and part of the extensive Westfield shopping, sport, and entertainment complex, so plenty of things to do and local restaurants etcRooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable.Public areas are nice and useable and complimentary breakfast is decent.

I enjoyed the vacation at the hotel, the location was excellent, the proximity to public transportation and other sites such as the mall and the Olympic Park were excellent, the service the staff gave us was excellent and every problem was solved quickly and the phone we received helped us very much in London

Staybridge pride themselves on making you feel as if you are home from home and I have to say that they are pretty much true their word. Their staff are really skilled at making you feel that your stay is very important to them. I could single out many of their smiling, accommodating front line staff but this review is to sing the praises of Lisa - one of the behind the scenes staff who takes care of you by quietly clearing away your post-breakfast or dinner clutter and generally taking care of the small things that make a big difference. It's a indispensable part of what makes staying here so special and why, with so many other places to go to in London, I am drawn back to the Staybridge Suutes time and time again. Lisa - you are a star.

Nice place to stay, near a mall with lots of eating place, near train station. However the breakfast was good but mostly english break fast. The gathering with the staff on wednesday was a nice touch and the facts that there was complementary soft drinks are a plus.

The hotel is simply best for family and it has all what is needed for a longer duration of stay and within quite an affordable budget. I would advice this hotel to all my friends, family and relatives.

column9: You want a hotel room? You want an apartment? How about a combination of both?
column10: Just stayed for the second time at Staybridge Suites, Westfield, Stratford, London. So you can see we're getting to like them !! In terms of location, you're slap bang in the middle of one of the greatest retail therapy areas in the UK. Near to the Olympic park. Train and bus connections for swift access to central London. The suite itself is a mini apartment. We have used both a studio suite and a one-bedroom suite. The only difference between the 2 being that the studio suite is like a spacious bedsit with kitchenette off, whilst the other has a separate room for the bedroom. Neither is cramped but open and airy. In both types, the kitchenette is fully equipped with all the crockery and cutlery that you would need, microwave, cooking hob, fridge, dishwasher, kettle, coffee maker, toaster and sink. Tea towels and the usual kitchen cleaning accoutrements including dishwasher tablets. But you don't have to stack it yourself as the service personnel will do it for you ! The suites are well furnished to sleep, eat, relax etc. Bed really comfortable. Plenty of towels, including face flannel. Quality bathing/washing shampoo, soap etc. Iron and board. Free effective wi-fi. Digital secure safe. Price wise we found that our stays compared favourably with good London hotels, Sundays and weekdays obviously being cheaper than week-ends but longer stays are rewarded. The staff are superb, efficient and well-trained. Free breakfast is included in the price - a good English and continental buffet.

Great hotel with excellent service! Was incredibly impressed by Anass, Francesco, and Sara who work at the reception desk. They were very responsive to our requests and made the overall stay very enjoyable. Ask for one of them if you visit.

I visited on business in June. The welcome was helpful and personable, the apartment spotless, facilities excellent, great views and super breakfast. Housekeeping staff cheerful and helpful too. Well located 10 mins from Stratford station, mostly undercover, through shopping centre. I look forward to going back.

Stayed here due to exhibition at Excel. Fortunate the company booked it and paid the bill directly. Despite the prices shown in here it's was ¬£205/night plus VAT at 20%. I don't normally stay in London but this seemed exorbitant!Hotel is pleasant enough with all the facilities that you could want. Free low speed internet and they charge for faster data rates. Low speed is fine for e-mail.Breakfast is OK though selection is nothing special. The one really positive thing is the staff here. They are all friendly and wiling to help.Can't say I'd put it on the top of my list of hotels to stay.

We were upgraded to a 1 bed suite, which was lovely and comfortable.  My only suggestion would be to have twin bedded rooms for people who don't fancy sharing a bed, I would stay here with friends if they had twins.Lovely bar terrace on the roof with views across the Olympic village.

column9: Another outstanding visit to the Staybridge Suites Stratford City
column10: This is, after Staybridge Suites Vauxhall, my fave place to stay in this top notch example of the IHG brand. Location is well, exciting. 300 shops, restaurants, and the Olympic Park yards away. Parking just ¬£13 for our Thursday to Saturday am stay. Staff lovely, and the concierge team simply amazing. Wheelchair accessible wetroom bathroom bedroom studio is great. Breakfast susrptisingly good. This is not a budget hotel but we've chanced  on some decent enough bargain rates from time to time, tho going to the Robbie Williams concert meant one of our two nights was pricey. Overall, love this place.

Had a lovely welcome from Mayra and Maria we stayed here for 7nights this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for a long time, the staff are great the location is brilliant for the O2 and the Excel we also so handy staying on top of Westfield shopping centre I was definitely stay here again on my return to London, The hotel is five years old but still has very brand-new breakfast is amazing very good choice also the evening meetings that are very good for networking and I feel location for meeting with customers as well as family.

column9: Excellent service made if feel like home
column10: Georgiana and her team .Stefan,Danielle and MD made the whole 10 days feel like being in a new family .The  breakfasts were great lots of fresh fruit and pancakes.Room always clean and tidy. Love the fact there was a self service laundry as we only had hand luggage .Don't miss the social evenings.a nice extra touch.

Cannot recommend enough would definitely stay again. Rooms are really well equipped with everything you could need, breakfast was great and catered for all you could want and the location was perfect. What really stood out was the fantastic staff and the service they provided, have not stayed anywhere in a long time where everyone you came in contact with genuinely went out of their way to help, all the staff were brilliant but especially the lady on reception and the guy at breakfast. ( Zara and Stafan ??)    Only downside which is not the hotels fault is we were staying there for an event at the Olympic park in order to avoid the hassle of getting home afterwards but you cannot get back into the complex as the entrances are blocked off after the event so it took an hour and a half instead of ten minutes to get back to the hotel as you had to follow the crowds back to the tube entrance.

I love this hotel. I would stay here on a holiday too, if I didn't live in England. It only takes a few minutes to get to central London. There is a car park only a couple hundred metres away. The tube & international train station  is 5 min walk

column9: Very good service and friendly personel
column10: Friendly personelRooms with extra kitchen in order to prepare something yourself is very nice.There is enough space in the room. The view outside is grate. When we opened the window we could even hear the Robbie Wiliams concert!

We stayed for 4 nights for a family of 4 adults and 3 kids. Location is fantastic, just above the Stratford tube station. You can get into central London within 20 min on the tube or even faster on the rail. The Westfield shopping Centre is literally at our feet, and shops open till 9pm on most nights, so ladies can shop to their hearts content and the guys can relax at the many F&B outlets. The only downside was there is no driveway to the hotel. On the day I arrived, the Carpark nearest the hotel was closed for a concert nearby, so we were parked quite far away. However upon contacting the concierge, they managed to locate us quickly and helped us with the luggage. The staff made was feel very welcome throughout the stay, always with a smile. The rooms were well appointed and well maintained. Beds were firm to my liking. Breakfast was included and adequate. Coffee and tea is available throughout the day at the eating area and there is a happy hour from 7-8pm on weekdays (I think). There is a laundry room, very impressed that and the machines were able to complete the washing/drying sequence quickly (takes about 2 hrs in total) as compared to other dryers which take at least 4-5hrs at least. Thank you Steven, MD, Georgina, Sara and the rest of the team for your kind hospitality!

column9: Very good value for your money!
column10: This is my 4th stay at Staybridge and my first review of the property as I am lazy. Great property situated as Westfield Stratford so excellent for shopping and exploring London. Breakfast is standard and the fact that it is included in the rate is a plus. I like the fact that the rooms have a full functioning kitchen so I can always cook and we end up saving cash as a result. The standout feature for me is the introduction of handy which is a mobile device similar to your smartphone and allows you to make local calls, gives hints and tips about London and things to do and means I am always connected. Will definitely be back again soon. No doubt about that!!

We had booked tickets for Frankie Valli at the O2 and so wanted a hotel which was next to public transport and this fitted the bill perfectly.  Each suite had everything you could possibly need  including cooker, fridge, dishwasher, microwave etc and the rooms are modern and airy with a power shower.  This hotel is accessed via Parking Bay B of Westfield shopping centre so all the shops etc are downstairs together with Stratford tube and railway station a short walk away.  The only problem we had was on return from the concert, we wanted a drink but being a Sunday is was early closing in all the surrounding bars and the only bar we could get a drink in was in the Holiday Inn next door.  The Staybridge only provided bottled beers which our friends weren't keen on.  Otherwise it can't be faulted.

We stayed here after seeing Guns n roses at the stadium close by. The staff were really pleasant and the room was stunning. Very clean feel. Breakfast the next day was lovely day. Just as a tip if you are going to a bit event you may have a very long walk due to the diversions the stadium put in place. What was a 10 min walk there was an hour back due to this.  Would stay there again definitely!

Stayed here Saturday night after a concert.  Staff were very helpful and friendly.  Very clean and well kept.  Did not want for anything.  I would love to stay here again.  Comfy bed and air con helped a fab nights sleep. Lovely breakfast with best hash browns I have ever tasted.  Thanks to all staff for a home from home x

column9: The perfect business destination in East London
column10: The friendliest hotel I've ever stayed in, set right in the Olympic Park and convenient for business and leisure users.  The staff make this hotel a true home from home, always welcoming and always professional.  The rooms are very comfortable and relaxing, with excellent blackout curtains!Great breakfast and plenty of options nearby for dinner.

column9: Great hotel in an ideal location for the Olympic Stadium.
column10: We stayed here for a concert at the Olympic Stadium. Staff are really friendly and very helpful. Room was perfect with small kitchen area, lovely comfortable bed and a great walk in shower. Great location for the Stadium, loads of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. Great breakfast selection.

I stayed at 3 different hotels in London on this trip (spread over 18 days), and Staybridge Suites Stratford had the best service! I would especially like to recognise Sara from the Front Desk -- she was so warm, friendly and helpful. She remembers guests' names and needs, and is proactive.The rooms are spacious and well-equipped. The breakfast has a good variety. The complimentary evening social reception is great -- good food and drinks.Being located in the Westfield Stratford is also super convenient -- Tube station, LOTS of eateries, supermarket, shops, etc. Very lively atmosphere every day.Overall, Staybridge Suites in Stratford is good value for money and I would defintely recommend it to anyone.

Lovely hotel, excellent helpful staff, stayed for a concert nearby, couldn't be a better location. Definitely recommend. Nice breakfast, plenty of choice. Big spacious room. Looking forward to going back.

Fabulous Hotel in the middle of the Westfield Mall and a stones throw from the Olympic Stadium. We were given an upgrade by the welcoming receptionist and walked into a tastefully decorated large clean room with a fully functional kitchen area and beautiful views over the city. The bathrooms well equipped and the huge bed was very comfortable. A Nespresso machine in the room and complimentary breakfast were nice and we will happily stay here again.

Right from the location, to the rooms, to the services, staff, breakfast served etc. everything just makes you feel home. I have had an excellent and super comforting experience. For all my future visits to the UK, I am going to stay here :).

Just back from a fantastic weekend with my daughter sightseeing and shopping at Westfield, stayed at the  Staybridge Suites , it was my first time staying here but my daughters 6 th time. .....WOW what a lovely place  , we arrived early asking to drop our bags off so we could start the day and was so excited to be told by the fantastic receptionist we could have our room immediately , and have breakfast if we wished .Check in was speedy and friendly our room was clean spacious comfortable nicely furnished , had a kitchen fridge hob dishwasher and a beautiful bathroom with a large shower    Spectacular views of LondonRight in the centre of Westfield Shopping centre Close to the tubes and Stratford station plenty of places to eat and drink.Slept like a  log undisturbed all night Highly recommend thank you for looking after us üòÉ

Received a warm welcome from Reception.Room was a a one bedroom suite which is great, only down side is the shower over the bath as I prefer the shower cubicle but apart from that it was perfect. The A/C kept the room at an ideal temperature throughout my stay combined with the comfy bed meant I had great nights sleep.

Staybridge is clean, modern and offered all that one needs when travelling. In guise laundry, a comfortable lounge, good food. The best part of my day were the staff. Big shout out to Greg and Sara who helped settle me in and welcome my group after our long day of travel. üòÄ

For suite, think ensuite bedroom with a small galley kitchen - fridge, hot plate, microwave, kettle, with accompanying cooking utensils. My room was large and very clean, but a bit tired. There was a note from management apologising for the state of the carpet and saying it was due to be replaced in the near future. The in room safe didn't work, but was fixed after contacting Reception. The room was very quiet and the bed comfortable. Breakfasts were ok and included in the room price. Staff were uniformly excellent, friendly and welcoming. Location convenient for the tube and DLR and right next door to Westfield shopping centre. The Olympic Park and London Stadium are a few minutes walk. There are plenty of restaurants in the Westfield Shopping Centre, so no need to travel far for dinner.

A very new, comfortable, clean, friendly hotel close to Stratford station and in the Westfield centre. Layout well thought out.Plus pointsHelpful friendly staff from reception to restaurantGood sized room (especially the one bedroom apartments)Apple TV in the roomGood quiet air conGreat shower pressureTerrace on 12th floor with great London views Slight disappointmentsShower is over bath with a curtain (prefer enclosed shower)Breakfast good but not piping hot however they microwaved it on request which solved problem. I do wish hotels would keep the hot buffet hotQuirkyIt takes a while to work out where the bathroom light switch is locatedGood Coffee is on tap on 12th floor 24/7 but no sachets in the room. A machine with capsules for strong expression in the roomWill definitely stop there againRecommended

We stayed here for three nights on a long weekend visit to London. We had a one bedroom suite which was immaculate and included all the comforts of home that you could reasonably want - including a dishwasher and a fridge. The bed was comfortable and the extra pillows I requested via the website were waiting for us when we arrived. On a warm and humid weekend, we appreciated the effective air conditioning.I'd also like to especially compliment the reception staff (actually, pretty much all the staff we met but reception in particular) on their friendliness and helpfulness. They are a credit to this hotel and made us feel very welcome.Inexplicably, however, despite how great everything else about the hotel is, we found the breakfast, which was included in our room rate, to be quite poor. Many breakfast items were of poor quality, especially the hot food (and particularly the scrambled eggs which can best be described as "grim"). There is a machine which serves fresh pancakes or, more accurately, takes ages to deliver tiny discs of rubber masquerading as pancakes. Even the coffee was bitter as though it had been scorched by too hot water. On our final morning at the hotel we didn't even bother with breakfast because the previous two days were so disappointing.To put things into perspective, we would definitely stay here again. The location turned out to be surprisingly convenient with easy parking, plenty of shops and restaurants and good access to the city centre. The room was lovely as were the staff. Even the price was reasonable by London standards.But we'll probably skip breakfast!

I stayed at this hotel for 19 days and found it to be excellent.The best thing about any hotel is the staff which in this case is awesome 5 stars guys.They would speak with guest and provide all help even at night. Morning breakfast is very good and staff again is very good. I had misplaced my travel adapter and had some urgent work and was helped by the staff at 12 at night also.The location of this hotel is very good and is very lively even during night.Tube station and bus station are just a stone throw away and hence very easy to commute. Sara from the staff was very helpful and very helpful cheers.

I am often in this area of London for work (flying into London City Airport) and find this hotel by far the most convenient. This is for location, design, price, comfort and most of all, the employees. Especially, Giorgina is such a delight! Very capable and always smiling and friendly. Such a gem. The rooms are very convenient with a little kitchen and everthing necessary in it. For me, the work desks are a bit high (or the chair is too low). But that's barely remarkable. Who wants to work with a shopping mall next door, anyway?!Will continue to come here in the furture and looking forward to it very much.

I really should start by saying that i never wrote a review from my previous stay here which was in September 2016 to January 2017 due to work we were in London for some time and here was a great location for access to Liverpool Street and the shoppimg centre, we loved our stay it was our home for 6 months and we were made to feel this way by all the excellent staff we were all on first name terms this was great and so deciding to stay there on our latest visit was an easy choice and it was like going home, from the doorman to the reception staff we were greeted as old friends, the hotel is made by all its staff they are always there to help in anyway they can, we will always be back to stay here it suits us for location and value is a great place with great people.

We had a quick overnight for a gig at the London Stadium. The room (a one bed suite) was ready when we checked in mid morning (our first surprise), and the second was the very helpful staff who really couldn't do enough for us. The room was comfortable and well equipped, with a full kitchen and spacious enough for a hotel at this level. I would not come here for a holiday but it was a super spot for a weekend of shopping at Westfield Stratford or a game at West Ham ( if you're that way inclined. I'm not).The lounge serves a good selection of hot drinks and papers, is quiet and has a small balcony on the 12th floor where you can take tea. All in all, a great overnight spot.

This is an amazing hotel and I will definitely be returning here next time I stay in London.  Staff are extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are very comfortable and well equipped, surprisingly quiet, breakfast was tasty with plenty of choices. Very good value and a great location too!

Really Nice hotel on a perfect location for our business trip. Rooms are clean and the staff is friendly, they let you feel at home.There are a lot of stores and food courts around the hotel. Our room even had a nespresso machine! Great!

Swift lifts to reception on 12th floor.  No waiting around. Lovely suite, everything needed for a comfortable stay.  Great breakfast selection and we appreciated The complimentary hot drinks and sparkling water 24/7

Really enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. We went to a concert at The London Stadium and it was the perfect location. The shops, bars and restaurants in Westfield right out the door and a 5 minute walk to the stadium. Also walking distance (all undercover) to Stratford station. Hotel Suite was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good.

column9: Business trip but felt at home!
column10: I was here for 4 weeks in May and am very impressed by the location and staff. One staff in particular has been excellent Gregorio and was always lively.  I  liked the concept of Socials which gives much relief after a long day to unwind. It has enough place for family and friends. I plan to stay with family if any future plans.  The location and surroundings are fabulous!!

column9: Excellent Place - Will be staying again
column10: We stayed for 3 nights from the 26th - 29th May 2017.The hotel is a very short walk from the tube station and we found it quickly.  On arrival we were greeted by security downstairs who told us to use the lifts on the left hand side to go up to reception - these lifts are actually for the Holiday Inn part of the building so for the Staybridge Suites you need to use the lifts on the right as soon as you enter the lobby and go up to level 12.ReceptionWe were greeted by Gregorio (apologies if I have the name wrong) who was extremely friendly and informative.  He told us everything we needed to know about the hotel and showed a genuine interest in why we had come to London for the weekend.The reception area has plenty of comfortable seats and tables and leads to the breakfast area which is at the end of the large room.  As far as we could see there was no bar area at this hotel however in reception there are fridges with alcoholic drinks in and you can help yourself (charged to room) and sit in the reception area which also has a small roof terrace.  Tea and coffee are complimentary and you help yourself from the breakfast area.In the same area in reception where the fridges are you can also purchase a variety of food and other drinks.The whole area has a lovely homely feel and is absolutely spotless.RoomWe stayed in a room with a small kitchen which was very well equipped.  This included a small hob, microwave, toaster, fridge and all cutlery and pans etc.]The main room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  Everything worked well in the room, TV Shower etc and the bed was comfortable.The room was lovely and quiet and we didn't have any issues with noise.There is free Wifi which you have to log into once you have your room number.BreakfastBreakfast was really nice and had a wide variety of options.  It is self service for everything including tea and coffee.  The food available while we were there ranged from full cooked breakfast, continental, cereals, toast, pancakes, fresh fruit and yoghurt, breads and cheese.The hotel is located right next door to the Westfield Shopping Centre and there are plenty of bars and restaurants here to visit.I really couldn't fault this hotel and would definitely stay here again.  The staff here really are a credit to the hotel as they are all really friendly and helpful.We asked for some fresh towels after deciding to keep the ones we had and use them again but they wouldn't dry properly - New towels appeared within 20 minutes, really pleased. We will be booking to stay again in November even though we are visiting a different part of London as we enjoyed staying here so much this time.Thank you to all of the lovely staff.

column9: Happy Hammer "home from home" weekend stay
column10: Had a great Saturday night stay back in early April. All home comforts except a better room entertainment package on the television. Fantastic sunny weekend, home win for West Ham, night out in the west end and decent nights sleep. Buffet breakfast on Sunday, retail therapy in Westfield shopping centre and a nice drive home via the M25 and M4. Lovely

I would strongly recommend this hotel where I have stayed several times. Great location with good connectivity to the transport network. Friendly staff and a real home from home atmosphere. Breakfast offering is great

The hotel is in the good location, it's in the out skirt of centre London (only 15 minutes tube ride away), there is a huge shopping mall underneath, you can get everything you want downstairs. All the staffs we've met are helpful and friendly, we felt so homey and welcome in the hotel. There is a small kitchen in the room so you can cook some light food after long day and get some rest. The breakfast and the Happy Hour (Monday to Wednesday), foods are good and awesome. Wine is tasty. Room is clean. Overall, I love the hotel and would definitely come back in the future.

The hotel is very nice & clean.. The best part of this place is the friendly staffs they have and that is the biggest strength of this place. They provide a very good & healthy breakfast and close proximity to metro, olympic stadium, bus station etc.. This is my second stay in this hotel and definitely recommend this place.

Excellent hotel in the perfect location. It is ideally located in the Westfield shopping complex and close to Stratford station which has connections for the DLR, tube and rail links. Staff were very polite both on check-in and -out. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The beds are amazing and so to was the shower. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff are very friendly. The breakfast is very good and has a great location, close to the metro and within a mall. I want to thank the staff Gregorio, who solved several things for me, with a lot of friendliness and efficiency.

I stay here a lot, and no matter what the work day has brought I always mange a smile when I walk into the building. I am greeted warmly by the concierge before entering the lifts and upon reaching the reception I am always greeted with a smiling face and a welcome back handshake, it immediately makes you feel welcomed.The breakfast staff, back of house team and management all continue the friendly nature that this hotel somehow manages to project to all its guestsThanks guys n gals

column9: Extrem friendly staff, review mainly about wifi speed
column10: First of all, rooms are very well equipped - as you can see on other reviews. My review will focus on two points:1. All staff is extrem friendly and service oriented. Big plus!2. Free wifi speed is download 1.0 Mbps upload 1.0 Mbps.3. Paid wifi speed (5¬£/24 hours or 25¬£/week) is download 8.5 Mbps and 1.9 Mbps. The good thing is, the speed is stable. I have tested in the afternoon, as well as in the evening. Always got 8 Mbps DOWN.Keep this in mind, if you need to do some bandwidth intense working during your stay.With free wifi, even surfing on google maps in a pure pain! My recommendation to the hotel is, to increase the free wifi speed to 3 Mbps at least to be up to date...And if the hotel ads is tell me, that "premium highspeed" will cost me 5¬£ a day, I would expect DOWN & UP at least 20 Mbps.

Excellent suites and brilliant staff we have stayed here a number of times and it never disappoints.The staff are always so welcoming and nothing is too much trouble.The location is perfect for the Olympic park, train station and Westfields.

Lovely place very secure and great location Rooms are amazing and have everything and more you could want. Only let down was the extended check out till 2At 11:30 we had a member of house keeping walking into our room whilst we were in bed. Then at 12.20 another member of housekeeping came to the door and bothered to knock this time to tell us it was after 12 although we had extended check out when I explain the response was " oh " she then walked away.

Visited for my anniversary and was met with brilliant staff who couldn't have done more to make my stay more homely and more welcome. The staff even treated us to a surprise which was just lovely! Delicious breakfast, especially the pancake maker! Amazing views form our room which completed the trip.I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London for more than one night and wants a spacious apartment to stay in with kitchen and facilities.

Its hard to beat this hotel. MD checked us in and was fantastic throughout our trip. We had an upgraded room which was nice but the sofa was very uncomfortable and need replacing and the lighting is terrible but that everywhere now with these new bulbs they take a while to get going. But free laundry facilities, excellent breakfast and mid week managers reception were all great perks. Def would stay here if ever in the area again. West Ham stadium is an easy walk. You are right in the mall with many dining options and all types of transport super close.......tube, train and buses. Easy ride into central London. Perfect location and hotel !!

Really had a lovely overnight stay at staybridge suites! Our suite was spotlessly clean and stylish, as is the rest of the hotel, every employee we encountered were very approachable and welcoming , particular Lisa when we went for breakfast, she was very helpful and attentive and made us feel 'at home', a real lovely lady

First time stay, usually stay in same building but the Holiday Inn. Well impressed though with first impression, friendly staff and the Staybridge concept. Snacks available 24 hrs along with complimentary breakfast which had loads of choices and well set out. Suite also well thought out with large comfy bed, very clean room. Price was very reasonable for a Thursday and Friday night. Will certainly be back and thanks to all the staff for making our stay a good one.

I have stayed in staybridge suites stratford for 2 weeks and i am very mush satisfied with it. Everything right from the rooms to breakfast to services was very good. Rooms very clean and nicely done with all basic amenities. Special mention to most of the staff at reception - Andre, MD and others and at the concierge for their assistance and helping attitude .Would like to give special thanks to AMI at concierge reception for the hospitality he showed and the timely assistance he provided us in London. He truly made our stay comfortable as we were first time visitors to LONDON. üëçüèª

Just returned from another great stay at Staybridge Suites, in Stratford. I usually stay here, once per month ,when visiting my son who lives in East London.The location is perfect for us but also for everyone who wants a comfortable hotel to stay, in London, close all the ways of transportation , above a fantastic shopping centre with a good value for money.Underground a few steps from the Hotel with direct line to Oxford Street ( Central line ) and Westminster as well ( Jubilee Line ). Bus 25 also connect Stratford with central London. Perfect also for those arriving at Stansted airport with direct bus from National Express closeby.The Suites are bright , with great amenities and perfect kitchen facilities . Everything in room was spotless clean.Good breakast and wi-fi included in the rate. Tea and coffe available all day.But that is the staff who definitely make this hotel a special one. They are always kind and helpful. That `s why I feel at home everytime I arrive and make me wish to return.

column9: The team at Staybridge Suites are the best around
column10: I have stayed at hotels all over the world and can honestly say that the team at the Staybrige Suites Stratford are the best around. Me and my family stayed for a month and we didn't want to leave. They made us so welcome and really treated my son like a VIP every day. Special people and special experience. Thank you!

Great location. Perfect for commuting around London and beyond as there various transport links very close by.The rooms are very clean and well serviced daily. Complimentary breakfast has many choices and should satisfy all.The hotel's greatest asset is it's staff. They are truly amazing and make each stay better than the last.

Staybridge Suites are right next to the Stratford Westfield City Plaza so plenty of food courts and restaurants and grocery shops a 1 minute walk away! Staybridge puts on an excellent breakfast with a range of cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, bread and spreads, and hot food like bacon, sausages, eggs and hash browns. They have a laundry upstairs that guests can use to wash and dry their clothes, and also a dry cleaning service if needed. Their one bedroom suites are awesome with a dishwasher, fridge, microwave, hon, kettle, toaster, desk, couch and TV. Central heating in the main room and the bedroom, good water pressure, wardrobe space and empty shelves to put things. Staff are super friendly and accommodating:) The train is a 2 minute walk away which is really convenient too. Negatives? The lighting is not very bright for working in (except in the bathroom), and the light switches are not in logical places for the rooms, which takes some working out.  It's better to prebook and prepay to get a good deal, otherwise they charge a non-fixed rate which really stings your wallet.

Best hotel we have stayed at. Staff from concierge  to front desk are amazing they clearly take pride in their jobs.  They made us feel welcome and made it clear they would do what it takes to make our stay enjoyable. Rooms are great very clean and have everything you need. The breakfast was great and the social hour was a great surprise feel wine and beer and snacks .Location is great lots of shops and places to eat.In fact it in the the middle of the largest shopping mall in London .Getting t downtown London on the tube was near bye and the only way to get around. You cant go wrong staying there.

Great hotel, great experience. Very accommodating for us and our 3 daughters and breakfast was lovely too! Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. Staff were friendly and the concierge on the ground floor was very knowledgeable and helpful. Only slight negative was with the initial booking of the hotel - received conflicting information on room availabilty / parking charges etc. And a few hours were spent trying to get it right but it all worked out in the end!

From the moment you walk into this hotel, you have an assuring feeling that you made a wise choice when you booked.  The service, the cleanliness, the views, the friendliness of the staff, the fantastic breakfast and the standard of accommodation were exemplary in every day.  A weekend in London was made perfect thanks to this hotel and its staff who looked after us so well.  Nothing was too much trouble for them.  The hotel is also very conveniently located in close proximity to a multitude of shops, restaurants and the underground.

I can't praise the super duo M.D and Georgina at reception enough.They make your stay as homely and comfortable as possible. They give the staybridge suite hotel an image way above most hotels I have stayed at, some with even higher ratings. They are just at another level  professionally  than any other reception staff I have encountered. I just can't recommend this hotel high enough particularly because of these two lovely people. Mr S Nozohoor

column9: A place we love to return to as often as we can
column10: The rooms are always clean and comfortable with roomy, strong showers.  Basic cooking is possible with a hob and small microwave/oven.  Although there is no shortage of restaurants within a stone's throw, it's nice to have the option, especially if you're staying for a few days.  We prefer to pay a little more for a room with the captivating view of London and always enjoy watching dusk settle over the city.  A great feature of this hotel is the lounge - fabulous views, comfortable bays for working or reading and hot drinks available if you help yourself.  It always feels like a productive space.  The staff are warm and friendly but very much 'on the ball'.  This trip, Staybridge was my base for the London Marathon and, along with a number of other runners, we really appreciated the early, runner-friendly breakfast.  We also appreciate the noon checkout.

The place is just great, they have amazing breakfast, a nice lounge which makes you feel at home, the rooms are also well equipped with a kitchenette, and all other necessary amenities. The staff are also super friendly. Location wise the hotel is in the middle of a big shopping center, it is also a minute walk to a train/underground station.

column9: Much better than a traditional hotel
column10: Stayed a night when going to the o2 only three stops on the underground.Very nice friendly helpful staff,nice clean room,nice comfy bed,good shower.In case you are not aware more apart hotel,fridge,microwave,hob,dishwasher and small kitchen units.Breakfast fine again nice room on 12 floor ,views over London nice to see planes coming and going over the city.My wife left her glasses rang up will just check yes found them will put in the post.No question of what to do simple quick service excellent.Have stayed in there Liverpool Hotel also excellent would always stay if in the area again.

Staff were amazing and made our daughter  (who was running the marathon) feel very special. Breakfast was good plenty of choice and fresh.Location excellent shopping and restaurants first classTransportation into city very simple, plenty of trains running every couple if minutes.I only marked down sleeping to good as the bed was too firm for me. Apart from that a great weekend with the family. Would stay here again and would recommend to others

Visited this hotel yet again, and it did not disappoint. There are few places that I visit and cannot think of negatives about, but this is one of those places. Outstanding in all areas, including staff, cleanliness, well-appointed rooms, quiet rooms, location and overall experience. The only negative was that the plug of the bath fell off, but this was not a problem at all, and staff were attentive to resolve the issue. Shame I couldn't stay for longer. Well worth a visit, or multiple. Well done, IHG, a really amazing hotel with outstanding staff who are a credit to your hotel.

column9: Stay in London where I grew up
column10: It's been a long time since I came back to Stratford since I moved to USA in 84, the area has changed and I wanted to stay at a hotel near my stumping grounds since it now has a great mall, trains,buses etc and places to eat, above all the stay was great, great staff,the only thing is the heat in the rooms does not reach a temperature to my comfort level, but this will be my stay in future, the maids kept the room splotless, I'm in the motel business in US I would hire her without hesitation, I hope the MGR gets to read this.

Stayed here over the Easter weekend 2017. Check in was very pleasant and easy. Room overlooked the Olympic park and West Ham United Ground - we was on the 11th floor. Lovely kitchen area, sleeping area and the shower was amazing. However, there was an half empty bottle of water under the bed and biro on the sheets. Both nights we was woken by a loud banging noise, lasted about half an hour but went as quick as it started. Breakfast is just ok, Luke warm but plenty of choice and like the idea of self service. This hotel has really friendly staff and very central for the shopping centre and pubs and restaurants. The car park was easy to access and we was pleasantly surprised that with the cost ¬£16 for just over 2 days stay. We would defiantly return

This hotel has the lot as far as I am concerned and the only restriction for me is the rack rate can be eye watering without a deal.First the location is excellent with the hotel being the top floors above Statford shopping centre which has its own tube station. You can also park your car in the shopping centre at very reasonable price <¬£10 a night. The lift to reception is a bit tricky to find but once you get there there is never a queue. The suites/ rooms are incredibly spacey for London with great views over The old Olympic stadium and Canary Warf. There is happy hour where you can drink some nice wine and cheese and biscuits for gratis.  Breakfast buffet is one of the best hotel breakfasts I have had. There is a choice of Restaurants in the shopping centre so you are really spoiled for choice. A great hotel...

Home away from home. It was an awesome experience. Close to shops and all you need for your trip. Tube station and buses. Great experience. Will always come back and also inform friends. The experience will linger for a very long time

I booked this hotel for a 2 night stay for my 4 year anniversary! The hotel was a decent price for Central London and the location is fantastic.When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised at the look/decor of the hotel. Judging by the way the room looks, I would have paid a great deal more for this hotel than I did. As the stay went on we were more and more surprised with the hotel, we had a fully equipped kitchenette (glasses, bottle opener, fridge, microwave etc). The hotel room even provides a little phone which you can take out with you for maps/emergency calls!! Never heard of this before...The hotel was very modern and had a really nice feel to it! Not to mention the breakfast was included which was really lovely and had a choice for everyone! Even a fridge full of loads of juices etc. I would most definitely return and recommend to any of my friends!!

Room was very clean, liked the fact that we could cook for ourselves if we wanted to. Location was brilliant. Would stay here again and would recommend to others. Breakfast was not only included but very good too.

The hotel location is very convenient, just outside the Westfield Mall, close to the tube station and close to Olympic Park, for a stroll or a jog. The d√©cor is very stylish, and in particular the common area is spacious and attractive, with a lovely view of the city. The breakfast offers a great variety, and the free cocktails and snacks from Monday to Wednesday is a great bonus. But by far the greatest appeal of this hotel is the staff, each one unfailingly professional, friendly and knowledgeable. It was truly a great experience staying here.

Easily the best London hotel I have stayed in. We had an executive room with an additional sofa bed, which was perfect for our needs. The hotel is situated within the Westfield shopping centre and is very convenient for public transport. With a great complimentary breakfast and spacious, quiet rooms, it's hard to think of anything negative to say about our stay. Even the weather was perfect!I must make a special mention of Mizan, the duty manager during our stay, who went out of his way to help when our 8-year-old son was unwell one evening. We cannot thank you enough for your assistance.Will definitely stay here when visiting London again.

column9: Nothing better than an English breakfast
column10: Great location--near Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, great staff--courteous, responsive, great continental breakfast--never have I ever had beans for breakfast. Only 30-45 minutes to central London by tube (if that) and plenty of creature comforts right outside your front door.

column9: A perfect base for a trip to watch West Ham
column10: From the polite greeting at the main door, to the check-in staff at reception, to the quality of the room, to the location of the hotel, to the nearby shops and restaurants, to a good night's sleep followed by a fabulous breakfast, you may gather we had a great stay and will certainly return.

Another great stay here at Stratford. Check in was quick and the staff were friendly. We got a one bedroom suite, which was fantastic.We slept great,no noise at all. Breakfast was excellent as always, plenty to eat and drink, hot and cold food. Some of the staff on duty recognised us from previous stays and welcomed us back like old friends. We will be returning in the near future.

column9: Probably my favourite hotel in London
column10: We have stayed here before but I had forgotten how great it was. A lot of very good value hotels have opened in London recently, but with that you sacrifice space and storage. Not so here. The hotel rooms are spacious and have a small kitchen with plates, cups, cutlery etc. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed super comfortable. Wifi was good, and there is an Apple TV in the room, although we didn't use it this time. The hotel had an evening reception the night we were there, providing nibbles, beer and wine, which was very good. The hotel reception is on the twelfth floor and has a great view.This hotel really is great, and you could easily spend a week here. The location is great right in the heart of Westfield Stratford, which only gets better, too.If the price is good, this is the place to stay.

Beautifully presented room , very clean all mod cons including a dishwasher! Large enough for 2 shower and perfect location for shopping at Westfields centre. Complimentary breakfast with 24hr access to hot drinks in lounge area as well as in room of course! Staff were absolutely fantastic and couldn't help enough. Definitely will be back!

Location was perfect. Hotel was located right in the center of Westfield in Stratford. Right outside the hotel you have a huge choice o bars,restaurants, and shops. Outside this you have a 3 storey shopping centre with so much to choose from. Outside the shopping centre there is an underground station to go into London towards London Bridge and Westminster, etc. There is also a bus stop that goes directly to Stanstead Airport. The hotel itself is fabolous amazing views from all the rooms. Each room is very comfy and clean. Beds are really comfy. Rooms are well equipped with everything you need, bathrooms are also fantastic. The breakfast was free for all guests when we stayed dont knowif that always happens but i would recommend buying it because there is such a wide range to choose from. Staff were great too, very friendly, we dealt with a man named Stephan who was an absolute gentleman.

The Staybridge Suites at Stratford City is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are large, bright and airy, with great views, and are very clean. The included breakfast is very good, with a massive choice. The hotel is very secure with a key card needed to access your floor.There is ample parking in Stratford City Car Park B (this info could do with being a little clearer when you book as you can't drive to the front of the hotel and the sat nav just takes you round in circles) and at ¬£9.50 for 24 hours is cheap for London.Stratford mainline, tube, overground, DLR and bus station is only 3 minutes walk away and there are loads of good restaurants within 1 to 2 minutes walk. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

I think the hotel is really good value for money in London. Everything is excellent. I see no flaw. The rooms are very clean and so are all the equipments. The free breakfast is not much but very adequate. I am amazed that such property exists in London , which the team really try to give best service to their guests. The room service that came from Holiday Inn was also very good. And i like the fact they provide coffee all day :) Very wonderful wonderful hotel

Great location, hotel very clean, staff are friendly and very keen to help you .  We will be definitely be back . there is eight of us in our party  & to please everyone that takes some doing, but everyone was pleased with hotel. Denise

Stayed here for two nights for a concert and chill out time. We were upgraded on arrival on the Thursday to one bedroom studio. The room and whole complex were spotless but what made the experience complete were the staff.The Concierge desk up front were friendly and helpful from the first footfall to the last and recognised us and were helpful for the whole visit.The reception at Staybridge were friendly and informative about facilities, breakfast was easy and fluid, well done to the team manning the servers it was flawless.Cleaning teams were awesome and not seen üòÑA definite must for a base if staying in the big smoke üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº

For genuine customer service a feeling of home this is easily the best experience of any hotel I have stayed in throughout London  The staff really look after you nothing is ever a problem the room are spacious very clean you could not want anything more

Comfortable and well-appointed suite comprising lounge/kitchenette, bedroom  and en-suite bathroom. Kitchenette included hob, microwave, fridge and dishwasher. Satellite TV had wide range of channels from UK and abroad. Views towards Olympic Park partially obstructed by new apartment blocks but the Olympic Pool and Stadium were both visible, Canary Wharf and O2 arena also in sight. On the southern edge of Westfield shopping centre, close to Stratford Railway station (Underground, DLR, Overground and National Rail) and walking distance from Stratford International.

From the comfort of the room to proximity to choice shopping and from pleasantly helpful front desk to a beautiful and filling breakfast, everything about Staybridge is great. I will definitely come again and again

Very impressed, clean and great staff, not to mention quite good value for money, well done all round, perfectly located for my business needs at the moment, probably not a family hotel, more catered to business needs

Our family had a wonderful stay at the Staybridge Suiets StratfordEverything was excellentHelpful courteous staff they did everything they can to assist us, help with any requestThey were great , allways smiling really friendly.   The room was spacious and well equipped with all you need.   Supermarkets are very closeBreakfast is good, it can improve with more vegetables but otherwise excellent.The view is amazing overlooking the Olympic park and downstairs the amazing Westfield mall with shops, restaurants, caf√©s, transportation ....It was a lovely experience and we hope to come again in our next visit to London

Warm reception-  the staff at the desk were friendly and  always ready to help. The  free phone place in the room has helpful  applications and it blew our mind to have it free to use.  The housekeeper that clean our room after the weekend did not change our sheet. She just  pull the duvet up and  make the bed  at a look  well made. It was disappointing when we were ready to sleep and realize the sheets are same.  Room 1101.

The check-in staff were efficient and friendly. Room was excellent and the in-room facilities exceeded expectations. I liked the 24 hour access to the coffee machine. Excellent lounge areas for informal gatherings

column9: The only place I want to stay on business trips to London
column10: Friendly staff, remember your name which is nice. Perfect location cheap parking, excellent location to jump on tube into London very quickly. Nice places to eat and shop if you have time.Rooms are perfect for my needs. With a perfectly adequate cute kitchen if you don't want to eat out again.Has a small gym, adequate, but you  can also use the Holiday Inn gym next door.Wish they had more throughout UK

Recent stop for a few days again, very comfortable and QUIET which is a blessing after a busy day. Must say that I feel that their standards have slipped but prices have increased.  Breakfasts were very chaotic at the weekends - they need more staff as the queues  for hot food and coffee became absurd,  Get it right guys - this is meant to be hospitality and you're not a budget venue.Rooms were super the rest is very average nowadays - hope they can improve and get back to where they were!?

The hotel was great. Nice staff and the room was really clean and nice. The breakfast was good and they had glutenfree bread. Really nice restaurants rifht outside the door and offcourse westfield shoppingsenter.
