I spent two weeks in this hotel and it was a great experience. Great customer service, great breakfast options and fine snacks at evening. It is funny and entertaining the fact that the hotel is located inside a shopping mall. It was relaxing and silence. The rooms are fully equipped to cook.

Thank you for a wonderful stay this week and a very special night for my birthday.  Both Staybridge Suites  and Holiday Inn, Stratford City, made my day very special and so enjoyable.  The special reception by Staybridge was unexpected and did not prepare me for the treats left in my room by Holiday Inn.  Thank you so much to all your  staff they are the real stars and those of us that stay there on a regular basis fully appreciate their kind services.  üòáüòáüòá

column9: Been here most weeks throughout the last 12 months and still being looked after!
column10: The team here are number one for customer service. The staff cannot do enough for you, with an extremely professional but personable approach, every one of them of great character, acting with autonomy and at the same time a well seasoned team. I have been here for most weeks throughout the last 12 months and have always been warmly welcomed back every Sunday evening upon my return from home - with friendly familiarity but without any complacency. The rooms and communal areas are kept very clean and tidy, the studio and suites are well equipped if you want to cook for yourself. The breakfast is of a good standard. I chose this hotel to bring my wife for our wedding anniversary weekend in London and the team went the extra mile. I hope to bring the whole family for a city break later in the year knowing this will be a great base. I look forward to many more months at the Staybridge. (Jules).

My absolutely favourite thing about this hotel is it's location!!!! You can get almost anywhere in the UK particularly with the Central and Jubilee underground lines (without having to make changes underground) - Kings Cross, London Bridge, Waterloo (for Paris too), Liverpool Street, (you would need to change for Victoria Line though. There is also National Rail service (caught a straight train to Hertfordshire quite easily) and DLR too. And if you need to pop into Paris or Amsterdam briefly, Stratford International is right there too! If for nothing else I will stay here again and again!!!Then if you're on a shopping holiday it's a great choice to be here. Not only does Westfield Stratford City have most of the shops in London; you can get to Westfield London just by chilling on the Central line for just a few stops. Bond street, Marble Arch, Tottenham Court Road, stations will also get you very quickly to whichever end of the oh-so-famous Oxford Street you want to get to. You can literally start at Marble Arch end, walk your way down the road and get a train back "home" without having to go back to the same station you arrived from - again, without changing stations underground!.OK, enough on location. The rooms are very well furnished and updated with modern furniture. The kitchenette has all the basics you need to make your own meals (I missed a blender though).

column9: Lovely new hotel in great location
column10: We stayed in the Staybridge Suites this past weekend for a single night but we had a really great time. The hotel is just outside of the Westfield Shopping Centre in Stratford and has it's own lobby area shared with the adjacent Holiday Inn. They have separate lifts and the reception for Staybridge Suites is on the top floor -- a very classy touch. We were greeted warmly and our bags were kept for us while we went out to explore the Maritime Museum as we were a little too early to check in. Although we parked in Lot A due to road closures we were still only a minute or two's walk from the hotel although Lot B is much better positioned for the hotel. There was a football match on which we hadn't anticipated and so the area was incredibly busy but we had no noise in our room from outside. As a Platinum member with IHG I normally get an upgrade but regrettably staff informed me they were fully booked, but I had asked for a room 'high up with view of Olympic Park' and they did not disappoint -- 11th floor with a delightful view of the Olympic Park and wider Docklands area, including the O2 arena. Staff were incredibly helpful, friendly, and informative. The 'pantry area' was well stocked and everything was affordable. The hotel features free self-service laundry facilities and a free hot breakfast every morning. The hot breakfast was fantastic and there was more than adequate seating. It was a help yourself situation and everything was topped regularly -- easily one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had in years, let alone for a free one! The room had mini fridge, dishwasher, microwave, hot plate, sink, and all the cutlery/dishware/kitchen equipment you could need. Room was cozy owing to the kitchen but the bathroom was huge and very well appointed. Bed was fairly comfy. Apple TV service didn't work particularly well, too laggy to actually utilise it. Wifi was good, complimentary 'premium' for IHG loyalty guests which was high-speed and easy to access for up to 5 devices. TV selection was adequate. Room was well appointed overall and absolutely loads of plug sockets, a big 'must' these days. We were really impressed by the Staybridge brand and hope to stay again sometime!

We were greeted with enthusiastic, polite and friendly staff. Booked for my bf's birthday they provided him with a gift and had his name noted as guest of the day at the reception. The room look identical to the photos. Nice kitchen space. It was clean and tidy and had a nice view. The downside was the room had a strong smell of indian spice.The breakfast buffet was good and had a good seating area. The omlette was a bit dry but there was a good selection of hot food, pastries, cereals and drinks. You can take the breakfast back to your room too with the tray provided. Theres a convinient stall at the reception that opens 24/7.The location is perfect, right in the westfield shopping mall area. Also theres a casino few steps away for night entertainment. The train/tube into London was mins away too. Parking here was brilliant car park B cost ¬£6.50/24hours weekdays which was brilliant for London. The price for the hotel room fluctuates daily which I didn't like. We booked for ¬£160 but the next few days it was ¬£104-134 (wished I had waited) so I would recommend anyone whos thinking of booking to keep an eye out. My experience here was great the staff sure knows how to put smiles on customers faces.

We were very happy with the accommodations and the location of this property.  The staff was outstanding in their customer service. The room was spacious, quiet, and comfortable. The property is located near the rail line and within a large shopping complex. We explored London with ease from this location.

If you're visiting London from Stansend airport, Staybridge Suites are perfectly located for city exploration while making sure you're not trapped in the city madness. Looking at location, service, quality of accommodation and prices, I really found it to be a 'Sweet spot' of London.

I would like to say my overall stay in this hotel was very pleasant. We stayed for 5 nights from Christmas to Dec 30th 2016. Like other reviews mention, the location is next to the Mall and close to public transportation, which makes everyrhing easy to access. The breakfast was nice and the dinning area was comfortable. Even if not enough seats, you can bring tray in your room to grab something back to the room.However, there were two mornings we have to wait and wait for the staff to replenish the bread and bagels (well, actually everything was gone and I waited 15 minutes to get two sausages and some scrambled egg )  About house keeping, there were 2 mornings the lady did not knock and just opened our door. And when she realized someone was in the room, she did not return and never came back to clean. Upon checking with the front desk why our room was not made, I was told that we refused the services.( I did not even see the lady's face, how did I tell her that I don't need her to clean the room)  someone just popped the door open without knocking again at 8:30 in the morning. Seriously, at 8:30? We were shocked since we were still sleeping and apparently it was the house keeping. I just wish they could learn to knock and ask if the room needs to be clean next time.

We stayed here as a group of 6 visiting London. Hotel was lovely. We arrived early and reception looked after our bags. Reception staff really good and very efficient. Rooms were apartment type with a full kitchenette in it. Kitchen was clean and really tidy, even had washing up liquid and tea towels. Complimentary coffee and tea in the room. Bed was really comfy and provided a good night's sleep. Bathroom was clean with everything you needed for a shower included. Breakfast in the morning was fine, buffet style so a bit of something for everyone. Hotel is above Westfield centre so handy for shopping. It is right near the Olympic stadium and Stratford tube station is within a hundred yards so real easy to get into London. I would really recommend staying here if you go to London.

This is not my first review of this place,  it was great the first time and every time since (must have stayed over 50 nights now since 2012). Always the same, it is a great hotel in a great location....but really it is the staff who make the place so memorable. All of them without exception are friendly courteous and helpful. Well done to all of you!!! Keep on smiling üòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòäüòä

I had been searching at places to stay that would give me everything I needed in one location as we would only be staying for one night. This was to be for a birthday treat with a few surprises along the way whilst staying in the area. I like to plan ahead and get a good idea about my top three choices, using T.A and the customer feedback I have found invaluable.I hadn't actually considered somewhere like this before but having checked out it's facilities and location I was sold. I could not have been happier. Having caught our train from Euston to Stratford all via the underground we stayed warm and dry. It brought us right up into the Westfield shopping complex.It was a short walk to a conceirge service on the ground floor. We took the lift up to the hotel reception I think was the 11th floor. Our check in was smooth and quick having completed information in advance when placing our booking. Everything was so clean, with soft warming glow from good lighting throughtout the hotel and plush luxurious touches everywhere I looked very pleasing to the eye.We made our way to our room and could see from that the guests staying here they are clearly very respectful of others I could tell our stay was going to be fabulous. As we pushed the door back to our room the lamp light glow just drew us in past a kitchenette area that I'd really like in my home.It had everything we would need I was happy. Nice decor, great furniture, comfy beds, nice sized en-suite room, and the view across London and toward the Olympic park. My girlfriend was smiling this was a great choice. We quickly dropped our bags as I we had a pre-organised engagement to get to at one of the local restaurants on the  Westfield complex it was a 5 minute walk (review seperate for BUSABA to follow.)We didn't have far to go to anywhere we wanted since arriving it was perfect for us, we even planned to head into central London the day after which was only a short train ride away. It really gave us the choice for all we would need or want during our stay. We decided on one last drink before heading back to our room. We went to reception and bought a few beers which we could drink in the lounge area or even take them back to our room.It's not your conventional hotel and it was a very refreshing change. As we sat with our drinks over looking the skyline at night it was great. After which was an awesome night, great sleep to then grab a fresh, hot buffet style breakfast in the morning. So much choice, I even liked that you could either take a seat in the spacious breakfast lounge area or again you could take it back to your room. Having thoroughly enjoyed our visit, got ready, checked out and then headed into the Westfield shopping complex for some retail therapy. Excellent place, great location had everything we needed which made for a lightly packed travelling back. So pleased we'll definitely stay here again.

I stayed at Staybridge suites recently and it's a real home from home. The staff are all amazing . The accommodation is very comfortable and you can really settle in. Every comfort for a business trip has been thought of , from the lovely shower room to the well equipped Kitchen area. I find the socials are great for networking and help pass the evenings. I always opt to stay at Staybridge suites if I can .

Arrived here on a Friday afternoon with a 2 night booking good to go... if you're driving head for car park b level p2 and look for the casino/Staybridge suite glass doors which surround the lift and pay station area ... get off at ground level and head towards the chestnut plaza .. it's s shared entrance to lifts with Holliday inn on the left and the staybridge on the right. Reception is on the 12th floor. Lovely greeting on arrival from all reception staff ... we were there an hour early than we should've been but the guy behind the desk said they'd got rooms ready for us and then He gave us a choice .. 10th floor or 12th floor ... I asked which of the rooms were quieter I was then told the 12th floor .. we had 1219... end of the corridor right out of the way although to be honest I should imagine all rooms are pretty quiet... the room itself was spacious enough with everything you'd need for an enjoyable stay . The mini kitchen is really well equipped and you have all you need and more... decent shower and ensuite with a large comfy bed... desk... dressing table and a free nepresso machine! Kitchen has dishwasher, fridge , 3 hob and a microwave oven... next to reception is a small convenience type display of any last minute bits you might need. We both slept really well on both nights . Very quiet hotel in a great location !!!Breakfast was great .... lovely views over the east side whilst having your coffee... perfect way to start the day.The staff that looked after the breakfast area were great... very professional and quick to keep Stocking up food and kept tables clean etc... all of this was done with a smile too !Perfect for the 02 or just a shopping break this hotel is clean fresh tidy and above all the staff actually genuinely seem to care about you having a great experience... it's like it's their business ... it's a rare thing to find especially in London and when competition is all over the place ... the rest will have to work hard to keep up with these guys!We'll be back !!!

The room was nice.  Staff  were extremely friendly and a joy to talk to.  Location was great.  Many restaurants near by along with a very large shopping mall with a variety of stores.  A short walk to rail transportation which made it easy to get where I was going.

Really nice suites in the Westfield. Lovely decor, great cooking facilities. Staff excellent had a lovely breakfast and evening reception with complimentary wine, beer and nibbles. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

fantastic and friendly Staff,  from the day we walked in to the day that we walked out. Rooms cleaned on a daily basis. Extremely clean throughout the entire hotel. The part I liked was that the bedroom was completely separate from the tv room / kitchen. I'd highly recommend this hotel. For a short stay or that little longer one. Home away from home. I'd definitely be back.

The hotel has alot to offer. I went there on business. The price is affordable and the rooms are nice. I would recommend to friends and family. The location is what i was looking for. I hope that this was helpful.

Loved everything about our stay here.. very helpful and well behaved staff and good food ! Everything from Check in to room service to laundry etc. is excellent. Specially liked the socials organised by staff from Monday to Wednesday. Gives feel of a home away from home :)

I stay quite often in this hotel as you always feel welcome and in a way part of the StayBridges Suite family. The staff at the reception is amazing and very customer orientated.The room is always very clean and the kitchenette allows you to bring your food when you do not feel going to the restaurant. The breakfast is also very good with a great variety of food to chose from.

column9: Discover London starting from a wonderful residence
column10: It was one week journey in UK to visit for the first time this amazing cittadini‚Äã, but despite of the weather conditions,  we enjoyed London and the hotel facilities. The SBS is well connected with public transport,  located just on the Stratford station,  where there are connections with railway,  subway and busses. The staff was really profi, friendly and satisfied all of needs,  also the breakfast was complete with many choices. Really nice and wide the suite,  large bed and bathroom as well,  full equipped kitchen-wall in the entrance, adequate the price,  excellent the cleaning. Interesting the rest area, open 24/7,  were you can take warm drinks for free or buy something to cook by yourself.

Staybridge is the perfect choice for business and/or leisure! There is a social hour with nibbles and drinks each Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evening, and special events like Valentine's Day. A special thanks to Chris, MD and Steven for their pancake flipping skills on Shrove Tuesday (Mardis Gras). Thank you!

I arrived in London from Australia and stayed at Staybridge Suites and it honestly felt like a home away from home. All the staff were friendly and accommodating, making the stay even more enjoyable. MD would go out of his to make sure you were comfortable and had everything you required. The social nights were fantastic along with many other aspects of the hotel including the room service, breakfast, laundry and free wifi. A movie night up in the Den would be fantastic and a great way to guest to interact or relax after a hard day working or exploring the wonderful sites that London has to offer!

I am enjoying my stay in staybridge. Thanks to Mr. MD for helping me in all the ways for getting comfortable with the facilities over here. I have gained all knowledge about here and london now feels second home to me as it was new for me on day 1. Thanks MD again:)Asish Patnaik.

Stayed at this hotel February 21st 2016. This hotel is situated in the centre of Westfield shopping centre. The reception is on the 12th floor, we were checked in quickly and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean with a large bathroom. The breakfast was first class and you get lovely views from the breakfast/ lounge areas. The hotel is of a high standard and all the staff are friendly. Will definitely be returning

highly recommend this hotel. really warm welcome and the rooms are lovely! even got greeted with a home made cookie on arrival. breakfast was great quality with a lot of variety! great location will definitely be returning!

Just returned home after a 3 night stay. I've now stayed at 4 of the 5 Staybridge Suites in the UK and all rate highly. A great brand and I look forward to seeing more of these open in the future. A little different feel than hotels. Great staff (in particular Andre) and great rooms with a quality breakfast. They also hold a social evening on most nights, where you can have a glass of wine and nibbles before heading out or as a chance to meet other folk.If your visiting Stratford or 02/Greenwich then certainly a great base.

I've been to this hotel since my last review many times and it is still one of my favourites. They have amazing social nights 3 times a week. The staff is really friendly, we usually have a good chat. The Hungarian night was cool, Dalma cooked delicious Hungarian food, what as a Hungarian I can tell was top. Continue the great job!

column9: Very impressive with some fantastic staff, Dalma in particular
column10: Clean and well organised, self contained room.  Very convenient location and some impressive inclusions (drinks, gym, washer/dryer, etc.).  We were lucky enough to have Dalma cook for us one night, she's an asset to this already impressive hotel!

The suites had everything I needed and more, breakfast was amazing and the staff is very professional and helpful. I would recommend the hotel. It's 3 minutes away from the underground and the train station so you can get to the center in under 35 minutes.

column9: A great way to stay in a "hotel"
column10: I was introduced to the staybridge suites so chose the London, Stratford one a few weeks ago. I travel a lot for work so miss my home comforts and this is ideal and you get a little kitchen with cooking facilities. I will return Only one issue the whole hotel smelt really bad and when I mentioned it to the staff he simple said "yes I know, it's been like that for months, Time to call a plumber, I think.

im a meber of the IHG group and this was the first time to stay in the staybridge suits...it was really amazing 1. staff were great , really friendly and helpful, got to know us by name.2. very kid friendly with all amenities needed , there is a games room with bioard games and stuff 3. the rooms very spacious and again has all you need.4. very convenient minis-tore if you need to by something ...supermarkets are very close but if your stuck its fine and resonably priced 5. breakfast is good , buffet and menu is alright it can improve with variety other options ...but im sure this is what you get ..not complaining 6. the view is amazing overlooking the olympic park and downstairs the the amazing westfield mall with shops, restaurants, cafes, transportation....it was a lovely experience e and definitely would go back there and try in future to stay in stay bridge suits if possible well done !!

We stayed for one night in the hotel. The facilities were excellent. Helpful courteous staff and really quite comfortable stay.  This is a great location for all the shops and restaurants too. The room was spacious and well equipped with all you need.

An amazing place to stay right by Westfield shopping centre and West hams ground. Really nice suite everything you need away from home. The suite is amazing with added extras . An amazing breakfast with lots to choose from and really friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

I am a frequent IHG guest but had never stayed in the Staybridge brand.  I have been missing out!Breakfast is much better than HIE, room quality is on par with some ICs that I have stayed in.  As a frequent business traveller the suite concept removes the usual hotel feeling which I like.Staff were great from check in to concierge, breakfast staff and checkout.Stratford is far from central but the DLR and Underground service is very close and make things feel closer, my business commutes to Docklands and Westminster were without incident.  The Westfield mall vicinity (mall entrance is 15 meters or so from the hotel entrance) gives plenty of activity, bar and restaurant options in the evening.  Rooms are on the 8 - 11th floors, so no noise from the mall.

column9: Nice rooms and great customer service
column10: I've stayed here several times. The reception staff are really very friendly and focused on giving a great experience. I often turn up at 8 am on the day I am due to check in and am always invited to go and help myself to breakfast - I have never experienced that at any other hotel.The rooms are well equipped. The unique feature is that each room has a small kitchen, complete with fridge, microwave, hob and even a dishwasher. All the plates, cups, saucepans you would ever need are supplied. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom has plenty of space.On the top floor, where the reception is, there is a large longue where you can go to read, chat, have a drink, watch TV etc.The hotel is in the middle of the Stratford Westfield, so there is a great selection of shops within a minute or two's walk.

Staybridge Stratford was home at the beginning and end of a Europe trip.  Really appreciated that laundry access at the end!  Great eggs and sausage english breakfast, warm friendly staff.  Lots of space to chill in the evening.  A whole floor is dedicated to common space.  Very accessible from tube station and within a giant shopping complex with M&S.   Having a fully functioning kitchenette was very convenient.

column9: Great view in a clean and comfortable room
column10: The front desk staff war perfect from the start. Always helpful and were always there to help. The Breakfast was great and they had everything. The room was really comfortable and clean, so nothing bad to say. Would love to stay there again.

column9: Excellent value, much nicer than a hotel, will stay again!
column10: Stayed for a weekend to relax, shop, go to the cinema and eat out.  Couldn't have found a better place to stay at Westfield. Lovely, spacious apartment, good breakfast, free coffee and sparkling water on demand, very friendly and helpful staff, great view from breakfast room and from 12th floor patio.  Excellent value!

Stayed there for almost 3 month and there is nothing i can complaint of. Wonderful staff and special thanks to MD for his kind hospitality. Breakfast has a variety and so much to choose from! Beautiful and clean room which has everything i can think of- Small kitchen with every needful equipment, nice bathroom with great shower and a comfy bed and sofa, beautiful view from the window and reception area. Having social on three days a week is an add on!! The best thing about hotel is the location which is situated just besides the building and metro station is within 5 minutes walking. One can never get bored here! Great hotel with great service and facilities!

column9: Nice hotel but be aware of lying reception staff
column10: This hotel is well located just outside the westfield Mall in Stratford, London. There is no direct car park to the hotel but if you are driving you need to go to the car park B of the Westfield mall. The hotel entrance is shared with the Holiday Inn hotel. On entry to the hotel building, you need to take the lift on the right hand side. The reception for Staybridge is on the 12th floor.Everything looks impressive except for our check in experience. We found out that the receptionist lied to us. As a frequent traveller, I am a Platinum Ambassador level of IHG and I always get upgraded when I check it. However this time, we were told on check in that we were allocated the best room but when I complained we were given many choices of much better rooms by another staff. I think it is unacceptable for reception staff to lie. If there is better room then those who are entitled should be upgraded. I hope the management will read this review and tell me if it is in the hotel policy to let reception staff lie. Now I will never believe what this hotel reception staff tell me. I think the manager need to improve on the staff training. Honesty is paramount! I am still angry whenever I recall this incidence. Other than this unpleasant experience, the hotel is nice and I will stay here again if needed.

We booked this as an extremely last minute thing, not expecting that much, but what a find this place has turned out to be.We travel quite a lot and I can honestly say I don't think I've ever stayed anywhere where every staff member you meet is so pleasant and always smiling. They are engaging without being intrusive and a real credit to this hotel.Room was spotlessly clean, bed comfortable , breakfast was more than adequate and the help yourself to coffee , tea etc all day in the lounge area was a nice touch. We had a small kitchen in our room which was probably the best equipped kitchen I've come across in a self catering apt. Free wifi also included which quite a lot of hotels still charge for. Also included in price free laundry room and a small gym.Would I stay here again....definitely.

Brilliant location. Room was very clean with amazing views. Staff were so friendly and polite. Breakfast is brilliant, so much choice.We were hear for two nights, parking cost us ¬£25 from Saturday 11am until Monday 2pm so that's not to bad at all knowing the car is secure.

We booked 2 suites at the Staybridge for 1 night as we were going to the theatre.On arrival at Westfield parking was so easy following the Instructions given when booking. We were warmly greeted shown where to get a hot drink and given a very tasty complimentary cookie.Our suites were excellent containing all you would need for ojr stay+much more,including microwave hob fridge dishwasher and more right down to washing up liquidOur suite was absolutely spotless.Because of the perfect location we were spoilt for choice when it came to dinner and all within 5mins walk.Breakfast has a lovely at home feel to it loads of choice and you can take it back to your room or just sit and look at the fantastic views across London.There is also free laundry facilities and gym on site.I cannot wait to return for a longer stay this would definitely be our hotel of choice when in London.

Amazing apart Hotel ! Very convenient; a 20 minute metro ride away in a very self sufficient mall, the Stratford metro station right below the mall ; the station has around 5 metro lines, one can get to anywhere in London in a 20 to 30 minute ride.Brand new property, real spacious and well appointed suites ( one bedroom apartment) ; absolutely spic & span; wonderful staff ;Strengths:Train connectivity. Size and facilities of the room.Service minded & efficient staff.Cleanliness. Mall, eateries & restaurants. Complimentary Tea & Coffee - 24 Hours.Laundry facility. Gym.Concergies services. Weakness:Bedroom area lighting very poor ( suite # 931 )No shower cubicle - step into a Tub in -  2017 !!!Only 2 elevators for such large property. On the whole: the most convenient place to stay in London.

This hotel caters to both corporate and leisure travelers. Not to mention, a bit historic. I am guessing hotel was mainly built for the Olympics-slightly out of London main city though. Saying that, it may not be in the centre of London, this is not a problem as you can get the tube to explore the quaint city any time you wish.For people who love to shop, this is overly convenient. Exactly situated where one if the biggest & largest mall in Europe is-Westfield Stratford City. Parking space would never be a problem-the hotel has designated parking area in the mall. This is a bit tricky especially when you are using a Sat Nav. Best way is to ring the reception and they will direct if you struggle a bit like we did.The hotel is pretty new and the best part of  it is they have a pantry open 24-Hours so you can help yourself to everything, don't miss the coffee-one of the best feature! You can make yourself soecialty coffees without any cost too! For coffee lovers, this  would definitely make you smile!If your are tired from roaming around the mall and London sight seeing, the hotel have a lounge. Go sit there, grab some nibbles in the pantry and watch telly or read magazines and books.Breakfast is typical continental and full English breakfast. If you want to pass on the breakfast, restaurants are everywhere just outside or head inside the shopping mall to try the food. So many places to eat and dine, take away or if no joy-you can grab some bits in the grocery and cook yourself a lovely meal in your room.The room has a really good size, with your own kitchen and dining. Cooking utensils, plates, etc are provided. Guess what, even dish washing liquid and sponge is provided. This makes me feel like I am home. This is a hotel which makes you have the feel of your own home!I would definitely be back and recommend this place. One of the new-ish and nicest hotels I have been in UK.

Been here a few times and this visit we did not get the room we wanted, poor explanation. Cooked breakfast sits too long once cooked on the heaters so it's disappointing. Good location and excellent helpful staff.

column9: King size bed much smaller than in US
column10: Booked king size bed, but was surprised to find barely a Queen. Hotel staff was friendly and explained,  that bed sizes are smaller in UK than US. Bathroom was very small. Loved the breakfast. Hotel close to shopping and train station.

We have just returned from staybridge suites. We stayed for 1 night while going to the o2 and shopping at Westfield. Its right in the centre. We couldn't have asked for more from a hotel. We had a lovely suite looking over the city on the 10th floor. Lovely kitchen area and a wonderful shower! Very quiet. Breakfast was included and was very nice. Thank you for a brilliant stay!

column9: 6/5 if I could!  Home from home.
column10: Essentially, this hotel couldn't be better.  Being a particularly difficult guest to impress, I really couldn't improve on anything I experienced on my recent 5-night stay.I was there for a bit of R&R combined with working from my laptop after surgery.  I chose the Staybridge Suites as I was a bit conscious that a "normal" hotel might drive me mad stuck in a small room with only a kettle to its name.The staff were all, without fail, excellent.  A couple of guys on reception really went above and beyond their duty to make sure I had everything I needed (even lending me a chair from their office as mine was a little lower than I was comfortable using at my desk!).The room (I had a 1 bed suite) was great.  Perfect to relax in with all the amenities I could have needed.  Apple TV was a nice touch too; helped with a binge-watch of a Netflix boxset from my iphone!If you're looking for a great place to stay and you're torn over the holiday inn downstairs and here, choose the Staybridge - I've stayed in both!  Every member of Holiday Inn staff need to stay in a Staybridge and experience what great service is like.I'll be back at this hotel as soon as I can find a reason to do so!  Might need to invent a business trip...!  Thanks all, from a very happy guest.

Excellent place to stay. Staff are lovely and very helpful. Great facilities for cooking things. Coffee machine in room. Good kitchen. Comfy bed. Good shower. Supply of shampoo conditioner and shower gel. Excellent serve yourself breakfast or take it away. No complaints.

column9: Great location for a shopping week end
column10: Friendly and helpful staff It was possible to check in early at no additional costGood breakfastProximity of the Westfield mall, olympic stadium and London City Airport allow a good all in one week-end outing.

Booked x2 rooms staying 2/12 for 3 adultsCelebrating a birthday so was close to tube for central London partying. I often stay next door at the holiday inn and imagined the staybridge suites to be a step up so payed the extra to stay here.Service was great we were upgraded upon arrival (not sure of what the difference in rooms would of been)Room was nice, although dirty coffee pods still in the coffee machine and a dirty ear bud in the corned of the bathroom. Shower pressure wasn't great and was very basic. was nice to have the kitchenette in the room but preferred next door the holiday inns rooms. No usual hotel amenities such as shower cap and wash bottles were less than half full!breakfast was ok but most things stone cold when we went down at 9:15am.We stay in Stratford once a month but for the money there at better places to stay.

I have to stay regularly in London and have struggled to find a good place to stay.  I originally stayed at the Premier Inn at Stratford but that has become a little tired and as for breakfast wait times....forget it! So when I was recommended to stay here I was more than happy to give it a try.  The room is very large with a small kitchen, other rooms are available with baths, disabled access, separate bedroom etc. but even the basic room is great.My favourite thing in the room is the shower, it has great pressure, easily controlled temprature and a large shower cubicle. It's great! The also provide shower gel, shampoo and conditioner too and a few essentials in the kitchen. Free coffe and tea is also provided witha Nespresso machine in every room :)

Truly great location right next to westfeild shopping centre and walking distance to Stratford station. The breakfast is good and rooms are clean and nice. Been here before and hopefully will be here in the future too. The staffs are great ( mostly ) and a prefect place for vacation or business. Lots of restaurant within walking distance.

Postcode takes you to a multi storey car park which is part of the shopping centre however¬† the hotel is easily signposted from the lift. Parking cost ¬£9.50 for 24 hours, which in a safe, secure location in london was a¬† bargain! Arrived at the hotel and was greeted by friendly and welcoming staff, check in was quick and simple. Got to the room which was beautiful, you get what you pay for, abundent amount of appliances, microwave, hob, dishwasher, you could stay for a week self sufficiently! The bed was clean and comfortable and even though im 6ft 3 i comfortably fitted within the bed without my feet dangling over the edge. The bathroom was also lovely with a powerful, easy to use shower. Check out was mid day so there was no rush in the morning and an all you can eat self service breakfast was included for free. We would like to give a special thanks to Hayat, who went above and beyond,¬† when she heard us talking about coffee in our hungover state and while we were getting our breakfast made us our drinks and found us a table by the window, making sure we were looked after without being asked or prompted. Overall great location, 2 minute walk to the nearest tube station, Westfield shopping centre on your door step. The only slight niggle was the lift system which at times decided not to open when you got to your floor but really enjoyed our stay and we will be returning! 9.6/10

Stay here for 6 nights. Hotel is very spacious and clean.It has a small open kitchen with all the kitchen equipment. Bed is comfort but a little small (queen size).Breakfast is good (standard continental breakie) but the Pancake is very good.Location is convenient, beside Stratford international train station. Take the train (not metro) to St Pancras International station ( King Cross Metro Station ) and from there you can go anywhere easily.Excellent Hotel !!

Great hotel. The staff is very nice and want to make the guest satisfied. Alexandra from the reception is very kind.The hotel is  close to a big mall and excellent for shoping.Breakfast is good and you have coffee all day free. Train to the center of London will take you 30 min.Very recommend.

It was a very nice accommodation in Staybridge in Stratford London, comfortable and quiet to stay in. Anass was a professional guy, he made my stay easier with his support many times. Thanks Staybridge, Thanks Anass

column9: One important night. Slept like a baby
column10: Not in the 'Up all night crying, eating and pooping' way a baby does. I slept well. And this was important to me. I can't go overboard on Staybridge. I checked in at 21:00 on Friday, and back out at 07:30 on Saturday. But I needed to sleep. (Rowing competition in the morning - don't go to sleep, I'm not going to tell you about it!!)And sleep I got. Checked in easily - quick, simple, no hassle. Room was nice and high up, away from any potential noise, with a good view of that odd spiral thingy next to the stadium. Kitchen was great (I didn't use a thing) - and the Nespresso machine was a good touch - the pods gave me a proper pick me up in the morning ahead of going to my competition. Toilet was lovely! Something you'd expect in a much more expensive hotel. TV was good, remote worked, and it was loud enough in the room without setting it too loud. And the bed. Big, comfy, loads of pillows. Not too hot, not cold. I slept well. Alarm clock needed to be setup as it was unplugged, but plugging it in set the time, so I just had to use my brain to work out how to set the alarm. Check-out was quick. Maybe because I'd booked it through Expedia, but I just had to say I was checking out, and 60 seconds later I was on my way. Location wise, it was right next to the Westfield shopping place - amazing if you're into that kinda thing. Close to Olympic stadium (West Ham now?) the Aquatic centre, and the Velodrome. Sadly, I didn't get to do breakfast, but someone else i know did, and loved it. Next time I'm racing this competition, I'll stay here. But I'll put part of the reason I won a silver medal down to the good night's sleep I got.

Another stay at Staybridge and it was another enjoyable visit... On arrival I mentioned it was my birthday! They gave a complimentary cidre and some chocolate. The receptionists were fantastic and very helpful. Every thing we needed was available and the staff so easy to approach. 5* for such a fab team of people.Our room was clean and tidy. On each day our bed was made and our room tidied up which made everything that little bit more special.They have a free laundry room... You just need your own soap... Which is fab... It gives you the opportunity to wash any lil things you may need when you head back home. Breakfast was fab... Lovely coffee... Lovely views from the top floor... Just spectacular.On departure we were refreshed and Happy after our lil breakaway from reality!Deffo 5* will visit again very soon!!!

Starting from check in to check out..the staff was courteous, so helpful and always had a smile which I think is so important always! I would always get spot on directions from concierge which left me no reason to look at maps at any given time! Breakfast was a spread to choose from..my room was spacious and so comfortable..so no complaints there.This was my first time in London really so cannot comment on location..but I had no trouble moving around since the hotel is conveniently located near a train station which makes it convenient to get to wherever you need to be. I would definitely go back whenever next in London...

column9: Excellent. Really nothing to moan about.
column10: Excellent says it all really. Have stayed here before, and a staying here again in the next few weeks. Always clean, staff always helpful, rooms well-appointed, and generally very quite. It is lovely to have the complimentary, unlimited tea and coffee throughout the stay, and it is also lovely to have the Nespresso machine in the room recently as well. Breakfast is good, and staff are really friendly and helpful. Would be well worth a stay, and is a fab establishment with easy connections to Central via the tube. Excellent previous stays, excellent current stay, and I would be more than confident to say I will be having another excellent stay in a few weeks. (If you have an IHG membership, make sure you book with this for extra rewards in due course).

Had a great 2 night stay.  Good location for all transport & shops at Westfield.  Rooms brilliant.  Full kitchen including dishwasher, large fridge,  espresso coffee maker. Fantastic views from our window overlooking Olympic park & dome.  Looked so pretty at night.  Bed huge & comfy.  Bathroom lovely with huge walk in shower & quality bath products.  Very quiet too.  Breakfast outstanding with lots of choices including hot food,  cereals,  fruit in the restaurant on top floor with views over London. Staff outstanding so helpful,  friendly & caring as husband in wheelchair. With particular mention for MD who was so helpful & always with a smile.  Will definitely return & recommend to friends & family.  Thank you for a wonderful stay.

From the time we arrived until the time we checked out the service we received was excellent. The reception staff MD and Georgiana welcomed us back for our visit. I was also presented with the guest of the day award at the time, which was a nice added little touch to our stay. Check in process was nice and smooth with no hassles or problems. We had problems with the first room we was given, unfortunately we couldnt access it as the batteries were dead in the door lock, so we went back to reception and they sorted us out another room, which resulted in us being upgraded, which was a very nice touch. Our room was lovely, very spacious and clean and the bed was huge!!! Our nights sleep was excellent and couldnt ask for any more. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent. With an excellent choice of hot and cold food. My partner was very fond of the little pancakes that you can make yourself. There was a great choice of food and being diabetic didnt have a problem with finding something that I could have. Checking out was just as smooth as check in. Keep up the great work and we will be back soon. Would definately recommend the hotel to anyone that is stayng in the area.

What a wonderful surprise tonight to have a lovely Christmas dinner provided for the social tonight.  Many thanks to all the staff but a special thank you to Stephan who worked so hard today to make it all happen.  Merry Christmas.

We had a wonderful stay here for two nights on the 9th-11th December. Room was a great size with a lovely kitchen. Breakfast brilliant.  Really unique hotel loved the pantry where kids enjoyed stocking up on treats. 24 hour complimentary coffee too. Great sized bathroom huge walk in shower. Staff were so friendly especially man who checked us in late afternoon.

Lovely rooms, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Even got a kitchen! All staff very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast. Location is great for tube into London. Reasonably priced parking very close to hotel. Couldn't fault it!

column9: Home from home at Staybridge Suites London Stratford city
column10: Stayed 3 nights over the "Black Friday" weekend. This was our first visit to a Staybridge Suites and we chose a one bedroom suite. The rate booked directly on the hotel site was very good and was actually cheaper on the Saturday night than the nearby Premier Inn! We arrived shortly after the 3pm check in to find a large queue, but the check in staff worked efficiently, so the wait was less than 5 minutes. I did ask on check in if we could have a room overlooking the Olympic park, but these had already been allocated. As it turned out, much of the views over the Olympic park are being obscured by new high rise buidings under construction. Our room on level 9 overlooked Westfields shopping mall. The suite was spacious and the kitchen provided the flexability to eat in the room. One obivious ommission in the room was the absence of a table to comfortably sit and eat at. There was a coffee table and a sort of breakfast bar, but the available chairs were slightly too low to eat comfortably from the bar. The hotel operated a policy of no maid service Saturday and Sunday (unless requested), which we were happy with. The hotel provided a complimentary breakfast and even gave guests the option to bring breakfast back on trays provided to eat in their rooms. This seemed a good idea if your room was on the same floor as the restaurant on level 12, but not very practical if you have to take a tray of food and drink to a different floor via the busy lifts as there were only two.  We loved that the hotel was within Westfields shopping Mall so that we could shop and return to our room in minutes. We went into Oxford Street on Friday evening using the Central Line tube. The journey time was about 20 minutes. On Saturday, we went for a walk around the Olympic park which has some lovely open space for residents and seems to be well utilised. Westfields has two railway stations, Stratford International and Startford City which has an integrated transport hub with rail, tube DLR and bus all avialable. On our final morning, we nearly got caught out with the early finish time for breakfast of 9.30am - this does seem a little early and appeared to have caught other guests out. As the check out was 12 noon and reception very kindly allowed us an extension to 1pm, we enjoyed a last walk around Westfields before checking out. There was a slight hick up when we returned to our room at 11:45 to find that our room key had been deactivated and I had to go up to reception to get it sorted. I could understand how that could happen if we had returned to our room after the official 12 noon check out - but not before!! Overall we had a lovely weekend and would certailnly recommend Staybridge Suites and would stay again.

Great hotel in a great location.Stayed here on a Sunday night as I had an early morning business meeting in Stratford.The hotel has a very friendly concierge who meets you at the front door.The hotel is modern, clean and well maintained.I will definitely stay here again.

column9: Another amazing visit to Staybridge!!!! you MUST go!!
column10: I stayed here 2-4 Dec, and being a returning visitor knew what kind of hospitality to expect. I was not disappointed... the staff here are AMAZING. They really make it the wonderful and warm experience it is. The design and interior is very homely too.The rooms are modern and very clean, very well maintained with working nespresso coffee machines, fridges, hobs, microwaves etc. The showers are strong, the amenities are of good quality. The included breakfast is great.The wifi is free and plentiful, the view out the windows is great, the location is fantastic - 15 min tube into central London, and the tube station is under the hotel so next door. You have SO many food options in Westfield and shopping options too. Or maybe go explore the olympic park which is only a stones throw from the hotel.I will only ever stay here when I visit London... !!!

column9: Initial problem at check in but once resolved the hotel is great
column10: Location is fantastic üòä. Staff helpful and friendly , rooms are spacious and have everything needed for a stay in London. Many restaurants within seconds walk. Breakfast is styled as if you are in your own home and has a wide range of hot and cold items

Pro's: - very convenient location tied in with Westfield Shopping Centre and the Stratford transportation hub- adjacent to the West Ham football stadium- comfortable common areas with plenty of seating and excellent free breakfasts and free dinners on some nights.Cons:- the standard room is fairly tight with less room than we expected- although the room has a full kitchen only one chair was provided and the table was small. So only really suitable for solo travelers for eat-in- you cannot drive to the hotel entrance. The closest street is 150 yards awayOverall we had an enjoyable stay and the staff were very attentive.

After being let down by broken promises we were not sure what to expect. The check in out process is a bit of a nightmare. Another let down and really not the hotels fault is right outside the front door is a smoking area which you have to walk thru to get into the hotel not nice.The location for shopping and the stadium is great for sure. The breakfast was really good and the rooms with the kitchenette is good. The shower is nice but not so keen on the bath products in huge bottles. Another huge benefit was the free laundry and such an asset for us as we had been traveling a lot and one of the reason's I picked this hotel was for laundry. Once you got the hang of the layout it was good. We would stay here again.

My stay in Staybridge suites was a comfortable one and worth the money! The room was a good size and having the living room and kitchenette was fantastic! I had a small issue with payment but this was resolved very quickly with very understanding staff! Overall a great stay!

column9: Great location for going to Excel or O2
column10: This is the second time we stay there and for 3 nights and I have to say I am very impressed. The service is always very friendly and helpful, the views from the room and eating area on the 12th floor are really nice, the location is great and close to everything! I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to coming again next year great job! Boom

This is a great hotel in a really convenient position if you are working in the city with tons of cheap parking.  The outstanding thing here though is Georgiana Chifu, the Guest Services Manager.  I was so impressed with her service that I wrote to the hotel to explain this and I received a really lovely reply from Georgiana herself.Not only did she go above and beyond the call of duty but she made me feel like an old friend rather than a customer.  Such a lovely woman that is amazing at her job, doing the little extra things without being asked.I stay in hotels 2-3 nights per week almost every week and this is the best service I've ever received at any IHG property, in fact, the best service I've received at any hotel ever.Really nice hotel with an exceptional member of staff; thank you Georgiana!

Stayed there on the 19th of November to attend a concert at the Copper Arena.Lovely hotel-spacious clean rooms,easy to get to and next to the shopping mall& casino.Special mention to the the helpful staff( reception and concierge on both days) - always smiling and ready to help. Looking forward to my next visit.

Exuberant staff, stylish, well stocked rooms, lovely modern vibe. I loved my stay here and being in such close proximity to the shopping centre was definitely a bonus for me (not my partner). I think the only 'even better if' would be a bit more choice and a bit better organisation at breakfast (had to wait a while for cutlery).

Had our third stay at this hotel this year. This place is really excellent and as good as any of the Staybridge Suites we have stayed at in the USA. The staff are incredibly helpful - a special thanks to Nicolas for his help. Cannot recommend this place enough

This mall is very convenient for the business or leisure traveler. It is connected to the Westield shopping mall and you can practically spend the whole day inside the mall which is what we did when it was raining outside. It is also the connected to Stratford station, the terminating point of the Jubillee line. The rooms are clean, and comfortable. There is microwave, coffee maker and dishwasher and complete utensils and cooking equipment. The laundry on the 12th is free for all guests. Breakfast was good and choices were many. A coffee maker and hot water for tea are available 24/7 at reception. The staff were efficient and friendly.   Truly a home away from home. Highly recommended!

I have stayed at Staybridge Suites Stratford at least 5-6 times now over the last year, each time staying around 3-7 nights. And I can only say that this hotel is truly home away from home. It is comfortable, clean, the rooms are large, and has wonderful service. Stefan and Greg from the front desk have been excellent in my most recent stay. They are friendly, professional, and ever so helpful! London is an expensive place, but Staybridge Suites prices are very reasonable for the level of comfort and service you get. It provides a decent breakfast every morning, and has free flow of water, tea, and coffee round the clock. It also has plenty of space for lounging.The location is far from the city centre, but it's one high speed train stop away from St Pancras, and it is well served by the Central and Jubilee tube lines which can get you pretty much anywhere in town.

ONE ISSUE:  My taxi driver had a hard time figuring out where to drop me off.  That was literally the only problem I had the whole time!  Just so you know you need to go into Car Park B for the Westfield Mall.  You take a little coin and get 30 free minutes in the parking garage so the car service can drop you.  Follow the signs up the escalator and you are right in the middle of everything! LOCATION:  So nice!  I was working at the Casino which was a 10 second walk.  It is basically in a mall so there are tons of shops and restaurants and anything you need. STAFF:  Extremely friendly CONVENIENCE: They have a great little shop to grab snacks, wine, water, etc.  They offer room service.  There is a kitchen in your room.  BEST PART:  They allow you to take a tray to breakfast and bring it back to your room!!  I love this.  I can go and get breakfast and eat at my own pace instead of wasting time in the breakfast room.  It has everything I have ever desired in a hotel for a business trip!  Would definitely recommend and stay again.

I stayed at The Staybridge Suites for business whilst travelling to London for WTM - I am familiar with this brand and have always been extremely happy, however I was disappointed on this occasion. Firstly I had requested a room with a view on a higher floor and was put on a lower floor (the 8th) over looking the AC for a local casino/shopping centre  - I think this was partly to do with their central reservations department, the lady whom I spoke with didn't really understand me. I was told to go back to reception the following day and see if I could be moved. The water in the bath was regulated and set to a maximum temperature, which was not hot just very warm. On the second day I asked once again to be moved but they cold not move me to a room with a view. Then the flush in the toilet could not be flushed again within about 40-60 minutes of the first flush - which is not acceptable, so they moved me to another very similar room - again with no view. Coffee was not replenished either and I was not informed of the managers reception (which you usually are when you check in) The second room there was an extremely strong smell of cooking or body odour I am not sure but made me feel sick - I had to keep the widows opened all day and night. I was offered to move to another similar room but did not want to then re pack once again so just decided to stay put. Reading the reviews most people seem extremely delighted here, so not sure if I was just expecting more from this brand but for ¬£250 a night I would probably go back and stay at The Westbridge next time. On a good note - the location is absolutely perfect for The Westfield shopping centre and the staff I think did try to assist were possible.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel one night because we had a dinner near Stratford with some relatives from Portugal, we just slept there but we felt like home.I suggest asking a room with a view, they have huge windows and it makes you feel welcome

Nice comfortable room, clean and had everything we needed. The guy who checked me in was very friendly and lovely, and it made for a nice change. I was worried about noise in the hotel from the bars etc below, but it wasn't a problem.  Much of the breakfast was a bit cold, and a little disappointing, but given it was free (bonus), it wasn't really the end of the world.

Visited the Staybridge on Thursday and had an excellent experience. I didn't have any expectations as I hadn't heard of or used the brand before but I was  more than pleasantly surprised.  The staff were fabulous, friendly and helpful, the suite was clean, large and super comfortable. The restaurant and bar area were clean and well stocked and the complimentary drink, snacks and breakfast were very unexpected and thoroughly enjoyed. I would definitely be staying again and would recommend for both business and pleasure.

I am a business traveller and the Staybridge is perfect for working away from base. Clean and sophisticated the Suit is so very useful. However what makes this hotel extra special is the staff. They are extremely polite and completely customer focused. Stephan and Greg on reception are simply the best. The fact that they remember me each time i visit reassures me that i am a valued customer. I highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here last weekend..we were in London for fireworks..as soon as we walked in we were made to feel very welcome...Reception is on 12 floor along with breakfast area...Had a suite on the 11 floor which was really like a small flat...everything you could possibly need for a great stay. Had buffet breakfast in morning which was very good Will definitely be returning. Thank you Staybridge Suites

column9: 2 Visits in 2 weeks!! Still Love it.
column10: I stayed here for on 2 separate occasions within a week so I guess I must like it.  As I have revised this before I will just go over any major points.  The hotel is perfect for a visit to London without being in the centre or wanting to drive.  I parked the car on both occasions easily and not expensive and then caught the bullet train into the city taking merely 15 mins.  Buffet breakfast was great as before and on the second visit my husband took the handy tray from the room and filled it up and so we had breakfast in the room for no extra cost.  The rooms and bathrooms still look brand new and modern.  Hotel staff were able to allocate me the same room both times as it was so nice and we love the kitchenettes.  Westfield shopping is still amazing ad now you walk around the park makes the whole area feel so much bigger.  Lets see how many times i can visit next year?

Stayed here many times and never fails to impress me, clean big rooms, excellent breakfast with lots of choice, decent coffee available 24/7, Laundry facilities and small fitness room. parking is so cheap also. Staff are so friendly , I left my phone charger in the room and it was waiting for me on my return to collect. Very impressive

This is the second time we have stayed here and I wrote a good review then - nothing has changed it is still great.Reception staff are always friendly, helpful and willing to sort out any issues you may have while staying at this hotel. The rooms are spotless and comfortable as was the bed, having the kitchen was ideal if you want to cook - we just did breakfast and ate at any of the restaurants in Westfield as they are right out the front door of the building. Being at Westfield you are only about a 5 minute walk to the tube station, DLR and buses if needed.

First time with this hotel.The hotel is just outside the shopping mall - literally a few steps.The building houses the Holiday Inn as well as Staybridge. Although they have separate elevators.The reception for Staybridge is on the 12th floor. Check-In was swift enough and I was allocated a Suite on the 11th Floor.The suite itself has a kitchenette and good sized bed, shower room rather than bath.Only there for the evening, although will most definitely use again.Great access to the bars and restaurants within the wider complex.

Excellent customer service on arrival after an issue with our booking. The gents of reception couldn't find the booking even after giving all the details. While asking us to waiting they offered us something to drink. I advised of a Restuarant booking we had and they sorted a room within 10 minutes. So from a negative feeling on arrival they reception staff quickly turned this around. Felt like John Lewis service.The hotel in vernal was very nice, clean situated great for events at the Olympic Park. The room was very good, bathroom was very nice.Would return again.

column9: Great location.  Great hotel. Great staff!
column10: Perhaps my subject line said it all but I like to be abit more elaborate perhaps because I like to read elaborate and detailed reviews. We stayed here for 2 nights.Location is perfect literally on the door step of the Westfield shopping center. Lobby was clean and inviting, it extends into a quite a large sitting area. Which is tastefully decorated. Clean, welcoming and comfortable. With ample sitting area (and a balcony).There was no one at check in for a good 5 min. When someone did come they went on to present 'guest of the day' awards to 2 separate couples because aparently it was their birthday. They went on to take some photos. We waited still. Seeing as it was sort of a goodwill gesture and a happy moment I didn't mind waiting. After that check in was quick and friendly with lots of smiles from both front desk staff. Room was very clean and comfortable with the sofabed as we had 2 children.  The Cons...We woke up Saturday morning and went out for the day. Got back at 4pm and our room was not cleaned. For about ¬£250 (i think) per night we expected our room to be cleaned by this time.  Especially since we had a brief chat to the housekeeping staff as we left the hotel that morning. After a couple of phone calls we learnt that, in fact, we didn't inform the check in staff that we wanted our room cleaned. This hotel does not have anyone to clean the rooms on the weekends  unless specified at check in or atleast 24hours previously.  Gentleman on the desk sincerely apologised for not having informed us at check in and I was happy with the way the matter was handled.  Mistakes happen.Also breakfast is free. But the selection of food could be slightly better. I understand their need to have a different menu for those that are staying there long term...but every breakfast needs baked beans! ;-) and some hot choclate for the younger ones would be nice like Holiday Inn express does. Would I go back to this hotel. Yes I definitely would.

Arrived at the Staybridge on Friday to stay with family also stopping here.  Very easy, polite and no fuss check-in.  Was located on the 10th floor, nice and clean and quiet with a lovely view.  Early rise and went for breakfast in a relaxed self service atmosphere.

I stayed here with my wife in October and was very pleasantly surprised. The welcome upon arrival was very friendly and set us at ease, the staff were helpful and pleasant to deal with and the room itself was spacious. The bathroom was clean and well fitted, there was a little kitchen, and the king size bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed outer stay in the room, breakfast was a buffet but was extensive and delicious, and we were able to take breakfast back to our room to enjoy it alone. Would definitely recommend and will be staying again in future

column9: Very different type of set up
column10: Spent a single night stay on a Sunday. Very friendly and efficient staff. Arrived early for trip up The Orbit but leaving the bag with the concierge was smooth and faultless. Reception on Floor 12 was very unfussy but no less effective. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff at all times of day or night. Room was very well equipped, with a great sense of space. The kitchen area wasn't used but would recommend suite for longer stays. Dined out though we could have easily dined in or cooked something ourselves. Breakfast was very informal but really good. Hot food could have been hotter but overall plenty of choice, plenty of space, no sense of having to rush off. Moved up to sofa for papers afterwards! A great location for the Olympic Park and The Westfield Shopping Experience.

column9: Couldn't fault it close access to Olympic Park venues
column10: Great place to stay,  like a hotel room but with a small but well equipped kitchenette.Positioned right in the centre of the Westfield shopping centre but on the top floors so no noise disturbance. Unusual set up for breakfast which feels more like stopping with friends as guests help themselves to things laid out in a sort of kitchen area. This would be a really good place to stay for a protracted period as it's got a less stuffy feeling than most hotels. Warm welcome and checked in an hour early with no issues. Everywhere clean and tidy so no complaints at all.

We booked through booking.com a suite - checked in at 3.20 (earliest check in was 3) - two nights.  When getting to our room saw we had been given disabled room.  This was distressing to us as we had booked weekend away as a break from caring for my terminally ill mother in law and this meant we were just reminded of this.  We contacted reception and was told that we had booked this room.  We categorically did not book a disabled room and despite arguing this fact was told we did and that everyone else had checked in and they couldn't change this.  We did eventually manage to speak to a Manager who changed our room but not without us making a fuss.  Apparently they do not clean rooms at weekends unless you request this - we did but it was not done and breakfast a shambles - no cups or glasses or cutlery - continually having to ask!  Will not be coming back.

Wow, what a great reception!  This was the warmest welcome that we have ever experienced in all our trips staying in different hotels everywhere in the world.  MD at the front desk outdid himself in welcoming us home to Staybridge. He invited us to breakfast while we waited for our room since we arrived early. He worried about the cleaning chemicals used in the room because I had asthma and allergies. He designated us as the "Guest of the Day" with a gift bag of goodies!The warmth did not end at the front desk but carried through everywhere and everyday. Everyone was friendly and helpful.  They smiled and greeted. Lovely Carmen from Rumania and colleagues, during the free evening receptions on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays, ensured that we had our wines, beers, and soft drinks refilled. They laid out the cheese trays, breads, crackers, chips, vegetables, hummus, and salsas and encouraged us to eat. Breakfasts were ample, generous, and replenished continually. All kinds of eggs, stewed tomatoes, mushrooms, potatoes, bangers, and bacon were the hot dishes. A pancake machine fascinated the kids and adults. A huge cauldron of oatmeal, various cereals, and yogurt with different toppings like nuts, raisins, currants, cherries, and banana chips were available. There was a big variety of breads, bagels, and muffins to satisfy the fussiest eater. Coffee of different types, tea, juices, and milk were the order of the day. I felt so spoilt by the choices and ate far too much every day.The suite was immaculate and cleaned very well every day except on the weekends. Our spacious bathroom was spotless. The kitchennete in our suite was also very tidy and clean with new-looking plates and cups and granite counter.Location. Staybridge Suites is above Holiday Inn and the entire building sits right on top of Westfield Shopping Center. This is a modern and large shopping mall anchored by Marks and Spencer, Waitrose supermarket, John Lewis, Primark, Boots, WHSmith, and Ikea. There are also many eateries from McDonalds to higher-end restaurants. The food court offers a fabulous variety of food.  Several bars serve wine, beer, and other alcohol.Stratford City is industrialized and modern.  Skyscrapers, unfinished apartment buildings, and cranes dominate.  Cute little English houses, small villages, and historic buildings are absent.  I missed them while staying here.Staybridge Suites is connected to the Underground/subway, busses, and trains. Getting to and from Heathrow Airport is not a problem unless you have lots of luggage because of the stairways in the Underground.  The subways run all day long.Going into Central London where the tourist sites are located is slightly more difficult.  You have to change/switch trains/lines. It is not as easy as staying in Central London where you can walk almost everywhere.  Therefore, familiarize yourself with the Underground and how it works.  Use the Underground after commuter hours in the mornings and evenings when the trains are less crowded.  Otherwise, you will be squished or smelling someone's armpit!This is an American hotel.  Everything is done well.  Everything is big.  The 12th floor lobby has balconies, a library, nooks, and crannies to sit, work, socialize, and have a complimentary cuppa tea or coffee twenty-four hours.  Comfortable sofas and chairs beckon.  The laundry room and gym are on this floor too.  The washing machines and dryers are free.  Yippee!We have stayed here for 11 nights already and will depart for home in another two days. It has been such a great stay that I was moved to write the review before I forgot the details.In terms of hospitality, the hotel industry could learn a thing or two from this particular Staybridge.  As they say here, "Welcome Home" to each guest, I truly felt at home.  Thank you, Staybridge staff for making us feel at home, especially, when we are an ocean away from our own home.  You earned our business!

I recently spent 3 days at this hotel. The hotel staff were all very helpful and genuinely interested in helping with any aspect of my stay.  Always with a smile to boot.The reason that I gave given the hotel 4 out of 5 stars is due to the overlooking of housekeeping to my room after my first nights stay.  This was quickly remedied however.The hotel rooms/apartments come with a cleverly designed compact kitchen which is fully functional. It was great to have a fridge to use and even a dishwasher on hand.The nespresso coffee machine was a nice touch,  however the 4 coffee pods that were supplied did not last very long and we're not replenished.  There is however a tea and coffee station in the breakfast room which was available 24 hours a day free of charge.  Nice touch having takeaway cups also.Thank you Staybridge staff, I will certainly be back.

i  booked this hotel again for a points stay for my family and they had an excellent time. Great welcome and great stay for daughter and grandson, very well lokked after Staff were excellent and suite was excellent

Very nice stay with all the amenities you would expect. Great location, quiet room, friendly and attentive staff on arrival and check-in. Key card didn't work but it was sorted quickly. The kettle caused the trip to go but the maintenance guy arrived very quickly and sorted it, and supplied new kettle. Nice kitchenette but didn't really need to use it except utensils and glasses/mugs. Bed was a little hard. Toiletries were large bottles, to share?- I'd prefer individual ones for each new guest for cleanliness. There is a gym but didn't use it. Did use the 'living room' to relax and read the newspaper. Breakfast was an odd affair. In their pursuit of making you feel 'at home' the sharing theme continues... Large boxes of cereal, cartons of juice and milk, pots of jam,etc. Again, if prefer individual portions for hygiene. I didn't see anything dirty though, I must point out. The pancake machine was excellent!!! Loved it!!!Overall very nice stay.

column9: Very good for Business and family
column10: Great rooms with kitchen facilities, clean toilet. House keeping is very good. Room service is prompt. Breakfast is decent. Right inside West Field Shopping Center and near Olympic Park. Lots of Bars and Eating options.

column9: Beautiful hotel, amazing staff & great location. Loved every minute!!
column10: I was lucky to stay at this hotel in March'16, for 2 nights. Such an amazing experience! The staff is incredible, extremely helpful, polite, friendly and just genuinely nice. They have made me feel welcome, and it was also a brilliant surprise to find out my arrival that I was ' The Guest of The Day'! It literally, made my day :) the complementary chocolate cookies, lemonade and popcorn were such a lovely touch!  The room was modern, very spacious, and very clean. Wi-Fi was free & fast. Bed was very comfy, and after a full day of exploring London - I slept like a baby. Breakfast was delicious, with big variety of food, drinks, Danish etc. Location of this hotel is also vey convenient - I was attending an event at the BBC Studios, and it was less than 10 mins walk. Additionally - great for shopping, as it is at the same complex as the Westfield Shopping Centre. There's a massive selection of restaurants, which is also very convenient. I would love to stay at this hotel on my next trip to London. Many thanks to the wonderful Staff!

Amazing location. I only stayed for one night and the apartment was perfect. It has everything you'll need. The staff are amazing and truly an asset to this establishment. The location is perfect for Westfield shopping and great to get into London via Stratford station. We had a great view of the Olympic Park too. Breakfast was very tasty, I would recommend taking a tray, filling it up and going back to your room to enjoy in the comfort of your bed!

column9: Short Shopping and Site Seeing Stay
column10: Long trip from Heathrow airport but well worth it, convenient to public transit (Tube/DLR) and Westfield Shopping center.  From tube follow signs toward Westfield and up escalator, then slighly right a short walk to elevator/escalator, up a floor turn left (away from pedestriant bridge) hotel on left around corner, can't see sign until you are there.  Waitrose grocery store nearby, head toward John Lewis and down a floor you are there or well stocked pantry at hotel.  On arrival up elevator to lobby, check in easy, staff friendly, room great and even rooms have best views toward Olympic Park,  Huge breakfast/lounge area and outside patio nice to hang out with a pint.  Would definitely stay again, the proximity to shopping and Olympic Park were a nice change of pace from our usual London trips, no line change required to visit British Museum either was a plus.

Just spent 3 nights here. Lovely clean modern hotel with a apartment feel. Staff were very good. Great location central to everything and as its inside a shopping center great for us ladies to shop but also spoilt for choice with the restaurants. My only complaint would be that breakfast finishes at 9.30 and when your on holiday it could be nice to have a lay in. Also the hot food was always luke warm to cold and not that much choice for breakfast. Otherwise it's a great place to stay

Stayed there for 18 days. There is an excellent breakfast buffet in the morning which is complimentary. Also social evenings are on the house every Tuesday and Wednesday. Rooms are bit small but cozy.

column9: Such a Lovely Hotel and Staff
column10: Walked in to be greeted by Andre. Such a friendly guy who made my husband's birthday by giving us the guest of the day prize. Both Andre and his colleague had a great laugh with starting our stay off on a great foot. Andre shows he's got what it takes in the hotel industry and a real great find for Staybridge.

A friendly welcome that was needed after a long working day. Comfortable rooms, great to have the drinks and nibbles in the evening and enough choice to make breakfast feel good looking out over a terrific view. Would be perfect without the annoying ticking of a clock in the kitchen area of the room and at the far end of the hotel (on the view side) up on the 12 th floor......the noise of trains is disturbing even with the window closed.Pretty pricy to stay here so think about better quality towels, provision of a bathrobe and better toiletries to reflect the overall quality feel of this hotel to really stand out from the crowd!

Stayed here for a boxing event the O2 on a Saturday night. Easy to find and car parking is close for a small fee. Ideal. We had a really warm welcome on arrival by two guys who took an interest in what we were doing and the best way to travel to the O2.The apartment was excellent. Spacious, quiet, comfy bed plus great kitchen facilities. It was a shame we were only staying the one night. Quick and easy to get to the O2. And right next door to Westfield which made it easy to grab a bite to eat before hand.Breakfast was a little sparse by the time we got there however what was left was good. Would recommend, and would happily stay again.
