A very comfortable stay in a great location. It is situated in a mall, that may be hard to get to with a taxi but just tell them the Westfield mall in Stratford city. It's on the second floor. Rooms are a good size, we got the suite with the king size bed. It comes with a kitchenette, microwave/oven, fridge, utensils and dishwasher. Very clean, the staff is very courteous, and helpful. They also offer a food pantry on site that you can buy drinks, water, juice, snacks and meals. The items are not greatly overpriced. It also offers free wifi. The hotel is also great for business meet ups. Gym and laundry on site. The mall has everything you may need, restaurants, cafe, and all the shopping you one could want in a mall. They are true to their mission.

This hotel was perfect for the few days we stayed in London on our honeymoon. The staff were all friendly and helpful even mapping out our routes when we weren't sure how to get to and fro. The room (we only had a standard room mind you) was huge including a living room space, kitchen area and huge bathroom! Breakfast included and offered plenty of options. This is attached to a Westfield shopping center which is high-end and felt safe, but the main subway transit was on the opposite end of the shopping center (not too bad of a walk though). The area surrounding the hotel felt very safe and clean.

column9: Convenient East London base for visitors with cars
column10: Our second visit to this Staybridge, chosen due to it's accessibility when travelling by car and it's access to public transport. Pedestrian access from the large Westfield car park is fairly straightforward if you enter Car Park B and park on level P2, the spaces are larger than average and this is a relative bargain at ¬£9 per 24 hours. We used the Overground and DLR to visit Greenwich and Clapton/Hackney during our stay, which meant we could leave the car alone for the weekend.Good points:+ Very reasonably priced rooms/suites and car parking+ Good breakfast selection and great views from the communal areas on the 10th floor+ Friendly and helpful staff+ Ready access to Stratford station for rail, bus and overground/underground Not so good points:- Staybridge suites don't fit locks to their bathroom doors, which I find really odd and may worry guests who don't want surprise visits from housekeeping while they are using the bathroom- The plaza area around the hotel's entrance can get noisy at night (partly due to nearby bars), this could be intimidating for some guests

We were greeted by Geogiana on reception when we arrived, who was wonderful and very helpful.  She asked about our plans for the day, gave us directions to the tube and a brilliant map. The suite was awesome, included a microwave, coffee maker and dishwasher, which as we were only staying for the night didn't use.The shower was fabulous and the bed super comfy, in fact I slept for over 7 hours which I never do at home!The breakfast buffet was quite a feast, you won't be disappointed.We shall be back!

column9: Awesome studio apartment - in the heart of Westfield shopping centre, East London
column10: Whether you are a London sightseer, Business traveller or West Ham supporter - there is something for everyone at The Staybridge Suites. Stayed here with my wife as a Birthday treat with Premier League football and retail therapy combined. My wonderful wife offered to become a Claret Member of West Ham United and buy matchday tickets to see West Ham at the Olympic stadium - former home of the London 2012 Olympics. West Ham moved here over the summer and it is the first match we have seen at this wonderful venue. The Staybridge Suites was the icing on the cake. The great reviews on Tripadvisor convinced me to splash out on this accomodation for the great location, so close to the train station and the stadium. The staff were great and remembered my name, the whole time I was here. The room was spacious and the view of the stadium was a bonus.I would be happy to recommend the aparthotel to anyone and plan to return - if we can get match tickets again.

I was greeted by two young gentlemen, Gregorio and Andre, who immediately made my long travel day become a distant memory.  These guys know how to greet their guests!  They are both #1 in my book.  I will be back again for sure.

If you want to stay in London look no further, price, location, and room size, it has got it all, the staff are polite and helpful and having had to stay at the Kensington close hotel due to being on a package deal ( hotel and show) with the rooms very very small and over priced we will definitely be staying at Staybridge in the future.Stuart and Denise

Staff are helpful, rooms are a good size. Also very clean. Great if you want to do your shopping and take it back to your room . We went as a couple but I think it would be good if you have children it has a full kitchen to cook something for the kids .

We love these apart hotels as we have stayed in them a few times now and every single time it has been brilliant. Apartments are very clean and very modern, staff are always very friendly and helpful - Alexandra & MD thank you very much also. The breakfast is also really nice and a bonus when its included with your stay :-)

Just returned home from a weekend in London and stayed at the Staybridge SuitesSuch an ideal location to venture into central London in 20 minutes everything on your doorstep We would like to extend our thanks to both Mo and Andre who checked us in quickly and efficiently with it being my wife's birthday she was presented with a goody bag and a bottle of wine on arrival along with a complimentary room upgrade which left us speechless and excited Thank you for making our stay memorable, comfortable and going the extra mile for us Would so highly rate the Staybridge Suites in Stratford

Best place to stay visiting London! We stayed for a weakend visiting London in september and there wasnt a thing during our stay that didnt satisfie us. Everything was excelent. The best suit we have seen.

I am over here @ staybridge since from last month and its absolutely nice the rooms, break fast area, people, service and the social party....... room is very good provided with all facilities.....staybridge has quality service I have ever seen.....staff is so helpful and coperative ..... one more thing about Staybridge which must highlighted that social party which made my evening....thanksss staybridge.... best luck for future.....

I stayed at Staybridge Stratford with my husband and 2 year old daughter for three months (June to September 2016) while our house was being renovated, and so I'd like to think we got to know the place pretty well...The thing that makes Staybridge Stratford stand out from the crowd is the staff. They are all, without exception, fantastic. MD on the front desk is completely committed to ensuring you have the best possible stay, and that you feel as though you are "home". Bindi in the reservations team is unfailingly helpful and responsive. The kitchen staff (in particular the lovely Hilda) were incredibly kind and attentive - often taking our toddler for little walks round the breakfast area so we could finish our breakfast quietly! Yes, the rooms are well equipped and comfortable, the location is super convenient for transport links and access to the Olympic Park and Westfield, the free breakfast included in the room rate is varied and delicious - but what we valued the most was the kind and helpful manner of the entire staff of the hotel. Thank you so much for making our very long stay so comfortable, we really appreciated it.

This was my first experience in a service apartment. I loved it. The staff is very helpful and polite. They are always welcoming for any queries you have. The day starting with a breakfast is a very good start. Apartments are comfortable with all basic necessary stuff available to set up a temporary home. The housekeeping is very good. The reception desk people or people in the kitchen hub all are very good.

We have stayed here several times and it have never had any problems.  The staff are excellent - nothing is too much trouble for them.  Rooms are just great - clean with good amenities - great views - great breakfast - good location - what's not to love

I stayed at the Staybridge Suites for three months, July ‚Äì September 2016 while major renovation work was carried out on my property. The location is excellent, the views and rooms were of a standard as to be expected for this type of accommodation, as were the facilities - hot drinks, computer and laundry. However the real star here are the staff. Every member of staff, from reception - the kitchen, worked hard to create a friendly environment that felt like a home from home and took immense pride in making everyone feel welcome. I‚Äôve never experienced such a consistently high standard of customer service. Everyone you meet is genuine, attentive and helpful. From Sal, Grant, Matthew and Marcos on the entrance, to Stephen, Gregorio, Alexandra, Andre, Georgina, Nicolas, Natalia, MD and the staff in the kitchen. They are warm, friendly and genuinely interested in your comfort and well-being ‚Äì I couldn‚Äôt praise them more highly they really are credit to the company.

Immaculate hotel. Room was great with a kitchen and a sofa. Like home from home. Breakfast was very good also. Fabulous view from the dining area, and the free coffee/tea all day/night was a great bonus. The staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks to Andre and Stefan, and Natalia who went out of her way to try and fix a problem with our airline booking. Room was spacious and well equipped, bed very comfortable and bathroom was a huge wetroom. Having the kitchen area was brilliant. Location is excellent, beside the Westfield Shopping Centre and transport links at Stratford Station. Highly recommend.

Conveniently located in the Westfield mall at Stratford London.Found everything to be satisfactory except the bed was not as comfortable as at other Staybridges stayed at. The room was not the largest but extremely clean.

The service provided is excellent...Come wit your friend or family ull just luv d experience..The train station is near from the hotel..You can all facilities near by as you are accessible for d Westfield mall as well...Security service is 24 7 available...Loved staying in StaybridgeHave a lovely experience in STAYBRIDGE

column9: Hilljill - 'Hotel lived up to their 'Welcome Home' sign at the reception desk - coming back'.
column10: First time at this hotel and very glad I decided to stay here for my 3 weeks trip to London. Upon arrival I was made to feel completely at home starting with the concierge. By the time I got to the reception desk I got the impression that all the staff has been trained to please their guests and make them comfortable.The room was as seen on the internet - comfortable, spacious and well laid out. My requests to be near to the elevator was granted - couldn't be any closer. I was on the 9th floor facing the city and loved it. Lots of sunlight and movement, trains, buses, people, etc. etc.. Excellent WiFi service - never a problem.  Was able to use my electronic devices from the moment I checked in - any hour of the day or night. GREAT!!!!!Excellent location as I could walk to the Stratford tube and bus terminal, not to mention browsing the mall and being able to get anything I needed right their, just a short walk away. Never had to worry about what to eat....lots of restaurants outside the lobby entrance in the mall and the food court in the mall offered many choices for a meal. Tea and coffee is always available 24 hours a day and the snack bar ensured you could get something to snack on all day/night.  Breakfast was very appealing and quite a variety - GOOD JOB.Very impressed with: the physical layout of the hotel; the warm friendly greeting from the hotel staff (calling me by my name) every time they saw me; the kitchen with a microwave, stainless steel kettle, toaster, dishwasher, fridge, safe, dishes, pots and pans all made my stay stress free and easier to cope. The hotel, rooms and amenities were always clean and the housekeepers did an excellent job keeping my room chemical free - thank you. This is not just an hotel it has a homely feel to it.  Also loved the way each staff member tried to accommodate my requests, especially  MD and Natalia.  MD was extremely helpful, professional and caring. MD made a world of difference to my stay because he walked the extra mile every time there was a need and even when there was no need. I thank you for your help in making my room change possible, timely and stress free. Because of you I will come back to Staybridge Suites Stratford. Natalia, thanks for printing my etickets and documents..you were so patient.kind and professional.  Gregarrio (?) I love your enthusiasm and eagerness to please - don't lose that.Liked the fact that I could speak to the Manager, Nicolas when there was an issue and he was quite understanding and had a good sense of what was happening. Thank you. It made a difference.Experienced some stress when the football game was on at the Arena. The entrance to the mall and hotel was closed off and I was not told about this.As a result, it was very stressful trying to get back to the hotel the night of the game.  May help if the Concierge and/or reception staff advise staff of this situation and how to get around it. You can call the Concierge and they will come and get you at the gate but I was not made aware of this before the first game.Another stressful situation is the fact that most of the housekeeping staff do not speak English and that made communication limited and stressful at times. The front desk staff made up for this because they were always there - ready to help. Thanks for a wonderful stay. Glad I chose Staybridge Suites Stratford - great place to spend an extended trip. Looking forward to coming back.

We stay here all the time and we really feel home. The staff is super friendly and helpful, rooms are big, comfortable and clean, the location right in the shopping center is great and the hotel is close to London City airport. Close by is also an nice running track along a canal. Multiple restaurants are close by.As airline crew we stay approximately 200 nights per year in hotels, the Staybridge Suites in London-Stratford is one of our favorite.

Excellent location - 3 min walk to Stratford tube stn and Stratford Intl, next to Westfield shopping centre, spacious studio with all amenities, gym, clean and comfy beds, decent breakfast and most of all lovely staff- thanks Georgiana Chifu for a warm welcome and friendly attitude. Hope to be back soon.

column9: Loved our time at Staybridge Suites so much last year that we are coming back again.
column10: Maybe the measure of a good trip is that even after a year you still have stand out, fond memories.  My husband and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites for nearly 3 weeks last year and used it as our home base for travel during our vacation.  After reading all of the wonderful TripAdvisor reviews we decided to give the Staybridge Suites a go and it turned out to be a wonderful choice.  All of the staff were super friendly and welcoming.  The location is very convenient.  A short 5 minute walk and you are at the tube station for a quick trip into London and points beyond.  After playing tourist all day it was nice to be able to come back to our hotel and have a plethora of dinning choices nearby either in the Stratford City Mall or the shops surrounding the area.  The breakfast each morning included many choices and the "hot" items changed each day so you didn't get tired of having the same thing every day.  The king sized bed was comfortable and the room as a whole was well laid out.  The kitchen area provides the opportunity for you to prepare your own meals if you so choose complete with a dishwasher.  We also made use of the free laundry room facilities (we brought some laundry detergent pods with us).  OK, so maybe the dryers were a little inefficient at actually drying clothes, but it still worked out.Over the past year since our visit I have recommended the Staybridge Suites to many of my friends and family.  Bottom line, this is a great place to stay and I am looking forward to our next stay there in November.

column9: This is the best next to holliday inn
column10: If there is anything i am looking forward going back to London, my staying here in this hotel is my first and foremost reason why. Everything are great, from services, staffs, rooms is like my home very competent, professional, they always attend for the welfare of the guest,  superb place to stay from crew , everyone are very friendly, there is nothing they can not do for you, very excellent! More so with the fallowing people whom i truly greatful namely ,Md, Natalia, Adriana,gregorio, grant, people from the concierge,almost everyone are very competent, highly recommend!

Return visit, and just as fabulous as the first time. Love the friendly reception staff. Arrived early and suite was ready. Very comfortable rooms, everything you need. Ideal location. Very relaxed atmosphere. Free coffee and tea available . Great choice for breakfast.Highly recommend

Another cycle event  so needed a  hotel for a night close to the start ( Olympic Park) and on a tube line from home  and you could not  get much closer than the Staybridge suites. Excellent accommodation though pricey than I would usually choose but all I could get. Price in line with facilities though. Home from home with hob, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, pans, plates , cutlery and upmarket coffee machine. Everything you could wish if you wanted to self cater. Room was spacious with separate large power shower and lots of towels.  Bed v comfortable; quite hard. Range of pillows. Good Flat screen tv. Only annoying issue was loud clock; easily solved by removing battery during our stay,.No problem taking bike with me into room.  No restaurant , but being in Stratford loads of places to eat  if you did not  wish to self cater.Breakfast was v good and included in price. Good range of cereals, juices, fresh fruit, yogurt, bread, croissants , hot food and cheese, ham.  Would make an ideal stopover for a 2 -3 days to explore London from as only 5 min walk if that from Stratford Station. Price may put some off , but if you self cater then may ease things.

Very good service, nice suites, nice, helpful staff, good food, convenient location. Free wifi, tv, laundry, gym, always available. Suites modern and comfortable, with all important kitchen staff. No negatives.

column9: The best I have stayed in London!
column10: First time staying in Staybridge Suites Stratford. Feel extremely at home with the friendly and helpful staff. Smily faces we see everyday! Many thanks to MD for trying to accomodate to my room upgrade. Accomodation is great although cleaniness can be better but still it was a great stay for me and my kids. This is a great stay for connectivity, convenience, shopping and family.

column9: A great second stay and had to review even if we still haven't left
column10: Once again returned to Staybridge for a three day stay as our London baseThe room is superb hospitality out of this world and cleanliness the best I have seen everIt really feels homely the breakfast is also great and the free get together with wine beer and drinks as well as snacks unheard of nowadaysI truly recommend staying here especially as you have Westfield shopping Centre right beside actually the hotel is inside or middle of west fields Our photos of our room 817Our visit was 22nd sept to 25th sept

No real negatives. Decent accommodation in a convenient location. Easy to access Liverpool Street and City Airport.Staff are brilliant - happy and helpful. They make a pleasant change. Georgiana was especially helpful during my stay.

column9: Great Place and Very Friendly Staff
column10: I was in London for a business trip, hence looking for a place which has good connectivity and shopping places nearby. Moreover, being vegetarian I wanted a place where I can get small kitchen as well.  Staybridge Suites Stratford was good at all parameters. For connectivity Stratford station is walking distance, for central, Jubilee lines and National rail. For Shopping Westfield mall is at doorstep. Rooms with a fully equipped kitchen. Hotel has a free laundry room. Breakfast options were good. The Staff is superb and extremely helping and took care of almost everything. i stayed for 5 days & the stay was great.  Next time I will make sure that I book Staybridge Suites again.

column9: A rare gem that makes you feel at home
column10: Great hotel, great and convenient location, all amenities nearby. Walking distance both from Stratford Station and Stratford International train station.Hotel has a huge Westfield Mall outside the entrance, rooms with a fully equipped kitchen. Hotel has a free laundry room .Olympic stadium is also at walking distance. Some may find it a little far from city but the warmth and hospitality makes it worth a stay. The staff is very helpful and sweet. Special mention for Mr Gregario who helped with everything-right from the map, to getting a train for the country side, to helping us with the laundry machine all with a lovely smile. The common reception area has a 24 -hour complimentary tea and coffee service and the breakfast on the 12th floor comes with a great view. We stayed for a week and always felt we were coming home after work and not to a hotel. Will miss this place till our next trip.

I travel to the UK 5-6 times a year for business. I have stayed in many hotels, but this year decided to make Staybridge my preferred choice. I've now stayed here quite a few times and it is always an excellent experience. The rooms are perfect, the service is outstanding, and the location is above the tube and shops. I am a frequent traveller, and this is the first time I've ever bothered to write a review. You won't go wrong using this hotel.

We stayed about a week at Staybridge for a family vacation, while helping a sibling  move in to the dorm nearby. The location was very convenient for our need, and there is a very large mall nearby where we did our shopping for kitchen and household items. The best part of our stay was the comfortable rooms. We stayed at a suite with a kitchenette that also had complete utensils and items for cooking. The bedroom and kitchenette were spacious as well as the bathroom. We made use of the gym and laundry facilities (washer and dryer on the 12/F) which were very good.The staff is very friendly, from those at reception (MD) to the bellman who greeted us when we arrived and those who serve at breakfast.The only improvement I would make would be to have the cleaners clean the rooms more thoroughly (e.g., dishes and carpets/ bathroom floor). It would also be good to advise guests that there is a few hundred meters walk from the street through the Plaza towards the hotel so if they are carrying a lot of luggage, it would help to be dropped off at the Chesnut Plaza side (landmarks are The Cow and Busaba Eathai restaurants) and to call the hotel a few mins before arrival so that a bellman could meet them.

Always my first choice when staying in London. The staff are amazing, welcoming and make you aware of all of the services. Clean and spacious rooms with great facilities and an on site gym. Social nights on Tuesday's drinks and snacks between 7-8pm plus a great pantry shop for any extras you might need. 2-3 mins walk from tube station and in the centre of great restaurants. This doesn't affect noise levels I would rate as a quiet hotel.

From our arrival to our departure we couldn't fault this hotel. We appreciated the fact that our room was ready at our check in at 2pm - but over our stay we noticed guests arriving at 8am expecting their rooms to be ready and arguing with the reception staff that they could not access their room on arrival.  The hotel management have obviously taken great care to keep the suites in tip-top condition since they opened. Our room was very clean, the bathroom had a good shower and plenty of towels and the kitchen came with a Nespresso coffee machine.The breakfast provided was very good with a good selection of cereals and a choice of a cooked breakfast - not forgetting the pancake machine :) which worked really well.All the staff worked really hard to make our stay an enjoyable one - the housekeeping staff were so friendly and the check in staff including Stephan worked hard to make our stay enjoyable.  Would I book to return - yes in an instant.

I was one of the long-term guest to live at this hotel. One of the best places to stay in all of London. Staff was incredible and they made me feel like I was part of the family. Expect nothing less than the best customer service here. Made my stay a fantastic experience everytime. Lost track of how many times I've been here now :) If you are coming into London for a business project that requires you to stay long term...this is the best choice you want to make. Breakfast every morning, happy hours every Tuesday's, Wednesday's & Thursday's.. free drinks from beers to wine :)Comfortable rooms for individuals and families. Excellent wifi connectivity, Apple TV's, cooking in room and the list goes on...As the hotel is located inside Westfield Shopping Centre, you've got pretty much everything you need within a 5 min walk including the underground station for daily commute. Have a great time!!!

I have just finished a month long stay at Staybridge Suites Stratford and cannot recommend it highly enough. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable and serviced daily to a very high standard. The shower in the room is amazing & the kitchenette allows for some cooking in your room. There is a gym and a laundry room which was essential for my long stay with great facilities. The staff are all so friendly and welcoming, all making an extra effort knowing that my stay was a long one. Georgiana is one of the managers who always went above and beyond. Georgiana was always friendly, warm and engaging. Nothing was too much trouble for her and she was constantly checking to see that guests were happy with their stay. Another notable member of staff was Carmen - she seemed to be working all the time but was always happy, friendly and willing to assist with anything she could. I recommend Staybridge Stratford for anyone visiting London.

column9: RATING TO STAYBRIDGE AND ITS STAFFS
column10: I am happy and fully satisfied with the stay so far in staybridge , it has been almost more than 20 days of stay & i feel like home here not because the IHG or the hotels facility but because of amazing Staff specially MD.If staff like him is in the hotel it will be always the priority to visit the same hotel again & again.MD helped me out in understanding the IHG facilities for gold members like the Free internet subscription(High speed) which is like no body bothers to tell anyone.MD always there to help irrespective of busy or equips with other things.I was away for around 10 days to scotland but i make sure that i should be back on the same hotel as i feel more comfortable here.I would even like to thanks MD for his amazing efforts & helping nature towards everyone.Rating from My end  - MD - Excellent - even more if exist.Thanks,Prerna Jain

I have stayed at this hotel for almost a year now on business. This is one of the most lovely hotels that you can ask for a long-term stay. The suites are well equipped with all essential amenities, breakfast is included in all room prices, there is a gym and laundry room for all guests, there are evening socials with free booze every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday; what more can you ask for!! Situated at the heart of the Westfield Shopping Center, anything that you wish to buy is just 2 mins away. Apart from all of the above, they have amazing staff who are extremely friendly and do everything possible to make you feel at home. Especially two people, Georgiana, Guest Services Manager and MD, a member of the Guest Services team made my and my family's stay extremely comfortable.This hotel is a very good value for money as I believe, you wouldn't find the same amenities and facilities at the same price anywhere else in London.

column9: Still great at what it does
column10: Stayed here again for the RideLondon 100 weekend and the hotel remains a great and convenient location for the Westfield Centre restaurants and for the ride start. Each year it seems to have more cyclists so they are doing something right!Rooms were cleaner this year than last and the staff were again valiantly positive and trying to overcome the tide of guests at breakfast who ate the food as soon as it appeared!!

I was the very first long-term guest to live at the hotel when it opened in 2012.  Located at the Westfield Shopping Center and directly across from the Olympic Park it is was and still remains one of the best places to stay in all of London.  When I lived there the staff was incredible and they made me feel like I was part of the family.  They couldn't do enough for me and my wife and made our stay the best experience anyone could have.  In the end we made some great friends and great memories.  Roll forward 4 years later and we finally got the chance to back to London for the weekend and the only choice for us was the Staybridge Suites.  This can be a risk sometimes because you are taking a bit of a trip down nostalgia lane but in this case it was trip worth taking.  The place is absolutely fantastic!!!!  The staff are on the game and greeted us like long lost friends coming home.   The breakfasts each morning was awesome, the rooms were perfect the location of the hotel you cannot beat.   You have the Westfield Shopping center just 30 steps from the front door of the hotel and close to 200 stores to choose from.  You have the Olympic Park across the street and you have the Underground just a 5 minute walk.  It does not get any better.   If you are coming into London for a business project that requires you to stay long term...this is the only choice you want to make.  They provide pots and pans for cooking in your room, breakfast every morning and hors d' oeuvres in the evening.  They have movie nights on Monday or Tuesdays and they make the guests feel like true VIP's. When you come to London make this your stop. Have a great time!!!

I stayed here for business and cannot fault this hotel on one single thing. The reception staff are pleasant, welcoming and attentive. the Suites are immaculate and very well equipped, it felt like a home from home. the bed is so comfortable and the bathroom is immaculate. Its a real bonus being situated beside Westfield and the Central line to City is only 10mins away. A great place to stay for business and leisure

The hotel is located in Westfield Stratford City shopping center.  It provides great access to food and shopping.  It is easy to get to the a Tube stop, and you can basically go everywhere in London once you learn how to navigate the Tube. The suites are spacious and clean.  The staff was wonderful.  The only caution that I would advise is not to take a taxi from Heathrow. Our taxi driver did not want to take us to the hotel.  It is in a nice neighborhood so my guess is that he would not be able to get a good return fare from the neighborhood.  It is best to take the Tube if you can.  If not, I recommend making arrangements with a fixed rate service in advance.

This was my 9 year old son and I 's second visit to Staybridge Suites this year. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite in April 2016 and stayed in a similar room this August for 12 nights. I am very happy to say that our stay at Staybridge Suites was as good as the last visit if not better! Rooms were thoroughly cleaned everyday with the option of weekend cleaning upon request. The complimentary breakfast had more options than before with a multitude of cereals, hot options, pastries, bagels, even brioche!!, fruit and yoghurt, coffees, teas, juices etc. We were spoilt for choice and both my son and I are picky eaters. I think Staybridge's biggest strength remains its staff. MO at the front desk went above and beyond as usual making my son feel at home and very special. He really is in a class of his own. Sal and Marco the concierges were great. Very warm, welcoming and always happy to assist. Staybridge has ceased to feel like a hotel to us and more like a family visit because of the amazing staff. I highly recommend this hotel also because of its very convenient location which I detailed in my previous post. I will definitely be returning!

Wife and I stayed here for two nights over the bank holiday weekend We have stayed here a number of times and never had any issues. This time was no different. Reception staff are always polite and efficient with checking in and any queries we had. Room 11027 was a standard room with king size bed and kitchen. It was clean and modern with good air conditioningKitchen has all of the basic facilities you need if you wish to cook including a good size fridgeBreakfast is complimentary at this hotel and a good basic selection of continental and cooked options. So overall, another good stay at this hotel. Thanks to the staff for making us feel welcome Paul

column9: Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City is best in the best!@
column10: My girlfriend and I booked here 3nights it was an amazing experience. The staff are super friendly and helpful. This is a hotel what I know will always be good. They have nice, clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds. The breakfast is complimentary. Would highly recommend staying here if you visit Stratford - you are right on top of everything you need... Shops, station, bars, restaurants, and also walking distance somewhere els. Room Tip: Ask for Olympic Park/City viewing.Miel

Staying here for a month and have been amazed by the fantastic service. Georgiana is extremely welcoming every time I see her and makes the social nights amazing! No matter when I see the staff, they glow. Every hour is happy hour here. It's great!

I stayed in this hotel for good 90 days at a stretch and can say that all throughout it was a comfortable stay. The rooms are of good size with a nice view of the olympic park from the large windows, plenty of sunlight doesn't make you feel you are in a small room. Furniture is good, modern. Facilities are sufficient. Bathroom is good sized as well. Breakfast is one of the highlights, its very good and has variety, although as a vegetarian, I would have loved to have more hot options.Another big plus for the hotel is its location...you step out and you are in the middle of a happening place! Westfield mall, Stratford Centre, Stratford station, Stratford Bus station, Olympic park - all of them at stone's throw away. But when in room, no noise to disturb you. Wi-fi - very good.The only thing I was not much impressed with was housekeeping. I surely have seen much better housekeeping in many hotels i have stayed in.But overall, very good experience and I would like to return whenever i have the opportunity.Oh..i must not forget the friendly Reception! Very helpful and smiling! An extra star for you guys! :-)

What a lovely clean hotel and fantastic staff who make sure that you have everything and more besides, always going the extra mile for the customer. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Loads of shops and restaurants in the Westfield mall co -located with the hotel.  Well recommended.

The hotel is amazing! The staff make you feel great and are extremely welcoming. Georgiana was so polite to one of our party that she almost made her cry. She had such a rough journey and instantly felt at home. Georgiana has made our stay feel like we are the Queen in her own home. As someone brand new to the UK Georgiana has made a fantastic first impression for customer service in GB.

Oh yes it is! Nothing too much trouble for the friendly staff. The rooms have a mini kitchen with hob and grill/microwave and even have a dishwasher. The living area is just right for one person on business trip or a couple on holiday. Well equipped shower room- nice powerful shower too.You have complimentary breakfast, better still you can select your choices from the breakfast buffet, then take it back to comfort of your room. Nice toaster and coffee maker make a leisurely breakfast complete. The air on is efficient, but you also he a window that opens (!)I cannot fault this hotel. Westfield shopping centre is always busy with shoppers and visitors, but you can escape the hullabaloo with a stroll around the 2012 Olympic park.

Stayed one night visiting relatives in area.  Excellent location and good standard accommodation that still looked fresh, bright, clean and modern.  Our room had a spectacular view over the Olympic Park and central London in the distance, lovely at night.   The outstanding thing about this hotel was the staff.  All polite and friendly with a special mention to Georgiana on reception when we arrived and checked out and also in the dining room at breakfast....lovely, professional lady and a credit to the hotel.Complimentary breakfast was reasonable and you could take food back to your room if the dining room was busy - they even supplied a tray for this.

My wife and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Westfield Centre, Stratford this weekend and had a fantastic stay. The suite is beautifully equipped with all top facilities, great shower, super bed and linen, modern tv and all mod cons. The communal lounge area is calm and inviting and in particular I would commend the Reception Staff for their warm and attentive welcome. This is a winner!

Needed to stay on the east side of London so booked this as seemed good value. In reality excellent value! Great location in the centre of Westfield,  easy access to London centre, very friendly staff, large comfy room and home from home breakfast (lovely porridge!).This will be my hotel of choice in London now where there is some very expensive rubbish.

column9: Still the best, but be warned!
column10: We love this hotel due to locality, service, and lovely rooms. The suites are great with everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. We stayed last weekend after travelling down to see the West Ham Juventus game at the new stadium, we booked 5 rooms for family members who all agreed it's by far the best hotel in the area. The parking is easy and the shops are right outside the door. One thing marred our stay which is the reason why I haven't ticked the usual 5 star box, was that my son left a new very expensive shirt in the room on departure which was not recovered. We called the hotel when we arrived home to inform them and was told the room was vacant that night so it would surely be found. It wasn't. It had obviously been stolen. We realise our son is at fault for leaving it behind but a hotel as good as this should have honest staff. The reception staff are great but many of the room cleaners couldn't, or wouldn't , speak English. We will return to Staybridge in late August but will make sure nothing gets left behind. I'd still strongly recommend this as the place to stay.

My Husband and I booked a night here last Saturday and it was an amazing experience.  The staff are super friendly - and I was their "Guest of the Day"..We were allocated a suite on 12th floor - I think it must have had the best views in the whole hotel!Giving a mention to Greg & Alexandra for their warm hospitality!Would highly recommend staying here if you visit Stratford - you are right on top of everything you need...  Shops, station, bars, restaurants, etc.

Stayed in room 1130 for 2 nights in a business trip. It was great. Right in the middle of the Westfield centre so all sorts of options for food. The suites themselves are spotlessly clean and services each day. You have an Nespresso machine with 4 free samples to use. Breakfast is included and is help yourself buffet serving English breakfast and continental. It's great!They suite was spacious and came with a kitchenette with everything you need except an oven which is disappointing. The TV was just freebies and the remote wasn't able to access the usb or other hdmi ports. Free wifi is absolutely dire (see screenshot) and the phone signal is poor too. Unless you place your phone on the window ledge then you get full 4g which is suspiciously weird. Parking is at the Westfield multi-storey park B at ¬£6.50 during the week and ¬£8.50 at weekends for 24hrsOverall, I'll be back without a doubt

This is a hotel what I know will always be good. They have nice, clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds. The breakfast is complimentary. There is not a big choice, but it's always a bit different and tasty. Every tuesday,wednesday and thursday there is a managers event with free nibbles and drinks.

This is a great place to stay the rooms are very nice and have self catering facilities, although this is in a very large shopping centre with loads of restaurants and bars. The public area is very comfortable where breakfast is served. There isn't a formal bar or restaurant area but drinks are available from reception. Not quite that odd there is a good selection. Breakfast is very good but limited although there is plenty. I wouldn't necessarily pick this as a first choice hotel not that there is anything wrong but i prefer to have a bar and restaurant available. I would definitely stay again.

This hotel is fantastic. The staff are really excellent, friendly and helpful and interested in the guests ( special mentions for lovely cheerful, smiling  helpful Baronesse and friendly, helpful Stefan from kitchen and breakfast area, and Stefan and MD from reception). Every room has a small kitchen, our room was spacious, spotless and comfortable. We had a huge, comfortable bed. There's a comfy chair and 2 desk chairs. A shower room (no bath). You get a full size ironing board and iron. A coffee machine with pods is provided and a tea tray. You may also make your own tea and coffee in the restaurant 24 hrs a day. It's our new favourite hotel in London. It seems it's great for all types of guests: there is a comfortable "den" with tv, a games console, a guitar and books. There is a lovely outside balcony just off the restaurant. It is set within the Stratford Westfield shopping centre with great views over London and some of the new West Ham united stadium and Olympic park (including the accelormittal  Orbit)It's fantastic for transport links as the Stratford station sits below the shopping mall. We did hear some train noise when we opened the window but none when closed. Air con in rooms to allow you to close Windows when it's warm. It looks like it would be a good hotel for business people too with lots of facilities, laundry room, gym etc. Good for families, business, couples, lone travellers, West Ham fans, sport fans, tourists everybody in fact.All in all a highly recommended hotel. We were very satisfied customers and we will be back.

This is a great hotel in the middle of Westfield Shopping Centre. Surrounded by restaurants and bars. The rooms have a mini kitchen which is great as you get a proper fridge toaster kettle coffee maker microwave & hob. So if you have had a busy day and don't want to go back out you can buy something inside at the pantry. Breakfast is good enough and you can take it back to your room if you want. Staff are really friendly & helpful. Very quiet in the night too. We will be back. Only thing to watch for is the price is plus vat when booking. Unusual in the UK

Have stayed here many times on work trips and a few times on leisure. Have just witnessed the 1030 Sunday morning breakfast carnage. Everybody having a long lie and then rushing down to enjoy the very good breakfast buffet at the last minute. The staff have been running around clearing dishes, topping up the food bar and bringing out special orders (pancakes). They could not have been nicer. Especially Baronesse and Hilda. Real stars and great customer service!  Well done!!

We were perfectly welcomed and intruced by Georgiana. She took care without being asked to provide us with two rooms at the same level and close enough to each other. She informed us about the daily social evening events when the hotel invites for a casual, convenient get together. The hotel is located on the largest EU mall (Westfield) and is close to a major public transportion hub, with many many ways to get downtown or away. The Stanstedexpress stops right there. We enjoyed very much the lobby with free fresh coffee and chilled water to take a short rest from our excursions in between before continuing our excursions.

Thanks MD for all your courteous support, and Natalya for the awesome Russian delicacies you prepared for the evening get together treatAll of you are fabulous. your smiles are infectious in making our stay memorable

column9: Excellent location outside of Central London
column10: Excellent location outside of Central London in Stratford City. Located amidst rows of restaurants and the shopping mall where you can find foodcourt Primark M&S Cinema JohnLewis.Trying to get taxi/uber pickup and dropoff was a challenge through. Hotel entrance does not have road access. Should have a sign by the road curb to inform guests to walk 50-100m inwards.Rooms are spacious and well-maintained. Windows can be opened for fresh air. Useful kitchenette to cook if you wish.Free internet was limited to some degree. Must pay for faster and unlimited wifi.Breakfast was as per expected.Overall, great price for great hotel in great location. But outside of Central London.

column9: One of the Best hotel in London
column10: I think Staybridge suites is one of the best apartment cum hotel in London. The best thing is it's just inside the center of Westfield shopping complex. So you can roam around, shop, eat or do what ever you like.The other quality of this hotel is the staff. They way they treat the guests are awesome. Always ready for the best service.

My partner and i have stayed at Staybridge on several occasions and this hotel remains a firm favorite when visiting London.The hotel overlooks the Olympic park and has lovely views of east London in the skyline including London o2 and the canary wharf. These can be seen from the reception/breakfast area which i believe is on the 12th floor. There are tea/coffee making facilities available both in the rooms and in the breakfast area. Wifi is also available throughout the hotel- at no extra cost. In terms of the breakfast menu there is something for everyone and a large variety to choose from including tea/coffee, Tropicana fruit juice, cereal, pastries, fruit, yoghurt and the usual selection from a continental breakfast. The staff here are always most welcoming and approachable to assist with any queries/requests. A nice feature of this hotel is that the rooms feel more like apartments, equipped with a small kitchen area etc, almost a home from home. The bathrooms are always impeccable, housing a generous shower, as are the rooms which are cleaned to a high standard. Westfield shopping centre is accessible on the hotels doorstep and houses a mixture of high-street and high-end fashion. In terms of parking, when my partner and i visit this hotel we always tend to park within Westfields car park which houses ample secure parking and costs ¬£6.50 for 24 hours on a weekday (hardly leaves a dent in your wallet).If you wish to venture into inner central London the Underground is easily accessible as is the DLR stations and buses. This hotel really is a hidden gem and one which may appeal to those wishing to escape the hustle and bustle attached to central London. Really cannot fault this hotel and look forward to my next stay here! :)

column9: I was here on business trip but just felt
column10: The hotel is excellent, especially for long staying guest like me.The staff is very friendly & customer oriented.MD was one of them who has helped me a lot. You just have to inform MD of any thing that you need & he will sort that out for you.Great guy...Great going MD....cheersAmreek  (room 1025)

column9: A good hotel in all aspects
column10: Our 'studio' room was a decent-sized hotel room, clean and comfortable, with a compact, well equipped kitchen area and accessible bathroom. Thebathroom  had sufficient grab rails. The shower (walk or wheel -in with large,very solid flip down seat) was easy and safe to use, with the shower spray unit itself new, in good condition and much better than many hotels we've previously experienced. Hotel Location is just yards  from the large Westfield shopping centre  and within just a few minutes walk of the Olympic park. There are are plenty  good eateries within a short distance of the ground level front entrance (no steps), so although being disabled myself and a very slow walker, those in the Chestnur Plaza, pretty much immediately outside the Staybridge entrance, were possible for me to walk to and from. Not that we tried it but our children assure us It's within a short walking distance of Stratford station and Statford international stations. We found taxis had to drop us off from the main road  at the end of Chestnut Plaza. Though they didn't tend to know exactly where Chestnut plaza is (they did all know where the Westfield centre is)  and once dropped off, there's a short walk along a 'street'  area between the numerous restaurants to get to the front door of the Staybridge Suites. Certainly no problem for a fully  able walker  though we normally used my transportable wheelchair. Our children found no problem using the Uber system to get Uber taxis to pick us up at the right point at the end of Chestnut Plaza.For somebody disabled, I'd say the hotel is suitable in an accessible room. The staff, particularly at Reception are very friendly and helpful and perhaps more importantly, efficient. We usually try to find find a place ouside rather than take breakfast in hotels but the complimentary buffet breakfast, although fairly standard hotel fare, was fine. We stayed at Staybrifge Suites on the recommendation of friends, would be happy to recommend to others and would certainly return ourselves.

column9: Staff is too good specially MD. Room clearing is amazing and break fast is good. etc..
column10: I am very impressed by the hotel services.Staff is too good specially MD. Room clearing is amazing and break fast is good. etc.. Total we have 12 people arrived in July and we have lot of bags. hotel staff have help us to carry the stuff and help us to find the rooms.

Staybridge Suites has a lovely atmosphere, it truly does feel like home here. The staff are very friendly and the place is very welcoming. Loved the location. The rooms are very clean and in very good conditions. I would surely want to come back here.

Booked for one night with my mum in a studio room for the anniversary games. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was modern, clean, a great size and had everything we needed for a great nights stay, also the breakfast had loads of choice and the staff were very attentive. It was the perfect location for shops, restaurants and the Olympic Park. I will definitely stay there again. Thank you for looking after us so well.

column9: Does What It Says On The Tin- Good But Not Very Good
column10: I would have given this 3.5 as its not average but not Very Good it's a Soulless Hotel rooms are clean and a good size for London, not sure why the staff are given so much praise in other reviews the breakfast team were very busy and really didn't have the time or inclination to chat. The reception staff were okay but nothing amazing the location of this hotel suited our needs for this stay but would I return probably not as there are other hotels within a ten minute tube ride that are better! There is nothing to complain about but also nothing to be amazed about either good for those who want a small kitchen facility or are staying longer and need the extra space we have stayed in various Staybridge Suites in the USA so know the brand well.

Booked in 22nd July 16 needed somewhere close to the Olympic stadium as had tickets for Friday & Saturday for the anniversary games wifes birthday present treat. The room we had was fantastic every thing you needed was there for you the staff on reception where brilliant nothing was to much trouble they even checked the train times for me for journey home. The breakfast was included in the price and again fantastic choice to start the day choice of cereals , pancakes fresh fruit salad or the normal hot breakfast egg bacon etc eat yourself silly yum yum. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance of hotel and the walk to the Olympic stadium was about 5 mins. A great weekend was had by myself & wife Mo on reception was great , Thank you Stalybridge  will definitely stay again when visiting the \stratford area.

I am currently staying in Staybridge Stratford for four weeks. I felt at home and the services provided by the staff are superior.The quick response in satisfying guests is a unique to this hotel; besides, the smiley faces with welcoming words from each member of staff is appreciated.Still more days left before the check out to relax at this lovely place in London.

Have stayed in this property several times and always a winner. I am usually here on business but what I like about the location is having access to a world of opportunities. After work there are so many places to eat and drink in the mall for all kind of budgets.There are also some great shopping options and awesome connectivity from Stratford station. Winner all the way. :)

Just returned from a long weekend in London staying at Stalybridge Suites. What a fantastic place - top quality at a fantastic low price in a great location. The suites are bang next to the HST which is one stop and six minutes from St Pancras and the centre of London. If you like shopping then you are right in the Westfield centre.Breakfast was top notch and the staff team are absolutely brilliant, very friendly and most attentive. We plan to return for another long weekend this coming December.

Loved this studio, very modern with everything you need.  Great shower room and very clean.  Fantastic staff, really friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was good, all you had to do was collect everything you fancied on a tray and take it back to your room.

When looking for a hotel in London I wanted 3 things:1. Wifi2. Breakfast included3. Be within zones 1-3 for the tubeThis hotel was a great match for everything I wanted and the price was reasonable. I also liked that it's located within a mall for convenient food.

Stayed at the Staybridge Suites for several nights and must say I thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Location is excellent, rooms are clean and well designed and staff are absolutely brilliant. They offer complimentary breakfast for all.  Laundry facilities are available and regular socials are organised, which is a great way to unwind in the evening.Every member of staff I encountered was so helpful,  professional, and dealt with our many queries smoothly and always with a smile. Looking forward to returning. The only problem you will find here is that you won't want to leave!

I work in London 4 days each week but live "up north" and return home at weekends.  I came here for 6 months in 2012 but I am still here.  I can honestly say that without Staybridge I would have returned home to work before now.  It truly is "home from home".  Just returned from the social tonight where Nataliya, who works on reception, has spent 2 days preparing Russian dishes for our delight.  The quality of the food was exceptional and something I had never experienced before.  Thank you so much.

This place is definitely a home from home. Fully equipped with everything a good home needs. The decor is modern and beautiful and the place well maintained.But what really makes the place is the staff. They are fantastic. MD was a great help to us throughout our stay nothing was ever too much to ask . Georgiana too was fantastic always so warm, willing to help and professional.Stefan, Gregorio and Nicholas were also extremely kind and helpful.They all are truly a credit to the company. We can't wait to return.

Just arrived home from 2 nights in the stay bridge suites in Stratford after a fantastic stay. As frequent travellers the hotel blew us away with what it had to offer. From the fantastic welcome with fresh baked cookies - my daughter was instantly impressed, to the fabulous suite equipt with everything could think of to one of the best breakfasts we have had. Spotlessly clean, complimentary tea and coffee all day. In a great location contained within a huge shopping centre right by many shops & restaurants with the tube, train & bus station on doorstep. We will definitely be back.

column9: A home from a home, amazing service
column10: The staybridge suites , is perfectly located and has a homely feel. The service provided is exceptional , especially from , MD , who made our family feel very welcome , brilliant service,  he's a great credit to the hotel.Also Stephan who was very kind.Thanks to the whole staybridge team who made our stay amazing.

Brilliant place, arrived after v long journey, really tired, staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful. Everything you could need. Fab. And complimentary breakfast too...highly recommended.

One of our favourite apartment suites in the world. We travel a lot as a family and it's so nice to have an apartment suite that reflects their motto " welcome home" and makes you feel like we r home:)This time we stayed for 2 weeks.Excellent service throughout from reception staff to concierge.We were very impressed by the service sometimes well beyond their  call of duty by staff and in particular I would like to mention the excellent customer service provided by duty manager MD on a number of occasions. It's our "home" every time we come to London.

I had a 20 day stay at the Staybridge and I cannot speak highly enough of the place or the staff.When I checked in Amelia was all smiles, and there was an issue with my booking but it was sorted out quickly and with a beaming smile. The apartment was perfect for such a stay. Compact but so much thought had gone into the best use of space. The kitchen was ideal a fridge and a dishwasher were great to have. Only minor issue was my sofa I think had been over used, by that I mean it was a little lumpy, but it was not worth complaining about.The staff that cleaned my room were very friendly and again reflected the whole staff. The fact that there was a laundry on the premises and that it was free was a again a great bonus. One would think that breakfast in the same place for 20 days would become boring, but as much as it was the same, it was different. By that I mean we had different potatoes or different eggs each day at the buffet. Fresh fruit was great as was the fresh bread and juices. I love grapefruit juice and would like to see that next time, but a choice of orange, pineapple and apple was more than adequate.Wifi was good, although it slowed at the weekend when occupancy was high. It was free as well.  There was next to noise the whole time I was there, however at night with the window open the train noise was a little loud.Location perfect for trains and also shops.

Friendly  checkin in greeting by staff.   Very comfortable bedroom suite with good catering facilities.   Generous size room and bathroom.   Made a lovely change from pokey hotel rooms!  Fabulous continental plus breakfast - better than many 4 star hotels I have experienced in a light airy comfortable breakfast room.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is at the Westfield Shopping Mall Complex. I stayed one week there. Go shopping it is not a problem!! Lots of  bars and restaurants besides hundreds of stores. But I did  not like the distance between the hotel and the city center. It is about 15-30 minutes by underground. The front desk people were quite helpful and friendly. Specially Greg! He was very gentle. I loved them. But the housekeeping...it was difficult. I think they are foreigners and do not understand what to do. Almost everyday I had to complain and explain what I needed. The receptionist usually came quickly to help me and solve the mess. Despite everything it was a clean room. The living room, the bathroom and equipped kitchen were in a good size. Very spacious. During my staying there was a happy hour  with lots of good food, wine and beer. Awesome. They also have a very good complimentary breakfast . And besides there are free coffee , juice and tea 24/7. It made me feel very happy.

column9: My eight weeks away at the stay ridge suites
column10: Can I congratulate the entire team at this hotel as they have made myself and my colleagues very welcome over the last eight weeks. It is truly like coming home at the end of each day. The staff could not do enough for us to ensure we were relhaxed and had everything we needed. Gym facilities, launderette and business services have been excellent too. In particular MD Shamsed, Amelia and Natalia have made the stay very friendly. We expect to return.

column9: STUNNING, AMAZING HOTEL!! LoVED IT ALL
column10: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel totally at home.. The Staybridge suites is suited just outside of the Stratford centre. Such a great location.. Right near all the bars, shops and the Olympic Park... Our check in experience was extreemly friendly and welcoming! The cookie was a lovely touch!!  Our suite was absolutely FANTASTIC!! I couldnt get over the quality, the space and the sheer luxury! Everything was spitless and like it had never been used.. Myself and my mum felt totally relaxed and didnt want to leave!!! The kitchen area is fabulous, Everything you could want and more! The bathroom was like something you would experience in a spa, the quality of the towels, toiletries and just everything was perfect... I had high expectations, but they were DEFINETLY exceeded...Breakfast was 100% the BEST I have had at any hotel ever! Such a wide choice... Even though it was busy, nothing ran out and everything was fresh and tasty.. Nutella was even provided! Which i loved!!!I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!!! Couples, families, solo travellers.. Everyone.. It deserves all the awards it has won and more.. THANK YOU.. Cant wait ti return....

Came here several times. The service of the the staff is great, always helpful and up for a smile. Especially at the reception they have a great service. The connection to the tube and overground couldn't be any better. The mall is right next door with a big variety in stores and restaurants

Stayed here for 2 nights recently and recieved excellent service from start to finish. We was welcomed and swiftly checked in by the staff on reception, was even offered a cookie! We received a room upgrade when we checked in, which was a lovely bonus. Our room was lovely, with a seperate lounge and bedroom. Kitchen area was lovely and clean and the fridge came in handy for bits we needed to keep chilled. Bed was extremely comfortable and we both slept well on both nights that we stayed. All the staff that we encountered over the weekend were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was delicious and there was plenty to choose from. The Nespresso machine in the room is also a great touch. And if you dont like the coffees that are there they will exchange them at reception and you can also purchase extra pods for 50p each. Overall a great stay and we will definately use again.

column9: Perfect Location and super friendly staff
column10: I had used Staybridge Hotels before and had high expectations and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located for any activities in the Olympic Park or the Westfield Shopping Center. It is an easy tube ride to any place in London you want to see as a tourist as well.Everything you need is downstairs form grocery shopping to restaurants and bars.The staff is super nice, helpful, friendly and will make your stay very pleasant and relaxed.Rooms have a great view of the city and the Olympic park (although a lot of construction is going on) and are well equipped and maintained. On top of this all, the hotel provided us earlier breakfast. We had a meet in the Olympic Pool and the Hotel started breakfast an hour earlier for the swimmers so we could enjoy breakfast. If that is not going the extra mile and making ones stay special I don't know what is. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

This hotel is so much better than a standard hotel when away on business. Having room to sit and relax that is not your bedroom is such a bonus and helps you relax after a long day. The kitchenette area is very well equipped more than enough to prepare a light supper. Bedroom was large with plenty of hanging space and had iron, ironing board and washing basket for your convenience.  Rooms are cleaned each weekday (and cleaned well) but if you want housekeeping on the weekends you need to let them know.Staff extremely friendly from checkin, breakfast, reception and social event.... The social event is superb! Tues, Wed, Thurs 7-8 is an opportunity to relax with a complimentary wine, beer or sort drink and nibbles whilst contemplating the view over London. The complimentary breakfast is also very good, hot and cold items and fresh mini pancakes just perfect to send you on your way. The to go cups for coffee are very handy! There is room service available, I've not tried it yet but might soon.

column9: Great for seeing London in 1 week
column10: Did a couples trip with the husband for 1 week from Canada.  Loved our stay here.  Easy tube ride in and out of London 15-30 minutes depending on where you are going and a half hour express train from Gatwick plus short tube ride.  Short walk from the tube to the front door (tip:  Google rush hour times to avoid busiest times).Was skeptical about it being in the largest Mall in the UK, but that turned out to be fun, when the husband was napping had a safe place to wander around shopping.  Casino next door (tip:  sign up for the loyalty card and get 5 ¬£ free slots and 2 free roulette spins.  )The suite had a great kitchenette (tip:  grocery store in the mall was fabulous with lots of reheat meal options and alcohol).  But it was all about the air conditioning.  They had a heat wave the week we went in June with high humidity.  Very few places, hotels or restaurants have air conditioning in the UK, it was worth staying out of London for that alone.  We could also open the window for fresh air when it cooled down.  Staff was awesome and even printed our boarding passes for us.  Tea coffee 24/7 and The breakfast buffet was the best we've had (we travel moderate priced).  Left for 2 nights for Bath and left our suitcases locked up with the hotel at no charge.  Tip:  walk across to Broadway, there are more restaurant options there than just the food court and franchises in the mall.

My friends and I stayed at this hotel/suite last weekend while visiting London for Field Day festival. Initially we booked this place because it was really good value for all four of us - we never actually expected it to be so fantastic! So, on arrival the staff were so lovely, accommodating, helpful and genuine. The views from the lobby are gorgeous, and lounging/breakfast area is just lovely to sit in.Our rooms were outstandingly clean, modern and contained all the facilities we needed and more. We had a kitchen (that we didn't actually use) but it was immaculate and included cups, plates and cutlery. We had a complimentary Nespresso coffee machine, free wi-fi access, a glorious bathroom with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, a widescreen TV, the most comfortable bed, full length mirror and a hairdryer. The whole feel of the place was very homely, and the welcome pack even explained that you could move the furniture around to your liking and the cleaners would leave it that way for the duration of the stay. I had a great night sleep with no disturbances.A hot and cold buffet breakfast came complimentary and I've literally never had a complimentary breakfast that's so good! I would have happily paid for it. And again, it was designed to have that 'homely' feel. You could help yourself to  a huge selection of different milk and fruit juices from a fridge, just as you would at home. There was every single cereal possible, granola, porridge, fry up, pancakes, fruit, yoghurt, etc etc. So good! You could also make your own take-away coffee at any time of the day/night.The suites are located literally within Westfield shopping centre also, so ALL the restaurants and bars you could possibly wish for are on your doorstep. It's also a 1-2 minute walk to Stratford Underground.Will 100% stay again, and even tried booking for a couple of weeks in advance but they were unfortunately all booked up. Couldn't possible recommened this place any more!

I stayed for 1 night on a business trip. Good location, secure parking, lots of other facilities at the Westfield complex. Room was very good for the rate and I liked the way they did the breakfast and the public spaces. Staff were very good indeed. Somehow I was made "guest of the day" - nice touch and nice little giveaways! Will use again if in the area.

We stayed over for a lone weekend. On tje doorstep of a massive shopping centre with literally everything you'll need. Close to the underground and over ground too! Perfect location, and even better staff!! We will definitely be back!!

Stayed here for an overnight stay. Located perfectly in Westfield. Great view. Very good customer service. I had to reschedule my booking a few times due to work or family commitments and management was very kind to do this for. Was pleased with overall stay.

column9: Home away Home in a convenient location !! Perfect for business or personal travel...
column10: My fav choice after staying there for a week on business travel and have been recommending to colleagues looking for a place in East London....Convenient location with right in the middle of Westfield Stratford close to Olympic village and step away from Stratford train station...Certainly a home environment, with a suite setup so you could relax and cook your meal if you would like or have your worn clothes washed etc....Breakfast buffet is standard & pretty good in terms of changing options everyday...

Myself and my colleagues are staying in the Holiday Inn/Staybridge suites in Stratford city during a long term project in London. I would like to comment on all the staff who were more than helpful to say the least....in particular a special mention should go to Ana Rita, Gabi, Artiom and MD who have made our stay especially enjoyable and for this reason we would not hesitate to return in the future if this is the level of service provided.

Friendly staff certainly made it more home than hotel! Loved the attention to detail, whether it was in taking care of us or our rooms! Enjoyed the evening socials too, and the lovely breakfast spread. Special mention to the staff who made us feel so special, especially my eleven year old - MD, Georgina, Amelia, Alexandra, Greg, Guiliana (I probably got some spellings wrong) ... Love you all, and we will be back!

column9: Another great IHG hotel... Love stay bridge suites!
column10: My wife and I had stayed at the Vauxhall version of this brand and thought we'd try the other side of town for something different. This place is in the heart of the new development at Westfields in Stratford and right outside the Olympic park and aquatics centre used in the 2012 Olympics.  It's a 10 min walk from station into Westfield's shopping mall in the restaurant quarter. Firstly anything I say negative is really quite superficial to my overall rating as its not really the hotels fault. But the outside of the hotel now is a post olympics site as Stratford is ready to become the international business zone with lots of new high rise buildings going up. To rest assure any concerns there are no noise concerns as the glazing is first rate. IHG are really on to something with this brand of hotel for working people and holidays era who stay in London. Each room has kitchenette facilities - including a dish washer. For holiday/long vacation stayers this maybe a welcome break on the bank balance if you want to eat in one night as its well stocked with cooking utensils and crockery. Personally we never used it - and probably wouldn't unless you are staying more than a couple nights (which we didn't) The room is smaller than the large suite we stayed at in Vauxhall, but really nice, clean, King bed, excellent TV and Apple TV to AirPlay the iPad from and a high-class tea and coffee machine. Plenty of spare plugs to charge things in too. The shower/bathroom was also excellent. Power shower hit the mark. The room doesn't have a bath, which was no issue for us.Breakfast is an amazing high class buffet. Holiday inn.... Take note from a sister brand how to do breakfast well! Pancakes, full English, croissants, fresh juice, breads, muesli, fruit, porridge - the list is endless. Well done. The service is excellent checking in a out.... They really look after there guests. Special mention to MD who dealt with our checkout with such friendliness and conversation. Overall - a really, really good experience, just don't look out the window too much!

column9: Ideal option over a standard hotel
column10: I love Staybridge suites as they are more versatile than a hotel.  Rooms here a modern and very well kept.  Bathrooms are oversized with a great supply of products.  Love the fact that there was a small kitchenette in the room so I could pop down to Westfield and purchase dinner as apposed to spend on overpriced room service or local restaurants. Comfortable nights sleep and friendly staff.  Loved the shop area by reception and also the free drinks mixer of an evening. Breakfast is also great with very friendly staff.  Great option if you find one in a city and are staying more than one night.

column9: Fantastic Staff - friendly, super helpful - in a spotless place, brilliant location
column10: Stayed 4 days for easy access to London Aquatics Centre, Olympic Park, Westfield, transport in and out of London.  I loved the fact that they welcome you "home"Room spotless, they have thought of everything a traveller could need, whether there for a day, a week, a month.  I could not have been more comfortable for a few days. Breakfast was brilliant - proper fresh fruit salad, loads of cereals, cooked breakfast, continental. Big choice, good felt like home cooked food. Best of all were the staff! Fantastic, friendly, thinking ahead constantly of ways to help you. Empowered - so that they could deliver. To name a few - Giorgiana, Giulia, MD - but not just them all staff - reception, housekeeping, kitchen, restaurant were exceptional. It was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had.

Nice place for people on business travel. Location is wonderful. I loved the reception location on top floor and rooms. It's clean but not enough. Excellent breakfast included in price. Near Stratford station. Very good Wi-Fi. Highly recommended.

First time staying in the Staybridge suits. Staff are very friendly and accommodating, the suits are equipped and spacious and the facilities were very good, this includes a long and den area with water, tea and coffee available at no cost. Everything you need is on your doorstep great shopping food and connections if you want to get into central London.would recommend this to anyone.

We wanted to get away for the night and do something. My partner complains about my snoring and likes a suite allowing a separate sitting room with a door. This was booked to allow us to see the olympic village and shop. Check in was overly complicated. We discovered the sofa bed had been made up which we didn't want. Because of this we were stuck in getting an extended check out. My partner is a priority guest. Check out with the guest manager was a much more pleasant experience. I get the feeling that this is a venue for working away from home. A small kitchenette in the room. Breakfast is well done in the reception area with lots of choice.

column9: Nearly perfection, and so much nearby!
column10: I actually wish we had stayed here for both of our London visits and not just one. The location is almost unbeatable. A short walk from the Stratford Tube station, and equally short walk to the Stratford International station, which itself offers nonstop train service to St. Pancras. So if, like us, you are coming in from Eurostar, you are one stop and 10 minutes from your hotel as soon as you arrive.The hotel occupies the 8th through 12th floors (sister hotel Holiday Inn has the lower floors). Reception is on the 12th. Don't worry about noise from the lobby if you have a room on 12 -- they are separate. Rooms are good sized and all have a great view with no noise issues noted. Our only problem with the room was that housekeeping apparently feels a king room should only have one guest and we were never left more than one bath towel -- had to ask for more. Wifi was a bit slow.Breakfast is great (and coffee/tea/water are always available). The hotel is located at Westfield Stratford mall so there are tons of restaurants and shops immediately adjacent to the property -- one day we didn't even leave the mall!A special shout-out to Stephan. He was so incredibly friendly and helpful in every interaction. All the staff were great but Stephan was above and beyond. We will 100% return to this hotel.

Stayed here for business and enjoyed my time. Thought the bed was a bit uncomfortable but otherwise it was perfect. Very clean, staff was mostly polite (has a grumpy lady at checkout). Didn't eat here so I can't give an opinion on the food.

column9: 6 nights for European Masters Swimming Championship
column10: We love our suite. The positives; First hotel in a long time to have a pillow thin enough for me but also have thicker ones. The breakfast rooms are spacious, excellent choices of food, superbly attended too by very pleasant staff, and the toasters don't burn the toast! They toast like at home, no stupid conveyor belts. The bed is very comfortable, the temp control is good and no loud fan at night. In fact dead quiet at night, no sounds from the many other guests. You can open the windows for outside air as you lease. It is overall a comfortable place to stay and the staff especially at the registration desk are exceedingly pleasant and helpful. Located in the Westfield Complex there is a huge choice of shopping and food.The little negatives that didn't bother us too much; I can't think of any right now.

I spend about 30 nights in hotels each year so am used to the normal run and expectations of a hotel.  However, be prepared for your previous conceptions to be changed - mine certainly were!First stay at a Staybridge brand, and if this is the direction of how IHG are going - keep going.  You have won me back.  Staff are warm, friendly and genuinely want to help.  The decor is clean, modern and exceeds expectations.  The breakfast was plentiful and a variety was offered.,  We stayed for one night (wanted longer!) in a One Bedroom King Suite, and loved the space, facilities and the fact it is perfect for guests that tend to want a suite experience in a hotel.
