The only comment would be that I think the concierge on the ground floor as you enter might be more engaging and wanting to help - especially during the night.  He was more interested in watching You Tube or similar than opening the doors for me at 3am in the morning! (I am a light sleeper and only sleep around four hours per night, so that is why I was awake!)  Overall recommend this property totally.  If this is the way IHG is going in the UK - GO FASTER, it is about time you were at the finish line!  It is what is says - a home away from home. As a ex-housekeeper for a another hotel chain - KUDOS to the Housekeeping team, you certainly earn your salaries!

Very nice and convenient excellent staff MD and Georgina very hospitable.Breakfast has a good variety to satisfy anyone. Will definitely be booking again if and when I need to visit again. 2 adults 2 children in suite with sofa bed very comfortable no noise from trains or anything at all very nice and peaceful.

column9: 4 months of stay in Staybridge Suites Stratford
column10: I stayed more than 4 months(Feb to May 2016 in) Stay-bridge Stratford. The service was amazing and all staff were very helpful and sorted most of me queries/problems.Special thanks to cleaning staff who used to take care of room in very well manner.Special thanks to Bindi and MD for their help.

The hotel is actually located within the Straford City shopping centre.  You can take the tube that will take you into the shopping centre, then maneuver yourself to the hotel entrance, which is outside the shopping centre.  If you take a taxi from the airport, you better book this through the hotel, as out of area taxi will not know where to drop you off.This is a relatively new development, and everything is nice and fresh.  The staff are also very helpful.  The room price typically comes with breakfast, which is also of very good quality.  However, the food tend to be consumed quickly so wise not to go too late.The small in room kitchenette is good for someone who would like to cook up something simple.  You can basically buy anything you need to cook for a good meal in the supermarket downstairs.  If you prefer to eat out, then there is also a good choice of restaurants.Rooms are nice and clean, but if you stay for slightly longer, then do get yourself the larger room as these tend to be on higher floors and are brighter.

Used this hotel as a base for four nights and found the service and facilities very good.  We used rewards points which meant the stay was uncharged, or should have been.  On checking the credit card bill some weeks later we had been charged for the stay as we had left a card imprint on file.   This was refunded immediately but left me suspicious of the hotel.

The hotel suites were homely, bed was very comfortable.  Very friendly, helpful staff.  Check in easy, felt nice and secure in a very busy place.  Would highly recommend if you are at Olympic Park for a few days.  Is a tad expensive but enjoy!

column9: Great hotel, especially for long stays
column10: The hotel has a very homely atmosphere with excellent and efficient staff. Would definitely recommend it for people who are looking for a long stay. Good sized rooms and good breakfast. Special mention for MD who's extremely friendly

We booked through Booking.com (don't do that..) and although they had messed it up, the Staybridge suites fixed an alternative room for us in moments. Great service! Rooms were big, clean, and had everything needed for self-catering it seems (we didn't test that..), a functioning TV and a sometimes-functioning wi-fi. Breakfast was a rather large selection of not that much, really (luckily, they found more bacon!), but all in all it's ok, still not entirely convinced it will be my "home away from home".The hotel is extremely centrally located if you're going to the Westfield shopping centre, or (as we were) the Aquatic centre -- but if you're going to explore central London, this isn't the place for you ;)

Me and my partner go to this palace every month. The rooms are very clean and tidy. Staff are friendly and we've never had any issues. They could put a few more utensils in the kitchen,other than that it's a nice play to stay within Westfield shopping centre. Not great for parking tho. You have to park in the Westfield car park which charges crazy prices üòï.

Amazing property with great staff. Special mention of MD GUILIA at the reception. Very humble and accomodative, brings a smile on the face everytime you meet him. Helps with all the requests. Great job

column9: Brilliant hotel with every convenience with a bonus of very friendly, helpful staff
column10: This is one of my favourite places to stay when in London because its so convenient on the tube/train intersection lines; is right by the fabulous Westfield shopping center and the Olympic park where i can go for my morning walk!  Staff go out of their way to be helpful and friendly and I got upgraded to a VIP room - very nice thank you!  And I was customer of the day ..... that was a big surprise!  Beds are a little too firm for me and pillow are unfortunately lumpy (all of them!), but its a great place to stay nevertheless.

column9: Great views from rooms and excellent location for the Olympic Park.
column10: Very comfortable room. Excellent breakfast. Good shopping on the doorstep and good choice of restaurants to suits all pockets. Within walking distance of all the facilities in the Olympic a Park at Lee Valley.

The best staff you could ask for - friendly and helpful with lots of knowledge Nice and clean rooms. Free wifi, the breakfast had lots of options and it was very tasty. Great stay, we will come back here for sure.

column9: Visiting for European Championships at the Aquatic Centre, Olympic Park
column10: Booked Staybridge Suites due to the closeness to the Olympic Park and the flexibility of being able to prepare meals in your own rooms. On arrival I was upgraded from a studio to a suite, which was a very pleasant surprise. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly from start to finish and were happy to let me use the left luggage facility as I arrived about an hour earlier then anticipated. This gave the opportunity to shop at Westfield, which seems to have pretty much everything shop wise!Room itself was lovely, immaculately clean and well decorated with a nice size lounge area, separate bedroom and a bathroom with a great shower (no water pressure issues at all) The kitchenette is small, but well equipped for basic cooking and had the advantage of a dishwasher.Worth investing in the premium internet option as the basic version seemed to struggle, even with just one tablet and a laptop. Only ¬£5 for 24 hours so well worth it. I opted for the buffett breakfast both mornings I was here and while the choice was slightly less then I've had at other hotels with breakfast buffets, it was all very good quality. And it is worth noting that you can come down and refill the rooms complimentary tea and coffee from the breakfast area at any time.Really enjoyed my 2 nights here and would definitely return. Thanks to the staff for all their help and making my visit very pleasant

We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for one night. We chose to stay there as we were attending an event nearby. The accommodation is located within the Westfield Complex. This means it's easy to find, it's close to shopping, bars and restaurants and transport links. We drove there, and although the car park was very busy (not helped by the numerous bays under repair) we found the parking at the centre very cheap, less than ¬£10 for time we were there. The Suites were located on the upper floors of the complex. Reception and our room were on the 12th floor, so away from the noise of the bars etc. Our room was very spacious, with a kitchenette,and a coffee machine. The bed was very comfy, so much so that my wife took a note of the pillows and has since purchased one similar. The view is a little spoilt by all the building work, but as soon as it's all completed it will offer panoramic views of London. We could see, Canary Wharf, the City and the Olympic Park from our room. (Ask for an even numbered room to get the same view)There was a communal area by reception, with free coffee and water 24 hours a day. Plus a selection of snacks and drinks that could be purchased 24 hours a day.  The area also served as the breakfast area in the morning, and included a separate den and balcony. There is a gym on site, which has a few machines, no treadmill surprisingly, however you can also use the facilities of the hotel next door if need be. We found the staff when we checked in very friendly and they could not do enough for us. The staff the next day, were efficient but we found them unhelpful, unfriendly,  basically they couldn't wait for us to leave! Would we stay there again. Probably. However not sure when we would need to again. It's too far from Central London and we prefer Westfield London to the one in Stratford.

We have stayed at other places when we come to London/Stratford, so it's first time here. We will be back. It really does tick all the boxes. Good location, good staff, good value, good accommodation and the fact it's a suite gives you more options with self catering as well. Welcome drinks apparently on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday's a good excuse to come on those days, with snacks and cheese as well, brilliant. The breakfast has branded products, excellent.

My wife and I enjoyed our stay at Staybridge, Stratford. From check in to check out I couldn't fault anything. The staff were excellent. Friendly and very helpful. Very professional and very natural with it. The rooms were well equipped and perfect for a long stay if required,  the room had all the amenities anyone would need. The complimentary breakfast had a great choice and included hot and cold items. You could also use the area during the day to sit and read a paper etc, which also included free hot drinks. The location is handy for all areas of London. It might be a bit further out of central London for some, but actually it's very convenient. This is due to the many transport options available from Stratford. Also have the shopping mall outside the hotel door is excellent. A great stay, I will come back here in the future.

What a fantastic place to stay in London!! Great location for getting around and what brilliant staff - Nic and his team made our stay a very memorable one !! The little extras that this hotel offer make it such good value and they always go over and above for the guests - thanks again for a brilliant time

From the moment I entered it I felt it home. Greeted by the staff, welcome drinks and swift check in. Got to my room and the view was simply breathtaking. Everything I wanted was there. In room dining and other services was perfect. later I found I could easily go shopping and commute to work from here.  I will defiantly be staying here again.BTW the staff's smiles are so nice, especially MD shamsed.

column9: Hotel make you feel Welcome Home
column10: "Welcome Home" greets you as you check in. It's been a long time since I was met with such friendly and heartily welcome as I was at Staybridge Suites in Stratford, London. Polite, smiling, and with a good sense of humor! MD and Giuglia opened up the rest of the hotel and made no secret they were there to make you feel "at home". Excellent!The hotel has everything you need; good atmosphere, clean and good beds. Tuesday-Thursday management has a social event and it feels like all staff goes all in to make you feel special and welcome home. Chris (mngr) greets you and indeed all make it a social event making sure to keep a sensitive distance should you prefer you privacy. I will go back first chance!

column9: Very cheerful and supportive staff make your stay memoriable
column10: I am in UK for more than two months now and have been to different places and hotels but undoubtedly I can say that staff in this hotel makes this property awesome (specially Stephan, MD and Anelia).Hotel is situated very near to tube station, so no problem in commuting anywhere in London.You can find largest shopping mall of London just below your hotel with food court, pubs, theatre, games etc in mall. There is a small kitchen in every room of this hotel which comes very handy during your long stay.

A truly amazing location. In the heart of Westfield Stratford City for shopping, 10 min on the tube from Canary Wharf, 15 min on the tube from the city and the West End, also walking distance to the Queen Elizabeth park. Rooms are of a high quality and the public areas are amazing. The view of London are stunning, if you look past the building works around the local area.

stayed at an apartment here during the May Bank holiday weekend for two nights. price very reasonable as not centrally located but makes no difference as its so easy to get to central london. Its a 2 minute walk to stratford station, and 10 minutes on the train. Westfield has plenty of parking, ¬£9.50 for 24 hours, but if you take the car out, you would need to start again. So we drove there and left the car in the car park and used public transport to get around. The receptionist was lovely and explained all the charges to my card very clearly, she was friendly and made us feel welcome. the room was excellent with a little kitchen which has everything you need, and enough room for my 3 year old to have space to have a play around with his toys. the room has free wifi, which is fab. excellent choice at breakfast, which is included in the price, all top branded items, no generic cheap food items. hot and cold items for breakfast. the apartment has a little den with a TV and unlimted tea and coffee. it has a fitness room too.the icing on the cake was that when we got home we realised we had left something behind in the room. I rang the front desk and spoke to Giulia, who was so lovely. she rang me back five minutes later to say housekeeping had found my item and they posted it out to me the next day. fantastic service, cant fault anything, will definitely stay here again. superb for a shopping weekend with friends i think

column9: A really lovely 'home from home' hotel!
column10: With out doubt this is the nicest ‚Äòhome from home‚Äô hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in. The entrance, hotel and room were spotless. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful and very eager to please. They allowed us to check in earlier than the advertised 3pm, which was a great help.The hotel is located within the Westfield Stratford City Shopping Centre and can be accessed with or without entering the Centre. Whilst it feels super safe during the day I‚Äôd be a little more on your guard during the night. My wife and I returned to the hotel at 11.40pm and Westfield Security were trying to defuse a very heated exchange getting close to blows outside the hotel entrance doors between a group of youths. It didn‚Äôt look very pleasant and we quickly got into the hotel. I guess with the bars in the area this is to be expected but not something you‚Äôd really want your kids to see if returning very late.The room was amazing. The kitchenette and bathroom were so clean. The first time I‚Äôve ever stayed in a hotel without a ‚Äògrungy‚Äô shower in need of TLC. It really was immaculate. However, I would say the room needed the most minor attention to detail. Silly little things really. The strike plates on the door frames for both doors were misaligned. For the main door this meant we couldn‚Äôt deadbolt the door at night for peace of mind. To counter this maintenance has installed a ‚Äòlook-see‚Äô latch, which is fine but the strike plate only needs a bit of fettling. Similarly the bathroom strike plate needs a small adjustment, a bend really, so the door can close smoothly. As it was I woke my wife at 6.30am using the bathroom.A hairdryer was provided but there wasn‚Äôt a single outlet near a mirror! To be able to use the hairdryer we had to rearrange the furniture moving a desk up a bit to reveal a hidden socket, moving a desk lamp to another outlet. There was a stand-up lamp located behind a really comfy chair but the switch was on the floor so every time we wanted to switch the lamp on/off we had to move the chair. As I said silly things but it felt like the room had been set out without proper thought or maybe rearrange by a previous guest?I can‚Äôt fault the complimentary hot and cold breakfast provided on the twelfth floor near reception. We managed to get a table as we were very early but there are lots of signs advising guests on weekends the breakfast area can get busy so you may wish to grab your food and head back to your room. There is tea and coffee on tap 24/7 also in the breakfast area and free WIFI. The hotel has a pantry with food to buy, fitness centre and laundry facilities but we didn‚Äôt use these.   All-in-all I really can‚Äôt fault this hotel and we will definitely be staying here again.

Our second visit to the wonderful Staybridge Suites. You are made to feel welcome as soon as you arrive at Reception. The staff are extremely polite, helpful and friendly our room was ready even though we had arrived early. They staff go out of their way to help you feel at home. We had another nice room with great views of London skyline and Olympic Park it is worth paying the extra cost. Nice little kitchenette which would be beneficial for a longer stay. Lovely shower and bathroom all absolutely spotless with nice complimentary toiletries. There is a great buffet breakfast on offer with lots of choice. Also complimentary tea & coffee available 24 hours which is an adavntage after a few hours in the Westfield Mall. Great location right next to the mall and for a visit to the Olympic Park or the 02 Arena. Stratford tube station is a 5 minute walk. We will most definitely be returning later this year as it really is as they advertise a home from home!

I stayed in the one bedroom suite and it was very spacious with a separate bedroom and living area with a very well-equipped kitchen. The bathroom had a full bath with a shower function. Facilities were modern and very well maintained by housekeeping. Reception staff was amazing and made my young son (8 years) who is rather shy feel very comfortable. Special mention goes to Greg and MO. They were simply outstanding in making us feel very welcome. I will definitely recommend this hotel as it is very family friendly. Sal the concierge was also a cut above the rest. Location is perfect as Stratford tube station and Stratford international are all within walking distance. The mall within which the hotel is located has a vast range of shops from primark, marks and spencer to more high end shops. I will definitely be back!!!!

Great Hotel to stay in - good location, close to station, great facilities and wonderful friendly service, convenient breakfast and relaxing evening socials. Special thanks to Natalia/ MD for making the check-in a breeze.

Without doubt one of the friendliest accommodating hotels I've stayed in. All of the team go out of their way to make you feel at home. The weeknight socials are a great touch. Rooms are great size and kitchens really useful. Perfect place for Olympic park and Westfield shopping. Views are outstanding. Honestly, if you are like me and need somewhere to stay whilst away from home for work - I can't recommend better in London. It's all down to the team.

column9: kitchen, gym and close to a major train station
column10: the hotel is excellent but more for the traveler who likes to be away from the major tourist attractions, aside from the mall its situated in:) it was a good stop for us in June awaiting the Foo fighter concert that ultimately got canceled. Anyhow, the room is a  good size well priced  w kitchenette, gym and good wifi. They provide complimentary breakfast which is the basics and it worked well for us, not picky eaters. the cons would be its location, its far off the beaten path and its housed with in the confines of pretty sizable Mall which was quite confusing when we initially got off the subway for the 1st time. regardless, excellent for its price and luxury of being able to cook snacks instead of getting killed by the mighty POUND.

Delighted with the staybridge. As it was a Friday the parking was ¬£6.50 in car park B , exit just across from the Staybridge. We were allowed to check in early. The Suite was very comfortable, had a fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee machine. Breakfast the next morning was very nice, lots of choice, I will certainly stay there again very soon.

column9: It really is "home from home" accomodation - only better!
column10: Booked direct on the IHG website, possibly a little cheaper, but most websites are similar, so no need to shop around for pricing.We have wanted to stay at the Staybridge Suites, Westfield-Stratford since they opened, but for one reason or another have not managed to.So, with the Hockey Finals being played over 2 days last weekend we booked a suite! I always love writing reviews when they are good. But, this stay was not good... it was excellent!! Our greeting at reception on the 12th floor was warm, welcoming and staff were smiling, obviously happy to be working there and checked us in very quickly. Our suite with a view over the London skyline was, well excellent! Everything you need. Spotlessly clean, microwave, fridge, hob, glasses, cutlery. No cheap coffee: an up-to-date machine. We said it was an experience like we have had in the USA where usually everything is big and service is usually very good. Breakfast was the best we have experienced in a long time. Stefan & his colleagues were friendly, down-to-earth, helpful, and the hot food was not only very good quality, but... hot ! (isn't it annoying when food is put out in hotel breakfast buffets and you find it luke warm at best?) Drinks machines excellent and loved the idea of milk in cartons, real fruit juices in cartons in a large fridge. No waste, no silly tiny glasses & jugs. Looking forward to returning!!!  Any criticisms? None. Highly recommended. Already booked to stay again in June and we are looking forward to it. I know that the selfish man who decided to break the rules and smoke in his room, won't be there. He is banned! He caused the hotel's fire alarm system to go off and we had to evacuate the hotel, after midnight. The staff were very apologetic, but they were absolutely right to follow the procedures and we weren't out in the cold for too long. Hasten to add he did not come down for breakfast - he would not have been popular.

We stayed for one night for my fiance's birthday and this hotel was so much better than we could have ever imagined. The staff were so friendly and remembered you. Our room was fantastic on the same floor as reception with a brilliant view. We even won guest of the day. Cannot recommend highly enough! It really did feel like home. We have already started telling family and friends if they get the chance to stay at a staybridge to do so. The kitchen in our room was fantastic and so homely. We had everything we could wish for plus the convenience store if we needed anything else. Absolutely love the staff here they were excellent! We will definitely be back

This hotel makes you to feel like you are at home, having your tea in front of your TV. The staff are so friendly like your neighbours. The design is very beautiful, you could see the beautiful view of London. Rooms has its own kitchen, as you are in the middle of Westfield Stratford you could go shopping, cinema, bar, restaurant, etc without travelling

This was my third stay in this hotel and certainly not my last. My family were well looked after by Georgiana from the moment we checked in. As a Spire member this hotel is a credit to the brand - spotless inside, all the staff are extremely friendly, the rooms are modern well equipped and the hotel itself excels in providing a relaxing atmosphere. It has excellent shopping, restaurants, views (check out my pic) and great rail links to start your day from. Probably the best value you will find in London!

column9: Perfect! Charming staff, brilliant accommodation, wonderful views
column10: The reception staff were so helpful and patient and cheerful - obviously enjoying their jobs.  The accommodation was such a surprise - immaculate, clean and tidy, light and bright with everything we needed and more. Lovely comfy bed. Fantastic views. Breakfast was the best ever!

I stayed here for 4 nights this week and it was fantastic, the staff can't do enough for you, are very welcoming and friendly. The room was beautiful and had everything you could possibly need away from home. The manager's daily happy hour was inspired and it was great after a long day at work to sit down, enjoy the view with a cold glass of (free) wine.Can't wait to go back!

column9: Excellent Regular Stop for London Work
column10: Great location for restaurants & shopping & easy commute to city centre and canary wharf. Love the rooms and facilities the suites provide. Also love the socials put on by the venue to introduce the great staff and encourage guests to mingle.

column9: A home away from home - I was blown away!
column10: From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out, the Staybridge Suites felt like a home away from home. The receptionists were extremely welcoming and helpful as were the staff at breakfast. The room itself was perfect for my wife and I and young daughter. We could make her food for her in the kitchen and store things in the fridge, which was invaluable as she has a dairy allergy. The room was so spacious and having a separate lounge made it much nicer to watch tv, talk and relax whilst our daughter was sleeping in the bedroom. The whole room and hotel were in immaculate condition. Moving on to the breakfast, this continued to fit the home from home feeling. A fantastic selection of food and juices to enjoy and exactly the sorts of things we would enjoy on a lazy Sunday at home. Little touches like having the condiments (e.g peanut butter) in jars that you could take to your table rather than packets just added to that homely feeling. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay after attending a wedding in mile end. It's my first time in a Staybridge Suites property and I was blown away! Thank you to everyone for making us feel most welcome!‚Äù

We so enjoyed our recent stay here. There was a really well equipped kitchenette in the room. The room itself was lovely and had big windows to see over Stratford. Right in the Westfield shopping centre too. The Staff were welcoming, very friendly and helpful too. A really good value for money place to stay. The breakfast was great with everything that you might want. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

column9: Awesome stay it reminds our home
column10: We just stayed here for only 3 weeks with family and felt like it was our home. My kids liked this place very much.Its really a wonderful stay. The staff was very nice & polite especially Mr.MD he is very friendly & polite. He used to guide us on the areas to explore here in London.The complimentary  breakfast was too good with many varieties. Overall it's an memorable stay at StayBridge Suites - Stratford City,London.

column9: Amazing team, made me feel @ home
column10: MD and the boys at reception were highly welcoming, fast and effective problem solvers, maintenance was right on it when my door didn't close properly and it was fixed immediately.  The rooms are great, bed is wonderfully comfortable, new showers, all the kitchen necessities one could possibly need are there, even a tupperware to take one's lunch out on the go!  All together a wonderful housing experience I highly recommend.  (Only complaint is that Internet was a little slow and dis-connective at times - to be improved!)

Staybridge was recommended by my friend. I stayed here for more than 10 days with my son spending the term break holidays.  I felt like home as I was welcomed by the friendly reception staffs, especially MD. His smiling face will cheer up everybody.  The room is spacious, clean and tidy.  I can do simple cooking and also washing here. But I found some of the guests was not so considerate when using the washing machine.  Hope this may not affect other guests in the future.  I must come back again!!

I booked 2 nights at the Staybridge Suites for a business trip in April 2016.  I am a frequently in London and use IHG website to book my accommodation.  On this occasion i needed to stay east of the City and consequently booked this accommodation.  I was most surprised that after accepting the price offered VAT should be added thus increasing the price of the room by 20%.Accommodation is good, lovely bathroom, comfortable room and bed.  Good breakfast and very easy access to shopping, tube and trains.  Facilities at the Holiday Inn can be used but I struggled with understand arrangements in the bar.  At 11 I was asked to pay my bill and told to use my card to pay for anything after 11.  I duly did. Then at 11.30 I was asked to pay again and reception staff were taking over running the bar.  All very odd.  The terrace also closes at 11.  Again odd.All in all a good stay.  Just a couple of things that annoyed me

column9: Excellent just like Home to Home
column10: I was staying few times this  wonderful property. but this time I was with my family and kids .Three days had wonderful staying  .my family they just love it didn't feel staying hotel just like move in to another home.first class services first class stuffs very good food ,very good location.I must give thanks to MS Georgiana ''guest service manager'' what a lovely lady with great smile she looked after us very well .we can not wait to meet her again all thanks goes to her she done great job .

I wasn't even staying in Staybridge Suits, my parents were, but MD welcomed me as a guest and treated me like family. From the second I came through the door I was invited to use the facility's and was invited for breakfast, which was amazing with such an array of choices. A relaxed home from home and I would definitely like to stay here myself.

Loved our stay, fab staff, good rooms, awesome views and couldn't ask for more. Perfect location near the Olympic Park and the Westfield. Had a late check out which was very handy.We did have an issue with our card access but the staff soon resolved it and we were sorted.

column9: Excellent place to stay for a family
column10: We love this property and have stayed there for a week long two consecutive summers. Many reasons why we love it. Primary reason would be the fact that the hotel is right across the Stratford mall and that means perfect place for a family to pass time if I was away for work. Also access to the many many restaurants in the mall is a huge plus and a major attraction for us to go back. The Stratford underground station is right next door and offers a reasonable connectivity to London and its various sights. The 1BR that we often booked was very spacious and perfect for long stays. It is quite well furnished with a full kitchenette, 2 TVs and anything else you may need. Free laundry was useful as we were on a long European trip. Another major plus was the huge reception area. Perfect place to sit down if you want to be outside the room and not outside the hotel. Also if you are meeting a guest. The breakfast was also quite good. It would have been better if they would change things a bit more than they do but despite this we were happy enough to eat there for a week. Free coffee any time of the day was a small but nice gesture. Really nothing that I could have asked more. I guess this is why we stayed there for 2 consecutive summers.

Staying here from more than 1 month, Always felt like home with all the facilities. Service being provided by MD & Gregrio is excellent. They are helping us in all the required things. All our issues (you hardly get) will be addressed immediately. Other advantages you would get is Tube station, Bus station, Shopping Complex (Westfield) are just 2-3 mins walk away. I would like to stay again here and definetely recommend others to stay.

Stay here for 3 weeks . Always feel like home. Very good and cheerful staff. I would say that it is my excellent stay in London. Breakfast is plentiful and varied and the managers evening on a Tues - Thurs night is also great. M D is very cheerful and supportive staff.He went out of way to ensure guests are comfortable

Stay here for 2 months. Always feel like home. Very good and cheerful staff. I would say that it is my excellent stay in London. Breakfast is plentiful and varied and the managers evening on a Tues - Thurs night is also great. M D is very cheerful and supportive staff.

column9: Great friendly staff, clean well appointed rooms
column10: This is great for a short break if going to Olympic park or excel arena or a shopping break as its right in the Westfield shopping complex. Despite the location, it's not noisy at all.The bar facilities are minimal, but you can use the 'proper' bar and dining set up in the adjacent holiday inn, and yes, you can recharge directly from there back to the staybridge as they are both iHG owned.The international staff are really friendly and professional. In particular MD, Gregor and Georginia who really do make you feel like they're glad to see you and that you're a guest not just a customer.

column9: Kind, Welcoming and Hospitable Staff & Nice Hotel
column10: The rooms are clean and spacious with its own fitted kitchen and a nice bathroom. This is made even better with its location, right next to Westfield Mall and the Stratford tube station if you want to explore other parts of London.Most of the time, no matter how nice a hotel is - the service is what makes or breaks it and this hotel's service definitely made my trip to London comfortable, worry-free and convenient. The staff, like MD, are always eager to help and approaching them is so easy as they have a very friendly vibe. You can see that they want to make your stay as good as possible.I definitely recommend and will book this hotel again if I come back to London

column9: Great place to stay and friendly staff
column10: Stayed here for 3 nights due to attending an event at Excel (20min journey to the centre). First impressions couldn't have been better with friendly and informative staff and the added bonus of chocolate. The room / apartment was lovely and had everything we needed while we were away. Breakfast was plentiful and varied and the managers evening on a Tues - Thurs night was also great and just what we needed. Overall I would stay here again if I need accommodation in the area and would recommend to anyone.

We had a fantastic stay in this excellent hotel. It did indeed feel like a home from home. MD made us feel so welcome on Good Friday and the bunny ears were just brilliant lol!!Our room was superb and very quiet. Breakfast was excellent - really nothing we could fault.

Stayed here 2 weeks during a business trip to London.The en-suite was impeccable clean and well-equipped. The Wi-Fi signal was pretty good and I could work from my room as well. The electrical iron was very efficient and suited my needs; and there was even a cork-screw in the kitchenette (despite the fact I had some trouble finding it). The breakfast was fresh every time, and on a sunny day the view from the breakfast hallway is great!I have found the reception to be very responsive.Upon check-out, running late and discovering I had lost my boarding pass, the manager, Georgiana, even offered to print a copy for me! Excellent client service, with very friendly, helpful and quick-witted staff.I will definitely come back again!

I recently stayed at the Staybridge Suites and was absolutely blown away with how nice everything and everyone was! I arrived later than my party who were also staying at the hotel to be greeted by i believe her name was Amanda who couldn't do enough to ensure i had the best stay and everything i needed. I stayed in a room on the 8th floor using the lift to get to and from floor levels was a breeze. I opened the door to my room and couldn't believe my eyes - it was like a mini home! The view was amazing ( i could see the O2 arena from my window). The shower is by far the best hotel shower i have ever used and would highly recommend using it! I unfortunately didn't get to make use of the Westfields shopping facility a stone throw away from the hotel but would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to shop, to visit the Olympic park or as a resting point after a day out in London - the tube station is a short 5 minute walk away. Overall i don't have a single bad word to say and look forward to hopefully visiting again!

Although no "boutique" hotel (& it doesn't claim to be) the Staybridge has a lot going for it. Top of the list it is immaculately clean, the location is very convenient for the  over and underground train network, ample easy to access parking, next door to the Olympic park, and part of the Westfield shopping complex. What's not to like. Checking in was quick, straightforward and very friendly, and the request for two independent reservations to be situated close together fulfilled.Breakfast self service with a good choice and ample supplies. The suites have facilities to self cater, and there is a laundry and small fitness centre.I thought it was really good value given the location and amenities, was very pleased with the accommodation, and cannot wait for the next shopping trip!

We had a great time when we stayed here over the weekend. My wife and I stayed in a studio suite. The suite was a good size, clean and well equipped.  It was very well located, right next to the Westfied Shopping Centre, the Olympic Park and the Stratford Rail Station, which has Overland trains, as well as the Jubilee and Central lines as well as the DLR. This made it very easy to travel all around London. There was plenty of parking and it was reasonably priced at the Westfield Centre. Staff were very nice and friendly and the buffet breakfast was fresh and quite reasonable to say that it was included in the price. Would definitely stay here again.

column9: Kitchen in hotel room great addition to already outstanding facilities.
column10: Had a really enjoyable stay at the Staybridge Suites in Stratford. Recommended this from family members who have stayed in the Liverpool one - the added bonus of the rooms is the kitchenette facilities! Use of a hob, microwave oven, dishwasher, and a Nespresso machine made the stay feel extra homely! Great views looking out over Stratford and the Westfield shopping centre, especially on the top floor reception and breakfast area. Free breakfast is also a positive, which was enjoyable to fuel up for a day of shopping around Westfield. This hotel is in a great location, whether you want to remain in Westfield or get on the Central line to the main attractions of London central. Friendly staff and great amenities, will be returning!

We have stayed at the Staybridge at Stratford before and have found it great for both local and central London requirements.  The Staybridge could do a few things better, when compared to others, the minor fact that they don't offer towelling robes is one, minor, but at the same price if you stay in a Holiday Inn, you'd have one and there part of the same group.As for its position, comfort and services provided it is good and worth a visit

We have stayed in this hotel twice now. Rooms are clean and the kitchen is well equipped. Staff are friendly. Location is excellent, within walking distance to the underground station. Breakfast is good although they seem to stop refilling items that have run out about half an hour before they close. They should have enough food to replenish up until closing time. Many items we requested had run out. I do not feel it is acceptable to have a "wind down" for half an hour. Would stay here again. Recommended.

This is my third visit to Staybridge Suites in Stratford and I can honestly say, each stay gets better. Easily found from Stratford stations and on the edge of Westfield shopping centre, its location is perfect for either a shopping break, a trip to central London, or a visit to the O2 arena. The suites have a small kitchen unit, with fridge, microwave, hob and sink, with cutlery and crockery for a couple of guests. It's modern contemporary in its style, and super clean. There is a small gym on site but sadly no treadmill.  You can however use the gym at the Holiday Inn in the same building. There is a laundry area and some nice relaxing areas to go read a book or the paper with a coffee.  Breakfast is one of the best I have had at any London hotel, with a range of hot and cold options - and not with the tiny glasses for juice and tiny cups for tea and coffee! The staff are wonderful, incredibly welcoming and friendly. Just book! You really won't regret it!

column9: Just the best place to stay
column10: My wife and I have stayed here twice now when visiting the o2 for a concert. The hotel is in an excellent location for both the o2 and the Olympic Park. The staff are brilliant especially Nicolas and Stephan who will attend to your every need and the rooms are just the best. I am not the sort of person who normally writes reviews but in this case these guys deserve some credit for what they do. I recommend this hotel.

Ideally located when you have business to attend to around Westfield / Olympic park (6 minutes by train from St Pancras).The flat I stayed in was clean, well equipped (full kitchen stuff), modern and quiet. (free) wifi was correct.One weak point in my stay was the breakfast, untasty and greasy (and restricted choice). Staff very friendly and helpful.I highly recommend.

We stayed at this hotel during Christmas and not only was it perfect for the 'Sales' but it's great for London, places to eat.The team are so helpful and friendly it's a pleasure to to be there.It truly is a home from home.

column9: An excellent hotel which feels like home
column10: Stayed at this Staybridge Suite when visiting London Excel for the Motorbike Show with my son.  Normally when we visit London we stay in a central location however this is definitely a hotel we plan to visit again due to it's close proximity to Olympic park, Westfield shopping centre (to keep my wife happy) and transport links.Once we arrived we were welcomed by 2 members of staff who were happy to assist in selecting a nice room for us as we were keen to have a nice view of the park and also London.  The room was first class with it's own kitchen.  As we only stayed 1 night we did not have a great need for the kitchen however after a busy day at the show we stopped off at the local m&s food next door to grab some food to take "home" just to try it out!  Having a good fridge which works well is a welcome change for a hotel.The breakfast buffet in the morning is also first rate along with the views.The lift takes a bit of getting used to as you have to use your card, just ask how to use it at reception to avoid going down to the basement each time üòÄ - it is for security to avoid just anyone getting to the rooms.We took the opportunity to visit the Olympic swimming pool and Velodrome which were brilliant with free entry to both we were lucky enough to catch a swimming competition and watch some amateur cyclists have a go.  The park is very large so we also took the opportunity to try out the recently installed "boris bikes" which are only ¬£2 to hire for 24hrs providing these are docked within time limits.I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a home away from home, as an HRG member it was also a bonus to learn I'd earned some points during my stay which I hope to put to good use with a return visit.5 stars

This is an amazing place to live right in middle of westfield Mall with extremely efficient staff.I love the social evening concept of engaging people and allowing visitors to get their friends and have their own get together's if they need one. I like the hostpitality and ambience which give me a feeling of home. Special thanks to all the supporting staff for making my trip a memorable one.

After suffering a flood in our flat over Christmas, my husband and I checked into Staybridge Suites in January 2016 and are still here 2 months later! It really has become a home from home for us. The room is spacious and the in-room kitchenette and communal laundry room provide the perfect facilities for a long term stay. The breakfast selection has something for everyone, and the socials on Tues - Thurs evenings are great.But above all, it is the staff that make a stay here extra special. They are without doubt the best team I have ever come across at a hotel and all appear to genuinely love working here which is a credit to how the hotel is run. No matter what time of day, you are greeted with a warm smile and a friendly face. They go out of their way to make you feel at home, and whether you are here for 2 days or 2 months they will do whatever they can to help make your stay perfect. I had not heard of this hotel 2 months ago, but it now comes top of my recommendation list for anybody looking for accommodation in London.

Great place to stay with easy access to central London.  Staff really helpful and friendly, especially on checking in and out.  Suites are spacious, quiet and the complimentary breakfast a bonus.  Plenty of room to relax on the 12th floor. Can definitely recommend.

This suite hotel is perfect. The conditions are great and the price is good.The staff is really nice and they are always happy to help you.Location is really nice, there are a lot a transportation nearby. Also the Westfield is just in from of it.I really recommend this hotel to everyone.

column9: Amazing place. Such a great concept. Would definitely return.
column10: Stayed here for one night whilst in London on business.A really quality hotel but a very relaxed feeling. The staff were exceptional. Food at breakfast was great. Used the gym, which was good and had amazing views. In fact the views were amazing all round. Location perfect for public transport, shops and restaurants.Sadly I didn't make use of the kitchen facilities whilst there, but if I were to come back (I most probably will), I would for sure use all facilities and think the concept is great. All round great place for business and leisure!

Although the hotel is on the Eastern side of London it has great Underground and Overground connections to Central London. The accommodation is of a high standard. Nice sized public rooms and good breakfast. Plenty of restaurants in nearby Westfield Shopping Centre. For Business or Leisure stays you can't really go wrong with this hotel.

I decided to stay here last minute as I wanted to be at an event in Docklands early the next day, and booked using IHG Reward Club points as I'm a member.Apart from the topsy-turvy layout of the hotel (reception, lounge and breakfast area are on the top floor) everything was as I would have expected and more.The staff were very friendly, the room and integral kitchen were clean and pleasant, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was very good, with a great view.Parking is in the Westfield Shopping Centre Car Park (B). There are no dedicated spaces, but park near signs for the Casino. The correct pedestrian exit has the hotel logo on it. Price isn't bad at all (for London). Stratford is something of an East London public transport hub, thanks to the Olympics, so it is easy to get anywhere from there.Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

That was the 2nd time I stayed in this hotel with my daughter who had her school half term holidays. I stayed for 9 nights. That was the longest stay I had in one single hotel, and obviously I was happy with the stay. The staff was smart and friendly, especially Guilia who helped me to check in with warm greetings and arrangement of my extended stay. Also Steven was helpful to answer my queries about payment of the room charges. The other hotel staff was also efficient to provide anything I needed in the room or during breakfast time.Room was clean and tidy. The furnitures and equipment inside the room were well-maintained. The housekeeping staff managed to check every details in the room during the daily cleaning. I was pleased for their housekeeping work.Although the shopping mall downstairs (Westfields) was always crowded with people, Staybridge is quiet and we were not disturbed particularly when my daughter needed to finish her school work and did some revision for her coming exams. We felt like a retreat and homely during our stay.

column9: I wish all hotels were like this
column10: I absolutely love this hotel! We have stayed here twice now and I can not wait to go back. The staff is friendly, but not cheesy friendly, just really nice. There is a small shop where you can buy food and drinks at decent prices. The room is lovely, you can do your laundry for free. Breakfast is always included and you can go several times (easy for us as we have a todler and this way one of us can go back and have a quiet breakfast) or you can just grab what you like and take it back to your room. If the shopping center is getting a bit busy for you, you can always pop back to the lounge during the day and have another coffee (and some pastries if you are lucky). Fantastic place!

We stayed in this apartment for work, the apartment was spacious, had everything you need and was lovely and clean. The bed was also very comfy! The staff are very very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was lovely with a great selection available!

My daughter and I needed a very last minute booking and certainly chose the right place.  From walking into the main reception to checking out the following morning everything was fantastic.  We were upgraded to a deluxe room with super king size bed without asking and the room was amazing and very clean.  Breakfast was also all we could ask for.  The location is great for shopping.  Staff were friendly and polite.  Definitely a five star experience and we would love to return.

Room and facilities were excellent. Staff were polite, friendly and smiling.  Breakfast was free and had a wide variety of cereals, breads, fruit etc as well as a cooked choice.  Would definitely recommend staying as the bed was very comfortable and it was 'home from home' with a cosy sitting room and a very well equipped kitchen which included a dishwasher and large fridge. I slept well as the rooms are efficiently soundproofed. My view was Stratford city and behind it London's skyline.

column9: Lovely place to stay with great staff
column10: Stayed here in jan. Its a lovely place to stay more like an apartment than a room it was very clean and very mordern and the staff was very pleasent and very helpful breakfast was included in the price and there was lots to choose from. Its right in the middle of the westfields shopping center so plenty to do day and night and just a short walk to the hotel. Was impressed with the pictures around the hotel that showed london back in the old days a very nice touch. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay in there again

Stayed three times at this hotel. The rooms are very nice clean and all you could want for a short stay. The holel is in a shopping mall and i am sorry to say shopping took most of my time. The breakfast was nice and plenty of choice even for the fussy people like me. The staff are polite and welcoming. So if your looking for a relaxing stay not far from centre look no further.

column9: The jewel of the IHG group
column10: For me, the Staybridge Suites are the jewel in the IHG crown. Whilst I know some of the other hotels, Hotel Indigo's rooms for example are stunning, Staybridge just hits the right mark everywhere.From the genuinely friendly team at the front of house, and little things such as the "Guest of the day" promotions. The 7-8 social hours, with free drinks and nibbles Tuesday to Thursday, the brilliant (and inclusive) "Pantry" breakfasts, and of course the rooms, especially the one bedroom ones are spaces, comfortable and have everything you could need.For me and my company, the Staybridge Suites (in Stratford) have become our London home from home. If we are anywhere near the East side of London (and sometimes if we are not) then that is where we will stay. So if you are in any doubt whether the Staybridge Suites should be considered for your stay, don't. In simple terms, they are brilliant, and most importantly (especially for London) affordable.

Great Hotel, location is a shoppers haven, but most of all staff delivered warm welcome and customer service to the highest standard! A BIG Thank You to Amelia and Natalija which both were exceptionally helpful and really showed they care!

We're just back from Stratford and staying at the staybridge, great hotel room was like a little mini apartment  trendy decor lovely and clean everything you need, complimentary breakfast each morning which was as nice, staff were very polite and always had a smile, the staybridge is fantastic for Westfields shopping centre also easy access to London via tube/train.. We actually followed someone's advice on here to get to car park and hotel and I'm glad we did as it would of been difficult if not, car park is ¬£9:50 for 24 hrs which is great for London but if you join the Aspers casino ( which is free) which is more or less opp hotel you get free 24 hour parking.. We paid ¬£9:50 for whole weekend üëçüèº, a great weekend away and will def be staying again .... Happy Valentine's Day ‚ù§Ô∏è

My wife and I, accompanied by another couple of friends, stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Westfield Stratford recently.  My wife and I were there for two nights and our friends just for one.  From the moment we got to reception the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful.  They were very courteous and professional.  We got checked in within minutes and informed that breakfast is included with the stay, where the restaurant was and anything else that we needed to know.  We then got directed to our room.The room is very clean with a small kitchen area (which contains a microwave, hob, oven etc. a kitchen away from home), and a large bathroom (for a budget hotel).  The room itself was much better than I was expecting from a hotel in this price bracket, which was a nice surprise.  The room was comfortable, as was the bed, and the shower was huge with actual water pressure, rather than the usual trickle you get from most budget hotels.You had an option (which you were given at check in) whether you wanted maid service each day during your stay (which is also included in the price).The breakfast area is on the top floor (12th) where reception is, so you do get some views of the area.  In the distance you can see Canary Wharf and the City towers, but unfortunately much of Stratford is under construction, so other than Olympic park/stadium, there is not too much to see.  The views at night are much better as it masks the construction and the skyline al lit up looks impressive.  With regards to the construction I mentioned, I will say that although it is going on, it in no way impedes your stay and you certainly can‚Äôt hear it from the hotel.The hotel is a short journey on the underground/DLR to various places around London and very handy for Westfield shopping, restaurants, bars or even the casino, if the mood takes you.  The commute from Stratford to Oxford street (which is fairly central) is only about 15 mins on the Central Line, so the location is very useful.  Another way to go, (which is what we did), is to head from Stratford to Royal Albert Dock, from there you can get the Emirates Air Line cable car over the river to the O2 Arena, and from just around the corner from there you can hop on the Thames Clipper which will take you up the river.  Nicer views than the underground even though it is a longer journey (I think in total the journey took us about an hour from when we left the hotel until we got to London Bridge).  You are also able to use Oyster cards on both the Air Line and the Clipper, so very handy.All in all, I would recommend the hotel.  It is very nice, very handy and very inexpensive for a London based hotel.  Two thumbs up!

column9: Very good hotel, great location and excellent service
column10: Stayed here recently for 2 nights and it's a lovely hotel although have to confess I prefer the Holiday Inn downstairs (Superior Breakfast), both owned by the same people though so not to worry.... Check-in was efficient and friendly and the room was very nice with views over central London and the Olympic Park. Breakfast was very nice although not quite up to the HI below (hence we sweet talked the Holiday Inn and had Breakfast there the second morning). Great location and this would be my first choice whenever going to the O2 or surrounding areas.

Staybridge Suites London- Stratford City was recommended by my sons' university.  It was a perfect choice and location.  The services was fabulous! Everyone (Stephen, Georgiana, Natalija, and Amelia) was so helpful and courteous.  The room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  Very important features in a hotel.  The hotel is at the end of Stratford CIty Mall / Westfield Mall.  Throughout my week, I always felt good / safe returning at night by myself and was always greeted by the concierge. The breakfast was a complete meal and the Tuesday - Thursday evening 'wine and cheese' events were practically a meal as well.  The entire staff was friendly and made me feel 'right at home'.  Stephen gave wonderful suggestions for day excursions. Natalia helped me identify a church to attend.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

column9: Excellent hotel at a good price
column10: First of all, you can't beat the view of the olympics park looking out from the 12th floor of the hotel.  Second, the free breakfast is better than most Holiday Inn Express or Hampton Inn in the US.  It is nice that they vary the food and the mini chocolate croissant is excellent.  Third, the place is very conveniently located. The mall next to it has a varieties of restaurants depending on what you want to eat and how much you want to pay for.  The tube and the light rail is right there.  You can get into the center of London in about 15 minutes.  Last but no least, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  We contacted them before arriving into London for transportation and it was there at the time we agreed upon. The fee was pre-negotiated so there is no surprises.  It was pretty easy for to arrange for transport back to the airport also.  And if you want to be cheap, you can ride the tube.  There are quite a few stations with elevators so you don't have to lug your luggages up and down the stairs.  All and all, we will book this place again.  Oh yea, the free laundry is nice also if you are staying for a while.

I like to cover off what wasn't spot on after a very friendly and welcoming reception check in on the 12th floor.Shower door fitting fell off.  No bath.Wifi kept demanding name and room number.Desk chair is too low for work area.Noisy ticking clock (although this highlights effective soundproofing).Coffee on tap 24/7 in the breakfast area.Comfortable bed in a spacious room.Manager reception Tue-Thu 7pm to 8pm pleasant with free nibbles and drinks.  Saved buying a starter when I nipped out for food afterwards.  No restaurant in hotel but plenty nearby.  Microwaveable snacks available in reception and the room had hob and microwave as well as a big fridge with ice box.  Kettle, toaster and dishwasher too.Numerous tv channels in many languages.  No premium sport channels.  Wifi good for emails, but need to pay a premium for streaming.Breakfast 6.30am to 9.30am was a step up from a basic Holiday Inn Express offering, with sausages, beans, saut√©ed potatoes (luke warm) but not a traditional full English.  Good range of pastries, breads, yoghurt, fruits and cereals.  Doggie bag option if you wanted to grab and go.I wouldn't be quite as gushing as some.  But I do like this place.

I made a reservation on the IHG site and found out after that there was a 20% tax fee !!I was shocked because now suddenly the room became very expensive !Thanks to Guest Services Manager Georgiana i could cancel the rooms without charge !!  Great !Nice friendly staff and reception.Comfortable rooms and a good breakfast.Exceptional personal service there !Much better then the neighbours "Holiday Inn Express" where they make feel you are just a number !!Thanks to Georgiana and Julia and all the others.We will stay here again for long business stay !!

When my Son Nick told me he would be resident in a Hotel whilst working in London I told him I couldn't think of anything worse. I then went to visit him. Wow..What a great place, I would move in tomorrow. We were greeted by friendly efficient staff, we were then shown our spacious suite. fantastic everything you could want including discreet self catering facilities, Comfy beds, Great selection of channels on the two televisions, classy toiletries. I could go on, however I want to leave room for a mention to the staff, from reception to the staff at the restaurant ( top breakfast by the way) Staybridge have found exactly the right formula for a pleasant stress free stay, but it is the people there looking after you who make it a must stay again Hotel. Congratulations to the G.M. for surrounding himself and his guests with people who obviously love their jobs.#

I had been staying here for almost a Month. I felt like as home. Whenever I had a problem, the Staffs helped me immediately, everything was perfect. I will definitely stay there again if i come to London. Especially thanks to Ms Anelia, you are the best :)

Went here for last minute night in London. The hotel is so central you can have dinner out and not walk far or get dinner from a shop and make it in your room. There was free tea and coffee whenever we wanted it. The breakfast was GREAT! and the service was GREAT! I have told my work colleague and she had already booked it up as I totally recommend this hotel as it central and you have shops on your door step. The view from our room was amazing, we where looking out over the Olympic stadium and at breakfast we was looking out at the 02 arena. So overall my stay was GREAT!!!!

We had never used Staybridge Suites before, and were very pleasantly surprised by everything we found.  The room was lovely, with a great shower room, well equipped kitchen and very comfortable bed.  The public areas were very nice, with comfortable seating, great views, and tea / coffee available 24 hours.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  It's expensive, but parking in the Westfield shopping centre next door balanced that out a bit.

column9: Once Staybridge never something else....You Made us feel Special
column10: It,s not the first Time that we stayed at the Staybridge but this time i can,t but have to share my experience. My husband and I arrived very late nearly at 2 am and to our suprise we got such a warm welcome. Not only that we were the Guest of the day:-) While booking the room i mentioned that we are there for our anniversary and Georgiana Chifu the guest manager gave us a upgrade without asking for it and decorated our room so nicly with Baloons a hand written Card and a goody bag full of Fresh cookys, pringle,s Chocolate drinks and what not. This really touched us as we have been in many top class Hotels before but never got this kind of friendly treatment. We felt totally at home and every wish was fulfilled. Even our request for a late Check out... Keep it up and many many thanks to Georgiana and the Team for a amazing stay at Staybridge....Till Valentine,s Day;-) Norin&Azim

Having never stayed at a Staybridge Suites before I wasn't sure what to expect but was very impressed with the Hotel and the level of service from all staff members I met. It did quite feel that they have brought a bit of the American customer service to the UK with the free cookies and what not - this is a great thing! Check in was swift and easy and the same on checkout, I was given all of the information I required and fully enjoyed my stay.

This is a definitely a great place to stay - close to canary wharf, lots of shops close by, nice comfortable rooms etc. They say feel like at home and they really mean it! Thanks to Amelia and Georgina for all your help! I'm definitely coming back!

We stayed here for 1 night while visiting London the week before Christmas.  I was really surprised at how easy it was to find, as we drove I was a little concerned about driving in London, but as this hotel is over in Startford I had no problem driving.  Parking isn't bad, worked out for 24hrs parking ¬£13 - much cheaper than getting the train.  We parked the car at 9am, and then headed to the tube.  Spent most of the day doing the sights, and then did Winter Wonderland. A little shopping at Harvey Nics & Harrords and I was ready to head back to the hotel.  Check in was easy, good explanation of the "lounge" area, the shop and breakfast the following morning.  Good that you could help yourself to complimentary tea/coffee still/sparkling water. The room had everything we needed, tea/coffee facilities, oven, hob and a microwave.  They said that it was a home from a home, they weren't kidding.  Bed was comfy, good linen and comfy pillows.  Decent sized TV with Apple TV connected.  Good hot shower, and good selection of toiletries.    Everything you need for a few days is here.  Couldn't fault the room.  Breakfast the following morning was good, it was a help yourself buffet. Again no faults.  Very pleased, and I'd certainly book again.

I have stayed at this hotel several times since 2012 and it has been consistently excellent. The staff are always helpful and polite (although it irritates me that they use first names with guests  - think this is an ihg policy for this brand). A fabulous location 30 minutes from central London with a world class shopping mall at the hotel (Westfield) and excellent transport on the tube only 5 minutes away.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a home from home whilst in London. Nice touch also that you can use the holiday Inn facilities (gym etc) which is located in the same complex.

column9: Excellent choice with good transport links.
column10: Stayed here for a few nights as we were exhibiting at the Excel centre in Docklands, which is only a few minutes away by tube and DLR.Check-in was swift and very friendly, in fact this was something that was noticeable throughout our stay, all the staff without exception were very friendly and helpful.The room was of a reasonable size, very well appointed and as the hotel is new everything was in good shape including the bathroom / shower. Our room also had partial views over the Olympic Park.Breakfast was pretty good considering it was included in the rate, hot and cold dishes all of a reasonable quality.The hotel itself is part of the Westfield shopping complex so there are lots of retail therapy opportunities and a handful of restaurants (although none particularly great) literally outside the hotel. Staybridge also shares the foyer with the Holiday Inn with separate lifts going to the respective reception areas.It's in a great position for transport links to London City Airport (11 minutes on the DLR), Excel exhibition centre, and even central London is only about 15-20 minutes away. Also only a few minutes by DLR from the cable car across the Thames.My only negative was that the bed was a bit firm for me, but my wife thought it was great!All in all a good stay and we'd stay here again when we need a hotel in the area or are flying from London City Airport.

column9: Normal hotels don't give you all this
column10: First visit to this facility - more fool me. It was a complete revelation. Met by reception who greeted me like a relative - their mantra is "welcome home"Each 'suite' has a full kitchen with fridge, microwave and dishwasher so you can grab a snack while shopping in the local shops - Westfield Stratford, the largest retail site in Europe. The facilities include gym and free to guest laundry. Complementary breakfast is outstanding which would cost you at least ¬£10 in an ordinary hotel. The lounge area has tea and coffee on tap and there is even a small stick of things to buy if you get night munchies. Staff were excellent keen that things were just right but not over zealous.The company has several other sites in England - cause enough to go visiting then. Prices are not high for what you get - try them. Don't think you will be disappointed

The location and the suite were first class. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and the room immaculate. Never before have I visited the Staybridge Suite and I was suitably impressed. The reason for our visit was to visit our son and his girlfriend who live close by. The only downside to our visit is that we wanted to re-book a room for early March only to discover that the price had virtually doubled !

column9: Excellent Value for money in easy reach of the City
column10: I use Staybridge Suites whenever I need to overnight in London. It is comfortable and quiet.Its proximity to foodstores and kitchenette, meaning that I do not have to live on Hotel food, yippee.Apparently the above was 5 characters too short for you to get any benefit from it. Now its 195 characters plus 128 in protest.

column9: Christmas at home in Staybridge Suites
column10: This was an excellent hotel to spend our 12 days at.  We loved the rooms with a kitchen and large bathroom, the breakfast was excellent, and the tea and coffee being available 24/7 was such an added plus.  Free laundry is such a nice amenity also, just 1 pound for laundry soap is all.  The staff was so welcoming and helpful as well.  We spent Christmas Day at the hotel and enjoyed having Christmas dinner with the staff and other guests.  It was an memorable experience and delicious food.

column9: only place to live in London for me
column10: Only place i can live like home, best rooms, best staff, if you face any problems they are omre than happy to fix things quickly for you. the bestest part is westfield shopping mall right beneath your feet. shop tillu drop and then come back to you room for the DROP ;) you can even do your laundry for free :D what else would you want?

It was our first time to stay in this hotel, and it's a best decision to spend our family new year vacation in Staybridge. What been expected from 17hours trip was answered, the service and staff friendliness, made it feel like a home from home. The concierge and reception were excellent. When Christmas day, when almost everything "shutdown" in town, the staff were preparing to make our stay not boring. Thanks to all the staff to help our vacation remembered....YOU ARE ALL GREAT.........there are many HALAL Restaurants near the facility (KFC,Malaysia,Nando)......

column9: I really feel I ought not to say how good this place is
column10: The reason for the title of my review will become obvious but in a nutshell the more people that discover this place the less likely I am to be able to get a room. As a frequent traveller to London once I a place I like I tend to try and book again.I stayed for the first time at Staybridge Suites at Stratford last night and I think the idea is great and the execution is excellent. The idea of being able to stay in a place which is like having your own flat whilst being able to access the Westfield so close by and Central London just a short Underground Journey away is great.The staff who were so friendly and welcoming chatting about both my stay and my plans for the theatre that evening and I cannot speak highly enough about them and the Hotel.My room had a kitchenette area, sitting room, bedroom and bathroom which was great and with the shops so close for anyone who does not want to have to eat out it is perfectFinally the on tap free coffee and tea and the breakfast (included in the price) were excellentWhenever possible I will be using this hotel when I come down to London in future

We stayed at the hotel and found it very comfortable, with staff helpful and polite. Also available to speak in Italian.The room was clean, spacious and quiet, with the possibility of being able to cook inside.Easily connected to central London with two metro lines.Recommended.

After spending almost 14 months at the Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City, l returned at the end of 2015 to find the great welcome and service just gets better.This hotel provides both the leisure and business traveller-	 A great welcome by all staff no  matter what time you meet them. -	Great rooms, that are cleans to the best of standards. Each suite is superbly furnished with all that you need for either an overnight stay or extended stay. I stay for 3-4 nights per week and each week the staff do pay attention to preferences ensuring that each stay is a good as the previous. -	Good choice of breakfast and also great fitness room with a fantastic view from the 12th Floor -	Great location for travel in to London City ‚Äì only one stop from Liverpool Street and 15 minutes by DLR to London City AirportIt is a pleasure staying at the Staybridge each week and although a great hotel and great location, the unique feature of this hotel is the service and staff friendliness, which does make it feel like a home from home

What a fantastic place to stay! The largest Westfield in the European Union literally down the stairs - fantastic shopping! The tube is less than a 5min walk & you can be in central London in 20mins! The apartments are lovely and spacious, great kitchenette facility so didn't have to eat out every night if you didn't want too! But most importantly the people that work here are so lovely & helpful! I would definitely stay here again & recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay near to London!

Very nice place to stay...the adjacent Mall is a hop skip and jump away with great shops and a wonderful food court on each level.  This was so convenient for us...a place to walk/shop and eat out of the cold.There is a casino next door too.Don't miss checking out the restaurant in Marks and Spencers' for some good eating too.The challenge is finding the entrance of the hotel...our cabbie didn't know this part of London and finally parked in Parking lot B by the elevators.  This is the best place to park if you are driving.  We went up and the hotel was a few steps away.  The concierge immediately came down for the luggage.  We were later told that we could have got dropped off on Westfield Plaza Lane but getting our luggage to the hotel would have been a challenge for 2 seniors as that is at least a hundred yards away from the hotel entrance.Apart from that, everything about SS is delightful.Good breakfast and free snacks and drinks once or twice a week at night.  Convenient kitchenette in room.

This was my first stay and was not disappointed.Checking in was fast and efficient (same goes with checking out)I had a one bedroom apartment - spacious, clean, modern deco. Perfect.There's a well equipped kitchenette but with the great breakfast spread, there wasn't an opportunity to use the kitchen!Located right next to the mall is great as it's really convenient to get whatever you need.Access to public transport is really good - literally a 3 mins walk (longer if you are distracted by the shops!)Other plus bits : launderette (and a small gym next to it) The lounge (with complimentary tea and coffee) - feel almost like an executive club floor.Minus bits: I hope management will consider a sofa bed for a third adult.There is no direct car access to the entrance of the hotel so be prepared to ring the concierge for help with your luggage if you are arriving by car/taxi.Will definitely return.

I cannot fault my Staybridge stop overs around the country.  The staff are always very professional and exceptional at customer service.This particular hotel is right in the heart of the Westfield shopping centre. Excellent location. The reception girls were as wonderful as ever.

The welcome we received on arrival was first class - asked us about our travel to the hotel, what we were planning and answered our specific questions. They also asked about any specific need we had and were very quick to discuss options etc., In particular can I mention Amelia - excellent customer care. The Staybridge Suite was in the middle of The Stratford Shopping centre with tube and rail connections literally at the end of the street. The rooms were very well equipped and the breakfast was absolutely fantastic. This is the second time we have used a Staybridge Suite and we will definitely use Staybridge again.

My husband and I went to view the fireworks display in central London. We needed a base for the night. The staybridge suites gave us everything we needed. The room was a great size, comfortable, great shower and great amenities in the communal area on the reception floor. We had a fab time watching the fireworks and it was lovely to come back to a warm, comfy room and bed! We will defiantly be using the staybridge suites again.

I visited Staybridge Suites and stayed  for 5 night's. The hotel is exactly as represented on the site. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms decorated and accessorised well. I had a lovely stay and an enjoyable sleep every night, highly recommended.

Stayed here for 2 nights in December thanks to my lovely partner for the surprise. Location is brilliant as it is based right next to the Westfield shopping centre and tube. Rooms are a great size, and very modern. Reception is on the top floor which was a change to the usual downstairs reception, staff were very polite and smart. Enjoyed the free complimentary breakfast which is also located on the 12 floor. I don't have any negative feedback about the suites just wish there was a car park for the hotel instead of parking in the shopping centre car park. Would very happily stay here again.

The Staybridge Suite we stayed in was fabulous; all the amenities of home were available for us if we needed them. The views from our suite was lovely especially at night. Staff in restaurant were hospitable and friendly and the food was delicious. We are big fans of Holiday Inn and use their hotels throughout our travels and will now add Staybridge Suites to our favourites. We will return again in the near future.

This "hotel" is perfect for long-term stays!The staff is nice and welcoming. The whole atmosphere is very nice and warm. The hotel is tidy and service staff is very friendly.Breakfast is typical British with Beanz, ham, hash browns, mushrooms, cereals, bagels etc. Enough for not starting hungry into your day!Water and coffee complimentary 24hours a day. And the coffee is really good. You can take a cuppa and take place in the living room atmosphere up there to meet colleagues, friends or guest from all over the world.A very great place to stay. It's like a huge communal living with someone making you breakfast, cleaning your room and having your own very private and quiet place when needed. I absolutely recommend it for as well as for business stays.You even have washing machines and dryers for free. Bring your own washing powder or buy some at the reception for a few bucks.Thanks to the Staybridge staff for making everything perfect around here,

column9: Comfortable and excellent for Westfield shopping
