column10: Our 4th stay here for the boxing day sales.We stayed in room 825 which is a one bedroom suite and has a separate lounge. There is a sofa bed in the lounge for an extra guest.Fully fitted kitchenette includes a fridge and microwave and dishwasher.Reception is on the 12th floor and there is free tea and fresh coffee 24 hour a day. Breakfast is also served here and don't forget you can take the tray in your room to breakfast and fill it up and bring it back to your room to have breakfast in your room.Staff are polite and helpful and always enjoy coming back here.There used to be good views of the Olympic Park before but with all the new buildings being constructed its not so impressive now.Rooms are more comfortable than the adjacent Holiday Inn in my opinion.

Located just outside the Sratford tube station which can be reached by the Central or the Jubilee lines, the hotel could be located with ease on a first trip to London. Rooms were perfect with all amenities as mentioned in the website. Breakfast is good. Hotel staff was very friendly and co-operative.

Stayed here before shortly after it was originally opened, stayed here for an event at the O2. Great location, not far from tube and excellent hotel. Staff couldn't do more for you and the breakfast is one of the best 'free' breakfasts I've had at a hotel. Best part of this hotel is the kitchenette in all rooms, we had to save time before going out so cooking our own food was helpful! Well worth staying here

I have stayed in the Holiday Inn before situated at the same complex, so I knew where the location was. It is just 5 minutes walk from the underground, and you need to ask somebody for the direction of the hotel or the Nike store, if you have problems. It is located 50 meters after the Nike store on your left side. I didn't need the kitchen facilities, but it was nice to a have a proper refrigerator and not a mini-bar to store your drinks. The wifi in the room worked very well, and they have a guest PC on the reception floor. The breakfast was varied including nice sliced fruit salad, Tropicana juice in a large refrigerator, standard English breakfast dishes and hot porridge on weekdays ! I would certainly recommend this hotel to everybody, and I will stay here next time I am going for a concert to O2 arena. It is only four stops on the Jubilee line to the O2 station, North Greenwich, so can be at the arena in less than 20-25 minutes.I will be back in 2016 !

Awesome team, lovely atmosphere, clean rooms, good breakfast and amazing drinks nights !! This is my second trip would be coming back again for sure. Definately recommend it for shoppers or people just want to stay in 'home' away from home.

The staff in this hotel are the nicest group of people! Yet to meet one member of the team that doesn't greet me with a smile, its honestly infectious! The rooms are of impeccable standard and come with the best soundproofing. I have stayed many times and not once woken up until my alarm. Also the other guests - everyone in the hotel seems very happy and friendly, I expect from the excellent service. The lounge has very pleasant atmosphere to socialise or work, even a comfy "den" watch the footy.I have stayed here may times and never fails to impress. Just remember to get down to the lounge for the managers social 7-8 on week nights for free drinks and nibbles!Best hotel I have ever stayed in, couldn't recommend highly enough.

We were staying here as my husband had a race at the Olympic village the next day. The staff could not have done more, and seemed genuinely interested in making sure were having a good time. Location is excellent for Westfield and for the OV. You can cook in your room, we decided to eat out as were only there for one night, but it makes such a a difference knowing you can cook, make tea, drink wine in your room. You can eat breakfast in the lounge, or bring it up to your room, again - nice to have the choice. Will definitely stay here again.

Really convenient overnighter, right in the Westfield Shopping Complex and a stones throw from the Olympic Park. We stayed here for a night at the Casino which was brilliant as we walked there in less than 2 mins. Parking cost just ¬£9.50 overnight - a steal for London. The staff were super helpful especially Greg and Guilia - they also have a super stock of snacks and drinks at very reasonable prices available 24/7. Breakfast was good, I took the tray from the apartment and we had ours in the room. Highly recommend.

This place is worth every penny spent and more so.   The staff are courteous and friendly, the room has everything one could wish for with a kitchenette complete with dishwasher.   The breakfast buffet is a 7 on a scale of 1-10.   There is a free on site laundry.   The adjacent Westside Mall is icing on the cake!Our only  problem was the cabbie couldn't find the right entrance.   It seems one parks on Westfield Lane and walks up some steps about fifty yards to an entrance on the right.  According to the hotel, a good drop off/ pick up point is the Cow Pub on Westfield lane.  Best Self parking is on B level and then the elevators take you to the hotel entrance after a short walk through the Mall.   Do get instructions from the hotel.  Convenient to the Tube.   Toiletries plenty but liquid soap was too perfumed for us.Pleasant lounge area for reading/getting some work done.

I have been to this hotel 3 times this year and every time the staff have been very friendly, approachable and helpful. No question or request was too difficult. Very clean and modern bathrooms. The breakfast buffet has lots of variety. The after work drinks and snacks are a great opportunity to wind down after a day in the office. The gym and laundry facilities are perfect for longer stays. There are supermarkets, restaurants and pubs very close by in the Westfield shopping centre.

My only regret with this hotel stay was.... We weren't there long enough! A single night as a stop over saw us leaving at 4am thereby missing out on breakfast.However we enjoyed the comfort of the room and all its little extras. Would definitely come and stay again the staff are so lovely even giving us a little breakfast bag to take with us on our onward journey. Not a cheap stay but worth every penny!

This my fifth time stay in stay bridge hotel and i want thank Mr dan He was really friendly and helpful the hotel is really ecxellent location beside the underground and Westfield the reciption team were nice  again thanks DAN hope to see you again in the hotel

Really convenient location excellent friendly staff nice very clean and comfortable room , very quirky check in you go up to then go bs j down to your room ! Breakfast was okay but not special however I I Will definitely go back

I just finished a 7 month stay here for work. The room is lovely and really felt like home. The staff are super super friendly and I got to know a few of them really well. The breakfast choice is great, the rooms are quiet and the shower is powerful. Comfy bed and an Apple TV. Couldn't ask for more.

We stayed here recently for a couple of nights and were very happy.Room was great with a lovely bathroom but what really stood out was the great level of service. really friendly and helpful, especially Gregorio and Giulia.

We recently stayed here for a couple of weeks with a big group of colleagues. All the staff were lovely and the rooms were just what we needed and very clean. The breakfasts were perfect with everything you could want and it was nice with the lounge area and hot drinks available all day. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. It also helped with the washing machines and dryers available 24hrs a day and the wifi was pretty quick. Thanks

The reception staff were superb. Very friendly and full of enthusiasm for the hotel. The suite was great. Kitchen area and living room. Separate bedroom and bathroom. Equipment in kitchen was almost as good as at home (I didn't use it but I did look at what was there). Only downside was that there isn't a bar or restaurant in the hotel. Worry not. The Holiday Inn (same group and same building) does have a good bar and restaurant. Location cannot be beaten. 10m from shopping centre. 20m from London's biggest casino. 500m from Olympic Stadium (soon to be West Ham's home ground). Only 6mins on train to centre of London.

column9: A great place to stay whilst away for work.
column10: I've been staying at this hotel almost every week (Monday to Friday) since the beginning of January 2015 and I have to say that I really enjoy it.  The hotel is excellent as are the staff, the views and the facilities all around.  The hotel is right in the center of the Westfield shopping centre so access to shops, bars, restaurants, and travel links are all only a few minutes away.  Rooms on the Olympic park side of the hotel have wonderful views over London although if you like to have your window open the noise from the nearby railway lines can cause a little disturbance at night.  Rooms on the other side of the hotel are equally nice however, the views aren't as good and the noise from the roof mounted Westfield air conditioning plants can be intrusive if you leave your window open.  If you keep your window closed the exterior noise level on both sides of the hotel is negligible.  Staybridge Suites doesn't have a traditional bar but does have a small gym.  You can purchase various food and drink items from reception.  It's in the same building as Holiday Inn, residents in Staybridge are free to use the bar and gym facilities in Holiday Inn.  Each room has its own little kitchen which is well equipped and for those on longer stays is great as you don't feel compelled to eat out every night.  Breakfast is free and offers a good selection of hot and cold items.  Free laundry facilities are also available.  Every week the hotel has 3 management social evenings where free drinks (including alcohol) and nibbles are available.  This is a great opportunity to meet some of the staff socially.  I've really enjoyed my year in this hotel and can certainly recommend it.

column9: A true home away from home... what an amazing place.
column10: I have been staying in Staybridge for the past 8 months and cannot sing its praises enough.The staff are fantastic - warm, friendly and personable. They really take the time to get to know you throughout your stay, especially during the Tue-Thur managers social evenings. Any requests I made about my room were sorted within 24 hours, usually sooner. Including:-fitting a shorter shower curtain-fixing my air conditioning-giving me a second bin-fixing the ethernet port in the wall-cleaning my room on a weekend(you could consider me a difficult guest but I'd say I just feel comfortable enough to ask!!)The team here go out of their way on a daily basis for guests and this shows in their fantastic TripAdvisor score.The rooms are spacious, clean, modern, homely and warm. The bathrooms are immaculate and the showers are strong and hot. The amenities provided are great and the linen is fresh white. The in-room AC is great and works very well - allowing you to set your room to 18c-24c. The kitchen facility is great - hob, microwave, fridge, freezer, sink, cupboards, cutlery, toaster, kettle.The beds are huge and so comfortable, I have not had a bad nights sleep once since arriving. The pillows are great. The TV, with included Apple TV and freeview, is great. The internet is fast (and free). The lamps give the room ambience. The view out of the window is jaw dropping. Housekeeping are efficient, my room looks brand new everyday.The breakfast is good, and again very homely. There is a selection of hot food everyday as well as cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, continental meats, juices, etc. There is 24/7 fresh tea and coffee, and pastries. There is a pantry where you can buy snacks and sweets. Room service is great.The laundry facility is superb. The washing machines and driers are modern and cleaned regularly. They are free to use, of course. The gym is great, and has a spectacular view of London City. The hotel lounge is comfortable and homely.The managers social, Tue, Wed, Thur, 7-8pm, has a great buzz and is something to do if you're here for a long time or alone on business. Almost weekly there is a hot food night where a selection of hot snacks are available and sometimes even full meals. Everyday there is cold snacks, crackers, biscuits, olives, crisps, nachos etc. and wine, beer, soft drinks etc. It's all free!I cannot begin to describe how much I will miss staying here and seeing the team daily - thank you so much Team Staybridge for your wonderful hospitality and for looking after me so well, I will certainly stay here every time I am in London in the future.

Arrive to a friendly greeting from the staff, relax in comfortable surroundings with other guests or chill out in your room/apartment.The staybridge team make a real effort to provide you with a real "home from home"The location at Stratford has superb connectivity making getting around the city for business or holiday simple and convenient.

I was there for 3 nights and it was a great stay. The views from the lounge on the 12 the floor are really nice. The breakfast was good with many choices. The bed is very comfortable, however to get a quiet nights sleep I pulled the key card out as I wanted to turn off the ventilation system, maybe there was another way but this was ok for me. I was staying on the 11th floor which also had very picturesque views of the Olympic stadium. The hotel is in a great location and I would probably stay there again in the future. The staff are very friendly as well hence my 5 star review

I cannot fault this hotel. I have stayed here both on a short term and longer term stay (3 months) for work. Excellent facilities, friendly welcoming genuine staff who cannot do enough for you. I will definitely be back when I am working locally again.

Very conveniently located, right outside the Westfield mall in Startford. Easy to reach central London through tube or the docklands through DLR. Very convenient to have a shopping centre nearby for a quick meal.Staff was very nice and accommodating. Very convenient luggage store before check-in or after check-out. Free tea/coffee and still/sparkling water in lobby. They also provide a pantry in the lobby, where one can buy food throughout the night if need arises.Room (I chose the Deluxe Suite) was large and well-equipped, including a fully functional kitchen with utensils, fridge and oven. Views were towards the city, and very nice. Bed was excellent, and I slept really well. The bathroom was somewhat on the small side, though, and could have provided a bit more space, especially around the sink. Shower was very nice, though, but the shower door didn't close quite properly, but this was really quite a minor annoyance.Breakfast was tasty and varied, with relatively long serving times. WiFi was very good and required only 1 log-in per 24h.All in all, this was a very good choice for visiting the Excel (Comic-Con), and could be  a good choice for central London as well (though try to avoid Stratford station at rush hour...)

column9: Great location and the nicest staff!
column10: Don't forget to taste the machiato available 24/7 and be pontual at 7 p.m. for free drinks in social happy hour (tuesday to thursday). Hotel stays literaly in the midlle of everthing. Very good location. The nicest staff that welcome you so well. Stephen and Georgiana thank you!

column9: Be careful with pre-authorization holds on your card
column10: A great week with the family was ruined on returning home to find that though I had paid for the full week's stay on the first night, Staybridge Suites went ahead to deduct the pre-authorization hold amount. Meaning they had taken the sum of 8nights for a 7night stay.I wrote several emails to the hotel, sent proof of my bank statement but the operations manager, Nicholas Dubas, still insists that they did not take the sum and would not be refunding the money. Even after my bank responded that the sum was paid to the Staybridge.The stay was pleasant but if I cannot trust my card details and the word of a representative of a supposedly reputable hotel chain, then no matter how pleasant the facilities, it is not worth it.DO NOT ALLOW ANY PRE-AUTHORIZATIONS ON YOUR CARD, you just might be surprised after you return home. And a frustrating long-distance discussion commences.I am now having to dispute the claim via my bank and I would have to cancel my card as I cannot be sure what other surprises may crop up.

We had a great  welcoming from  Georgiana CHIFU.  With a professional way  she  guide  us to  rich  our destinations. is  been  a  nice stay, the room  had a beautiful  view, quiet and  very  clean.  We  will  be  back  again!

Stayed for one night, what can I say.... The hotel is brilliant. The accommodation is clean, the room is of a generous size, the shower was lovely a big, nothing too much trouble. Free coffee all day from the restaurant. Breakfast was first class. Can't wait to go again in December with my daughter.

column9: Leisure & Shopping at Chestnut Plaza, Stratford, London
column10: This was my second stay and my first was in February this year. I came back because the services and standard are good. The Front Office/Guest Service Manager, Georgiana and the FD staff, Gregg are quite helpful. They helped sort out my reservation problems directly with the IHG Central Reservation Department promptly because the latter did not communicate with the former correctly for my free night issue. Certainly, the room is spacious and good in-room facilities such kitchenware etc. The room is clean and tidy. The hot breakfast served is good and you will not complain for the breakfast items. No doubt, the location is good and convenient for shoppers but you better drive to the hotel because it is situated on the parking area. However, I do not see there are any problems to drive there. Overall, I feel quite and happy and satisfied with everything. By all means, I will definitely come back and stay at this hotel.

Stayed here for 8 weeks- comments belowWhat was good:- The rooms are great - we had a 1 bed apartment so the living room was separate from the bedroom. The room was always cleaned to a high standard. There is a kitchenette with dishwasher - Location - next to Westfield so you can easily go out for dinner or grab something from the Food Court and bring it back to eat in your room- The staff - all staff (receptionist/ concierge / breakfast team) polite and friendly. there is a 24/7 staffed reception- There is a large lounge - if you are here for work you can take you laptop into the lounge next to reception and enjoy the view whist working rather than being in your room -Air-con (hot and cold) always worked well - just give it 20mins to get to the right temperature-Quiet - unlike the holiday inn on the 3rd floor the Staybridge Suites has a quieter feel Tips- there is a Apple TV in the room but you need to pay for it. I suggest bringing a HDMI cable and plug your laptop into the back of the TV- if you can afford it try and get a 1-bed apartment rather than normal suite - There are no free weights or running machines in the Staybridge Gym. However you are able to use the Holiday Inn gym on the 3rd floor which has free weights up to 20kg dumbbells and 3 running machines. There is a static bench press up to 93.5KG in each gym. - Order Nandos 20mins in advance online. This means you do not have to wait when collecting from the Food Court- Internet is free but pretty average - don't expect anything above 10mbps - If you want a view ask for one as not all the rooms look out over the Olympic Park

I stayed here on 31st October for one night as a treat for my lovely girlfriend. First thing I'd like to mention is a big thanks to the gentleman I spoke to at reception on the phone (didn't catch his name) and Georgiana, also on reception, for ensuring my special request of a bunch of pink lillies was met - my girlfriend loved the surprise when she entered the room first!The room itself was perfect. The view we had was unexpected in the sense that I did not think we would have such a nice view of the Olympic area (stadium, the 'Orbit' etc.). I did not know the 'Orbit' lit up at night, that was a nice surprise!It was also good to have our own cooking utensils if we wanted to use them, though we only used the cutlery and microwave. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was very spacious.The breakfast this morning was lovely, as well. The cooked food was hot and there was a lot of food to choose from with a decent selection of teas as well. It's a shame there was no hot chocolate (that I could see), but a wide range of juices made up for that anyway.The service that we experienced was high standard and all staff seemed very friendly. The hotel itself was also very peaceful.The price of the hotel was very reasonable, especially considering the location, and we would not hesitate to visit again. As an added bonus for any shopaholics out there, the hotel is literally on the doorstep of the third largest shopping centre in the UK - now that's convenient!Loved the hotel, loved the stay, and I would recommend to anyone... thank you very much, Staybridge Suites!

column9: Very good location at a reasonable price
column10: My wife and I stayed here for three days and found the 'extended' hotel facilities to be very good including the 'free' breakfast.  The views over the olympic park from the breakfast area are excellent and the wifi is very fast.  The hotel was very 'quiet' and spacious which suited us and there are free newspapers every day.  Rooms are also spacious and come equipped with microwave, sink, kettle and dishwasher and there is a Waitrose and a M and S foodstore in close proximity in the Westfield centre should you want to do your own catering  The room was very clean and staff very helpful.

Had 2 nights over last weekend with my partner, the room is ok, rather smaller than I anticipated , also thought I'd upgraded to have a small separate living room, bathroom smelt of sewage. A couple of minor things, the pillows are awful and the breakfast was average for the price charged and no sausages ...

column9: Very nice suites good location for Excell
column10: very nice and roomy suites. same building as the Holiday inn. all is new and within the big and impressive mall. close to the olympic park, the Excell exhibition park and the O2. further away from city center. all resturants in the area close by 2300. if you want to eat later you face a problem. room service is limited and also ask for additional service charge that make it expensive. This is the only down think I found in this very good hotel

I was attending an event at the Olympic park which didn't finish until late in the evening, so this proved to be the perfect hotel for my trip. Even without needing to take that in to consideration, i'd highly recommend the hotel to anyone. It was very smart, spotlessly clean and a great place to stay. The staff were always polite and helpful and helped make it an enjoyable stay.The room was excellent, a good size and with everything you might need. I had a great view over the Olympic park, the city & millennium dome. Early next year i'll need to be in the same area for over a week, and this would make a perfect base for me. I'll look forward to returning.

Booked by chance, and in the last minute - hence I did not have big expectations. To my surprise, a very nice hotel, modern and well equipped rooms, nice and friendly personnel (special Thanks to Georgiana).

Room is very good  employee is very good  Services is the best a The area is very good and the  underground is very near to the hotel Are you  recommend it that hotel I think my next visit I will come that again

This is an excellent place to stay in London.  The rooms are really well equipped with all the small kitchen services and equipment you could need.  The staff are excellent and they even hold welcome get togethers with wine and nibbles so you can meet the staff and your fellow guest.  Brilliant idea ! Very handy for shopping at Stratford and the tube to anywhere else in London. Great views over the Olympic Park if you stay in an even numbered room.  Excellent stay, and I will go back.

The location within the Westfield Stratford City is perfect for access to restaurants, shopping (including groceries), and transportation links into London.The staff were warm and hospitable from the start: compliments to Nicholas, Gregorio, Arminta, Emily and Giulia.

My first stay at a Staybridge Suites, while I have been staying at IHG facilities for years. From the first interaction with the staff through the 4 days, I can say nothing short of a great thank you. While I had great interaction the Gregorio and Amelia, they were examples of all the staff. Concierge personnel were friendly and very responsive. One had the feeling that all staff were genuinely interested in your stay and well being. As mentioned in other reviews, food was good and plentiful at breakfast as well as at the one evening social I attended. While travel to this part of London is not normal for me I would certainly stay there if the opportunity arose. Excellent location and not too far from the Excel Centre for those going to an exhibition show. D Gregory

Overall good, new, clean hotel with suite rooms. Breakfast was typical English breakfast with limited selection. A bit remote from the center - need train or tube ride of about 30 minutes to reach the city.It is located next to the Westfield shopping mall - a huge mall with all the usual brands.

column9: Best hotel location and excellent service
column10: Staying at this hotel was a very nice experience.First, the location is great. You are in the heart of the Westfield Center and surrounded by cute restaurants and many other things.The service was really good.Staff is very friendly and welcoming.I surely recommend it!

column9: Amazing Experience - Comfort, Professional, Friendly & Supportive
column10: I am staying in this Hotel from Mid July 2015 and till date my experience amazing.  Location: This is one the best location in London where you would like to stay.Staff/management: Staff and Management is very courteous and professional and at the same time very friendly.Service: It is been 3 months and I have no complaints till yet.In addition to that social is the event which you will never want to miss specially when you are tired and want to relax. You can interact with people and Management at the same time.Animesh

This was our second visit to this hotel, our first was in the hotel itself and this visit was staying in the Staybridge suites. Both were excellent rooms, to a very high standard. The Staybridge suite was our first time of staying in one of these, but certainly not the last. Having the kitchen area complete with dishwasher, fridge, freezer etc is a real bonus. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the middle of the Westfield shopping centre, a very large complex that we still have not managed to get all around after two visits. Transport links are second to none anywhere in London, with three tube lines all servicing Stratford, as well as main lines trains and a bus station. We actually took the car on this occasion and the parking in Section B is a very very short walk to the hotel, less than 100m. We saw a show on Saturday afternoon in theatre land, then came back to the hotel and had a lovely meal rather than trying to find a restaurant in theatre land that had any seats available. After that we walked across the mall to the Vue cinema and took in the late night offering of the Legend. The breakfast has to be as good as anywhere, all on a very relaxed, self catering basis, with pretty much something for everyone. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, which is pretty much what every reviewer has stated.

column9: A home away from home! Exceptional service!!
column10: I had to travel to London for family heath reasons and needed to find a comfortable hotel quickly and easily for over 3 weeks. The staff couldn't do enough to help me. From the staff down in the lobby to the housekeeping, breakfast and staff at reception - a huge thanks to all of you for making me feel part of your family. My husband visited for one week for his birthday and the staff decorated our room with balloons,cards and a bottle of wine - WOW! When my daughter joined us the hotel staff found us a suite with a sofa bed even though it was very last minute and they were booked solid. There were so many things I loved about the hotel - there were trays in the rooms and we were allowed to go to breakfast each morning (which was delicious) and take some food back to the room - I've never been to a hotel that has allowed guests to do that! Also 3 nights of the week - the hotel supplied free drinks and nibbles which meant that we could buy something small to supplement it and make it our dinner - a double WOW!There was 24 hour coffee (cappuccinos) and herbal teas;  a whole floor of comfortable couches, tables, chairs, fire place, TV's, books etc to relax and bring friends and family to; a guest laundry; a guest gym; the room had a small kitchen; the hotel was perfectly located 3 minutes away from the train station, 1 minute from the busses and Olympic swimming pool and right in the heart of Westfield shopping complex - so we had everything on our doorstep in terms of food supplies and eating out. As a single person I felt safe walking to and from the hotel at night. I don't think I've ever experienced such exceptional service anywhere in the world. I will definitely be back there when I'm next in London. Truly a home away from home!!!

column9: Spacious, comfortable, clean and friendly suite hotel in London!
column10: In my opinion, this is about the friendliest hotel in London. Well located right by  the westfield shopping mall and Olympics stadium in Stratford. This was ideal for shopping and rugby events at the stadium. From the front desk staff to room service everyone was eager to please. The services manager Nick is a great guy and was always ready to answer my questions and attend to me with a smile. I was amazed at the quality of services at this all suite hotel. It was like being at home! Rooms were quiet, super clean,lovely furnishing , complete amenities to make your own meals and a nice work desk. The daily  breakfast buffet had a good selection everyday of my stay. The city views from my suite on the 8th floor and the breakfast room on the 12th floor was amazing.  I have found my new home hotel in London.

column9: Very smart, well appointed quality hotel
column10: This hotel is located on the upper floors of the Holiday Inn at Stratford mall.  The location is ideal if the City or east side of London is where you need to be.  The rooms are spacious with small kitchens but all the facilities you need (inc. dishwasher!).  The breakfast is superb, help yourself buffet with a wide selection of food.I will definitely stay here again, my only comment was the wifi was fairly slow on the 9th floor.

I have visited this hotel twice for a 6- 8 week stay in past 1 year. The greatest point about this hotel is ease of commuting and access to lot of things like mall next door, Olympic park across the road, casino adjacent to it, tube station with connection to all lines including national rail. Minutes away from central London this was my fav activity each morning to hop on to tube and get back to hotel by sunset. They have this concept of special social evenings for guests to unwind and relax with light snacks and drinks served on the floor at reception area.They do take request for room delivery and personally deliver your courier with utmost care at your room . I really was impressed by the way they helped me surprise my hubby with anniversary courier delivery at his room. Same was my experience during my next stay to deliver bday cake for my 3 yr old. Thanks to le conceirges and reception staff for your personal attention towards little needs of ur guests.Breakfast sever is typical English spread with more or less routine stuff. This is good for short stays but becomes little mundane and discouraging for longer duration staysüòä.There is a small kitchenette with all basic cooking equipments handy in the studio set up. It also has a small dining cum living space with a bedroom n attached bath. Good for couples to stay comfortably. Laundry service available with end of day delivery with proper packing. There is also an option of self service with washing machines and driers at reception floor. Detergent bars available at reception as well. Gym available adjacent to laundry room. Use it at ur convenience üëçüèª.

Had a great stay here. The staff were friendly and they went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Room was a nice suprise. There was lots to see within walking distance. I ate in the hotel one of the nights and the food was of a high standard

I left my phone charger in my room and when I went back to retrieve it, I was told the room service people had my passport, as well! Wow. The person who physically cleaned the room went through the drawers and discovered my passport. Her name, I was told, was Ionela. In general, the rooms were clean and the service people were terrific. The onsite restaurant (on the top floor) had a wide variety of very good foods. Thank you, Staybridge Suites!

I had a difficulty with my booking and I have to highly commend the manager Nicolas for the professional Method in which he handled my concern. In addition the reception staff were also highly considerate. I am looking forward to a visit to London and I will definitely be placing these suites at the to of my list of places to stay.

column9: Home from Home thanks to Great Team, Service and hotel
column10: Stayed at this fantastic hotel with the best team around for nearly over a year that is became my home from home. It is ideally located to get around and enjoy the delights of London, offers amazing service (the team could not do anymore if they tried) and with that great facilities. I loved that it was like a mini apartment in a hotel so you had those little extra elements such as a kitchen that other hotels can not offer. Enjoy the social nights, they are great fun especially when you sit down and get to know all the team that look after you and make your stay extra special.

We were here for the Rugby World Cup, it was so close to Olympic park, the Westfield shopping centre is enormous, so if you love to shop, your in the right place, room was quite spacious, clean and the staff very helpful, only downside was the inadequate gym, they really need to upgrade the equipment, great food places in and around the centre.

We arrived  at reception by Amelia who was must welcoming and helpful. Just like all the stuff may I add. The room was spotless and the facilities were more than I could of hoped for. It was very relaxing in the lounge areas.

I would definitely recommend this accommodation to anyone . Staff so friendly . Everything extremely clean and offers all anyone would ever want was like from home to home . Have rebooked here already for another weekend .

Was reluctant to book a "Staybridge Suite" but was overruled by my girlfriend - had intended to book al luxury hotel but am really pleased with her choice which was primarily due to cost which didn't concern me whatsoever.I am delighted to have been proven wrong (yet again) by her as the room was, as mentioned by other reviewers, just like a small apartment with everything you needed. Lots of space, a television each (one in seating area and one in the bedroom). Super location for visiting any part of London - nice car park with safe parking and simple access to the suites. Staff extremely welcoming - breakfast very good although on the Sunday morning it was extremely busy with food running out quite quickly. Am already planning my next trip to London and this place will be first on my list.Many thanksJohn F HowardNorwich

This hotel is a great location in the greater London area. 5 minutes walk from a major tube station and right above a multitude of quality restaurants and shopping. The breakfast every morning was delicious in a well maintained dining area. Each interaction with the staff was very polite and professional.

I've stayed at the this property for about 100+ days in past 4-5 months. I plan to come back here again very soon. The positives:1- The location is very convenient to visit Liverpool Street from here. Multiple modes of transport -Tube. TfL, overground, Bus etc.2- Stay is really courteous, warm and helpful.3- Rooms are decent with all the equipment one may need for a month long stay4- It's in the Westfield Mall area so lot of options to shop and eat 5- Olympic park is 5 min walk - lots of open spaces to jog etc.6- There is a small fitness center and a laundry room7- Breakfast has good options and evening specials every Tues-ThurCouple of things that need improvement-1- Sofa in the living room is not at all comfortable. It's lousy.They need to think about better design & product2- Carpets in some rooms needs replacementThey have gor everything else just spot on!

column9: Good central base for Olympic Park with a touch of luxury and nice facilites
column10: Stayed in a deluxe suite on Floor 12. Lovely big room with spacious bathroom with a huge shower and well-equipped kitchenette. Great welcome from friendly staff especially Amelia- muchas gracias!Excellent hot breakfast too and tea and coffee available all day. Lovely view from 12th floor balcony and comfortable lounge areas make this feel nicer and not the usual hotel accommodation.

We stayed for a couple of nights primarily owing to its location and where we needed to be throughout most of the weekend.On this occasion I needed to drive and park the car up for the weekend.  The hotel sits above the shopping centre and Car park B (postcode E20 1EJ), which is closest, has 24hr parking.  This is ¬£9 per day which for London is good value.  Nice and easy access from the car park to the hotel also.We weren't really expecting much as we were just using it as a crash pad for the weekend.  However the rooms are actually fully equipped mini-apartments, which are clean, spacious and have everything you might need for a short stay, including your own kitchenette.  There's also a decent bathroom with good sized shower.Our last stay in London was a poor one, despite selecting a supposed 5 star hotel and despite having membership of that particular chain of hotels.  We are also members of the IHG group, which the Stalybridge Suites is part of and this was a much better experience all round.Staff in particular were more attentive, friendly and helpful and our stay was far more enjoyable and comfortable.I was a little concerned that we might be disturbed by being just above the shopping centre but the insulation must be excellent because we didn't hear anything, despite there being some overnight maintenance being carried out below.It is also very well placed for access with several tube lines, TfL rail and bus station all situated within a few minutes walk.This is definitely one of the better experiences we've had of stays in London and there's no doubt we will be staying here again.

1- excellent location (above Westfield Mall-Stratford City)2- Waitrose Supermarket is just below the hotel.3- Cinema is within the Mall.4- Variety of restraunts are in the Mall.5- Stratford Main Train/Underground Station is within the Mall vicinity.6- GYM open 24/77- Free Laundry Room 24/78- Free breakfast.9- Very friendly and helpful staff.Rooms are very comfortable & soacious compared to London standards.

column9: Modern hotel 30 minutes from Oxford Street.
column10: The location is in the Westfield shopping centre with all that it has to offer, however if you are looking for a hotel to enjoy London and theatre land then perhaps it is too far out. It is only 5-6 minutes from the tube but a further 25 minutes into the centre. The hotel is new but the room was somewhat smaller than I would have hoped. It is a normal sized room with a small kitchen in the hallway. Nice bathroom and shower. If you want your room serviced at the weekend though, then you have to request it. The staff are friendly and helpful, but there are few of them. Self service at breakfast and there are no staff about if one of the coffee machines isn't working. Food is basic. The hotel is designed to be run with very few staff.

Everything first class, staff were so welcoming. Rooms are beautiful, with everything you could possibly need, (especially the proper hairdryer, not one attached to wall !!) Railway and tube stations a couple of minutes walk, so handy for everywhere. Will definitely return anytime we are in London

Brand new hotel, clean and modern, with a great breakfast, gym and laundry room.  The Staybridge Hotel is about 20 minutes from all the great monuments and sights of the City.  Across the way from the Hotel is a fantastic Mall, with hundreds of shops and a good many restaurants.  A short walk from the Hotel, you can find the Underground, the train and several buses going into the City.  I would stay at the Staybridge anytime.Also, in the Mall, you can find 2 supermarkets where you can find all that you need to cook your favorite dishes.

column9: Stayed for over a year. The helpful team makes all the difference to this modern hotel
column10: Excellent hotel, with a warm and helpful team!!I spent a better part of the last 12 months, at this property. I stayed in over 5 different rooms over the period. Overall the rooms were modern, and the interiors were quite new. The bed and the sofa were always clean and comfortable. The upholstery and the furniture looks new, fresh and I have never found anything frayed or worn out during my stay. The kitchenette, though small, is quite utilitarian since you can cook a complete meal and has the essential utensils, a microwave (that doubles up as an oven), a stove with a chimney, a toaster and a kettle. The bathroom fittings are also quite modern and are at a decent standard. I have had colleagues complaining of lack of water pressure at other hotels, however over the course of one year I haven't had a chance to complain about such a thing, nor about the lack of warm water in the shower (one of my pet peeve from an earlier stay in another country). The building is just outside the Westfield Stratford City mall, and has great views of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic park, the Arcelor Mittal Orbit and the city skyline from one side of the hotel. Proximity to the shopping mall and the tube station is a big plus if you are travelling on business or leisure, since it gives you quick access to some good hotels and transport. The city view rooms definitely are much quieter. The rooms that open onto the shopping mall side could be tad noisy over Friday and Sat nights.Secondly, the team ensured that my stay was excellent. Special shout out to Nicolas, Anca, Bindi for their wonderful hospitality. The hotel team took care of all the big and little things, and made sure that my stay was comfortable throughout. On a couple of occasions the team went out of their way to get my queries resolved with the Rewards team, and that meant I had to deal with one less thing. The reception staff is always smiling and very keen to help you. I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel, and definitely look forward to visiting it again.

column9: Excellent staff, nice rooms, convenient location
column10: I've stayed here a few times recently. The staff are excellent - really helpful, friendly and chatty. Rooms are great, spacious with a nice en suite (big shower) and kitchenette. The two rooms I've stayed in have been maintained and cleaned to a high standard. The room also has Apple TV, there's a pretty good free Wifi and there's a room safe in the wardrobe. Beds are a little on the firm side. The breakfast is included so it can work out cheaper than the partner Holiday Inn in the same building. Cooked breakfast choice is a bit variable. Although they don't have a restaurant per se they do have a bit seating area where you can relax in the evening if you wish. They also have drinks and snacks for sale in the reception area, including wine for c. ¬£17 a bottle.

Overall a really good experience. Room was very comfortable n luxurious. We went for a spacious deluxe room with Olympic park views. Great selection at breakfast. Great location in shopping centre for car park and also close to Stratford station to get around on the tube. Staff good overall my only disappointment was a request for a late check which I thought was a perk as a club member but the woman at reception refused without what seemed like even checking only needed an extra half hour - hour n we ended up checking out 20mins late after rushing anyway.

column9: One of the best in town for Business and Leisure
column10: Just spent the last 17 months staying at this hotel while working in the City. This hotel has to be one of the best all round places to stay for both business stays and leisure breaks. All rooms  suites, deluxe and one bedroom apartments are  decorated to a high standard and very clean. All staff exceptionally pleasant and extremely helpful. Has to be one of the friendliest hotels in which i have had the privileged to stay in, I had not only myself booked here but my of my colleagues and all have given this hotel very positive feedback.Looking forward to being back there again soon

column9: Wow, first choice whenever i go to London
column10: I stayed here for 2 years off and on for business and leisure travel, but since day one I have been treated very well by the team and they are so welcoming whenever I arrive.  The rooms are exceptional for the price, especially in London.  Full kitchen, nice big bedrooms, showers that you don't want to get out of and when I was travelling with my family, a suite more than deals with our requirements.Travel networks...well you are in the very place the 2012 Olympics took place so you can imagine that it is very well connected and easy to get around.  Great base for travelling out around London on both business and pleasure, I will be back whenever I am in London visiting or on business, its always my 1st choice.

column9: Hotel thats a Home Away from Home
column10: Over the past 15 months I have been a regular at this hotel.Nice, spacious, modern rooms that are very comfortable.The kitchenette in the rooms are brilliant for preparing your own food.Breakfast is ok.Well connected to public transport.Directly opposite Westfield Shopping Centre.But what sets this hotel apart for me is the staff. They have a great team at reception that make this a great place to stay. They are always welcoming, warm and receptive and go that extra mile to make the stay a good one.I have no hesitation recommending this hotel for a stay in london.

Well appointed modern rooms with kitchen facilities, combined with a welcoming atmosphere and plenty of areas to relax. A great hotel as a base for London sighseeing, shopping or business. Plenty of national restaurant chains in the shopping mall, all under cover.

Often stay here with work, rooms have very good facilities and spacious. Quality showers with shower gel, shampoo & conditioner supplied. Staff very friendly and always helpful. Only have two issues I have is twice despite it being clear my company is paying for the room my credit which I put ¬£50 on for extras has been charged for the room and the refund can take a while. So check your card statement I have a rewards card every the card is never linked to the booking so staff manually updateDespite this its a good hotel with very good facilities

1. Very convenient location - access to underground/ DLR/ national rail/ overground, but not close to city centre. 2. Westfield is located right next to it - can spend a whole day just shopping there. 3. Friendly and helpful staff.4. Clean and tidy.5. Well equipped kitchen - you can actually cook there! 6. Only double beds available

column9: All amenities; great E.London base. Bad internet
column10: Very pleasant apartment-type property adjacent to the sister Holiday Inn. Room had everything from microwave to dishwasher, pots, pans etc. but didn't feel at all cramped. The staff were very pleasant. The location is excellent for Westfield shopping mall, east London and the former London Olympic venues. Would definitely stay again though two things I'd improve on if I were management: 1) the internet, which was dire on the free bandwidth service and not particularly improved on the GBP5 per day, higher bandwidth offering (free to IHG members, Gold and above I believe). 2) Breakfast, which was a bit like survival of the fittest on the savannah. The cooked dishes simply ran out at 9.15 and there were not enough tables. Could have been because this was a busy period. All in all, a great stay in a vibrant part of London.

I went to London and stayed at Staybridge Suites - Stratford City.  The service was excellent.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The concierge, Graham, was very knowledgeable about the city and was always ready to answer any questions we had.  The front desk staff were very pleasant and always greeted us with a smile.  The room was spacious and included a fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, bedroom with a king size bed, and a pull out sofa sleeper in the living room/kitchen area,  with two flat-screen TVs.  AC worked well, and the shower was awesome.  The hotel is located on the northeast side of central London, adjacent to the Olympic Park.  There's a beautiful view from the lobby on the 12th floor (reception desk/breakfast and sitting area is located there) with an outside balcony.  The hotel is located in Westfield Stratford City, one of the largest shopping centers in Europe with 360 stores. The nearest tube station, Stratford, is adjacent to the shopping center and about a 200 meter walk from the hotel door.   Breakfast is included each day and there is a good variety of foods to choose from.  If you want to cook in your room, there's a Waitrose (supermarket chain) in the shopping center about a two minute walk away.  During the week, a manager's social is held on several nights with free wine and cheese, finger foods etc. in the lobby.  The hotel is clean and well-maintained.  The only drawback to the location is that it's about an hour from Heathrow which is on the southeast side of London.  Other popular locations in London averaged about 20-30 minutes via the London Underground (tube), so even though it's not in downtown, it's not hard to get around.  I would definitely stay here again. Loved it!

column9: Ideal overnight stay for the East of London if travelling by car
column10: We chose the Staybridge based on previous good experience with this new IHG brand and because of the onsite car parking available below the Westfield Stratford City Shopping Centre. We did use one of the many restaurants in the Westfield, we didn't stay here to do any shopping but it has obvious appeal if that is the purpose of your stay.Good points:+ Lots of onsite parking at a reasonable overnight price+ Good public transport connections from the two adjoining Stratford stations (to Eurostar, overground and underground trains)+ Even numbered rooms have great views of the Olympic Park and taller London landmarks (Shard, Natwest Tower) in the distance+ Usual Staybridge benefits of suites with small kitchens and seating areas+ Excellent service and a very friendly welcomeNot so good points:- Getting to Westfield and the right part of the car park proved more difficult than expected, as my satnav did not recognise the Westfield postcode and there were no signs to Westfield from the older parts of Stratford. Once we had found Westfield, it was easy to find Car Park B as the three Car Parks are well signed, but level P2 isn't obvious once you are in the car park. We had similar problems choosing which car park exit to take when leaving so ended up doing an unnecessary loop of the area to reach our next destination- No lock on the toilet doors in the suites, which is an odd omission and detracts from privacy for guests

column9: What a find! Great Location,Great Service!
column10: Stayed here for a short break and a concert at the 02 Arena. What a great choice the Hotel really is home from home,rooms are comfy air conditioned and spacious enough with tea & coffee making facilities,handy kitchenette with fridge, dishwasher & microwave. Great having the flexibilty to do your own catering if you wish. Lovely shower room spotlessly clean with complimentary toiletries and nice large towels. Flat screen tv with Freesat channels and free Wi Fi throughout. Lots of storage space an Ironing board and hair dryer also provided. Our room overlooked the Olympic Park had a great view of the Stadium and London skyline in the distance. There is also a complimentary fitness centre with great views of the Olympic Park. Guests on a long stay could also make use of the laundry room The staff that checked us in were extremely welcoming and gave us home made cookies to have with Tea or Coffee that is available in the public lounge 24 hours! The lounge areas are very relaxing with fantastic views & there is a verandah to sit outside & enjoy those views.Westfield Shopping Mall is at the doorstep and you are minutes from the Olympic Park. The buffet style breakfast in The Hub had a great choice of hot or cold food. You can also purchase groceries from The Pantry anytime which stocked microwave meals,snacks & sweets.There are plenty of restaurants nearby,a Casino and also a popular pub named The Cow that also does food.The Stratford City tube station & railway is 5 minutes walk and you can be in central London in about 20 minutes,also 3 stops and you're at The 02 Arena.We will most definitely return.

Short break to London with family, chose Staybridge Suites in Stratford due to proximity to restaurants and tube station. Was not disappointed and couldn't have been happier.Everything about the hotel was wonderful and the location was perfect. Loads of bars and restaurants on your doorstep along with the superb Westfield shopping centre.20 minutes from central London it provided us with a perfect Base for our break.Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go back ourselves.

Stayed here for the 100 Mile bike ride on Sunday which we did for Breast Cancer NowPerfect location for the start and really good rooms with a great view of the park...Kitchen facilities in the room, very good for making the pre ride porridge !Excellent staffGreat access to the MallWill be back!!

Stayed with friends here for the second time in a year and both times were outstanding. The check in staff were friendly and welcoming and very helpful. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The stand out aspect of this hotel though is the breakfast. Tasty selection of pastries and hot food and the breakfast staff were kind, considerate and replaced the food constantly. Will definitely stay again.

We stayed here with friends last weekend and I have to say all the staff were very welcoming and friendly. We especially liked the breakfast host who was very welcoming and made time to speak to all the guests at breakfast. She is a great asset to your hotel.The bedrooms were clean and the shower is great. Only gripe we had was one of our rooms smelt of fish! - Even after leaving the window open all day. I suppose the previous guest must have used the kitchen facilities.Would definitely recommend and would come back.

Stayed here for 2 nights for the cycling event nearby. Easy, safe and cheap parking near the hotel. Rooms are great. Clean and the small kitchen facilities are very useful. The hotel even arranged breakfast to be extra early for the ride London on Sunday. Fantastic views from reception and the eating area. Westfield shopping centre has everything that you need including bars and eating places. Would stay again.

The Staybridge Suites at Stratford is very well situated for communications and local amenities, with the large Westfield shopping centre being right under the hotel and a large variety of restaurants available within a short walk.The view is over the Olympic Park on one side and over the air conditioning equipment for Westfield on the other side (the view that we had!). We did not however go to this hotel for the view.The one bedroom suite was very well appointed and reasonably spacious, with a reasonable kitchen area and useful equipment such as an ironing board and iron.It is not pretty, but as a functional hotel with excellent communications into London it works very well. The price is very reasonable.Do not expect a full service hotel, this is not one!

I stayed here when I was engaged in December/January 2012-2013. The rooms were neat and my vance's mother wasEven getting married again inside the hotel. This place is also kid-friendly because a lot of families were staying there also. This place is Modern and........... AMAZING

column9: A clean, modern, comfortable and homely place to stay
column10: Staybridge Suites is more home than hotel, with modern, comfortable and clean rooms and a spacious and homely guests lounge.I was at check in for 30 mins checking in because the staff were so friendly and chatty and it was quiet as I was arriving late. I could have been checked in within 2-3 minutes had I not stayed to chat. I got a cookie upon check-in which was a nice touch. I arrived into the room which was immaculate, neat and tidy and had even more cookies. The room is decorated in a homely manner with dark wooden furniture, nice carpet and 26" flat screen TV. Staff are friendly and build a good rapport with short and long-term guests alike. They are very hospitable and accommodate all of your needs.It's on the doorstep of Westfield shopping centre which is Europe's biggest shopping centre and has fast food options, cheap eats and restaurants. It's only 2 mins from Stratford Tube Station which is only a 15min tube journey into Central London.I would definitely recommend staying here if you're in the area.

My partner surprised me with a stay here recently, and it was perfect! Comfortable space, very nice bed and pillows, large bathroom, and plenty of space for storage. Very close to the Westfield which is perfect for shopping. Parking was quite reasonable, ¬£9 for 24 hours. Absolutely perfect, would recommend it.

Location is conveniently close to the railway which then gets you into Central London in 15 minutes. As the hotel is designed for the long-term guest it gives you a lot of flexibility to cater for yourself or make use of the Holiday Inn facilities that are within the same building (floors 3-8 is Holiday Inn and floors 9-12 are Staybridge Suites). There are plenty of good restaurants and shops within walking distance.  Staff are friendly and helpful.

I booked the stay ridge because I was running in the 10 k around the Olympic park, so we made a weekend of it and done some shopping in Westfield, everything in the hotel was perfect and the staff were really helpful, will definatly go back

Stayed here when my wife came down to meet me when I was working in London , my wife arrived before me as I was still working, and she really struggled driving in London traffic and as usual got lost . So she rang the hotel and asked the man on the reception(Matthew) for directions not only did he give directions but he talked her all the way to the hotel car park and then to the hotel (about 15 mins). So I like to give a big thank you to him as I never got chance to thank  him myself. As for the hotel I found the staff very polite ,professional,and helpful the hotel rooms were large very clean and comfortable and had a great self service bar/ lounge area on the twelve floor with a great view on a night over the city. I Will definitely be returning with the family near Christmas to do a bit shopping and relaxation .

column9: Best place to live if this is your first time in London
column10: Great location! It was right next to Westfield mall, train station and bus stations.  The room was very clean. We had good service all around.  I was there for 2 weeks and it definitely made London feel like home.  Definitely, would consider staying here again if I travel to London again.

It was a pleasure to stay at Staybridge where people are nicest in the world, rooms are not feeling like hotel but more like home. I highly encourage you to visit Staybridge as often as possible - this will definietly always be my choice when visiting London.

column9: Right at home, clean and excellent service
column10: Here in London for business 4 nights and was absolute at home in this place, super fast WIFI at all time, excellent service, very clean room, excellent food and love the complimentary breakfast. Bonus right in the hub, both westfield, train and bus right here.

What an outstanding hotel!  Very nice staff at all levels, friendly, easy going, thoughtful but proactive as well.  Immaculate everywhere, very comfortable room with great views of the Olympic Park and Westfield shopping centre - and perfectly positioned for visiting both.  I have no doubt that we will be back!

column9: High standard of self catering accom
column10: The room was very comfortable with plenty of room for a one or two night stay.  It is very similar to the Holiday Inn rooms downstairs but with the added kitchen area (hardly what I call a suite)Staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming.  Breakfast was self-service with a good selection of food plus there was some Soya milk in the fridge, which is a rare find in a hotel.Location is perfect for Stratford & the business districts of London.

column9: Good location for Wesfield and easy access to tube to Central London
column10: Centrally located in the Westfield Shopping Centre, the Staybridge Suites are located in the upper floors of the Holiday Inn.If arriving by car, park in Car Park B Level 2 & follow the signs for the Holiday Inn/Staybridge Suites, take the escalator up and exit into the Chestnut Plaza & the entrance to the hotel is immediately behind you by the digital waterfall.Car Parking costs ¬£9 for 24hrs at weekends & ¬£6 for 24hrs during the week.Access to the tube (Jubilee & Central lines) /rail network & DLR at Stratford Station is 5 mins walk through the shopping centre. Taxis are available outside the centre.With the introduction of 24hr tubes in mid-September, linking into central London throughout the night, this hotel gives you the flexibility to have a late night out in central London coupled with the convenience of driving to the capital, and utilising the cheaper parking in Westfield, than paying the very high parking charges of more centrally located London hotels. There is a concierge 24/7, the reception to the Suites is in the 12 floor. Check in was speedy, efficient and the girls on reception very friendlyThis floor overlooks the Olympic Park and is also the location for the buffet breakfast, which is served up to 10.30am at weekends.There is a choice of cereals, juices, fresh fruit, yogurt, fruit compote, breads & pastries, cheese, tea & coffee and a selection of hot food comprising scrambled egg, bacon, sausages, beans & hash browns, the buffet was frequently refreshed and the quality is pretty good.You can take breakfast back to your suite if so desired.There is also a small outside patio area which has great views of the park & the London skyline.Adjacent to reception there is also a "pantry" where you can buy chilled ready-made meals and various other items if you cater in your suite, however M&S is very close by if you want a larger selection of food.The studio suites are quiet, modern, clean and tastefully furnished, with a kitchenette containing, hob, microwave/grill, toaster, kettle, fridge, dishwasher, tea & coffee. An iron & ironing board is also provided. There is a reasonable amount of storage space and a safe is built into the wardrobe.There is an easy chair & work station area, and a sort of breakfast bar arrangement with a chair suitable for one person to eat at but no table and chairs so not that easy if two guests are wanting to eat in the suite. The king-size bed was comfortable, with nice linen.The shower room is compact but adequate with a double sized shower, good quality towels & toiletries.Your door key is needed to access the lift to suite levels, so security is good.There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel.This comfortable hotel provides excellent value for money, it is in a good location for Westfield, Canary Wharf , the O2 and the attractions of the East End of London, yet also offers a convenient link into central London.

column9: Ideal location for 02 gig and fab staff
column10: From the moment we checked in the staff were friendly and efficient. The room was big for London standards and the bonus of having a full kitchen would be great for longer stays. The shower was superb and the room we were given had a top view over the Olympic park. Breakfast the next days was included and I loved the ease of it, with the option of taking a tray back to your room. There was a great range of food and 24 hour tea/coffee went down a treat. It is also right in the heart of the Westfield Shopping area so perfect for eating out, walk in the park or shopping.

Cannot fault the hotel.  All the staff were super friendly and efficient.  The styling is really nice.  Everything was spotlessly clean.Great location - walk out the door and turn left and you are looking at the Olympic park and look ahead you are in WestField shopping centreWhat was really nice is that we stayed on a Fri night and bfast was from 7:30 but there was already some cereal and stuff out at 6am so you could have had a quick little bfast.  Plus there is 24 hr tea and coffee machine.Also do not forget the view of the literally the whole of Londonlastly we went to the O2 arena and it took us 30 mins from leaving our seats to be getting into our room.  (the Jubilee line runs later coming out of London than going in so this was the reason we chose this hotel) - the O2 website gives last tube times)

column9: Good location for Olympic Park,Westfield shopping centre and easy access to central London
column10: Easy to locate within the Westfield shopping centre Stratford. Easy access to the reception area on 12th floor by lift.Check in was quick and simple. Key was needed to access all levels with suites which gave added security and peace of mind.Room 808 with views over the park but sadly soon to be restricted by two (may be more in the future) high rise buildings. 'Suites' are not large but adequate with a good kitchen area however a table and chairs to sit at to eat would have been a useful addition.Good breakfast in a large lounge area, plus an outside area with views over the park.If you wished you could take your breakfast back to your room hence, in my opinion, the reason for table and chairs.Breakfast consisted of a good selection of hot and cold food, a massive improvement on the 'grab and go' offered by some apartment/hotels.Only criticism was the lack of availability of food after 11pm. There is a pantry but nothing we fancied. All restaurants in the centre close at 10pm although there is a restaurant in the casino but not impressed!Will definitely use again when needing a hotel in the Stratford area.

column9: Good choice for family trip to London
column10: The hotel is fresh and modern, the room very quiet, bed was comfy and bathroom spotless. The location is excellent for a family visit in London. The hotel is located in the middle of a huge shopping mall with nice family restaurants. Easy to go shopping, bring your bags to the room, rest for a while and then go back for a nice meal or to buy takeaway to the room. A few minutes' walk to the tube and you are in central London within 15-20 minutes. We stayed for three days and managed both plenty of shopping in the mall as well as many classic attractions in central London, including Buckinghamn Place, Piccadilly Circus area and London Eye (you get easily from Straftord with Jubilee line to Waterloo, which is 5 minutes walk from London Eye). I've been to London many times, first time with my kid, and this hotel is by far the most modern I've seen. Very good value, you are not able to find a hotel as good as this in central London for this price. Also the mall with surroundings was well planned and clean. We opted for a suite with a view - definitely worth paying a little more to see the Shard and the Gherkin from the distance!

Great Homely service. Rooms and facilities best i have had in London for business trips in the last 12 years of travelling to London regularly.Not many hotels can offer an olympic sized swimming pool near-by.The staff are passionate about service.No need to go elsewhere (unless they are booked up for being too popular !)

I stay in Staybridge suites often but first time at this one.The apartment size, style and furnishings were all fine and the usual Staybridge standard but there was a lack of kitchen and cooking items.Breakfast again was the usual buffet style you get at any Staybridge.What wasn't the same as other Staybridge locations was the service...Check in at 10pm took forever. There was a guy checking in before me who wasn't being processed efficiently. Whilst polite conversation is expected, full blown 20 irrelevant conversations are taking liberties when others are waiting! When I reached the counter, another girl appeared at the desk and said to her colleague, you should have called me! He said he had and she bluntly stated, well I didn't hear you!No recognition of gold elite membership. Then when I asked for a VAT receipt I was told I could get one from the agent I booked with so I had to tell him I booked directly! No apology just printed a receipt which wasn't a VAT receipt so he had to do it again!All in all, good location, good standard but awful service on this occasion.

We stayed in order to visit family and get to an O2 concert. It worked out very well - right alongside the Westfield centre with all its shopping and eating potential. Spacious room and great service at the front desk. Breakfast was relaxed and enjoyable. We will be back.

We ended our few days stay in London with a one nights stay at the Staybridge Suites! Our appartment was on the 12th floor with views of the Olympic park! They were very clean with everything in them you could possibly need! The staff were excellent and all very friendly! We loved all the complementary extras they provided throughout our stay!! Thank you Staybridge we will return! Suef (from Dorset)

column9: All that we could wish for
column10: This self-catering suite was all that we could wish for in an eight night stay. The room was modern, comfortable and quiet. The cooking facilities were adequate for preparing our own meals which is an important consideration for a coeliac vegetarian. Shopping is right on-site as the hotel is located in the Westfield Shopping Centre, the largest in Europe. The public transport is right on hand as well for cabs, buses, overground rail, Docklands Light Rail, and underground rail services. It is not far from the London City Airport as well.Breakfasts were complimentary and were of high standard. Gluten free bread was available. The view from the 12th floor breakfast room was outstanding.We arrived mid-morning after a flight from Dublin to the London City Airport and were admitted to our room early without any problems. Reception staff at Staybridge were efficient, courteous and friendly. The concierge kindly arranged bookings to a concert at the Royal Albert Hall for us as well.We would stay there again on a trip to London, UK.

I have been staying here for few days as i am here for work. Coming with experience from staying with Marriott in US, initially had hicups to adjust to the differences. The breakfast and socials are turning out good. Once a month they have managers social, where they offer extensive menu , which is as good as dinner. My experience with Marriott in US of having cakes, pastries,burgers,pizzas etc at socials at regular intervals was ofcourse different. This hotel can still make eventful to customers staying long, by offering some change to socials menu and breakfast menu. Overall I would definetly recommend this hotel...

column9: Really good option for the East End
column10: Really good hotel. Lovely rooms with a small kitchen area if you want to do your own cooking. Very good free breakfast at the top of the hotel with great views over Olympic Park. Comfy beds, friendly staff. No issues at all. The location is right in the middle of the Westfield mall so lots of options for food. Good transport links at Stratford station and the night bus runs very frequently so its east to get back from the West End at night. An excellent choice!

So having been moved out of our house for repairs to be conducted following a water leak the staybridge team turned a 2 week stay that became over 2 months into a home away from home.The standard was generally high, the service was always excellent, the suite itself was spacious, comfortable and convenient.What made it though was the staff lead by manager Nicholas who always had a smile, a joke, a willingness to help and a sense of customer service that didn't waiver even under difficult circumstances. Great job guys.

I with my wife and two kids of 14 years each had stayed here for 4 nights from 16/05/2015 to 20/05/2015 on a vacation.Ideally located in the westfield shopping mall though slightly away from central London.very helpful reception staff and the concierge service. Very good neat and clean rooms. Will definately stay here when I visit London again.

Stayed here to do some shopping and had a day at the pet show at the excel in London. Stayed for one night. Is a great hotel, great location, step outside to shops and restaurants. Has a kitchen with everything you could want. Very clean and friendly staff, would like to stay here again !

I've used this hotel over 30 times since it opened in 2012, as it is very comfortable, modern, and convenient for shops, and getting into the City. Regular staff are very friendly. Minimum fuss to simplify stay. Midweek drinks & nibbles get togethers.

First of all the location was perfect for what we needed, and it was handy being so close to all the shops. The hotel is in the same block as the Holiday Inn Stratford. The room was small but nicely decorated, bed extremely comfortable, bathroom was excellent, everything was very clean and tidy and the kitchen area was a nice bonus. The breakfast was a buffet where you helped yourself to everything - no waiting staff at all, but we enjoyed everything that we ate. Overall, an extremely enjoyable stay and we will definitely be back!

column9: Hard to find as directions are not great!
column10: Once you have got over the fact that this place is a nightmare to find due to porr directions, it is actually very goodVery clean & modern inside, every room is equipped with a mini kitchenette which is a very handy featureBreakfast was good too, although each day they kept running out of items, but here was that much to choose from it wasn't really an issue and there were good views too.Given the size of the room/suite and the price paid I recomend this quite highly as being being good value for money and a nice plae to stay

column9: Great Location good hotel, heaven for shoppers in London
column10: Was there in Dec'14 and Mar'15. Awesome location just 15-20 mins from central london (in tube).But almost 90 mins distance from airport (in tube) This is located just on a corner of one of the biggest malls in London . Stratford City Mall.  Has great stores in the mall, wonderful eating joints. Movie hall etc etc.It has v good rooms with kitchen and good view from the room. Staybridge Suites if from 8th-12th floor, with reception at the top floor. :-) Below floors are for Holiday Inn which is also good and also an IHG hotel.Just that this is a bit on the expensive side. If one has lower budget to stay, you may book at Holiday-Inn Express which is about 1km walking from this hotel. Both are IHG properties and are good.

The location is fantastic, right in the midst of the shops at Westfields. The room was however, small. Nonetheless,the staff at reception were very welcoming and helpful and the breakfast was great with a variety of things to choose from.

column9: Good friendly staff, evening drinks & food are a perk!
column10: Enjoyed our stay here, we have stayed multiple time now. !! Its really a good place. Friendly staff, Pros: Neat and TidyFood is good..(breakfast n evening drinks)ProximityConsRoom size (but may vary with people's view)

During my second stay at the Staybridge Suites in Stratford London  I discovered the refreshing concept of this place.  It is an easy going place with high service standards.  Uncomplicated breakfast (for some maybe a bit too basic)  which I appreciate in the morning.  The freedom of having the capability to cook a meal in your own room,  which contains a fully functional kitchen,  including dishwasher :)!  The staff are a very important part of this refreshing concept.  All about being your second home.  All in all a superb location offering the possibility of create a fine dining meal in the comfort of your own room when the many restaurants at Westfield are getting boring or are closed.

Very good hotel I am happy to coming back to dis hotel. My stay  at stay very  blesser. Will coming sun as possible . Thank you Ioana , Mihaela and Delia.thank you very much:)))))üòòüòòüòòüòòüòòüòò .!!!!!!!:::))))))I am happy to see you next  month again .

column9: Fantastic location for a shopping weekend
column10: My mom & I stayed at Staybridge for just two nights last weekend.  We were there mainly for shopping, plus a day's visit from folks living in London. Upon arrival, we were met by Julien the concierge who was most helpful.  He informed us the reception is on the 12th floor and even gave us his namecard in case we need any assistance. Check-in was swift and the male French receptionist was super friendly and most informative.  We were lucky to get room 1102 which faces the Olympic park and the Aquatic arena.  View was fabulous.  WiFi was strong and we have no problem logging in. Room was immaculately clean and spacious hence we suspect it's meant for the disabled.  Breakfast was so-so on Fri, but on Sat there was baked beans, sausages and omelettes.  Not bad for it to be included in the price.  Needless to say the location is spot-on for shopping as we could practically get all we wanted without having to travel into downtown London.  The underground, trainstation and light rail are all within 5-10 mins reach.  On the whole, I'm very happy with my stay and will not hesitate to return.  Highly recommended for a ladies' weekend of shopping!

I spent a night at this hotel and wasn't sure what to do. I attended the hotel's evening social which included delcious food and free drinks. The staff are by far the best asset of this hotel, Debbie was the most gracious host who made me feel welcome and invited me to particpate in some light games with the other guests. It was the most delightful night and will not question returning!

column9: Initial Check In problematic but good customer service recovery
