column10: We arrived late on a Sunday & had lots of luggage-initial response from concierge & reception was poor as got the run around of how to get luggage to the hotel. The hotel/apartments are located inside the Westfield Complex which meant the taxi couldn't drop us at the door. My husband had to wait about 200 metres down the mall while  I went to the Concierge desk which operates for both the Staybridge Suites & Holiday Inn. In general most staff don't have great English skills & I ended up having to repeat myself or try to explain in other  ways what I wanted. I ended up complaining to the Senior Manager regarding the check in delay & after this our stay went smoothly- they are to be commended on their service recovery skills. I wouldn't stay there again though because it took about 40mins by tube or bus to get to central London requiring two changes. I was also unaware it was linked to the Holiday Inn chain & would not have booked it had I known. The quality of linen, soaps, tissues, towels etc etc where quite cheap in style & not what I expected also the size of the room was small for being marketed as a suite.

We stayed for a week, in two different rooms (by choice). Everything was great- tasty & well-stocked breakfast; comfy, clean and quiet rooms; fantastic shower head. Unfortunate occurrences during our stay were a fire alarm going off at 1.30am one nights (down then up nine flights of stairs to evacuate the building) and the wifi intermittently going down (staff instructed us to go to the Holiday Inn reception on the 3rd floor). The staff were very pleasant and helpful, the reception floor (12th) has a nice atmosphere during the day, and the social evenings during the middle of the week are a nice touch. I would certainly stay again, the only slight downside being the location- quite a trip to/from the city (but also very handy for London City Airport & shoppers would probably enjoy being within the Westfield complex).

column9: Excellent hotel in great location for the Olympic park
column10: I stayed here 1 night for business which was in the area. I found the hotel hard to find initially as I didn't know the area but after a phone call found in within the shopping mall. I was impressed with the location, great for the park, ideal for shopping and eating too. The hotel itself was excellent. I wasn't able to get a room upgrade and guess that i had a standard room on the 8th floor, it was just fine, spacious, the right amount of furniture and of course the kitchenette. I didn't use it on this stay but handy to have. The bed was very comfortable and I'm particular, always needing a firm mattress. The bathroom was a little small but functional nevertheless. It's a quiet hotel with wonderful views. It has a gym, but I didn't have time to use. Breakfast was everything you need, and as nicely presented. Can't really fault this hotel and I've booked again!

My family spent 8 nights in this hotel. Very nice staff, friendly and helpful. Laundry and fitness room for free. Kitchen inside the room allowed  to save money and is very helpful for families with small children. Social nights from Tuesday to Thursday, good drinks and food. The best 8 nights stay ever!

As a regular guest it was great to see the Team making an effort to celebrate St George's day. Flags around the gathering area and then of course Debbie. She came up trumps again with typical English nosh for the managers social event. Great pies, chips,peas and gravy. Nothing more English than that lot. Yet again Debbie your tireless efforts were much appreciated. Well done. What's next I wonder????

Due to my long work assignment in London, I am in this hotel from last one year. It feels like home. I never ever had any issues related to any thing. Whole staff of this Hotel is nice .I will recommended to everybody check this first before going anywhere.

My wife and I visit London on regular occasions, and this has become our favorite hotel. We have stayed here a few times now and always have a great time. The rooms are spacious and the beds are so comfortable. The kitchenette is an added bonus. We have had a couple of issues in the past that were sorted out very quickly. This time it was slightly marred by being charged for a nights stay when we had booked a night as a reward night. The lady on checkout said she would sort it and clearly didn't. However when I noticed it had been charged on my credit card. I called the hotel and spoke to Bindi on reservations who apologised and refunded the payment very quickly. Even though we have had issues it would not stop us from booking this hotel in the future. All the staff we have encountered have been very friendly and helpful without exception.

column9: Far from the center but close to the Olympic pool
column10: This hotel is located in Stratford on the central line. Just above the new mall and the olimpic park. about 20 minutes from the center of the city. If you plan to swim a lot and do some shopping it's the perfect place for you. The central line will get you to Oxford circus or change at Holborn to the Piccadilly line which connect to all the thrust location. The room are quit new and are better than what you usually get in London.The breakfast is very poor. But there are many options for breakfast very close by. The Apple TV does not work. I asked and was answer they stop the contract with the company that support it. The internet is crappy. And although it's listed it just don't work. The room I booked on booking is an upgrade room. And although I paid a higher price for it. The reception guy told me that room are dependent on availability and that they can't promise I'll get the room I payed for. Lucky for me I didn't have to argue cause they just had 1 suite left. The bed was suppose to be a king size but again they said they can't promise that and the bed was not a king and not even queen. Just the smallest double bed. I would suggest calling the hotel to make sure you will get what you order. Last there is a constant noise from out side. But it's not so bad. Try to ask for a higher floor might be better there. From my room there is 0 view. So again try to be on the 11-12 floor.

I've stayed here a few times and it's always great, probably one of my favourite hotels in the UK.The lobby on the twelfth floor is always impressive, and the staff are always great.Rooms are big and have a great vibe, had a one bedroom suite this time which was perfect for my marathon prep. Breakfast is great, with an amazing view, all really relaxed.An oasis in London, a little more relaxed and removed from the city.Only small problems on this trip were no wifi for 24hrs and brief fire alarm at 8am.

column9: Wonderful Staff, Amazing views, Fantastic stay
column10: I booked this hotel as part of weekend in London to surprise my partner for his 30th Birthday. From start to finish the whole experience was fantastic - it couldn't have been better. Before my stay I emailed to ask if staff could decorate our room on our first evening whilst we went out. I received a very quick and lovely response saying this was not a problem. On arrival we checked into our room, which was wonderful! We had a view looking over the Olympic park (which I had requested, but wasn't guaranteed to get) and the staff had even left a bottle of wine in our room to help my partner celebrate his Birthday. As promised, they had also decorated our room whilst we had our first evening out, with banners and bunting I had given them. The room was very spacious, clean, tidy, and the floor we were staying on was very quiet - we had a wonderful night's sleep. Breakfast in the morning was great, loads of choice, with views looking across the Olympic Park. They even have a balcony, which I guess had the weather been warmer we could have sat outside for breakfast. The hotel also has gym facilities available, although we didn't have time to utilize these.Although the hotel is a little way out from Central London, we had no problems getting into the centre on the underground/DLR. There are plenty of shops/restaurants on the doorstep which is fantastic, and plenty to do within the Westfield centre. I much preferred being slightly out of the centre, and am so glad I chose to stay here.All in all this was a fantastic stay, we loved the hotel, it's location, and it's facilities, and would not hesitate to book another stay here next time I visit London.I would like to thank all the wonderful staff for their help in making our weekend special, and one to remember.

column9: Excellent social night hosted by Debbie and Steven
column10: Yet another great night hosted by Debbie and Steven. Lovely night with hotel and staff and other guests. The pie,chips and peas was a lovely homely meal. Look forward to another night in with everybody.

column9: Home away from home - social sessions are fun!
column10: For a consultant who travels 350 days a year, it's important to find a hotel such as staybridge. Specially if you get to attend Debbie and Stevens social! The ambience in the hotel is very homely & the kitchenette makes life comfortable! When you are here the den is a must visit!

Debbie and Steve treated us with the most amazing pie and chips today at the social. I am very delighted with the constant endeavor of the best staff staybridge has and their endeavors to keep it interesting. I actually look forward to come back to the hotel after a long day at work...Look forward to these interesting that evenings..

They make amazing pies on thursdays .. love you debbie and steve !!!the hospitaluty was really good. I could not esist but to have 3 pies :-).. highly recommend to stay and enjoy the grest atmosphere at staybridge suites. and remember do not miss the pies from debbie

Visited here for a birthday celebration, the staff were attentive in making the stay extra special. We had a lovely view of the Olympic park from our room and there's also a great view from the communal areas by reception. It was useful to have the kitchenette although we really only used the fridge to keep champagne cool! The included breakfast was adequate and as an added bonus you could take it to your room to enjoy breakfast in bed! Convenient location for transport links, the Olympic park and shopping, with an abundance of eateries close by too. Would definitely recommend and hope to stay here again.

Stayed 4 nights and would definitely stay again. The suites are superb and in the best location for Olympic Park. Having the kitchen was brilliant and made life a lot easier compared to staying in a normal hotel. Get a room looking towards the stadium though because the Casino opposite in Westfield is noisy at the weekend and you can hear it even with the window shut.The breakfast room is good but not sure about the cleanliness aspect of people sharing the same cereal boxes & milk cartons. I realise this cuts costs but it seems even less hygienic than a normal hotel buffet and even those make me cringe at times. Don't delay book it!

My fianc√© and I are checking out today after a 3day stay and I'm so sad about it! These suites are IDEALLY located withIN one of the most amazing malls London has to offer!! What could be more ideal than shopping till your feet hurt, eat just about ANYTHING your heart desires then just simply going up to your very comfortable suite and relax?! Nothing! Also, you are a tube ride away from any other hotspot you would want to visit. But fantastic location aside, the staff and service is so warm and polite, yummy buffet breakfast included. I stayed on the 10th floor. The room was clean! Has a nice posh feel to it for a reasonable price, kitchenette included and nice views- bed comfy and you have the ability to control your room temperature :) It is also very secure- rooms only accessible from the lift with your room card. We were out all of yesterday (of course) and when we returned, we found our room cleaned, bed made, there were important/valued items/cash laying around which were all untouched. Very impressive Additionally, there was a complimentary drink/cocktail hour each night of our stay but we missed it because we got caught up shopping so I cannot comment on that perk/feature but I'm sure it was pretty awesome :)The only "con" I experienced is that after 10/11pm weeknights - food find was challenging. There is a 24 hr confectionery area at reception but nothing of real substance for the hungry person. There is room service - prices a little steep and only limited items are available beyond 11pm.I would definitely recommend this place to anyone willing to listen!Loved it and will definitely return!

Fab weekend stay at staybridge. Lovely staff, very welcoming. Very clean hotel and like the super quick lifts to all floors. Amazing views over london and love the little shop selling snacks etc next to reception. The rooms are so lovely! Deffo more home than hotel. Love the seperate kitchen, living room space and bedroom. Very clean, huge room for the 2 of us. We had a view over stratford shopping centre that we visited often. Breakfast wasnt as great as last time. Very hectic, people running about, the cooked food was sparse and was different on both mornings for some reason. Would deffo stay again, had a great time.

Visiting family in London, we booked our stay at Staybridge Suites sight unseen simply because of proximity to family and to public transportation. The hotel is a very short walk away from the Underground, train and bus line. What a pleasant surprise! The rooms were spacious and immaculately kept. The shower was amazing. (I want that shower head!)The staff were all friendly and courteous. Every day the front desk staff inquired about our day and offered any needed assistance. The free breakfast was simply outstanding! We now have our go-to hotel when visiting London.

column9: Unbeatable Customer Service and superb hotel
column10: Customer Service from Joao and Carlos on our arrival and stay and attention to our kids was beyond excellent it was superb and I would like to personally thanks them for making our stay extra special.Holiday Inn express located in same building messed up our booking and on top of that treated us really badly, however Stalybridge suites and especially the care we got from Joao saved our day.It is impossible for me to put in the writing the awesomeness and care for details of all staff members and will book and stay in this hotel again very soon.

This accomodation was a great surprise. The Staybridge Hotel gives you all you need when traveling.Location is great for shopping, eating and discovering.New hotel and fantastic infrastructure and even includes breakfast for √† affordable price.I do recommend!!!

I stayed in Staybridge Suites London Stratford in February. Reception and kitchen staff is amazing, friendly and reliable. Breakfast is so good, there is a wide variety both of cold and hot food. Rooms are very clean. You can find a comfortable king size bed, big open shower and a kitchen with microwave, washing machine, stove and all you need in a kitchen. Wi-fi is for free and you can also use free gym and laundry facilities. What else?! It is a great place to stay, it is inside Westfield Shopping Centre, the largest mall in Europe. It is 5 minutes walk from the Olympic Village, where you can go swimming at the Aquatics Centre. Well located as the place is linked to the city by the Jubilee and  Central line, Overground and DLR as well as buses and train station. Hope to go back soon!

We stayed here for my husband's 30th birthday celebrations. Right in the heart of Stratford Westfield this hotel is an excellent location for exploring London. The suites are very nice and clean with a relatively well equipped kitchen. Unfortunately, the staff are not very friendly. The breakfast was good with a variety of choice. Overall a good stay. Would recommend.

column9: Awesome stay in a great affordable hotel! IN LONDON!
column10: Good London hotels and affordable pricing tend not to go together. Just like London hotels and large rooms are also opposites. But this is not the case at Staybridge Suites. Sure with the GBP being what it is, it's not exactly cheap but compared to its competitors, for what you get this is a bargain!Conveniently located to the Westfield mall (by which I mean, this is pretty much IN the mall), there is every kind of shopping and dining experience imaginable. To save some coins, the rooms also come equipped with a kitchenette (with stove top and microwave) and dinnerware, so you can comfortably eat in. This hotel is in Zone 3 if you're considering the underground, but on the central line train (located just steps from this hotel), you can be in central London in less than 20 minutes so it's pretty convenient. Most of my business was in central London and West London (where my friends were) so I was pretty much on the opposite side of town from them but the transport links were excellent and as a single woman travelling alone, I never felt unsafe coming back into the hotel late at night even when the mall was closed.I stayed in 2 different types of rooms over the course of my 1 week stay. A few days in a standard studio and and my last few days in a 1 bedroom king because my friend was coming to stay with me in the hotel and I thought I would need the room. With hindsight, this was probably unnecessary. The Studio Suite is plenty big enough for 2 adults. You could probably even throw in a child (maybe not 2 unless the 2nd one is a really small child) and be perfectly alright. The difference between the Studio and the 1 bedroom is minimal in terms of space. The bedroom area of the 1 bedroom king is pretty small and the living room feels a little narrow (more or less the size of the typical London front room) so whilst the room is patently bigger than the studio suite, you lose the feeling of space the open plan studio gives you. It IS nice to have 2 rooms though and if you're staying a little longer or with someone with a different sleep schedule or different entertainment tastes, it's nice to have the option of two rooms and two tvs. The sofa in my 1-bedroom suite was very comfortable and I suppose one could sleep on it, but it was not a pull-out sofa with a bed or anything. The bathrooms were lovely and I really liked the full-size toiletries.The hotel offers a nice, homey, simple breakfast that I'd describe as continental with extras (eggs, youghurt, some days baked beans or tomatoes, some days grilled mushrooms, some days bacon or sausage). Everything is tasty and feels fresh and not mass produced even though this isn't a particularly small hotel. I don't think any other meals are offered at the hotel, although I think there was a happy hour I didn't attend. At the reception, there's a little grocery that sells snacks and frozen meals you can whip up in your room at a pinch if for some reason you couldn't get your shopping done. There is a room service menu available in the rooms and room service runs pretty late (maybe even 24h?) so that option is also there. Wi-fi is freely available for unlimited devices and it's pretty good for free hotel wifi.If you're trying to save money and/or you're concerned about your waistline and want to eat healthy, you're not limited to Waitrose and M&S Food in Westfield or the dining options in the mall. There's a smaller, less fancy mall on the other side of the train station called Stratford Center and they have a farmer's market type situation right the middle of the mall with fresh produce of different kinds. There's a butcher shop (the proper kind where they attend to you) and a Sainsbury's supermarket much cheaper than the Westfield offerings. Basically, food is not a problem.The staff is incredibly friendly and professional, very helpful and a real credit to the hotel. There is a lot of seating between the lobby (on the top floor) and the breakfast room with a spectacular view and newspapers and magazines so it's a lovely place to hang out as well pre or post breakfast or if you need to checkout early. I sat there only once because I arrived really early before my room was ready (and was also allowed to have breakfast even though I wasn't entitled to it). Overall, I had a lovely stay and it's definitely one of my go tos, if it's available when I'm in London.

Stayed at the Staybridge Suites for one night mid-week to visit the O2 and Westfield Shopping Centre. Excellent location for both. The staff were a delight and extremely helpful. Reason for staying was my mother's birthday and we received a bottle of wine in the room as a celebration...very nice touch. One of the cleanest rooms I have EVER stayed in and breakfast was plentiful, fresh and delicious!All in all...a FABULOUS hotel which I would highly recommend!

The hotel is well located in Stratford City with good access to the tube, mainline trains and car parking.The suite was excellent and the kitchenette was fully equipped including a dishwasher (with tablets). Breakfast was included and there was a good selection available. The staff were particularly welcoming and friendly.

column9: Perfect location for Olympic Park visit
column10: Very modern, clean and comfortabe hotel, with rooms that have the added luxury of having a small kitchen area that doesn't detract from the size of the room. Superking size bed and a lovely bathroom. Member of staff at check in was so friendly and did the very best to welcome us. Buffet breakfast was excellent and well stocked. I would recommend this hotel which has some amazing views of the Olympic Park.

What a great stay fantastic welcoming staff full of information family and I were so impressed that we booked again for a family annual Christmas do before we left  this hotel would be talked amongst our family for a very long time we couldn't fault it and just to top it off the hotel is placed around shops and restaurants !!!!!

column9: At last suite style rooms at affordable prices
column10: I normally stay in Staybridge's in the US and am now glad to see them here in the UK. For the space and service you get there is no better value. The rooms are a good size and well appointed, having a kitchenette is a great benefit. Thankfully the attention to service has also been transferred, with a friendly attitude plus a free reception (drinks & nibbles) on week nights. Add to that great transport links, the olympic park and Westfield shopping centre on your doorstep, i'll be making this a base for London visits in future.

We found this hotel through the Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed.The views are spectacular, you can see the O2, Financial District, Shard and lots of other London landmarks. Oh yes, I nearly forgot, The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park!!!The rooms are really well appointed and have their own kitchen facilties, and we mean everything you need, not just a token gesture! The room has everything and is really comfortable.You have a great reception and lounge area on the 12th floor with an observation platform giving you exemplary views of the London skyline and the Olympic Park, which is literally within shot-put distance!The location is also great; fill your boots with shopping at the Westfield, pretty much every culinary taste you may want, and a rail/tube network to get to the heart of everything else going on in the capital!Cant really say enough, this is worth every penny of a trip to London!

the Hotel is just excellent, an amazing concept , we booked a a suites with a sofa bed and kitchenette. Close to the London Stafford city  underground and train station,the maul Stafford westfield which very useful. The suites is very clean and have a very nice view.An amazing breakfast better than few 4 * Hotels with an excellent and very kind staff especially Moussa and the Lady during the Breakfast thank you so much for your Kindliness.If we go back to London for sure our stay will be on this amazing Hotel.

Just had to write about the excellent service at Staybridge Suites Stratford City.  The evening social on St Patrick's Day was a wonderful surprise.  Guinness, Jameson's Whiskey and then as an added bonus, some Irish Stew courtesy of the Holiday Inn.  I wouldn't get this at home!Thank you Nicholas, Mary and Steve (you should definitely save the tie for next year!)

Stayed in a one bedroom suite. Lovely living room complete with kitchen microwave hob, and fridge. large bedroom and ensuite bathroom.The rate came with complementary breakfast which had a lot of choice.You could buy things from a pantry area which wasn't overpriced and with Waitrose and Marks's nearby great if you wanted a meal in your room.Very smart and not bad value. Will definitely stay again.

column9: Booked by the company, will be back myself
column10: Stayed here two weekends in the last month while working in the city, but will definitely be back. Great base for a trip to London. Overlooks the Olympic Park, and is part of the Westfield shopping centre. 5 minute walk to the tube, and 15 minutes from the centre of the city and all the sights. Staff were polite and helpful, and the rooms were spotless and very comfortable, with kitchen area which I didn't use cos I was working but was a great idea if you're staying for a holiday.  Great buffet breakfast sets you up for the day. Definitely recommended

My husband works in London and frequently stays overnight. Our usual favourite hotel was not available so we tried the Staybridge Suites at Stratford, which offered very good value on the night in question, and has a great location right in the heart of the fabulous Westfield shopping centre.I was really very impressed with the hotel. Check-in was quick and the young man on the desk could not have been more polite and attentive. The room was spacious with a small kitchen area, which was very useful. We bought some food from the Waitrose at the Westfield centre, instead of dining out, which was a nice change. My only issue here was the lack of cutlery. We may have caught them on a poor day, but I think someone should perhaps have an inventory check.They had a manager's reception on the night we stayed, which provided wine and beer, with snacks/salad. It was really well done, and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming.The air conditioning in the room worked well, and the window could also be opened, which I like. The bed was pretty comfortable, too. Basic Wifi is free, but my husband and I paid the ¬£7 premium fee which allowed us to access our own stuff on the Apple TV that was provided in the room. I really liked that and I hope other hotels start to implement the same service.All in all, it was a great stay, and I would highly recommend staying here.

Stayed here as going to concert at O2 . This a great location for eating shopping and really convenient for 02 . Room was ready when we  arrived ,it as excellent lots of space nice lounge bath room , kitchen & bedroom. Breakfast was also excellent lots of choice. Will be back soon

column9: Best Value Hotel I've EVER Stayed In
column10: You will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here. Paid under ¬£100 a night through Hotels.com and couldn't believe it could be this good. Quality of room and Hotel is fantastic. You even get a kitchen with microwave, 2 hotplates, fridge, dishwasher, crockery and cutlery for four people, pots and pans, washing up liquid and sponges, three different sets of glasses and cooking utensils. Included in the cost is a huge choice on the hot and cold buffet breakfast. Which was good quality. Staff are great and location has the biggest choice of restaurants within 100m of the hotel. Rail links within 100m both mainline and underground. Views from rooms are fantastic across London. Great lounge area to relax in that has an outdoor balcony with great views across the Olympic Park and Docklands. Cannot praise this Hotel Enough.

This is a great place to stay in London, near loads of sites with really friendly staff and excellent facilities. Whether you are on holiday, or business with or without a family I recommend this hotel. I particularly like the social evenings and  the relaxed homelike atmosphere.

We booked the staybridge suites Stratford city as a present for my parents,for their 60th wedding anniversary and my father's 79 birthday. I picked this hotel as I had stayed here before, and thought the location in the middle of Westfields would be ideal.I phoned the hotel a few days before they were due to arrive to ask as it was a special occasion could they have a room with a view of the city, they said they would do their best but could not guarantee this. When we arrived at reception we were told that they had been upgraded to a apartment suite. On arrival at the room there was a complementary bottle of wine and a lovely card wishing them a happy anniversary and birthday. Which I know made it extra special for them. I would like to say a big thank-you to staybridge suites and all their fantastic staff for making their stay a special one

Just got back from a special weekend. Arrived to find out they upgraded our room had ballon, wine and chocolates in the room. View was brilliant all over Olympic park views over London . It was spotless lots of space nice living room. Large comfie large bed large beautiful bathroom. Staff were all fantastic. Lots of shops, Resturant, casino everything on ur doorstep. Loved it can't wait to book another trip.

We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a really excellent stay. Rooms are exactly as they look on the website. We were warmly greeted by Carlo and opted for a room on the 12th floor. This is where reception is. You will also find the well appointed breakfast area on this floor along with the lovely lounge/ tv area. You get a great view from here overlooking the Olympic Stadium and beyond. We made good use of the comfortable lounge area. Breakfast has something for everyone. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Room was spotlessly clean, comfy  and had a fantastic shower. There is a free laundry facility. You can buy snacks, drinks, microwavable meals etc. at reception. The location is great within the Westfield shopping mall with loads of bars and restaurants nearby. We flew to London City airport and got the DLR train directly to Stratford. We had a minor issue with a light bulb which was taken care of straight away. I can't fault our stay in any way and would highly recommend this property.

It was the best hotel we ever stayed in London!  The staff was the best!  They gave us a welcome card and freshly baked cookies when we we're checking in .  What an awesome welcome!  The staff was also quick to help when we had questions.  The room was excellent and very clean.  They also offer free laundry.The plus was also the hotel was next door to a shopping mall, very close to the train stations and good restaurants.  I highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed in Staybridge Stratford between December 2013 right through to October 2014, and I could not fault the place. Absolutely brilliant. Staff were always friendly and talked - they got to know me in the 10 months. Room was always cleaned spotlessly every morning whilst at work. The rooms were a good size with the kitchen area separate from the bedroom. Sofa bed in living room, and if i ever had a friend staying, staff always responded promptly to me asking for extra duvets etc, this was never a problem. If I ever had any problems, blown bulbs etc, management always responded and sorted the issue really quickly. Location wise it was great, right beside Westfield so good for shopping. Could rant on for days about the level of care and attention I received but couldnt possibly mention everything, so will just leave it here. Well done to everyone at Staybridge Stratford and thank you for making my stay so enjoyable... "more Home than Hotel"

awesome hotel, great rooms, an amazing shopping center connected to it. could not find pancakes in the breakfast otherwise it was a lovely experience. staff is friendly, helping, you even find a laundry there, could not wish for anything more :D

The hotel is perfectly placed for a weekend city break and what a fabulous hotel it is with a wonderful relaxed atmosphere. The suite was brilliant with everything we needed and The staff were amazing and so professional giving us lots of tips on places to see and cant wait to go back!!

I stayed here for 20 months and must say the staff did everything they could to make it feel like home! The fitness and laundry rooms are great and the rooms are nice and big. Will definitely be staying here again when in East London.

I took my partner for the weekend at London Stratford city. The hotel is in perfect location for shopping. All the rooms are suites. I would have to say the best hotel I have ever stayed in. A large room for the relaxing area and a separate bedroom and bathroom. It also has a kitchen area with everything you need. If you have any doubts about paying the extra money, do not quibble. We will be coming back again. Thanks staybridge.

Recently stayed a night in one of the Deluxe Studio Suites.  It was refreshing to find the rooms looked identical to the pictures on the website.  Decor tasteful, clean and modern and there was room to move around the bed!  The shower was lovely - perfect if like us, you like to shower together!  The area is great and the view is amazing although nothing can beat how it must have looked during the Olympics - ah, what a wonderful Summer that was!  The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is the breakfast experience.  Whilst the food choice was extensive and the staff were friendly, everything kept running out in minutes, even the forks!  This resulted in guests constantly having to ask staff to replenish items but not enough was brought out or the dishes were too small so everyone who was already waiting emptied supplies again within seconds.  I completely understand that if more food is put out, more will be taken and lets face it, most people are greedy in these circumstances but the situation could be made better by a bigger hot food area and larger containers for the eggs, sausages and bacon and larger containers for the knives and forks.  Hot chocolate would be nice too but that's only a really minor item and only because I don't drink tea or coffee!  Overall a lovely experience and I would definitely stay again.

We needed a hotel in London last Saturday at very short notice and quite by chance found this at Stratford City shopping centre and is part of the Holiday Inn group, built for the Olympics.I think it is designed more for the purpose of staying a number of days etc rather than for one night but really loved it. The reception is ultra modern with all the communal areas bright and spacious. Nicely decorated but most impressively spotlessly clean.We had a studio on the 9th floor with a king size bed, well appointed bathroom with a very large shower and a kitchen that lacked for nothing. Again beautifully designed and very clean throughout.We also got a free self service hot buffet breakfast which was excellent.The front of house staff had a smile and were extremely helpful. Especially about the car park which we got for the discounted price of ¬£9 instead of ¬£50! Also directions to the tube which was so convenient.If you want a very comfortable stay at fantastic value the stay here. We definitely will again!

Location is perfect! Next to stratford station which can take you to central london in less than 20 minutes. It is also in the middle of a huge westfield shopping mall and loads of fancy restaurants to choose from. The hotel itself is good boasting of high quality service from their friendly staff and the view of the olympic park is stunning. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are well equipped and spotless. The breakfast menu was very good too and restaurant staff are also very helpful. There is 24 hours free coffee station, strong free wifi everywhere in the hotel. Its been an absolute pleasure staying here. Will definitely come back and recommend.

Just returned from work trip in London, stayed at Staybridge the first time (have stayed at their hotel in Birmingham). They had a good rate on Booking.com, otherwise it would have been to expensive because I think their rates are quite high. But, it 's an excellent hotel: staff are great, location superb (2 min walk from Stratford stn, next to Westfield shopping centre), overlooks the Olympic park. There is a gym, huge dining area and apartments have fully equipped kitchenette. You are spoiled for choice as far as the restaurants around the hotel go. I always thought Stratford was a bit far from central London, but now I know that's not the case - takes 5 min to get from Stratford to Liverpool Street Stn on Tube. And if you have time for some retail therapy while in London - Westfield shopping centre is huge.  Highly recommend.

Stayed here with my wife and son for a few days while she was on business.The hotel is situated in the Westfield shopping centre close the the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.This is good as there are plenty of shops, restaurants and things to do nearby.The hotel is also handy for Stratford train and underground stations and is roughly 30 mins journey into the centre of London.The rooms are well appointed with the usual tea coffee etc. I like the fact you also have a small kitchen with microwave, dishwasher etc.The reception is on the 12th floor and you are able to buy small microwave meals as well as snacks like pot noodles and crisps etc.I would be happy to stay here again.

I have stayed in a fair few hotels in my time, but this hotel was fantastic. Built in kitchen in which included microwave, kettle, dishwasher, fridge. The room itself was a good size which consisted of a Kings size bed, Apple TV, Kiddie care cot bed for my daughter. The bathroom was modern with a power shower. And the staff also were fantastic! I will be visiting again for sure

Stayed at this hotel for a week during our annual 'pilgrimage' to London. Great location with tube, train and bus connections to the city, a mega-size shopping centre next door with lots of neat places to eat, and a friendly staff and spacious, well-maintained mini-apartment. Will come again.

Fantastic hotel, with superb rooms. Clean, spacious, comfortable. Full kitchen, best shower I've ever had at any hotel. Great service, free cookies, fantastic location and view from the room. Safe, ironing board and iron, cutlery, fridge, pizza cutter. Equipped with everything. You would be happy to live there.The hotel is right in the centre of the Chestnut Plaza, near to the bars, casino, restaurants and shopping centre. Literally no more than a 2 minute walk to anywhere.Would happily stay here again, for any Stratford/London base. By far the best hotel room I've stayed in in this country. Had many other facilities such as a pantry, laundry room etc. Think it had a gym.A little expensive for 1 night, 2 nights better value. But you get what you pay for, which is top notch stuff. So worth every penny.

column9: Great place, lovely staff.... TV options/stations could be improved.
column10: I spent a week(6 nights) in this hotel, the fist 3 in a studio suite then moved to a king one bed suite as I required more space. It's a really nice hotel, within the Westfield mall. Considerably nice views from window. The housekeeping/maintenance staff do a great job and called at least 3 times a day(which is nice if you were asleep/not around previously), the concierges and all the reception staff were very friendly and nice. Although the staff, location and facilities in general were great. The TV channels were basic. A simple addition of a basic Sky package(News, etc) or something would go a long way.

Right within the Westfied shopping Centre - I almost wished my visit had been for shopping rather than a base close to where we were working early the next morning!  It's quite a late check-in at 4pm but it's a great place to stay - particularly if you want to be independent and to stay in quality accommodation that provides a well equipped kitchen, bathroom with nice smelling toiletries and a comfortable bed with flat screen TV.  It's a very tall building and reception is on the 12th floor.  The Staff were very helpful and breakfast is included and was very good - particularly the coffee.   There's a good choice of restaurants very close to the entrance but book as they are popular.  I also really enjoyed my view from a high floor and I'd happily stay there again.

This hotel was just perfect for us! The rooms were really spacious, decorated to a lovely taste and high standard and the facilities were brilliant - kitchen, iron, everything you could need! The staff have been really nice as well - Can't do enough for you and always greet you when given opportunity. Food is lovely (You can also eat at the holiday inn restaurant which is in the same complex) 24 hour pantry service for snacks and a take away service in rooms. Love this gorgeous hotel - views are amazing and location couldn't be better!

Yet another week in London meant that I needed somewhere to stay. I've been here before, and this was a very welcome return.The room is a bit bigger than a normal hotel room, in good decorative order, plus you get a fridge, dish-washer and cooking facilities (2 rings and a combi microwave oven). Bed gets made for you / bathroom cleaned daily (Mon-Fri). Laundry and gym also available.One advantage over many other apartments is that they include breakfast - the choice is similar to what you'd get in the Holiday Inn, but a much more relaxed atmosphere. In addition, the coffee / tea / juices are available there for you (free) during your stay.Tue-Thur evenings, 7 till 8 they have a "reception"... so a free glass of wine and some cheese, biscuits, dips etcAll staff I met were very pleasant and relaxed.

I LOVED my two night stay at the Staybridge Suites last weekend. My better half was celebrating her hen night in our flat, and I wanted to play poker in the casino next door, so I booked a room and it was awesome.The studio with its kitchen and bathroom was spacious and fresh (clean, design, view ect.), the internet was fast (and free), and the hospitality of the guys in the reception, breakfast area and pantry etc. was some of the best I have encountered in the UK.I'm now looking for an excuse to go stay again. So although it is only a few miles from our flat I may go this weekend. Afterall it's close to the shops, cinema, restaurants .... Maybe I should bring my fiance this time... hmmm, or maybe it should just be a treat for me :)

Have used Staybridge Suites elsewhere.  Used Stratford City (no it's not a city but anyway) on a business trip.  Excellent room, professional service, great view over the Olympic Park and nice self-catering facilities.  Would certainly use again for business or family.

column9: Always consistent. Great place to stay.
column10: Fantastic place to stay if you are visiting the 02. The hotel is well located next to the International station in Westfield. The staff were friendly, the restaurant and bar area is pleasant and the room are as always consistently good.

Had an overnight stay after attending NTA awards with my daughter. We usually stay at Premier Lodge Stratford but Staybridge was better value as breakfast was included in the same price. Absolutely first class. Clean , modern , lovely large comfortable room with fantastic view. We had a kitchen complete with fridge cooker ...everything we needed and more. The staff were very friendly. Breakfast was indeed a feast. Will definitely recommend anyone to stay there and looking forward to my next stay

column9: Excellent facilities, great location and very helpful staff
column10: The suites are really a bedroom with a small kitchen facility, but are nevertheless very well appointed for a couple. The room was immaculate, the communal areas excellent, breakfast really good, and the staff were tremendous. Really can't fault this place at all. Access to the Westfield centre (and good value overnight parking) together with easy access to Stratford station and tube made our stay here really convenient.

Unfortunately we could only stay one night but our stay at the Stratford Staybridge Suites was fantastic. From the chocolate cookie on arrival to the fresh coffee on departure. The accommodation was clean and modern and a credit to the hotel. The staff were friendly, polite and keen to help. The breakfast delicious and what a view. I would thoroughly recommend the Staybridge Suites and will be back soon.

I spent two nights here on a recent trip to London and really enjoyed how convenient the location of this hotel is. You are literally right beside the westfield mall, the Olympic grounds, and the tube station. Was quick and easy to do everything and the hotel itself was very nice. Our room was spacious and clean with Apple tv and a kitchenette. The breakfast selection in the morning was fantastic and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We had a minor issue with our tv and it was solved by a member of staff from the front desk in minutes. We were there a Sunday and Monday night. Monday morning we were woken by noise from the room above us and they did test the fire alarms the Monday morning which apparently they do every Monday but over all the stay was fantastic and I will return in the future.

This was my first stay at a Staybridge Hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised!  The suites are well furnished and the kitchenette well equipped. The cost was comparable to a normal hotel in London.  The staff, especially the receptionist who was on duty when we arrived were extremely helpful and had a really pleasant manner.  Will definitely go back.

What an amazing place to stay.  For the same price or better than many standard hotel rooms in London you get a lovely mini kitchen with your room, including a hob and dishwasher.  our room had fantastic views of the Olympic park also to be found in the lounge areas.  Everything is spotless.  Quiet at night.  Very helpful and professional staff.  It only takes 7 minutes to get to Liverpool street, and you have much of what you might need on your doorstep in Westfield shopping centre.  I will definitely will recommend to others, and hope to return myself.

column9: Great staff, great facilities and great location!
column10: My title says it all really.  I recently returned from a 2-night stay and can only say that the reviewers here are correct: this hotel truly is a home away from home.Upon check-in my friend and I enjoyed chatting with the friendly and helpful staff.  Nothing was too much trouble!  The spacious suite was perfect.  The breakfast 'hub' has a full breakfast and really something for everyone.  Bacon, eggs, sausage, baked beans if you want an English hot breakfast and cereals, fruit, bagel, toast etc if you prefer.  Indeed, have both as I did!  The 24-hour coffee/tea service is also very nice.The hotel is in the Westfield shopping mall area and therefore very convenient for shopping and for esting out.  Central London is about 20-25 minutes away by tube.All the staff were amazing but special kudos to Bindi who was so helpful and friendly and genuinely seemed to care about us!  I hope you make it to Japan someday!The next time I'm in London I'll be staying again!

I found this property very nice to stay. I have been a guest of SBS, Cairo for quite a long time but I can say SBS, Stratford city is also a nice place to live in. Hotel staff is quite friendly. I would appreciate efforts of Debbie for providing me vegetarian items in the breakfast.I would request hotel management to provide more vegetarian items in the hot buffet breakfast.Thanks

This is truly a home away from home. I have been mostly on projects which require travelling to different countries for extended duration in last 10 years. Staybridge Suites at Stratford London is one of the best places I have stayed so far. Everyone is very helpful and wonderful.Today I came to post this review more so especially for two ladies - Debbie and Mary who did excellent preparation of nice curries this evening for a surprise...!!!Thank you guys...you rock!!!Mohit

What an amazing surprise! Their free cheese and wine evenings (Tuesday-Thursday's) are good enough, but this evening we were lucky enough to enjoy some gorgeous curry too. Big thanks to Debbie and Mary for serving it with friendliness and a nice glass of red. Big thumbs up!

column9: Another fabulous experience with the Staybridge team
column10: Staying away from home on business is always tough but the Staybridge team at Stratford have taken the time to ensure that the stay away is as pleasant as possible. Ask any member of the team for something and they will assist you, whether it's their job or not, Nothing is too much trouble. There was even a welcome extended to my family when they visited me which was above and beyond what you would expect. The rooms are large and spacious with one of the biggest beds I have ever slept in. If you want feather pillows... Quick call to reception and housekeeping arrive with your pillows!Fantastic breakfast choice every day prepared by Debbie and her team and Mary, Jordan, Musa and Merrily always greet you with a smile and a friendly greeting. The managers socials held on Tuesday through Thursday nights are a great way to meet other guests and the Staybridge team. Alcohol or soft drinks are complimentary and accompanied with various nibbles and snacks and occasionally hot food is also provided. The rooms do have catering facilities and even a dishwasher for your dirty pots which the housekeeping team will load for you. Add in the free use of washing machines and dryers plus the gym and there is everything you could possibly need to make a long term stay as comfortable as possible. If there is something missing... Just ask and it's usually provided!Overall I can personally recommend the Staybridge Stratford for long term stays and know that even short term and transient guests are greeted and catered for with the same excellent level of service. Thank you Staybridge team for making my stay comfortable.

column9: If I could stay here every time I visit London, I would!
column10: This hotel is excellent! My husband and I stayed here for one night, and left wishing we could stay for many more. We were able to check in early which was a bonus and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The lady on reception even remembered us the next day and asked us about our time in London. The room was fantastic! Very clean, quiet and large by London standards, with an amazingly comfortable bed and pillows. We slept like babies! The breakfast was delicious, plenty of food with stunning views for miles all across the Olympic Village and further. Excellently located right in the middle of Westfields Shopping Plaza, so plenty of places to eat and drink and less than 5 minutes walk to Stratford tube station. Perfect place to stay for our weekend away and we will definitely stay again.

We spent 3 nights there over the Xmas period with my wife and mother visiting my daughter and son in law who live in East London..we were in a one bedroom suite, mother in a standard suite...a great experience, brilliant staff and so pleasing to have young hotel staff who can actually communicate intelligently with all age groups..a credit to the management team and of course to their parents!! Excellent buffet breakfast, great location for Westfield, easy rail access to Central London, spotlessly clean, great rooms and amenities. Btw we live in Dubai and previously Hong Kong so are used to and probably spoiled by having 5 star hotels on our doorstep but Staybridge really surpassed our expectations...cannot recommend strongly enough..probably best value for money in London currently.

I had stayed at Staybridge several times and for long durations and its one of the best places  i have been at. When I got my family to London, we all stayed at Staybridge and the kids just loved staying here. Its not just a hotel - it has a small pantry and the interiors give your the feeling of Home. The location is just amazing - inside the Westfield Stratford City Mall - and just 3 minutes walk from the Stratford Station.The staff is courteous and helpful. Breakfast is served hot and suits everybody's taste.I recommend this Hotel.

I was staying in Staybridge Suites for a week during business trip in December. They used the slogan "Feel like home" in their flyers etc. - and you could really feel it. Room was cosy and comfy - with fully-equipped kitchen, large bathroom and king-size bed. The stuff was helpful and hospitable, the breakfast they served - delicious. And such an amazing view for a huge part of London! Besides, the hotel is in a great location, inside the shopping centre - just a short walk to a underground, DLR & train station, well connected to Cannary Wharf or city center. I wouldn't mind staying there longer!

Stayed here for the night on 20/12/14 after a day of Christmas shopping. Stayed in a 'suite' which was basically a normal room with kitchen facilities. Sink made an awful noise all night, missing lightbulbs and one towel for the two of us. When we checked in we were told 'You have a lovely view of the Olympic Park' turned out we had a view of a car park and some rubbish.

This hotel is in a very good location, right inside the shopping centre & across the road from the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. We were able to park close by in the underground car park of the shopping centre for a reasonable ¬£6 for 24 hours. The full english breakfast was excellent, there was also plenty of choice and the food quality was good. The staff were very polite & attentive, the room was clean & well appointed. The hotel is between 2 busy stations both only a 5 minute walk away with excellent links to London & many other destinations.

Just returned from a 2 night stay, what a great hotel. Excellent location, great facilities and the staff are amazing. From check in to check out all the staff were great. Very friendly and helpful. Used the hotel as a central base as we were going to a gig at the O2 then going into the west end for Christmas lights and shopping. This hotel is a great place to stay as its easy to get in and out of central London. The rooms are very comfortable with great facilities. The kitchen area is very useful and the fridge is great for keeping drinks for the weekend in. Overall a great stay. Will definitely use again.

A very well located hotel.We stayed here for an event at the O2.Flew into London City and got the DLR over to the hotel.The hotel is situated in between the Westfield shopping centre and the Olympic park. Our room had a great view over the stadium and the park.Well appointed room and cleverly laid out with kitchen.Would definitely stay here again.

column9: Faultess Service! When can I return?!
column10: Where do I start? From the moment we arrived at the Staybridge Suites I knew we were in for a treat. I stayed with my boyfriend and parents for 1 night prior to us running 10km in Victoria Park. Upon arrival we were greated by Joao - just the most welcoming man. Nothing was too much trouble. We asked questions, asked if it was possible to have 1 room later so we could return to shower following the run - nothing was too much trouble. AND he gave us free cookies! BONUS!The hotel is located at Westfield Shopping Centre so there's plenty to do and places to eat. Right by the Vue cinema too if shopping isn't your thing. Or why not take a stroll around the Olympic Park - it's right across the road.The rooms were lovely - HUGE bed, HUGE shower, kitchen facilities - I couldn't fault a thing. Breakfast - which was included was delightful. Well laid out, attentive staff on hand to help or advise. Hot cooked breakfast, toast, fruit. I can't wait to return. I just hope more Staybridge Suites open up around the UK. I know what my choice would be from now on.

Awesome place, have stayed there many times in the last couple of years. What makes it special is the staff and location. Staff outshine really, they are what makes this place truly a cut above the rest.My only suggestion will be bigger pan options in the kitchenette.

Great hotel - concept is home from home and its as close as you can get.  Rooms, facilities and staff all exellent. I stay a lot in hotels in the city of London but have made this my first choice even though its Stratford. I love the breakfast set up and the fact tea and coffe is on tap all day, when other hotels are charging high prices.  The fact that you can cook in your room is a bonus and the kitchen facilities provided are awesome.

Stayed here for 2 nights when visiting West Ham for a football match!Every member of staff  were very pleasant so a big thanks to the Hotel manager for creating such a good standard.Room was very comfortable and had everything you need. Shower was great with a rain forest type shower.Breakfast was included and everything available.Plenty shops and restaurants nearby and handy for the tube.Would I stay again - yes sure would!

column9: Amazing place - Best London hotel location
column10: We had an unknown checking-in tech error which wasn't both parties fault but took a while to be solved. The amazing part was the customer care given to us while we waited for solutions - Marilia and her team at the reception treated us with great care and understanding.The feel of the hotel is like being at home (if yours is homely & posh - lol) and has won over the hearts of my family & friends.

We stay in many hotels and this is the first one in a long time that we agreed-WOW.The staff-unparalleled.  Super nice.  We arrived really early from our trans-Atlantic flight.  I was wiped out and they offered us bottled water, coffee, tea while they arranged a room.  We had just missed breakfast, but if we had arrived a little sooner, it was available.The room was large, the kitchen was very well-equipped.  Apple tv  and internet were included.  The included breakfast was very good, providing plenty of options.  Cereal, oatmeal, breads, meats and cheeses, pastries, jams and jellies, yogurt.  Several juices, teas and gourmet coffee machines.The manager's evening cocktail hour is remarkable.  Draft beer and wines, soft drinks.  The food is the exception to the norm.  Pate, fruit, crackers, hummus, chips, veggies, breads, cheeses.  Yes, PATE!  The hotel is near the train line and located in the Olympic Village.  It is in the Mall and very convenient.  If you are looking for a hotel for the Rugby World Cup, this is a great choice!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Stayed here for a week during the last week of Nov-14. Staff is super friendly, taken care of my taxi, luggage, feel at home. My next stay in London is going to be at staybridge, Stratford. Definetly recommend to all.

Stayed here from friday 28th to sunday 30th and was fab from start to finish, on entering staff on hand to help to tell you which way to go in the lifts to reception,  staff on reception were all very helful couldnt do enough, we stayed in room 803 which was a nice lay out little kitchen area, with mod cons, cosy little sofa tv area, and really comfy bed, and lovely shower wet room with lovely complimentary shampoo and condition and shower gel, also had hairdryer in the draw, iron and ironing board so what more could u need also aircon. Shops and restaurants on your doorstep great base for tubes and buses if you want to visit places all with in easy walking distance. Also considering we was near the lifts didnt have any noise from other people, and didnt hear any doors slamming as u would normally in hotels.Breakfast was excellent catered for all tastes plenty of choice, even got gluten free bread on request for the hubby, it was all beautifully set out and immaculately clean, all staff we chatted to from start to finish were very polite nothing was to much trouble well done we shall be sure to visit again soon üòä

Great stay here. Staff friendly, easy to find from the DLR and the underground, and a great choice of restaurants nearby.I stayed in a studio room. Plenty of room, good kitchen, very comfy bed. Staff can't do enough to help.Breakfast was good bearing in mind it's free!!

Stayed there for a night with my partner. Room was very clean, spacious shower, kitchen had all the tools you need for cooking up a meal. Lots of shops nearby for groceries. Felt like home. Breakfast was perfect too! Nicolas was very friendly and helpful. Great service from him!

20 Sept to 5th Oct 2014. My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom suite No 1110 on the 11th floor overlooking the Olympic Park. I must say the suite was perfect for our 15night stay. Separate bedroom, lounge and kitchen also a spacious bathroom. Lots of shops and eating places right outside in the shopping centre. The A/C took a bit of working out we did not seem able to set it where we wanted. All the train services and buses also on the doorstep. Breakfast was O/K but is crying out for an egg station. Scrambled eggs end up like rubber. Staff very polite and helpful. The social drink and nibbles during the week was very pleasant. A down side was the bad behaviour of several children. Hands in the food is very off putting. At each night and early morning there was lots of thumping noise coming from above our room which I know for a fact was caused by children running around in the lounge area on the 12th floor. I actually went up there one evening and two children were playing with a ball up there. It is a shame that parents allow their children to behave this way  and I believe this establishment would benefit from making it adults only. It is a bit hard to see why families would want to stay there as there is no facilities for children. We would stay there again but in a room not affected by the noise from the 12th floor. The architect should be flogged as it easy enough to install acoustic insulation when the building is in progress

column9: Great location - Shame about AC and Breakfast
column10: I've stayed here on a number of times, it's a great location, easy parking and friendly staff. But I couldn't eat breakfast, the water from the tea comes from an urn, so tastes like old hard dishwater. The eggs tasted like powder with water ( from the urn)  and the sausages like sawdust. Hayho guess thats what ¬£169 gets you in London these days, thankfully Costa coffee was open in Westfield below. Th AC in the room did not work it was stuck on 24C, despite turning it down to 18C. It also came on automatically in the early hours of the morning, full bast ?

I only stayed for one night- but will use this hotel again on future trips as I was extremely impressed with the room, facilities and friendly staff. Super well appointed room with a comfortable bed and great shower in the en-suite.One tip...to get to the hotel from Stratford station, leave through the main exit and go outside (not into the shopping centre), immediately go up the steps on the left by Marks & Spencer. The hotel is at the end of this pedestrian shopping street on the left.

Stayed for 1 night...lovely and clean room...awesome shower facilities. Excellent breakfast. Only disappointing area with this hotel was the mattress which was extremely hard and left with back issues :(Staff were all lovely. Especially Nicholas, who checked us out... thanks dude... :)

Very nice comfortable accommodation.  Staff were so friendly, very helpful. Accommodation was excellent value, I was apprehensive as initially I wanted to book a decent hotel, but no need to worry looking back. Great location too for shopping.

My first time at this brand, but definitely won't be my last! A great location with good public transport access, fabulous views from the 12th floor reception out over the Olympic Park and further to Canary Wharf, the river and the city. Good rooms, excellent showers, very pleasant public areas where you definitely feel comfortable as a single traveller lingering over a drink or the newspaper. Really good range of well presented food for breakfast. But to top it out, the staff are remarkable. In a city where to find a hotel with more than one staff member whose English makes conversation comfortable, the staff here are great - engaging, polite, helpful, clearly enthusiastic about their hotel and happy to go the extra mile whatever the request.

This is my third stay at this particular hotel in almost as many months and feel compelled to have to write a review about it. Each time we arrive we are greeted by a smile by reception staff who makes us feel welcome. While checking in we are asked a number of small questions such as where have we travelled from and how our journey was so we are not just standing there while the room cards are prepared. The rooms are clean and ready and beds are extremely comfortable. This was the first occasion we had ordered room service and we were very impressed. The portions were good and tasted lovely. There is a choice of breakfast options with staff always around making sure everyone has assistance if required. On check out we are asked if we wanted to leave our bags there so as not to need to carry them around while shopping or we if needed a taxi. So to some it all up, we would not hesitate to book it again, it is now our first choice.

Stayed over on the weekend of the 8/9th November and am pleased to say that it was nothing short of 5 star excellence, before our trip we looked around the whole of the city and couldn't find anything that remotely compared that was in our budget. On arrival to the Staybridge Suites  both Mel and I were bowled over by the professionalism of the staff and equally pleased by the very high standard of the hotel and its location.The room was very clean, with the exception of the previous tenants last meal still clung in the air..... needles to say the bed was amazingly comfortable and a welcome after a long walk around the Capital.Breakfast in the morning was plentiful, although the cooked food was a little on the cool side I certainly had my fill with the fabulous sunny view of London's skyline over Mels' shoulder......

Stayed here October/November 2013 and gave 5 stars. Sad to say in October this year their standards have dropped. Rooms, location and sleep comfort are all still very good but they have dropped the ball for service.Check in time is 3:00pm. We arrived at 3:10pm and our room was still not ready till 3:30. Check was very clinical with no smiles or "welcome to Staybridge". In both rooms of our suite the windows looked like they had not been cleaned properly, or at all, for quite some time. When the box of tissues in the bathroom runs out, instead of replacing  with a new one, they just stuff a handful of tissues into the empty box.Check out was even more clinical than check in. All that was said to me was "you have prepaid so there is nothing more to pay". There was no "have a nice day or hope you enjoyed stay". NOTHING. As a IHG Rewards Club Gold Elite member I found the check in/out attitudes very disappointing. The only time I felt valued as a guest was when the young lady at reception (Australian I think) assisted me to print my airline boarding passes.Sorry to say it is unlikely that I will stay here again and will only recommend to friends with reservations.

I had an amazing stay in this beautiful hotel, amazing view of the Olympic stadium...very friendly and helpful staff...I would definitely comeback to this hotel and recommend to anyone with pleasure!!! Forgot to say that the rooms are very spacious and lovely

If attending Excel, as I was, then this is perfect. Just a few stops on the DLR and you are there. The hotel is excellent, really friendly staff and great rooms, though smaller than the normal Staybridge rooms (that's London for you!).It is actually part of Westfield shopping centre, so no problem with choice of shops, and there are two main railway stations within a very short walk offering access to East London and the West End.

About a 20 minute easy tube ride to center city. Located within Europe's largest mall, directly across from a Casino and neat indoor / outdoor walking environment within a mall complex. Also across from the site of the 2012 Olympics.  Not cheap at all, but as opposed to some of the smaller rooms I had read about in London, we had a very nice one bedroom suite. First class service , great breakfast , great ambiance. Lived up to the reviews as one of the top hotels in the city. If a twenty minute ride on the tube is ok with you to get to center city, and it was fine for us, this place rocks.  Very nice , friendly , helpful staff also.

We stayed at the Staybridge on a Saturday night as part of a trip to London to watch some football. The hotel was conveniently located for the westfield parking at a good overnight rate.All the staff we interacted with were brilliant especially Nichlas who we saw on check in and check out.The hotel amenities were great and the room was very comfy and homely . We had a great view of the Olympic Park too.It's great for the westfield and also stratford station.Will definitely be back for next trip to London.

i have become a regular guest here! Like many others I am so impressed with the warmth of the team there and rooms are really comfortable. On arrival on Bonfire night I was amazed to see that Debbie had put on something of a treat for the " get together" that happens every week Tues - Thurs. This time she excelled herself with bangers and mash, onions, pies and gravy! Really very welcome after travelling. Thanks Debbie see you next week!Paul A

column9: Great Location but watch the VAT
column10: I stayed here after flting into London City airport, I can honestly say that this was one of the warmest welcomes in any IHG hotel I have stayed in. The staff were exemplary, polite, efficient & friendly.The rooms are large & well equipped (even Apple TV), so absolutely no complaints there.Breakfast was hot, plentiful & had a great range of choices, but why do some guests spoil it by seeing fit to stuff their pockets with food from the breakfast buffet ?The only negative is the policy on the website of not including VAT in the price, VAT is not optional so should be reflected in the price without having to read small print. IHG did this a while ago for hotels inside the M25 to make the appear cheaper, judging by my conversation with the desk staff, i am not the only one to have complained about this. I do understand the VAT rate reduces after 4 weeks for long term staying guests, but it should still be shown as a total on the booking.This prevented a very good stay, being an excellent one !!IHG 721119655

Worth every penny.Can't fault anything. Just having a free drink and good hot food at the evening reception.The evening reception is a great chance to relax and meet people.Rooms are great, staff are very friendly and helpful

column9: By far the best hotel I have ever stayed in!
column10: !   I can honestly say I have neverfelt so well looked after and at home in a hotel!  Staybridge Suites Westfield are outstanding.  The hotel is situated  by the Westfield shopping Mall in Stratford. It‚Äôs  an easy walk, even with suitcases , from the train station or tube line at Stratford, and just a quick 15 minute tube ride from the centre of London.  On our arrival, the Reception staff couldn‚Äôt  have been more welcoming, always with a smile and a very efficient service.  Our suites were of a very high standard.  We had a fully equipped kitchen ‚Äì even a dishwasher-  a luxurious bathroom with bath and shower, a proper hairdryer with all the attachments, a bed that was so comfortable that I could have quite easily slept all day and a flat screen TV, as well as a comfy sofa, and an office table and chair. The Wifi connection was very good and with no extra charge for light use.  The room was also totally soundproofed with an easily controlled room temperature thermostat.  Breakfast was substantial, with a daily change to the hot food and always cereals, fruits, croissants and breads.  A coffee machine  was available 24 hours a day, as well as coffee  facilities in the room. There was also a laundry room  and a gym.  We had a fantastic holiday here ‚Äì travelling into London to see the sights was so easy on the Tube, and the shopping at Westfield was fantastic.  There were also many restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel for the days we didn‚Äôt want to go further afield.  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough for anyone wishing to visit London.  Stay at this hotel -  you will not be disappointed!

On check in there was a problem with the room.  There were no other rooms available and we were assured that all would be taken care of in the AM.  (We checked in late after arriving from Lisbon.)  Special thanks to Joao who helped make our first night as comfortable as possible.  All of our concerns were dealt with in the morning to the fullest extent including an email from Wayne the manager.  We also rec'd a handwritten note and chocolates and a promised upgrade for out return.  The staff were also wonderful in giving directions and answering any questions we had about the area.  This hotel is very well situated by the mall and the tube station.  I do suggest that they put directions up on the IHG site from the tube station.  It is about a 5 minutes walk and very convenient, however, you can easily get turned around if unfamiliar with the area. The rooms are lovely and quite spacious by European standards.  The public areas are lovely and the pantry is well stocked with snacks, wines and other beverages.  Breakfast is excellent.  Will definitely be back for our promised upgrade

column9: First time at a Staybridge Suite
column10: This was our first time at a Staybridge Suite. Will definantly check others out elsewhere especialoy if we stay somewhere for a number of days. The room decor was immaculate the kitchen area was well equiped. The shower was a good size with great pressure. Plenty of eating options in the Westfield Centre. The free breakfast was lovely especially the bacon. The location proved really convenient for our flight out of London City.  Enjoy we did.

column9: Good quality Hotel with great transport links
column10: Yes, very impressed with the first Staybridge Suites I have stayed in the UK. The rooms are usefully sized, not oversize suites as in the US but a decent size with kitchen amenities plus a good size shower (not a bath). This one is within the Westfield Shopping Centre with shops, restaurants and bars around it, plus a Casino close-by. Parking is easy but not free in the Shopping Centre Car Park. Stratford Central and International are a short walk away and its easy to get anywhere in London from there, or even South-East England from Statford International. Breakfast is good and inclusive. Rooms overlook the Olympic Park on the even room numbers.

This has to be one of the nicest hotels that I've stayed in for a while. Lovely and clean and still seems like it is brand new. The staff were all very welcoming and it is really good to see modern technology as standard - Apple TV in all rooms.

I attended the social night which they have at Staybridge Suites and I must say I had a blast. It wasn't what I expected. There was free nibbles and drinks, alcoholic drinks :). The spread was great and there was various different foods to suit all. On the night I attended Bingo was on. It was the funniest bingo i have every been too, I enjoyed it thoroughly. There was a fantastic host for the evening, Debbie. She was great and got all the crowd going. I actually won a game of the bingo and won a bottle of wine, although to get the wine i had to do a dance, which i did and laughed all the way through it. If you do every stay here i highly recommend the socials and i will be certain that you will have an absolute laugh.

On a recent visit to London for a weekend we stayed here for the second time and it was just as good as our first visit. Each room has a small kitchen a fine size bedroom and large bathroom which is very hard to find in London. It is right in the Westfield shopping center and a short distance on the tube to Central London. A nice buffet breakfast is included in the room price and this is served on the 12th floor with great views of London. We look forward to staying here again when next in London.

For any business, it is your staff who make your name, and Staybridge Suites can certainly take it from me their staff at Stratford, London are superb.My wife and I checked in early as we had booked a matinee performance in the West End, and Louise on reception was great. We weren't bothered one way or another on having an Olympic Park view we just wanted to be able to dump our stuff in our room, so she checked us in to an already cleaned ready room. She explained the hotel facilities to us and within 45 minutes we'd got our room and were on our way into the West End. Very convenient just a couple of minutes from the Underground too.We had a studio rooms and unlike some comments on here, did not think it was small. Nice big comfortable bed, good size tv and bathroom, albeit a shower.The complimentary breakfast in the morning was more than adequate with hot food and continental style breakfast available.

column9: The Best (.. and getting better in each stay)
column10: My first stay in this hotel was about a year ago, with my youngest daughter.Since it was such a great experience, we returned about 10 days ago for a week, this time with two other family members.So...why are they the best? Because of the people who make this hotel what it is. Starting with a warm and efficient check in, a nice elegant clean room, equipped with a full kitchen, You get up to a good breakfast, (the special artisan breads and cherry tomatoes were a nice addition to the regular rich selection), and come back to their social evenings (3 times a week) with wine/beer, good cheese, and welcoming staff members.  Unfortunately, our daughter got sick and being in a foreign country, the information and guidance we received from the caring staff in the reception, was invaluable. They knew which folders to open and who to call, presenting all the medical options in the area. They are efficient, warm, and go out of their way to help you.An extra bonus for families is the ability to prepare light meals and save some money. (There are 3 supermarkets in the area)It didn't feel like a hotel, it felt much better.

Now on my long term stay and the staff have been as excellent as ever! More home than hotel is the Staybridge strap line and it is exactly that. Management have gone out of their way to make the long stay away from home (thank you for the wok!) and are very welcoming and friendly, Not a faceless hotel like a lot I have stayed in previously. If you want something more than a faceless hotel then try a stay in the Staybridge!Managers socials bring people together and the themed nights (Indian food) go down a treat! Thank you Staybridge team!

WOWThis was amazing. Firstly the staff are so welcoming, so friendly,A diffent concept of a hotel stay, but for us Staybridge suites are the way forward.The rooms are beautiful. very comfortable, clean and a fabulous modern bathroom.Our room had a view over the olympic park.The breakfast had plenty of choice including, fresh fruit, cerals, bread, pastries aswell as several hot items.
