Coffee/tea available throughout your stay.Stratford underground or the DLR are within a few minutes walk away which makes Stratford an ideal place to stay for all parts of central London.The hotel is within the Westfield shopping centre so great location for shops bars and restaurants,

column9: Excellent overall- Feels just like home-wouldn't stay anywhere else
column10: As a consultant the nature of my job is working away from home five times a week. I have stayed in different hotels all across London but only Staybridge Suites has given me the comfort, quality and service I hoped for. I have stayed there for 6 months now and the place feels just like home.The staff are extremely helpful and polite.The rooms are clean, well furnished and beds are extremely comfortable.The kitchen is fully equipped so all you need to do is pop down to your local Waitrose or M&S to get your food essentials.Breakfast in the morning is great with a wide variety for all appetites- The flat white in the coffee machine is on par with StarbucksI feel extremely safe especially at night as there is 24/7 secruityThe gym is great and well equipped so I dont need to pay for any membership else whereThe free laundry room is a massive bonus, meaning you can get on top of your washing at anytimeFinally its a great location- Great transport routes all within 2 minutes of the hotel, great restaurant choices below you and great if you want to go on a shopping spree as the shops are also just below youI would reccommend this for families, couples, groups and business stays

from the moment i arrived i had first class service. The room was clean and comfortable.  Dinner was delicious and the restaurant staff were very professional. Maybe a feather pillow would have been better than the synthetic ones, but the bed was comfy and I slept well.The views over the Olympic park are wonderful.

column9: Very poor service, unwelcoming, at a premium price!
column10: Now, I'll try and keep it concise.My wife and I arrived at the hotel to be seen by Bindi. Checked in easily. We arrived at Room 1101, which was not cleaned properly. There were red stains on the carpet and dust on the surfaces. In addition, the room was quite small and also had a broken shelf. We reported this to reception, who arranged for housekeeping to fix. Two hours later, we returned to the room and nothing had changed. So we visited reception again, and spoke to Sarah. Now Sarah had the most disgusting attitude from any hotel staff member I have ever experienced. Her response to our complaint was, "What do you want me to do about it?" Is it not that I'm the guest and Staybridge is the host, and Sarah should be answering the question rather than asking it? Her attitude was horridly disgusting, at which point I considered cancelling my reservation. I rang hotels.com, through whom I made my booking, and discussed cancelling my booking with a very pleasant gentleman. Naturally, they wanted to keep the business and discussed options with Sarah and myself, and agreed to offer me an upgrade to a one bedroom suite instead of studio. At such short notice to find another room, we took the offer up. This room was admittedly much cleaner and larger. Overall, the service was abysmal. Looking beyond that, as difficult as it is, it's pretty much mixed opinions. The wifi was good, as was the room we finally ended up in. Breakfast was more than adequate, allowing a self-service takeaway option as well which was useful. However, breakfast ends at 9:30 on weekdays - too early! Manager's Reception on weeknights was a nice touch. The gym had the basics (no free weights), and there was a launderette available too. Parking was low-priced for London standards and plentiful. But the hotel is found wanting with respect to the 'little things' as some might say. For instance, the lift had a broken support handle. The iron in the room did not iron particularly well. There are no vanity sets - this might seem ridiculous to some, but at around ¬£150 per night, I want these things! Some of the furniture had original product stickers on them from wherever they were purchased (Room 916). And the hotel corridors and foyers and lifts (aside from reception and breakfast area) seem to have a stale smell about them which could easily be fixed by some air freshener or fragrant diffuser. The toilet in the room has the flush hidden behind the seat lid, so you have to put the seat lid down when you flush - not major, just annoying. You have to switch on the in-room phone to actually use it, even though the lights on the phone suggest that it's ready to use. This is not obvious and not mentioned at check in. Finally, housekeeping could easily be improved. Replacing the towels and opening the windows is not good enough. I expect a little tidy up too eg crisp wrappers and empty drink bottles to be cleared, and this was not done in any of my SIX nights of stay. Regarding the staff, I dealt with Sarah who I have mentioned already. By contrast, the other staff were reasonably pleasant (Bindi, Lauren,Helen and Joao) and I met one suited gentleman on a Tuesday afternoon whose name I didn't catch who was exceptionally polite and courteous, and someone that all the staff should learn from. Would I stay here again? No. Given the service I received from Sarah, definitely not. I have stayed in Holiday Inn just underneath it (owned by the same overall company) and they were fine last year, as was Premier Inn Stratford (again, nearby), so I would reconsider returning to these guys if I must stay in Stratford. They don't promise any luxuries, but at least they deliver the basics well without disappointment or shoddy service.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend while on vacation.  The Staybridge Suites was built just a couple of years ago as part of a Westfield shopping center connecting to the Olympic Park.  It was simply wonderful!The rooms were clean and well stocked with cooking supplies which meant we didn't have to eat at restaurants for every meal.  Breakfast was free as delicious.  The wifi was free and fast.  Staff were kind and helpful.The hotel is part of a mall complex with many different shopping and dining options, including grocery stores.  It is connected to the Stratford tube stop which is on the Central and Jubilee lines.  These two lines will get you to the big sights in London!We loved this hotel, and if we travel to London again we will be sure to stay here!

Swift stop over in the big city due to an expected business trip. Used trip advisor to help plan my trip as my agent would usually do this for me. So leaving a review to help others. Rooms adequate, staff friendly. Good location which important as I had a early flight to Scotland. Would I stay again - yes -but I would ask for a different room, as the one allocated was a little noisy. Good breakfast with reasonable times, plenty of choice. First trip trying suites instead of hotels, so trial and error, but so far so good.

column9: Great location, good service, reasonable value
column10: We stayed for 2 separate visits over a 10-day period. The staff were very attentive and helpful. My partner is gluten intolerant and they were able to provide fresh GF bread daily. Unfortunately their facility can only provide a version of scrambled eggs and hard boiled (cold) eggs for breakfast. Would have liked poached eggs, but the staff were mostly able to provide us fresh eggs, which we poached in our room.Being located next door to Westfield with 400 shops, dozens of quality restaurants and direct central line access is also great.The only difficulty is the parking is in the Westfield car park, with a daily max rate of 5 pound weekdays and 8 pound weekends, but makes no allowance for a visitor that is coming and going from the car park a few times a day, incurring the minimum 2.50 pound charge each time. This is cheap by Melbourne standards (and probably UK) but would be better if the hotel and (mostly) Westfield could make some alternate arrangement.

I first stayed here just before the Olympics started and enjoyed that stay so booked two rooms for two nights earlier this year.  Check-in was friendly and efficient.  On the first night that we stayed free drinks and canap√©s were served, which was a nice touch, and then we went to Westfield and found some food to cook for dinner.  Breakfasts were fine, although the layout takes some getting used to.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable - on my previous visit I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite, but this time it was a standard room, which still had a good amount of space.  As the hotel is on the top few floors of the building all of the rooms have good views, but those on the same side as the reception have the best views.  The hotel is easy to reach from Stratford Underground / DLR station, although the station itself is large and occasionally confusing.  Highly recommended.

I stayed here for a long weekend as a treat for my mother. The hotel is brilliant!! I am currently looking to sort out another weekend to come back! Right in the centre of the shops (bonus), walking distance from the tube & Olympic Park over the road! A female staff member on check in was rude and never noticed me as being an IHG member or a member or staff in a IHG hotel! Made us wait to check in, where as a young (American??) gentleman was more than helpful and sorted us a room which was already available :) would highly recommend staying here!!!

column9: Staybridge Suites - Stratford City, London, UK
column10: We visited London for two days in August on our way to another European city. We arrived at Heathrow, and took the London Underground (tube) to this hotel, the trip itself took about an hour and ten minutes, but it stops very close to the hotel (two minute walk). We chose this hotel because although it was a ways from the city center, it had rooms with a kitchenette. The check in process was easy, and the front desk staff are very polite, and very helpful. The lobby was clean, with a large sitting area, and there was also an area to purchase snacks, and have a beverage. This hotel also serves breakfast. This hotel looks out on Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park (complex for some events of the 2012 Summer Olympic Games), and also on Westfield Stratford City Mall. The rooms are immaculate, and the kitchenettes were well stocked with all that one would need for a meal preparation. There is a Marks and Spencer in the mall, with a grocery store in the basement, and although it is not a full size grocery store, they carry almost everything you could want for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks. The rooms are also equipped with a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, and wifi is available. There is also a laundry room for guests to use, but the washers and dryers do take longer than what we are used to in the US. The only other thing I want to mention, is that if you are traveling from the US or Canada, make sure to bring power converters with you if you will need to charge any electronic equipment. We are planning a trip to London next summer, and will definitely be staying here again.

Having just completed 7 days .working on invictus. My long days were offset by the first rate service and breakfast. The staff after a mix up on my booking sorted it without any fuss. No doubt will visit again

I needed to stay at Stratford (for Westfield), and other options were fully booked.  The Staybridge turned out to be an excellent property - very relaxed and well run, with brand new, well equipped rooms.  Location & transport links are of course excellent.I would certainly stay again if doing business in Stratford.

column9: good location, nice decor just a few finishing touches
column10: Stayed here for one night and had a lovely evening around Stratford.  The property is very well located for enjoying the Westfield area or even venturing on the tube elsewhere.  I stay in London Hotels a lot and the room size along with the lovely bathroom were a real treat. That said, the room needs a few little touches.  Perhaps a mini-bar or similar goodies draw?  At the moment you need to go to the 'pantry' which is on the 12th floor. Slept very well and enjoyed the stay.  Only concern was when I went to use the iron and the front panel fell off exposing all the wires etc.... Could've killed me! Nonetheless, I'd happily return without hesitation.

We stayed here for 4 nights in August and it was awesome! At first, we had a bit of a mix-up with the rooms as they were unaware we wanted one with a pullout couch. They were unable to provide that for us the first night, but they gave us a new room for the other 3 nights. The staff always greeted you when you walked into the lobby and were very friendly. My only complaint would be that there was a mall nearby so it was a bit loud during the day, but the upside of that was there was a lot of restaurants connected to the mall so it's not difficult to find a place to eat. Other than that, great experience!

column9: Nice hotel...some of the staff need to be let go...
column10: Stayed at this property last month during a week-long trip to London.   Here is my feedback:Pros:The hotel is newer and connected to a shopping mall which is convenient.  The Jubilee and Central lines (underground train) end here, but watch out for periodic strikes so have plan B's ready for transport.The views of Olympic Park are great!The operations manager, Nicholas, should be immediately promoted as he has awesome cust service skills.   He was very pro-active and understands the needs of clients and customers.  The canteen is stocked 24 hours with snacks, drinks, and ice cream :)The housekeeping staff do not speak English, but they are AWESOME!   The staff are courteous and do a wonderful job cleaning.The shower head was amazingly refreshing - the massage functionality alone makes it one of the top shower heads in the hospitality business.  Cons:The greeting was terrible...we arrived at 11am from the U.S. and the young blonde at the front desk reception yells, "You can't check in until 3pm".   Wow...what a warm welcome.    She needs some serious customer service training.   Especially, after staying at another IHG property last time (Intercontinental Park Lane) in 2012, having such a lukewarm and rude awakening..we were about to bail but the operations manager, Nicholas was a great listener, and promised to take good care of us...he was excellent!The breakfast needs to improve and the breakfast staff are not warm - they're so into turning around the tables that they feel offended if we ask them any questions.   Suggestion:  they need to relax or get them more resources to be able to get to know the hungry breakfast comers.   One of the nice gestures the hotel has is to allow customers to take a breakfast tray to their rooms.  However, the trays are found in the room.   They should have a smaller tray or replacement trays avail in the dining area.   I came all the way down desiring to take a tray back to the room, but was told to go back to my room to get the tray....whew!The bath tub is too high off the ground...for a guy who is 6', i nearly slipped on the way out...maybe add a step for the tub.   Overall, great hotel but mediocre service from a couple of bad apples.   Most of the staff are awesome and look exhausted and overworked.   The GM of the hotel was in the office a couple of times that week but does not communicate with any guests.    The higher management should smile a bit more and say 'hi' to clients, especially when their meetings are in the dining area.  It seems the Staybridge Suites we've stayed at in the U.S. are a bit more warmer than this particular one in the U.K. and it clearly shows.   As a Platinum Elite IHG member, would think twice about staying here here again...only if they address some of the opportunities for improvement mentioned in this review.

Another fantastic night at the managers social evening.  Debbie,  Jordan and the rest of the team put on a quiz for all the guests,  my team didn't win but it was a fun night.  They put on pizzas and other nibbles on for the guests.  Also there was complimentary wine and beer which made for a good evening.  Would highly recommend

I have stayed in Staybridge suites for my summer hols in London for the two years consecutively and every stay is pleasant. From kind staff to nice English breakfast to proximity to the train station, they have so many reasons why one would love to stay there. The shopping mall is right at your doorstep which makes shopping a delight. There's a gym for sports lovers too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a strategic place with loads of shops.

1st time staying there as we went up for my husband's event at the Velodrome. Smart building, friendly staff and the room was lovely. If you were staying for more than a night the suites have a small fully fitted kitchen that you can do your own meals in. The bed was very comfortable, lovely bathroom with large shower. Breakfast was good (other than one small issue that was dealt with immediately) so no complaints from us. All in all a good place to stay and would recommend although you do pay a little more to look over the Olympic Park. Night view is amazing.

Second time my husband and I have stayed at the Staybridge Suites in Stratford and once again we were not disappointed.Great location in Westfield Shopping Centre, spacious rooms with excellent facilities and spotlessly clean.Staff were helpful and accommodating.We will stay there again when next in London

We stayed in a room facing the Olympic Parc. It was a really nice room, no noise from outside. All worked very well. Great shower ! Breakfast quality could be improved (there was no bacon some days). In a nutshell: great stay !

This is a hotel with fantastic views, welcoming and friendly staff, excellent facilities both in the room and across the wider hotel, is in a great location with shopping, restaurants, tube, rail and DLR on your doorstep and the centre of London is only 15 minutes away by public transport. The staff in particular were very personable in their approach and over my week long stay I witnessed them engage freely and genuinely with all the guests. My luggage had failed to arrive with my flight and the staff pursued this through the airlines on my behalf over a two day period so that I was able to get on with my sightseeing. My particular thanks to Bindi for all her assistance with this.

Another fantastic stay at Staybridge.  Thanks to Debbie for a fun night at the social, never seen so many people there and new friendships were forged.  The staff always give 110% to ensure that you enjoy your stay.  Special thanks to Debbie, Jennifer, Helen. Timothy, Nicholas, Mary, Musa and all the team for making my regular stay away from home so much pleasure.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 days between house moves. We had a one bedroom suite which was very nicely done, modern and clean with all mod cons. The kitchen was fuly equipped, and the sitting area was perfectly adequate.The bed was very comfortable  and the bathroom was perfectly adequate.Given that the hotel is situated within the Westfield complex, where there are lots of restaurants and music, the sound proofing was very good as the noise could not be heard in the room with the window closed.A nice added bonus was that on a few of the nights the manager had a happy hour, where they provided free drinks and nibbles for an hour.My only tiny gripe is that the laundry room was always very busy and it was difficult to find a free machine.But overall I enjoyed staying here and will definitely look out for other Staybridge Suites to stay at on my travels.

We had a suite on the 12th floor with amazing views over London. Everything was perfect and the staff excellent very friendly. The only slight downside was we had the first suite backing on to the Den and we could hear the TV during the night. Breakfast was really nice good choice and you can take back to your room to enjoy in your suite. Would definitely stay again

I have to agree with most of the other reviews of this hotel, it was perfect for us.  The room was comfortable and clean, the view from our room was fantastic, we had a view of the O2 arena and the city in the distance. Being in the shopping center was convenient as far as places to eat and the tube was right under the shoping mall and the overground train was right there as well.  The only thing is that it takes about 20 minutes to get to the city center.  The morning breakfast had a good variety to choose from.  And the midweek reception was just as good and added to the value of our stay. I have to say that Debbie was absolutely wonderful!!!  Not only in her interactions with my wife and myself but with all of the other guests.  This hotel has the FRIENDLIEST and NICEST staff of any hotel that I have been to.

We had a great experience at Staybridge in New Orleans US, and decided to try this one in London. Were not disappointed!  Location is part of multi-use center near Olympic Village in E London-adjacent to multi-story Westfield Mall with tons of shops, food court, bowling, cinema and casino. Outside are more restaurants and specialty shops and underneath is parking plus entrance to London Underground (subway), trains and double-decker buses. Easy 10-20 minute subway to most sites in London. Hotel room very comfortable, big shower, fully equipped kitchen, etc. 12th floor checkin/lounge has quiet seating alcoves, kitchen with 24/7 free coffee and tea, great free daily full, hot breakfast, and a quiet library/den. The manager's socials Tues-Thurs feature free wine, beer and snacks and on some nights a hot food selection. We wish they would make the reception 6-7 instead of 7-8, so one could also go out to dinner without it being so late. Other than this minor point, we can't say enough about the superb job Debbie with the food and hospitality. Our stay was delightful. A word of caution. If you are flying in, do NOT take a London cab. Contact Staybridge ahead of time to arrange a special car pickup-it will cost about half of the exorbitant price the taxis charge-we met several guests who had the same experience of being "taken for a ride" and feeling totally ripped off!

excellent managers reception once again hosted by Debbie and team ,special indian night with also deserts available ive been staying  ere for the last 3 months which feel like my second home all staybridge staff are excellent

Tues,we'd & Thur there is a managers special get together for new guests and existing onesFrom 7-8 free buffet and and a chance to mingle and meet other guests from all overThe food is excellently prepared (by Debbie) and there is sometimes some entertainment visa vie Bingo night a very well thought about evening that is fee to all and more to the point very entertainingThis is my fifth week and I still look forward to Thursday evenings(only one I can make)Keep up the good workMark

Well this hotel is all suites with kitchens and dish washers etc in them, you also have complimentary buffet breakfast as well, the lounges are very spacious and the views over the Olympic Park are stunning. Our suite was good and clean and modern with a brilliant walk in shower. The welcome we got was very good and the staff were very helpful. Around the Hotel is the Westfield shopping centre which has all the shops restaurants and bars you could want.The Olympic park is right next to the Hotel as is the shopping centre.

column9: Fantastic place to stay in London
column10: We stayed here over the past weekend to make the most of our exertions on the Ride100 (a cycle sportive in London and Surrey). It is easy to find easy to oak and simp to check-in.The breakfasts are great and the location is easy for South London - we wanted to go to Greenwich this time; as well as for the City and for the start and end of the Sportive. Cycling back from Buckingham Palace only took 20 minutes or so.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants the space but not the high cost of central London hotels - this year's Ride 100 cost the same but we got an extra night for the same cost by moving 10 minutes from Trafalgar Square!

column9: We will certainly stay here again and will also tell friends
column10: I stayed for one week in July with my ten-year old granddaughter and she was over the moon! I chose this hotel for many reasons: one was accessibility both by bus, overground, underground and mainline station. Arriving from Liverpool Street Station it is direct to Stratford on the Central line or arriving from Waterloo or London Bridge Stations it is direct on the Jubilee line. The complex surrounding the hotel has bars, restaurants, shops, supermarkets and cinemas; my main consideration was the kitchen, we were tired of eating out the two weeks previously and with the shopping centre food was a doddle. Breakfast was included and it is the same as most hotels we stayed in, the view is excellent from the 12th floor overlooking the Olympic park. On this floor there is a very nice lounge with plenty of seating space. Our room on the 8th floor had a very good view. The suite was well equipped with fridge, microwave and dishwasher.  The shower was very good (like a waterfall according to the ten-year old) but we found it odd that the bathroom light was permanently on all night unless we removed the door key card from the slot. Not an exceptional choice of tv programmes for the 10-year old, I had to suffer Viva but we were there when the Commonwealth games were on in Glasgow so we followed some of that on BBC. All in all I was very satisfied with my stay and both the reception staff and breakfast staff are very nice people.

column9: Ideal location, next to Stratford Westfield... 20 minutes by tube to central London
column10: Within a 5 minutes walk to the underground and Westfield being right downstairs, this hotel is very accessible. The hotel staff were quite friendly in explaining the hotel to us, however the service could be improved as they were not very welcoming.The view from our room (929) was not attractive. However, the room itself is relatively comfortable. The room was clean and fully equipped. On the other hand, the positioning of the furniture was not impressive. The toilet is right beside the bed. Also, the extractor fans were very poor as the bathroom got very hot and streamy in a matter of minutes when taking a shower.BE AWARE: COMPLIMENTARY INTERNET IS NOT INTERNET AT ALL. YOU CAN NEVER CONNECT TO THE NETWORK, NEITHER ON MY IPHONE AND LAPTOP.UPSIDE: THEY PROVIDE COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST, THE FOOD WAS DECENT.

Stayed here after the Back to the Future Secret cinema event in the Olympic park. Great location, cheap parking and very good value hotel. Well presented and maintained. Would definitely stay again. Breakfast was nice and staff very friendly. Great location too for Westfield shopping Mall

column9: Great Place to stay - easy access to London
column10: We recently stayed for 2 weeks while on a six week holiday in Europe and the UK. The Location was perfect for us, we wanted to be close to London but not stay in the city. The tube station was underneath the shopping complex and buses and taxi's were available as well. Using the underground (subway) we were able to be in the middle of London in about 20 mins depending on which underground line we used. The Hotel is right in the middle of the Westfield Shopping Complex which was ideal. Supermarkets and restaurants were only 2 mins away. We had a deluxe studio suite on the 11th floor which had an amazing view. The suite had a small kitchen with a microwave, fridge, dishwasher, and all the necessary items to prepare meals. Breakfast was included each morning and made for an easy start to the day. The hotel also had a laundry on the 12th floor with 4 washers and dryers available at no charge. The room was serviced each week day, and weekend service was available if requested (no additional charge).The staff were extremely helpful and the concierge was full of helpful information, Bathroom was a little on the small side and the only negative thing was there was no electrical outlet in the bathroom, apart from the shaver outlet, also only one hook to hang up towels, but this was only a minor inconvenience.  There was free WI-FI available but i found this a little slow - faster access was available for a small fee.To sum up it was an amazing place to stay

Excellent service and great food.  Potatoes were lovely and fresh with plenty of fillings available both for meat lovers and veggies.  Friendly staff Debbie & Jordon went over and above to make sure that I always had enough drinks and food.  Cant wait to come again and see what other theme nights are taking place.

We've stayed here twice now and it's our hotel of choice in london.  It's good value and the suites are really excellent.  Location is perfect for the O2, most people travel in the opposite direction after shows.  Returning again in December.

column9: Great hotel .... but be aware of the VAT!
column10: Staybridge is part of the Straford City Holiday Inn, although you access it by way of a different  lift.Like the HI, it's rooms are brand new and, if you get one on the City side, then the views are amazing.If you are booking via the IHG app, then it always comes up next to the HI and it shows the lowest available room rate for both. What isn't obvious is that the quoted HI price includes VAT, but the Staybridge price excludes it. This can lead to quite a shock on check-out!I have no idea why IHG do this, but be aware.

You may think that staying in the middle (nearly) of a large shopping centre would be really noisy - no (unless you opened the windows, but as the air conditioning was so effective that wasn't necessary). Staybridge Suites are in the same building as the Holiday Inn in Stratford. The reception and breakfast area on the 12th floor commands great views across London towards Canary Wharf, the City, West Ham and of course the Olympic Stadium. Our suite was on the 8th floor and consisted of a small kitchenette which was well equipped, a sitting area, a bedroom and ensuite bathroom. There was plenty of room, the bed was very comfy and the whole suite was clean and well presented. Having a full size fridge was very useful.Breakfast was included and was a help yourself buffet style with a reasonable choice with a mix of english breakfast, bread, pastries, cereals and fruit options, and of course coffee, tea and juice were on offer. There was a small "pantry" where you could buy things to cook/consume in your "suite" which was handy - but with Waitrose just over the way we only used it for beer when we were strapped for time. There was also the option to have a room service meals which were OK.The location in Stratford is handy for any sporting events going on in the area and also for sightseeing with the DLR (Docklands Light Railway) and the Jubilee line offering handy connections to places such as Cutty Sark, the museums etc...Staff at Staybridge were always friendly, helpful and smiling - good place to stay.

Stayed here several times and the rooms are really quite fantastic for the price (in London) all are suites with kitchen, not that I used it but its a nice idea!!!Good for longer term, stayed here every week for 6 weeks (Mon-Thur), platinum member but I only got upgraded once which was disappointment.Great location attached to westfield, with numerous shops and restaurants available, great selection.Try and get a room facing the Olympic Park, which is a great view and you also get londons skyline in the distance which is also nice, canary wharf easily viewable.

What can I say another entertaining managers  night and a great laugh it the place to be the staff outstanding especially  !!!! BINGO DEBBiE !!!! so funny made our night if only we could do these more often hosted by Debbie and team ,Pizzas garlic bread nibbles and beer also wines  plus prizes for the winners Fills like being at home with all these staff

I stayed at the staybridge suite due to work commitments in London. If your looking for somewhere  For an extended stay, then staybridge is perfect. I regularly stay in London for extended periods and I haven't come across anything better yet! The price is affordable and what you get in value is fantastic! The rooms are spacious, clean and the bed is comfy. There is no traffic noise outside due to you being situated in the middle of the Westfield shopping centre so a good nights sleep is guaranteed! There are desks in the room to work from with free wifi and a kitchenette so that if you don't fancy eating out alone, you can cook for yourself whenever it suits. There are free laundry facilities too and a free latte machine in the reception for whenever you want.A highlight of my visit was the 'managers social', Tuesday to Thursday night. Between 7pm and 8pm, the lounge area provide free wine and beers and nibbles so you can unwind after a day at work. On one of the nights, Debbie, one of the staff hosted a bingo night where you could win a free weekend stay here! It was fantastic, lots of other people here on business, lots of banter and a pleasant change from working in my room alone on a night.I haven't met 1 staff member that hasn't been absolutely professional or friendly yet. I am staying here next month and for once I won't flinch at the thought of working away from home so much!

Another excellent Managers night at the StayBridge Stratford..... Bingo & Laugh's, Pizza & nibbles, Wine & Beer and soft drinks for the kids....   Oh and did I metion all FREE... Yes you read it correct... Don't book all the rooms please as I'll be back.G

Service at Staybridge Suites was friendly and enthusiastic.  The rooms were large and well appointed, beds comfortable.  The breakfast was great, with a choice of high quality continental and hot dishes.  Espresso machines for customized coffee.  The complimentary laundry room was good to have, but don't wait until Sunday evening - there's a line of extended stay guests getting ready for the next week! It was handy to have the mall/shopping center below the hotel, with access to subway and trains.  The area felt very safe, and it was only 15 minutes into the center of London on the subway.  The only problem we had was occasional water issue, with hot water only, but they are working on fixing the system.  Overall, we were very happy and would stay there again.

Cannot complain about the Staybridge Suites at all. Modern, spacious and immaculately clean room, complete with free wifi and even Apple TV! Extremely friendly and welcoming staff. Fantastic complimentary breakfast with a beautiful view of the Olympic Park. It honestly was perfect, and the location cannot be beaten for ease of travel, and of course shopping. The staff especially went out of their way to make my trip fantastic, and their signature cookies are to die for!! Five stars :):)

We visited London to see a west end show. Usually staying at the Premier Inn Westfield, we booked this as the Premier had no available rooms. I have to say the premier was great in every way but the Holiday Inn  Stale-bridge studios are far better. The suites are apart hotel rooms like studio flats  with modern fully equipped kitchens inc dishwasher, fridge, sink & 2 ring hob. Also all china and cutlery in the kitchen.Lovely bedrooms with a huge  comfortable bed. Apple TV is also available on the tv menu. Great bathroom. Our bath room had a 1200mm walk in shower with power shower but no bath. Very well planned with everything you'd need thought of. The air conditioning was very quiet. Parking is very close and cost ¬£13.20 for the weekend. Then just a couple of minutes walk brings you to the hotel. You are immediately in the shopping precinct amid the great choice of restaurants and bars.the hotel staff are really good and genuinely appear helpful. If the shops are closed   You can purchase snack items to cook in your room from the reception which is on the 12th floor, ie a choice of ready meals, canned soups, etc so you'll never go hungry. Stratford station is a short 5-10 minutes walk at the most. The station makes any part of London easily reached. You can get an Oyster travel card from the machines there and pay as you go on all London Transport including buses. The hotel is by far the best situated in Westfield. Breakfast is a buffet but not a full English as most hotels are, however the choice is sufficient enough to please everybody, try to avoid the late breakfast  times as the hot dishes aren't replaced quickly enough to serve everyone at once. From . 8-9 was great and not too busy. The seating area in reception is very peaceful with large sofas situated next to the floor to ceiling windows giving fantastic views across the Olympic Park and the London skyline. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

We were originally booked in at some rather hot and noisy apartments for 2 nights and had to move here after the first night.It was wonderful!Clean. modern and excellent staff and the breakfast was lovely too.In a nice area and close to lots of shops and restaurants. Loved it.

Its a bit tricky to find this hotel but once you find it, its a very nice place to stay. No vehicle can go near the building as it is located in Westfield shopping complex. One needs to walk at least 100 metres to reach the hotel. This is tough if one has to carry luggage. Check in was very fast and staff were very courteous and helpful.Room size is not big but room is very modern and has all required amenities including kitchen items.Bath room is neat and clean. Shower, wash basin tap and kitchen area tap has hot and cold water flow with adequate pressure. Break fast has quite a few items and is tasty.West field shopping area is a minute away and Stafford station and tube are about 5 minutes away.Large number of restaurants are available in west field complex. Ckeck out was a breeze.

We had a fantastic time at Staybridge! It really felt like home.The staff was friendly,personable,caring and fun to be around. Nicholas greeted us when we arrived and he set the mood for our entire stay.He made us feel so welcome and comfortable the instant we walked in. The hotel goes out of its way to make a homey environment with a complimentary washer and dryer for use. They have free wine, beer and snacks hosted by the wonderful Mary. Mary was amazing. We had the pleasure of chatting with her and it made our night! Thanks Mary! Timothy and Sarah were other standout for us.Everyone in general was amazing. The hotel is located in a huge shopping mall so I had plenty to do while my boyfriend was off on business. The hotel offers stunning views of London from its patio. It is right next to a tube station and a bus station and there's even a casino in the mall! All in all this was a fantastic stay and I would come again!

My Wife and l spent 7 nights at Staybridge Suites and found the service to be good and rooms also very clean and modern. It was great having the convience of having many restuarants,two supermarkets , and the tube within a short walk.  l was initially concerned about the location of the hotel being away from the city and long travel times to get into the city for sightseeing. But this was not a problem at all, it took on average 19min to Get to London Tower station and just under 30 min to get to other side of the city. Breakfeast was ok could do with a bit more variety and managers social drinks Tues to Thurs was great . Our taxi driver had a real hard time find the entrance of Staybridge Suites, as his GPS software was not up to date and did not pick up new roads, he ended up dropping us off in the carpark which wasnt ideal. But this can be avoided if your taxi driver has an up to date GPS or if you book taxi via hotel. Overall all was happy with my stay and enjoyed the convience and good service this hotel offers

column9: Don't miss Mary's Thursday special manager's social
column10: Staybridge Stratford is almost like home now, seeing that we've stayed here for almost half of 2014 already.Don't miss the manager's social (Tue - Thu) Thursday special where Mary whips up something different from the usual run of the mill evening fare. She goes to a great deal of trouble to prepare something exotic, and it is quite the highlight of the week. Its quite something to watch as she manages the kitchen and still finds time to meet everyone with a smile. Keep up the good work, Mary.

Great hotel at a great rate. Perfect location for the tube, shopping and having the Olympic park across the street was perfect for my 10 year old son.  The rooms are very spacious and very comfy. Super quiet hotel and they have free laundry facilities which is a nice plus. The breakfast in the morning was just perfect and a great way to start off each morning. The staff was extremely friendly and really went out of their way to help. I would highly recommend this hotel.

From check-in to check-out, enjoyed a very comfortable three night stay here.You could self cater, but there are also many & varied restaurants to choose from in the adjacent shopping centre.The lounge area on the 12th floor affords great views over the Olympic Park and to the London skyline beyond.Breakfast was of a high standard with good selection of fresh fruit and if you didn't want to eat at the tables in the lounge, a tray was provided in the room, so you could take your meal back and eat there.

Great room, view, kitchenette, shower, laundry facilities and location.Only fly in the ointment .... arrived Friday afternoon for 4 nights and they asked me to forgo the room cleaning for the weekend.. I agreed. Unfortunately they didn't clean it on Monday either so It never got cleaned the whole time I was there. Disappointing .... Maybe not worth a drop of 2 stars but definitely worth a drop of more than one .... and there are no halves.

I had a wonderful time at the Staybridge. It is ideally situated and the staff go out of their way to deliver excellent service. The food is amazing and the social events the hotel organisers really help guests feel welcome.

Great 2 week stay. Convenient location for sightseeing purposes as central London was just 20 minutes away on the tube. Room was very clean,comfortable and quiet. We made use of the mini-kitchen picking up groceries from Marks and Spencer and Waitrose. Staff was very friendly and helpful especially Jordan & Musa in Hub kitchen. The breakfast buffet was beyond our expectations with wide variety of healthy choices including lots of fresh fruit! The evening reception was very nice.The free cookies were delicious. Wi-fi in the room was always reliable. A few minor issues came up, including a leaky dishwasher. The manager, Wayne, addressed these issues quickly and to our satisfaction. We would definitely return!

Stayed here for 5 nights and had a room with kitchenette....the room was very good size and the staff were fantastic! Close to Westfields shopping centre and a lot of good restaurants. Breakfast was buffet style and very good with different hot dishes every day. Wi-fi was great and the room very comfortable. Would def stay there again!

Another good experience at Staybridge Suites Westfield Stratford City.Best parking for here is Car Park B; the charge is ¬£8 for weekdays and ¬£5 at weekends.The apartments are in the heart of the Westfield complex, in Chestnut Plaza adjacent to the casino.Staff were very helpful and friendly throughout. They struck the right balance between following the corporate script (which now includes offering a free cookie on arrival) and genuinely engaging with guests.The apartment was an OK size with a desk, armchair seating squeezed in and an Apple TV. As well as being spotlessly clean, the kitchen is equipped with all the basics and a fridge, microwave, hob and dishwasher. Double glazing prevents any outside noise becoming an irritation.Well recommended for anyone needing one night or an extended stay.

I'm again doing research in London and have returned to the Staybridge Suites.  It is really excellent: clean, excellent value, pleasant obliging staff, good breakfast with plenty of choice. The location is also great: while - unless one has an interest in the site of the olympic stadium - one would not come to Stratford for tourism, the Staybridge Suites is located close to a station with excellent links to all locations.  There is also a mall next door, with Marks and Spencer and Waitrose for groceries for self-catering.  For someone wishing for quality at a good price in London, this can't be beaten.

column9: Great place to stay, especially for London
column10: We toured London for five days, returning here by Tube every night (easy). Very courteous staff, clean, great beds. Only one caveat: the shopping center (with several restaurants) around the hotel is tempting to go to for food, but is average at best. There are great places for a pint or two in the area. Highly recommended.

column9: Welcome to your home away from home
column10: I stayed over the late May bank holiday weekend, and having stayed in the Holiday Inn down stairs we knew what to expect from the area, having never stayed in a Staybridge before I wasn't quite expecting the superb room and service that we got. We had a great check in from Nicholas, and very much enjoyed the welcome note and cookies in our studio. It had everything you need for any length of stay in a homely environment, and in a space that was so cleverly designed it delivered nothing less than the effect of a tardis....Breakfast each morning was great, all you could need and a notch above many many hotels in terms of food quality. Of particular note is the shower, probably the best hotel shower ever, and the quietness in our room, best hotel sleep ever, it probably helped that we where facing away from the shopping centre but noise levels where such that we could easily have assumed we where the only guests in the hotel. I'd have no problem recommending this hotel and look forward to returning.

column9: Everything was above class. Rooms, food, location, staff. Would definitely return!
column10: Stayed here at the beginning of March during a business trip, everything was without fault. Nice view of the olympic areas, right next to the Westfield shopping centre and plenty of great restaurants nearby. Also close to the train station. Would definitely return for leisure trip sometime

First time in a Staybridge suite, very impressed! A shame we only stayed one night as the room was excellent. Exceptionally clean and well designed. Particularly loved the body wash and shampoo provided.The views from the 12th floor are fab, could spend hours people watching and train watching!Breakfast was excellent, felt like you were helping yourself in a big kitchen! Lots of choice and all very fresh.Liked that the reception was just a desk and the receptionists were not behind a big counter, they were all very helpful.Hope to stay again very soon! Thank you :)

We were greeted very warmly by staff and immediately felt that this was a great start to our Europe holiday! We arrived and had to wait for our room to be cleaned, we were offered coffee and snacks while we waited, staff took our bags and we sat on the balcony, we waited less than an hour. Our suite was awesome, large and very clean - we loved that it had a kitchenette, an amazing shower and great view of the Olympic Park and at night, the lights of London!! The Stratford Westfield shopping centre was next to us, so we had access to shopping, restaurants, coffee shops etc very handy when we got back from touring London and beyond. We chose to travel by the Tube while in London, the Oyster card was the best value if you are intending to travel in and out of London city. We were a bit apprehensive about riding the tube for the first time, but after a couple of trips we were seasoned travelers, it is so easy to get to where you want to go, you just need to know where you are heading and what line to catch - if you download the tube app it is very easy!! A great stay at staybridge suites - the only negative was we were constantly asking for towels, sometimes we would only get one towel, it was inconvenient but not anything to really worry about. Breakfast was amazing lots to choose from - cereals, juice, hot food, coffee, pastries, breads - we were very happy with our morning breakfasts, this was our main source of energy for the long days ahead! Overall we loved the suites and was probably one of the best stays on our holiday!!

Can't say one bad thing about this hotel, spotlessly clean, great breakfast, fantastic rooms, very nice staff, great location, everything you need on the doorstep, shops,casino, cinema, fantastic restaurants, can't praise it enough! Will definitely be back.

Have stayed here for close to 6 months on and off. The staff are really friendly and helpfulThey are accommodating and very flexible.My experience with other hotels and service apartments have always been quite monotonous and lifeless, mostly purpose built. The staff here make you feel at home and are happy to accommodate most of your needs, which is quite surprising for a hotel at their price range. I would like to specially mention Debbie (Restaurant/kitchen), Nicholas (Ops Manager), Tim (Ops) have been exceptional. Of course other staff are equally friendly and cheerful.Location is brilliant, stone's throw away from Stratford Olympics center, Tube Station, Bus Station. Well it is literally inside one of the best malls in this part of LondonThe facility is great, you get to do your laundry and workout at the gym which is fully covered. If you need a swim, you can head to the Olympic swimming pool which is 2 minute walk. You have fantastic running tracks around the park, so that's a bonus as well.

Staybridge , Stratford is one of the best hotel i stayed in Europe. Usually hotel with Kitchen is not common in Europe,but if someone is looking for a homely ambience then staybridge it is. There are lots to talk about staybrdige starting with the location, which is spot on with malls, stations .The entire crew are so friendly and will make sure you are right at home, The morning breafast and evening social events are definetely worth mentioning. Especially Debbie from the Kitchen cooks best foods durng the hot food evening. They also have quiz nights and bingo nights. All in all, its always more than what you ask for. People like me , who stay for more than 3-4 months Staybridge is always a home away from home.

An excellent night at the managers evening at the staybridge suites.  The food and the quiz were great.  I will definitely return again.Debbie and Mary were the quiz masters and made it very entertaining.  As an extra bonus our team won the quiz.

column9: Great hotel for a short or long stay
column10: We booked this hotel as we were on a shopping spree at the Westfield centre, we had previously stayed at the Holiday inn opposite which was also a nice hotel but this time we decided to stay at the Staybridge, this is a excellent hotel to stay at whether you are visiting locally or you want to travel into London to shop or see the sights as the underground is only about 5 mins away from the hotel. The Front desk staff were excellent and very polite and helpful at all times especially Tim and a young lady who was expecting (sorry forgot you're name).The rooms were furnished to a high standard with everything you needed if you choose to stay in at night to cook a meal in the kitchen,the settee in the living room was quite hard in some places but as strange as this sounds the more you laid/sat on it became quite comfortable, the bed was very nice too the mattress being hard but this is what type of mattress we have at home, so we had a excellent sleep. The bathroom was to a high standard as well with the best bit being the shower which was very relaxing when used.The breakfast in the morning had a very wide range of items to choose from and the staff were always restocking when any items ran low,the staff here were very polite and cheerful as well.Overall we would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again as we were very impressed with the staff and the rooms.

Perfectly located in the Stratford Westfield shopping complex this hotel, with apartment style rooms, has a warm welcome and friendly staff who attend to all your needs from the moment you arrive. Having been in contact directly with the hotel team our earlier than normal check in was accommodated with no fuss and the check in and reception team were excellent. I have stayed in many hotels, specifically in London, but none compare to the feel and experience I had at the Staybridge. Our room was located on the same floor as reception which made things easier, for breakfast and the social evenings. We had a studio room which was big enough for us both with a kitchen arrangement as you enter the room, very large king size bed, (may even have been super king?) along with a desk to work at, easy chair and space to relax. The kitchen has all the pots pans and cutlery you need to cook your own evening meals if you wish, halogen hob, microwave/oven, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. Daily housekeeping even attend to your dirty dishes, loading them in the dishwasher so you don't have to!The bathroom is plenty big enough and features a double size shower. Amenities are provided and the whole place had a good clean feel to it. Breakfast has ample offerings of cereal, pastries and got dishes which are changed daily to provide some variation. Fruit juice, tea, coffee, water and soft drinks are also available. This is an excellent breakfast choice, not a mass produced buffet style experience that some other hotels provide. In the reception area is a very large lounge area that has TVs dotted about should you wish to sit and relax. The balcony provides an outside sitting area overlooking the Olympic stadium and park area, the view of the city skyline through canary wharf to the O2 is fabulous. Tea, coffee, soft drinks and sometimes pastries are available at all times in the lounge area and I liken this to a typical 'executive lounge' offering in hotels that you pay to be upgraded to experience, this is all part of the service at this Staybridge!What is also worth mentioning, and also compounds the executive lounge comparison, is that on Tues, Weds and Thurs evenings there are the managers social events whereby complimentary snacks, nibbles, hot offerings and alcohol are offered as part of the hotels drive to get people to meet their staff and each other. This works really well and I have to say was the cherry on too of the icing in the cake!A laundry room and gym is located on the 12th floor, as is reception, and you can utilise the Holiday Inn's places to eat and room service during your stay also. This is not your typical hotel and experience. The staff are genuinely interested, not typical patronising 'how are you' questions. The management appear to have worked out what a hotel visitor wants from a stay and deliver it to perfection. The suites are spacious, clean, perfectly located and provide a great experience that you can't quite put your finger on but you just get a good feeling about the whole stay. The suites offer a long stay option as well as the causal visitor/tourist few nights requirement and I am so impressed I have already made arrangements to stay for 3 months at the end of the year!Well done to all the team and I look forward to returning in September!

When I returned to London after my trip to Spain and France...I opted to stay again in Stratford City...The NEW LONDON town with the Olympic Park and Westfield Mall...as it is adjacent to my previous stay at Holiday Inn, I tried the next door Hotel which is a condotel equipped with kitchen and bigger space than a regular hotel room. As it turns out it is run by the Holiday Inn Group.Look for Nicolas the French Operations Manager who was very accomodating and made sure our stay was again ..feel like home.

We stayed just one night last week and were well satisfied with our choice of accommodation. We were made very welcome from the moment we arrived and had been up-graded to a room with a great view across to the olympic park  sculpture. Bed was very comfortable and everywhere spotlessly clean. We could easily have stayed here for a week and been happy. Small kitchen had all that you would need for a few days. Whilst Staybridge Suites Stratford is outside central London that is not a problem as it very close to a tube station. Lots of places to eat on the doorstep. Will definitely think of staying again next time we are in London.

column9: A good stay at the Staybridge Suites
column10: I stayed here with my husband for two nights in March 2014.  The service from the moment you walk through the door is excellent.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was fine for our two night stay but I don't think it was well enough equipped for longer stays.  The room was a decent size and was comfortable enough for us.  The hotel is conveniently located next to Westfield Stratford and all of its amenities, while it is only about 20 minutes into Central London it is a bit further out than I would normally like to be, this is the only reason that we probably would not stay here again.  Breakfast was complimentary and was of a good quality.  Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel

The Staybridge Suites is part of a split building - the Holiday Inn is on the first few floors, the Suites on the top.Check in was fine, and the rooms are brand new with a good spec. The usual layout for a standard room - small kitchen, with a bedroom and bathroom. The beds are exceptionally comfortable, and as a gold elite IHG member I got free internet access.Breakfast in the mornings was of a good standard and variation - and in with the price. I also used the gym, and you can get a decent workout.My room was on the mall side of the building - there is some noise from the aircon extractors opposite, but my earplugs (once again) saved the day.This would have been a five star business stay but for one thing - too many families. There was one family with two rooms in particular who let their kids run up and down the corridor screaming all night. I eventually snapped and told them to shut up and have some respect for other guests, but it just took a little bit of shine off the experience.

Its rare but sometimes you can be delighted by a good service and Staybridge did exactly that. So many times, hotels claim to care about you and meeting your needs; well this place is little talk but all action. The attention to detail in the concept is very good. For the busy professional, for the avid shopper,why would you not want to stay in a modern, clean suite with everything you need, right next to the tube into central London but a stones throw from an amazing shopping mall?The staff were professional, friendly but not at all snooty. I loved it and will be coming back. Well worth the money. My visitors also loved it so please don't let it go down Staybridge

Not sure what I can add to the plaudits other guests have already furnished this place. The top floor has the best view from any hotel I have visited in London with the shard, olympic park, canary wharf, the city skyscrapers and BT tower all laid out before you. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the kitchen amenities ensure you can choose how you want to eat during your stay. This food choice is aided by the wonderful included breakfast and the abundance of food outlets available at Westfield - Stratford City. Transport links are excellent with frequent mainline trains, the overground, the central line and the jubilee line all stopping at Stratford station. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

We stayed May 3rd the hotel was so central great for shopping in Westfield and visiting the Olympic park , and a short tube ride to Central London , as Staybridge only serve breakfast we had dinner in the holiday inn restaurant which was excellent the staff really looked after us well ,would stay here again

I stayed here with my wife and her family recently , If you are thinking of London/Stratford area for a trip then this Hotel is Top Class. The peoplle are so friendly and welcoming. We were greated by Timothy who was very polite and professional ,and made us feel very welcome. The room we have was nice and clean and quiet. The hotel alos had excellent views of the Olympic park from our room and the reception/Breakfast area also overlooks the park. It is also located in the Westfield Shopping Area which is a shoppers dream , they have every shop you can think of and more.I will be back for sure.

My daughter and I were attending a show at Victoria Palace Theatre and booked this hotel on employee rate.  I have to say the room was amazing with the facilities in there.  The views were spectacular and the staff were very friendly.  If I had to come to London again I would avoid central London and stay in the Staybridge suites which has access to lots of shops and restaurants. Breakfast was just like being at home and very plentiful.I was a bit concerned about the amount of noise coming from the nearby pubs below but once the window was shut and curtains closed we didnt hear a thing.

Stayed at Staybridge with my children for 11nights. Location right inside Westfield, very good and modern facility, clean. The kitchenette is a huge money saver for me. Cooked almost all our meals. The breakfast is just ok not superb.Also this is the 1st hotel i will stay without daily housekeeping. They only remove your trash without cleaning the floor. With 2 young kids this was a huge challenge; however the floor was vacuumed on request.

column9: A home away from home - but without the kids!
column10: My wife and I recently stayed at the Staybridge Suites, Stratford. We stay in London fairly often and fancied a change from the West End so thought we would give Stratford a go. I'm really glad we did - from the moment we arrived the staff we so friendly and attentive. All facilities were explained and we were given a fantastic room on the 12th floor. The hotel is very relaxed and the views over London are very impressive. Whatever you need is simply no problem for the staff. They really are happy to help.As it is in the heart of the Westfield shopping district there are plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from should you wish to leave the comfort of the hotel. Breakfast is a spectacular marathon - help yourself to everything you can imagine from the huge family style kitchen - just make sure you don't have any fixed plans as you could easily lose yourself for a couple of hours!Oh, and there's the Olympic Park and Stadia to have a wander round if you have time.We will definitely be staying again.

We had a fantastic weekend in this hotel! Fantastic and extremely substantial Breakfast and the mostly friendliest staff I have ever come across in my life! The Room was incredibly comfortable and we will most definitely be back! I just wish it could be sooner :)

column9: Great place, friendly staff & very comfortable rooms
column10: I did wonder what it would be like staying in a shopping centre but you soon forget this.  The staff are exceptionally friendly and it's a very comfortable hotel.  The beauty salon in the attached Holiday Inn does great deals too.

I have stayed here since July 2013 on business and has basically turned into my second residence, I cannot fault the place one bit. The rooms are spacious, luxury and well equipped (air conditioning, Apple TV, WiFi, HD TV channels, dishwasher, washing and ironing facilities etc) and the beds extremely comfortable. The rooms are cleaned daily and towels changed etc. Excellent views from rooms facing Olympic Pack side and the balcony terrace on 12th floor. The breakfast is really good with a wide range of cereals, hot breakfast, fresh juices, fruit etc. There are 'managers social' events Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday evenings where sometimes themed complimentary food and drink is provided. Staff are excellent, helpful, knowledgeable and very friendly which makes the stay a lot better.

column9: Excellent, perfect location in Stratford (London), friendly staff
column10: Excellent stay, great location for Westfield shopping centre, Olympic park or for connections to central London via Stratford station (DLR, tube, overground, etc).Rooms are excellent suites with bathrooms and kitchens.  Well equipped and comfortable.The staff were very friendly and welcoming.Free breakfast was good quality, with a good variety of items on offer.All in all, excellent.

In over thirty years of visiting London I have never enjoyed a stay in a hotel; with so many good reviews this hotel had a lot to live up to but my expectations were not high. So what happened?Well, our stay exceeded all expectations; this is a great place to stay and no review could do it justice.First, the location is great for shopping in the Westfield shopping centre, you‚Äôre right in the centre itself. The entrance to the building can be difficult to spot if you are unfamiliar with the centre but the helpful concierge staff soon had us in front of the reception on the 12th floor. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful; explaining everything we needed to know about our stay.Our suite, a king size bedroom and separate living area, was spacious and well furnished, very clean and well laid out. The room had an Apple TV attached to the large LCD TV in the living room and there was another TV in the bedroom. The bathroom was large and well laid out. This was a great place to chillout and relax. I had the best night‚Äôs sleep I have ever had in any hotel; the bed was so comfy. We stayed over the weekend so the shopping centre was busy, even late at night, but the noise level was very quiet. The Internet connection in the room was good; we did pay the extra for the faster connection and access to our Netflix and Apple Match movies via the Apple TV; this is a great add-on service.We used the on-site pantry for soft-drinks; all items added to our account without any fuss by the helpful staff and reasonably priced. The breakfast was a surprise; all food options are covered, hot, cold, healthy and just plain indulgent! Add to this a great view over the Olympic park and a sunny day and you have the recipe for a great start to the day.The underground station is a 5 minute walk from the suites. Central London is 30 minutes away on the underground and the Excel Centre is 15 minutes on the DLR.The suite prices reflect the quality of the suites; I considered them reasonable for a London hotel. Check-in and -out was fast and efficient, our account was accurate.I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It is a credit to Stratford and London. I have until now associated visits to London with being ripped off, not any more. We will be returning later in the year. Bookmark this hotel for any visit to London.

This is a great hotel with wonderful service and the location is just fantastic. across the road from a great shopping mall "Westfield" with the best of shops, cinema halls and a casino.The location is also good for getting into the city with the underground central line.

column9: Great hotel, first rate staff & with fab views of the Olympic Park
column10: Having stayed next door at Christmas in the sister Holiday Inn, this time we checked out the Staybridge Suites for the London Marathon. Without doubt both hotels compliment each other very well. Staff here are great from the moment you check in, all are very well trained, courteous, and obviously enjoy the jobs, which comes across in the first rate customer service. Check in staff were on the money, and special mention the two ladies doing breakfast on Sunday morning, who went out of their way to accommodate my early morning food needs as a participant in the marathon.The Saturday night we ate burgers in the Holiday Inn, and they were still as good as those we enjoyed on our last trip. Rooms are good, shower hot and fast flowing, with fresh linens throughout. My daughters used the gym, and both said it was cool to work out overlooking the Olympic Park.Overall, loved the hotel and a good base for local shopping in the Westfield Centre, as a base into central London with very good rain and tube links. Well down all.

column9: Without doubt best hotel I have stayed in for some time.
column10: Fantastic location with a great view over Olympic stadium and London.   Really friendly staff where nothing is too much.   High quality rooms and breakfast and good value.   Seconds away from bars, restaurants and the casino.

We recently stayed here for 2 nights for a weekend in London. What a great hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful on check-in and check-in. We had a lovely room on the 11th floor overlooking the Olympic park. Room was comfortable and spacious. Kitchen area was nice fridge was handy for cold drinks. Breakfast which was included was lovely and they had a good selection of hot and cold food. Bar area was nice, but a bit confusing to get to. Overall great stay and have booked to go back in June.

Stayed at the hotel overnight this past sat and was very impressed with it! Was our first time at a Staybridge Suites and love that you get your own kitchen etc which is perfect if you are just wanting to relax or if you are staying for a few nights. The room was perfectly clean and Breakfast was great, especially considering it was very busy, you weren't waiting too long for anything. Service from the staff was just as I would like and expect. Perfectly courteous and helpful. Great Location so will definitely be returning when get the opportunity and highly recommend!

The rooms are excellent, the breakfast is very filling. Location is lively, across from a casino, but anyone coming to stay here should expect that. My only gripe was the bed - sheets just seemed very cheap and Premier Inn-ish. Overall a superb place to stay.

column9: Great time and will def be back
column10: This was our first time staying here and a last minute booking , but so pleased we stayed . everything you need is there and staff so welcoming . The breakfast was a bonus as well , you could even take it to your room x

column9: Wonderful stay, already booked to come back!
column10: Whilst attending the Country to Country weekend we booked into the Staybrdige Suites in Stratford. Westfield Stratford has excellent and reasonably car parking, restaurant options and is on a main train/tube terminus just perfect for easy access to the O2. The hotel rooms are excellently appointed with kingsize beds, large en-suites and a kitchen. This is an excellent option for staying in London as you can leave drinks in the fridge for later for example.The hotel itself has a small shop open 24 hours if you need anything, and a complimentary breakfast is included. The breakfast is served on the 12th floor, which has a stunning view over to Canary Wharf, 02 and The Shard. There was a good choice of breakfast options with fruit salad, hot options and pastries. Both the hotel and the room were superbly clean and the staff were friendly and welcoming.All in all this is an excellent option in terms of location and facilities. It was so good I have already booked to go back!

Our second visit to the Staybridge Suites and the Hotel is still keeping up standards unlike some of the Holiday Inn complexes.The Rooms are great and each feature a Kitchenette fitted out with a Fridge, Dishwasher, Hob and Microwave. Bathrooms all have a Shower (no Bath) and are nicely fitted out as are the Bedrooms with a large comfortable Bed, Reasonable size TV and good lighting. We paid extra for a room overlooking the Olympic Park (all rooms are over and above the 8th Floor) and the view also included the complete East side of London including the O2 Arena, Canary Wharf and the Shard.The Holiday Inn concept of Buffet Breakfast works well here and always has a greater selection of Fruits, Breads and Hot Food which are constantly being topped up or refreshed by the proficient staff.Always a favourite place to stay when we are in the East of London and look forward to a return.Location:                  5 Presentation:           5Bed comfort:            5Bathroom facilities:  4Cleanliness:             5Soundproofing:        4                     Food:                       4

column9: Top class service, Excellent food, Awesome location
column10: Happy to share that me and my Husband have extended our stay in this hotel due to excellent facilities. Rooms are quite good, with all necessary items provided in abundance, good view.Staff is very nice and friendly. Gym is also well maintained.Free evening snacks provided on weekdays are quite delicious.Should not forget to mention Fish n Chips, Chicken wings, Veggie Burger !!! Keep it up. Expect to see more delicacies.

My husband and I visited here as we were going to the theatre.  We stayed for one night.  The rooms are clean and comfortable with excellent views.  There's a hairdryer, ironing board and iron, tea coffee ect.  In the bathroom there's shampoo and shower gels.  The shower is lovely.  Different settings and powerful.  The decoration is relaxing and calm.  Flat screen tv by bed.  Kitchenette perfect including dishwasher, fridge and utensils. The bed was very comfortable and I slept perfectly.  The only thing I would have liked is a softer pillow (only due to neck problem) but apart from that we thought it was perfect!  The breakfast was plenty.  Though id suggest to go down earlier whilst its nice and fresh as the bacon was solid by time we went to have breakfast but as I said we did get down there late!  Brilliant car parking in Westfield shopping centre, car park B for us, right by the hotel, and to go shopping in Westfield we just stepped out of the hotel and we were there.  Staff friendly, professional and polite.

I only stayed at this hotel as my regular hotel in Tower Bridge was full and I LOVED IT. The proximity of the shopping center and the array of restaurants around make it for an excellent stay. The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. They are the ideal representation and image of the diverse cultural backgrounds which make East London so vibrant and attractive. And I believe that it contributes to create a genuine, caring atmosphere at the hotel. The rooms / suite are great, well appointed. When you think of how much you pay, it looks classy, stylish and really on par with some far more expensive properties in downtown. Breakfast is a good experience not to be missed, quality and quantity have found the right balance. Overall, I could not recommend this place enough and I shall return as soon as I am given the opportunity. Yes, it is a bit far way from the West End but with the javelin train bringing you to St Pancreas in 5 minutes, you cannot really complain !

column9: Staff training during peak check-in will cause delays!!
column10: Big queues at check-in as a trainee was fumbling through the check-in process whilst the Trainer was obviously doing his own thing leaving her to flounder. Queues built up and people were obviously annoyed!This lets down an otherwise reasonable place to stay, and the Manager's social evenings from Tues-Thurs are a chance for the management to talk to the guests and positively encourage good reviews on sites such as this.Please try and keep initial training to out of peak hours. Ive had this on more than one occasion in my stays over the past few months. I doubt I will return to this hotel.

We stayed one night at the Staybridge suites having stayed the previous night at the Holiday inn. I only wish we had booked the Staybridge suites for both nights. What a wonderful experience it was. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left, it was a very pleasant experience indeed. Apologies for not knowing the name of the gentleman who checked us in . I do know he was French and from merely approaching the check in desk, he was very warm, welcoming, helpful and accommodating. Our room was very well appointed and very comfortable indeed. The whole experience felt like we were encapsulated in our own little bubble. The views over the Olympic park were magnificent and it was certainly an environment to relax in. We are already looking to see when we can next make a booking.

column9: Good place for long-stay business travelers
column10: The hotel is tucked away in the Westfield shopping centre in Stratford, but has good public transport facilities nearby.The hotel is more catered for long-stay guests. The rooms all have a large (really larges) kitchen and the sleeping area and bath-room are above average size as well.Rooms have good design and are clean. Nothing that really striked me in particular, and a good place for (long stay) business travelers. Good breakfast buffet and a shop at the reception to buy food (e.g. to cook in your room). Several dining options in the shopping mall (but many closing quite early).The staff at the reception is helpful.

Stayed at the Birmingham Staybridge suites and was so impressed stayed here. Even better. Suite was clean, modern and fresh with everything you would need in the kitchen area. The location was great-straight out of the door in the Westfield Shopping Centre and the Olympic village. The reception was on the 12th floor and the view to the O2 ( three stops on the tube away, Canary Wharf and the Olympic park was breath taking. Sitting there in the morning ,eating breakfast ,it was spectacular. Staff were helpful as usual.  Loved the opportunity to help ourselves at any time for a coffee in the Pantry and sit , watching the view, relaxing. Took 30 minutes to get from the suite to west end to see a show. Will certainly be back soon. Thank you for a great time- made even more fun sporting the Sport Relief " stars" at breakfast.!.

column9: We will be back! It was grrrrr8!
column10: We have just got back from London having stayed at the Staybridge for just one night. We are employees of IHG and after staying here, it has made us even more proud to work for the company. Great view on the 12th floor of the Olympic park and the skyline of London.  Lovely welcoming staff on Reception on Friday afternoon. Lovely clean room with a gr8 view again overlooking the Olympic park. We were pleasantly surprised at the bottle of wine and a card in our room as we were celebrating whilst we were staying. Sucha nice touch! :) Lovely Breakfast in the morning, so much to choose from and the layout is fantastic being set out in the style of a home kitchen. Jason on check out was really friendly and helpful offering to look after our bags whilst we went shopping. Just want to say a special thank you to Anca in reservations for all your help during the lead up to our stay. We are seeing Katy Perry at the O2 in May so we will be back!! Overall great hotel, great location,  great staff, great food, great facilities. Thank you Staybridge! :)

Great place to stay within the Westfield outlets, next to the 2012 Olympic village. Brand new hotel, built on the top of the Holiday Inn Stratford. Even great service and clean room, still too expensive for the value.

A thoroughly enjoyable stay. First time at a Staybridge Suites hotel and it won't be the last. The hotel is very homely with friendly staff and an atmosphere which conjures up random conversations between guests unlike any hotel I've stayed at before.
