Easy early check in to a room with a stunning Olympic park view as preferenced. One bedroom suite was spacious, clean and worth the upgrade. Also has the added benefit of a sofa bed and a bath. Breakfast was of a good standard and also made use of The Den to do some work, which is a nicely furnished communal living room/library. I cannot fault this hotel. Despite being a 30 min Jubilee line journey (or 7 min high speed) out of the centre of London, with Westfield downstairs I would recommend this for most London stays.

Great rates. Sooooo convenient on the Central Line with direct access to central London. Debbie does a crackin' bacon butty for breakfast. The list of +'s is endless. I see no point paying ¬£200+ per night in the West End when you can "come home" to the Staybridge with the same level of luxury.If you missed dinner, you can "fill up" on Tues/Wed/Thurs nights as they lay on hotdogs...cheeses etc. All complimentary. Have to say I always feel well looked after. Lee Jeffries

This hotel has got to be my favourite in London mainly because the staff are so friendly and accommodating. Tim and Chloe on the front desk and Jordan, Debbie and Julie from the kitchen. The kitchen staff in particular are fantastic - they always go out their way to help and are really chatty and full of energy. The added touches such as the food their serve in the evening which is complimentary is a real nice idea.

Lovely hotel.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Room well equipped with everything you would need from toaster to a dishwasher!   Clean throughout. Great location for trip to west end to see a show.   Plenty of choice for breakfast with view over what was the Olympic park.  Checkout is not till 12.00 which was great as most shops in Westfield don't open until 12 on a Sunday.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay?

This place has the hotel quality feel yet homely and well equipped.  The kitchenette is decent sized and it makes for a manageable size, so there isnt a mess all the time.  The room has TV in living room and one in the bedroom.  There is an Apple TV connected to the living room TV also.  there are a lot of useful hidden storage options, which make for a pleasant surprise.  Hopefully you can get a room with an Olympic Park view.One word of warning is, Stratford Westfield closes around 9pm, except for the restaurants, which isnt great timing for working folk like me.  You can always take the central line directly to Oxford Circus or even further west to Westfields Shepherds bush though.The place itself though, is very convenient, easy access to the station and in pleasant surroundings.  Oh and there is a second gym in Holiday Inn on the 3rd floor.

column9: Friendly & Welcoming Home away from home
column10: Stayed here for two months - Feb & Mar 2014. Very warm and friendly staff - Umunique, Luke, Nicholas, Timothy, Musa, Mary, Debbie, Jordan and others - go out of their way to make guests feel right at home. Adi, my two year old boy gets spoilt rotten by everyone and has the run of the place.Rooms are spacious and well furnished. Complimentary breakfast in the mornings like many other hotels, but also light snacks and drinks in the evenings that no one else does.Great location too, right in the middle of Westfield mall.We'll be staying here every time we visit London.

Debbie's Managers Reception was an American diner this week and the ambiance was created by Chloe with her sparkling wit and wonderful conversation. Always a home away from home with these guys!! Bring on the pie and mash next time....

My partner and I stayed at the Staybridge suites Stratford, as we where going to see a show at the O2. The hotel was well situated for the O2 and lots of other London attractions. The room was very spacious and comfortable, there was plenty of choice of things to eat and drink for breakfast. The staff where very helpful and knowledgeable. Great views over the Olympic park, and great for all the shops, restaurants, and bars & entertainment at Westfield shopping centre.

column9: Great location, friendly staff but not the most comfy of beds!
column10: Really good location that has easy access to the tube and rail networks, made the mistake on arrival of entering the lifts for the Holiday Inn and the staff were not very welcoming but the Staybridge Suite staff were so friendly especially Debbie at breakfast one morning!Found the beds just too hard and have found this the same in all my visits to Holiday Inn properties but this is down to personal preference so we're probably just being fussy I guess!Tea, coffee and pastries are available all day long which is something nice to have access too for that break now and againBreakfast was good seeing as it's free, only stayed two nights but it seems they mix up the hot selection every day, could of done with some beans the first morning which appeared the second day! huge selection of items hot and cold, cereals, pastries, omelettes, sausages etc.Would stay here again for the location to the O2 as you travel back eastbound after a concert thus avoiding the huge crowds heading westbound towards Waterloo and the various connecting lines.

I stayed here for the first time in February after a colleague recommended it. Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds and peaceful location despite being surrounded by the train stations, roads and tubes. The variety of options for places to eat is perfect or you can stay in and use the hotel facilities. The breakfast buffet was nice too. The staff are professional and friendly at all times. Highly recommended.

column9: Great value for money business hotel
column10: I like the Staybridge Suites at Stratford for the flexibility of either going out to eat (lots of options) or staying in (using the facilities of the hotel) but most importantly their amazingly comfortable beds and clean rooms.The hotel staff are friendly & professional. The location of the hotel is perfect for the tube station. I would highly recommend as this is now my preferred hotel when staying in London on business.

column9: Your place to stay for the O2 and great shopping!
column10: Wow - stayed here with my daughter for the weekend it was so easy to get to see Beyonce at the O2 on the Saturday night. Shopping Centre right on the doorstep, and easy to get to by car and by train. Nice room, great shower

Stayed here in two room while my daughter and her friend went to the O2. Perfect location , 5 minutes walk to the tube.  Right in amongst the shops , ¬£5 overnight to park (maybe a special) cosy rooms, decent breakfast and great service on reception. Fantastic all round.

This is the most stunning place to stay! The whole place is clean, friendly, and so resourceful with its own pantry/shop despite being next to the shopping mall. Brilliant idea of having a kitchen with hob, microwave, toaster, fridge and dishwasher as it cuts cost of eating out all the time. The views of London , especially from the communal areas are 360 degrees and right next to the Olympic village. The staff are friendly and helpful and the choice at breakfast was second to none. The omelettes were a lovely variation!Right next to the station, the shops and the entertainment but never a sound heard.Would definitely return!

column9: Great Place, Especially manager nights !! Thx to Debbie and the team
column10: If your staying in London and want a friendy place to stay, with special treatment on manager nights then this is your place. Where else in London is giving you free pancakes (Delicious BTW) and a glass of wine, beer, or softies for those who don't indulge, alongside on shrove Tuesday.Oh and the rooms great, location great, and at the price... I've already booked my next 2 trips.Zac

Stayed for 2 nights in a one bed suite. It was very clean and well appointed. Great location for shops and restaurants 1 minute walk (Westfield) . Also great links within a 5 minute walk......tube and DLR at Stratford Station.The staff were all very helpful with problems that arose..... coffee machines kept breaking down at breakfast on both days.My only gripe was a portable alarm clock in the bedroom which was set for 6.30 on the Sunday morning (not on saturday) with a second alarm at 6.40!! Not the relaxing Sunday lie in  I had envisaged. Perhaps housekeeping could check that no alarm times are set when they clean the rooms? I look forward to returning very soon and I have already booked a Olympic Park view room when I return for a concert at the O2 in a couple of weeks. Overall a great place to stay. Taxi to city airport was ¬£18 on the Sunday.

column9: Nothing bad to say about the place
column10: Stayed here in December 2013 for 2 nights, really liked it. We did some Christmas shopping and for that it was great...although the Westfield is a madhouse on the weekends. Convenient to get to Central London aswell. Room was quite big, TV was a bit complicated, but sleek and nice. Bathroom great aswell, property was in good condition. We had great view of the Wembley and surroundings. And it was such a breeze to get there from London City Airport, 20-30 minutes from the time we got out of the plane, door-to-door. Since it is a bit out of the way (wouldn't worry about that), the rates are quite good for expensive London. They also let us check in at 9am, which was a huge plus for me. Staff was really nice anyway, no complaints. Will definitely stay here again.

Excellent From Start To Finish, Stay In December On A Saturday Night Book By My HusbandChecking In Was Very Easy And Quick Cant Remember Name But Very Nice ,The Rooms Are Fantastic, Especially The Shower ,The View Was Great Looking Over The Olympic Stadium And The Staff Were Very Helpful And Friendly, ( DEBBIE WAS OUTSTANDING VERY WARM AND WELCOMING ,SO DOWN TO EARTH AND NOTHING WAS TO MUCH FOR HER THANK YOU DEBS )Breakfast Was Superb With Excellent Friendly Smiling Staff Never Felt So At Home Thank You Be Back Again

I booked a 2 night stay for my wife's birthday and was not disappointed. The room was a king studio and is spacious enough for a weekend, was well equipped and clean, the bathroom was also well kept and a huge shower.We also had friends staying for the Saturday night and they said the exact same about their room.The complimentary breakfast was fantastic, hot food, pastries, cereals everything you could want.We will definitely being staying both here and using the Staybridge brand again,Thank you :)

column9: A tale of the good and the disappointing
column10: Not quite. First the good: super location, spacious rooms. Several little things that add up to just an ok grade:Check in: I was in a hurry and the clerk was trying to do his full X point routine. Just did not get and then Gym: was not loaded on my card. I had to go back to reception. Phone: just did not work, could not call out easily. WiFI: was fiddly, just required me to do too many things. AppleTV: no controller in my room. And, nice folk had a kettle in the room and some instant coffee, but no spoons. Silly

Stayed for 3 nights with husband and family.  Enjoyed the friendly atmosphere in this hotel. Enjoyed the good breakfasts and the drinks and refreshments at 7pm-8pm on Tues-Thurs.Great views from top floor and a great shopping area at Westfield shopping centre

Stayed for 4 nights at the end of January. Hotel was brilliant, staff all very friendly and room was brilliant. Our suite was on the 11th floor, what an amazing view! The staff also left a bottle of wine in the room, what a nice touch. Bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in! The amenities in the suite were very good too, Apple TV was a nice touch. Location wise was excellent, just a few minutes walk from the tube. Being located in the shopping centre too, anything you could need was a stones throw away!I will definitely be returning in the future and have already been recommending to guests in my hotel!

column9: Really felt as if in home - Vinayak
column10: Its been first time in London, also being vegetarian, this hotel makes perfect place to stay. Nice staff, hygienic breakfast, gym, very near to Westfield shopping, walk able to Stratford tube station.The thing which I liked most is every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday there will be managers at reception, in which we relax after work with drink with nibbles and off course along with lots of chit chat with friends..

I stayed at the Staybridge Suites on Saturday 22nd February. I arrived at the reception desk and was greated by Tim with the fantastic American Accent. He was very professional explaining everything to me re breakfast times etc. I went to my room and it was lovely a proper little apartment. A lovely compact kitchen area with everything you could possibly want, kettle, toaster, dish washer, hob for cooking etc. The lounge had an really comfortable sofa with a plasma screen with apple tv to use if you have an account. There was also another plasma in the bedroom. The bathroom had full size toiletries including shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. I had lunch in the Holiday inn that day, which was a very good sized chicken burger with chips. It was quick to turn up and very generous portion of chips. I then had afternoon tea in there after doing some shopping in Westfield which was fantastic proper tea leaves with a twinings timer which I had to wait 3 1/2 mintutes for it to brew. It was lovely to sit there and look out over the olympic park. I went out to dinner that evening with a friend in westfield. We then went to 'The Den' which is back int he Staybridge Suites to watch some TV. It was really nice to sit there and have free tea while sitting there chilling. When I went to bed it didnt take me long to drift off as the bed was so comfortable I forgot that I was actually staying in a hotel. The following morning I woke up and had the most amazing shower, the shower head is huge, I thought from previous hotel stays that the pressure for the shower was going to be rubbish. Oh no I was totally mistaken, the water came flying out as each of the rooms has its own set of pipes. I really didnt want to get out of the shower. I actually went to look at the breakfast in the Staybridge which looked lovely but ended up eating with my friend in the Holiday Inn below which was lovely. A very good selection of breakfast items and they also managed to get me some gluten free bread for toasting which was a very  nice touch. All in all I can say that if you want to go on a nice shopping weekend I would definetely recommend staying here.

column9: Great experience at the Staybridge stratford - Cheryl & Jasmine
column10: Perfect hotel for shopping and a great view from hotel room of London City. I enjoyed our stay at the Staybridge stratford and would recommend it. The theme nights are a great idea and I look forward to my next visit!

Stayed here just before Christmas to do some shopping with my girlfriend. It has to be said that the location of this hotel is second to none. It's situated on the top few floors of the Holiday Inn and the entrance is literally about 30 yards from the Westfield shopping centre. Check in was quick and easy from the top floor of the hotel which has fantastic views of the Olympic park. There is the usual incidentals charge of ¬£70 for the room which gets credited back to your account shortly after departure. The suite itself was a decent size with a kitchen area along with one bedroom and a living area. There is a tv in both the bedroom and living area. There is also a bathroom with decent size bath. The room in general was clean although there were a few staines on the sofa and tea towel! The self service breakfast in the morning is also on the top floor of the hotel so you had the great views and the breakfast itself was of superb quality. You could also take your breakfast back to your room if so desired! Overall a nice place to stay in a truly superb location!!!

Had to stay a weekend away from home and choose to stay here as it is in the opposite area to where I life. It is a very nice hotel, all good but nothing extraordinary. Location is good and bad at the same time but I guess you know when you choose.

Excellent location for those who love easy shoppingopportunities. As Westfield are just across the sidewalk. So leave your coat in your room. But the area also have nice local pubs and not to forget.....the Olympic Parc

Stayed over a weekend in a Studio king. Check in effortless. Very comfortable room with Microwave/convention oven dishwasher, sink and utensils to cook around a basic meal. Fridge for your wine. Spacious airy and bright room. Bathroom is limited to a shower which was disappointing. Comfy bed, towels average quality and basic toiletries provided. Breakfast buffet was good and the area has a home from home kitchen feel, where you can mull over a recipe book, which are provided in the area. Tea and coffee available if you require during the day. No housekeeping service provided, however, if you wish they will organise for you. I consider this a pre requisite but I can understand that this is a nod to guests who don't wish to be disturbed and staybridge cleverly market it this way. Great free laundry facilities should you require and good gym over looking the stadium. The staff were amazing, courteous, polite, helpful and very friendly. On the doorstep of an amazing shopping and leisure centre with excellent transport links. A really comfortable enjoyable stay. I have awarded 4 due to the lack of tub and housekeeping and believe a 5 has to be an amazing, blow your socks off awesome type of experience, however, if you want a very comfortable stay with great service and great access to London, plus fancy a bit of shop, you won't go far wrong here.

column9: Good, but not worthy of top rating
column10: London rooms can be problematic, they are small, expensive, sometimes old and run-down, so at least this was in decent shape being new and provided a comfortable sleep, but this isn't worth a 5-star review...which should be reserved for the exceptional and special places that go beyond basic function.On the positive side, the location is good if you need to be on this end of the city for a conference at the Excel Center. It is handy to have shopping and dining options of the Westfield mall down the elevator.  They have a nice breakfast buffet and good shower temperature and pressure with rain shower head.  I can see the small kitchenette being useful for longer stays.  The price was good compared to options in central London.Things that could be better include rooms that are small and nothing special; no comfortable area to sit in the room, hence the large public areas near the breakfast room. My room showed signs of wear with broken tiles, chipped furniture, stains on floor/wall.  A pet peeve is that the shampoo, conditioner, shower gel are in open large bottles and not sealed or fresh per check-in.  I don't like this and decided to buy my own from the drugstore in the mall.  Free WiFi is too slow to work effectively; had to pay extra to upgrade to premium speed level.  Location is not near much beyond the mall and the dining options are not really local options, felt like chain restaurants like at a mall back home; if you looking for local flavor look for something more central. Entrance is in the mall so you do have to deal with your luggage through the shopping area even if dropped off by car.To get here from Heathrow I recommend you take the tube if you can mange your luggage down one flight of stairs - it is one connection at Holborn and takes about 1 hour and costs about ¬£6.00 per person vs. a ¬£100.00 cab ride that also can take about an hour.

Stayed here for one night while attending party at Holiday Inn (part of the same building). Well appointed and fitted out one bedroom suite with living room. Overall a bit on the small size, but not unusual so for Central London, full kitchen, good size bathroom and bedroom with fantastic view of the Olympic park. Greta selection of entertainment on the TVs (if you can workout how to use). Communal areas spotlessly clean and well kept. Breakfast selection was first rate - although the lady attending was so miserable, in contrast to the reception staff. External balcony with great view of London. So convenient for mainline transport and Westway shopping center. Literally a few doors along from the Casino. Entrances tightly controlled by Key card.

I've been staying at Staybridge during the week for many months. The team there make life very easy for me and any little requests receive speedy attention. I've put this review on to illustrate their customer approach. A couple of weeks ago they consulted clients about the Manager Social night. In less than 2 weeks I sat in the lounge/hub last Thursday tucking into tasty Indian lite bites put together by Debbie and team. They'd also moved the event back half an hour - a further response to customer feedback. All in all a great night, great atmosphere and proved once more Staybridge listens. Well done team.

Tonight was the first of I hope many theme nights at the managers social. We'll done Debbie on a fantastic selection of Indian tapas. Onion bhajis, tandoori chicken, dips, Bombay mix - really yummy. Looking forward to the next one. Thank you very much staybridge.

column9: Peace in the Middle of a Mall
column10: Stayed at the Staybridge for 2 weeks. Hotel is in Stratford within the premises of the brand new West field mall which seems to be teeming with people all the time. Another great plus is it is walking distance to the Stratford Train Station. Had quite a bit of difficulty locating the address! It does not show up correctly in the GPS. Found it to be a little PRICELY compared to similar Staybridge properties in the US.Breakfast spread can do with a lot of improvement but otherwise a great, neat, quiet property with a touch of class near Central London

column9: A little nicer than the Holiday Inn
column10: My husband and I stayed here last year , the rooms are very nice, you have a little kitchenette area with all cooking facilities, cutlery and crockery provided which is handy if you are staying for a few days. The room was cosy and has all the amenities you require with good views of the Olympic park, the Staybridge Suites are just a little nicer than the Holiday Inn, cosier !

My children and I stayed at this hotel for four nights.  The hotel is just a few steps from the Westfield mall.  Moving around was easy as there was a taxi stand in front of the mall. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, with a king size bed and a sofa bed. The rooms are clean and well maintained with adequate toiletries provided. There is a small kitchen equipped with a dishwasher, refrigerator, stove, toaster, cooking utensils etc. which are very valuable if you are doing some cooking. The staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is good, with a variety of foods to choose from.Checking in and out was smooth and easy.The hotel is quiet, despite being located beside a big mall.  I had a view of the Olympic stadium from my room window.The down side was the inability to easily locate the hotel on our first day.That notwithstanding, the hotel met my expectations and I will definitely be going back there!

Wife and I stayed a few weeks ago, on a Saturday night.  We were attending an event at the Copper Box.The location of the suites was ideal for what we wanted.  The room was well decorated with subtle and muted decor and furniture.  The room we stayed in was in good working order and not signs of any damage.  Overall, we were impressed with what was in the room and the overall layout.Reception (on 12th Floor - take lifts on right as you enter building) was very efficient and Timothy was very helpful, polite and 'quick' with the whole check-in process.The room/corridor noise was minimal and we slept (we have two 6 month old baby daughters) very well.  Breakfast, consisted a buffet of simple cooked and continental food.  I am not a breakfast person (eggs/bacon and double espresso) and my wife is a cereal and toast person - the buffet was more that adequate.We found a number of restaurants very close to suites, though it was extremely busy on a Saturday night ‚Äì I would recommend to explore in the day, see where youi want to eat and book.  With the huge amount of choices and a Waitrose supermarket then there really is something for everyone in a very close area.I will definitely stay again, when we are back down for another event.  One, comment ‚Äì there are no ‚Äòtwo bedroom‚Äô suites, which would be nice for our specific circumstances ‚Äì though ‚Äòadjoining‚Äô one bedroom suites is available on request.We enjoyed our stay.

Stayed here for two nights 21/22 January with my daughter as we were going to an event at the 02 . We had a one bedroom suite which was beautifully equipped and very comfortable. My daughter decided not to share the kingsize bed with me , but to sleep on the lounge settee , a request for another duvet was given immediate attention , and was supplied within 10 minutes ! All the staff were very friendly and made us feel very much at home . The hot or cold breakfast which you helped yourself to from what looked like a large family kitchen was very good. The location was perfect as it was on the large Westfield shopping centre and the links to london and the 02 , could not have been better , it was extremely easy to get around , even for a country bumpkin like me . I would definitely stay here again if I come to london and would most definitely recommend to anyone . Top marks staybridge suites !!!

Booked this hotel as we were going to the anniversary games - and what an amazing time we had !! The hotel is in a perfect place and has a wonderful atmosphere with fab staff who are very helpful and knowledgable !! Would defiantly recomend a stay here

I booked this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday and it was just as I imagined. Perfect location, especially if you want to do a bit of late night shopping. The staff were extremely friendly and I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast in the morning was good but we were unaware it was a buffet, no complaints for the standard though. Would love to come back!

Just got back from a 3 night break from the hotel. Can't recommend it enough if you want to avoid central London prices, have a decent size room and feel at home. Was let down by quite a few little things; on arrival kettle had 2cm of descaler left in it! Luckily I noticed and didn't make a cuppa, almost did though. Mentioned it to reception as this could have been dangerous, but they just said they would get someone to clean it out (which they never did!)The sofa in our lounge was beyond uncomfortable, the padding must have been very cheap as can only be a year or so old, but it's flat and solid. This made sitting in the lounge a waste of time, and money for the upgrade!Strangely you can upgrade your TV to Apple TV and use airplay, great, we could keep upto date with the soaps on demand. Unfortunately the Apple TV only works on the lounge TV as the bedroom TV is not connected up, and with the sofa being unusable, well another wasted upgrade!The finish to the rooms must have been very quick, paint peeling off all over, shame really as it's a nice looking hotel, but as long as you don't look too hard you don't notice, so didn't worry me too much.Photos and description of the one bedroom suite made out they had baths, but only a shower. Was a big reason to upgrade, so felt a little mis-soldEnough of the negatives (even though that's probably more what your interested in), the positives;Excellent location, 15 mins tube to central london.Very friendly team at the hotel, especially breakfast team who seemed very friendly (which is often rare at breakfast)Friendly reception team, but lacked genuine concern it seemed at times, even though they always asked.Modern and homely and great views. All in all, was good, but disappointed with the lounge, bath(or lack of) and TV.Would stay again, but would shop around first.

column9: Fantastic Location - A Must when staying in London!
column10: Stayed at this hotel in December during a weekend of Christmas Shopping in London. Hotel is in the perfect location, a 5 minute walk from Stratford Train and Tube station with Westfield shopping centre on site and central line tubes running into Central London every few minutes.We arrived early but were able to check in straight away, and were given a studio suite on the 10th floor with views over London and the Olympic Park. Rooms have a kitchenette in them with cutlery, crockery, dishwasher, fridge and freezer so perfect for long stays. Room was spotlessly clean and had fantastic facilities. TV was of a good size and bed was comfy. Bathroom was lovely and shower was amazing! Had room service which comes from the Holiday Inn Below but it was of a good standard and there was quite a good selection of dishes on offer. Breakfast the next morning was exceptional - I would go as far to say it was the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. Didn't have to wait at all to be seated, even at peak times, and there was a huge selection of hot items (sausage, egg, hash browns, bacon, tomatoes and mushrooms), pastries, breads, meats and cheeses, juices, teas and coffees. Breakfast room was lovely and light and had fantastic panoramic views over London - even better on a nice, clear day. Check-out was quick and efficient, and all of the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful - Especially a lady on front desk with pink/red hair (don't remember the name!) who looked after us spectacularly throughout our stay and made us feel extremely welcome.Overall a fantastic stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again if I was staying in London.

Can't complain about this place at all.  We arrived into Kings Cross from Newcastle and rang the hotel ahead to see if we could check in early which they were more than happy to do and we also got a room looking over the Olympic stadium!!I've seen a few reviews complaining that there isn't much choice for breakfast which got me worried but on arrival into the kitchen area I was surprised to see a full English buffet, 2 coffee machines, toasters with every type of spread available, a fridge full of drinks to help yourself with and a island in the middle topped with yogurts, croissants, bagels, baguettes and fruit salads plus much more so I think maybe the posters about lack of food were slightly out of touch as I certainly couldn't fit anymore in after breakfast!!!The rooms themselves were fantastic. Every room has a kitchenette fully equipped with dishwasher, sink, hob, fridge, microwave (also a grill) plus glasses and cutlery pretty much everything you need to cook for yourself! We had a double suite so minus the living area but it was perfectly adequate for two people, along with a lovely bathroom and amazing shower!!! We stayed for the new year fireworks and were regularly travelling between hotel and Central London and found the 20 minute journey no problem at all! For ¬£5.90 with a railcard we came and went as we pleased each day!!All in all we loved our stay at the Staybridge which added to a great four days in London to see in the new year!! Thank you Staybridge Suites!!!

Staybridge Suites are in an easy location within Westfield Stratford City. The best parking for here is car park B, on the level you enter.It is in the same building as the Holiday Inn hotel, but has a separate elevator.Check in was excellent; and throughout my stay the front desk staff were superb - there was a high level of interest and enthusiasm from the staff. My room was a studio suite (disappointed not to have been upgraded as I was in my previous stay) which was fairly well-appointed with a desk and kitchenette. Sadly there was only a single chair rather than a sofa.Room rates were OK however on the high side compared to other IHG properties in the area. I would recommend this to people looking to stay in the area.

An absolutely great stay!! Booked for my husband as a surprise and I couldn't have been happier with the staff, hotel and location. The hotel was spotless and the suite we stayed in was very spacious with a big kitchen so u can eat in if u prefer. Complimentary breakfast which exceeded expectations. Westfield shopping centre right on the hotel door step, with plenty of shops we grabbed  great bargains. Many restaurants to choose from too. All in all, if we will be recommending the hotel to all family and friends and if we are back in London this hotel will be our first choice. Also, Timothy and Rabia, if you are reading this, keep up the great service you provide. Both are wonderful with very bubbly personalities and a very helpful attitude. You made our stay as perfect as possible from the moment we walked in and it's been a pleasure to know that such genuine people still exist in hospitality.

column9: Beware - Group opening in Tibet despite ethical issues
column10: Before I write my review I want people to be aware that this hotel group is opening a hotel in Lhasa in illegally occupied Tibet and naming it Lhasa Paradise. There are so many human rights violations by China here & IHG are selling "paradise" branding which lines China's pockets through encouraging tourism and allows capitalism to further remove the culture of the Tibetan people. I'm saying that because if I had known I wouldn't have stayed here. What is happening to these people (and has happened) is atrocious and I want no part of it. Over 100 Tibetans have now self immolated (drank & dowsed themselves in petrol, then burned themselves alive) in protest. So now you roughly know too and if concerned can look into things yourself as you see fit. Again I stress to make your own opinion based on your own research and not take what I say for fact or complete truth. I may have made a mis-statement and would not falsely want to misrepresent the situation in Tibet or behavior of IHG. I just know those with ethical concerns would want this highlighted even if I put things ineptly. I stayed here with a friend in November. I stayed in one of the suites with both a bedroom and a living room. The bed was comfortable - enough so even for my friend that suffers from a mild hip problem (I am not a doctor or anything close - please don't take that as medical advice! Each person will feel different about the bed and should be advised suitably if they have any medical conditions). I had been expecting to be able to play movies on the tv in the bedroom but could only do so on the tv in the living room.The sofa is ok for two but you get squished in if you want to share it laying down. The view was down onto the Westfield Shopping Centre. (Just in case you are wondering - yes there is a primark in there).You really are right next to it. It's a five minute walk out the station and to the hotel. There are two exits from the train station but head to the Westfield Centre itself as sign posted. I am a nervous traveller but it wasn't hard to find at all. Once outside the Centre you will see directions to the hotel sign posted. It is just before John Lewis.On arrival you go up a lift. Another hotel operates on the lower floors. In reception you will be treated to two staff members that stand up to greet you which is a nice touch. Check in went very smoothly for me, fairly quick and they will mention an IHG Rewards Club you can sign up to. Movie night is also mentioned - one night a week they show a movie all guests can attend. It is usually advertised in the lift. As usual you get told breakfast times - oh and if you come in the afternoon a free cookie. I missed that cookie as I came slightly too early and never had chance to find an excuse to come back downstairs. It should be added reception staff are lovely. While you are checking in you can see down past an area you can buy some food and drinks (minimal amounts) as well as very basic toiletries. I didn't spy condoms so if you are their for fun make sure to pack them! The room is open plan and goes right down to the breakfast area and a small hanging out area. There is a balcony on the right where it is pleasant to look out over the surrounding area. It is all modern and tastefully decorated with daily papers adorning the tables to read.I remember thinking the shower was pretty good. I did not use the cooking in facilities but they looked well stocked. Everything was clean through out the room. What I did do was order in twice. The food however comes from the hotel below in the same building. It is meh. Normal British pub grub - I think they could have been better dishes. They suffice and are not bad but I know there is room for improvement. I had better food at the Premier Inn at London County Hall for example which is lower budget - but again food from downstairs hotel - not this chain. Also if you are up to it you have access to the shopping centres restaurants and there it pretty much caters for everything. I think their pantry could have been better stocked, it's nowhere near any close to a well stocked shop. If you plan on doing lots of cooking here bring what you want to cook from elsewhere.While I think of it if I was as a female travelling alone I would have felt safe here. Zero creepy vibes from employees. Also there is a beauticians in the building, something I had been unaware of. It is again downstairs with the other hotel.Breakfast! The breakfast room were food is laid out is fairly user friendly. Around the outskirts you have a hot food station with fry up items, there is a toaster, fridge containing a variety of fruit juices, a tea area, as well as shelves interspersed with glasses, condiments and other eating implements which you may help yourself too. There is an island in the middle which has muffins (blue berry and chocolate), small array of cereals, yogurt, milk, breads etc. I think there were a few cheeses and meats too. Oh and a few types of sweet pastries. I give a special shout out to those muffins though. They were good - very moist. You should hoard those. Trust me. Be careful of one of the hot food serving handles, it gets really hot. I think it was the beans handle but am not 100% sure. I told an employee and they were aware of the problem. They had moved food items around to resolve the issue but it ended up encouraging meat items to drop in veggie items like the beans so ended up back with a very hot serving handle on one dish. There were 4 employees there one morning, a very well supervised area. At the end of breakfast time they pack away sharp so be sure to get in and load up your plate if you want seconds! Next to the window is a nice place to sit if you like to gaze out and look at city landscape.You should have a pretty nice stay here. Only other thing I can think to mention is their website doesn't give as much detail to the hotel as say a non-chain would and that could be improved. I ended up moving to the London County Hall Premier Inn which is right by the London Eye. I had to extend my stay and the price here at short notice was overly high. They would not barter down enough to prolong my stay with them. Granted this is good value for London - with London being expensive but short notice it went up too much for me. I guess the cut in price is due to it being out of central London and not in a main tourist area. At the Premier Inn luxury was less of an issue as my company would not have been in the consideration in the same way. It was also a good central place to stay (but with no frills). If anyone has questions I'm happy to try and help. Enjoy your stay wherever you go.

My girlfriend and i regularly use this hotel although we only live a few miles away, we come here to chill out and for nights out at the Casino is Westfeild Stratford, the location is great and so is the hotel itself, the rooms are modern, the staff are great, very talkative and very friendly, the breakfast is very nice and is also included in the price of the stay, the prices can sometimes be a little on the expensive side but if you book in advance you can get reasonable rates, the only downfall is the parking costs but you can park for cheaper in nearby places, we are big fans of Staybridge Suites and will keep coming back to their hotels.

column9: My favourite place to stay in London
column10: I stay in London a lot for work and the Staybridge Suites at Stratford City are probably my favourite.Clean rooms, good showers with plenty of hot water, cooking facilities (although I've never used them), numerous restaurants and shops in a safe area immediately adjacent to the hotel, parking, and a tube station less than two minutes walk away. What's not to like!The staff are friendly. They have a bar (in the holiday inn - same building). Wireless internet access (and it works).Highly recommended!

Even though this is an "extended stay" hotel, we stayed just one night and it was perfectly adequate. They really have thought of everything. Super friendly staff, who went out of their way to be helpful in every way. From Nicolas at the front desk to Helen who made all the arrangements and all the other staff we met, they are a top team here. A few niggles, like the a/c that turned the temperature up by itself in the middle of the night. Also the bed sheet was too small for the mattress it was on. When reporting these matters to the front desk the next day, the staff were very apologetic and promised these would be dealt with as soon as possible.The hotel location is very convenient for both central London and City Airport and definately a suitable alternative to staying in the centre of the city.Also breakfast was good, though not the most elaborate buffet, but still a good selection. Also, the manager's cocktail hour was a nice surprise with free drinks and nibbles.Recommended.

Stayed in April for 8 nights, friendly staff, great room, location is very convenient besides a shopping centre and 3 mins walk to a tube, breakfast is simple. Laundry service is reasonable, Recommended!

Stayed 1 night in December 2013. Nice greeting at reception, was given upgrade but still a studio type room. Lovely evening reception ( free) and buffet breakfast. Great view of Olympic swimming pool. Very festive atmosphere with great friendly staff. If the price was ¬£20 lower I would stay more often. Beware that because its a suite they sometimes don't have the 20% VAT included in the price - I got caught out and the expenses dept are non too happy.

Stayed here whilst visiting London, clean and tidy throughout with a good selection for breakfast, not a lot of the Olympic site to see at the moment, good for shopping as its within Westfield shopping centre and on the main train and tube lines for easy access in and out of London. Friendly staff too

The rooms are fantastic, the view was great looking over the Olympic stadium and the staff were very helpful and friendly, thank you Debbie for looking after me every morning and at the meet and greet nights

Since I work abroad and do not have a home in London, I prefer to stay in Staybridge suites Westfield because it offers value for money,  good location and great service.  If you are familiar with London it is a great choice rather than staying in central London since it takes under 30 minutes by tube to reach the west end. Nothing to complain about. Would recommend to anyone especially  those staying a week or more.

column9: Long Stay - made to feel at home
column10: Stayed here during London 2012 for a whole month and I'm so glad I was able to. Perfect placement for the Olympic Park and Stratford.The staff were always very attentive and pleasant, while the facilities were excellent.Rooms are spacious and brilliantly equipped. The bathroom was superb.It's a little out of town, but with the trains into the city so regular (and the high speed link available if you need it) it's a very comfortable place to stay.

column9: Great accomodation with view on Olympic stadium.
column10: Although this hotel is not in centre, it is directly at the underground station, so you can get almost anywhere with local transport. You have small kitchen in the room including toaster, microwave and dishwasher. You have limited choice at breakfast, but it was very delicious. Staff is very friendly too and there is also big shopping mall right under the hotel. Maybe just one tip - it would be usefull to me when I got there. If you get out of Underground station, use stairs in front to go up one floor, you will see Samsung shop there, then turn right and you will find hotel on the left side. There is also Holiday Inn in the same building.

Have use Staybridge in Newcastle but first time in London. Staff helped talk me down to the place (hint - look up) and room was excellent. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast room has great views. Will use it again

Great hotel, all very new. Staff were welcoming but sadly I didn't feel particularly special as a platinum PC member. No upgrades apparently (I spotted others with that problem on here), and no other bonus. In many hotels you get a free drink or a movie. It may not be fair to blame the hotel for those things but tbh it does affect your stay.Room was a good size, great view and clean. Shower was fantastic.The lounge/snug is great and there is an incredible balcony on the 12th floor with views of the Olympic park. Beautiful on a good day.30 min Tube ride from the city centre, but walk out of the door straight into the Westfield.

This is my second stay at the hotel.  I was hoping to get an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite with platinum status at IHG but they told me it was full.  10 seconds later on IHG.com, I see there are plenty of 1 bedroom suites available.  I suspect the reason was I paid the lowest category which was a studio suite and they didn't want to double upgrade me to the 1 bedroom type.However last time I stayed at the hotel, I booked the studio suite but I got the one bedroom suite at check in.  If they wanted me to pay a small supplement, they should have mentioned it.  I don't know why hotel staff think that a guest can't check online to see the availability of rooms?Anyway, the deluxe studio suite which I ended up getting is spacious and well appointed.  The bed is really big and the mattress is pretty good too. The bathroom isn't as nice as the 1 bedroom suite but it is fine.The complimentary breakfast is still a little bland in taste but thank goodness they got rid of those red plastic trays.  I would stay again at the hotel. It is very comfortable and well positioned in the Stratford Westfield mall.  For some reason, none of the rates include VAT when every other IHG hotel in the UK does?

Nice rooms with all facilities required and more e.g. airplay; room service items at high standard; the reception team was outstanding and Helen was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Great local amenities and transport network.

We stayed at the Staybridge suites hotel between 21-25 Nov 2013.The hotel is innovated and comfort, although a little far from the city center. There is a large and very nice shopping center inc'l tube station nearby, with shops and restaurants of many kinds.During our stay, we encountered a few issues - one regarding the housekeeping service, which was not present through the weekend, and the other regarding the breakfast service on sunday morning, which was crowded and missing various items. These issues were solved very fast after a short talk with Mr. Rafal, the hotel operation manager.Mr. Rafal and his wonderful front desk stuff were helpful, efficient, friendly and more than willing to help.We had a great time and we will definitely stay again in this hotel during our next stay in London.

This hotel is fantastic.  After Timothy helped me very patiently guide my inept cabbie to the location, he got me settled in, answered all my questions and made me feel right at home.  The hotel is impeccable, and the hot breakfast was well beyond what I expected.  There was a small hiccup and I'm happy to say the manager corrected it quickly and cheerfully.  A gem in London where a lot of hotels act like they're doing you a favour by giving you a room.  I stay mostly at ICs when I stay in London.  I'd put this on par with them, and many ways above, any day.

Receptionist at check in was very friendly, polite, informative and made us to feel like it was her pleasure to have us stay. We had a one bedroom suite on the 11th floor for 7 nights overlooking the Olympic stadium and, off in the distance, the London skyline. We could also just make out the London Eye.The suite was very comfortable with a well fitted out kitchen, adequate size lounge with comfortable furnishings, a large bedroom with large comfortable bed, 2 good size wardrobes and in room safe. The bathroom was quite large with a great shower over the bath. Free WiFi worked fine and we had no signal drop outs. The included smorgasbord breakfast was not the best or most varied we've ever had but it was adequate and did the job quit acceptably. Let's face it, we are not paying Ritz or Hilton prices, and the overall experience is better them anyway. Afternoon/night staff on reception sometimes appeared a little vague when asked for information but all the day staff were great, especially the young French guy (can't remember his name) who was particularly obliging helping me to print my airline boarding pass.   Being part of the Westfield shopping complex it's very convenient for all of your shopping needs and wants, including supermarkets, cafe's, restaurants, fast food and fashion. Several train lines run through Stratford station which is virtually just across the road. There is also a major bus terminus out the front of the shopping center plus a taxi pickup/drop off area. Underground train trips into London were only 15-20 minutes with trains leaving about every 5 minutes on average.We really enjoyed our time at Staybridge Stratford and will always stay here whenever in London.

I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions since it's opening and my recent stay was as good as the first. It's such a pleasure to be greeted by the friendly check in staff and on this occasion got offered a cookie as well as a rewards club member. The rooms are still cleaned to a very high standard as is the rest of the hotel. Of course the bonus in these rooms are the kitchen facilities. Just remember it is not located in central London which is about 20 minutes on the tube but don't let that put you off. Thanks again for an outstanding stay!

Very nice modern new hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good with a good variety to please almost anyone and the view of stratford area and the olympic village is a treat from the breakfast room on the 12th floor .Being on the mall is very convenient with so many eating options plus the underground, upper trains and bus stop are connected to the mall. The only drawback is the approach by car as there is no direct access to the hotel and most taxi or limousine drivers have no idea where to drop you . It takes you a some time and asking around to get to the hotel and if you have a lot of luggage then it certainly becomes a problem. Going to the airport the best thing is to ask the concierge to arrange the car as they know where to come and your luggage can be taken by them to the car.We had arrived early morning at the hotel and the hotel tried their best to accommodate us by providing a room as soon as one became available and offered us to have breakfast while waited for our room.

We stayed here for one week in November while attending a tradeshow at Excel. This was our second stay as we were here at the same time last year. Guest rooms were spacious and clean, staff friendly, fantastic shower, great breakfast. Location excellent! I have absolutely no hesitation to recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you Rafael and staff for another great stay. See you next year!

column9: Large room a luxury in London
column10: If you think the Staybridge Suites is not a luxury brand, well, the huge room that you get here might change your mind. I was totally surprised by the sheer size of my room here at the Stratford property. There was a living room, a fabulous, well-appointed kitchen, a large bedroom with an ultra-comfortable bed, and a sizable en suite bathroom. This was a far cry from the tiny, cramped rooms that you get in a London hotel. Sure, the location is not downtown, but the trade-off for the big room makes it a moot point in my book.This no-frills, low-service hotel is perfect for business travelers who just want to come back to sleep quietly each night. This is not ideal for families due to the lack of facilities, entertainment and noticeable luggage service staff. It is very good, however, for solo guests and shoppers who want the Westfield mall experience right next door. The Stratford tube station, DLR and bus depot within walking distance made commuting into London a breeze, though it does take time to get in and the transportation got crowded during rush hour. The hotel is not on the street, so this made getting into the building a chore if you have many bags to haul. Many taxi drivers did not know how to access it. You either take the train to Stratford station and walk a while, or take a taxi to the nearest point and walk a bit. Any method you choose requires some walking, so be prepared for that. That is another reason it is not great for families with kids and the elderly.The service was efficient and affable in a crisp sort of way. For this sort of accommodation, you do not expect family warmth but a more functional approach to hospitality, which Staybridge Suites Stratford handled very well.The 24-hour convenience store in the lobby is a wonderful concept, though what is on sale there is not cheap. With the fabulous kitchen you get with microwave oven, a dishwasher, and a full range of crockery and utensils you could ever hope for in a kitchen, you are tempted to at least mini-cook one meal. If you do not wish to not eat out at all, then Staybridge would be a perfect choice.I loved the extra comfortable bed, the sift pillows and the multi-channel television. The bathtub was a bit too high for me, but everything else in the bathroom was excellent.Overall, Staybridge Suites Stratford was fantastic value for money for me. I would opt for it again the next time I am in London for business.

I stayed at Staybridge Suites with girlfriend and we loved it.  Our room was on 8th floor and had a fantastic view over London.  The rooms are very well equipped and clean with a nice king size bed. The staff at reception are really friendly and welcoming. Hotel is also very well situated with directly outside being the Westfield Shopping Centre which has plenty shops, restaurants and bus/underground station. Would highly recommend best hotel I have stayed at!

I and my Mom stayed at Staybridge Suites for a holiday. The first thing I would like to mention is that service was absolutely fantastic. Very friendly and helpful staff. Check in was very smooth and fast. We took a standard suite which was fully equipped and had everything to make our stay comfortable. We had buffet breakfast included which was good, but not much choice if you are a vegetarian. Very well located close to Westfield shopping mall and the underground / DLR. This station is connected by lifts so therefore no stairs / minimum stairs. Which was great as my mom has a knee problem. If you are coming for shopping a great location, but for sightseeing a little far off. The mall had lots for restaurants so no problems for other meals. We will definitely stay here again.

Just backfrom a week's stay for business. Rooms were very fresh, clean and comfortable. Staff was really helpful and friendly. Location is super convenient, shopping, food options and transportation. This one's a keeper for me.

My partner and I stayed here for the night as he needed a night away to gain the extra points. Check in was quick and smooth and as my partner is a IHG member we was given a free cookie which was very nice. The staff on reception was polite, friendly and helpful. Our room was a  9th floor studio and the end of the corridor and it have everything you could want, hob, microwave/grill, fridge, kettle, cups, glasses, knives, forks etc, the bathroom was a shower room only, there was laundry room, flat screen TV and a gorgeous big bed,The hotel has a pantry which has food to buy, this includes rice, pasta, sauces and drinks,We had a buffett breakfast included in the price, this was fantastic, the food was hot and well cooked and there was cold options as well.I would say as a person who has a fear of hights, the hotel floors have wall to wall windows giving amazing views, however if you do have a fear of hights like me you could be rather scared.My partner parked over night and this cost him ¬£8 for the night.This is an excllent hotel and I would recommend staying here. The hotel is right in the heart of Westfield which has food and shopping on the door step.

Stayed at this hotel for a saturday night in late 2012, we got the train from Norwich to Stratford and on arrival we were so early our check-in wasn't quite available (although as we arrived they made sure to speed up the cleaning of the room). This wasn't a problem though being right in the heart of Westfield, so we left our bags and went for lunch and did some shopping before returning to get our keys to our room. The room was really clean and nicely furnished; our room was just a basic double room (with a queen sized bed I think) and there was apple TV, a desk and a fully functional kitchen (staybridge also has it's own shop in the lobby that sell ready meals, pizzas, bread, milk etc.) as well as all the usuals, ensuite etc. Bathroom was fab and modern with a big shower and all the soap type things. Access to the rooms was via keycard which also took you too your floor through use in the lift. I've seen some people comment on location being the only problem and although I can understand this may be the case for some people, we were in London for a surprise trip to see Les Miserables on the saturday evening and it was perfect for us - just getting the tube across the city - in fact it was so convenient we even went to a restaurant near Marble Arch via tube for sunday lunch also. 100% would recommend this hotel and location in Westfield perfect if you want to do some shopping and have lunch/dinner out (there's also many bars and a 24hr casino) -everything right on your doorstep but its still very secluded and private.(also we both had the best nights sleep ever on their beds, I don't know what it was but I woke up feeling as if I'd had the deepest nights sleep)

column9: Hotel very nice, location may be an issue.
column10: The hotel is zone 3 of the underground - it was a 25-30 minute ride out from Euston - and then a short walk through a shopping centre to get to the hotel itself. For people flying in ‚Äì a taxi to the hotel would be ¬£¬£¬£‚Äôs.This is the first time we have stayed in a Staybridge in the UK - but have used them in USA. Hotel is fairly new and thus is in good order, nice fixtures and the 'home from home' environment was evident.Our room was ¬£168 for one night ‚Äì midweek rate booked 3 months in advance. That included a hot breakfast. Breakfast was fine - self service, limited buffet style but it does what a breakfast does.Hotel has a small fitness area and a laundry - so for longer stays in London I guess this would be ideal. Rooms are well appointed, bathroom has a shower and  small kitchenette means people could self cater - again, a plus for longer stays. Plenty of dining options in and out of the hotel.We did not receive any sort of upgrade for being platinum elite customers - I believe there are bigger rooms - but we were placed in standard studio one - clearly the hotel must have been full, and it is not a mandatory to upgrade - it is just we usually are, unless it is a stay on points, which this stay was not. We were given high speed internet access as part of being a platinum elite guest - and a cookie! Room styles are listed as studio king, deluxe studio king, standard suite and 1 bedroom suite with breakfast.  I am not sure if any of the rooms are able to accommodate any more than 2 people?The staff were lovely - though there was always a delay at reception -even though we didn't arrive till 7pm. Cleaning is at a very high standard. In short, if you are staying a few days in London - being a bit out of the centre, with a very flexible room would be very beneficial. Especially if you want to do some mall shopping & laundry! If you want to see the central sights and are only staying one night, I am not sure this would be such a good choice.

My wife and I stayed here a few days ago as a business trip with a couple of days pleasure tagged on.  It was a bit out of town compared to the usual central London location we pick but was handy for my conference.  But the really big plus for us was that it's only 6 minutes on the Javelin high speed train from St Pancras, where our train arrived (well Kings Cross really but it's almost the same) to Stratford International rail station. The Javelin runs about every 13 to 15 minutes.From that station to the Staybridge Suites is a 5 minute walk, almost completely indoors, via Westfield Shopping Centre, one level up from the lower ground where you enter from the station concourse.  The main Stratford underground/overground and DLR station is a 4 minutes walk in the other direction; the underground is served by the Central line, which takes you right into central London.Staybridge Suites is really just floors 8 to 11 of the Holiday Inn but it has its own dedicated check-inn.  The suites are like a studio timeshare, complete with microwave, fridge, kettle, sink etc.  The bathroom is done out in a nice contemporary marble, with a really good monsoon shower. It has a 42 inch flat screen TV and free Wi-Fi.  Breakfast was really good.  Maybe not quite up to Hilton standards but I did like the layout, where you got juices and milk from cartons in a refrigerated display rather than something resembling a giant tea urn.  The kitchen staff were friendly and kept everything spotlessly clean.  The breakfast area is on the 12th floor with a great view of the Olympic park (see photo), although it is bit like a building site just now as it is being redeveloped.  There's also a patio balcony for the warmer weather.The Westfield Centre is vast, with virtually all the major stores in residence.  It also had a good selection of restaurants - we dined one night at Jamie's Italian which is a one minute walk straight out the front door of the hotel, directly ahead.   I also like the combination of indoor and outdoor layout of the Westfield - must be good in the summer.We will definitely stay here again when we next come to London.  I imagine it would be even nicer in warm weather.

This is our 2nd time we have stay at the Staybridge Suites in Stratford, the hotel is lovely staff really helpful, Rafal and Tim are very helpful and friendly, the breakfast is really good and caters for everyone's taste, you can't complain. the hotel has great views over Olympic park, London,  Canary wharf and surrounding areas. close to the tube, easy to find lovely comfortable rooms, also great for shopping with it being in Westfield shopping centre.

We stayed here for 1 night after flying into Stansted from Belfast - finding the place was easy with the Sat Nav in the car. Parking in Car Park B was good as it was only 5 pound for the night and very convenient to the Accommodation. Having the pantry to buy some food etc is a good idea but not a great selection of "meals'' perhaps because Staybridges is connected to the shopping centre and there is plenty of places to get a meal there. Rooms and bathrooms were immaculately clean and well designed, bed was so comfortable. Our room was opposite the Casino but that was not a problem as no noise was heard so we got a great nights sleep. Breakfast was help yourself - again a good idea - staff were friendly and there to help if need be.Location was good - near the tube and DLR plus Westfield was really good.Would we stay here again - absolutely !!!

column9: Great location, friendly staff, wonderful accomodations
column10: We were first-time visitors to London, and this hotel's location right by a tube stop made this an affordable, convenient, and comfortable choice for us.  We loved it!  Good restaurants were just steps away.  The small kitchenette in this modern, spotless hotel allowed us to bring food back and reheat it the next day.  Breakfast was adequate (even though the coffee machines frequently malfunctioned), and the weekday evening reception was lovely and good. The staff was always available with helpful information about transportation, London attractions, and good places to eat.  We were very happy with our choice of hotels, and I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

The Staybridge Suites Stratford was perfect for us... a couple of first time London visitors.  The location was great, with access to the tube and the DLR just steps away.  Being in the Westfield Mall provided many choices for restaurants and even a grocery store for those nights when we just wanted to stay in after a long day of sight-seeing.  We were worried that it would be too far away from the City sights, but it is just a few minutes away from all of the attractions via the tube.  The breakfasts offered a variety of hot and cold foods and got us off on the right foot every day.  The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating.  One fellow even spent about 15 minutes showing us how the free (yes, I said free) laundry services worked.  The room was clean and modern, the bed was very good, and the microwave, refrigerator, dishes and dishwasher gave us extra choices that made our stay very enjoyable.  On top of that, the view of the Olympic Village was amazing.  The Staybridge Suites was the perfect place for us.

Excellent clean, modern accomodation in fab location, excellent transport links to central London and Docklands if you want to see the sights (excellent base).Just outside the front door is the Westfield complex, cinema, resturaunts and loads of shops (plenty to do).The suites are lovely and modern all the usual hotel facilities with the addition of more (fully equipped kitchen allows you to cook if you wish- hob, microwave, even a dishwasher)The main public areas are on 12th floor with awesome views over Olympic stadium and city skyscape further beyond, even a small roof terrace to sit outside in sunny weather. Accomodation on floors below, again have excellent views.Good breakfast choice hot & cold.

Absolutely great place to stay!! Amazing location, shops and restaurants within a minute walk! Very friendly helpful staff made our stay even better! We will definitely stay in the future and recommend to friends and family!!

Great modern hotel ,Easy access from the car park ,The guy on reception was very friendly and helpful ,(sorry I did not catch his name) giving us the best room available on our floor ,very secluded with a fantastic view over the Olympic village.The room was clean well set out and very comfortable ,Even came with its own well equipped kitchen, the complimetary breakfast although selfservice was excellent with a great variety and as much as you wanted. Will definetly stay there next time we go down to london,By the way my wife says to mention that its attached to westfield mall,

column9: Very nice hotel with friendly staff and great transportation link
column10: I have to say this is the first time I have stayed in Staybridge Suites. From the sounds of its name, all rooms have cooking facilities/fridge. As an IHG platinum member, I have been upgraded to a larger room with beautiful view of Olympic stadium. It offers good quality American/British style breakfast. Overall, this hotel is great if you a. want to do shopping in Westfield Stratford City, b. travel from Stratford station in early morning, c. have ticket to the event hosted in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

column9: No longer good value for money
column10: The first time we stayed here we paid ¬£120 per night and we were very impressed with the standard of the room although everything is very basic and breakfast was terrible. But we thought that was ok for the price for a hotel in this location. The second visit the price had shot up to ¬£200 but the breakfast was better in that there was more choice and plenty of it. The third time we stayed - last weekend we had to pay ¬£220 and the breakfast was awful. There was no coffee, no bacon, very little on the continental buffet, the bread was dry and stale and there was only dried up cheese and laughing cow processed cheese. People was clearly overloading their plates and then throwing it away what was not eaten, it felt like a factory canteen -  people wandering around looking for a free table when you could see tables of 6 with two people sitting there, surely it would be better to have tables for two or four which could be put together to accommodate 6 or 8 by pushing them together?   At ¬£220 per night you should expect a better standard than this.

This is a fine place but it depends what you're looking for.  It has a small kitchenette so it's great for someone staying for a while who wants to eat in but doesn't add to a regular hotel.  The room is big and there's a good shower.  But I found a lot about it odd.  They say they don't have housekeeping service on weekends absent request but they provided the service anyhow.  The service is friendly but it's understaffed so there's always a wait.  It's very convenient to the Stratford tube/bus, the Westfield-Stratford mall, and Olympic Park.  It's a trek from the downtown tourist stuff and the airports (other than City Airport), so it's not a great place to stay absent a reason to be in the area.

column9: Very good stay but beware credit card policy
column10: My wife and myself stayed here from 27th Sept to 30th Sept 2013. The room 915  was one of the best I have stayed  perfect bed, good powerful shower, good flat TV screen and excellent quality mini kitchen. Staff was very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was first class. I have taken  stars away for the following issues I asked for my room to be cleaned on the weekend and on the Saturday this was not done I had to bring this to the attention of reception on Saturday night to make sure it would be cleaned on the Sunday. Be warned on their credit card policy  I had booked online and took the flexible rate . On arrival I was told I should settle my bill on departure and was asked to swipe my credit card for authentication. When checking out I paid my bill of 432 pounds using the same credit card. That night when I arrived home  I checked my credit card statement online and found out I has 480 pounds on hold on my card from my arrival at the hotel  as well as the 432 pounds I had paid to settled my account at departure . It was five days before the 480 pounds was released back to me. To me this is unacceptable,  I will stick to Premier Inn and travel lodge for any short term stays in London as they are more transparent and upfront when you hand over your credit card . I would only consider Staybridge for a longer stay and would pay their nonrefundable rate up front

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights.The staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was lovely our room was huge compared to a standard London hotel room. The kitchen was fully equipped including a dishwasher which was great.The hotel is near the tube and DLR and a few steps from the Westfield mall.We will definitely return.

column9: Excellent location, Reasonable price with Friendly staff
column10: I have stayed here for 9 months on business and I have to say that as far as serviced flats go, this is right up there.The location is magnificent - literally 10 metres away from Europes largest shopping centre, Westfield! The prices for accommodation are reasonable and the staff are helpful and friendly. What more can you ask for?!

We arrived for our second visit for a short weekend break to catch up with family.  Still just as impressive, the mini-suite having everything you could possibly need.  We had one glitch in that our room was not serviced on one day but the staff could not have been more helpful in putting this right.  Very impressed by the management and staff.Breakfast on both mornings was excellent with a vast choice and although the hotel was very busy, tables were made available quickly and we did not have to wait at all.Location is great with Stratford station literally less than a 10 minute walk (nothing we can do about the foul weather!) and shopping right on the doorstep.We shall return and look forward to it!

It's in the middle of Westfield Shopping Centre (brilliant to Xmas shop and dump off your purchases), it's a stones throw from Stratford train or tube, car park is well signed for access to hotel (car parking overnight was reasonably priced, ¬£5 i think), it has a good bar type restaurant which serves a very good breakfast, the rooms are mini suites and are very modern and well appointed.  I have stayed here twice now and in both occasions I have had a comfortable stress free stay. Highly recommended.

column9: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Service
column10: My family and I stayed at the Staybridge suites for a long weekend. We were there to celebrate my mom‚Äôs 70th birthday. We were really impressed with the level of service. It was really clean and the staff were helpful with questions we had. We will definitely stay there again.

I was really impressed with this hotel - it offered an excellent standard of accommodation combined with first-rate customer service. I find it hard to think of another hotel in London which offers such a quality experience at such a reasonable rate.The rooms were spacious, exceptionally clean and modern in design. Each room has a kitchenette which is a great bonus, although with so many restaurants nearby you won't really need to use it. If you do want to make a snack, there is a small shop right by the reception.There was a huge selection at breakfast and set us up for the day. Complimentary tea and coffee is served in the Den throughout the day and evening and although we did not experience it because we stayed at the weekend, there is complimentary cheese and wine on weekday evenings.What set this hotel apart was the staff - we could not have been made to feel more welcome. They were all friendly, cheerful and helpful. We would like to give a special mention to Timothy who went above and beyond the call of duty, helping us set up the Apple TV in our room and chatting to us about the NFL match at Wembley that we were in London to see. Give that man a pay rise!The hotel is ideally placed - far enough away from the bustle of Central London but also just a short Tube ride away when you want to be in the thick of it. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in London.

Great for visiting stratford shopping, a little expensive for 1 night out of london, really clean and modern with a good breakfast.Rooms are large with separate lounge with small kitchen. Flat screen TV in bedroom and lounge with Apple TV.Nice modern bathroom with really good sized toiletries, perfect for a long stay.No bar which was a disappointment but I think you can use the holiday inn express bar.Situated opposite the casino and next to wahaca kitchen and many other restaurants.

I am extremely picky and was very comfortable here, which means its clean! I always take note of the tiles in hotel bathrooms and the grout was spotless-which means they take the time to pay attention to detail during housekeeping. It's literally in a mall so there is plenty of choices for food. It's steps from the train into the central part of London, but a long haul in my opinion. Very long trip to heathrow as well..When you arrive its a pain because you can't have your car service drop you off in front of the building and you have to walk a bit past bars with your luggage to get to the lobby. But all in all, it was extremely clean and I really have zero complaints.

column9: Beyond any expectaitions and I am fussy!!!
column10: Fantastic little hotel in a great location for shops, bars, restaurants etc with great style, spotlessly clean and friendly relaxed atmosphere A++++++ Being fussy the breakfast could be improved, good selection just hot food Is typical of a buffet. but is at least hot and edible!

After reading the really positive reviews others had made, I booked this hotel to take my wife away. We were greeted with a warm welcome and the rooms satisfied the hotels motto of being a 'home from home'. The hotel was in a great location in terms of access to Central London and the Westfield shopping centre. It's was great to have a choice of restaurants on the door step. Now for the unfortunate negatives. We had a far from peaceful night. Although being on the 10th floor there was the unwelcome noise of drunkards and party goers from the adjacent bars and casino throughout most of the night. The rooms failed to keep this noise out. This was raised with reception on booking out, they advised that they would make a note on their systems so we would be placed on the other side of the hotel on our next visit. The only other negative was the hot buffet breakfast was more of lukewarm and of poor quality. The fresh cold items were great and, again the homely set up was refreshing compared to the usual hotel feel. Unfortunately although feel we had an unusual poor experience compared to others, we will not be making a return visit.

column9: It's rare that I will rate a place 5 out of 5 but I have here for good reason!
column10: Stayed here for one night whilst in London on business as wanted to try out Staybridge Suites and I'm very glad I did.The staff were all lovely and welcoming and the suites were presented extremely well. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and had all the facilities one might need when staying away.The twelfth floor lounge area was lovely with comfortable sofas to sit on and great cosy areas with views over the city.Breakfasts are included and were lovely - a good selection of cold and hot items to choose from.My only small moan would be that the beds (although very comfortable) were only 5ft doubles; would have been good to have 6ft super king size for a hotel of this high standard but it's not really a big deal. I also thought my room rate was a little expensive as booked late but it was worth it. I'll try and book in advance next time to keep the costs down.Will definitely return!

Have been staying here since January on and off , staff are very helpful and friendly , Emma and Nadine on sales have always been  helpful finding , booking and changing reservations at a moments notice same with Wayne the manager , reception staff Chloe , Timothy,Shannon,Helen ,Nickolas and Mohammed always have a smile and everything ready on arrival .
