Debbie , Raffa , Jordon,Nancy ,Mary ,Ahmed and the rest of the breakfast staff do excellent job with the buffet which is always  fresh ,varied and plenty  it's never to much trouble if you want anything else , same as with the rest of the staff in the hotel , Debbie , Nancy and Jordon always ready with a smile in the morning and up for any banter , I can always get one over on Jordon when Spurs lose ,the cleaning staff always friendly  rooms are always clean and tidy  if anything need they are always on hand to bring it to the room , great hotel will always come back .

I was absolutely delighted with my stay here and I could not have faulted it. It was made especially delightful by the mid-week reception that provided free food and drink to residents between 6:30-7:30pm by charming and friendly staff. My room had a spectacular view over the Olympic stadium and Canary Wharf. It was spacious, excellent quality and with a small kitchenette (which I didn't use, but it looked excellent; if you do want to self-cater there is an M&S nearby). Breakfast was a self-serve buffet that provided a huge range of choices and the full works if you wanted it. I am a person who dislikes formality; I do not wish to pay for staff to bow and scrape before me and always prefer self-serve if it is available. I just want the service I request delivered pleasantly. So for me, this place is perfect. If you want bowing,scraping and fetching, this is not the place for you! Finally location was great, both for access to the city and for the direct link to Southend Airport, which was where I flew in to London.

The best and friendliest place to stay in London. We have stayed here for the past 5/6 months on and off, whilst working in the area, such a great place, with great staff. Always greeted with a smile and some friendly fun by all of the reception staff, Chloe, Timothy, Helen, Shannon, Nickolas, mohammed and of course manager Wayne.Suites are very clean, with great facilities and views of the Olympic park.A great relaxing buffet breakfast is always laid out and presented well by the excellent staff,( Debbie, Jordon, Nancy, Mary,Ahmed and all of the breakfast team) nothing is to much trouble for these guys, you can always gaurantee some good breakfast conversations and banter, especially from Debbie and Jordon!!!  The best, see you all again soon i hope.

Stayed here for 1 night after a shopping and birthday treat!! Such a great welcome from Timothy on reception sooo helpful even gave my daughter free bottle of wine for her birthday!! Lovely studio suite overlooking Olympic park. Suite clean and very compact everything you need! Breakfast was excellent lots to choose from and in a very pleasant area too with an outside balcony if weather permits! Cannot fault the place and so nice to just relax in the suite after a day shopping!! Would certainly return and already planning WHEN!!??

I was booked at another hotel for a conference, and after checking transportation to the venue, I decided to stay at the Stay Bridge Suites.  It was a good choice.  The staff is the friendliest I have found yet.  A special thumbs up to Timothy, top notch.  The rooms are clean and ample sized.  The location is a new one for me; it is located in a mall.  So you will have to carry your luggage through parts of the mall to get to the hotel and again upon departure.  The conference I was attending was at the Excel Center across from LCY.  The cab fare to it was ¬£14.  The cab from Paddington was ¬£54.  There is a tube station out front on the ground level that will connect to the underground.  There are a variety of restaurants in the mall to fit anybody's taste.  There is also a supermarket.The room comes equipped with a hotplate, microwave and a basic set of utensils if you want to eat in your room.  Tuesday thru Thursday there is a Manager's reception and on Mondays they show a movie in the den.They did their best to make it as good as home, and they come real close.

My wife and I stayed at the Staybridge to do some long overdue sightseeing of London. Though only there for a weekend, we enjoyed much of what the hotel had to offer. It is situated next to the 2012 Olympic Park and a very large central commerce center/mall with many upscale stores and numerous options for dining. Approximately three minutes of walking presents the Stratford underground station that connects to the Central, Jubilee, DLR lines and a large bus station. Very convenient, very new, and superbly friendly and considerate staff. Full English breakfast was nice and offered views of London, the O2 arena, and the Olympic Park from the dining area. The room included refrigerator, oven, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker etc, comfortable bed, clean atmosphere. I've stayed in London four times before in different places, but now I intend to return to Staybridge because it has everything I am looking for.

Bit of a problem with external noise from the adjacent Casino on the first night of our stay dealt with efficiently & simply with a change of allocated room. Staff are first-class. Concept for a longish stay is near perfect.

My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights in early Sept '13. From the moment we walked through the doors we felt like we were welcome and at ease. The staff were wonderful from the start. We arrived 3 hours early before check in but were accommodated and given a room.¬†The complimentary breakfast was a bonus, with a choice of hot and cold foods. Despite reviews saying it was bland, both of us found it extremely varied and tasty - we love our food. The complimentary drinks and nibbles on the mid week nights was an unexpected surprise and appreciated. Unfortunately we checked out on Monday missing the Monday Movie Night. The staff were always helpful, friendly and took the time to go out of their way and help. This was witnessed throughout the hotel, from the reception to the concierge desk.¬†The room was furnished with modern appliances and furnishings and extremely soundproof. We could not hear anyone in the adjoining suites or hallway. The bed we slept on was amazing and found it hard to pull ourselves out of it in the mornings. The bathrooms were clean, modern and well equipped. The shower was spacious and the pressure was brilliant. The rooms were cleaned daily, freshened with new towels and remaking of the bed.¬†The location couldn't be better. Situated in the heart of the Westfield shopping centre with lovely restaurants and a variety of clothing shops on your doorstep. Only a minute walk and your at the Stratford train station with the overground and underground taking you to anywhere you want to go.

column9: Concept good, execution better, staff best of all
column10: For those not familiar with Staybridge Suites they were conceived for longer stays and all the rooms are suites - either studios or one bed mini apartments and as they were designed for people to "live" in them they are all complete with fully equipped kitchen areas and have loads of space which makes them a fantastic place for a one night stayWe were here as we were going to a concert at the O2 and it is a perfect location, the O2 is minutes away on the tube and even better coming home when the crowds are all heading to central London in the opposite direction.This Staybridge is a fab example of the brand well maintained, well run and has the most fantastic staff. They are all great at making you feel welcome but I must single out Timothy on reception who is a ray of sunshine on a dull day, an absolute treasure. They also serve a great breakfast although the toasters seem to be a challenge to many guests who didn't realise they need switching on when the bread goes downThoroughly recommend this for anyone visiting the O2 and it also sits right on top of the Westfield shopping centre if yiu need a little retail therapy before heading home

I stayed in Staybridge Suites London-Strafford City from 24th August to 21st September for my business trip to London.I must say this is the best hotel - value for money, perfect facilities for service apartment and warmest customer service.It is located at perfect location at the doorstep of Westfield shopping centre, 5 minutes walking distance from Jubilee, Central, DLR, With movie nights, Mon-Wed Managers's social night with free flow of drinks, 24-hours drinking facilities, free laundry, 24-hour gym facilities, you have practically run out of your wish list.For my stay, I subscribed to premium internet connection.  Paying for an average 2 GBP/day I had 20gb internet connection and it came together with Apple TV facilities!The only room for improvement would be the breakfast.  Having to repeat the same meals everyday could be boring.  I was aware that the hotel was trying to improve when they introduced additional menu items however, it can be better.I hope I will come back very soon.

column9: Good option for East London or anywhere on the Central Line (tube)
column10: The rooms are a good size when compared to rooms in Central London and having the small kitchenette gives you more freedom - there are plenty of places to buy food to cook, in the nearby Westfield shopping centre. The breakfast is average and a lot of people attend the early evening drinks reception during the week. I wasn't given the room size I had paid for when I checked in but the hotel staff were helpful in trying to resolve the problem. The hotel is clean and very convenient for shopping at Westfield, which also has a cinema.

We were made to feel welcome from the moment we checked in. On the morning of our booking I rang ahead to reception to check everything was ok. I mentioned that it would be my Mother's 60th birthday. Timothy, the person I had spoken to on the phone was there to greet us when we arrived, and had kindly left a bottle of rose wine and a birthday card for my mother. So thoughtful!All the staff we encountered were warm and friendly. This hotel is in a great location. And obviously still very new and clean everywhere. The breakfast area was well stocked. Just the right amount of choice. Hot sausages, bacon, omelettes, beans and tomatoes. Pastries, toast, cereals and fresh fruit. The coffee machine made great freshly ground lattes. In the evening there was free wine, cheese and crackers. Nice touch, though I believe this only available tue-thurs, 6.30-7.30.I can't wait to come and stay here again. This hotel will be my first choice the next time I'm staying in London.

column9: A real Home away from Home
column10: Stayed here for 15 days and were the most memorable days..  Beautiful suites. very spacious. Clean and tidy.. nice view.  nice people all around. Clean bathrooms. Nice Kitchen .. In short a perfect stay altogether. And very good breakfast too.. Next to westfield mall and stratford station..  very convenient for shopping and travelling..

column9: Great suites for business or pleasure
column10: Stayed at Staybridge Suites on a business trip - the hotel is extremely clean with rooms spacious by London standards. The rooms have all equipment - microwave, hob, dishwasher, etc. in line with other serviced apartments. The self-service breakfast has good variety and is a real bonus! The washing machine is in a common area. Being located in one of the large malls is an advantage - the shops cover almost everything you may wish to buy in London. If you're bored of cooking in your suite, the restaurants in the mall offer excellent options! The subway is a 5 min walk through the mall. Stratford is not Central London, but it is just a short tube ride away. For those travelling to work in the City of London as I did, the location is no problem at all. The only downside is the hotel is a little difficult for taxi drivers to precisely locate, but that is a minor hassle compared to all the plus points. Overall, an excellent option for stays in London!

column9: Excellent. All you need is London Travelcard.
column10: Very clean hotel with spacious rooms include everything, even dishwasher and ironing board. Located 20 meters from a large shopping mall and a five minute walk to the subway. The only thing you will need is London Travelcard that will give you the option to use local transport freely, the hotel location is relatively far from the center, about 20 minutes by subway. One more thing, do not forget to bring slippers. Highly recommend the hotel.

We were visiting family in London and chose Staybridge suites for its location at Westfield. Its a great base outside the city centre because it has great transport links (every type) on its doorstep. Also, Westfield has so many restaurants, there is no need to go travelling in the evening if looking to eat out. Suite had cooking facilities we did not use but there is an M&S 2 minutes away in Westfield if you want to bring something back and eat in the room. We were able to park in the Westfield centre for ¬£5 per day which is reasonable and it was 2 mins from the car park to the room! Breakfast was included and far better than we expected. The Breakfast area is on the 12th floor and has great views across London and into the Olympic stadium beside it. Could not recommend enough, it was a perfect stay

A very professional Hotel that exceeded my highest expectations.The room itself was well presented and functional for an overnight stay and I must say a very fine shower indeed,night time views of London in the distance were almost worth the stay alone. Breakfast did offer a good choice of an English style and a Continental in a relaxed setting which included a terrace overlooking the Olympic stadium. Overall a very pleasant stay and definitely a hotel I will look to stay in when I come back to London in October.

We needed a hotel with parking for one night, as we had a family commitment in east London. I'd never heard of Staybridge Suites, and I didn't know there were any hotels in the Westfield Centre at Stratford. This was the perfect solution for us. Parking is just ¬£5 for 24 hours (as long as you don't move your car out of the car park and return: it's ¬£5 for the first two hours, then free for 22 hours, but if you leave and return you pay another ¬£5 for the first two hours after returning). The one-bedroom apartment we had enjoyed a stunning view over the Olympic Park. It was superbly comfortable, and of course everything is brand new and fresh. The bedroom, bathroom and lounge area were larger than in standard hotel accommodation, and having the kitchenette (complete with fridge, microwave and dishwasher) was fantastic. There's loads of storage space, and the decor is stylishly understated in warm colours. I can't praise the staff highly enough. It's obvious that they're chosen and trained for their customer care skills. Because this is a place where many guests spend weeks at a time, the staff need to be able to deal with a wider range of issues than on a standard hotel reception desk, and their friendliness and helpfulness were outstanding. Rafal Wasiluk, the Operations Manager, was very helpful in responding to my email enquiries before arrival, and was there with a smile and a cheery greeting when we checked in. Nicolas on reception checked us in efficiently, and later was very helpful in resolving some wifi access issues. Thanks go to both of them.Breakfast is included, and it's an impressive spread. Fruit compote, fresh fruit salad, cereal, yogurt, croissants, pastries, plus hot bacon, sausages, omelettes and hash browns. A better selection of jam would be nice (there was only one - squeezable strawberry), but this is a minor quibble.The shower was powerful, which was great. I noted the helpful environmental gesture of refillable large bottles of shower gel, shampoo and conditioner; it's good to see the hotel taking this issue seriously. The room was extraordinarily quiet; we heard no exterior noise at all. The blackout curtains worked very well, too. The bed was very comfortable, but unfortunately the pillows were hard and uncomfortable; it would have been good to have a choice of soft or hard pillows available. That's my only criticism; otherwise, this stay would have been perfect.Being on top of the Westfield facilities was brilliant. We shopped, ate, and saw a film, all on our doorstep. This would be a great base for seeing more of London, but for our purposes it worked really well not having to go further than five minutes' walk for dining and entertainment. I would happily return to Staybridge, where they genuinely do make it feel like home.

Professional friendly staff, spacious suites with kitchenette, excellent buffet breakfast, great location in the newest Westfield shopping centre, just 15 minutes away from Central London.  Fast and efficient check-in, no request is ever too much trouble for the staff.  Hot and cold breakfast is kept topped up with fresh items, right up to the end of the breakfast time.  24 hour tea and coffee facilities available in the spacious comfortable lounge.  Large, comfortable bed in the bedroom, with an option of a sofa bed in the lounge area.  Laundry facilities and gymnasium on site.  Definitely a home away from home with staff who truly go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible.  As well as a huge selection of shops, Westfield has a large variety of outdoor restaurants, and is only a five minute walk away from the tube and overground rail services.  I will definitely choose Staybridge over a central London hotel, and will be back on my next visit to London.

to start, i cant say enough for the staff who were all extremely polite, friendly, whilst remaining professional, the breakfast was just what we wanted, coffee, cereal, juice and a nice amount of cooked items like eggs and bacon, and the room was spotlessly clean and well layed out. people cant complain about weekend housekeeping as there are signs everywhere saying you only need to ask and they will do it, no problem. the only MINOR quibble is we didnt realise that the centre of london is a bit further away than what we are used to but thats our fault and nothing to do with the hotel, all in all its a fabulous hotel with attentive staff, clean rooms and nice touches, dont let the distance put you off as the tube station is only a couple of minutes away!!

column9: Great place to stay to shop or travel into London
column10: We stayed in this Staybridge over the August bank holiday weekend. We arrived to a fabulous welcome from Timothy who did everything he could to make us welcome and meet our room needs, which he did.  The Staybridge is a fantastic place right in the middle or Westfield shopping center with fab views over the Olympic grounds to the stadium and beyond to docklands and the city.  We had a King bed suite with separate living and cooking area all spotlessly clean and tidy. The breakfasts are great - help your self to a variety of cereals , cooked breakfast and fruit and so on. Much more than you would expect and all very good quality. Westfield is massive and has some great places to eat and shop - walk through the center and you are at the train/tube station and only 10mins away from the city.  Central line , Jubilee Line and over ground. I would recommend this place to anyone - it is very good value and very very clean and safe.

I stayed here for one night on a last minute decision.  The check in staff were pleasant and courteous.  I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite overlooking Olympia park.  The room was in mint condition and the amenities were also very good.  There are two flat screen televisions, a full kitchenette, a living room...etc.I would stay here again in a heartbeat if my travel plans brought me again towards the Stratford area.My only gripe? The quality of the breakfast was just ok.  There is a lot of choice but the cooked options were a bit tasteless.  I paid 120 pounds for the night.

What impressed me the most was the staff at this hotel seemed extremely well motivated. All were very welcoming, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. This made the stay all the more pleasant. The room was comfortable very well appointed and a brilliant view over London.Would stay here again and again.

I arrived here as a last minute change in plans. From the minute I arrived it was such a nice experience I immediately wanted to stay longer.... alas i could only stay for one night. The room was spotless and I was delighted to find large containers of Shampoo & Conditioner supplied in the bathroom. The Shower was powerful and easy to switch off after a long day :) what a relaxing evening.

This is a classy hotel and was a real pleasure to plan and book/stay at Staybridge Hotel. The rooms are very well presented & comfortable and they offer a homely touch with their breakfast process. The team of people that work there are very helpful and react quickly to any issues, you only need to talk to them. They are impressive.The location is very good & close to central London, it is not the West End but considering it is literally within a few minutes of a main train & tube line, is accessible by road with easy & cheap parking and has lots of things to do all around it as it's surrounded by Westfield Shopping Centre I was not at all disappointed.Since this hotel met all my expectations and exceeded some, I would highly recommend it for you,

column9: Nice & modern place. And you'll have a kitchen!
column10: The location tells about itself - the view from your room is either over Olympic park or still fresh and decorated Westfield trade center. It's most convenient if you have come for shopping, for some  event in Olympic park or even if you want to visit Central London since it's only 15 minutes by tube starting from ground level of Westfield. The spirit of hotel crew is awesome - you'll feel constant care and readiness for help. Breakfast are quite standard for London, but fruits were all the time fresh and abundant and the comfortably furnished canteen is on the 12th floor so you could sip your morning coffee enjoying yourself with a fascinating panorama from a canteen balcony. Room equipment is still fresh and mostly in good condition. Free gym is available as well as laundry

column9: Have to agree with every body else .....
column10: I booked this late on points for the weekend of the Sainsbury Anniversay Games, so was surprised  to get the room on points. You can not fault the location and the welcome was first class (Nicolas, I think). Was very pleasantly surprised with the  free breakfast. I do a lot of work in the city and had never thought of staying here, but it will be top of my list for  the future

Ok, so I stay here a lot as one of my shops is inside the shopping centre. That aside, the centre and the hotels were built for the Olympics and that makes them new! The  Staybridge is in the same building as the holiday inn and has the most wonderful view(depending on the room) of the Olympic stadium and the aquatic centre as well as the big spirally restaurant thing. I know that is a particularly unrefined description but when you see it it does describe it well. The underground and DLR are two minutes walk and it's only ¬£11 peak or ¬£8 off peak for a 1-4 zone pass and 10 minutes to Liverpool street. So a very handy hotel with plenty shopping in Westfield Stratford city a casino and for food than you could ever hope for. The hotel is clean, tidy, new, reasonable value for London and you get a free breakfast to boot. Manage to get an upgrade and you'll be very happy indeed with your lounge, bedroom, kitchen and bathroom and should you prefer to shop in waitrose or marks and spencer you can cook yourself. LCD tv with Apple TV can make it a home from home. Sit back, relax and enjoy.

Keep in mind that it is a good value because it is not in central London.  When we tried to get a cab at Heathrow upon our arrival, the first cabbie looked at us as if we were nuts.  Too far and no way he could do that.  Luckily we found a driver who would take the fare (115 pounds plus a small tip!).  We were tired and just wanted to get to our destination.  Happily, upon leaving we found a nearby car service that picked us up and took us back to the airport for a mere 50 pounds.)  So then once we were where the hotel was supposed to be it was a nightmare trying to find it.  You have to go up *into* the shopping mall area to get there.  I am not sure if we overlooked directions for that but it was very frustrating, especially when you are tired from travelling.  So if you are ok with the time it takes (anywhere from maybe 20 minutes to 40 minutes minus the walk from your hotel room to the tube station) to get into London, the hotel is good.  It was clean, which is of course one of the most important elements, and the desk clerks were very polite and helpful.  Breakfast comes with which is nice but don't be too picky......cereal, bread, pastries, eggs (which I really didn't care for - they seemed like powdered eggs maybe?) and I think fruit and yogurt.  That'll do if you are on a budget.  Now the upside of the location was that it was in a mall also.  Many places to eat, including supermarkets where we could shop to cook/eat in our room to save money on a couple of meals.  When my watch broke and my feet hurt, I quickly replaced the shoes (Skechers) and watch (Swatch) with new ones on our way to the tube station.  I think we might try to up the budget and stay closer to London if we went back but if not, we would stay here again.

We were on vacation and we had a fantastic time. Good food and location, close the west bury mall and  O2. Good access to rail and underground. Helpful staff. Draw back 1. Lack of direct access to public, one has carry stuff when checking in & out. 2. Not changing sheets frequently  -it took calling reception before they could be change, 3. No weekend cleaning and emptying of waste bins-which overflow by Monday .

We have always enjoyed the staybridge suites hotels in The U.S.A, so very interested too see how,the UK version compared! We used points so it was excellent value, and after an initial problem with trying to book a room for 2 adults and a 4 year year child, when it kept advising we needed 2 rooms?? Not sure how the 4 year old would cope having his own room???? I emailed hotel,and it all was sorted.The room was excellent, the only issue we had was it was underneath the gym and laundry which meant a constant thumping from above and frequent loud bangs when people dropped weights.This went on till late at night and started again very early in the morning.Other than that , we found the staff friendly and helpful, the breakfast great, drinks and nibbles 3 nights a week were appreciated.Hotel is right in the middle of Westfield, which was great for shopping, although a little inconvenient trying to get luggage in and out as you had to go through shopping centre, especially as they had closed the car park closest to hotel.All in all a lovely stay and look forward to returning!

This hotel is simply fantastic.  We stayed for 5 weeks over Summer 2013 so had plenty of time to truly assess everything it has to offer.  The location, cleanliness, soundproofing, rooms and amenities are first class but the service is what makes this hotel truly special.  I have been to many hotels around the world and many 5 star and 6 star resorts and I can honestly say that the service we received from everyone over our stay was probably the best I have ever experienced.  The front office staff were all so polite, knowledgeable and friendly it was a joy to speak to them and they truly made us feel at home.  Nothing was ever a problem and at no point did I feel our requests were not going to be dealt with immediately and professionally.  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - they strive to make you feel at home and in my opinion succeeded every day we were there.

column9: Awesome - but wifi could be better
column10: It's hardly worth raving about all of the fantastic things about this hotel as everyone else has already done so. The location is great. I'm not into shopping malls, but having a tube station downstairs makes it very convenient. The staff are very well trained and seemingly sincere in their friendliness. The room was great and the Tue-Thu "manager's social" was a nice touch (unlimited beer/wine and snacks for an hour).It wasn't perfect though. I hate it when hotels charge for wifi. OK, wifi is free, but it's slow (ie. deliberately slowed down to a certain limit) and you have to pay ¬£7.50 for 24 hrs of fast wifi. My other slight gripe is that I was given a disability room and told that this is what I'd booked. I hadn't. When I showed the reception guy my booking (from hotels.com) he arranged a different room for the following night.In all the hotel is awesome. If they stopped charging for fast wifi it'd be perfect.

column9: Great Stay in a Great Hotel
column10: Our usual stay in London is more central. This time round I decided to go a little further out but still in range of the underground. I was not disappointed. The staff were excellent at all points; concierge, reception, dining, household. The executive room (necessary for our 4 year old using the sofa bed) was clean & tidy and had views towards Stratford Station and to the right of it the Olympic park.For our two night stay we decided to take up the hotel reception offer of breakfast. At ¬£10 per person + children free this was great value. The buffet range was very good; cold meats, fruit, cereal + full English.The first night we dined in Westfield (the shopping mall in which the hotel is located) and could choose from a range of experiences; Mexican, American, Italian etc. The second night we decided to stay in the hotel. The standard menu was more than adequate and we had an enjoyable meal.Overall a very good experience.

column9: The Best Place to stay in LONDON
column10: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights.. the rooms are very spacious. They have open kitchen in the room with all amenities even dish washer. The best thing is the LOCATION ... Its situated in the WESTFIELD CITY..Its the biggest mall in EUROPE. The Tube train is in the basement of the mall.. so connectivity to anywhere in London is no problem. There's a CASINO opposite the hotel.. its open 24 hrs. serves free drinks .. a must visit.I would highly recommend this hotel..!!

A first class hotel with the best view from reception I've ever seen - nice office!The reception team - Nicolas and Timothy were very accommodating and understanding of having children and being on a tight deadline to get across the roadDebbie and the breakfast team were top drawer and probably one of the best hotel breakfasts in the UKLooking forward to returning when the velodrome re-opensThanks!

Stayed at Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City for 5 nights in July 2013.It's very conveniently located near shopping (including groceries) and public transportation.We had a suite which included a kitchenette, living room with pullout couch and on site laundry facilities. The only negative was the side of the building that our room was located. The casino patio was opposite our room and the noise level until the early morning hours was unacceptable. I highly recommend this location if you can secure a room on the other side which is the Olympic Park side. I'm sure this would not be an issue in the winter months.

We stayed here for one night after i won a competition, we had room 818 and it was a lovely sized, clean room.We had a nice view of the orbit and olympic park, the bed was firm and comfy,there is a kitchen in the room with dishwasher, fridge and everything you need to make yourself a meal except cutley! whether this was an oversight i'm not sure.wifi is free and the shower is large and powerful, great after a long day!Breakfast was lovely and included in the price. there were lots of sofas and chairs to sit at and a nice terrace to enjoy the view of the parkthe staff were very friendly and the hotel is right inside Westfield, steps away from the shops.Highly recommended, would stay again in a heartbeat

column9: AMAZING!!!!a piece of paradise on earth
column10: Stayed for one night to see the anniversary games - wow what a location - everything went really smoothly and the car parking is fantastic value . The staff are wonderful polite and sooo helpful ( especially Raf , Nicholas and Chloe!!!) thanks guys for making our weekend one we will never forget:))

My daughter and I had an extended stay here.  I was concerned by the distance to the major London attractions, but the Tube was easy to manage.Kudos to Rafal who helped me figure out the laundry and handled all my questions and concerns so well. Our room was huge, especially the shower.  the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a stove, a microwave, and a dishwasher.  We warmed things up, but never really cooked.  There is a pantry in the reception area, but we usually just got drinks there, and picked up food from a nearby shop.The fact that this hotel is in a mall is a major plus.  While still in Paris, I sent my clothes to the laundry and got them back late, the day I left, and with horrid blue stains all over them. After checking in to the hotel, I immediately went shopping and found decently priced outfits that would pack well.  There were plenty of restaurants nearby.  Often my daughter and I would pick up pre-made meals at M & S.  They were healthy and inexpensive.  Breakfast was great here with plenty of options.

This hotel is so nice! I stayed here for one night as I was getting back late from a festival. The staff member Rafal (sorry if that's spelled wrong) was really helpful as he let us check into our room early and the room was spacious and stylish, the bed was very comfortable and everything was in working order, we also had a great view of Stratford. The buffet breakfast was delicious, there was plenty of choice. Would definitely stay here again, it's great!

I had 2 lovely nights at the suites. As others say, it is home from home, and when you are away from home a lot the extra touches mean everything. Lovely room with comfy bed. No upgrade offered to platinum member, or upgraded wifi, but this didn't spoil my stay. The drinks and snacks on an evening are lovely and I will stay again.

Just stayed for one night, and working near by at the olympic park, it was a perfect location. The only down side is finding it from the tube station, you have to go up in Westfield shopping area and along to find the hotel. Everything else was perfect and staff were great. I will be staying again.

I have been working in London since December 2012 and needed a place to stay during the week that was not just a hotel room, but somewhere that felt homely, safe and where I could relax at the end of each day. I also wanted a place to stay where my wife could travel down and stay over too, which again, needed to be more than just a room.The rooms offer so much more than a bed and bathroom, for example, a kitchen and a household fridge, and that has given us the choice of whether we eat in or out.The rooms are spacious, well equipped and very comfortable. The view to the rest of London is brilliant.The location of Staybridge is excellent and not only are the transport links easy to access anywhere in London, but the place feels safe. That is so reassuring for my wife who has the opportunity to leave the accommodation on her own and seek out the sights.Now the staff. Always listen. Welcoming. Happy to help. Treated like a relative not a client (subtle but very much appreciated when away from home).Summary: 10 out of 10

We stayed overnight for a bit sightseeing and shopping. It is right in the mix of Westfield Stratford, which is nice after long day of shopping.  Staff were very good, we had a few issue s after checking in but everything was sorted for us with a smile especially Tim, much appreciated .  The decor as a whole was neutral, relaxed and modern, right up my alley.  Our room had a kitchenette and living area separate from the bedroom and bathroom.  My husband has stayed in a Staybridge before, he said I would love it and I did. We will be staying longer next time.

The best value for money I ever got in a London hotel. The building is new and they are doing a good job keeping it fresh and clean. Quick and extremely friendly check in, spacious and quiet room, free Internet, gym - really lovely place. On top of that the breakfast is complimentary with lots of choice of food and drink and they give you free wine/beer, cheese and snacks on some evenings.The service is most friendly I've ever encountered. Definitely my choice on next visits to London.

I stayed 3 nights in this hotel. It is so modern, stylish and chic. The staff is really nice and friendly, also very helpful. My room was clean and i liked the way they put everything. I had a kitchenette which was helpful. The bathroom had a spacious shower. The kingsize bed and the sofa are just perfect after a long day of work and a long afternoon/evening of shopping. The shopping center is just in front of the hotel which was perfect for me. There were sales: i shop, i drop in my room, i shop again. No need to carry all heavy bags!!!!The minus point is the breakfast: more choices would be better.

Truth be known, I was biased toward giving this property a 4 point rating ‚Äì at minimum ‚Äì from the start, based on glowing reviews from TripAdvisor.  However, too many unfortunate ‚Äúhiccups‚Äù along the way ‚Äì during our 5 night stay! ‚Äì accumulated to bring the overall assessment down a couple of pegs?To start, we had a bit of an awkward experience attempting to reach the hotel lobby area itself?!  Specifically, I sort of realized ‚Äì based on TripAdvisor info ‚Äì that the hotel had no direct driveway access.  But I wasn‚Äôt 100% certain what to expect?  And neither did the airport transfer service we hired to take us there?  So we ended up having to drive through a large short-term pay garage to the foot of an escalator bank, which led, in turn, up to an open Westfield shopping mall plaza area.  So the hotel itself is literally in the middle of a shopping mall.  Thereupon we were responsible for lugging our heavy luggage (LOL) the remainder of the way (approximately an American football field‚Äôs length in distance ‚Äì 50 yards!) to the ground level of the property ‚Äì which was curiously where the concierge station was located.  It was also isolated from the main check-in area which was another elevator‚Äôs ride away‚Ä¶ up on the 12th floor!  Alternatively, a 2nd elevator bank on the ground level took one up to the 3rd floor check-in area for the Holiday Inn, as the two properties (H. Inn and Staybridge Suites) share the same building in common ‚Äì just different ‚Äútowers‚Äù.  So first tip for anybody reading this‚Ä¶is that it‚Äôs highly recommended that you coordinate transportation arrangements beforehand directly with the hotel ‚Äì even if you‚Äôre making independent preparations!   At the very least they can provide guidance on the most convenient drop off /pick up points (i.e. ‚Äì the Cow Pub on the shopping center‚Äôs perimeter it turns out!) and/ or arrange for bell hop assistance, to help avoid the types of logistical challenges we encountered.On that note, the staff there was exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  Upon check-in they informed us straight away about the free wine and cheese event for hotel guests held every Tuesday ‚Äì Thursday evenings from 6:30-7:30 p.m., which was an unexpected perk.  We also unexpectedly found out that the daily breakfast there was complimentary for ALL guests ‚Äì which said so right there on the room entry cards!   This news was a bit of a surprise for us, as we‚Äôd paid extra for breakfast inclusion through our EXPEDIA booking.  Thus be cautious of web sites which improperly charge extra for this?The room itself was a bit on the compact side, as far as ‚Äúsuites‚Äù go anyway?  However, it was fully equipped with a full complement of cooking utensils, silverware, plates, fridge, microwave, etc., ‚Ä¶anything suitable for a standard level of apartment living.  On the downside, though, there were remnants of leftover food from the prior tenant‚Äôs stay, remaining in the refrigerator;  AND the living room T.V. ‚Äì a really nice Sony flat screen I might add ‚Äì wouldn‚Äôt work (although the bedroom T.V. was fully functional).  Add to this the disappointing view we had of air ducts and pipes from the roof top of the adjoining building.  Unfortunately, all rooms overlooking Olympic Park were taken, although we‚Äôd requested upon booking.  Anyway, all of this contributed to a rather unsettling ‚Äúbreak in‚Äù period.  Good news, though, was that following our first 2 nights there (out of 5) the front desk actually honored our request for a room with Olympic Park view, after we‚Äôd largely relinquished hope that this would ever occur.  Thus, it was a pleasant surprise, as we hadn‚Äôt pressed the matter at all, beyond casually mentioning our desire for a potential room change on day 1.Elsewise the Staybridge Suites‚Äô East London ‚Äì Stratford City location certainly offered up a veritable shopper‚Äôs and gambler‚Äôs mecca.  Because as previously mentioned, it sits smack dab in the midst of what happens to be Europe‚Äôs largest shopping center ‚Äì the New Westfield Shopping Mall;  and is additionally a foot bridge‚Äôs walk away from the Stratford Centre‚Ä¶the latter of which is home to a number of discount retailers and individual vendors who set up shop there during the day, peddling their various wares.  Both malls are home to convenient grocery stores ‚Äì which we took full advantage of.  But Stratford Centre is certainly a more economical alternative to the pricier Westfield facility.  Topping this off ‚Äì for those who have a gambling interest! ‚Äì was the Aspers Casino, which was literally only a stone‚Äôs throw away from the hotel.  There was also a myriad of various ethnic restaurants and countertop service eateries (within the Westfield‚Äôs food court) practically just outside of the property as well.  In fact, we had dinner twice at ‚ÄúThe Real Greek‚Äù restaurant which offered up a nightly discounted fixed price menu.  You can also get a coupon book offering restaurant and retailers‚Äô discounts directly from the mall.  So be on the lookout for this!Transportation access from the Staybridge to Central London was relatively uncomplicated as the extensive London Metro tube (underground) and over ground combined Stratford station was literally 3-5 minutes walking distance away‚Ä¶depending on your gait I suppose?  LOL.  However, it may require as many as 10 stops (20-25 minutes total) ‚Äì with a transfer possibly sandwiched in between ‚Äì to reach some of the more popular tourist destinations from Stratford City.  So just an FYI!Switching focus back to the property itself, the daily breakfast was generally provided from 6:30-9:30 a.m. with a 7:30 a.m. start on Saturday (unsure about Sunday)!  It featured all of the standard continental breakfast fare (croissants, juices, cereal, bananas, etc.), typically served in conjunction with baked beans, slab bacon (very salty), pork sausage and either scrambled eggs and or cheese omelets.  And to reiterate, it‚Äôs absolutely free to all guests.  YAY! The Staybridge also advertises free laundry facility usage for guests‚Ä¶which was factual.  What they didn't tell you, though, was that they also have the slowest washer /driers in the world!  So a single load of clothes requires upwards of 3 hours to completion ‚Äì no exaggeration!  And then you have to continually check back to ensure that other guests haven‚Äôt set any unattended laundry ‚Äì possibly your own! ‚Äì aside, which we discovered they were wont to do!And for those of us who further desired to utilize their advertised free 24 hour internet service, the front desk attendant informed ‚Äì with a straight face -  that we could do so in their ‚Äúbusiness center‚Äù?!  LOL‚Ä¶  Well it turns out that the ‚Äúbusiness center‚Äù was comprised of 2 lonely p.c. terminals sitting in the 3rd floor lobby of the Holiday Inn;  which meant down to the ground floor (from level 12) and up the adjoining elevator bank  to their ‚Äúsister‚Äù property.  And as it was evening at the time, there was barely enough overhead lighting to view the p.c.‚Äôs keyboards at all.  Thus  you‚Äôre  sitting there enveloped in virtual darkness,  or extremely dim lighting, at best‚Ä¶to be generous!  When I mentioned to the Holiday Inn desk attendant,  she intoned that lights are turned down by management in the evenings and she had no authority to turn them up.  What in the world?!  LOL.  However, the final insult to injury was that the machines were EXCRUCIATINGLY SLOW ‚Äì to the point of being nearly unusable in fact!  Turns out, I could only frustratingly use the infernal devices for checking emails‚Ä¶and this was after waiting for seemingly interminable lengths of time for the websites to pull up on screen.  Whenever I tried to SEND messages, however, I received irreconcilable ERROR messages, due to systems overload, or some other mysterious root cause.  Same thing when I tried to book tours online.  And the staff could provide zero assistance in resolving.  Thus, in short, the ‚Äúbusiness center‚Äù there was extremely inadequate at best and pretty much bordering on a total embarrassment, that management sorely needs to attend to.  Otherwise, perhaps you‚Äôd enjoy better success ‚Äì or maybe not?!  LOL. - by bringing your own notebooks for interface to their WIFI network as an alternative?However, additionally worth mentioning is that the Staybridge apparently DOESN‚ÄôT PROVIDE regular housekeeping services on weekends‚Ä¶based on signage posted in the rooms?!  But I wasn‚Äôt entirely clear on what the property‚Äôs philosophy was behind this, and would advise validating their actual policy with them directly‚Ä¶lest I miscommunicate.  But as we were only there during the week ‚Äì with a Saturday a.m. departure ‚Äì we weren‚Äôt around to experience this first hand. Speaking of departure, we had another nightmarish adventure upon checking out of the hotel.  Specifically, despite our best efforts in precisely describing the locale of the hotel to our airport transport provider ‚Äì they totally bungled the pickup point nonetheless and ended up in Central London somewhere!  As again, it is a bit confusing if you‚Äôre not familiar with the area and layout there.  So we waited outdoors in the heavy drizzle and chill for nearly an hour prior to finally having to defer to the Staybridge concierge to call us a taxi ‚Äì which was another hour‚Äôs drive and 60 British Pounds to Heathrow.  We only made our international flight back to the U.S. by some miracle of fate (i.e. ‚Äì airline personnel actually delayed the plane‚Äôs scheduled gate ‚Äúpull away‚Äù time in anticipation of our hectic and sweaty late arrival)!  But just further reinforcement for having the Staybridge staff itself help negotiate the property‚Äô inevitable logistics challenges associated with finding your way to and from the property!In closing ‚Äì finally ‚Äì we‚Äôd likely consider staying here, going forward ‚Äì excluding weekends perhaps‚Ä¶LOL! ‚Äì from a simple price / value perspective alone.  But there is definitely room for improvement!

We stayed at Staybridge Suites this weekend for just one night (sadly) having watched a concert in the Olympic Park. The hotel was fantastic!!! The staff were really helpful and friendly and did all they could for us from printing our concert tickets to letting us watch the Wimbledon final 3 hours after checking out.The breakfast was delicious with a good variety of food, the sun terrace was a nice addition and the rooms spacious and clean. All in all a fab hotel, would highly recommend!

column9: Very good choice if you want to shop in one centre and be close to a place that hosts mega concerts.
column10: The hotel itself is situated in an ideal position. We chose Staybridge because it was close to where Michael Buble was in concert at the O2. Therefore meaning that we were also close to public transport. (We were at the O2 in fifteen minutes circa and we made it back in less than thirty). The fact that all kinds of fashion houses etc are under one roof and within a five minutes' walk, is perfect. Even the restaurants are that close, which is a bonus. The hustle and bustle of London and Westminster is thirty mins away. Calming Cambridge is an hour's train away. The only things that disappointed me slightly were:- -The fact that the rooms do not shut the noise totally from outside, even though they are twelve floors high! So one hears the humming of the machinery on the roof tops of the shopping complex as well as the voices of the event direction guides speaking on their megaphones in a muffled way that can still disturb your sleep. -the fact that the air conditioning unit within the room is not a quiet one and the building within itself does echo other residents' voices and movements in certain areas. -as soon as we entered our room we found an open bar of chocolate in its wrapper; half eaten and a stained foot runner on the bed which we obviously attribute to human error due to the busy custom of the hotel. (But it was still distasteful at first impact)The above reasons is why I rated my stay as an overall very good otherwise I would have rated all as excellent.

column9: It is decided, probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in
column10: And I will break it down why. So what are the things that most of the people of all ages look at when staying in an hotel?Bed comfort, room isolation, room cleanliness, quality of service at the front desk, room service, room contents, showers, quality of sleep, WiFi, location, breakfast, view from the room and maybe a fitness center.Pretty much in every single category this hotel deserves a top rating, maybe except the location, but even then it is conveniently located as almost a part of the Westfield mall, where you can get whatever you need. The tube is located just at the other exit from the mall.The bed was very comfortable, the room was very well isolated and clean. The quality of service was absolutely spotless, the people at the desk really knew how to approach their clients and perhaps the "TripAdvisor 2013 Winner" badge at the reception is a good motivation for the people working there. The room had a small, but sufficient fridge, a stove and a microwave, which struck me as a surprise considering that this is a pretty expensive hotel. And expensive hotels don't usually provide this type of service counting on people ordering food from the astronomically priced restaurant. Koodos for that. Showers were well lighted, comfortable and clean. Besides the numerous TV channels, the actual Samsung TV was also equipped with the Apple TV add-on and access to YouTube.Another problem I have with most of the expensive hotels is the fact that you have to pay for the WiFi access or the access is so inconvenient that you rather not use it at all. This is where this hotel also has pleasantly surprised me. Strong WiFi signal on all of the floors and only once you walk out of the lobby, your signal is completely lost which disables the people passing by to obtain the connection, which is a smart thing to do. WiFI access doesn't require any personal information and it is a straightforward open connection.From the room I could see a pretty nice view on London and a view on the Olympic Stadium. To get anywhere on the elevator, you must have your room card available, otherwise you'll be waiting for quite a while, which is a very good security measure, I find.The breakfast was the last contribution to winning me over. The large kitchen setting provided a large choice of breakfast to anyone's taste. Even my brother, who eats breakfast about couple times a year, actually picked up a few things at the buffet and enjoyed a nice scenery from the 12th floor of the hotel. Mind you, there is nothing very luxurious about this hotel, but it is definitely worth the price paid.Prior to our stay at this hotel, we spent 3 nights camping at the Download Festival in Donnington, so to have a bed and so many convenient services was a real blessing at that point.Most of the hotels in London are quite expensive, but if you don't mind throwing some more money to get this type of great service, I think it is well worth it. Taking all these factors into consideration, I actually think that this is probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in (moving Hilton Lac-Leamy in Gatineau to the 2nd spot)

column9: Excellent value relative to other hotels in London
column10: I read really good reviews of this hotel before booking and it certainly lived up to its billing and even surpassed it in certain aspects. I stayed with my wife and 2 little kids. The hotel is awesome value for money relative to other hotels in Zone 1-3 in London. Very clean hotel, excellent service, very well appointed rooms, full kitchen, free breakfast, free laundry. Stratford station is 200 metres away and is on the all-important Central and Jubilee lines for tourist. Shopping heaven Westfield is downstairs, and we killed time in there when the weather was miserable. You can't beat this hotel for value in London.The only slight negatives were the speed of the wifi and the fact that we had to constantly activate the wifi every few hours. But this is picking at bits really.

column9: A very good place to stay in London
column10: Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City located in one of the best shopping centers of london is like a home away from home. Olympic village is just 2 minutes away. Spacious clean rooms with well equipped kitchen makes stay very comfortable. Lots and lots of great eating options in the Westfield mall. Will definitely return here on my next visit to London.

found all the staff to be very helpful and friendly, room on 12th floor so you don't have to keep coming up and down in the lifts. The hotel has a great evening reception with free drinks and snacks and a lovely outdoor terrace to enjoy it on.Some other little positives: windows that open, tea and coffe making in room, plugs by the bed for phone charging, ironing board already in room, easy to work shower, lots of tv channels and very large proper king bed with no join in the middle! The staff were all super and went above and beyond, Timothy was especially helpful and friendly. I have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in London (mandarin oriental, Dorchester, Browns, Carlton tower etc) but was just as happy here. The location, style, views, happy hour, breakfast and newness of the hotel make it great value and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

My taxi driver struggled to find the best drop-off place for the Staybridge Suites at Stratford City but that was the last problem that I had there during a seven-night stay. The facilities are excellent and new, the access to the Underground slick and straightforward, staff friendly and welcoming and the rooms giving the twin benefits of hotel and apartment.

super friendly, right across from train station, quiet at night. Room breakfast area. Decent choice of cereals, cooked buffet, nice coffee!We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and loved it. The rooms are new, very clean and has perfectly equipped kitchen.The hotel Beautifully spottless room with an AMAZING view and the bed was incredibly comfortable,  quite big and comfortable. The staff was very nice...

Our enjoyable sightseeing adventures of London was sandwiched with leaving & returning to the Staybridge everyday. Upon our arrival, the staff was very polite & helpful eventhough we arrived a day late. I was impressed with the cleaniness of the room. Everyday a member of the staff came by to ensure that the cleaning crew had cleaned our room. Other plusses were a nice, firm bed, air condition and the heat of the shower. We also enjoyed the assortment of items available for breakfast. In addition to all of that, the location was ideal. The Westfield Mall is practically at our doorsteps. The surrounding environment was also a plus. My wife and I loved watching the outdoor chess competition each evening as we returned to the room. If we return to London this will number #1 on our list.

column9: Excellent views next to a shoppers paradise
column10: Very clean, staff super friendly, right across from train station, quiet at night. Room 1101 had a cracking view of the Olympic stadium and the city beyond. V slight AC noise, but nothing major. More great views from the breakfast area. Decent choice of cereals, cooked buffet, nice coffee!

column9: Suuuuuperb! Great view, amazing staff, yummy breakfast...
column10: I booked a deluxe room for Saturday night as a Birthday present for my friend and we couldn't of asked for anything more, it was superb!Beautifully spottless room with an AMAZING view and the bed was incredibly comfortable, we both slept like babies! Breakfast was great, especially the croissants! Really well situated for shopping in the Stratford Centre and literally 2 mins from the tube station. Parked for ¬£5.00 in the centre carpark overnight which was a bargain.We would like to thank the staff, they were all very friendly and helpful. I have stayed in a lot of 4 star hotels but never met such a wonderful manager. Wayne was LOVELY and so very charming! We will definitely be returning and recommending!

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and loved it. The rooms are new, very clean and has perfectly equipped kitchen.The hotel is located right next to westfield mall, and a few minutes walk from the tube and DLR station.Not like in many hotels in London, our room was quite big and comfortable.The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful.The breakfast was nice and the price was reasonable.We will definitely stay there again.

Stayed here for a long weekend.Great view overlooking the Olympic Park & the show-jumping that was on.Good room & facilities.Excellent location for a meal & concert on the Friday night at the 02, the foodie festival @ Clapham Common on the Saturday.Loads of restaurants & bars as well as the shops in Westfields itself.Good to be on Jubilee line into central London (Green Park).Will definitely stay again.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is 20 minutes away by tube from places like Bank Street etc. It is a direct line and if you board from Stratford, there is hardly any crowd. The hotel is located inside a mall. There are signages however, we found it difficult to locate the hotel. This is something that the hotel staff should better. We entered through the parking area and it took us some time before we could figure it. The easiest entry is on the road from front of Olympic park. The best part is that you don't have to climb stairs/ escalators etc since it is at the same level. The other way is to get down in front of the mall next to the tube station and take the lift to 1 floor and walk towards the open area. The hotel is right above Holiday Inn with a common entry but separate lifts. It is opposite the diesel and prada stores. The hotel is very nice. Rooms clean with all amenities available. All big brands are just at the door step. Waitrose and a food plaza are a floor down and you can always walk in and buy food. You can cook since everyhting is available in the room. The service was great.

Had a 4 day stay in London and booked to stay here. Really great apartments, very comfy bed and all the amenities, much nicer than a hotel. Great views out over the Olympic park, ask for a high floor though that faces towards the park otherwise you'll look out over the cinema. So handy for shopping in Westfield, great Waitrose if you want to stay in to dine but also several nice dining options 2 minutes walk. Very convenient for the tubes/trains. The staff were very welcoming and polite at all times. Would be sure to book here again for a London break. The complimentary breakfast was also better than we had expected with coffee and tea available all day. Would be excellent to stay on business too. Large lounge to meet up with colleagues.

Stayed here yet again while going to the O2.  Only 2 stops on the Jubilee line to North Greenwich and the O2 arena.  Arrived quite early but reception more then helpful and upgrade to one bed suite straight away and was able to drop off luggage. Room as always clean and fresh, unfortunately not overlooking the Olympic park, something to remember if you are going to be staying a while as the side overlooking the Westfield plaza can be quite noisy if your room overlooks the casino! There is a manned 24hr concierge in the entrance hall so always someone available when you return from a late night as well as the usual reception on the 12th floor.  Breakfast was from 7.30 on the Sunday, eggs hash browns, beans as well as pastries, breads and sweet cake selection.  Coffee machines make proper strong coffee to get you going.  Check out efficient and even offered to store bags if we wanted a luggage free day.  Excellent location, apartments but the staff make the whole experience, can not praise them enough, will return next time I am in London, only little criticism, if they could update the bathrooms to have a magnifying mirror for shaving would be perfect.

Stayed here the evening of a concert as the misses wanted to do bit of retail therapy before and the moring after.Well this is not the easiest place to find and it is probably better to follow te signs fr the Holiday Inn which is the same building as he Staybridge Suites.In general I was very impressed with the place -large roomed suite with nice big bed and modern top class bathroom.Niggles were someone's left over salad nicoise and half eaten fruit salad in the fridge and the ice tray smelled so strongly of garlic that we had to get house keeping to come and take it away.Nice buffet breakfast but I am pretty sure the scrambled egg was made from a mix which is a shame.Anyway good place for a base around or near the Olympic park with a great view (from the right side).Not too cheap though.

Stayed in a one bedroom suite twice over the past week and have been impressed with everything here (along with most of the other reviewers here).The one bedroom suites are great for relaxing in front of the TV in the kitchen/lounge area or retiring to the room on the comfortable bed. Bathroom is a great size and the shower nice and powerful.Really enjoyed the whole ambience of this hotel and would really recommend it to anyone wanting a home from home whilst in London.

Had a brilliant time during my 3 months here, the staff have been so accommodating  nothing is too much trouble, special mentions have to go to Helen, Mary, Nicholas, Jordan oh what the heck everyone, it's been a home away from home! Although after a lengthily stay I will be glad to get home and normality I will miss the service provided by a first class team!!!!  Best wishes Ebonny xx

Spent 2 nights in Stratford Suites. Hotel is modern rooms well equipped spacious and clean.Shower is an enjoyable experience. Breakfast a bit modest but ok really and has fruits included.Coffee at room but also in dining room 24/7.Location- far from center of London and Heathrow. Close to London city airport.A train station and tube nearby to reach any attraction in London.Located next to Westfield Shopping mall - a huge center that caters for all your needs just draw your plastic cards. Aspers Casino is next door if you look for opportunity to part with your money.Olympic park next to Hotel.Cheap car parking - an advantage.

column9: Brilliant property, surprisingly well-located, keep it quiet!
column10: Firstly I HAVE to say a huge thank you to Nikolas, the young man on the reception desk.  He went out of his way to help me when I was having major issues trying to get Dominos to deliver a pizza!!!The property is absolutely brilliant, well appointed and for London HUGE!  The kitchenette was well laid out and makes your stay more of a 'home away from home' than a hotel stay.  The room was spotlessly clean and I had a brilliant view of the Olympic stadium.Given that it is an apartment more than a hotel the Waitrose and M&S located inside Westfiled shopping centre of which the hotel is part make buying groceries exceptionally easy.  If you don't feel like cooking there are a number of great restaurants in the centre for you to choose from.Don't be put off by zone 3 on the tube - you have national rail, Overground, Underground, DLR and more to choose from in terms of getting around.  Central line to central London took me 20 minutes to meet family for dinner and the Jubilee line to Canary Wharf was no more than 15 minutes to meet a colleague.  As I said in the heading it is surprisingly well-located.  I met family to attend an event at Twickenham and used the Overground service.  Again easy to use and navigate...  I actually think that the hotel is better-placed than many central London hotels from a transport perspective (the only downside being the GBP50 taxi journey from Paddington after the Heathrow Express).On the down-side, mainly small things:-  hooks on the bathroom door to hang towels would be a great addition-  the 'gym' is more of a 'fitness room' and desperately needs to be better equipped.  There are 2 treadmills, a stationery cycle, a seated cycle, a non-moveable bench and an odd assortment of dumbbells.  It needs at least a cross-fit multi-purpose type machine to be even vaguely useful a and there is no alternative close by!-  be aware that the drop-off is in the street and that you have to walk with your luggage to the hotel as there is no place for direct drop-off (this is a MAJOR design flaw!)-  healthier breakfast options - no muesli or granola that I could see... no oats... hot stuff is all pre-prepared (and the eggs/omelette looked grim)...Having said all of that it was a great stay for 5 days and I will definitely be back!

column9: Superb location with Excellent Service and Quality
column10: Having stayed at Staybridge Stratford a few times over the last one year, I decided I need to do justice to this place. Despite being away from the city, Staybridge Stratford prime location with views of the Olympic Park, and the huge Westfield Stratford shopping mall just next door, makes this accomodation one of the best in London.For business travellers, if your offices are in Canary Wharf financial area, it will be worth staying at Staybridge. With free internet and breakfast (albeit a simple continental one),  free laundry room for guests, and nice sunset views from the lounge (or room if you are facing the park), it is a definite home-away-from-home location.Kudos to the reception staff are always very friendly and helpful, regardless of time of the day and queries from guests. Housekeeping is good, and rooms are nicely cleaned daily.Whether you are here for business or pleasure, the huge Westfield Stratford has everything you need - from big branded and luxury wear and fashion, to many fusion and local restaurants, bars and cafes, it definitely caters to all walks of life.  There is also a huge VUE cinemas for those looking to catch up with big screen shows.  The hotel and Westfield is easily accessible via DLR or tube, or if you are coming from central London, there is the express National Rail that connects Stratford to Central London.A point to note though, is that it gets really REALLY crowded on weekends.

My family stayed over for 5 nights. The check in was smooth, with great help from receptionist even do my family could not speck English.Excellent service and standards, breathtaking views, ideal location  and staff always there to help.My family had a stay to remember and promised they will be back.

column9: Excellent service, breathtaking views, ideal location
column10: Enjoyed our one night stay at this lovely new hotel, phoned ahead with a couple of questions & the staff couldn't have been more helpful, accommodated all my requests & had our room prepared slightly earlier than usual for our arrival. Shopping right on the doorstep & more places to eat than you'd need in 6months! The staff helped us with directions to the venue for our 10k run that evening & went out of their way to make me an ice pack for my injured knee after the run (!). The room was quiet, the shower was awesome &  breakfast the next morning was just what the Dr ordered in lovely, 'just like home' surroundings. More than I'd usually pay for a single overnight stay but totally worth every penny!

Though the location is at zone 3, the hotel room has it's own kitchen. As the hotel is located at Westfield shopping centre, you could buy grocery conveniently and cook in your room. The hotel staff make you feel at home. On top of that it has it's Shared laundry room for guest to wash their clothes. It's definitely value for money. If you are taking the train, please take to Stratford international and then to straford, it's thru their national rail , not the tube. London cab is really very expensive.

column9: Just as the catch phrase, it felt like home.
column10: I'll start with the negative as there is not much to say:Location is a bit far on the other side of Heathrow, so it takes about 90 minutes with a tube.The hotel is also in zone 3, so buying an oyster weekly pass is a bit more expensive (as generally for the main London attractions you want zones 1&2). Breakfast is missing some basic stuff, but there are alternatives very close. The good:Large, comfortable beds and very quite rooms. I slept like a baby. My room & it's kitchen were very well equipped with everything I needed. Free WiFi is good enough. Staff was very friendly. I could not ask for more for what I paid.

New hotel built adjoining Westfield shopping centre and apparently during London Olympics development. Clean, modern, good location for travel within London (DLR, overground, couple of tube lines, buses), reasonable size room and friendly staff (in particular Timothy and Nicholas). Will stay there again when returning to London

I stayed with my friend at Staybridge not long ago. Check in was quick and staff were friendly.  Room was very clean  and  everything was nicely presented. Kitchen area was  handy and we had everything we needed. We spoke to housekeeping couple of times with extra requests and everything was done in no time.  We are planning to stay there in future again.

column9: highly recommend so don't come and stay as I cant get a room
column10: The suites are new & clean if you pay the extra very spacious , been staying here for afew months wouldn't go anywhere else , close to shopping centre and train , ten mins into central London very handy, staff are great and friendly , Nadeen , jenifer really  helpfull, Helen, Cloe ,sophie and the boys at front desk friendly & always willing to help, Debbie , jordan , Mary & Madlin can't do enough for you at breakfast time always got a smile on their faces at breakfast time . All the cleaning staff and hotel manager very polite , three nights aweek has a guest night , great for meeting the staff

I am Priority Club Platinum member and stayed a night here on points redemption.This is our first stay in Staybridge Suite chain .When i saw King size bed ,that should able to fit 2 adult and 1 child.Unfortunately,its more of extra queen bed size.It was not a comfornatble nigth sleep for us.Other then rest rest of the room is modern and clean.Complementary wifi is great and very much welcome.Breakfast is bit chaotic and the food is not fill up quick enough.I did'nt that they have baked bean till 15 mins later .I would have return here for single or couple trip but not sure if family trip.

This was my first visit to a Staybridge and I was really impressed - the room was clean and comfortable and the staff were exceptional.  A fantastic welcome, quick check in and check out.  Breakfast was really good and of course it is an ideal location to visit the fantastic shopping centre with a good choice of restaurants.  The only downside was our good old English weather!!

column9: Nice stay, but dont expect a spacious apartment.
column10: Incredibly courteous Staff, Location is great, room ok, even though I expected a spacious apartment but it was the size of an average double room. Misleading pictures. WiFi not good enough. I rather stay in an hotel room as the apartment is so small.

Found this hotel last minute for my boyfriends birthday as the rate was reasonable. We were surprised on how easy to get to the hotel it was from St Pancras less than ten minutes on Javelin train! Check in was quick and the staff were amazing, Chloe spoke to us like we were her friends and she even upgraded us to a one bedroom suite and then even better we found a bottle of wine and card when we entered the room. The room made us feel like we were are at home, very spacious and clean.Breakfast was lovely and we did not realise it was included in the rate until check out, there's plenty of selection to choose from and with the free coffee facilities we could not go wrong! Although breakfast was good we lost track of time and ended up coming down later than planned, but Helen made sure we got the full selection of food and cereals which was very much appreciated!!The hotel is situated in the centre of Westfields Shopping Centre which is a major bonus with all the shops and restaurants open til late. All in all this hotel is one of the best last minute properties we have stayed in and would recommend it to anyone staying in London as transport around is also great!

The only "minus" for the hotel is 30min by tube to the downtown. However, after we read so many negative reviews on 4* hotels in other districts we decided to choose Staybridge and were very satisfied with the choice. Rooms are new, clean and comfortable, breakfast is good, location within Westerfield shopping mall is very pleasant, tube station is 2mins from the hotel.

The hotel is clean and comfortable, albeit a little small. The hotel staff are amazingly helpful (not just one or two.. all of them are equally helpful) and friend. Quite a big contrast over the hotel (Palace Hotel @ Manchester - really really bad hotel) that we stay next. In addition, the hotel is next to a major tube station (Stratford). We took a risk to stay away from downtown London. Turn out be a really good choice. We also love the view facing olympic park. Would definitely consider this hotel again in my future trip to London.

This was our fifth visit to London and the finest place to stay for the money. The staff at Staybridge where friendly and helpful. We need have some small issues during our stay but they corrected them quickly and in a caring matter.A few things to note suites are not serviced on weekends unless requested so be advised.Once checked in you must swipe your key card on the black receiver in the lift to stop at the room floors - no sign to tell you this !Also, their name on the building is not easy to see at first so look for the Holiday in sign above the Staybridge sign they share the same building.On exiting the central line tube walk to the Westfield exit than at the mall go up one level and keep to your left through the main outside walk way.The managers social in the evenings is very nice Mon - Thurs, but the breakfast is a little below standard. They cater to the younger professionals and maybe they are not so finicky on breakfast.

column9: Best apartment i stayed at in the uk
column10: I've stayed at staybridge for over 3 month along with 60 other of my colleagues. I got the say despite the hotel being packed to capacity you couldn't tell everything was smooth and effortless the staff were so helpful. The room was clean daily to a very high stardand. Fresh towels , bedding & extra hanger on request was never a problem even though the hotel was full. Big thanks to the staff to tim, debbie (aka big mamma) and helen who made may stay a pleasure. i will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends and family and will definately be staying here again shortly . Coulplw of xtra thing i got to say impressed was the manager evening on tuesday/wednesday and thursday where the management team come down to meet and greet you and provide free cheese and wine :-) . The movie night on mondays is also a must as always showing the latest film released that week.

My partner and me stayed at Staybridge Suites because of work for 3 months approximately. We really recommend this hotel as long as short stays.Our room was perfect size; with a nice kitchen, living room and big room and bathroom. This was everyday clean. The housekeeping and reception staff was lovely and always helpful. The location is good, 5 minutes walking to Stratford tube, and 15 minutes to London centerClearly, we will come back.

Got a great deal, room with city views breakfast included for 100 pound per night.We were attending concert in O2, 10mins took us there on underground which is 5 min walk from hotel and 20mins took us into central London Bought a day pass for 8 pound enabling us to use all buses, trains and tubes...great value. Hotel surrounded by all the Westfield shops, restaurants and a casino. The hotel itself was spotless , staff very pleasant and helpful and breakfast was good. Unlimited free tea and coffee was available at any time of the day and the views from the dining area are spectacular. The rooms are of a good size, not as big as they look on website but sufficient for our needs.I would have no hesitation recommending this area or hotel to anyone wishing to visit London whether for business or pleasure. The only gripe I would have (and it's a minor one ) is we had a few difficulties with our key which is also used to operate lifts. A very good stay and will return on future visits to London.

My young kids and I stayed at staybridge suites in April and it was an amazing experience. Reception staff (Sophie, Timothy and Nicholas) were friendly and exceptional at all times. The breakfast was great as well as there was enough to eat for everyone....the kids loved the scrambled eggs, lol. Its right in the mall so shopping was within very easy access and we didn't have to take our jackets out for shopping when it got cold. I've already recommended to hotel to my friends and will definitely definitely stay here again and again. Keep up the good work guys.

column9: Was getting 5 stars even before I remembered it was a suite room
column10: I came to London for my first time from Stansted airport and this place impressed from the second I touched down. First, I expected to have to navigate London Metro with all of my luggage. To my surprise, the second I walked off the plane there was a bus waiting for Stratford City for 8pounds. I had to walk through the mall to get to the hotel and the mall in and of itself is an attraction. Tons of shopping and lots of great food. When I checked in the staff were very friendly and courteous. They checked me in early, let me borrow a power adapter and informed me of all of the perks which come with this middle-price ranged room: free internet, free laundry, free gym, free drinks in the lobby on some days, and free breakfast. The free internet, laundry, and breakfast will save you nearly 30pounds a night by itself.The hotel was already on its way to getting 5 stars before I walked in and remembered that this was a suite we purchased (I actually overlooked this fact when booking). There's a full modern kitchen in the room. Perfect for stocking up on drinks and munchies and avoiding having to eat out (there's a very reasonably priced grocery store on the bottom floor of the mall). This place definitely deserves the ratings it gets.
