The best advice I can give any reader who has a need to stay a few days in London at a reasonable price, and wants or needs to be in the City or Docklands, is give this place a try. I almost guarantee that you won‚Äôt regret it and you will go back.I am not usually a fan of hotels within shopping complexes, but here it works well, as you have quick access to the DLR, the tube and the main line stations, as well as taxi .The rooms ( suites) are well appointed, with views out over London, whilst the common areas are spectacular as the overlook the Olympic Village. The entire complex is immaculately clean, the staff helpful and the rooms well serviced. Each room as a good sized  bathroom two TV‚Äôs  and the usual serviced apartment cooking and washing facilities. Parking is only GBP 5 a day, which for London is a huge bargain. Within 2 mins walk you have about a dozen decent chain restaurants, a cinema, coffee shops and, should you want to go to them, a huge selection of shops.Overall a complete bargain, and doubly so as it is in London, where one can pay a small fortune for rubbish.

It was the best choice for my holiday close to the all shoping.The rooms are very clean spotless and the staff very friendly. Breakfast as well very good. Definitely we are coming back. The views is fantastic and I feel so sorry that we have to leave. Once again we will be back on summer.

We stayed here in Dec 2012 and the experience was incomparable. This has been the best hotel we have stayed in. Service was implacable. The staff never failed to make our day. Buffet breakfast has the homely feel and variety was good too. A plus point would be the views we got from our room and the breakfast room. Being next to Westfield Stratford was itself a major advantage. There's a plethora of things to do in Westfield Stratford and food options were excellent (there were very good choices for halal food).The rail links were excellent to go into central London (approximately 20 minutes journey). Considering the price range, the distance from central London was not even a setback.Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay in Staybridge Stratford and can't wait to be back here when we are visiting London again.

I would like to move in permanently... Friendly and welcoming staff. Good size room with nice layout and decor. Very clean, with wonderfully comfortable bed and pillows. Housekeeping staff have done a spotless job. I couldn't find anything to critisize. Nice breakfast with a view as a bonus. Plenty of shops around and easy travel to central London. Not over the top - JUST RIGHT.

column9: The best place I've ever stayed in London
column10: If you have the opportunity to stay here - DO! Without a doubt, the best place I've stayed in London.Beautiful reception area with lounge and bar. Self-service kitchen, just walk up and take a snack.The rooms are spacious, stylish, decorated with style, and well designed. Good sized kitchenette, with dishwash, microwave, and well stocked with utensils etc.Large comfy king bed, nice sized bathroom with wet-room style shower. The staff are exceptionally friendly - taking the time to talk in detail with me. It felt like staying with a friend.Set in the Westfield shopping centre in Stratford - a brand new development of stylish shops. A food court is nearby offering street foods from around the world, and a whole host of big name restaurants too.About 5 mins stroll from Stratford tube, for the Central line, Jubilee line, DLR, and overground. Central London takes about 20 minutes.Superb value too. I'd very happily stay here every time I visit London, it's an amazing experience without a doubt. I actually wished I wasn't travelling alone, so others could share the experience too!

Stayed for a week and every evening coming back from work really did feel like coming home, all the staff make you feel welcome,  always ready to chat and make you feel relaxed, more like friends rather than hotel staff. I am going to stay on a long term basis and will even bring my family down at the weekend to enjoy what I enjoy in the week. The Buffet breakfast has just what you need, hot food, fruit, cereal, fruit juice, yogurts great. The thing I like about staying at the Staybridge is that you can be self sufficient, you don't need to go to breakfast or go out to dinner you can eat in just like being at home, put the dishes in the dishwasher and of you go enjoy shops on the door step out for a drink and even a little gambling opposite. overall i found the Staybridge perfect for what I need from a weeks stay, even made new friends not something that happens when away on business.

Booked a weekend stay using their special Weekender price, which allows you to cancel your booking up until 4pm on Thursday, which I think is pretty good and would recommend. Anywho, back to the hotel itself. Didn't have too much trouble finding the place, although the signs in the Westfield Carpark could have been a little better, but I guess that's not the hotel's fault. The receptionist on the phone was really helpful.Arriving at the building situated out on The Street at Westfield, you are greeted by friendly staff and have to take an elevator to the top floor to reception. The whole hotel was spotless; faultless in fact? The room we had was facing the city, with fantastic views over London. The skyline at night is absolutely beautiful. The room was fairly big, clean and furnished pretty well. We booked a normal King Size room, so was equipped with a mini kitchenette area, which was cute. The shower/wet room was pretty generous, and the water pressure really good, which was a plus, I enjoyed a really nice shower in the morning. Also comes with your usual washing/shower products, such as shampoo and conditioner, but I brought my own anyway. There's a hair dryer in the room too, which was handy. The free Wi-Fi wasn't great, it was quite slow at times and you couldn't really stream anything properly without it breaking up at times. You can upgrade to the option premium internet, however with the price we paid for the room and the feel of the hotel, you'd expect that sort of internet access to be included. The hotel has a 'business class' feel to it, so I suspect it appeals to a lot of business travelers. Again, just furthering the need for higher speed internet access. Apple TV in the room too, but again you need to upgrade to the higher internet, so that was a little disappointing. Breakfast in the morning was to a good standard, however, we were disappointed with the lack of bacon. Although we thought there could have been more variety in the way of hot food, there is an extensive range of cereals, breads, croissants, fruit etc that you can help yourself to. Oh, also really liked the 'home from a home' feel to the restaurant area - it's basically a kitchen you can help yourself too: you can make your own coffee, toast, etc - so that felt pretty homely. So, yeah, only criticism is that they could have offered a wider variety of hot foods - overheard another guest asking about beans? Be sure to check out the balcony in the dining area - some fantastic views, and luckily we enjoyed some sunshine so was really lovely to enjoy a coffee out there in the morning. Would probably stay again, it did the job and it did it well. I would say it lived up to my expectations and was a good price for what it was. The staff are really friendly, the breakfast is good and included in your room price, noise levels are low and we had a really comfortable room. I'd recommend it.

When I last visited London, I stayed in the Holiday Inn Express next door to the Staybridge Suites, which was just fantastic so when there was no vacancies this time we decided we would be on a winner in the Staybridge Suites. Upon arrival the lobby looks fresh and clean and the receptionists were very pleasant and welcoming. First impressions of our suite was that it was still fresh and new. Very pleased until entering the bathroom only to find a patch of dried on crusty urine under the toilet seat! yuk!! I called the receptionist who said " sorry"  (and not much else) and sent a couple of girls to our room to clean. As I looked I noticed one of the girls wiped a dry cloth over the urine stain, then immediately wiped over the sink and the mirror with the same part of the cloth, which didn't even have any water or cleaning product on it. The second girl got her toilet brush and brushed and swilled all around the inside of the toilet then proceeded to scrub the floor and the toilet flusher with the same brush without even rinsing or cleaning it! this was enough to put me off staying there ever again! absolutely disgusting hygiene levels and makes me wonder what they do when you are not there if that's what you see when you are. Not acceptable by any means!!!!!!! breakfast was no where near the level of the Holiday inn next door and there was a lot of people always waiting for refill and top ups. No where near enough choice.

I was fairly skeptical when I saw the sign "Welcome Home", as I stepped into their reception the first time. It didn't take too long to identify with it, though! Hotel is in a fantastic location both in terms of the immediate environment (new and huge mall, lots of restaurants with variety of cuisines, cinema theatre, casino et al) as well as connectivity (5 mins. walk to the Stratford station, which is a junction of so many lines that you can reach most parts of London with ease). One thing to keep in mind though - the building is in the middle of several blocks of restaurants and the mall - so the taxi goes as far as the Westfield Chestnut Plaza Restaurants board - with Busaba Eathai on one side and The Cow on the other... you would need to walk it (less than a minute) to the hotel itself from this point.Rooms are fairly spacious and clean and come with all necessary amenities for a comfortable long stay (kitchenette with hob, dishwasher, fridge, toaster, microwave, kettle and basic crockery and cutlery). Views from the room could be towards the mall or looking out towards the city - the latter is absolutely incredible, especially at night with the twinkling skyline, the green laser beam of the GMT line, the trains doing their busy runs and so on (ask for a city-view when you book). In-room amenities are standard. They provide Apple TV (at extra charges) but the basic TV channels were more than enough. Free wireless and wired internet connections within the room, but if you need to stream videos, you will have to upgrade to the faster and paid internet. Wardrobe plus drawer space was ok but could be better. Basic toiletries provided - I liked the low-waste approach where they don't provide the little vanity kits, instead have big bottles of shampoo, conditioner and shower gel - just like at home. Carry your own lotions, though.The 12th (top) floor hosts their reception area, gym (comfortable for 3-4 people to work out at the same time), laundry room, pantry, breakfast area and the "den". I loved the den! It's a cosy room at the end of the floor, with a big TV, a little "library" (just a handful of books but enough), board games and multiple points where you can plug in your laptop. They host a movie once a week in the den too, complete with popcorn to go. Socials are ok with the wine / beer / sodas and cheeses, olives and salads, chips, breads and p√¢t√©. But easily, the winner is their complimentary breakfast - with a spread of hot and cold, veg and non-veg items, from fruits to cereals to eggs to sausages to yogurt to croissants etc., there are enough options to choose from and it's all yummy too, though one may tire of it after 2 long months :). Another convenient thing was a 24 hours tea/coffee availability, though one needed to go to the 12th floor for this. But it was nice to be able to get my cuppa literally anytime, complete with honey to go! And all this at no extra charge made this one of the best value-for-money places by far!Also, the hotel folks are really nice, friendly and very helpful - when I needed to get printouts and scans in the middle of the night and their own scanner was not functioning suitably, they went down to their other hotel (Holiday Inn), got it done without my having to run around one bit! Without a doubt, will be happy to stay here again!

Stayed in this hotel as it was close to rail station giving easy access into London, It is in the midst of Westfield Shopping Centre with all the bars, restaurants and shops and thought it would be interesting as it is next door to the Olympic Village.  Staff really friendly and helpful, room immaculate and views from the upper floors were great.  Two rooms:  one open plan with kitchen, sofa bed flat screen tv, the other main bedroom again flat screen tv and bathroom. Very spacious.

We stayed here over Easter weekend.  The staff is wonderful, and very accommodating.  I am a light sleeper, and we had our 21 month old daughter with us.  The first night we were on the side of the hotel that overlooks the mall/casino.  Very noisy from the casino, and could hear people on the smoking deck.  I asked if we could switch sides the next day, no problem.  It is in a great location, right next to the huge mall with a lot of dining options.  We would take the underground into the city for the day, and come back and have dinner at the mall at night, worked perfectly for our little family.  Rooms are lovely, and quite spacious...although the queen sized bed is smaller than what we're used to!  We would definitely stay here again!

Great facilities and location - close to the Shops at Westfield Stratford and all transport links into the cityNote the shops do not open untill 12.00 miday on a Sunday. Breakfast the best offering ever..so much choiceNext to the Holiday Inn - I would choose the suites evertime

column9: Worth the battle on the tube
column10: I have stayed here every week for 16 weeks and I can honestly say it has consistently been one of the best hotel experiences I have had.The staff are fantastic (every time), there is a really friendly atmosphere, mini- gym is great and breakfast is great too, fantastic views from the lounge with a balcony to enjoy breakfast.I have stayed in lots of fantastic hotels in the City and this place has the edge every time,

column9: Very good value overlooking Olympic park
column10: This was an experiment that worked. I stayed 3 nights, mix of business and pleasure, and was worried about how much time it would take to get to and from Stratford to City, Marble Arch and Hammersmith. On average I got door to door in about 30 mins - which was better than I had expected.Hotel does the things I value well. Suites are slightly larger than average hotel room. Bed is comfortable and pillows well above average. Room is dark (or was on olympic stadium side). Windows open (hoorah) and even then noise was very minimal for London, just the odd train creaking away below but quiet through small hours. All in all a pleasant place with clean bathroom and very good shower pressure. I can recommend highly especially for anything south of ¬£140 per night.They throw breakfast in ...which is just as well as it is not as good as the room you just vacated ! Limited and bland cooked with sub par sausages and overcooked beans..plus egg omelettes. I did like the homely attempt at presenting cereals, jams, juices etc as you would have them from larder/ cupboard at home but the experience scores a 6/10 at best. Many might prefer Costa coffee close to hotel entrance.Apart from one missed wake up call (overcomplicated telephone system) - the experiment worked and sadly I have to recommend it highly, which will probably push prices up to a point where the hotel no longer remains good value. We'll see....

column9: Great hotel, Great value, just a bit far out
column10: Nice rooms, very comfortable and great to have the kitchen and living room. Flat screens in both the bedroom and living room with satellite TV. A great place for families - We had spent our first 3 days in London at a very Centrally located hotel, so we were able to get all of the typical sightseeing when we were local. While at Staybridge, we did remote locations like Hampton court and StoneHenge so being a distance from central london was not too much of an issue. This was a nice place for when we wanted some downtime, with shopping, bowling and spending time at the hotel (although I wish there was a pool). Great common area upstairs and a very nice, homestyle kind of breakfast. Great value for the price. This was definitely the most comfortable hotel we stayed at during our trip to London and Paris and it was the least expensive. A fair trade off for the somewhat out of the way location.The cons: 1. No one made our room -- we were told they were short staffed over the Easter holiday. We were given fresh towels upon request, but that was it. 2. it is 1/2 hour away via the tube to central London. Days when we were tired it was tough to take the long ride back. That also meant a long (and expensive) cab fare from the train station and to Heathrow.3. Concierge was sick one day and we got some misinformation from his fill in, which caused us to miss a tour -- I'm sure that's an isolated incident however.

column9: ideal for business or city break
column10: We stayed for two nights and can thooughly recommend this accomodation. We booked a studio suite on the 10th floor with great views across London. The suite was really well appointed with an excellent kitchen area including dishwasher!Breakfast is included in the cost and was really good with a choice of full English or Continental and this can be collected and taken back to your suite if preferred.There are good lounge /terrace areas to meet up with other guests or just sit and relax and the staff could not have been more helpful.Although primarily designed for business stays it was ideal for our city break and we will definitely be staying again in the future

Really enjoyed our stay this weekend. All the staff were friendly & welcoming, particularly Timothy who always had a chat & a smile whatever time of the day. Rooms of a good standard & clean. The comfortable bed was the best in any hotel we have been to recently. We had one room upgraded and had a great view over the city,canary wharf & What is left of the Olympic Park. Only 5 minute walk to the tube & DLR. The Brazilian restaurant nearby is worth a visit too. We will definitely be back in the future.

We stayed her for one night over easter weekend, done some shopping, went for dinner and watched a movie. unfortunately the shopping centre was closed easter sunday, but that didnt make too much difference. The room was gorgeous, very spacious and definitely catered towards every type of guest, lots of room for wheelchair users in the room and lots of space in the bathroom. I found the lift system was really good and definitely made you feel safe (you could only get off on room levels if you had a room key) so you know random people wouldnt be wandering about in the hotel. Bed was large and definitely comfortable, had air con or heating if you needed and as I mentioned huge bathroom. Couldnt fault the rooms at all. Breakfast was good, buffet with quite a big range to suit anyone, you just need to get used to helping yourself! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

This was the 2nd stay at the Staybridge Suites and unfortunately it didn't live up to the standard of the 1st stay in Oct 2012. Firstly, I was in a room which was below the gym, not a very good idea to put the gym above where people are staying/sleeping as it is quite disruptive when others are using a treadmill and throwing weights on the floor early in the morning or when you just want to relax!!!! Perhaps if they offered a price reduction for those rooms which suffer from the noise and vibrations from the treadmills it might be a good idea. I did go to reception about this but I wasn't offered another room. Next, the hygiene wasn't very good in the kitchen area i.e dirty crockery and cutlery. There were also parts of the room that looked like they needed finshing off. The ratings I have given reflect my views of the 2nd stay. For ¬£100 a night I expected a higher standard....

I stayed here recently with my partner as it was the ideal location for both of us.  From the moment I walked in to the personal welcome, to the time we left, the service and facilities were excellent.I was upgraded to a larger room than I'd booked as there was space available. The room was fantastic with a big, extremely comfortable bed, spotless bathroom and excellent lounge and kitchen area.  The TV (including an Apple TV) was brilliant.Breakfast was a lovely on the 12th floor with views over London and including a wide range of premium items.  If I didn't have a train to catch I could still be there now!A great hotel in a great location with great staff. I'll definitely be back.

Have to start me frist review on here with 5 star rating... I travelled from LHR which took around 1 hour on the tube which was great .. few little minor problems finding the stay bridge suites but that was mainly my fault .. After arriving at the entrance i took the elevator to the 12th floor and was welcomed by a young and very pleasant gentleman called Chris he took very good care of me on check in and explained everything in the local area and the hotel very well and really did make me feel welcome to stay bridge, After a long trip i took rest then ran over to the shopping mall which was amazing and its only 2 seconds walk.. The day after i heading down to the breakfast area and was welcomed by amazing Debbie, The food what was on offer was amazing you couldn't think of anything else you could really want .... I stayed on a wednesday and was welcomed to the evening reception which is a gathering for all guest with free drinks and snacks met the wonderful Rafal the operations manager of the hotel a very pleasant man .. I would recommend a suite facing the former Olympic park and also a one bedroom suite.. I was checked out by Chris the same guy who checked me in and once again was Amazing!!! I really can not wait to come bak and see all the wonderful sights which the hotel offers been in a prime location ..

Start with the one and only negative, parking where instructed in the Westfield Shopping Centre, meant that we had to find a space near the lifts (not easy) take the cases up the lift and out into the shopping area and walk 60 metres in the rain to reach the hotel entrance.From that point forward things just got better and better. Taking the express lift up to the top floor where the reception is situated, we were greeted by happy smiling receptionists who not only processed you, but also made you feel welcome. We asked if they had any rooms overlooking the Olympic Park and they were only too pleased to find us a fantastic room (1001) that not only looked over the Stadium and ArcelorMittal Orbit, but we also had views of the Shard, O2 arena (Millennium Dome) and Canary Wharf.The room had a comfortable king size bed, shower bathroom, flat screen TV and small kitchenette with all the essentials (Hob, Microwave, Sink, Etc.).Breakfast the next morning was unexpectedly good, lots of choice and tasty with a vast range of cereals, fruit, bread, juices and yogurts. The cooked Breakfast only consisted of Scrambled Eggs, Tomatoes, Bacon and Sausage, but all of it was well cooked and delicious.Great place to stay in the middle of London.

This was our first stay and won't be our last. Great rooms, well thought out and equipped, exceptionally clean and comfortable. Very friendly staff and a great relaxed vibe. Well located for travel into central London. Highly recommend

We stayed here as we were attending a gig at the O2 and were really impressed.  The suites themselves are lovely.  Small but handy kitchen, good bed and tv, very nice shower.  The only downside was perhaps our view but we weren't there for that so it made little difference. The location is excellent - it didn't take long on the tube to get to the O2 and being at the Westfield Centre meant that we could step out of the hotel and into the shops and restaurants.  Reception staff were lovely and I was impressed by the breakfast offering.  We had initially been concerned by the lack of a bar or restaurant but were happy to cross the corridor and eat/drink at the Holiday Inn as we had the ability to charge it to our room.Perhaps the only complaint was the badgering of the housekeeper in the morning.  We had put our do not disturb sign on the door the night before but it disappeared by the morning.  In any event, it seems odd to me that they cannot simply be updated by reception when people have checked out so that they stop knocking on the door every half an hour and querying when you plan on leaving when it isn't even check out time yet! Other than that however, an excellent place to stay.

This is now the third time we've stayed here and that probably speaks volumes for the hotel. the reservation was arranged easily , we were given the rooms we wanted (connecting) and as always Rafal handled our our requests perfectly.We booked a 1 bed suite (1116) and the connecting standard room (1114).  As before the rooms were clean and well equiped, house keeping was efficient and helpful. The big plus is the location, right on the Westfield Mall and ideal for the tube and Docklands railway. When we stayed during Feb half term the parking was still only ¬£5.00 a day so not bad for London.Dont forget you can take your breakfast to your room by taking your room tray to breakfast , loading it up and then bringing it back to your room (kids loved this).It is a little more expensive than its Holiday Inn neighbour but then it is a different type off hotel as it has a kitchette in each room.Sure we'll be back again.

We stayed here for one night on the 10th march as we were visiting friends.the hotel is beside Westfield shopping mall and the rail station is a two minute walk.the hotel suite has a small kitchen area complete with microwave and dishwasher.the bathroom was beautiful with a power shower and nice toiletries.Beds were really comfortable.The complimentary breakfast had a good choice of hot and cold items available.Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful .The only downside was that we only had one night to enjoy this beautiful hotel and would stay here again.

We stayed for two nights at the Staybridge Suites, Stratford, London at the beginning of March.  This was our second visit and we intend to stay there again in the next couple of weeks.   The suites are of good size, spotlessly clean with an excellent shower room.  Although we did not use the kitchen facilities as we were visiting our son and mainly ate out, the facilities seemed more than adequate for those wishing to have the occasional meal in.  Breakfast was very good with a wide selection of hot and cold items, my only complaint being an absence of cheese and meat slices.  The staff are the most friendly and attentive of any I have encountered in London.Although not in the centre of London, transport facilities into the centre are excellent and for shopping there is always the Westfield centre on the doorstep

column9: Great and friendly like a home
column10: Stayed more than 20 times since it opened so they must do something right. If you drive then convenient otherwise need to walk through the shopping centre.  Occupies the 8th to 12th floors of a building.  3 classes of suite all with well equipped kitchen and Apple TV, handy if your films and music are on iTunes.  Managers drinks in the evening, basically cheese and wine with lots of take away food options or waitrose and marks and Spencer's a 5 min walk away in Westfields.  Price includes hot buffet breakfast which is OK. Place is spotless and staff great. If staying more than one night in the area then it is the obvious choice over a traditional hotel.

We traveled with our 17 year old daughter and stayed four nights. While the location was fairly far from the center of London and the attractions, the hotel was at a transportation hub and we traveled quite easily to the places we wanted to visit.( Make sure you purchase an Oyster Card!) Our daughter was thrilled that we were adjacent to the largest shopping mall in the UK and if you want to be part of the typical life of the locals, it was packed with people during the weekend. It was very safe to walk to and from the station and mall at night.   Saturday night was a little noisy due to the fact that our room faced the Casino and there was a bar that had an outdoor area that was pretty lively.The hotel staff was wonderful and  helpful with any questions or concerns we had. The room was spotless except for the lower portion of the window which was covered with children's hand prints. The complimentary breakfast offered a nice selection of hot and cold foods  and allowed us to start the day well-nourished.  There was a complimentary happy hour with wine and cheese during the week and it was nice to relax near the fireplace. The suite had a kitchen where we could cook a light meal purchased at one of the two grocery stores in the mall. We all slept well- the bed was comfortable and the pull-out sofa okay for one. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

column9: Superb location, fit for purpose and value for money.
column10: This is the first time I've stayed in a Staybridge Suites. I know London and wanted to be close to the rail links, and yet near to friends and the new restaurants and bars in East London. The location is right in the doorstep of a huge shopping mall so you can shop to your heart's content in both designer and high street shops. There are good restaurants right next to the hotel, as well as on the top floor of the mall. It's easy to get groceries as there is a Waitrose supermarket in the mall too, along wih various deli's.  The room was not huge, but no more than I needed for my husband and I.  It was clean. Can't comment on the breakfast as we went to the mall.It's an easy 15 minutes on the underground to central London, on the red central Line.  The cost is cheaper than your average central London hotel.   All in all I found the hotel perfect for my needs.

We visit London to see our family a few times a year and usually stay in a top grade hotelHowever this time we decided to try something different as we were paying for somethingwe didn't really make the best use of as we are only in the room for sleeping. The room wasspacious, clean, comfortable, good views of the Olympic Park and the City beyond and adequately furnished. The shower is huge and very easy to use, good lighting and air conditioning that works quietly. We shall certainly go back, it is great for shopping also,  being right in the heart of the Westfield Centre with all it has to offer.

I travel quite regularly for work and usually stay in the Holiday Inn hotel next door, but that was fully booked so I settled for here instead, it was more expensive but the reviews were good so I thought I'd give it a try.In summary it was "ok" but not sure if ill stay again for the priceThe staff were friendly, the room was initially clean and the general location of hotel is great.The breakfast was poor, I was told by the guy on front desk breakfast is on until 10:30, wrong, it's 09:30 and 10:30 on a Saturday. So on the Friday I missed breakfast - I was not overly pleased. On the day when I had breakfast (I stayed two nights) there was no bacon! The only hot food being served was sausages, hash browns and folded omelettes. If you love a good breakfast unfortunately this place was limited in choice.After attending the room, I had a "suite", so there's me thinking it'll be a huge room with some kind of lounge area - it's just a basic hotel room with a mini kitchen in! The bathroom is modern, but v small, there is no bath - just a shower!! After the first night the following morning the room wasn't cleaned very well, dirty cups were left in the room, the milk for tea/coffee wasn't replaced - bathroom wasn't cleaned properly - a severe lack of attention.Hopefully the manager is reading this - hotel just needs some polishing.

Try to stay here when I am in London, although its out of the city the quality of the accommodation and friendliness of the staff more than make up for the travel time.  Evening check in staff were fantastic, great guys and nothing is to much trouble, upgrade to a deluxe room overlooking the old (Now!) Olympic park, room as usual was spotless.  You can get the overland, tube and DLR from Stratford station which is a 5 min walk from the hotel so no problem getting into the City or further afield.  Breakfast was a great spread of either omelette, scrambled eggs with hash browns, cereals and pastries. Would have no hesitation in staying here again when working around London

column9: A Good Deal Near the ExCel Centre
column10: Recently, I needed to attend a trade show at London's ExCel Centre.  As its on the opposite side of London from where I live, I like to get a hotel room at ExCel, or nearby, whenever I am attending for more than one day, or with an early start.  Unfortunately, on this occassion, I got approval so late, to attend the show, that all the hotels at ExCel were sold out...except one: the Premier Inn.  I've stayed in Permier Inn's before and they're okay, but very basic.   On their website, they quoted me an astronomical price and I didn't want to pay that much for a Premier Inn.  Luckily, the Intercontinental Group came to the rescue. As a Priority Club member, I had their site open, because I had wanted to stay at the Crowne Plaza at ExCel.  The Crowne Plaza showed nothing available, but the Holiday Inn Express, Docklands, was an alternative.  I'd prefer a Holiday Inn Express to the Premier Inn and the Holiday Inn Express was cheaper, but not much.  Also, it's one stop away from the ExCel on the Docklands Light Railway (DLR).  I've stayed at that Holiday Inn Express before and It's a decent hotel, but it's a bit in the middle of nowhere, after hours.  Also, the price quoted was high, probably because of the show at the ExCel.  But, further down the list of Intercontinental properties was the Staybridge Suites at Startford City.  It's a higher level of property and they were quoting a lower price.  Staybridge opened in time for the 2012, London Olympics.  Now that the Olympics are over and it being winter in London, I guess it wasn't too busy.  Staybridge is only 2 stop on the DLR and 2 more stops on the Jubilee Line from ExCel.  Also, the overnight parking chrages are only ¬£5 per 24 hours, at Staybridge, while the Holiday Inn Express Docklands was quoting ¬£10.  Staybridge is part of the Stratford City complex, co-located with a Holiday Inn, alongside the Westfield Mall.  Wesfield has restaurants, a food court, and a Vue Cinema, along with loads of shops.As an all suites hotel, Staybridge has nice rooms, with a fully functional kitchen.  Free, hot breakfast buffet was included, as well as a free wine and beer session, each weeknight.  Good quality, cold, Becks beer on tap for the evening mixer, also free nibbles, just add to the value of a stay here.  The staff were very friendly and positive.  I was given a room with a view of the Olympic Park.The only negatives I found were small things, which made it slightly less than perfect.  The closet is small and because the in-room safe is set on too high a pedestal, inside the closet, Long items can't hang in the closet.  Also, I had trouble finding a power plug near the bed.  On one side, the cordless phone uses the plug, while on the other the clock is plugged in.  Eventually, I found anotehr plug...behind the bed heaboard!  It was in a very awkward position to use.  In the bathroom, the hand towel is on a railing below the sink.  It's too low and when I had to bend over to use the towel, it semed to be at the exact height to cause an uncomfortable feeling in my lower back.  The shower drained slowly, so I ended up standing in a puddle of water, at the end of each shower.  They give you a free, basic wifi, but offer a higher speed version, if you pay, as part of a package with Apple TV.  I stuck with the free version and found it mostly adequate, if ocassionally slow.  Ample shower gel is provided, but, personally, I prefer bar soap to shower gel.  They did give a small bar of soap for hand washing.  Finally, the hot brekfast food seemed below the quality level of the rest of the hotel.  Despite these small flaws, I enjoyed my stay.  The property is new and looks it.  It definitely worth it for me to stay there, saving over ¬£30 per night, for a better class of property.

2 night break deluxe king suite ,room very good nice and clean spacious ,wall clock didnt work and pillows wernt comfortable but those are minor niggles im sure they can sort out ,breakfast was adequate there was plenty of it but a little unexciting again im sure minor changes could easily wow instead of satisfy ,location of the hotel is superb seconds from the shops and restaraunts 25 mins on the tube and your in theatre land but its the staff here at staybridge make the place so good real smiles and a willingness to help they are great unlike the companys pricing policy but i enjoyed my stay so im not going to blame the hotel for the companys shortcommings !! ps when in stratford mall 2 places to avoid are the casino dark dingy and oppresive atmosphere ,and the cow pub was much the same if you want a good drink with chat and a friendly smile head for the micro brewery "tap east " situated near waitrose in the mall

column9: This place is better than you might think..
column10: We stayed here because we were going Christmas Shopping at Westfield.We did not need anything amazing, but at the same time wanted a bit of comfort & somewhere clean and neat and tidy.What we got was somewhere really quite special.Very very clean, really friendly staff, superb facilities in the room [kitchen that actually was a kitchen, etc.]There is a great view as they are quite high up & it really in first class.

I stayed at the Staybridge Suites London Stratford City for a recent business trip and would definitely stay here again when in the area. First of all, the hotel is new and is located in Europe's largest shopping mall. Even if you don't like shopping, you are not far from lots of great restaurants. The rooms are spacious and all have a little kitchenette with dishes, fridge, microwave, and even a dishwasher! The bed was reasonably comfortable and the bathroom spacious. Customer service at the hotel was great - the staff really made me feel welcome. There is coffee/ tea available 24 hours, they have Monday night movies with free popcorn in a room off the main lobby, they have Manager's receptions a few nights a week with free drinks and snacks, and the breakfast is great! I found this hotel really paid attention to details. My TV remote wouldn't work and they replaced it right away. The hairdryer in my room also had a detachable diffuser - if you have curly hair (like me), you would understand how excited I was to see this!When I booked the hotel, I was worried about the location as all of my meetings were in Central London. This was not a problem at all as the hotel is located right beside Stratford Tube and train station. The tube takes about 45-50 minutes to get to Central London but the best way is by Javelin train. This fast train (put in for the Olympics) gets you from Stratford to St Pancras King's Cross in 7 minutes! I bought a week long pass and could use this as much as I wanted. I was even able to go back to the hotel to change/ rest between meetings and dinner in Central London. It coundn't have been more convenient!! I had a mid-day international flight from Heathrow Airport and was able to make it to the airport in just under one hour via Javelin train, tube (5 stops), and Heathrow Express.

I stayed here for one night a month ago and was surprisingly impressed. When I booked a hotel in Stratford I was booking for ease of travel but wasnt expecting any kind of luxury or much service, however I was very wrong. I stayed on the 10th floor in a lovely suite built with comfort in mind. It had everything I could have asked for without the need to ask however if the need arose I knew I would be greeted with fantastic customer service.The staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. The breakfast catered for every requirement and was great.If I was staying for longer then I would definately stay here again. It appeared that the hotel was well organised and managed. All in all it was great value for money and close to all other amenities. Highly recommended.

I stayed two nights. Was recommended to me by a friend back home. Wow. Great prices for what you get. This is a upscale hotel near Olympic Park.  Clean and Modern.  Friendly staff. I had a great view from the 10th floor. Lots to do nearby. Good food and shopping. When I travel back to this area. I will be happy to stay here again.

Stayed one night in an apartment w a fantastic view over London on the 12 th floor. The apartment has everything you need and is very nicely furnished, bed a bit too hard for my back though. Breakfast was good and the apartment was very clean. If you take the elevator down you are in the middle of a huge shopping center, with shops, restaurants and entertainment. The trainstation is a short walk away.

When I first arrived to the hotel I thought to myself...the east end of London..no way!  Who goes to the east end for anything.  What a surprise.  The hotel was brand new..right across from Olympic Park.  The staff...unbelievable...absolutely incredible.  They went out of their way to make me feel right at home.   When I I had to travel for business they looked after my room to make sure everything was alright.  They greeted me with open arms when I came back.  This was better than anything I could expect.   So after 7 months has anything changed?  Absolutely not!!!!  The original owner John asks after me all the time.  Wayne the GM is always there when we need something.  Rafael always has his hand out to shake yours and asks if everything is OK...do we need anything, are we happy.  Tim, Nicolas, Hamad, Helen Sofie, Chris,  Deb, Mary, Mathias, Jason, Paul, Roy have made me a part of the family and look after me as one of their own. Some folks have left for new opportunities which is a bit sad because you become friends but the ambience, the attention to detail and prompt response when something needs to be fixed has and still remains fantastic. Anyone looking to travel to London needs to seriously consider this hotel.  You are in the middle of the Westfield Mall.  In 5 minutes you can be on the tube and into central London in 20 minutes.  You have the taxis if you need but the underground is still the most efficient way to travel.   This place is a real gem!!!  The staff make all the difference.

column9: Great hotel but far from everything
column10: I picked the stauybridge after reading great reviews on trip advisor. A a matter of fact the hotel, rooms, bathroom, service are all excellent. Only remark is that biggest bed is wuenn. Small for those - like me - used to american king beds. We were though very surprised by the fact the hotel is way outside the city of London. A taxi from heathrow costs 107 pounds...And - although the subway statuion is not far from the hotel - closest attractions are 20 min away. If you wanto to go downtown by subway count 45 min...When you come back after a day walking, you do not feel like going out for dinner...A pitty I had not noticed that fact on the reviews I read.

Stayed for 3 nights and wished it was longer! Great rooms, we had a one bedroom king suite with everything you could need it really is a home from home. The staff are very knowledgeable,helpful and really friendly. Breakfast is very good with a nice selection of foods. The pantry in reception is well stocked if you fancy a snack. It is on the Westfield shopping park and the tube drops you off right on the doorstep so to speak. We will definitely be back!

column9: Can be hard to find....but worth it.
column10: Staybridge Suites shares a building with the Holiday Inn alongside the Westfield mall. If you're coming by Tube like I did, it can be a little confusing to find, but once you get the hang of it it's very easy. Just remember there are three levels and the hotels are on the second! Out of the Tube station, up one level, then down the Street...and the hotel is right there.This is a lovely place to stay. The rooms is large (by European standards), very well equipped (right down to a dishwasher and full kitchen setup), and the cleanliness and maintenance are perfect. Check-in and breakfast are on the 12th floor, with suites below. Staff was always friendly and very helpful. There is a restaurant and bar shared with the Holiday, but much better places within and short walk.

Spent 8 nights here and I really liked it.  For a long stay it is excellent since they have a fully equiped kitchen in the rooms.  Really clean and efficient.  THe best thing is that the Westfield Mall is right next to the hotel which is open till late so any access to shops and restuarants is there which usually in London is great since things shut here quite quick.  Also with both the Picadilly and Central lines connect to Stratford it makes it really accessible to the rest of the city. Breakfast is great - simple but well stocked and fresh food.  Staff is great too.  The only downside was the room service which I thought could do with some improvement.

We stayed here for one night during London 2012 & I was almost disappointed to leave to go to the cycling ! I would have happily lingered in the breakfast room and looked out across the Olympic Park. Perfectly placed for Westfield Stratford & great transport links to all over London. Room was clean & service great.

Basically the place is ok, set in the shopping centre. We stayed one night because of the proximity to London City Airport via DLR. My main critique is the upgrade policy. As a Priority Club Platinum RA I booked a standard studio with points 2 months prior to our visit, based on the positive remarks at trip advisor. When I checked my booking online I saw that it had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite. At that time I was thinking of canceling my reservation because I read the Olympic Park was closed and I was not really out for shopping and other options were also possible for a reasonable price for instance the very decent Hilton Canary Wharf were I would have had guaranteed club access. In the end I opted for the staybridge suites, because I liked the idea of a big suite and a kitchen. When I arrived at the place rather tired out after traveling, the person at the reception said I had been upgraded and that was fine for me. When I got to my room at the end of a mile long corridor I noticed it was a pretty small studio. My girlfriend was happy to have a bed so I did not complain, because it was only for one night. However I still think that it is rather strange to modify the reservation and offer a decent suite and then when you arrive at the place you get some box. This has up till now never happened to me with IHG, I mostly stay in IC Hotels and had very positive experiences in the past. If I had known that I get no or a marginal upgrade I would have chosen another hotel, especially because the place was not as excellent as I had hoped. You could hear the wind outside, bathroom small and boxy no electric kettle, so I had to boil up water for tea in a pan... Honestly after my experience I would not come back and am currently thinking of canceling my upcoming reservation for Staybridge Suites Time Square, because the benefits of a suite hotel a quite marginal if you a put into a small studio...

Amazing experience. The service was at an amazing level. I felt really looked after throughout my stay. The staff are very friendly and smiley. Nothing seems too much trouble for these guys. Great breakfast buffet with plenty of choice so it's a good start for the day.The room was very clean and spacious and have all necessary amenities including your own kitchen.A real home away from home and so conveniently located - took me under 20 min to Central London. Westfield shopping centre is a big bonus as its right next to the hotelI can't wait for the next trip to London and staying again at this beautiful place.It's a must!!!

We stayed here a few nights in September 2012 (after the Olympics) and have no complaints whatsoever. Everything was top notch and we will return again in future. The apartments are centrally located; very close to the train and bus stations, shops and restaurants with beautiful views. The rooms are ultra modern, very neat and all the amenities you would expect even with Apple TV‚Äôs in the rooms. Breakfast had a wonderful selection of hot and cold options and then additionally, located at reception, a pantry stocked with everything from wines to ready meals for purchase. The reception team was friendly, helpful and went out of their way to send a pair of jeans all the way to South Africa free of charge when it didn‚Äôt arrive on time from dry cleaning for our flight home. The Hotel has an arrangement with a Taxi company with very good rates to the airport. Very impressive indeed!

Staybridge suites in Stratford is excellent:  it is clean, modern, and with very friendly and helpful staff.  What is on offer is much less spacious than, say, in Staybridge Suites in the US (just one chair in the corner of a bedroom, rather than a separate room for relaxing), but the kitchen facilities are good, as is the breakfast.A key feature of this is location: Stratford has first-rate travel facilities, and one is only a short walk from them.  The property is just by a large shopping mall, which has good supplies for catering for oneself (Marks and Spencer and Waitrose are both close and first rate); there is also a wide range of reasonably priced restaurants, and a cinema.A few small points.  The hotel offers low grade wifi; I paid for their enhanced service, but it was not all that reliable, and I'd recommend getting a backup 'dongle' (e.g. from Vodafone in the mall) if you need to be sure of some form of internet connection - although when the hotel service was working, it was better.  The hotel provides three free washing machines and driers - they are good, but not nearly enough: even when the hotel was fairly empty, it was a matter of real luck to get a machine when one was needed; beware, also, that they also have very long wash and dry cycles.  Third, the prices for outgoing phone calls are crazy - e.g. four pounds a minute to the US; six to Australia - if you wish to make calls, I'd strongly recommend purchase of a cheap phone and buying pay-as-you go minutes (there are, again, several phone companies in the mall; I personally ordered a cheap Vodafone from Amazon.co.uk to be delivered before I arrived).  Finally, found the room much too hot, and it took a while to get the heating switched off.All told, though, this is a first-rate place, and if I come back on business, it is somewhere that I will certainly return to.

I have been many times in London in recent years, but this was the first time at Staybridge Suites. The hotel is located next to the Olympic Park and in the largest Shopping Mall in Europe, Westfield Stratford.  I paid in advance, through the hotel's site, ¬£ 648 for a King bed studio for 7 nights from 26/12/2012 to 2/1/2013 ( I want to note that there aren't twin rooms ).  Although I asked a studio overlooking the Olympic Park, I finally had one overlooking the Mall. However the view was just as good and the most important was, because I am a light sleeper, did not bother me any noise from across Cazino.  The room was very clean, tidy with free wi-fi. There are two TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The kitchen is very convenient if you want to make or heat something     (it would be useful to exist instructions for the microwave, as there are for the dishwasher).  The breakfast was adequate, nothing special. I did not like that there were jam & honey jars that everyone got on the table and used his knife or spoon to eat through them.   The staff was very friendly, helpful and always with a smile.  The area is covered by 2 Tube lines (Central & Jubilee), overground, DLR, Southeastern high speed train which terminates in St. Pancras International station (which was very helpful when I arrived on 26/12 due to the Tube strike) and many bus lines ( 25 bus terminates in Oxford Circus).  Inside the Mall you can find many restaurants, we tasted "the Jamie's Italian" (Jamie's Oliver restaurant) and "the Real Greek" on the ground floor coming out from the hotel on the left. Also in the lower ground floor there are several fast food, better in my opinion "Olive oil & Oregano".  I felt like my home, I will definitely come back next time and I think small imperfections are not very important.

I have stayed here a couple of times on business. Rail transport to city centre is good. If travelling to the hotel by taxi make sure that the taxi driver knows where it is located as this caused a problem on my first visit.Staff friendly and suite rooms large and comfortable with excellent views. Good sized bed. Breakfast reasonable.

Have just returned from Staybridge and allready miss it.Everything was just superb...from the warmest welcome we have ever be given, moderen clean and spaceus suites, great location-just a short walk from underground (centar line), friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast and much more.As we celebrate our friends birthday suprise party, they complimentary upgrade their room and give a botlle of wine and HAND written birthday card..Speacless!!!!We are allready planning our next visit to Staybridge;)Staybridge staff just keep doing in that way!you make us feel home away from home!BRAVO!!!

Rooms are clean and well taken care of, very furnished including a full kitchen. Very close to the Stratford tube station and practically inside the shopping centre. Makes it very comfortable. Hotel staff are polite and cordial, more than willing to take the time to help you in whatever you need and offer advice. Short walk into Stratford centre and the tube makes it very easy to go anywhere else. Window also opened to allow changing of the air in the room.The Stratford stop is the first in Zone 3 of the London Public Transport system. Room temperature kept dropping to a lower setting thus becoming cold during the night. Breakfast although plentiful with a mix of hot and cold, is a bit bland and changes slightly day by day, so one day could be better or worse than the next. Breakfast hours finish early.

Traveled to London a dozen times both business and pleasure and this is the first time at the Staybridge in Stratford City.  Our family of four stayed in 2 adjoining rooms for 6 nights over New Years.  Most London hotels can be a bit cramped and the Staybridge offers modern conveniences, a superb location adjacent to the new Westfield shopping center with plenty of restaurants, and convenient Underground service to downtown London (20 min) or St Pancras Int'l train station (7 min).  The bathrooms are elegant and modern, beds comfortable with fantastic views of Olympic park (which I recommend the walking tour from Bromley by Bow tube station at 11a everyday, even though you wont be able to tour the stadium as it is under construction for permanent use). The breakfast buffet was excellent with lots of fresh fruit, pastries and hot entrees.  The manager's reception on Tue and Wed offers light snacks and refreshments.  After a long day touring London it is quite relaxing to unwind at the Staybridge and the restaurants in the mall are excellent (just forget that you're in a mall).  We ate at Wagamamas and L'Agunitas (great) and Pizza Deluxe (not recommended).  We used underground service everyday via the Oyster Card (unlimited travel, kids free) which also goes to/from Heathrow with one only one transfer (1 hour 20 min) and 20 min to Waterloo.  If you cab from Heathrow you will be charged well over 100 pounds. All of the employees at Staybridge were friendly.   I remember one gentleman Timothy who checked us in who was quite courteous.  Also, we were provided a to-go breakfast bag from the manager on our early departure from Heathrow.  Well done Staybridge and definitely will be back!!!

Stayed only for one night and my first time at a Staybridge Hotel. Great location, staff were super freindly and I'd go back anytime. Love the concept.Managers cocktail reception is a great idea (Tues-Thurs).Hotel is moden, clean and feels homely. I wish more hotels has such friendly staff.

We fancied a short shopping break at Westfield but didn't want to miss out on the excellent food and wine available at the numerous bars and restaurants at this great London mall. We decided we would book a hotel stay for 1 night, and chose the Staybridge Suites. Result! From the moment we checked in, we were greeted like royalty and made to feel like we were at home in our new surroundings.Everything was explained to us, and we were also told that we were invited to the Manager's Reception at 6.30pm that evening (every night Mon-Thurs) where we could chat to staff and fellow guests over complimentary food and wine ( & beer ).The rooms/suites were superb, and the bed was extremely comfortable! If you are staying for a longer period of time, this place is perfect! The rooms have a full Kitchen and as there is a Marks & Spencer and a Waitrose in Westfield, you won't be short of things to cook. However, Westfield is blessed with lots of great eateries and top notch restaurants too!The Managers Reception was delightful and the staff were very chatty and attentive. Thank you guys!Overall, this hotel is superb and I couldn't rate it high enough! Its a 5 from me!  :-)

column9: If you want perfection this is it!
column10: after a terrible start next door at the holiday inn,i was saved by Nicholas from the staybridge suites. What a true gentleman and very very good customer service skills. Both he and the other young lad sorry i cant remember his name but i know he was from york :). i was put in suite 1204 and had a beautiful view over the olympic park and london in the distance. A very very comfortable bed and a lovely kitchen,lounge area. If you are in the area this is definately the place to stay. Thanks again guys for making my new years eve something special!!

column9: Excellent place to be near mall, restaurants and Olympic park.
column10: Very nice hotel rooms are superb with everything you might need. Had a bedroom and lounge with kitchen. The kitchen is fully equipped with microwave, fridge and even a dishwasher. The room was a little smaller than some suites I've been in but the space is well used. I use a wheelchair and managed no problem. In fact it was better than a lot of hotels specially adapted rooms which is a bit ironic. Would definitely come back to this hotel.

A great hotel that definitely feels more like home than hotel. However, with some slight disappointments.Airport transfer:Stansted: Take Terravision at the airport, (booth 12), do book prior to departure to avoid getting caught in the long queues at the station. Book a later timing online, but no worries, you will be able to take the earlier ones if you arrive earlier. Cost of booking online is $6 pounds.Heathrow: It is really difficult getting from the hotel to Heathrow airport. Booked with National express but was greatly disappointed. Ultimately took a London cab to the airport, that cost us a total of $100 pounds. Rooms: Beautiful room with a full set of kitchen facilities including microwave, dishwasher and everything. Great Apple TV, and also wifi connection.Location: Staying at Stratford means that you will be able to get to pretty much everywhere just by taking the underground which is right next to the apartment. However, as it is based right next to the shopping mall, the nearest road is at the bus stop which is at least a 10 min walk to the hotel. May be a little of a challenge with luggages. Of course, the mall right next to the hotel is one of the biggest in London with Primark, Marks and Spencer and pretty much everything else. Shops open daily at 9am to 6pm from Mon - Sat. This means you can pretty much shop every day when you wake up!Disappointments: However, maybe it was the holiday seasons that the fact that they are shorthanded. The breakfast was a little sloppy with poor selection.Also, the dishes were not properly cleaned and lastly, the housekeeping that was arranged did not happen as well. All in all, a good stay with a great location.

This hotel was near perfect. Very nice staff, clean rooms, very little noise. Close to the shopping centre and perfect for shopping. You also have a great variety of restaurants on your doorstep. The only letdown was the breakfast for me. I have celiac disease and I'm used to having to ask for gluten free bread. Most hotels cater for this, I have to wait a bit longer, but that's ok. However, be aware that Staybrigde suites does not offer gluten free breakfast. The solution for me was that I had to buy my own bread and toast it in the rooms. So, if anyone working at the hotel reads this: Buy a gluten free frozen toast bread. When someone asks for gluten free bread, take a few slices, put them on a clean bakingtray and warm them for a few minutes in the oven. And voila, you can now offer your guests a gluten free alternative!

column9: Very enjoyable stay, with great staff
column10: My stay was over the Christmas/boxing day period with my boys. Check in was warm and welcoming, I loved Chloe?? (the dark haired girl with the Northern accent)  And Rafael was equally attentive and warm and tried very hard to accommodate me and my requests. Rooms were very nice and not as small as I thought it would be (i had a 1bed suite) with everything you could needBreakfast was good with lots of choice, and loved the concept of helping your self to cartons of juice as if you have a large party you could simply take a carton to your table for all to share, only downside was it ends at 9.30, I think 10am would be a better option, but you can take the food up to your room should you wish.My major gripe with hotels is noise, I can say that I did not hear a peep not even from other guests during my stay, however I was placed on the Olympic side.So why the 4 and not 5 stars? My stay was not without its glitches, albeit minor however I addressed this upon checkout and they seemed to genuinely take my concerns/constructive criticism on board.I would recommend this hotel to all visiting London if you don't mind being a little out of the center and not looking for the 5* experience. You get such a good deal for what you pay and it really does feel homely

column9: Our home away from home for one wonderful week!
column10: Planning to travel to London for Christmas and New Year's with our two "Tweens" (ages 14 and 11), my husband and I were concerned about booking a 'regular' city hotel room for such a long period of time (many of the hotels we looked for did not even have rooms to sleep four people), and we really did not want to spend $500/600 dollars/night for two rooms. My husband found the Staybridge Suites on line. It was newly built for the Olympics (summer 2012). Not only is everything pristine, the showers great, fully appointed kitchen, rooms spacious and a full and tasty breakfast included every day (and with as pricey as everything is in London, you will certainly appreciate that treat!), we were able to get two adjoining rooms for less than it would have cost us for one closer into the city! The staff is so helpful and friendly too. Most especially, if you go there look for Timothy ...he goes over and above, and gave us wonderful advice on many matters (transportation, things to do)! On Christmas, when everything is closed, he invited us to watch movies , popped popcorn , made nachos and served wine and beer to celebrate! (Chloe, another staffer, was also kind and helpful). My kids were sad to bid farewell to Timothy when he left for his days off before we left!The one negative of the Staybridge is that it is relatively far compared to other hotels. It was about a 20-40 minute tube (subway) ride once you got to the station (the central line station is a short 5 minute walk from the hotel). It is attached to a huge mall that has tons of stores and food options though. For perspective, some of the tour companies pick up at various hotels, but this one is far outside that range.All in all though, we felt the many fabulous things about this hotel (Timothy and the great service, the beautiful and spacious rooms, and the free breakfast) greatly outweighed the negative of the distance which we got used to. Highly recommend for families with older children-we would go back for sure!

My wife, son and I stayed here for 10 days around Christmas, and our experience was outstanding.  The hotel provides excellent value for money, and we stayed in a nice two-room suite with views over the Olympic park and toward the Docklands and City (see accompanying photo).  Although technically located in East London, the hotel is extremely accessible to many parts of London via a short ride on the Tube, Overground, DLR, Bus and/or Javelin, plus it is part of the Westfield Stratford City complex, supposedly the largest retail centre in Europe, which provides an endless choice of shops and restaurants during one's stay.What really sets this place apart from countless other places we've stayed is the staff, who went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable, comfortable and worry-free as possible.  They never complained about any request and never tried to point out somehow that they were going out of their way or taking extra steps.  They just did everything possible for us as though it was the most natural thing in the world for them.  Special mention goes to Timothy, Sofie and Chloe at the front desk, and Debbie in the breakfast lounge.The one negative of the hotel is that it is not very convenient to arrive at and depart from with luggage.  It doesn't have a driveway like most hotels, and so when you first arrive it's necessary to get dropped off in the Westfield car park (underneath the Casino) or on the road next to the "Chestnut Plaza" restaurant area and then go find someone at the hotel to help transport your luggage to the hotel.  Indeed, we departed the hotel on Boxing Day, and there was such a huge cue of cars coming into Westfield for the sales that it wasn't even possible for a mini cab to drive to the Chestnut Plaza area.  And so Timothy (again without the slightest complaint) moved our luggage through the "Street" area of Westfield and over a footbridge to the Stratford Tube and Bus station in pouring rain so that we could meet our mini cab there.  All told, these difficulties with luggage end up being a very minor inconvenience compared to all of the positives of the hotel.Very highly recommended!

Me and my husband decided to go away for the weekend to get some shopping done in westfields Stratford so stay bridge seemed perfectly situated. I have been to many luxurious hotels as well as apartments so I had very high expectations for my stay; I was far from dissapointed I LOVED MY STAY! The staff were the extremelly kind and considerate especially (Timothy) who was a great help. The room was spacious with great views and amazing shower. I would 100% recommend staying at stay bridge because their quality of service is second to none.

column9: Great hotel in the middle of shopping district.
column10: Close to the Stratford City Tube Stop, close to Westfield mall (largest mall in Europe), incredible 360 degree view. Great customer service. Clean, comfortable room, Manager's Reception time in the evening, hot breakfast, concierge service. Wife and I snuck away from Arizona to enjoy London during Christmas time. Even with bitterly cold weather and wind and rain, the hotel was more than ample for us.I would encourage anyone to use this hotel on a trip to London.

If you want to 'shop 'til you drop' this is the hotel for you!  It is a short walk from the railway/tube station, followed by a quick ascension, in a fast lift, to the 12th floor, where charming and helpful receptionist are waiting to assist you.  We were checked in by Sophie, and later met Timothy (when I requested a room change)  Nothing was too much trouble for either of them.  The rooms are excellent, with everything one could need - I would like a slightly softer mattress (or perhaps a 'topper' on the mattress) also a choice of softer pillows,but that is all a personal preference.  Microwave, hob, dishwasher, fridge and sink, which is handy if one wants to stay in and cater for oneself.The breakfast was a 'help yourself to everything' and was more than adequate.  Hot and cold choices, with good juices, fresh fruits and a small selection of hot food.  Unfortunately we missed the evening nibbles with wine or beer on the Tuesday night (too busy shopping)If you need to stay in this part of London I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

column9: How convenient can a hotel be.....
column10: If your doing serious shopping at the mall this has to be the ultimate convenience , it's right there in the middle of the mall, good rooms, well equipped,  good services like free coffee machines  in the social room  and a great breakfast, my kind of style good but not heavy. The rooms are very comfortable and have Apple TV so you can also watch what you might which at home, also microwave, dishwasher, fridge, etc etc really well equipped and laid out. Strangely you don't seem to be able to from the car park to the hotel with out going outside, it's literally 50 feet, but these days it seems odd to have to carry bags outside from the underground car park and back inside . Shoppers would be surprised if they had to park and go outside to get to a mall that right above their heads. There is no end to the choice of places to eat and at every level from quick and cheap to expensive and formal, the quality  of all food outlets is very good and of course there is the shopping. Very recommend , rates are not the lowest, you pay for the convenience I suppose

I stayed here with my mom for one night in November. It's a ways out from all of the main London attractions but it's easy to get to using public transit so it wasn't an issue getting there. It's also right on the Westfield Stratford shopping area which was very nice because it was easy to find places to eat and things to do in the evening. The room was clean and if we would have been staying longer the kitchenette would have come in very handy. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast had a good variety. The only issue that we had was our phone not working which made it difficult to call the front desk but it was a short walk from our room so it wasn't that big of an issue.

Imagine this, I've only just discovered the jewel in the crown of IHG.  How can this be? I even lived in the USA without finding the joy that is Suite living.The hotel reception (and lounge & dining areas) are all on the 12th floor.  This is like a penthouse experience.  The views of the city are incredible.You take your first sip of coffee as the cold winter sunbeams crack through the wispy clouds, silhouetting the iconic cityscape with an eerie shimmer. All of this stays with you... Well until your next bagel anyway.The location is ideal for the Westfield mall.  Superdry, David & Goliath and Jack Wills are all on hand, especially if you have a fashion conscious 11 year old daughter, like me...I've definitely found my first choice brand, with exceptional value too, as I just used Priority Points! I knew there was a good reason to switch from HHH.  Well done!

Accidentally, I stumbled across the "jewel in the crown" of the Holiday Inn brand.  This not-so-secret residence is my future  choice for any possible alternative to the regular hotel fodder that you find on the usual internet travel sites.  Why haven't I been aware of this particular brand before?  I even lived in the US for two years without rumbling the delights and practicality of "Suite" living.OK, so you get my point, not well known, but just in a class of its own.  The Westfield Shopping 'mall' is incredible too, built as part the regeneration of the East of London as a legacy of the 2012 Olympics, so take empty suitcases so you can shop till you drop.  Superdry JPN, David & Goliath and Jack Wills were targets for my daughter, so you won't be disappointed if you follow fashion.Back to the hotel, sorry Suites, the reception (and lounge & dining areas) are on the 12th floor (on top of the world) and what a view of the city! Imagine this as you digest your complimentary breakfast, a panoramic vista; dramatic winter sunbeams cracking through the atmospheric cloud base, silhouetting the towering iconic Cityscape in a moment that will stay with you, at least until you finish your bagel...!  Incredible, seriously.To top off the stay, it cost me just Priority points.  Another reason that reminds me why I switched from HHH, without regret.

fantastic view, fantastic facilites, friendly and helpful staff, everything you could want from a hotel really, and a great location as well..cannot recommend this hotel enough, great job staybridge, we look forward to staying with you again.a special mention to the general manager wayne who went out of his way to ensure our stay was 'perfect'

Stayed for one night , excellent service the rooms whre clean and very attentive staff the breakfast in the morning although was busy  but te staff coped well with the rush , could have done with some water in the room all in all very good Hotel

column9: Wowee what a view & what a great hotel manager!
column10: My partner booked Friday and Saturday night as a Birthday present for me and we couldn't of asked for anything more, it was superb!Beautifully spottless room with an AMAZING view! Breakfast was great, especially the croissants! Really well situated for Christmas shopping in the Stratford Centre and literally 2 mins from the tube station. Parked for both nights for ¬£10.00 in the centre carpark which was a bargain.We would like to thank the staff, they were all very friendly and helpful. I have stayed in a lot of 4 star hotels but never met such a wonderfall manager. Wayne was LOVELY and so very charming! We will definitely be returning!

excellent throughout from start to finishin the middle of westfields shopping centre make sure you have lots of money also try the casino while you are there you dont have to be a member . check in was good esp chris on front desk he made you fill so @ home and very friendly ,breakfast was superb with lots of variety ,staff was so helpful a big shout out to DEBS who is excellent nothink to much for her to help you .and her sausages are the best by far ha ha she makes you fill like your her family excellent service from her .be going back in  new year for a longer stay overall all staff excellent

Third stay here in two months and an additional stay in the liverpool branch. Stayed in a standard room this time as I gave my upgrade (kudos for givin one out) to a staff member, but the room was still fine. Manager reception continues to impress in terms if offering and staff continue to be very good, that said Tim continues to be the star, coming in on the morning shift he remembered me after a couple of months and even thanked for my last positive review - seriously this guy is a gem and his morning banter is easy going, very genuine and welcome.Well done staybridge you remain my first choice and even the colleagues I've recommended you to have even impressed.

It was clearly not worth four stars. The breakfast was poor. Cold eggs, bacon etc. Coffeemachines ware most of the time not working. There were jam jars that everybody used and take them to there tables. They used the knife were they were eating with. That is not so hygenic. There was no cheese or ham, so we brought that our selves.  We didn't think that is was so clean in the hotel, it was not bad, but not spotless. We had only towles for 1 person and we were with 2 persons. How difficult can it be. There was also a stain on the sheets, probable blood. Toiletpaper was also a problem. We always stay in four star hotels and this was a big difference. I am sorry, but three stars is more than enough.When we wanted to check out the man from the reception was on the pone and wanted to help us while he was still on the phone. That is very rude. The hotel was well situated and we had a wonderfull view.

column9: Fabulous weekend break at the Staybridge
column10: My husband and I spent one night at the Staybridge in Stratford, and it was fabulous.Great reception service, first class accomodation in a great location, situated in Westfields shopping Centre.  My only complaint is breakfast was expensive at ¬£12.00 per head and not very exciting.The room we stayed in was superb, couldn't fault anything, great facilities and spotlessly clean,

The service was wonderful. Timothy was awesome and really makes you feel at home. He was giving advice and making talks that help lighten up the mood. Being a relatively new hotel, this place is clean and spacious. Love the rooms. Just beside the shopping centers where you can shop and dine. Real convenient. Tube is a 5 min walk that takes you to town easily in 15 to 20 mins. The hotel did airport transfer to gatwick for 55 pounds and it was really reliable considering we got it at 6am in the morning. We can't thank everyone enough including parry.

column9: Super-friendly Staff, Great Room, Excellent Breakfast
column10: Very impressed with my stay here - the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, the room very quiet and clean, with a great kitchenette, and the complimentary breakfast (all you can eat, and you can even take it back to your room!) was brilliant. Would stay here again.

Usually stay at the Holiday Inn when in London but decided to give the suites a try.  Apart from not being able to find the hotel initially we were very pleasantly surprised once we arrived.  We were lucky enough to overlook the Olympic Park which is a great first view on entering the room.  Spacious, bright and spotless.  The only minor niggle was not being able to alter the heating as each time we thought we had cracked it it automatically went back up to the original temperature - not a huge problem as we just opened the windows!Breakfast was good - we do not have a problem with serving ourselves and had no problem finding a seat or helping ourselves to a good substantial meal.  The waiting staff are a little quick to tidy the table when we have not finished but the experience overall was good.The concierge was helpful in looking after our case as we checked out before our train was due to leave.  Only used the kettle and fridge in the room but the utensils, crockery and glassware were abundant and again spotlessly clean.Would we stay again?  Definitely!

The apartments are easily accessible from car park B, right next to the escalators and opposite Hugo Boss. Staybridge is in the same building as the Holiday Inn, but has separate elevators.Check-in was fine and I was upgraded to a King one-bed suite.
