The suite was a surprisingly generous size for London and was furnished to a high standard in-line with other Staybridge apartments.However, these had the edge on other Staybridge apartments in Liverpool and Newcastle due to the bathroom size (generous) and having windows that can be opened! Room rates were reasonable and I can see that this would be a comfortable choice for extended stays.

After a short walk from Stratford tube station I had limited time in the hotel, but from check-in to check-out it was a great experience. I was upgraded and greeted as a platinum member. The suite was spacious although the lighting could have been better; both from a brightness and control perspective. I was in the gym at 6am and as the sun rose I had a great view of Canary Wharf & was directly opposite the Olympic Park. After showering I took a quick breakfast, which was self serve, but there was a good choice and felt like very personal, ie like being at home. The staff were very helpful and chatty.

Last minute, Theater visit - stopped in the Holiday Inn  last time , thought we would give the Suites a try. Excellent - great facilities , did not use the cooker , microwave or toaster, did use the dish washer for all the cups and glasses.Breakfast - excellent the best choice we have ever hadHighly recommended, we will use again when in London.Free parking in the Westfield Centre was a bonus.

Holliday in double booked me, so put me in staybridge. It was a very pleasant suprise.Very very clean, everything is exactly as you would expect in a top hotel, but for about ¬£120 per night.Very impressed!Also you can park securely in the Westfield centre, car park B, for ¬£5 per night.

Great stay. Will stay here next time we go to London location was great too. Couldn't beat it for the price either. Breakfast was very good and the shopping centre made waiting for rush hour to be over not so bad. Staff were always very helpful no matter what time you were about. Always said "hi" and smiled. All round great hotel, stay and experience.

Having stayed at Staybridge in Newcastle, I was excited about trying out the London equivalent. And I wasn't disappointed. Fantastic location in the heart of Westfield, a five minute walk to the Underground and a great view of the Olympic Arena (very inspiring when you're on the treadmill in the gym :).Lovely staff, great breakfasts (where do they get their muffins?), free papers, wonderful rooms with apple TVs. And exceptional value for money. When are you going to open more of these in the UK?? And I don't even do their PR!!!

Stayed for a weekend, breakfast was a bit chaotic but dont let that put you off! Staff and rooms were excellent and the location is superb, 2mins walk to the train, tube &bus station, and in the middle of the westfield shopping centre, but because the hotel is so many floors up in the building theres no outside noise at all!

We had stayed at a regular suite on the 19th floor. The room was modern styled decorated,  spacious and luminous (big floor to ceiling windows). It is all still very fresh and new.. The bathroom was big, providing good quality amenities together with huge towels. Breakfast area is where you have the most fabulous view.. right on top of the Olympic arena. Beautiful. Breakfast itself was nice, offering good selection of hot food together with a verity of cereals. fruits and pastries. Staff members were extremely helpful and kind. Special Thank you note to Robby (who had just been moved to the Holiday Inn, and came to assist us), who did not let go and made sure we are literally inside our Taxi... truly exceptional service experience.  The hotel is located inside the Westfield mall, and right next to a very big central underground / train station. It took us around 10-20 minutes to get to any of London's attractions by the Underground. We had a great stay and will definitely be back.

We stayed here as a celebration for my boyfriends birthday. From the start the property was wonderful, great location, with a warm and friendly welcome. On arrival to the room we were very impressed and the fully equipped kitchen enabled me to cook a full three course dinner!Rooms are spacious, very new and some with great views of the Olympic Park and beyond.The best thing about this hotel is the atmosphere: very relaxed, welcoming and feeling like home (although I wish my home was as nice :)) going to breakfast you can either eat in the Den (like someone's living room its so comfy) or take your breakfast and tray back to your room. We chose the former because it was so nice and the views amazing. Overall a great stay, perfect location, and very warm staff.

A wonderful friendly place right in the heart of Westfield, with the shop and Stratford station right on their doorstep..  A home from home experience. The staff are all extremely friendly and helpful.  Fantastic value for money. Thoroughly enjoy my stay.  Thanks to all

column9: Excellent Rooms - Great Value for Money
column10: The location with views of the olympic park and the shopping mall and 4 monites from the station make this very good as a base. It not in the centre of town and a tube or DLR n Tube ride required about 30 minutes away. Excellent modern rooms with 1st rate facilities.You can use the holiday Inn resteraunt that is adjacent, but these are suites and a shop and cooking facilites all included in the hotel.Breakfast a bit of a rugby scrum if you go at peak times. I would recommend for families or leisure trips, for business the facilities are good but a distance out and when you only in the room or 7 hours.

There are loads of poor quality reviews on this site sadly, and I am sure many others would have been in the same predicament I have been in the past having trusted the review. However, I have to admit that this is the first time I have reviewed a hotel in London. Having lived here in London previously, I know how dodgy some hotels can be if you compromise on the price of rooms. However, the Staybridge Suites is unbelievably incredible when it comes to value for money. The hotel is amazing, extremely clean and hygienic, excellent customer service, quiet and practical yet so close to amenities. I have been truly impressed with this hotel and if ever in London, this will definitely be the place to stay. If I could I would put this hotel as the top 10 in London!

column9: Couples and Families will enjoy it
column10: One of the best rooms I've been in London. Clean, welcoming, and really a place I would like to bring my wife and kids to. Having Westfield center and Stratford station nearby makes it very convinient.

We stayed for 5N.  The hotel has a long stay rate and offered us a good rate ~ 130+ per night inclusive of breakfast for the family. I don't think we could have gotten a better rate elsewhere.Minuses:- Location wise, a bit far out of central London, all the way to the east end.- No housekeeping service after 6pm (we checked in about 8pm and asked for our kettle to be changed and was told we had to wait till the next morning).-  'Chalky water' - Only one staff attending to reception, check-in & out.Pluses:- conveniently located next to Westfields, the new shopping mall, you can find almost everything here. - the Stratford station is a short walk away.- room was clean, modern decor and sufficient space for our family of 2a+2c.- equipped with kitchenette and dishwash machine.- laundry available (common facility on the 12th floor).- 24hrs coffee, tea, juice & milk available in the lounge.- free wi-fi. - card key security.As what some others have mentioned, we also encountered problem with the card key disabled on the check out date. So, if you leave the room for breakfast, the card key will not work when you return to the room to pick up your luggage. I understand the hotel is aware of this issue and working to rectify the software.Breakfast was not fantastic, the cooked food section is limited.If you have a Holiday Inn Priority Card, do bring it along.

I stayed two nights in this hotel and I must say that I loved everything about it. It is right in the middle of the Westfield Stratford City shopping centre and only 15mins tube ride away to central London. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. I will definitely be returning.

had a long weekend staying at staybridge sutes, great location for 02 and london city, will be even better when olympic park opens in july 2013. the room was spotlessly clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfast excellent.public transport links ace found using the jubilee line to central london less busy  (westminster is only 20 minutes) buy a travelcard tube in and take the river shuttle (half price with card) back to 02 (decent eataries) and tube back to stratford.

Has a small gym good to exercise at night also has the Olympic view right next to Westfield shopping centre. Staff are nice but the thing that lets it down is the breakfast, it's not that nice to be honest.

column9: excellent for London City, O2 and shopping
column10: stayed here for 2 nights from 9th - 11th November.  Upgraded to one bedroom suite due to hubby's priority card, which was a nice surprise. all staff we encoutered were very pleasant and polite.  On arrival in our room, we found the kettle was missing.  a call to reception and one was delivered within 5 minutes.very spacious suite.  spotlessly clean with very comfy bed.breakfast was very good with plenty of choices and although busy, not too chaotic.  Nice bright lounge areas.  One downside here is that it would be nice to be able to buy a good coffee in this area.  you could do as we did and bring one back from a cafe across the plaza.we went to Pizza Express and the cinema in the Westfield complex first evening.  Nice just to walk out of hotel and go around the corner for this.Saturday - easy access to Stratford Station and a short journey into the city on the Central Line.  Lord Mayor's Show in the morning, West End show in the afternoon.  By the time we got back to Stratford, we decided to get some food from M@S at Westfield and cook this in the kitchenette of our room, with a bottle of wine.  Excellent facilities in kitchenette, complete with dishwasher, so if you are feeling lazy, you dont even have to wash up!Sunday morning - hubby made use of the gym, while I took advantage of free newspaper and leisurely breakfast.  After breakfast, we did a trip on the DLR to Greenwich.  A walk around the Cutty Sark and the Naval College in the sunshine, nice lunch and then river boat to the O2.  Back on the Jubilee line to Stratford for a bit of retail therapy before driving home.  And only ¬£10 for the car park from Friday to Sunday!!  Would therefore recommend Staybridge Suites for a weekend break.  Ideal location for so many activities and very good for couples or families.The only downside we experienced was the noise from the shopping complex between 04:00 and 06:00 on the Sunday morning, which woke us on 3 occaisions.  On talking to the Reception staff, who were very apologetic, it appears the Westfield shopping centre test their alarm and warning systems without due regard to hotel guests.  The Receptionist stated they had complained previously to Westfield about this.  We would definitely not let this put us off staying at Staybridge Suites again, but would recommend requesting a room overlooking the Olympic park, as you would not be likely to hear it there.

Checked in without issue, however had to change the first room as the safe did not work and the bedroom tv had no signal. Unfortunately maintenence were not available to the next morning.The kitchen/lounge and bedroom were good although compared to Park Plaza suites they are smaller.For some reason the lounge tv has access to apple tv whereas the bedroom tv does not.

column9: Perfection, great for O2 and then they spoiled it.
column10: Spent the weekend at this hotel as we were going to see Muse at the O2 (15 mins door to door on Jubilee line). We drove to the hotel.  Followed signs for Westfield.  Parked in Car Park B and then literally 30 second walk to hotel.  As you walk in the hotel, use the lifts on the right hand side (left are for HI).  Reception is on 12th floor. Everything was fantastic.  The hotel is spotless with huge bed, kitchen in suites, Apple TV, wonderful bathroom etc.  Staff are incredibly helpful although very laid back.  Location - right in the middle of Westfield Stratford, overlooking the Olympic park.  5 minute walk to Stratford station which has you in Central London in 20 mins. Paid ¬£100 per night which was good value for London.  Would have rated it 5 stars but for breakfast on the second morning.  I had to move pots myself to find a table (the table next to us wasnt cleaned for 30 mins) and it took them 20 mins to bring me some pepper (had to ask as couldnt find any).  When I raised these issues with reception, they advised me that they were short staffed.  This is bad enough on a Sunday morning.  However, in the lifts there is a notice that advises guests weekend 'brekkie' is busy after 930.  If the hotel know breakfast is busy then why not put staff on?  Gave us a bad ending to the weekend.

Stayed on Saturday night. Great location and easy short walk to tube station. Reception located on 12 th floor where the dining room is. I stayed on the 11 th floor with view over the Olympic park. Choose even numbered rooms higher than 20. Small clean kitchette and lounge with separate bedroom. TVs in both rooms. You can take your breakfast down to your bedroom just remember to take the tray from your room (the one with your mugs on it). Great value and comfortable night.

Have also stayed at the Holiday Inn attached to the Staybridge a couple of weeks ago. Both hotels are great. The location is superb - only 20 mins into Central London on the Underground. Both hotels offer great value for money. The Staybridge rooms are bigger as they have their own kitchen, perfect for those longer stays.  TV's in both the bedroom and the lounge and the room I stayed in had excellent over the Olympic stadium. Staff were friendly and eager to help (similar to Holiday Inn next door).  Plenty of restaurants and bars in the shopping centre just outside the front door. Perfect stay.

We spent 3 nights at the Staybridge Suites and everything was definitely perfect. The hotel is ideally located just a few steps from Stratford tube station on the Central Line. On arrival we received a very warm welcome and, as it was our anniversary, we were free upgraded and found a bottle of wine with a lovely message from the staff in our room. The room was clean and beautifully appointed with a fully equipped kitchenette and a spacious bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable. The rate included a lot of benefits like daily buffet breakfast, wifi connection, tea corner all day long... The staff was outstanding. A home away from home. We will come back. Thank you very much for making our stay memorable!

column9: Awesome place. If only it were closer to London
column10: Last minute, we had to find a place to stay when hurricane Sandy cancelled our return flight to NY. Two big bags, didn't want to take the underground from heathrow so we took a cab. Hotels.com advised me this would cost about $60. With the meter running and me watching the GPS on my phone, it cost $200. Ouch. But staybridge guaranteed me half that to return to the airport Entrance is actually in the mall complex so you don't drive up to the entrance.  Great welcome, awesome suite, I wanna take the bed and pillows and comforter home with me. Breakfast was certainly adequate considering we are in England ( plenty of food, nothing very good, but we ARE in England)First experience with a Staybridge and I have to say that it just might be the best hotel experience I've had. Will definitely come back to other Staybridges if this is a good example of themDr Phillip Raclyn

I have stayed in a Staybridge in the USA before and I know this chain is very good. This hotel in Stratford is not different. Very friendly and professional staff, spacious rooms and a good breakfast is served. The view from my room on the 11th floor was great. The tv in the rooms have many channels from many countries. However bear in mind that the breakfast room can get very crowded (especially on weekend mornings after 9.00) so consider taking items to your room. Also bear in mind that rooms are not serviced during weekends unless you request it 24 hours in advance. Altough the hotel is not in central London the location is perfect. Stratford station is a real public transport hub.

Stayed here from Friday to Sunday. The location of the hotel was brilliant, right next to westfield shopping centre which includes lots of restaurants too (literally about 30 steps...i think other customers may have been using the wrong door from the shopping centre to get here) and right by the tube (which you get to from shopping centre). When we checked in the staff were really pleasant, friendly and efficient. We were told there was no automatic turn down service on the weekend however they would do this for no extra charge if we asked for it (we didn't ask for this). I saw staff doing rooms during our stay so this clearly wasnt an issue if people required it. The room was fantastic. It was clean and nicely laid out. There was a little kitchen as you walk in the door (it didn't feel as though it was actually in your bedroom) which although we didn't cook while there was handy for the fridge and tap for drinking water. The bed was really comfortable and the tv (apple tv) was great. I always like cereal for breakfast and was really happy with the cereal choice here (they even had coco pops!). My partner likes to have a cooked breakfast when we go away and really liked the bacon and hash browns on the Saturday morning of our stay and said it was one of the best cooked breakfasts he'd ever had. The only negative thing to say about the hotel is that unfortunately on the Sunday the only cooked breakfast choice was sausage scrambled egg and beans (which he doesn't like). I guess they change the hot breakfast items each day. Thinking there was no harm in asking, there was a staff member in the area so he asked her if there was any chance of hash browns or bacon and she snapped "that is all you are getting today". Just seemed a little unnecessary. I had never stayed at a staybridge suite hotel before and feel like I have been missing out. It's a lovely atmosphere and the staff can't do enough for you (with the small exception at breakfast). I would definitely stay at this hotel again and try others of the same brand.

Stayed for two nights at midterm break, 2 adults and 2 children - wanted to see Olympic village.  Accommodation is good - comfortable, clean and spacious apartments.  Had a few problems ‚Äì we had checked in and unpacked and then realised that there was no bed for the children ‚Äì sofa, not sofa bed. Had to pack and move.  Also, very noisy outside.  Work starts at 7 o'clock in the morning! Advise to get confirmation of rate before arrival - as we were charged a higher rate than agreed.  We did eventually speak to manager and get a refund.  Watch out for the VAT as not quoted in price.  Expensive for location and what you get.

Stayed here while working in Ilford, excellent location in the Westfield shopping centre and Olympic park, next to the main Stratford station with overland and tube links to the city of London.  First niggle is its not exactly easy to find, after leaving the station and approaching the shopping mall you can see the Holiday Inn sign but there are not further signs once you are inside the complex, I ended up having to ask at the information desk to be told I had to go upstairs then back out of the complex and round to the right past Mini shop and entrance was on the left.  Once in the entrance its all to easy to take the lift to the 6th floor reception to find you are in the Holiday Inn, the lifts to the right of the entrance lobby take you to the 12th floor Staybridge reception!  Check in was very efficient, upgrade to suite with bath and shower overlooking the shopping mall and casino, small living room with kitchen, fridge, dishwasher and microwave all very clean.  Bedroom separate from living area with comfortable double bed. Bathroom had large bath with rain forest type shower over it and bottles of shampoo and body wash, towels were lovely and fluffy.  Second niggle is the rooms that overlook the shopping mall can be quite noisy, there is only basic double glazing on these windows and music from the mall and casino goes on until around midnight, these windows should be triple glazed, not sure how quiet it was on the other side of the hotel but I assume the room overlooking the Olympic park would be a lot quieter.  The shopping complex has over 250 shops and an excellent M&S if you want to pick up a few things to eat in but it also has a vast array of restaurants and coffee shops.Arrived for breakfast around 7am, very quiet with plenty seating.  Breakfast spread was very good, hot selection of omelettes, scrabbled eggs, beans, sausage.  Pastry selection with croissants, muffins, bagels, loads of cereals fresh orange juice and a proper coffee machine grinding the beans as required.  Selection was not restricted to small packets either but full sized cereal boxes and large bottles of fresh orange juice.  Fantastic views over the Olympic park from the breakfast room.Check out was again efficient and everything in order.  I would have no hesitation in staying here again, staff were pleasant and room was exceptionally laid out and clean, but I would request a room on the Olympic park side to avoid the noise from the mall.

column9: Good value. Modern. Spacious. Comfortable. Excellent!
column10: Two of us stayed here in October 2012 for a week, in two separate rooms.  I was acknowledged as a Priority Club Platinum member on check-in and was given a complimentary upgrade to a one-bedroom suite on the 12th Floor.  My companion had the standard studio suite as booked.The hotel is situated a little distance away from Central London, adjacent to what was the main venue for the 2012 Olympics at Stratford.  I did not consider this non-central location to be in any way detrimental; it is close to the main Stratford transport interchange and is served by very frequent services on the Underground, Overground, Docklands and National Rail services.  It takes only about 7 minutes from Liverpool Street station, and is connected directly to the West End by Underground.  It is also close to the alternate Stratford International station which is served by High Speed services from St. Pancras (again, about 7 minutes) and various towns in Kent.  Visitors arriving by Eurostar can change at Ebbsfleet or Ashford, or can, of course re-trace their steps from St. Pancras.The hotel's entrance is directly on part of the huge Westfield shopping centre, which offers a very comprehensive range of retail and dining choices.  So, unless one has other reasons to do so, it's quite unnecessary to travel into London ‚Äúproper‚Äù for, say, an evening meal.  I suspect that value is probably better here, too.  As I travelled by train, I can't comment on options for parking at or near the hotel.The hotel shares its building and mall entrance with a more conventional Holiday Inn.  Different lifts serve the two hotels, each of which has its own separate reception.  The Staybridge occupies the higher floors, with its reception area unusually on the top (12th) floor.  As well as some rooms and suites, this floor also has the breakfast room, lounge, an external balcony and is the venue for the evening reception (of which more later).The Staybridge appears to fall somewhere in between the concept of a conventional hotel, and that of serviced apartments.  That's not a criticism;  because of its suite style, the rooms are far more spacious than is typical for hotels in much of the UK and in London particularly.  Yet the important aspects of a more standard hotel are also present. The one-bedroom suite I used was superb with plenty of space in all three areas ‚Äì the lounge/kitchen with its own TV and sofa, coffee table, desk etc., the bedroom with another TV, and the full sized en-suite bathroom.  The studio suite used by my companion was smaller of course, but still of sufficient size to prevent the feelings of claustrophobia often experienced elsewhere.  The studio room's ensuite has a walk-in shower, but no bath.There are no teams of smartly-dressed bellhops hovering around, but reception is manned 24 hours a day.  Rooms are equipped with fully functioning kitchen areas with kettle, microwave, hob, dishwasher, fridge, toaster, extractor fan and more than enough cutlery, crockery and utensils to make an extended stay here (as a home from home) quite practical.  There is also a guest laundry for (complimentary) use by guests. and a small gym with a small selection of modern equipment in good order, again free for guests' use.  There is no swimming pool.The rooms themselves have other useful offerings; the TV system, as well as the standard set of digital TV stations, offers an in-house streamed TV system (Apple TV) with movies and other extras ‚Äì these are a chargeable service.  There is complimentary WiFi throughout.  As an option, guests can subscribe to a faster WiFi service, and doing so also includes the aforementioned enhanced TV provision.  Iron and board, hairdryer, tea and coffee ingredients and a safe were all present and correct, as were supplies of toiletries and towels etc., in the bathroomThe room was spotless and modern, but without appearing austere.  The hotel is fairly new so that is probably to be expected.  Normal hotel-style housekeeping is done daily except on Sundays when this service is only on request (at no extra charge).  The 5ft bed was very, very comfortable, and soundproofing appeared to be excellent.  I had seven very comfortable and undisturbed nights' sleep.  Air conditioning was effective and virtually silent.As is practice with Staybridge properties, there is a complimentary breakfast available daily and I have to say, I was quite pleasantly surprised at what was on offer.  Alongside a reasonable selection of breads and pastries were fresh fruit, dairy products, cereals and a good assortment of hot and cold drinks. And there were at least four hot items - scrambled egg or omelettes, baked beans or tomatoes, bacon or sausages, and hash browns available in various combinations daily.  If I had to criticise, then, as is often the case with hot buffets, the hot food wasn't always as hot as I would have liked.  As a complimentary service though, I thought this compared very well to some very over-priced alternatives in other establishments I have used recently, and the saving over eating in a paid hotel restaurant or, indeed, outside, can have quite a substantial impact on total costs of the stay, especially for a couple or larger group.For one hour only in the early evening, on three days per week (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) they hold a ‚Äúreception‚Äù in the same room.  This is free to guests; on offer are various snacks and alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.  It's a nice opportunity to meet other guests, or simply to have a free beer or two!  A nice touch.At other times, the same area has tea and coffee facilities and ingredients, and a fridge with soft drinks, fruit juices and milk, and guests may help themselves to anything they want.  Guests who have other needs, varying from washing powder to microwave dinners, ice-cream, sweets and so on, may purchase these from an area by reception.  All in all, this is an excellent enhanced level of service and provision. Reception staff, the breakfast staff, and the management team who greeted us at the evening reception, were all exceptionally friendly and hospitable.  At an average cost for the overall stay of GBP120 per night (weekends are cheaper than weekdays)(advance non-cancel rate, including VAT) I thought this hotel, for London, was exceptional value, particularly when one considers what is included (or ‚Äúfree‚Äù).  I think there are many other chains who need to take note.In summary ‚Äì for its area, it's an unusually spacious yet very good value place to stay, just outside of, yet very convenient for, London.  In particular, the extra ‚Äúfree‚Äù services offered to guests can have a big impact on total trip expenditure.  The property is in very good order and is very very comfortable.  It would serve equally well, I think, for a short stay or as a place to live for a longer period.  I'd stay here again in a heartbeat and have no hesitation in recommending it.  Good job, Staybridge!

We stayed at this hotel from 10/12-10/20 (8 nights).  I booked and prepayed the stay looking for value, and liking the tripadvisor reviews.  The room was clean and larger than many other London hotels.  Housekeeping did not come on many days.  I believe they came about 4/8 days, and not the last two.  The towels dried quickly enough, but there were not extras.  The bed was made when housekeeping came, but sheets not changed in the 8 days.  To me, the overall housekeeping was substandard.I thought the breakfast was fine; my wife did not like the quality of the food; her feeling was the same as another recent reviewer.  However, there was yogurt, a variety of juices and milk, eggs (even I agree they weren't great), some form of meat, a variety of cereals and rolls.  I avoided the hot foods.  However, unless you are somewhat demanding, I thought that the breakfast was not bad.  The staff was quite friendly, but not really a concierge service.  They were not generally very familiar with restaurants in the area, but they certainly tried to be helpful.  We felt very safe.  I paid about 1200 pound/$1800 for advance payment for the 8 nights in Stratford.  I thought it was a fair value, but quite a good value if the housekeeping had been better.  I did not think Stratford was that far out of downtown London.  About 25 mins/8-12 subway stops, which was fine to me.  The shopping area was huge, but coming from the US, we weren't actually doing a lot of shopping.Overall, this was a fine stay.  We would probably stay there again.  Even for the value, I could not call this one of the top hotels/deals in London.

I recently stayed at Staybridge Stratford, yes the staff are very courteous, the quality of the accommodation is high considering the price, however I feel the hotel is a little confused, it's not a full service hotel, or a serviced apartment, and I feel they are trying to be the best of both but both poorly. Breakfast was a disgrace, quite obvious that it had been prepared by Holiday Inn downstairs and delivered to staybridge at 0630, It's not hot not even warm, the eggs were awful, bacon tasted just of pure salt, and hash browns no taste at all, the cold options (excluding the cooked cold breakfast!!) were fortunately of a good standard. The room itself had a small kitchen area, no oven except a microwave, and only 2 rings. Okay this was fine for a 2 night stay, but definitely not for long term use, impossible to cook anything except fried foods or microwave meals really, no washing machine in the room but a laundry room is on site if you don‚Äôt mind washing your laundry in public!! The Holiday Inn is a far more suitable option for those seeking comforts and services, but guests who are looking to heat up the odd microwave meal in their room, that are willing to suffer the breakfast options, and are looking for a no frills budget accommodation Staybridge works fine.

If it's shops you're after, you could hardly do better than this - it's right at the heart of the Westfield in Stratford, which is evidently the biggest shopping center in Europe.  It's also reasonably convenient for central London - 20 minutes by tube from Westminster, though I think it's a bit more than the 200 yards from Stratford station that they claim in their publicity.  And when you get to the Westfield, it's easy to miss it first time as the only signs at ground level are transparent images on a glass frontage.Inside, it's bright and new, though you have to go up to level 12 for reception and then back down again for your accommodations.  The kitchen was well equipped and the furnishings comfortable, with a bath tub that's actually big enough to stretch out in.  The whole place is built around the marketing concept that this is your 'home' for your stay, and that is reflected in the way breakfast is made available - a little chaotic the way the different tables with food are laid out, and with staff more obsessed with clearing up than doing much in the way of help or service (I left my table momentarily to get a coffee and by the time I returned all the rest of my food had been cleared away, which meant I had to start again).  Overall the staff (reception especially) are pleasantly friendly, though the nightly manager's reception was an embarrassing experience - it's billed as free drinks etc to unwind and get to know the other guests, most of whom (predictably) aren't really interested in this sort of artificial conversation and are only there for the drinks (which were fine).Overall then, good accommodations, but I'm not sure that the 'homely' ethos really works in any different a way than a regular hotel.

column9: New hotel, great city edge location and shopping galore !
column10: The Staybridge Suites is an outpost of a well known American brand.  The concept is all American too, with big rooms with a kitchenette and no hotel restaurant or bar but food and drink to buy at reception.  Therefore it‚Äôs not the place for a posh dinner, but for a great room at a great price and whatever you choose to eat, it‚Äôs a really good deal.  Room service food IS available 24/7 though.I should mention that the hotel is about 50 yards from the food court at Stratford City - Westfield, so you have great food from all around the Globe right on your doorstep.  Why should they bother with a restaurant in the hotel ?!Being next to Westfield is a big plus and the hotel is less than 100 yards walk from Stratford station which has so many connections into London I couldn't list them. Suffice it to say that it is three stops and 10 minutes into Liverpool Street in the City so it‚Äôs very convenient.Add to that a towering location with views over the Olympic Park, Canary Wharf and most of London, then the location is pretty amazing.  All rooms are on the 10th floor or higher.The rates are very reasonable when there is no big event on, and quite often this hotel appears as one of those "no name" hotels on Lastminute and Expedia.Every hotel should provide as a minimum a great shower, a great bed and a great breakfast. The plumbing here is of the rain forest deluge variety, the beds are brand new and comfy and the buffet breakfast is always part of the deal and is set in a lovely room with sweeping views over London. Nuff said.Try it while it‚Äôs still new and shiny !!

If you are visiting London and want a great hotel close to the city, close to shopping center, with great staff, large rooms and excellent value for money then this is the hotel to stay at. As you will find prices for any reasonable hotel accomodation in London are outrageous and finding this hotel was finding a gem. They even have a laundry room which is free (bring your own soap or buy tablets for 1 pound) and some nights in the week the hotel manager invites for free cocktails.

column9: Smart and clean with charming staff - definitely recommended.
column10: Smart and clean with charming staff, the Staybridge Suites are an excellent place to stay when in London. Originally I was looking for somewhere closer to the centre of London, but with prices still inflated after the Olympics, Staybridge proved to be excellent value. We had asked for a room with a view, and they didn't disappoint, our room looked directly over the Olympic stadium and swimming arena.Coming from Stanstead airport we got directly to the hotel via a train from the airport, and three stops on the central line from Liverpool Street Station. A couple of minutes walk and we were there.  The close proximity of the tube meant we could be in central London in half an hour, so despite not being in the centre we found it most convenient.Our room was well appointed with a small kitchen and a most comfortable bed. Everything was very clean and well looked after. The kitchen was ideal for our purposes, the only thing really missing was a place to sit and eat.The free wifi is a bit slow and you have to pay extra for fast access, but it was ok.We found the buffet style breakfast to be nice, with a wide variety of cereals, breads, fruit and some hot selections too.I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

I stayed here for a one night mini-break for leisure. I believe the hotel is almost brand new and the entire place was immaculate. I enjoyed the reception on the 12th floor and the lobby area up there as well. The balcony was another nice touch with views of the Olympic stadium.The included buffet-style breakfast was very nice with a good selection. The room was very modern with a small kitchen which came in handy when I needed to re-heat my lunch that I had bought from the Westfield mall downstairs. I particularly enjoyed the apple TV. The room was spotless, ultra-modern, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The highlight I must say was the welcome at reception. The staff member was very welcome and genuine and I have never received such a warm welcome from any other hotel. He also remembered my name at check-out which was a nice touch. Location-wise this hotel is smack bang in the middle of Westfield shopping centre which was very convenient as we visited the casino there during out stay, which is directly opposite the hotel.This is a fantastic hotel and I hope I get the chance to stay here again!

column9: Choose this hotel you can't go wrong + fab views = bonus!
column10: First impressions; smart, state of the art hotel on the outer edge of the fabulous Westfield shopping centre, sandwiched between top end retail stores Liberty and Mulberry.  Friendly and efficient staff on reception.We were going to the o2 to watch a Cirque du Soleil performance, so convenient only a 200 yard walk to the tube station then a couple of stops on the Jubilee line takes you straight there (get off at North Greenwich tube station which is right at the o2).  I have never stayed in an aparthotel before so we decided to try out the kitchen facilities and eat in, there's Waitrose and M&S nearby to buy some nice food and wine.  There are of course plenty of eateries in the shopping centre and there's also a room service menu at the Staybridge.  The microwave was perfectly adequate though you might struggle if you need to warm up a big pizza as you don't get a conventional oven.  Also we were missing a kettle - so had to boil up mugs of water in the microwave for a cup of tea.  I enquired the next day when I checked out - apparently some rooms had their kettles removed for descaling and clearly not replaced!  Everything is modern and new with most things provided; tea/coffee/milk/sugar/salt, dishwasher tablet, washing up liquid, paper kitchen towels (though no tea towel to dry any washing up).   Also tissues, body wash, shampoo, conditioner is provided in the bathroom.  There's a good sized safe to stow a laptop.The best bit - the view and watching the glorious sunset!   We had a panoramic view of the London skyline including the o2, Danary Wharf, Gerkin, Shard, post office tower with the Olympic Stadium in the foreground.  We were in room 1102 which we were warned was under the gym but there was absolutely no noise. It was a room for the disabled so there was a wetroom shower rather than a bath (not sure if this is standard throughout).  The Suites are from floors 8 to 12 so the views are all great.  I think Holiday Inn take the lower floors and views over the other side towards the shopping centre.Excellent sleep quality, 2 pillows each as standard and very comfortable mattress.The breakfast exceeded expectations, I thought it would be a simple continental breakfast but there was a hot counter with sausage, hash browns, scrambled egg and tomato as well as the usual cereal, toast and croissants plus a huge fridge filled with cartons of fruit juices and milk.  Check in is from 3pm and check out at 12 noon.  We stayed on a Saturday night and just wished the Westfield shops opened earlier than 12 noon on the Sunday as we didn't have time to hang around, but great if you want a lie-in and don't need to rush off anywhere!  I'm tempted to book in again just to do my Christmas shopping! Choose this hotel you can't go wrong.  I predict it will soon be no.1 for London Hotels on Trip Advisor.

Hotels in the centre of London are getting greedy and it's increasingly difficult to find rooms that are within budget.So a couple of weeks ago, I cast my net out further and stayed here.This was probably the shortest time I've spent at any hotel, as I arrived late in the evening and had to depart soon after breakfast.I did struggle to find the hotel, not helped by my late arrival, the fact it was already dark, the shopping centre closing and the lack of signage to it.  The nearby Premier Inn seems to have taken all the signage space for itself.  With the clear light of day the next morning, it was clear that it wasn't too tricky to find when you could see your way. It is marked on the key to this map.http://uk.westfield.com/stratfordcity/images/pdf/wsc-mall-guide-oct09-12-lo-res.pdfI did try to call for directions, but the phone wasn't answered. Later, when I did check in, the reception phone started to ring again and the lady who was looking after me even told me that she wasn't going to answer it.  I chose not to tell her that that would have been me 30 minutes ago!I've stayed a few times at the excellent Staybridge Suites in Newcastle-upon-Tyne.  The suites here in London are similar, but about one-third smaller.  I did get a Platinum member upgrade which gave me a bath as well as a shower.  I've always found the lighting systems in these suites confusing.  Having mastered the one in Newcastle, I didn't do as well here.The bed was comfortable, though I didn't sleep as well as expected, as the Westfield Shopping Centre doesn't seem to "sleep".  Throughout the night, I could hear the sounds of maintenance taking place and deliveries.  Next time, I would probably ask for a room overlooking the former Olympic Park.As it was late, I decided to select some things from the hotel's larder.  I was disappointed to find just one single item of frozen food in the cabinet, namely a twin-pack pizza.  All the other items were just snacks.  So that had to do.  I'm used to a much better stocked pantry in Newcastle.Breakfast as OK, though I was very disappointed to find the baked beans to be stone cold.  And the breakfast service had only started 15 minutes earlier.Check-out was fine and the young gentlemen very personable.I've decided to rate this hotel as "average".  If there was a 3.5 "good" rating, I would have scored it so.  But some of the shortcomings I've mentioned, when compared to the much better experience at the Staybridge Suites in Newcastle, mean I can't rate it a "very good".

column9: LOVED It, a good experience & I'll definitely be back
column10: Was in London for a couple of days and due to short notice and the amount of rooms I needed (7) I was struggling to find anywhere nearer the centre. Decided to bite the bullet and try the Staybridge having stayed in them in the States and Newcastle Upon Tyne in the past. It is a good tube ride away from the centre of London but literally only 40 mins and very straightforward. There is a bit of a lengthy walk once outside the tube, you have to walk up and across the the Westfield shopping centre and the hotel is situated at the far end. It shares the building with the Holiday Inn but you have your own lift and separate reception on the 8th floor.Check in was fairly simple, our rooms weren't ready as we were early but we left our luggage and headed into London again for the afternoon. Once we got back and got our keys we were all on the 7th floor. The King Suites were lovely a proper self contained apartment, kitchen with fridge and cooking facilities, large lounge with bed settee, and a large bedroom and bathroom. I had no view except of the roof of the shopping centre and most disappointing was the fact the windows wouldn't open at all, I hate hotels who do this as I like fresh air. The lounge and bedroom both had efficient air con but not suitable to sleep with it on. There's no bar in the Staybridge but they do occasionally put a managers evening on which includes free wine, beer and nibbles. There is a balcony with seats but don't think you'll be allowed to go out here and smoke !...........you have to descend the 8 floors in the lift and stand outside the entrance, not sure why.Breakfast is adequate all self service with a fair choice although the coffee machines are sooooo slow it takes an age and the queues can get very long. They absolutely adhere to the timings for brekki so if your 5 mins late forget it as everything is promptly cleared away bang on 10am.I'd definitely stay again, but would be better prepared and probably sort my own breakfast out and take my own drink for the apartment.

This was my second visit to the Staybridge in Stratford since it opened; my 1st visit was a bit disappointing when comparing with other Staybridge locations I‚Äôve stayed at. However, I have to give credit where it‚Äôs due, the place is a great place to stay now, it seems to have sorted out some of the initial teething problems. The place is comfortable, convenient, clean, quiet and the staff are very attentive. Well done I hope the place goes from strength to strength.

This is the latest arrival to the IHG stable of brands to reach UK shores, and its been well worth the wait.Firsty the location... Want to shop? Its within just a few metres of the Westfield shopping centre in Stratford. Here on  business in the East End? Youre at the east end... going to Canary Wharf? So's the DLR train at Stratford station. Doing the London tourist thing? Well its just a short walk through the Westfield centre to the excellently connected Stratford station, providing overground, Dockland railway and the Central line. As with all megacities, whatever you're close to you're close to, but thats never much in comparison to what the city has to offer, so using the tube is an essential skill for any tourist tp London. Hence while you can pay big money to be next to parliament, or Convent gardens, or one of the many museums, or Lords, or Harrods, or Hyde Park, or... well you get the picture, you wont be aywhere near the rest. So why not stay here for less than half the price and use the tube to get to all you want to see?And what do you get for you much cheaper price? Well a huge amount actually. Your room is a suite, with a small fully equipped kitchen featuring a 2 ring hob, dishwasher, fridge, combi oven/microwave, kettle, toaster and all utensils. There's a large workdesk, sofa and a TV with the Apple box. The separate bedroom has a king bed and the ensuite a full size bath. The whole place is new and scrupulously clean. There are connecting rooms for larger families.The rate includes a complimentary breakfast which does mean its a little limited on hot and fruit choices, but this is still much better than a holiday inn express complimentary breakfast, and they're most satisfactory. The view from the breakfast room is wonderful, and for those wishing to challenge their vertigo theres a large outdoor balcony to enjoy.Staff are really friendly and a special mention  to Timothy who I can see is becoming a real legend on this thread. Yes, Tim, I will be back. Both for business and with the family. I am pretty certain that this is likely to become my new base for both business and pleasure in London. The value and connections make it undeniable...

Booked this as a "top secret hotel" deal and felt like we'd hit the jackpot! Staff were friendly and efficient. The suite itself had the most amazing views - Olympic Stadium, Canary Wharf and O2. There was pretty much everything needed in the suite for a very pleasant couple of days stay. One of the best things about the hotel is how well sound proofed it was - no being woken in the morning by doors slamming - bliss!The shopping centre nearby is great for food as well and trips into the centre of London by tube only seemed to take 15 / 20 mins.Minor niggles - 1) Nightmare to get to using satnav due to new roads. Glad we printed directions out as well. 2) No bath in our suite which was a shame....but a very nice shower3) Despite having a "do not disturb" sign on the door, housekeeping still knocked came into our room at 8:30am ...... a pity as we'd arrived late and were hoping for a good lie in!Would we go back?     Like a shot!

We stayed here for 9 nights during our visit to London.We flew into London City airport and commuted into London and area daily. The location could not have been better!This is a new and very clean hotel. Being part of the Westfield shopping centre, there were lots of meal options including catering your own meals.The staff were by and large great and very helpful.I would easily be able to recommend this hotel to anyone.One small annoyance would be breakfast service. The staff just could not keep up with the guests. There was always something finished, or cuttlery needed, or plates needed, or the coffee machines needing service. There just was not enough staff for service. By and large the food was great with one exception being the omlet (needs work). This would not put me off staying here again but I hope the service would have improved before my return.

I recently stayed in this hotel for two nights and really enjoyed my stay. I went to concerts in the O2 and found the hotel to be in an excellent location - just 2 min from the tube station on the Jubilee line, all the London attractions within easy reach on the tube from this hotel. The hotel is situated in the heart of the biggest shopping centre in Europe so it would be just ideal for people visiting London for shopping. It is also right by the Olympic stadium, so it has a lot to offer. The views of the London skyline are wonderful, the rooms are clean and spacious. They are completely self sustained with everything you would need for a very long stay. You are close to the supermarkets as well so you could cook everything in the rooms, it is ideal for people staying in London for work. The breakfast is good and the view from the breakfast room is lovely. The gym is small but with good equipment. There is also laundry room that can be used. Overall, I really enjoyed the hotel and apart from the brilliant location the room was really comfortable and quiet.

My husband and I loved this hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful, the breakfast was varied & good, and we could walk to shopping destinations at night (we're not really the bar crowd, so it was perfect). We rented a car just for a day & the staff arranged every detail.

As a priority club platinum member I am a very regular visitor to IHG hotels, most frequently the holiday inns and crowne plazas around London. Boy do these guys need to up their act based on the staybridge suites Stratford.For a very reasonable rate I got a lovely room and the friendliest welcome I have has in as long as I can remember, thank you Timothy and for your restaurant recommendation - spot on! Your trip advisor fame continues!Having never stayed at this brand before I found it clean contemporary and friendly. Only 7 mins on the javelin from st pancreas its a doddle to get to. The managers reception was very pleasant and Lynn, very welcoming - do get back to me re. Those corporate rates Lynn, Jonathan Clark.A top night for a business stay and my new local in London. Well done!

Our trip to London was the result of an unfortunate death in the family. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were met by the warmest, most accomodating staff who made us feel so welcome. Our rooms were perfect in every way... home away from  home. Free Wi-Fi, kitchen, really, really nice bathrooms, and plasma TV's. The free buffet breakfast was above average. The hotel is right in the middle of Westfield Mall and across the road is the old Stratford Shopping Mall where you can find grocery stores, sweet shop stands, a drug store, and a variety of vendors to meet your every need. The tube station and bus depot is located right downstairs. You are smack-dab in the middle of everything, and it's all at your feet from atop the Staybridge Suites. We can't say enough positive things about this hotel or the staff. It's our new favorite when in London.

Having stayed at the Holiday Inn on the lower levels of the same building and in rooms situated opposite the noisy casino, I booked a room in the Staybridge in the higher floors. I asked for a room on the opposite side and they obliged. It was a world apart! Great Room, Great Staff (Managers Reception 6:30 - 7:30 T/W/T with drinks) and good breakfasts. My only concern is that giving this a great review might lead to booking uplift and me having to stay elsewhere! Need to sign off now to book for next week.

Stayed for a weekend. what can i say arrived after long journey at 12.30. check in was 3 however our room was ready for us. room was excellent, roomy, clean and good views.Loved the idea of having a kitchen everything u needed for a weekend stay.The hotel was situated in the shopping centre which had plenty of shops, supermarkets and restaurant.Breakfast was perfect in the morning so much choice even though we arrived just before half ten. Hotel offers constant tea and coffee in the lounge which we took full advantage of.Security really good could only access lift with your room card. whole hotel very quiet.Would like to complement the excellent reception staff Rafal and Timothy. The friendiest, polite, smiling and helpful staff i have encountered they could not do enough for us.Would love to have the chance to visit again and would recommend to others.

column9: Wonderful place I love to stay at...but miles from town
column10: Love:- Rooms - recently built, stylish, comfortable beds.- Staff - young, personable, educated, interesting - perfect.- Staybridge offering - only inclusive breakfast I actually like, larder, free wi-fi..etc- The HUGE shopping centre that surrounds this place - restaurants, shops (jncluding very high end - i.e. Prada, cinema etc all on your front step - for business people you can come home, do the London shopping for the family and eat all within 200m of the front door.- Transport links - so many optionsCould do better:- The Olympics are OVER! If you are a tourist this is a long way outside central London (30 minutes by tube). That said, if the cost and quality overcomes the daily trip...than who am I to argue 'cause that is why I stay there.Context - I am a IC Hotel Platinum member who stays over 125 nights a year in their hotels. I therefore are often upgraded. This is pretty much the best of their entire chain (value for money wise)

We stayed at the Staybridge for 2 nights on weekend trip to London.The staff are very friendly and the rooms are very well presented with all the amenities you could need for a weekend away... including a fully fitted out kitchen with a dishwasher. We had a great view of the Olympic park from our room and with easy access to the Westfield shopping centre and Stratford tube / rail station (5 mins slow walk from hotel entrance to the station) this means you never have to walk too far for anything.The breakfast provided was very good quality, fresh and tasted lovely.If you go on a weekend you will need to tell them to clean your room as they leave the cleaning on the weekend, so if you want a nicely made bed on your stay you should let them know this on arrival.Overall we had a lovely stay, our room was bright and in very good condition, helpful friendly staff and a delicious breakfast to top it off.

Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Suite was fantastic, clean, comfortable bed, serviced every day.  Buffet breakfast was excellent and generous.  The location to Westfield Shopping Centre and Stratford Station was very convenient.  I can recommend this Hotel and will definitely stay there myself again,

This was our first stay at a Staybridge Suite and my first trip to London as well.  First of all, I was impressesd by the location of the hotel. Upon arriving via the tube at the Stratford station, it was barely a 5 minutes walk through the modern shopping plaza of Westfield city with tonnes branded outlets, fastfood chains and restaurants. I knew it would be very convenient even before arriving at the reception.The reception itself was located at the highest level of the building which was unlike any typical hotel lobby. There was a homely feel to it with plenty of tables and comfortable chairs. From the lobby it was all about the breathtaking view of the Olympic stadium. 	The staff who greeted us was friendly enough. We did arrive around 1.30pm which was earlier than the 3pm check in time. We also requested for a room with the Olympic stadium view during our advance purchace via the official hotel website. Understandably, the room was not yet ready since we arrived early. 	We were told to get ourselves comfortable at the lobby and pantry with complimentary bevarages from the coffee machine. Our only regret was that we waited until past 3pm and we were told our room was still not ready. It was unfortunate to get an explanation that it would take a bit more time to try and get the room with the particular view requested. I almost felt that the fault was mine for putting in such request. After reinstating that the request was made more than a month in advance we were given 'another' room on a different floor with the olympic stadium view. It definitely wasn't a pleasant check in process.	Once we (finally) gotten into our room, a king size bed studio suite, everything was available just as mentioned in the previous reviews. The kitchen was a stand out with all its kitchenette and even an automated dishwasher. The apple tv was a good inclusion as well with its huge selection of international channels except the surprisimg lack of English sport channels. Those Barclays Premier League football fans may be slightly disappointed. Then we noticed the fridge wasn't working. The frontdesk was notified. There wasn't any other room of our type available. Subsequently, we were very grateful that they decided to upgrade us to a one bedroom suite.	Our four nights at the Staybridge has been a pleasant experience. With all the facilities available (even has a free laundry room complete with washing machine and dryer), I would say it has also been a good value overall. Special mention to a staff name Timothy who has been very helpful and friendly.

Me and my partner went to the stay bridge for his 25th birthday. we went on a saturday til the sunday. And I must say it was soo fantastic, the staff are soo friendly and welcoming and the rooms are 5 star. we was on the 12th floor and from our room we had fantastic views of the olympic stadium and canary whalf. its just litteraly 30 seconds from stratford station, we drove and park in the car park for only ¬£5 for 24 hours. The shopping is great soo many stores to choose from. The best part of the trip was the night life theres a big casino and a very nice bar with music for all. I must say the rooms are sooo cosy and romantic its sooo worth the money, i will be going back again in the new year!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The breakfast is includid in your rate and there was a very wide selection its was fresh and warm. we got our breakfast and brought it back to our room for breakfast in bed lol....had a greaaat time.

Stayed here recently for a weekend trip to London with my wife. Hotel is 2-3 mins from  the doorstep of Stratford station (Jubilee, Central and Overground). Central London is only 20 mins away on the tube (you'll need a Zone 1-3 travelcard). It is located within the brand new Westfield shopping centre which is huge and has loads of shops and restaurants. Hotel sits on the top five floors of the Holiday Inn Stratford and if you get a room on the even side, you have great views of the Olympic Park (although it is now closed until next July). Rooms are an okay size but very well decorated. You have a full kitchen with everything you need - microwave, fridge, toaster, oven, hob and even a dishwasher. Flat screen TV with AppleTV connected. Bathrooms don't have a bath but the rainfall shower is excellent. There is a complimentary breakfast served on the 12th floor each morning and as well all the usual continental breakfast items, they also serve hot items like sausage, egg, bacon, hash browns etc. There is also complimentary tea/coffee served here at any time. Although the internet is complimentary throughout the hotel, it is very low speed (256kbs) and is really only useful for web browsing. You can purchase high speed internet for ¬£7 per 24 hrs which runs from the Apple TV in your room and gives you speeds of approx 8Mbs. This would be my only complaint about the hotel. I was there Ryder Cup weekend (bad timing, I know) so purchased the internet on the Friday afternoon and expected to have to renew it again for the Saturday evening, but it was still connected and was only charged ¬£7 for the whole weekend. Not sure if this was an error or maybe you get it for the 2 days at weekends but I wasn't complaining. I also had a problem when checking out as someone else rather cheekily purchased a bottle of wine and put it onto our room, but the extremely pleasant american guy at reception immediately removed it with no hassles when I queried this with him. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting London. Any staff that we encountered were very helpful and friendly and the location is excellent (if you don't mind 20 mins on the tube into London). For reference, I had a bit of trouble finding the hotel on first arrival as it is not signposted, so here are some easy directions if you do plan to visit there.When exiting Stratford station, you will see some escalators/stairs in front of you, go up these to the ground floor (station is on lower ground). You will see M&S on your left. Stay outside the shopping centre and walk round the corner to your right and then walk up towards the Nike and Liberty stores. When you get past Liberty go round the corner to your left and the entrance to the Holiday Inn and Staybridge Suites is on your left. Take one of the two lifts on the right hand side of the small lobby and go up to the 12th floor.

column9: Make sure you get the even numbered rooms!!
column10: Stayed here for the weekend ... Weekend rates which are very good for a London hotel. This place is in the centre of Stratford City Westfield Shopping Mall... So perfect for shopping. This area whilst in East London is also great for the West End via 25 bus or Central Line tube. Hotel is partnered with a Holiday Inn. Very new and clean with full kitchen suites...The upmarket Waitrose supermarket is few steps away and although breakfast is thrown in .. it is what I call "plastic" ... And so was avoided.So far so good then? You'd think so until you get given an odd numbered room whichever floor. These not only look out onto the rooftop air con units ... See pic.. But also face the very large outside (smoking) area of the Casino opposite. Being a light sleeper the noise subsides at 4am. To be fair on checking out, the receptionist did say when I was asked if everything was OK that they do recognise the noise problem and views of these rooms. The even numbered rooms do not have this problem and also have wonderful views over London! So how to get one I asked?  "Ring ahead and get reception to lock down a room for you". So there you have it ... Be warned.

stayed this weekens as a romantic trip away for me and my boyfriend's first anniversary, the hotel was absolutley beautiful the room actually did make you feel like you were at home, seperate living area with a kitchenette and a seperate with bedroom/bathroom in, very clean and luxurious with great views of the olympic parkBreakfast included everything you could imagine, very yummy although sometimes a little crowded maybe needed more staff to help clear tables off, the hotel will also keep your bags for as long as you want as we wernt travelling back to the afternoon they give you a ticket with a number to proove which is your baggageHOWEVER when i booked the hotel i paid upfront and when we arrived at the hotel they wanted a debit/credit card incase any charges incurred whilst at your stay, me and partner eat out and therefore when we checked out on the sunday morning there were no extra charges, as expected.UNFORTUNATLEY when i returned home the hotel had held an extra ¬£100 i rang my bank to confirm it was staybridge suites, i rung the hotel and they informed me they hold ¬£50 per night from your card in case there were any charges at the hotel, they did not inform me of this when using my card and it is a good job i have money in my bank, i now have to wait 3-5 days for the money to be releasedother than that great stay, great staff!!

Well thought out hotel with the reception and breakfast room on 12th floor with great views and a balcony.  All staff were more than helpful and the customer service was friendly and personal.The rooms are very clean, great shower and comfortable bed.  Rooms have a kitchen equipt just right with enought to cook a quick easy meal with a dishwasher, hob, microwave etc.  The food sold in reception is expensive, but there is a Waitrose around the corner selling almost anything.  Breakfast selection is superb, however the scrambled egg was powdered, but then again it would be difficult to stop it from drying out on a hotplate.  Transport is great and 24 hours in the car park was only ¬£5.I would definately stay again, as I had booked two rooms for family and everyone agreed that it was the best stay in London.

We stayed here for four nights on a short London break. It's initially not easy to find - certainly not as easy as the directions on the website suggest. Best to go into the shopping mall, get yourself a map and find it on there. It's only a couple of minutes from Stratford station, once you know where you are going. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast has received mixed reviews, and I can understand that the basic buffet system won't be to everyone's liking, but it was fine for us. The only negative was that the tables were sometimes cleared away rather hastily - one day we went to get some hot breakfast, and returned to our table to find our remaining half glasses of fruit juice had been removed - I heard other guests having similar problems. Great to have the tables cleared efficiently, but only once the guests have actually finished please! Plenty of restaurants around, either adjacent to the main entrance, or in the shopping mall. Room was quiet and comfortable, transport links excellent. We'd happily return.

column9: Briges the gap between a hotel and self-catering
column10: I stayed here for 12 nights while working at the Paralympics. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout. I had a studio room - bedroom, bathroom and kitchen - with a great view of the Olympic Park. One of the real plus factors is that the hotel is very new so everything feels clean and fresh.While there is no room service or restaurant there are numerous restaurants in the Westfield centre and crockery and cutlery is provided in the kitchen if you wanted a snack in your room, or even to cook a meal. There is a supermarket in Westfield. On the 12th floor of the hotel is a fantastic patio/balcony with views over London and the Olympic Park, along with a lounge and a den with board games provided if needed.The hotel does serve breakfast in the lounge daily but this was the one drawback. The choice of a cooked breakfast was limited and I gave up on the scrambled eggs after day one as they tasted like powdered eggs. The croissants were also good some days and dry on others. And the coffee - from a machine - was awful. Practicaly undrinkable.I paid a premium rate during the Games but if you want a cheaper option to stay in London - but with bigger and more luxurious rooms than you would get for that price in central london - this is great. And the transport links into St.Pancras or on the underground are fantastic.

column9: Stay bridge is nice but a little far afield
column10: Very nice hotel with great staff. Wish it was closer to central london-takes a good 25 minutes on the tube.Beds are not comfy-kind of like sleeping on a box of rocks-but otherwise the stay was nice, good price and very. Clean safe hotel.

The recently opened Staybridge Suites are a real gem, both for the business-traveller as for families. Their hospitality is much more than can be expected. To the point, outgoing, friendly. Rooms, including a small kitchen, are great for a longer stay, to do some work and to feel 'at home'. It's well situated on top of a great shopping mall, and very near tube and railway-station. It's all well designed and thought of. The best of all: the balcony near the breakfast-room. A really splendid view over east-London, the City and the Olympic Park. Do go there!

Stayed here for 2 nights from 22 to 24 September. Booked a studio and was upgraded to a one bedroom apartment. Excellent value for money (GBP90++ a night, incl breakfast). Location is alright, a bit hard for my taxi to find (your car need to go into carpark B, mine went to the wrong one), a bit out of the way but above a huge shopping mall with lots of restaurants and shops. Very good if you are using London City Airport.What makes it special apart from the price is the little extra here and there. Here are some examples: the staff are friendly and helpful, will go out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. Complementary breakfast, you can bring the tray from your apartment to the breakfast and take them back to your room. Free wifi, enough to check emails etc but if you need a faster connection, it will cost GBP7 per 24 hours which is cheap compare to other London hotels I stayed.A few negative points: my key card seems to have problem operating the lifts. Need to change the card 2 times before it works (Nicolai from reception has been extremely helpful). Fire alarm also went off on Monday morning twice, with no prior warning (just a couple of seconds each time). You cannot get from hotel to taxi without carrying your luggage through a flight of elevators and when you left the hotel building to the elevators, that area is uncovered (it was raining the day I left).

This was our first trip to London and I really utilized the reviews on Trip Advisor to make my decision.  The comments prior to mine are right on target.  The entire staff here that we encountered were wonderful.  Beyond friendly and always helpful and made you feel right at home.  It is a bit hard to find once you exit the tube station and the first time we were hauling luggage as we came from the airport.  The mall that is attached has everything you need to include a grocery store.  We were tired of eating out one night and decided to get a small meal to make in the room but the prices for food in the grocery store are really no cheaper than eating out.  The rooms are super quiet which I loved.  But don't be fooled by a "king suite" for us Americans that means a king bed as well.... Not here the bed is a queen.  The bed and bedding were very comfortable.  The breakfast in the morning is a real plus and the views from there are spectacular.  My only complaint is that it is a bit out of the city proper and you really need to get on a tube to do anything.  Most rides averaged 20 to 30 minutes and little waiting at the stations.  It's good to buy a week long pass.  But it took almost an 1 1/2 hours to get here from the airport with two major switches.  A pain when hauling luggage but a taxi would cost well over $130 dollars.  Bottom line..must not mind riding the tube a lot to get around.  We are staying near the airport for our last night as we have an early flight and don't want to mess with the trains at 0300.Would stay here again for sure.

I stayed at Staybridge for 3 nights and it was really great. Staff very friendly and if you miss anything in your room (I had no kettle) it is solved really quick. If you want your room cleaned during weekends you can ask for it 24 hours in advance, but it was absolutely no problem for me, got some extra towels and I can make my own bed... Kitchen is the big plus for the suites, complete with dishwasher. Bed very comfortable, really comfortable chair (seems a small detail, but I loved the big chair). The walk-inn shower also very good, did not miss the bath. And it's clean. So nothing to comment on the rooms and staff, very positive!The only downside is the area it's in, good transport but Central Line can be very busy. Shopping center is of course a great advantage (very good supermarket on the lower ground floor, Waitrose) but there were quite some construction works going on, starting at 7 in the morning, even on Sunday. And opposite my room was a casino with outside terrace with heating, very busy until 3 in the morning. After the first night I bought some earplugs. Conclusion: I loved the Staybridge Suites, will definitely be back, but with my earplugs.

My 2 daughters and I booked a one night stay to do some shopping at Westfield. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The suite was large with a kitchenette, a huge bathroom,living area and a king bed in the bedroom.Views from the hotel were amazing from the 12th floor balcony. As well as seeing the London skyline, Canary Wharf and The Olympic Stadium we could also see Alexander Palace in the distance.Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice and it set us up for a days shopping. Staff at reception were particularly helpful especially Rawal. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for its lovely atmosphere,views, close to shopping  and stunning rooms. Will definately be back!

What really stood out about The Staybridge Suites was the staff. I was given a really friendly welcome by Wayne and the professionalism of all the staff throughout my stay was really impressive.My stay was just over a week after the Paralympics and there was a lot of work going on in and around the Olympic Park  so there as quite a bit of noise, with drilling starting at 7.30am on the dot on each of the 3 mornings of my stay, I dare say this will only be short term though.The Staybridge is next to  the Holiday Inn, and Receptionis unusually located on the 12th floor. The property is located on the doorstep of The Westfield Shopping Centre which has eveything you could ever wish for with regards to shopping and eateries.My room had a small kitchen which included a fridge, microwave,  oven  and dishwasher, and the bed was comfortable .Stratford is well served on the Jubilee and Central lines as well as the DLR.All in all a decent place to stay, especially if you are looking for some retail therapy.

column9: excellent  hotel from start to finish
column10: i stay here while i went to see the olympics with my girlfriend  it was a excellent location has well has a excellent hotel all staff is very nice and cannot do enough for you check in was good , breakfast was excellent with so much to choose from , there also a free laundry room , bedroom was big and spacious with everythink you need including free shower gel ,shampoo and conditioner . there one problem being in the middle of westfields shopping centre cost me more money than i expected but it was worth it . def would go back a big thank you to the  staff in kitchen who made you so welcome

Just stayed here for 4 nights with my wife.  Staff was excellent especially the young blonde man at the front desk (horrible that I can't emember his name)!  Room was spacious and comfortable, big bathroom and the kitchenette was nice to have.  The free laundry services were a terrific plus, however the dryers are about 2.5 hours for any cycle so plan to be in for the evening!  Location is out of the way for any of the central London attractions but they are pretty easy to get to if you are comfortable with the tube.  Avoid the Central line into the heart of the city at rush hour as you can imagine it is a bit tight...  Overall excellent stay for a great price!

column9: Excellent hotel in the middle of Westfield, Stratford
column10: Really good hotel in the centre of Westfield shopping centre.  Large rooms with kichenette with everything you would need for a long stay.  We only stayed overnight but the Staybridge Suites would be great for a long weekend or business stay.  Room was bright and very nicely furnished with high quality TV (inlcuding Apple TV)

Booked a studio room for a couple of nights in mid Sept. and thoroughly enjoyed the relaxed, easy going atmosphere. Check-in was quick and early (we managed almost two hours early!) which allowed us to go for a late lunch in the busy Westfield shopping centre next door. Rooms were well appointed and comfortable with larger than expected showers, and the kitchen area had a more than adequate supply of cooking equipment. Apple-TV/enhanced internet available in the rooms from an extra ¬£7 per 24-hrs which proved a useful option. I used it to connected to my Netflix account with no problems.The food at breakfast was fine, not a huge range of hot food though, but it never ran out, and the self-service open plan kitchen arrangement was uncomplicated and relaxing. You could alternatively make use of the doggy-bags provided and eat breakfast in your room or at a later time. Tea and coffee from the kitchen area was on tap 24-hrs a day with fresh milk and juice available from the large open fridges.The views over the Olympic park are great and at night the London Skyline was very picturesque. Even numbered rooms seem to have the best views though.A very relaxing stay.

I stay here when the rooms are less than ¬£100 per night. On all but the last occasion I've stayed I've been upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom suite. Everything is brand new and the hotel is right next to the station.The staff are a little too familiar and presumptive but very pleasant.

Stayed here for three nights, arrived to catch the back end of the Olympic Parade and although London was packed full the check in was seamless. The effort the staff put to make you at home from the minute you arrive to the time you leave is extraordinary.Our trip was to celebrate our Mums birthday and after doing all the usual touristy things such as London Eye, Open top bus tour, West end show etc it was an absolute delight to know you were returning to Staybridge. The suites are spot on and the kitchen gives you the option of grabbing something from M&S or Waitrose in the adjacent mall (approx 50m from the entrance) and eating in if youve had a long day.
