Alternatively there are lots of restaurants if youve still got the energy to pop out.The suites are positioned on the floors above the Holiday Inn so have much better views and they are super quiet, we hardly heard anything so a good nights sleep was had by all.Breakfast concept was very good and again the emphasis was "making yourself at home" good choice of cereals,pastries,fruit and hot items in a very relaxed atmosphere. We managed to get back one night in time for the Managers drinks getogether with some complimentary drinks and snacks plus a quick chat with the staff. Rooms with even numbers look out over the Olympic Park but odd numbers have decent views too and you can clearly see Alexandra Palace so no worries either way. This is a fantastic place to stay when in London, its ideal for tube and train but my tip is to buy tickets for the high speed train service from St Pancras, its a 6 minute journey, loads of seats and it is far more relaxing than the hustle and bustle of the much longer tube journey. Our return ticket cost just over ¬£11 for 4 people so book online for a stress free journey too and from Staybridge. Many thanks to all of the staff who made my Mums birthday such a memorable event, the cake card and upgrade were all very much appreciated and we look forward to seeing you soon.

Overall, I would say very good. A bit disappointed when the family wanted to roast chicken in the evening and realized there was no oven [only a microwave]. The restaurant at holiday in is very much over priced and when we went there to eat, it was dead empty. when we looked at the prices on the menu, we guessed why. That is not a problem because you have countless restaurants within 5-10 minutes of stroll.On the plus side, rooms are neat, staff are helpful and nice when not busy and good value for money.

column9: Won't stay anywhere else in London now
column10: The welcome from the reception staff was the first bonus, they could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room was excellent, clean with a fully equipped kitchenette, king size bed and a really spacious shower, plus safe and ironing facilities. We were allocated a room with a view over the Olympic Stadium and the entrance area so we were able to experience the stadium both at night lit up and in the daylight. Bottled water was provided and complimentary tea and coffee was available 24 hours in the Den. The complimentary breakfast should be enough to satisfy anyone's taste and appetite and the staff in that area worked extremely hard to make sure everything was available and the area clean. Breakfast could be eaten in the dining area with a great view of the Olympic stadium or on the balcony weather permitting.The suites are an integral part of the Westfield Plaza shopping complex and transport links are excellent from the Stratford station just two minutes walk away.The room was very quiet and air conditioned and e enjoyed a comfortable night's sleep.

Stayed for one night during the recent Paralympics. Excellent location very close to Stratford International Station. Staff were very pleasant and helpful when dropping suitcase off in the morning. Faultless and friendly check in. Rooms are large with kitchen area (didn't use this). Really excellent shower in the bathroom - great water pressure. Comfortable beds and absolutely no noise from corridor or other rooms. Loved the pantry to buy snacks and a beer after a long day at the Olympic Park with the added bonus of standing on the outside balcony with a fantastic view over the Olympic Park. Breakfast was good - good quality sausage and omelette as well as juices, breads etc. Tea and coffee on tap 24 x 7. My only regret is not staying longer.

column9: Amazing hotel - incredible staff and fab location
column10: Our stay at this hotel was amazing - when we turned up to check in the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (Tim and Rafal in particular). When we turned up we had a chat with Tim who was checking us in, he provided lots of information on the area and hotel and advised us the best places to go/see. Also as it was our first stay at the hotel we were upgraded to a room with a view of the Olympic Stadium which was incredible.The room itself was spacious, the setup was really well done, the kitchenette was clean and perfect sized for two. Everything about the room and hotel was pristine and very tastefully decorated. The view from the room was absolutely stunning, we had a view of the stadium and across the rest of London - every major building was visible.The hotel was very quiet and you couldn't hear any noise from any of the other adjoining rooms. The only noise was at nighttime from the Stadium - but the windows more than blocked it out and this wasn't a problem.We didn't take full advantage of the on-site shop or communal areas but these were pristine and we were encouraged to make use of them.The location of the hotel itself was perfect - right next to the tube station but there was no noise from it. Also directly located at entrance of the Westfield shopping centre which caters to every need.Considering the footfall around the area at the time the hotel was very peaceful and the staff took the time to speak to us and when we were checking out Tim asked about our stay and had remembered what we had planned to do in London and chatted to us about how our trip had been.All in all these guys were amazing and the hotel was spectacular - if you are thinking of staying here do it! Hope to return one day!

column9: Feels like home. Very friendly and comfortable
column10: This hotel is in a fantastic location with very easy access to central london via the tube and buses and the huge Westfield shopping centre at your doorstep. The rooms are in immaculate condition with the staff extremely friendly. Very informal relaxed atmosphere. I loved the nibbles and wine on the rooftop level overlooking the 2012 Olympic stadium, this occurs Tuesday through Thursday nights to mingle (or not) with other guests. I would definately recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.Checking in is a breezeBreakfast is simple but sufficient and served  in a huge kitchen like area. The dining area is similar to that of home with a living area with fireplace!  It's a home away from home.

Staybridge Suites London - Stratford City was a superbly situated hotel from which to attend the London Olympic events as well as visit the city itself. The hotel's facilities are brand new, very clean and comfortable. The 12th floor lobby with many amenities and outdoor balcony has a panoramic view of the Olympic Park and was a perfect venue from which to observe many of the Park's activities from the opening to closing ceremonies. And its location provided easy access to many other conveniences in the nearby Westfield Shopping Mall and points of interest via the 'tube'/underground station only a short walk from the front door. The staff's extremely personal attention to our comfort, convenience and logistics were beyond even luxury hotel concierge services. We experienced once-in-a-lifetime opportunities with their assistance and advice. We will definitely be back.

column9: Fantastic stay - great mix of 4 Star accommodation with homely feel
column10: I stayed 3 nights at the Staybridge Suites just after the Olympics had finished and I was very impressed.When we arrived I had only booked a studio but I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom unit which was a great first impression.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and they even let me check in at 11am as I had arrived rather early. The rooms are brand new... it felt as though I was the very first person to have ever stayed in the suite.  The 1 bedroom unit was very spacious and has a very decent kitchenette and a decent sized fridge (bigger than your average bar sized fridge that you would usually get).  This was great as I had been travelling around Europe for 6 weeks prior and I was glad to be able to finally cook some decent wholesome food as I was rather over eating out for every meal.  The lounge on the top floor is awesome too, its open 24 hours a day and you can take your own food and drinks up to the lounge area and just relax.  This was great, I would invite friends over and we would have evening drinks up in the lounge.  Then when we wanted more privacy, we would just simply head down to my room and I would entertain in the lounge in my suite instead.  THIS is why the place feels like a home away from home.  The views are of the London skyline too which is fantastic... great at night too.There is also a free laundry with washing machine and dryer... the only downside is that you have to stay with your washing whilst it is drying as there is no 'timer', just a sensor that 'senses' when your clothes are dry... the sensors are terrible and they constantly stop even when your clothes aren't dry so you must stay there - but its free so its good!!  The location is fantastic as well!  Only about 10 mins by tube to Liverpool Street stop and it is amongst Westfield that was built for the Olympic games, its the biggest mall in Western Europe and its very VERY nice place to hang out, it has a movie theatre, plenty of places to eat and a tonne of shops... you can spend an entire day there without realising you have done so!  I only have one little negative to say ... the hotel does not do room cleaning on Saturday or Sunday!  So on the weekends you will have to make your own bed, and ring up to have fresh towels delivered and toilet paper etc.  A little slack and this is a concept I don't quite understand for a fantastic hotel like this.  A second negative is that when you do have staff come to your room, they never knock, they just open your door with their master key and walk on in... I really did get a major fright several times when this happened.  I think it would be courteous if they could knock and wait for a reply or for someone to answer the door.Other than that, this hotel is perfect and I highly recommend it!

I stayed here a number of nights over the Olympics, the staff were very helpful and could not do enough for me. The breakfast area is very well layed out and a relaxing environment. The room are clean and plenty of room to swing your cat, if you have one, with cooking facilities if you need them. Only issue I did have was the air vents clanged between midnight and 6am which kept me awake, after calling down at 2am to get it sorted I was told they could do nothing until an engineer arrived in the morning. They did not even offer me another room.   The following morning after raising the compliant I was offer the nights stay for free. Which I was happy with. The staff are the key feature of this place as they always have time for you and are very pleasant about it too. I would stay again.

This hotel shares the same building with the same group's Holiday Inn (which occupy the floors below it) - I tried both, and was pleased with both.  Brand new in the heart of the Westfield shopping mall, around five minutes walk from both Stratford Underground and Stratford International stations for excellent connections to central London and East Anglia/South East England.  I was told my room was an upgrade (as I have Holiday Inn Platinum Priority Club membership) but the bed was small, much smaller than the one I had in Holiday Inn.  But otherwise the suite was well laid out, with a decent lounge/kitchen area and separate well appointed bathroom.  Cooking facilities mean you can do your own thing - plenty of microwaveable meals at Waitrose or M&S in the shopping mall and Sainsbury's is not far away.   A good buffet breakfast is included in the price, including some hot food items (although these may not be to everyone's taste!).  It was bit crowded on Sunday morning; difficult to find a seat, but items were replenished speedily.  Good selection of freeview channels (although not quite the full range) on large screen TVs - one in lounge and another in bedroom!  Free wifi although it is a little slow.  There are only two lifts which can mean a bit of a wait sometimes, especially as anyone checking in also needs to use them to get from the ground floor to reception.  Check out took a bit too long - mainly the fault of the guest 'in front' of me rather than the reception staff, but it did mean I missed my train.  Express checkout facility would be appreciated.  Once the Olympics are over I imagine there will be some good deals on offer and considering the good rail and tube links it may be worth thinking about this as an alternative to more expensive central London hotels.

column9: Excellent all round service and location
column10: Located less then 30 mins from city centre London by tube, hotel is located one level above the Stratford Westfield shopping centre.  Its a 5 min walk up from the Stratford tube station.It has great views of the Olympic stadium and London's skyline which can been seen by most rooms and main balcony.From check-in to the managers nibbles and drinks to the breakfast in the mornings, the service was first class!The rooms were finished in a high standard with everything you need for your stay.  You can even open the window to the outside world!  The hotel encourages for long duration guests to change the furniture around to make it feel like home!!I love the concept and everything about this hotel!!Did I mention the countless restaurants, bars, shops within a stone throw away....Just perfect!

I stayed at the Staybridge Suite in late August for three nights. Overall, the hotel was very good for the price and location, and I left the hotel feeling relaxed and impressed enough to stay again.GOOD POINTS: The welcome by the reception staff was professional and easy. The room (I stayed on the 8th floor) was very comfortable and had everything you would need for a short stay or longer as the mini kitchen was well equipped with utensils and appliances (dishwasher, microwave oven, kettle, fridge). The bed was exceptionally comfortable (Hypnos Beds) and the Samsung TV had a good range of channels, all with good picture/reception quality. The bathroom was not massive, but the shower was a good size with strong water pressure and a shower head that was height adjustable beyond 6ft. The view from the room overlooked the Olympic park and the city skyline, and on a clear day you could see for miles. There are numerous restaurants within minutes of the hotel and Stratford tube/rail is less than five minutes walk away. Despite the potential for a lot of noise in the immediate area, the rooms were very quiet.BAD POINTS: Only one, and that was the breakfast. The format of the breakfast is considerably more relaxed than most hotels, with the hotel trying to convince you are at home by using large jars of jams, full size cereal boxes and kitchen decoration that you might have at home. For me, this didn't quite work, as whilst the type of food available was okay, I'm not so sure about the hygiene aspects of many people using the same jar of jam or box of cereal. The coffee from the automatic machine was pretty rough, though the good selection of Twinnings tea made up for it.

Stayed for a long weekend on the 11th floor with Olympic stadium views. Location is excellent and you can feel the 'vibe' of the redeveloped area. Lots of places to eat, shop and have a drink nearby, although you do have the option of cooking in your own suite with a fully stocked kitchen with all the latest gadgets. The suites are very modern and I have stayed in 5 star hotels and these facilities are equal to these hotels.Staff were really helpful and friendly (Tim on reception!!) and nothing was to much trouble. I stayed with 3 young children and they loved the patio that gave you views out over the Olympic park and the buffet style breakfast, where you have a great variety of choice and well cooked food.I wouldnt hesitate to recommend these suites to anyone who wants a quality place to stay in a great location.

The Staybridge Suites at Stratford are amazing. What I really like are the kitchen areas in the rooms the space the modern decor and of course the view over the Olympic Park! But what sets this apart from other hotels are the outstanding friendly staff at the reception desk. Located on the Westfield shopping complex and a few minutes walk to the tube station. I know where I am staying on my next visit to London.

column9: Fantastic Property, Amazing Location, FAB Staff
column10: I stayed in a Studio Suite on 8th Floor with a view towards the Olympic Park. The location of the property is fantastic; just a brief walk from the Tube. The Westfield Shopping Centre is on your doorstep but it doesn't feel like its too close. It's perfect because there is just no noise whatsoever when you are in the rooms. The rooms are superb. They have brilliant facilities, amazingly clean and bright. The staff were truly fab! They are all so friendly and helpful! Very comfortable bed and great breakfast!

column9: Perfect location, beautifully designed, friendly staff
column10: I stayed at the Staybridge suite at the end of May upon a recommendation from a friend. I have to say, it's probably one of the most beautifully designed and finished hotels I've ever stayed in. The hotel room and the lobby and reception areas were all superbly lit with really close attention to detail paid to the colours and materials used throughout the whole complex. The room that I stayed in was like a large five-star studio flat, with a state of the art kitchenette, huge wet room shower, and ultra-modern fittings. If you appreciate good design and detail this hotel is non-stop eye candy.The staff were super friendly and accommodating. My only criticism is that I was so wow'd by the whole place that when it came to breakfast I was expecting something on a similar scale, but it was a bit more inline with other hotels I'd stayed at - which was fine - but given the size of the breakfast area I'd maybe got my hopes set a bit too high! I understand when I went the hotel had only been open a few weeks so perhaps this has changed.And lastly, the bed was so comfortable it made it pretty hard for me to actually get up and start my day - beware if you've got things to do the next day, it'll be difficult to leave this place behind. Am looking forward to the next time I stay here.

Had a short overnight stay at this hotel.  The room was excellent, well decorated and clean, with a great view of the Olympic park.  They have all the gadgets in the rooms including apple tv.  The bathroom was very clean.  It is well located in the shopping area of the Olympic park and is easy to get to with a train station very close.  When I arrived I got a nice welcome from the person that checked me in.  He was informative and helpful.  If you are looking for something just out of central London with great transport, this is it.

column9: 'Suite' stay at the Staybridge London Stratford
column10: Pros-location outstanding, at the doorstep of the Olympics stadium, you're inside the mall, in front of Stratford Center metro and train station, outstanding staff with shout-out to Nicholas and Jessica, in-room kitchen with Marks and Spencer for groceries just steps away, plenty of washers and dryers for guest use, gorgeous views of the city from the top floorCons-WIFI signal poor with constant drops, must navigate thru the mall to get there, small continental breakfast, limited adapter plugs to borrow

We decided to have a short weekend splurge after the craziness of the Olympics. This place is perfectly located to see all the venues and we could see the stadium from our room. The staff were amazing and shared some great stories of the excitement of the games. The room, atmosphere and food all lived up to the reviews. We actually live in London and are so happy to have found such good value, quality accommodation we can reccommend to visiting friends.

brand new hotel spacious rooms with kitchenettes great views from terrace overlooking the olympic stadium . excellent shopping at the westfield shopping mall next door. friendly staff . just one member of staff who was on reception who let the image of the hotel down with an unironed shirt . easy to get straight  into central london on the central line in next to no time. or the new super fast javelin train into st pancras mainline station in 6 mins. we were disappointed that we couldn't look around the olympic arena that our taxes have paid for

column9: Great staff, great rooms, and great location!
column10: Was in London for five weeks and had the pleasure of staying at the Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City. The staff couldn‚Äôt have been any better!! The rooms are great and clean ‚Äì and the location is central and super close to transit. Complementary breakfast and happy hour - an added bonus!

column9: Nice hotel in a lively location
column10: I stayed at Staybridge Suites London-Stratford City for a weekend in mid-August. This was my first Staybridge experience and I have to say I really liked it!The hotel is located in East London, within the Westfield Stratford City complex. It's just a couple of minutes from the Stratford tube station (zone 3). Oxford Circus is about 18 minutes away on the tube's Central Line. First I was a bit concerned about the distance to Central London, but in practice it was a non-issue.Finding the hotel is a bit adventure because there is no Google Street View (nor a detailed Google Map) available of the area. Basically it goes like this:1) Exit the tube to the Westfield / Olympic Park side of the station.2) Go one level up to the Westfield outdoor plaza level (stairs, escalators and lifts are available).3) Walk about 150 yards along the shops and restaurants and pass The North Face and Timberland stores on the left. The hotel is in the same building as these stores.4) Turn left on the corner of the building and you have arrived to the hotel. Take the right hand side lifts to 12th floor for reception. (The left hand side lifts are for the Holiday Inn hotel.)The building is a brand new one and houses two hotels. The Staybridge Suites is located in floors 8 to 12. The reception and common areas are located at the top floor with the most of the rooms in floors 8‚Äì11. Rooms with even numbers have amazing views to the south(ish) and skyscrapers of Canary Wharf. The rooms with odd numbers face the Westfield with not so amazing views.I stayed in one bedroom suite which, by London standards, was huge. Everything was brand spanking new and spotlessly clean. The decor is modern and comfortable. I really liked the use of framed art photos and some glassware as decorations. The suite kitchen is very good with a stove, microwave/grill, fridge and dishwasher. All needed pots, plates and cooking accessories were also available.The lounge/breakfast room/den in the 12th floor is very comfortable. Coffee and tea are available 24h from there. There is also a very nice terrace with great views to the Olympic Park and London skyline.The staff was very friendly and accommodating during the stay.All in all it was a very nice stay. Will definitely stay there again.

This hotel has an amazing location with perhaps some of the best views of the Olympic stadium.  Even if you're traveling after the Olympics, the location is great - a quick walk to the Tube and within a few minutes of the great stores and restaurants in the mall.  The staff were very friendly and eager to help.

I absolutely loved my stay at staybridge. The hotel is very new and clean and is very spacious.The is located in next/in to the huge westfield shopping center. If you are a shopaholic like you will love the location of this hotel! The is located right next to the olympic stadium and you have a great view of it in the lounge/ breakfast area. Theres even a balcony area for breakfast outside and its great for taking pictures of the scenic view. The breakfast was great. It was selfserved and had nice eggs,bacon,fresh fruit,yogurt,coffee,tea,juices and a assortment of pasteries such as cakes and crossiants.The atmostsphere is just amazing the rooms had kitchen amenties and a great bathroom with huge bottles of free toiletries. The hotel had free wifi and very close to the train station which is good. The walls are soundproof and the staff was so nice and friendly. One of the best stays I had in years. Would totally recommend this hotel!!

The hotel is very new, clean and perfectly located next to a large shopping center and Olympic stadium. My suite was large and comfortable with a view over Olympic stadium itself! Fully equipped kitchen had all needed amenities.As I travelled with children they have put a baby cot and a baby chair to my suite, that was really nice. All staff members were nice and welcoming.The hotel does not have its own restaurant but it vever was a problem: there are plenty of restaurants in Westfield next door.So generally we were really happy with the hotel and would recommend staying there.

column9: Fantastic Hotel on the Olympic Park's doorstep.
column10: I had a fantastic stay at this hotel at the beginning of July for 2 nights as I was attending an Olympics training event at the Olympic Park.First of all the location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. It's literally 2 minutes walk from stratford station. Some reviews on here spoke of the hotel being hard to find. It's actually really easy. Coming out of stratford station you take the lifts or escalators outside up to the 1st floor and instead of entering Westfield you walk to the left along the outside part of the centre called "The Street". The hotel is on the left next to the Prada store.The reception, pantry and breakfast area is on the 12th floor giving fabulous views over the Olympic park with an outside terrace with a bbq.The welcome from the reception staff was fantastic and really friendly. All of the staff I encountered during my stay couldn't do enough for you.The room itself is absolutely fantastic with a huge bed and a fully equipped kitchen which is very useful as Waitrose supermarket is nearby in Westfield so makes it very convenient to cook your own food. Alternatively, if you don't want to cook there is a huge range of different restaurants in Westfield and also in the adjoining Holiday Inn. The room and bathroom were spotless and still had that "new building" smell. The shower was huge and very powerful. The room also had a large TV with digital channels and free wi-fi is available. For an extra charge you can upgrade to using the Apple TV and to a faster wi-fi connection.The breakfast is included in the room price and was very nice. It's a buffet in a room that is like your own kitchen from home. There was a large fridge with different juices that you can pour yourself and they had loads of different spreds in the jars that you can have with your toast. There was also a decent selection of hot items as well.Overall I couldn't recommend this hotel more. I had a fantastic stay and wished it could have been for longer. All the staff were great and the hotel truly feels like a home from home!

Great Hotel, exceptionally helpful and well trained staff at the front desk and management very friendly. Great for familys but no 2 bedrooms suite so needed 2 rooms nect to each other.  No room servies over weekend so get new towels on Firday (nice conservation measure I guess). Need a printer for guest to potentially use but front desk did it for us and more brochures on sites and things to do Wide variety of resturants downstairs, and one in the Holiday Inn section of th hotel although we did not try it alos plenty of fast food type in the Mall next door.   Can even buy food at M & S/grocery stores  in the Mall and cook in your room if deisred.    Free Breakfast is standard and nothing exceptional but english style buffet of eggs/beans/ceraleas etc. - good coffee (24 hrs) and juice.   Rooms new and well laid out  although could have more or brighter lighting.   Free laundry again nice svaings and less packing for longer stay!!!Gym not set up yet but able to use the Holiday Inn gym as well - never stayed in a dual hotel same building but 2 elevators one for stabrigand one for Holiday Inn?Proximity to the Westfiled Mall is a good except you should expect the credit card will eventually melt for so many purchases.  It is a little outside of City center but commute via Undergorund is 20 minutes and at times a little crowded,

column9: Fantastic, luxurious hotel in great location!!!
column10: Absolutely gorgeous hotel, Huge and extremely comfortable beds, huge shower in the very modern suites which are equipped for all kinds of guests!! Brand new hotel in ideal location with amazing views of the olympic village and london city.

My daughter and I stayed here for one night only but we would have happily stayed a month. Firstly we travel within the USA a grewat deal so have got used to the chasm that exists between customer service in America and the UK. At the Staybridge in London it was akinb to being in the Ritz-Carlton in New York.The hotel itself is part of the Westfield Mall and is adjoining Olympic Park. About a 3 minute walk from the tube. I booked the night using loyalty points so had paid nothing but nevertheless was upgraded to a one bedroom suite. Timothy on reception was awesome; he could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. Debbie was the same- she took my daughter off to take pictures of the Olymopic stadium and made us feel so at home.The suite was lovely, if you were there for an extended trip it had everything you needed including a fridge, hob and microwave. Our only gripe was the bed was a little firm but we like squishy!Due to the upcoming Games the Staybridge gym was not in use but I was able to use the Holiday Inn gym which is attached.The evening reception, managed again by Debbie was by far the best complimentary reception we have had. It puts the Embassy Suites and Drury Inn ones to shame.The breakfast too was fine tho scaled down a little due to a piower cut. Ot still had everything we wanted (except bananas!) and the staff managed providing a breakfast service on an emergency generaor with aplomb.In sum I would stay here again in a heartbeat and will definitely switch my 'Suite hotel' allegiance from Embassy Suites.

The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is brand new and so very modern, both in the bedrooms and around the rest of the hotel. It's a stone's throw away from the underground station, where you can get the central line that cuts across the centre of london and also connects to most other tube lines - so getting across the city is very efficient from the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by fantastic restaurants in the mall, which range from very nice to simple quick meals. Equally, the restaurant in the hotel boasts many delicious, inventive dishes coming out of the kitchen led by an attentive head chef. The view goes without saying, it's exciting right now because of all of the Olympic buzz, but even without that, from the hotel you can see all of London's biggest landmarks, the eye, the girkin, the new gondola, the 02 arena canary wharf. Overall the hotel is very cozy, and well equipped to suit anybody's needs, whether travelling as a family, in a couple, with friends or solo.

Brand new facility. Excellent on all counts. Service was exceptional, very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Room was a delight, especially for London known for tight hotel rooms. Kitchen, seating area, large extremely comfortable king bed, and an incredible bathroom, spotless and huge. The lobby, seating areas were very nice and impeccable. The included breakfast was great with plenty of selection and high quality. Without a doubt the best hotel stay I've experienced in London, or almost anywhere in a very long time. Not to mention it's proximity to the tube station a few hundred feet away and it also overlooks the Olympic Park. Best value I've found in London, not to be missed.

column9: Great room, great view, great mall!
column10: This hotel has only been open for a few months and was spotless. The room is really well decorated, has a kitchenette, a large tv, and a big, modern bathroom. We had a view of the Olympic Park which was really cool! We had some trouble initially finding the hotel, because we didn't realize it was actually in the mall and joined with the Holiday Inn. Our idiocy aside, the mall is only a few minutes walk from the tube. Loved the location - the mall was great. It took a while getting into the heart of London on the tube, but it was nice getting away from the hustle and bustle at the end of the day. The breakfast was great! Hot and cold selections and lots of juices to choose from. Walls seemed a bit thin, but I sleep with earplugs. Great hotel!

column9: if you are thinking of staying here; JUST DO IT.
column10: I travel a LOT for business and this place is great.I stayed here privately for 2 nights for an anniversary. views of the park from the 11 floor (our room) and from the 12th where the reception, den and balcony are just great. You can see workers every day going into the park and at night practising the fab light shows!I took piccies of the suite and brekkie as I could see that other travellers hadn't. The evening reception with free wine (red, white and a great rose) with 'snacks' was just lovely. Essentially we used this time as a 'starter' to the dinners that we had in restaurants after. snacks were french bread, crackers, nachos' , salsa, a whole cheese board, crudites and pate.one of the best hotels I have satyed in for a long time!

You really can't get closer to the Olympic Park, so the views from the 12th floor is absolutely amazing!! Great decor and very attentive/friendly staff.The concept is really casual and informal which makes the breakfast a refreshing experience - help yourself from the large fridge with large bottles! Feels like being in your kitchen at home.Sure this hotel will be a firm favourite in future!

we cannot recommend this hotel enough!! Newly opened and overlooking the Olympic park.  The hotel staff were fantastic, the rooms well equipped and clean and the hotel in a fantastic location being right in the middle of the Olympic park and Westfield shopping centre. As it was my wife's birthday, the very helpful staff were kind enough to upgrade us to a twelfth floor suite, which was fantastic.Great communal areas, nice relaxed feel and very attentive staff.

column9: American style suites in East London at amazing price !
column10: If you are looking for large hotel room with a fully equipped kitchen at a very reasonable pricein London then this is the answer . The hotel is right in the Westfield,Stratford shopping mall who came to be biggest in Europe . Westfield itself is quite huge and offers almost everything from luxury shopping to international  food courts to casinos etc . We had a big room which was facing Olympic 2012  main stadium and that itself was an awesome view . Hotel is extremely neat and clean and secure too . Entrance is directly in the mall complex itself . Breakfast is pretty elaborate including eggs , fruits , juices and usual stuff . But , you have a fully equipped kitchen and you can buy all coking grocery and material from M&S store which is 1 minute away .Connectivity of this place is also excellent . There are two metro lines which cover Stratford Metro station which is just 2-3 minutes walk and in fact is connected to Westfield complex. Central London like Oxford Street is just 15-20 minutes by direct metro connection .  It is a bit far from the Heathrow Airport but connected by Metro train network . You need to take a combination of Piccadilly and Central lines and do just one change at Holborn . It takes about 70 minutes by Metro network to reach to the hotel from Heathrow.  Good point is that if you take a London Metro Zone 1-3 pass for a week then you can cover your airport travel too.

The hotel is luxurious. That means in this case big nicely decorated room (and bathroom) with great view over London. Also the dining and lounge area have the same quiet and sophisticated feel with again the view. Staff is very professional, friendly and helpful. Location near olympic stadium has many benefits; huge (and again luxury) shopping mall is next to the hotel with loads of nice bars and restaurants. Short ride from City Airport, the City and Canary Wharf. Therefore a good place if you are in London for business; because of the quiet and luxury feel and at the same time the excitement from the bars, restaurants and mall around the corner. And at a competitive price!

column9: First class, with views of Olympic Park.
column10: These are excellent suites with all facilities backed by an excellent staff. It is very close to the Olympic park and the breakfast /Bar area has grand views of the Olympic park.

Have just returned from a weekend break in London and was lucky enough to stay at the new Staybridge Suites in Stratford.The entire process from initial booking through to check out was perfect and I would like to say thanks to Rafal, who was so friendly and welcoming.The hotel is easy to find in a great location next to Westfield and Stratford station. I had  a room on the 11th floor overlooking the Olympic Stadium. The room was very modern and stylish and had everything you need, you could simply live there!The hotel has a spacious lounge with fantastic views over London, Breakfast is complimentary and has plenty of choice to set you up for the day.I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and hope we will see many more Staybridge hotels emerge in the UK.Thanks for a great stay!James

Just a one night stay with a pal - not enough time to make use of the little kitchen but it all looked perfect! We wanted to have a bit of a pre-Olympic experience and certainly had that - lots of activity in the Olympic Park - not sure what but involved lots of lights and people milling around!Emailed the Operations Manager beforehand and he replied to confirm that, yes, my pal could check in before me if she wished and yes, we could have a view of the Olympic Park. Thanks!Comfy bed. Fabulous (and I mean fabulous) shower. And what a view!The view from the 12th floor (reception, breakfast etc) is the best of London I've ever seen. In the distance, the Telecom Tower*, Shard/Gherkin, Canary Wharf, Millennium Dome*, new cable car, and... hills! In the foreground, various train lines (with what look like little toy trains from the 12th floor) and all the activity of the Olympic Park. No wonder we took an hour and a half for breakfast - you could spend all day just looking out of the window!*I know this isn't what they're called now but they're not BT Tower and O2 to me!The hotel doesn't have a bar but you can use the Holiday Inn bar in the same building.Good breakfast included.

Pros:- New- Beautiful decor, quality furniture- Courteous staff, very friendly- Fantastic views of Olympic Stadium- Close to train station, close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment- Quality Internet service- Delicious complimentary breakfastCons:- None

We stayed in the staybridge suites for 2 nights to celebrate an anniversairy. Upon arrival we were greeted with a congratulations and upgraded to a one bedroomed suite. The location of the hotel is perfectly situated in Westfields so ideal for eating out or shopping. With Waitrose & M&S close nice food can easily be bought to so can save money on eating out. Inside the room there was a stove, microwave and fridge so could easily cook to. Only complaint was couldn't find the instructions for the microwave so wasn't sure if we could heat it up to be an oven or not but if we were really concerned the reception could have helped but we decided to stick with stove and microwave foods. View was great over the Olympic park, we had paid extra for the view over the park but if I'm honest I don't believe it was a necessity as the view out of the reception and when you're eating breakfast was the best in the whole building so the extra money for the view out of the room I wouldn't personally pay for again.I'd definitely recommend the Staybridge Suites to anyone and after staying in the Newcastle one & now this one I'm looking forward to more opening up around the country.

Stayed with the family and had two rooms, they were clean, spacious, nicely set up with an incredible shower!Highly recommended for shoppers, my daughter and wife said the mall next door had all the stores they needed, so no need to go to Oxford street.The staff was extremely helpful, we got to check in at 11am, which was great after a long trip.The fitness room is not finished (has no equipment) but the view of the olympic park from that room is great.The alarm went off in the night for a few seconds, which the hotel apologized the morning after.

I stayed for one night in one of the one bedroomed suites in this new Hotel. The suite itself was well appointed Like a Home from Home (small kitchen area with all the mod cons you may need for a stay, separate living area with comfy sofa to watch TV, nice bathroom) Just off the reception is a lovely external terrace area which looks out onto the Olympic Stadium. So it‚Äôs great if you want to see the Olympics and also if you like retail therapy which can be carried out in the Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre next door. Stratford itself has excellent transport links such as Oxford Circus in about 20 mins on the central line. However, the stay was not without its negatives, the larder (this is a place where you purchase foodstuffs to cook and eat in your room) was poorly stocked, the fire alarm went off during the middle of the night and the team seemed a little disorganised.Said that, I‚Äôm sure that things will sort themselves out but when you pay over ¬£200.00 for one night, you expect nothing to go wrong.

We stayed three nights in a standard suite overlooking the new Olympic park in Stratford. Room very comfortable and while obviously new in top condition. Two minutes walk from Stratford station and then easy access to central London including Oxford Street but why: if you want to shop the Westcliff shopping centre is outside your front door. An excellent breakfast each morning (included) and different combinations as well. Really helpful and friendly staff. Will be happy to return.

column9: The best of hotel and serviced apartment!
column10: Great stay, with really amiable and helpful staff. Stayed for 3 weeks and usually stay in Canary Wharf when here on business. Stratford City is a much more vibrant destination with a plethora of amenities on the doorstep. Commute to Canary Wharf only being 7minutes. Views across London are stunning from 12th floor terrace, where they hosted a comp BBQ for guests!Added bonus of breakfast daily and a gym, never stayed in a serviced apartment like it! Great concept, see you again in September!

We stayed in a king suite last weekend whilst my daughter attended the Hackney weekend.  This hotel is new and feels nic and new too.  Its so easy to find standing tall within the Westfield shopping centre.  2 mins from both stations in Stratford.  My daughter caught the 6 minute high speed train from St pancras and i drove to Tottenham Hale and caught the 10 min train straight in.  Was a lot cheaper then the ¬£25-35 per day parking.  When you entre the building make sure you use the right hand side elevators as the ones on the left take you to the Holiday Inn that shares the building.  Check in/out and the staff were superb, very freindly and attentive.  The suite itself was very spacious and luxurios.  Lovely kitchenette with everything you need (including a dishwasher) , free tea and coffee although they also serve this free day and night in the residents lounge.  Big apple TV, relaxing chair and table and a huge very comfy bed.  The bathroom was really nice with a massive shower and very nice toiletries.  There is even a laundry basket in your room if you want to pop to the launderette down the hall.  You can purchase food from them or M & S or Waitrose that are next door to cook  or The Holiday inn have a restaurant serving food.  The free breakfast was great, all you can eat, hot and cold and the even provide takeaway bags if you want it in your room instead.  The views are stunning as they overlook the olympic park.  The hotel is right in the middle of the westfield centre and all its eateries so you will never be bored or go hungry.  I would def stay here again and prefer this to central london as the connections are so good.

We stayed at this hotel over the weekend as we were at Radio 1's Hackney Weekend so the location was perfect. Whilst the hotel is a little out of the centre of the city, Stratford tube station is two minutes walk away, and the location near the Olympic park would obviously be perfect for the Olympics. Since the hotel is brand new, everything was spotless. We stayed in a Studio Suite which was pretty small but well laid out, with a small kitchen area that felt separate to the bedroom. The bathroom was great - huge shower and large bottles of shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, and plenty of towels. The bed was quite firm but really big and comfy. I really liked having the kitchen and the hotel really does feel like a home away from home. Breakfast was laid back - no waiters to speak of but a serve yourself area full of bread, pastries, hot and cold drinks, fruit, cereal and hot food - sausages, hash browns, eggs and beans. A nice touch at breakfast were paper cups and bags for a takeaway breakfast (or a few extra croissants to eat later in the day!). Service was also top notch, so all in all, a fantastic hotel and a great bargain before the Olympics start!

Great location and a brand new hotel. The rooms are just like the other Staybridge Suites - spacious, well equipped, fantastic kitchen/bathroom and sparkling clean. Free Wifi works, albeit slowly at times. Breakfast is good, although at weekends it becomes a little crowded when everyone typically eats between 9-10am. On weekdays people tend to eat spread between 7-10am so much calmer and spacious in the kitchen. Views from the hotel are awesome... with rooms on floors 8 to 12. Try and request a room that faces the Olympic park -  you can also see the Millennium Dome (O2 arena), Canary Wharf, Ghurker, and the new Shard and the even newer Mittal Orbit.  If you get a room facing the other side, you can still enjoy views of the city from the reception-level loungeParking... the Westfield car park (the recommended car park) is now closed until after the Olympics (mid September 2012) and the next nearest car park (the older Stratford Shopping Centre - ¬£25 for 24 hours) is only a few minutes walk from the hotel. This is fine, but as it's the only car park near Westfield, it was very busy. Importantly, this will also be closed from 21st July until after the Olympics.So... we used ParkAtMyHouse.com - a website where people can rent out their driveway. There are several people near the Westfield centre who are renting their driveways - we parked at one person's house just 12 minutes walk from the hotel and was very convenient, and also cheaper than the car parks. In short we loved everything about it - the rooms, the location, the views etc. We will think about staying here next time we go to central London - a great location for Westfield and just an underground trip away from the middle of town.

This hotel is brand spanking new, part of the Wesfield Shopping complex in Stratford and next door to the Olympic Stadium. First impressions were that teh directions were not clear enough and I had a tour of the Westfield complex bfore I found the hotel. But, once I had found it I was suitably impressed. The reception area is part of a series of areas interlinked to form relaxing and eating spaces. The reception is unexpectantly on the top (12th) floor. From here you can relax and enjoy the scenary of the City or the Olympic complex laid out before you.This hotel was a new concept for me. It is a building full of suites, which have self contained kitchen and cooking areas. From close to reception you can buy produce from the fridges or off the shelf - milk, fruit juices, cans of beans, bread...loads of stuff. Ther room was wasted on me to be honest. I was on a whistle stop one night business stay, getting in late and leaving early with a dinner out in between. Not enough time to appreciate the spaciousness and comfort of the suite. it had a living area with sofa and TV, kitchen space, separate (and roomy) bedroom with bathroom. I could have spent a lot of time there comfortably.Breakfast was a plentyful and varied and a bit DIY, in a nice way. Bit like being in your own kitchen. For example, fruit juices were kept in a large fridge in 2 litre bottles, pour what you want, not dispensed. Same with milk and other things.I really liked the relaxed almost home from home atmosphere, it was spacious, spotless and comfortable beyond belief and super convinient for transport. But, all this comfort and convinience comes at a price....and a very reasonable one it is too. V. Impressed with VFM. As always the question would I go back...Yes, and I am next time for more than one night so that I can take advantage of the comfort space.

column9: Brand new hotel in a growing area of London
column10: This is a brand new hotel in one of London's newest neighborhoods. It is located within one of Europe's largest shopping centers, with great shops and restaurants. The hotel is well organized, and everything inside is brand new. A great place to stay once the Olympic games are over, with good travel connections to Central London and London City Airport.

Stayed here for the weekend on leisure. The location is perfect if you want to combine shopping at Westfield mall and downtown sights as you can choose either Jubileum or Central line to the city. The mall and the Underground are within 5 min walking distance. The sights over the Olympic village are also awesome.Service here was really friendly and our expectations were exceeded by far. Special thanks to Rafael who took care of the  water damage incident in our room really professionally.The breakfast room, and the reception are awsome with view over London city. Unfortunately the selection of breakfast goods was quite narrow, but I guess it¬¥s the concept of Staybridge. If you are used to a wide variety of breakfast products you¬¥ll disappointed. Sorry to say, that the quality of the breakfast was quite poor.Despite of the disappointing breakfast experience I would definitely recommend this hotel both for leisure and business!

We stayed one night as a 50th Birthday Celebration in London.  We had a lovely room with a stunning view on the 12th floor, beautifully furnished with the added bonus of a kitchenette area with fridge and microwave.  The lounge and dining areas are really nice and benefit from the panoramic views over the Olympic Park and the City, particularly stunning at night.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming and the location is just brilliant, adjacent to the Westfield Mall and just a short walk to the rail links.  Only negative point was that we only stayed for one night, just BRILLIANT - hope to return again in the future.

column9: Excellent location and staff, still some teething problems
column10: We stayed with our 2year old daughter for a week during half term. Excellent location next to Westfield mall and staff were all excellent. Beautiful views of the Olympic stadium and breakfast was just perfect with a real homely feel in the lounge. A special mention to Debbie who makes you feel right at home. Kitchen perfect when travelling with younger kids and has all utensils and cutlery provided. Wifi did not work in our room and we had to sit in the reception/lounge area to check email or book any attractions. This will hopefully get sorted out soon and was only reason I did not give 5 stars. Also we were not aware that suites were not serviced at the weekend but as soon as we asked for it to be serviced it was sorted out with a smile within minutes. We will definitely consider staybridge suites again.

I have stayed in different hotels around London, including Holiday Inns/Hiltons/Marriotts/Guomans, and can say that Staybridge Stratford offers one of the best and value for money experience.PLUS sides:- Brand new (as of 2012)- Spacious rooms including kitchen+utensils (maybe it's still new or housekeeping work is good, there is no strange odour due to a kitchen in room)- Complimentary internet and breakfast (but pretty basic, hot choices include scrambled egg/bacon/hash brown/tomato)- Extremely polite and helpful staff- Cosy reception area with fabulous view overlooking the Olympic Park, accompanied by 24 hour complimentary tea+coffee.- Cheaper than the averagel rates of mainstream London hotels- proximity to Stratford tube station, can get to Central London within 20 mins via Central line.- plenty of shops and restaurants around as the hotel is within the Westfield Stratford City shopping complexDOWN sides- really cant think of any. Maybe its apparent out of centre location.I will definitely return!

We stayed for two nights last week after the jubilee and found the staff very welcoming and a clean new immaculate room. The view across the Olympic park was spectacular especially at night.On Thursday the manager's welcome party was excellent, we loved the reception area and enjoyed a nice glass of wine and snacks while we took in the splendid view. Breakfast was delicious and varied including a full fry up, with very attentive and friendly staff who really could not do enough to please.The whole concept makes you feel as though you are at home, very comfortable and relaxed. With the Westfield centre just below and very good transport links to central London this is an ideal base and we will definitely be back.

column9: Great location and brand spanking new!
column10: We've just stayed for the Jubilee weekend - I wanted to combine shopping at the mall with seeing the royal pageant on the Thames. The suites are ideal - much more comfortable than a regular hotel room due to all the conveniences that have been included - the kitchen area, the laundry room, the included hot buffet breakfast, the 'pantry', the coffee and tea on tap. All with incredible views and then when you tire of the those, popping downstairs to Westfield, with its myriad of shops and restaurants. I had concerns that it was too far out of central London but there are multiple ways of getting about. At one end of the mall, near M&S is Stratford station and the tube line. The central line takes about 25 mins to Tottenham Court Road. At the other end of the mall near Waitrose is Stratford International and its super train, the 'Javelin'. For about ¬£5 you can be at St Pancras in 6 minutes! This is going to be a great service during the Olympics.So, in summary, I'd stay here every time I visit the city now. The staff are lovely, the location fabulous, the transport a doddle and the suite just great. It's better than a home from home.

column9: Awesome views of city and Olympic Park
column10: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel excellent with a few exceptions.  Had trouble getting clean towels.  Also we weren't able to use the phone in our room.  The fire alarm went off several times and startled us while we were napping.  Apparently a technician was doing some work we assume since the hotel is so new but would have appreciated a heads-up.  We thoroughly enjoyed the terrace with views of the Olympic venues and the city not to mention the view from our room.  We did have some trouble finding the hotel since most people in the area hadn't heard of it and we weren't aware that it is in the same building with Holiday Inn.  We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in this part of the city.  Westfield Mall is excellent also.

My husband and I had a great stay last Saturday. Great location overlooking the Olympic stadium and perfect for Westfield. Staff really friendly and genuine. Room modern, brand new and really well equipped. Breakfast varied and of good quality. I would stay again and find other Staybridge Suites hotels.

We stayed over the weekend two adults and three children. We had an excellent welcome from all the staff, Tim and Teresa who were attentive and genuine. Hotel being very new is Clean and smart. The lounge and balcony area is a perfect retreat from shopping. Car parking is great if you park in car park B and look for signs by lifts for Staybridge.We a have a couple of interconnecting rooms, beds comfy and apple TV in all rooms, and small kitchens. Views great of the Olympic park, and Westfield shopping centre is below for shops and restaurants. We would highly recommend hotel.

column9: New hotel with amazing view over london skyline and great staff
column10: This is a brand new hotel, in the place to be for 2012. The hotel is located on an amazing shopping centre, where you can shop till you drop, next to the Olympic Park. Even more amazing is the spectacular views over the Olympic park and the London skyline. This is a must see!But the best thing about hotel is the large room with full kitchen, the great free breakfast and above that all an incredible friendly staff.The hotel does not real restaurant but there is a Holiday Inn below this hotel, with a very good and affordable menu and a very nice terrace.  Also a good place for a late evening drink.

Stayed here overnight during the week with my teenage daughter. We paid ¬£140 for a king studio, complete with small kitchenette, desk, sitting area and ensuite bathroom. Everything smelt and looked brand-new. What a treat! Sadly we were out in the evening and missed the complimentary wine and cheese evening for guests-Tues-Thurs at 6.30 pm, but we did sample the hot buffet breakfast the next morning. This included juices, tea/coffee, fresh fruit, cereal, yoghurt, pastries, bacon, eggs, hash browns and beans. The reception, pantry (for guest supplies) and restaurant areas are on the 12th floor with fabulous views over London and the Olympic Park. A laundry room is situated close to reception, and all the rooms are supplied with their own iron and ironing-board. The staff are a real asset-friendly and professional and determined to make each guest feel valued and appreciated. We were offered a late check-out and storage for our luggage while we went shopping at the amazing Westfield Stratford centre-175,000 m2 of retail space! Stratford International and the underground station are just minutes away. Can't wait to go back-it was a real joy to stay here!

column9: Outstanding - Can't wait to go back
column10: The best stay in a hotel in London by a mile.  From the moment i arrived the staff were excellent.  i arrived very early and before normal check-in time but was able to leave my bags.  i arrived back at the hotel quite late the same evening and the staff were extremely helpful and the check-in process very efficient.  The room itself was outstanding, you have your own kitchen which is great, hairdryer, iron - everything you need really.  The room was very clean and plenty of towels and the usual soaps available etc. I'll definitely be back to stay there again.  Great connections between Statford and Liverpool Street so you can be in central London pretty quickly.As an added bonus there's great views of the Olympic Park and a great shopping centre on the doorstep.What more can i say!

column9: Fantastic! Everyone made us feel right at home!
column10: Fantastic stay in this new hotel. The views over the Olympic Park are breathtaking especially at night! The staff were fantastic, really made us feel welcome and went out of their way to make sure the kids were happy too! A lovely friendly relaxed atmosphere all round. I booked my next trip on business before I left the hotel. This week I have had the pleasure of joining the after work receptions, the hotel serves free wine, beer, soft drinks and nibbles to guests on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays. After a hard days work it was great to unwind with colleagues over a beer. I will definitely be back again and recommend to other colleagues.I'm following them on Facebook too!

column9: A gem in the East London
column10: Staybridge has done it again! Great location, 15 minute from central london on central line. Suites are well equipped with great technology...AppleTV...Amazing beds and baths, and the greatest bonus is the kitchen. Waitrose and M&S on your doorstep, open till late, those nights when you just want to stay in to finish your report or watch a movie, you can cook for yourself in your own privacy. Canary Wharf is stone away...and you can see the Olympic Stadium from your room. Very friendly and efficiant staff....and if you are staying in mid week, complimentary wine and cheese is not to miss. Tip: Sunny mornings, you can have your breakfast on the terrace over looking to the Olympic stadium!

What a marvelous hotel! Not only is it the closest you'll get to attending the Olympics (without a ticket) but the service is EXCEPTIONAL. Incredibly friendly and super helpful staff and rather stylish rooms to boot. Great transport links and the fabulous Westfield mall closeby.  I will certainly be staying there again.

Comfortable, homely (without the chores) fully equiped, light, friendly staff and what an amazing view!  On top of that you have a brilliant shopping centre seconds away.  Wouldn't want to stay enywhere else!

Wonderful stay in this new hotel! Great location (the best possible view on London olympic site!), beautiful rooms (design, but cosy), many possibilities (shopping & restaurants). Staff was particularly kind and professional!

Its neat and the scandinavian design shows in its simplicity and minimalism. But the rooms are slim and fit and not generous. Some business travellers may miss the lighting that we need to work from our rooms.

Service was excellent from check in to check out, food was great and the rooms are stylish. Great transport links to get around also. We booked this through secret escapes and would do the same again for the price we paid!

Lovely decorated room with lots of small additions not usually found in hotel rooms, such as wireless chargers, tablets for ordering room service etc. Generally very clean apart from some dark hairs on the shower walls and floor. Only other negative comment would be that the reception staff were over familiar, which I find quite awkward and intrusive. It's also not necessary for reception staff to show you to your room, or they should at least ask rather than just do it. Finally room service pushed the trolly all the way in to the room which was also unexpected and awkward as someone was in bed. I would expect them to ask if they are ok to come all the way in first.

column9: lovely stay apart from a couple of things!
column10: My partner and I stayed here for our 12th year anniversary last Friday as we are local and have seen the hotel being built over the years! They upgraded us to a bigger room which was lovely! Very clean (apart from some blood on our bathroom door which I guess is easily missed as they are sliding doors). They left us a lovely cake and message which was also lovely! Before we arrived I preordered a bottle of prosecco (which was meant to be a surprise until they mentioned it in front of my partner at reception) and so we waited not long and it came to the room. They even told us it was complimentary which again was very kind! Annoyingly it was then charged to my room and I only knew once we had left, such a shame as we ordered another few bottles, had dinner and breakfast there too! I tried to email just to ask but didn‚Äôt hear back. Overall a lovely stay with lovely modern decor. Would possibly be back but maybe not for an anniversary!

This is a great hotel in the former London Olympic park, currently being revitalised. The hotel was very stylish throughout and has very nice communal areas - including a roof terrace that would be fabulous in the Summer. All the basics were covered: comfy bed, great linen, spotless rooms and a nice bathroom. There were other facilities in the room however that other hotels have been slow to adopt. Most notably Apple TV mirroring which allowed us to watch Netflix etc on the rooms TV, via our smartphone. There were a few niggly issues but I would put them down to teething troubles as the hotel is very new. That said the customer service was some of the best I have experienced in the UK and the staffs attempts to correct the aforementioned issues mean I would not hesitate to stay here again.

5 star service !!! Truely amazing, only downside no kettle in room only coffee machine. Beautiful hotel. Precall before arriving, shown to room, room was spotless,wonderful food,a perfect london hotel

column9: Pleasant and helpful and great location
column10: Thoroughly enjoyable stay. Room good. Helpful and friendly staff. Hotel is right beside Stratford International Station and minutes away from Central London by train. Also yards away from a major shopping centre. Rooms are surprisingly quiet.Any improvements? The tea/coffee maker produces tea that tastes of coffee as remnants stay in the system, so drink coffee or do without. I have not yet received the promised invoice by email, but I would be very happy to stay here again
I stayed for work and I was also on crutches due to an injury.The staff were really helpful and the hotel was very well designed and extremely comfortable.Would like to return injury free!Great stay

The rooms are brand new and beautifully decorated in muted type scandi style. Beds are really comy - I stay here for work now regularly and always sleep well. The Allegra restaurant is pricey but worth it for the standard of food and the hotel staff can't do enough to help. My new favourite hotel in London.

Staff were absolutely incredible from start to finish, I would highly highly recommend the stay as i was treated so well, especially as I needed to move from one area to this hotel. The staff were especially helpful in conversation about the hotel.The hotel is close to West Ham stadium and tube station.

column9: Brilliant, just a couple of let downs
column10: Only a one night stay, but the rooms were clean, nicely decorated, modern and above all, comfortable. Complimentary cocktails in the bar as part of our deal. Nothing was too much trouble and a pleasant surprise to find a dog friendly hotel in London! Well situated for links in to London via the tube, and Westfield shopping centre is literally on your doorstep. Drove down and parked in the Stratford international car park next door. Booked ahead and paid just ¬£12.60 for over 24hours!! I‚Äôve paid more that that for 9 hrs in a car park in Leicester!!Couple of small gripes, evening music in the open lobby area was way too loud making normal conversations a bit of a chore whilst trying to enjoy some nibbles and drinks,and one of our breakfast waitresses had rather a ‚Äúcan‚Äôt be bothered‚Äù attitude towards serving..... shame. Our breakfast was complimentary and though no refills of coffee and juice were offered it was a very filling breakfast and certainly left neither of us wanting!Definitely coming back

We were very warmly greeted on arrival and staff continued to provide friendly, welcoming and helpful service during our stay, in particular Inge, who hugely added to our enjoyment with her polite, ever cheerful personality and professionalism.Our large room was excellent with an extremely comfortable bed and soft bed linen, excellent technological bias and wonderful shower with a plentiful supply of lovely toiletries.Train noise can be heard from the room but was not a particular problem.The corridors are very peaceful and quiet and the modern Scandinavian decor was fresh and welcoming. We tried the Brasserie and enjoyed our meal from the short but adequate menu choices. It was lovely to sit by the fire enjoying a nightcap in the relaxing bar.We did have breakfast one morning. Again the staff were superb - a unique selling point at the hotel and much appreciated. Breakfast was slightly pricey; the pastries not particularly fresh or tasty and the coffee not over hot so a slight let down to an otherwise superb stay. We would definitely return.

"All that glitters is not gold".  A question mark hangs over this place for me.  Potentially prejudice or bias against a certain race!  Enough said.  What every customer  seeks is a consistent message from one establishment.  If I ask you a question, I expect a clear message to help me make a decision.  Here I received various messages only to be let down or put off by offering excessive pricing at the last minute.  Won't be staying here anytime soon.  There are other alternatives in the same area.  I doubt very much you will get what you pay for.

column9: Efficient service but breakfast service is odd
column10: Excellent hotel with very clean and good quality rooms and bathrooms. I stayed in a medium room which for one person was great.The hotel is far from the city center but well connected by train. The Westfield shopping center is next door and there are nice bars and restaurants in the area.For the cost of the room and breakfast, I felt a bit short changed on the breakfast service. It is not a buffet and you have to select any one item from a small menu. We were later told as a special case we could have anything from the menu but the restaurant staff were still unclear. I ended up eating the exact same breakfast for 5 days. The breakfast is freshly cooked so service is very slow and not ideal if you are on business. The coffee was usually cold and watery.Other than the breakfast service a great hotel to stay with extremely friendly staff and efficient service. A lot of the services are app based so its very useful as you can schedule your room cleaning services, ask for services, use your phone as a key, etc all from the app. Shout out to Anna at reception for a great warm welcome.

We stayed here for one night as we were going to a concert at the O2. Very new and fancy hotel, lovely cocktails and continental breakfast! Extremely comfy bed! A great secret escapes deal which was definitely worth the stay. Right next to Stratford tube station and Westfield shopping centre and only 15 minutes to O2!

Lovely new hotel in a great location near to the Westfield Shopping Centre and with very easy access to all the sights. Great transport links available. Bedroom was lovely and there is a very well equipped gym available also.

Excellent hotel, good location for us as it was close to our daughter, the Westfield shopping centre and onltya 20 minute tube ride to central London...... and we discovered that is dog friendly; what a bonus for our next trip. Comfortable room and super beds.Downsides?  Only a couple of minor gripes, The music in the lobby / bar area was unnecessarily loud on the Sunday evening. We had to give up about 8.30pm and retire to our room.We had an inclusive continental breakfast rate which was more than sufficient for our needs, only issues for us was that there were no ‚Äútop ups‚Äù of coffee and juices offered and one one of our waitresses was a little surly and unhelpful in her attitude.Otherwise brilliant and will definitely be coming back to the The Stratford

Thank you for my stay on Sunday night. Travelling alone for business I could not have asked for more - comfortable, safe environment. Thoughtful, engaged and motivated staff, beautiful building and facilities. I am looking to book again for a stay in December and will recommend to my business colleagues. Food was stunning. Many thanks, Jamie C

The Stratford Hotel is very modern and only a stones throw from Westfield Shopping Centre with London Stadium a 10 minute walk. The front desk staff were excellent and always treated us with a smile and a hello and super pleasant to chat with. We were fortunate enough to spend some time with the front desk manager and the G.M. they are two exceptionally pleasant men who were very down to earth. Our room was a good size and the beds were very good with pillows like clouds that you just sank into. We had breakfast included in our stay which was a man size English breakfast which was that good we didn‚Äôt mind missing lunch. The brassiere staff were very punctual and pleasant and our meals were delivered quickly. Overall one of the best place we have stayed at and we have travelled to many places in the world. I would highly recommend staying there to anyone

I write many reviews and believe when you're paying for a service you should not be disappointed. Normally I can find fault with hotels or restaurants, however on this rare occasion I have to say that the hotel was exceptional. I phoned to find out about parking and my call was answered straight away with a very professional employee. I then called back again as I was having trouble booking through secret escapes and the reservation team were extremely professional and helpful. When entering the hotel we were greeted by the concierge and accompanied to reception. Check in was faultless and quick despite arriving an hour before check in time. After seeing the room we had been allocated we decided to ask for a room with a better view. This was no trouble for reception and the lovely lady came with us to check the new view was ok with us. The room was immaculate and extremely comfortable. The bed was queen size and the owners have really paid attention to detail. Every aspect of the room was perfect. The only thing that I would change is having drinking water in the room as It was something I had to go to the bar for. The breakfast was delicious and I'd definitely recommend it. I'd also definitely recommend this hotel. The staff are very friendly and the service is second to none.

I booked a room for my Daughter and her partner for their Birthdays this week. The messages from the hotel prior to the stay from Kornelija were exceptional, so friendly and courteous.On arrival at the hotel they were greeted by the warm and friendly receptionists.They were taken to the room and were shown everything in detail.They had a stunning room, a lovely personal note and birthday cake plus a bottle of Prosecco.It is an extremely impressive modern hotel, and the staff certainly know how to look after their guests.Breakfast consisted of a lovely selection of fresh food and the staff again were attentive.All round amazing, a big thank you to everyone!

We had a 1 night stay here in the Studio on the 6th floor. The staff are very friendly, the room was very clean, the design of the room was amazing and the food was brilliant. To wake up to a beautiful sunrise in a very comfy bed was perfect. We went for a 3 course dinner at the Brasserie and it was a lovely meal. Thank you for having us!

Hotel is very modern clean and comfortable. However no ice machine, no vending machines, only one bar and only one restaurant in hotel with limitations. No microwave and no hot pot in the room. It was a luxury bedroom. Very close to a huge mall just steps away and the train.  Rita, one of the floor attendants required us to depart the public lobby lounge after a specific time.  Very unexpected and not accommodating.

I've stayed at The Stratford several times now and I would highly reccomend it. The staff are always so kind, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are a good size and incredibly comfortable. I always sleep so well when staying at The Stratford and despite my room looking out onto the busy road the soundproofing is great. Technology is used really well and I particulaly love that you can request room service and much more through the tablet in your room or via the app on your phone.  I'm often here whilst on bussiness so fast internet and a good work space is important to me but The Stratford has got both covered - quick and stable internet connection and a good sized desk and chair in the room.  If you are looking for a hotel to stay at in Stratford don't bother looking at the other hotels as this is by far the best and in such a brilliant location for transport and shopping.  Look forward to my next stay here later in the year.

The staff are fantastic all over the hotel, great Modern danish design.Best veggie sausage I‚Äôve ever had down in the brassiere for breakfast, lovely atmosphere at night with people chilling around the giant glass fronted open fireplace. We drank cocktails up at the 2nd floor bar while  dj‚Äôs span tunes at the wknd... oh & did I mention the restaurants? Wow wow wowA must visit hotel if you love cool contemporary luxury...

Superb design, high spec.Staying at The Stratford was a welcome surprise. High spec rooms, modern design, brand new.Special thanks to excellent Front of House staff, Salvatore and Greg. Who kindly showed us our room and how to work the coffee machine. Also for changing our room to a larger quiet room. Nice to have Front of House staff keen to go the extra mile and interact with guests, thank you guys!I recommend the breakfast in the Brasserie. Delicious granola and muesli, highly recommend the poached eggs and avocado.All served in a stylish setting.We will definitely stay at The Stratford on our next trip from London City airport.

A great new design hotel in stratford. Beautifully designed, fabulous rooms, great staff and the food was amazing.Located literally at the door of stratford international train station so anyone heading out on the eurostar is only 6 mins from St Pancras.Will definitely return, a beautiful hotel

Celebrating 6 years with my partner. The Stratford was the perfect location. It was our second time visiting, this time staying in the new hotel and it definitely did not disappoint. The decor is absolutely exquisite.The room was perfect, the hotel food was perfect, the restaurant was perfect. All facilities are everything you need and more.Not to mention the WestField centre right on your doorstep! With other restaurants, shopping and even a cinema.The staff were amazing, especially Elisa and Inga. We loved how friendly the reception staff were they made us feel right at home and couldn‚Äôt have been any more helpful and attentive. Thank you to the staff and chef in the restaurant, Allegra for giving us the best service and most incredible meal. The food was out of this world. I already can‚Äôt wait to return and if I could become a regular customer I definitely would. Unfortunately it‚Äôs quite a trip for us but even still, 100% worth it. Both my partner and I hope to visit The Stratford Hotel again soon. I thank you for making our stay so unbelievably special. It was honestly the most perfect few days away! Regards, Kira Marie x

Good modern hotel but did have to wait 40 minutes for breakfast and had a cracked cup in our bedroom so liquid was leaking and why do hotels always scrimp on breakfast tea bags only had one until we asked for more

A friend booked the Hotel for my friends and I, eight in all, five rooms. From our arrival we had friendly but professional welcome and great service from everyone working at the Hotel. The rooms were very comfortable and bathrooms had good lighting (a normal bugbear is poor lighting). As this a newly opened Hotel, all usb, plug sockets etc, in place to make life easy. Hotel had a lovely atmosphere in the main lounge and dining areas. We had a really enjoyable overnight stay.

column9: Good location near to transport/shopping/football, modern, large, friendly staff
