column10: We enjoyed our stayIt's right next to the Westfield centre in Stratford and the various train stationsEasy access through the centre to Olympic parkVery modern with large rooms, good facilitiesWe were upgraded to a mini suite with connecting doorsThe mini suite would be good for business meetings etcFriendly staff, nothing was too much trouble

The Stratford Hotel is an absolute gem, modern and vibrant with great rooms and great facilities. It is ideally situated close to Stratford International DLR and next to the Westfield Shopping Centre.The hotel has subtle but extremely professional security providing a reassuring ambience which puts one at ease straight away; so if you‚Äôre residing or just popping in for a coffee or meal in the very reasonably priced restaurant you‚Äôll feel relaxed and secure.  I have stayed here twice in the last month and it is the staff who make the stay there so terrific. From managers Ashley and Tommy, to Inga on reception and Simon working security all of the staff go above and beyond to ensure all patrons are completely catered for.  Highly recommended, I will definitely stay here again.

column9: Loved my stay here. Will stay again soon
column10: Ive been to the Stratford Brasserie a couple of times but hadn‚Äôt stayed on the Hotel itself. I had a lovely time here. My Boyfriend loved it too. I like the fact that breakfast is freshly made to order, to be honest... there‚Äôs nothing to complain about . Hope to stay there again soon.

This hotel is amazing! Such friendly staff who showed me what the rooms were like to see if I would have liked to upgrade (I asked, this wasn‚Äôt pushed). I went for the Stratford studio which was just amazing! The room smelt amazing and it was so spacious! Shame that I could have been on the 4/5 floor as they were being painted! So I was on the third floor. However the manager on site was very helpful (along with another lady), and she took my suitcase up for me. Free standing bath and you can watch the world go by! The price of the room in my opinion should have included it, but the breakfast was amazing!(even if they did forget the beans!) Everything could be ordered on a tablet which was by the bed! Plenty of toiletries and it wasn‚Äôt the small amount you get in most hotels either! They also take a ¬£50 deposit when checking in. There is the Stratford international car park which is just past the hotel which cost about ¬£6.50 (I arrived at 3pm and left at 11am) which is more reasonable than the parking in Stratford shopping centre!The tv kept turning off for some reason and the lighting could have been a bit simpler! Even if there was a tutorial or guidance I think it would have helped! The staff cannot next faulted!

In short this is a very nice Hotel ,ideally situated to the Olympic park and shopping facilities with very helpful and welcoming staff. However I can not justify the advertised ¬£300+ room rate, We paid a lot less ! I would stay again.Now more detailed .The wife and I stayed at this location over the weekend of the 25th Oct 19. And the overall experience was vary good. Being a recently opened (Jun 2019) hotel it was clean and tidy and well presented as you would expect a new place to be.The staff on arrival was very welcoming  and as the reception was tucked away we was gladly escorted by the concierge to it. The reception staff was very helpful e.g.  after check in they took us to our room and told us more about the facilities of the room and hotel.The room has some additional  features e.g. a free wifi tablet and  mini bar with additional packages to make the stay more pleasurable  if you get meaning!!!The bed was comfortable and although right next to the DLR and International rail station there was very little train noise heard.Although we never used the Bar or Restaurant facilities the food we saw on the ground floor restaurant looked very good. There is a  restaurant / bar on the 6th floor with a terrace, which we visited just for the view. it is nicely laid out with large rolling desk chairs around the outside (On rails) and on a sunny day this would be very pleasant to be sat in. Overall this is a very good experience,

column9: Perfect. Already booked for next month.
column10: + great location; 8 mins to kings cross+ fantastic condition of rooms; large bright and stylish+ good value parking for London+ excellent front desk; very friendly and polite + nothing to complain about; I‚Äôve already booked my stay for next month!!

column9: Lovely hotel, friendly staff and great location.
column10: Lovely new hotel, rooms well thought out, total relaxation. Staff really friendly and helpful. Regularly stay in Strafford and this is now the first hotel I look to book. Highly recommend this hotel when staying in Stratford.

column9: Well appointed hotel with excellent gym
column10: Convenient to public transit to Central London and especially convenient to London City Airport (15 min away on the DLR) this new hotel provides solid value, well appointed modern rooms, and several dining options including a casual brasserie on the lobby level and a chef driven restaurant Allegra on the 7th floor.  These are restaurants that happen to be in a hotel and attract a local crowd, not ‚Äúhotel restaurants‚Äù.   The wild mushroom toast with poached eggs at breakfast was excellent.Highlight for me was the excellent gym facility on the mezzanine level  - open 24 hours with modern equipment and a broad variety of machines and never very crowded.  For some reason hotel gyms are hard to come by in London but the Stratford‚Äôs offering was first rate.They are still working out some kinks as a new property but staff were friendly and helpful and overall my stay was superb.

As a West Ham fan who lives between Lincolnshire and Spain and stays in Stratford for every home game with either his two sons or as part of a larger group I am glad to have discovered this new hotel which is a class above the others in the area.

Stayed one night so we could have an evening out with friends in Stratford. The staff are wonderful, the room very well presented and comfortable and the whole experience a delight. We spent the late evening in the bar that was a perfect end to a great day - top notch service and an excellent DJ. Nice to not have to check out until 12.00 the next day allowing a gentle start to enjoy a lovely breakfast.

Wow. Super impressed with The Stratford. One night stay in Oct 2019 and found that it was understated for its simplicity, beauty and functionality. From a very subtle hideaway reception (special mention to Inga, who was really pleasant) to the opulence of roof terraces. It is the simple, clean styled but more importantly super efficient operationally. Rooms are packed with great tech functionality and it is in a great location for London and UK exploration. Great work

column9: Our go to restaurant and hotel
column10: Love this place...brilliant location. Rooms are stylish and immaculate. Beds are divine. Staff are friendly and professional. The breakfast is 1st class. The restaurant downstairs is where we have eaten a fair few times! ...the food is incredible...try the cod cheeks they're amazing! Oh and the Romenero peppers ...oh and the scallops. The shared steak platter is immense! I could go on...I'm working my way through the menu! And then you are a stones throw from Stratford Westfield and the train station just perfect! Enjoy!

We were off to see Cher at the 02. The Stratford is the premium hotel in the area. The hotel is brand spanking new. Beautifully decorated rooms, amazing service (such well-trained staff). We had brunch in the brasserie with a G&T, being a vegan I was worried that the options would be limited, like most hotels. However the selection was great, cauliflower burger to die for. The transport options are amazing, DLR, Stratford International, Jubilee line. Plus the shopping at Westfield was worth spending the whole weekend.  I work in Hammersmith and was at my desk in 50 minutes. Amazing will be back.

Fabulous hotel, it was the best decision to stay here on our recent trip. Location was great underground a few minutes away and rail service a minute away. Rooms are very comfortable and clean size of the rooms are brilliant. Staff we very friendly and obliging could not fault anyone. Special mention to Federica the lounge manager and Michaelangelo, it was such a pleasure to meet you both and seeing you every morning was a great way to start the day both of these staff members went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed we our stay. We will certainly be checking back in when next in London. Thankyou so much Stratford Hotel.

Welcoming hotel with beautiful rooms and facilities friendly staff, who are all eager to attend to your request, A good choice on the menu for breakfast, I did feel there was a slight lack of knowledge of what was required for the table

Beautiful minimalist clean hotel. Fairly spacious for a medium room. We made use of the bar on the mezzanine one evening and lobby lounge for coffee on our final day. Could not fault anything! Just a few steps to Westfield shopping and Stratford International for high speed rail which is amazing. Would love to stay again!

Fantastic luxury hotel. The staff is very kind and helpful. The breakfast is very good. The room is Clean, modern and the bed is comfortable.Nice place near the mall and underground. Close to center city, around 10min with underground.Nothing to add !!

Front he start the staff were amazing and I highly recommend this as a great place to stay. Arrived early and they were able to arrange room for me before check-in. The service and accommodation was perfect. Well done.

Hotel staff very professional and attentive we were upgraded to a larger room which was appreciated only thing was the dark bathroom not so great for applying make-up apart from that great hotel and location

A special trip deserved a special location to stay. The Stratford Hotel gave us that. Stylish, very comfortable and extremely friendly staff. The room and its facilities were excellent and made for a good nights sleep. Thanks for making it a good stay.

I enjoyed my weekend stay there. I was able to check in early and they staff walked me up to give me a tour of the room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and very clean as well. The staff were amazing and really friendly. I will definitely be going back!

The staff were very friendly and the hotel had a lovely relaxing feel. The rooms were very well equipped, comfortable and quiet with lovely REN products in the bathroom. Parking was next door in the station multi-storey which was convenient and well priced. Travelling back to the hotel was a little tricky at night once the DLR had been closed so we had to get a taxi back from Stratford station to the hotel. Overall a very lovely stay and would recommend.

Just enjoyed a two night stay at this very modern and classy hotel The service and staff were top classYou must try the baked eggs for breakfast they are deliciousThe Allegra restaurant on the 7th floor is a hidden gem,class food,service,highly recommended üëå

Excellent reception and excellent facilities Keep it upThe beds are excellentThe furniture are new and elegant The staff attitude ; oh mineThe food ; kudos to the cheffThe environment is friendly and quiet.I look forward to coming back.I highly reccommend other travellers.

column9: Fabulous place to stay - clean, fresh, modern, a delight
column10: Courteous staff, fabulous rooms with excellent little extras that made the whole experience fabulous. Ease of access by DLR and close to places including Excel, O2 etc. I would highly recommend staying here and will definitely use again every time I am in the area.

Stayed at The Straford for 1 night in a medium room with outward window view ( of westfields and train station), we also had dinner and breakfast. Absolutely loved our stay, the hotel decor is minimalist but still artistic with a luxurious feel. Our bathroom was beautiful with a shower head and rain shower feature above - the bathrooms also come with REN products which is a brand that I love.The bed was extremely comfortable, definitely made it hard to get out of in the morning!Loved that checkout was at 12pm - would definitely go back and recommend for couples!

column9: Lovely hotel and ideal for the O2
column10: Stayed for one night as we were going to the O2. It‚Äôs 20 mins on the tube and Stratford is a lovely area, so ideal location. The hotel is clean. The room was gorgeous (we were upgraded on arrival), the facilities in the room were perfect, room service for breakfast was fantastic and easy to order, staff were really friendly and helpful. For London, the price of the room was very reasonable (the mini bar is expensive but we didn‚Äôt use it). We go to Stratford a lot as my sister lives there but we will definitely be using this hotel again. Fab night away.

Great stay, clean/spacious room, staff extremely attentive, only negative I would say is while I was there a fire alarm test happened and I was not notified so assumed it was real came to reception and was told it was a false test alarm, other than that would highly recommend!! Will be returning for sure.

Quite a new Hotel - but offers a wide range of plus points and reasons for staying in Stratford. Easy parking next door to hotel - book in advance or pay per day for just ¬£6.30. The overground train service runs every 20 minutes and gets you to St Pancras International in 6 minutes!! The Westfield Centre and surrounding streets offer a cosmopolitan choice of bars, restaurants, shops that cater for just about everything.  The Stratford is stylishly modern and the staff are friendly and helpful. This will be our destination hotel when visiting London - it makes complete sense! Oh ... and dog friendly!

Anna and Rita on reception have absolutely just made my week - warmest, friendly service and the most beautiful room! Could not recommend more - will definitely be returning. Rooms are large, very clean and so nice. Thank you!!

Excellent friendly staff in all areas including bar and restaurant Clean immaculate roomsSpacious in central areas car parking next doorsBreakfast great with good choiceMany good features Albeit near station no noise from trains will definitely visit again anytime

I stay in this area for work from time to time and this is by far the best Hotel in the area.Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. There was a query over whether the business had pre-paid or I had to pay on checkout and all of it was handled brilliantly by the receptionist.The room was gorgeous and felt luxurious. A lovely handwritten note from ‚ÄòTash‚Äô who had presumably made up the room and fresh fruit had been left for me to have.The team in the restaurant couldn‚Äôt have been more attentive at breakfast. I‚Äôll definitely stay again.

column9: One of the best hotels in London by far!
column10: Absolutely stunning! Lovely staff and a great location with the Stratford underground and Westfield literally on your doorstep, plenty to do inside and out of the hotel, its brand new, clean modern and stylish, really enjoyed our stay here and cant wait to go back again. Breakfast was lovely! Only downside is the showers are not very powerful at all.. but everything else 10 out of 10!

I felt at home straight away, greeted by staff on arrival. The hotel is right next to Stratford International station and walking distance from the ‚Äòordinary ‚ÄúStratford station. The room was perfect for my needs and very clean. It‚Äôs also very handy for Westfield Mall. I‚Äôll be staying here next time.

We booked a nights stay on 21st September and I can honestly say that The Stratford is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. A large part of this is down to each and every member of their amazing staff, who helped make our stay so wonderful. The hotel is next to the Westfield Centre, which is fantastic for food, drinks and shopping. Very close to the Olympic stadium/West Ham, and next to Stratford International, so perfect as a base to explore London. On arrival we were greeted by Sue and booked in by Inga. Both made us feel so welcome and the checking in process was very quick and efficient.We were allocated room 505 which was a king sized room. Sue showed us to our room and took great time and care showing us all of the facilities and how to use the room tablet for anything we needed. Our room was a lovely size, very contemporary in design, but still warm and cosy. The rooms have all been designed with great care and thoughtfulness. There were plenty of electrical sockets around the room and on both sides of the bed(even European ones), and a wireless iPhone charger. These were a huge bonus considering a lot of hotels do not take it into consideration. There was a well stocked and very reasonably priced mini bar and snack basket, along with a proper coffee machine. These were all neatly stored away in their own area behind doors. In this area was also a proper hairdryer, as opposed to those things hotels claim are hairdryers, attached to a wall. The wardrobes were of good size, which contained a robe, slippers and hoodie. The bathroom was pristine, with a walk in shower and a lovely range of complementary toiletries that were more akin to a day spa that a hotel. The only thing I could possibly find a fault with is that the water pressure was not so great, and if it was better, then it would be absolutely perfect. We especially loved the many lighting options for the room and bathroom. Unlike other reviews, we loved the movement activated lighting near the bathroom. The light isn‚Äôt bright and it was welcomed in the middle of the night. The bed! The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, and the bedding and pillows were unbelievably comfortable. Along with the black out curtains, thick windows and a great air con system, we had a fantastic nights sleep. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar/restaurant when we returned from our evening out and again, found the staff to be welcoming and friendly. A wonderful range of drinks and cocktails too. We didn‚Äôt eat in the restaurant, but the menu looked lovely. We already had a late check out, but were thrilled when we received a message saying that because of the rain, we could check out at 2pm. This was a lovely touch as we didn‚Äôt want to move! We ordered breakfast in bed and it was cooked to perfection. We very reluctantly had to check out and were helped by yet more friendly staff. I cannot sing the staffs praises enough. Every single member we came across were friendly, polite and helpful. We shall most definitely be returning to The Stratford. Thank you for such a wonderful stay

My daughter and I had a great stay, the staff was very friendly and kind. It s eco friendly how I like, we only had breakfast there but it was so yummy!!! Love the pancakes ü•ûüòã I highly recommend this hotel, no just for business trip but for any occasion, it s a really relaxing stay ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

column9: A stunning visit from start to finish
column10: Amazing hotel! Very clean and beautiful rooms, the staff were lovely and so helpful. Nothing was too much trouble, I highly recommend this hotel!One of my favourite hotels in London - stylish but not pretentious

column9: Lovely hotel-great room, food and facilities
column10: Had a great stay. Lovely room with a comfy bed and stylish decor. Used the gym. Had drinks in the lounge and the bar, and dinner in the brasserie. Perfect for a business stay as I felt safe and comfortable and didn‚Äôt have to leave the hotel, yes still felt I‚Äôd had a lovely, varied evening.

1 night thoroughly enjoyable business stay.6 minutes from St Pancras by trainRoom was excellent; two TVs, comfy bed, nespresso coffee machine, excellent decorStaff were friendly and helpfulFood was lovely (One of the best steaks I‚Äôve had in a while)Received a free cocktail upon arrivalThe hotel has only been open since July, so there is the odd thing you notice that needs tidied up I.e. in the lifts, however do not let this put you off.Highly recommended.

column9: Lovely modern hotel with great rooms
column10: Fantastic hotel right next to Stratford International and Westfield Olympic Park. Really nice rooms with great en-suite. Would love to stay here again for business.Rooms have sockets for all travellers and connections Game consoles. 24 hour gym and amazing restaurant.

column9: Nearly there. Friendly staff let down by one individual.
column10: Check in - speedy and friendlyRoom - plush and comfortable HOWEVERThe backlight in the lower bathroom would not turn off meaning we had to shut our bathroom door in order to sleep in darkness.The design is generally very slick but the design of cupboard doors is a pain because there are no handles. Did the builders forget these?Facilities - We were looking forward to our view and meal at Allegra as promised online but on arrival we were told ir wasn‚Äôt yet open, disappointment here.The downstairs bar was well stocked with a great selection of malt whiskey, wine and local products (try the local pilsner as it‚Äôs very good! Also there‚Äôs is a low alcohol pilsner also made locally which is also good). However the bar was slightly unfinished, perhaps the builders are behind schedule as no light fittings, just concrete.The evening barman (guy with glasses) was fantastic. He was friendly, chatty and was happy to recommend things to suit our tastes. The waitresses were very friendly and accommodating and one member of staff even brought my jacket up to my room as I‚Äôd left it downstairs.Sadly, the staff was let down by one particular member, a bar managed called Pablo. He was arrogant and only seemed to want to serve us after we had changed into slightly smarter dress. He was condescending when handing us the menu, his product knowledge wasn‚Äôt up to scratch. It seemed as if we weren‚Äôt good enough for him until we bought more expensive items. Overall - really enjoyed stay, felt relaxed and comfortable but the said barman really got to me and one was made to feel slightly unwelcome, and once he took over the bar, we retreated to our room. The room had great sound system, tv and entertainment options and minibar nicely stocked. Robes and hoodies for comfort and a nice coffee machine provided. The bed and pillows were comfy and the blackout curtains ensured a good night sleep. If possible ask for higher room for better view. Transport links excellent - would consider returning if management was as friendly as team.

column9: Wonderful drinks party at the Stratford Hotel
column10: On Friday a friend of mine arranged a great wedding night cap at this lovely hotel. I want to say a special thank you to the staff and manager on the night who made every effort to make the evening special and accommodate our party. The bar staff made incredible cocktails which were a great way to close in the evening. The ambiance of the hotel is amazingly stylish and I can highly recommend this location as a haven from the busy streets of Stratford.

Kind and professional staff!!  Clean and comfortable rooms. Great location for work and sight seeing. Quiet location despite being so close to major transportation connections. The gym is excellent!!!!

Very easy to reach the hotel: It is right next to the station and it only took 6 minutes from St Pancras.  Stunning building, beautiful sculpture in courtyard and the interior of the building is great too.  The triple height ceiling is a real WOW factor.  Very friendly staff (went out of their way to make it a special stay), room has everything you need and more, lovely shower.  Food was excellent and can recommend the cocktails - great atmosphere in the open plan lounge. Continental breakfast was super and it was refreshing & nice to have it served (and not have a buffet style breakfast). Will definitely stay here again.

Lovely room, well appointed with lovely fittings. Very relaxing. Staff were fantastic - attentive and helpful. We ate in the hotel in the evening and the food was super. Imaginative menu and lovely breakfast experience too. Will stay here again. Very strategically situated and who can resist all those shops next door?

column9: A Memorable Stay At The Stratford Hotel At Manhattan Loft Gardens
column10: I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Stratford Hotel At Manhattan Loft Gardens and it didn't disappoint.My welcome was warm and inviting and my check-in was seamless.The elegant bedroom was beautiful in appearance, spacious and the decor was very impressive.The bathroom facilities are light, bright and airy and the shower is simply heavenly.The food in the Brasserie was superb and the breakfast options are a certified winner!The hotel is ideally located and less than a two minute walk from Stratford International.In short, a gorgeous looking property with outstanding views and exudes elegance, class, sophistication coupled with first class service from the excellent and friendly staff.

Great stay at The Stratford!  Really impressed with the staff, location and decor.  The in room iPad system for ordering room service was very clever, and I loved the feel and vibe of the hotel.  As some have mentioned - it‚Äôs not quite finished yet, but this should not detract from the experience.

column9: Not sure if it‚Äôs open yet
column10: Firstly the room finish is beautiful, it‚Äôs a lovely piece of design through and through. Amazing finishes and attention to detail is 10/10. The place just is that, a piece of design with little thought for the humans within it. Not much in the way of directions to get places, complicated fixtures & fittings, and zero atmosphere (on a Monday night).We had to call the reception at 00:30 to find out how to switch off the final lights. I feel like there are some bits that just haven‚Äôt been used and these problems have not had a chance to be fixed.Worth a visit but I‚Äôd give it a while for them to think about the needs of the humans inside the hotel and not the ego of the designers who worked on it.

column9: Gorgeous room and the friendliest staff!
column10: Great location, right next to trains and Westfield shopping centre. The staff are hands down some of the friendliest people we have ever met! From walking in, to checking in, to being shown the room and then check out, every stage was greeted with a smile. You could really tell that everyone cared about the guests and would do all they can to make sure all guests are happy. The room was gorgeous. We felt very fancy, that's for sure! The bathroom was beautiful and gave a real sense of relaxation. The windows were ceiling to floor which gave a lovely light into the room. The bed was so comfortable, we didn't wake up once throughout the night and woke up refreshed! We didn't order room service (my fault as I'm vegetarian and although there were options, I'm a bit of a picky eater!) But the menu was great and considering how fancy the hotel is, the prices were really good! They've also got a great system that runs through a tablet in the room where you can order room service throughout the day and night, look at information such as local restaurants, local events and events at the hotel and other services the hotel offers. Will definitely stay here again next time we visit Stratford!

Really enjoyed my stay at The Stratford as did my girlfriend. Comfortable bed, lovely decor, wonderful shower and great use of tech that was easy to use. Staff are super friendly and if i need to come to the area again ill look to stay here.

First time staying at the Stratford recently, fantastic rooms/facilities and really great staff.  A few minutes walk away from the Train station and very close to the Copper box arena. I will definitely stay here again.

Ideal location for East London, adjacent to Stratford International Station and the West field Shopping Centre. Monochrome decor everywhere which is attractive - feels like one is inside an art installation. Breakfast is a-la-carte and we prefer a buffet. Not clear to us (or the staff!) what is included in a bed-and-breakfast booking. There should be separate menus and, surely, modern computers can inform the breakfast reception staff which guests are on which deal (as you have to declare room number when you arrive in the dining room). There were plenty of staff in the dining room; but service was poor - we had to "chase" our order on each of our three day stays.  The food, when it arrived, was delicious, except for the pastries and toast, which was dry and not fresh.All the staff were friendly and helpful.

The lobby was spacious, relaxing and comfortable, and the rooms were stylish and a good size for London. The bathroom was particularly good, with nice facilities and products. Staff were friendly, but seemed to have little to do. The hotel seemed unfinished, with some lack of attention to detail (the handle of the tap came off in my hand, cabling was visible in the corner of the restaurant and a bit of the shelf in the bathroom was hanging off) and it was disappointing that the roof terrace wasn't open, despite being advertised on the website. I did really value the technological integration in the room, though.

Well spec'd one of the main reasons for choosing and everything still as new. Staff couldn't do enough for us and all very nice and no 'wish I wasn't here' attitude. Food good albeit with some early days teething problems. Not wishing to be negative but the biggest disappointment was the roof terrace and restaurant wasn't open yet. The real test is would we go back, yes we, even if it was just for the terrace.

Oh oh oh, we had our honeymoon-visit to this hotel which we selected mostly because of stylish furniture choices and scandinavian design -feelings and boy we didn't get disappointed. Got upgraded room and prosecco waiting for us which was very nice gesture from the hotel!Room were very clean and nicely decorated. Big windows giving to Westfield -shopping center (which is huge if you're into shopping) and to railways. Sun was shining to our room every morning so really can't complain about that. Bathroom was nice and tidy with rain shower.Only things I see someone would be bothered (not us) were sounds of trains passing hotel. And the thing that we can give slight minus were about breakfast, which was in awesome restaurant, but was not easiest to understand what you can order with inclusive breakfast, what you're really getting when ordering something and in our last morning, staff seemed like a couple of trainees compared to earlier experience.But yeah. Highly recommended!

column9: A gem in the heart of East London
column10: We stayed at The Stratford during August with our 5 year old daughter. From the moment you step in the door you can tell the hotel thrives itself on making sure guests have the best possible experience. The place is luxurious in every aspect.The concierge was incredibly helpful to highlight the many things to do around the area and how to get there etc. After check in our bags were taken to our room whilst we had a relaxing drink in the bar; all the staff were all so friendly and attentive and made our little girl feel like a princess. The decor is modern but tasteful and the rooms are not lacking in mod cons. The bed was heavenly and the bath was amazing. We didn‚Äôt eat dinner in the hotel as we were meeting friends but did have breakfast the following morning. The great thing about this place is the food is cooked to order so not sat under a hot plate going hard and dry. You can switch things up to suit your own tastes if there is something you aren‚Äôt keen on. The restaurant staff seemed more than willing to accommodate our specific likes and dislikes. You just have to ask! This was our first time visiting East London and I love it so much more than Central London in terms of atmosphere. The hotel is really well positioned next to the station and the shopping centre. Well done to the management at the Stratford who are clearly working incredibly hard to make this new hotel a success. We can‚Äôt wait to come back soon.

Is already a lovely modern hotel but sure will be even better when fully completed (Did not interfere with our stay in any way)Great for anyone wanting a top class hotel for the London Stadium!You can just step off the train  into the hotel.

From the moment we arrived the staff were amazing, nothing was too much trouble. We were upgraded to a room with a bath and we had a great nights sleep in the lovely queen size bed. The staff on reception were so helpful and we would definitely stay again. Many thanks.

Arrived at the hotel and staff were keen to help and park our bikes. I‚Äôd stressed we wanted a twin room which wasn‚Äôt quite ready. Of to register at the excel we went. Asked the crew to please clean the floor between the beds we wanted to separate. Chased later at night and someone finally appeared with a hoover late at night. Rooms are lovely , comfy beds and mattresses. Bathrooms well appointed. Our view was of the loading dock, not everyone‚Äôs cup of tea but I quite liked it. Liked the tablet in room for info and a great TV. Do think you can get much better for money locally (holiday inn, premier lodge etc.)if you book far in advance.

column9: Fancy but not for me - a soulless place.
column10: The hotel was easy to get to from central London by main line services and next to the Westfield shopping centre, for restaurants. The hotel was difficult to find from the station, as the signage couldn't be seen, but reception was pleasant and we were  even personally showed to our room - a very nice touch. Our room was pleasant and had all the amenities you would expect. I slept extremely well - the bed was lovely and it was like sleeping in a cloud!Breakfast was unusual, in that it was all made to order. As we had paid for breakfast in the price, we were given a selection of things we could choose from. This seemed both mean and wasteful, as we were given items we didn't want, yet couldn't have other things we wanted without paying extra. I felt this hotel was aimed at the trendy hipster market, rather than me and my hubby. It all looked lovely, but it had no soul or anything really to make it stand out. Apart from breakfast I couldn't fault it, hence the 4 star review. We had a good deal, as the hotel was new, but at full price i wouldn't return to this pricey, soulless place.

column9: Nice room and staff but shockingly bad experience in the brasserie
column10: Lovely staff and hotel room, although we did need the maintenance man to turn the temp down on the shower as it was fixed at burning hot.  But it was the service and food i the brasserie that will make me avoid this hotel in future, overpriced food that a pub could do better at, no whole prawns in the prawn linguine and when they got my order wrong they left my friend with his so i had to watch him eat while i waited a further 20 minutes for mine... compensation a drink oh wow.. and i still got charged full price for the meal! Wont return.

Stayed here prior to riding the Prudential Ride London 100. Hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly with complimentary bar drink on arrival. Very nicely decorated and the room was very comfortable with everything you‚Äôd expect. The hotel even has secure bike storage which is a bonus if you choose to stay there for future PRL100 events.

column9: Great location and even better Hotel.
column10: Beautiful hotel, recently completed. Everything was brand new and staff were super friendly and helpful! Location close to Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre was ideal. Keep up the good work. Will definitely return!

The Hotel is new and very clean. My room overlooked the rail tracks and the back of the Westfield complex but it was quiet in my room. The room was comfortable although I had to look to find the coffee maker. It could be clearer what is free for guests as the coffee and tea are but the biscuits aren‚Äôt. A kettle was brought promptly when requested. I slept like a top. Wi-fi was excellent. Breakfast, smoked haddock scones, different, delicious and the poached eggs cooked to perfection. Thank you.

column9: We enjoyed your service pretty well.
column10: Everything is good with modern amenities.Actually it was an impressive experience we accrue from your benign services. But one thing is that we didn't get back deposited amount of 100GBP still. Please take necessary steps ASAP.

We stayed here using secret escapes offer.  There are lots of positives - staff exceptional (Rita / Gary plus a few others whose names i didn't know / couldn't remember).  Standard room is great in size, quality of finish good, hairdryer can be plugged in by a mirror!  Would have benefited from a bit more storage for clothes and bits & bobs - the stand for the bedside lights looked great and we were expecting it to have draws in it or something, but nothing - unless they were super well hidden!   It would also have been good to have 2 easy chairs rather than just the one. No noise transference of any significance either inside or from outside.  There were 2 things that were of disappointment to us - for our stay the skygarden wasn't open as the restaurant wasn't ready - a big push in the blurb was about enjoying the superb views over the london skyline and this was one of the first things we'd asked about when we first checked in - while Rita kindly gave us a tour of the one on the 25th floor, it's not the same as being able to sit up there with a drink - especially when the view from the hotel room is over the train lines and the loading bay area for the Westfield Centre with nothing of the skyline visible.  The other thing is the breakfast - the hotel goes for an a la carte rather than a buffet set up.  Breakfast was inclusive in our rate, however could have been super carb heavy as you had one option plus toast and pastries. Breakfasts away are one of the joys of staying in a hotel, and we like a mixture.  It seemed strange to be able to order a fruit bowl (¬£6) on the menu or an eggs Royale (¬£12) or a full english (¬£14) and have these all treated as one option.  Gary and the other staff understood our dilemma and we ended up doing a pick and mix, replacing the toast and pastries for me with fresh fruit, and sharing so that we could enjoy a broader selection.  The food was great and portions generous (i.e. 2 pieces of toast each with avocado and poached egg on, or 2 muffins each with egg benedict on) -  it was just not as relaxing an experience as we would have liked when we were having to explain this each time we got new staff (we stayed 6 nights).  Also by having everything served to you it did make the breakfast quite slow - we were sometimes waiting for 30 mins after placing our order and nearly every day something was forgotten.  One suggestion would be for the cooked food to give the option for a small portion or a full portion, so that for inclusive rates you could naturally have more of a selection.  Staff were all super keen for our feedback during our stay which we did provide - when i got the feedback email i was going to put all this to them direct, but got routed immediately to trip advisor!

column9: No food left on our plates in the Brasserie
column10: Visited the Brasserie Bar and Restaurant with six other people and after the meal there was not one morsel of food left on any of our plates and we were all completely satiated, could not recommend high enough, local beer was a nice touch too.

I stayed her for 4 nights and did not want to leave.From the big open bright spaces, modern decor, incredibly comfy bed and beautiful bathroom- I couldn‚Äôt design a room more perfect.My room was cleaned to the highest standard every day with new bed linen and the biggest towels youve ever seen.The lady on reception that I checked in with (she was from Spain) made me feel like I was arriving ‚Äòhome‚Äô at the end of a long day with a big friendly greeting, using my name every time (when I‚Äôm sure she‚Äôs checked in a lot of guests) this was a really nice touch!Breakfast was beautiful with a really relaxing calm ambiance (just the start I need before work!) however the team still need a bit of training in order to make it perfect.One day I was told I had the ‚Äúcold package‚Äù and the next day i was told i had the ‚Äúhot package‚Äù which meant i could only order certain items each time. And on one occasion I was running late so I asked for something I could ‚Äúgrab and go‚Äù such as a banana and the staff looked extremely confused resulting in them having to ask multiple people for help on what to do. This was minor however compared to the incredible home away from home that The Stratford provided for me.I will DEFINITELY be back time and time again.The best hotel at this rate by FAR in London.

Everything went well, the bed felt like being on a cloud and the whole room design was just perfect and cosy! Didn't experience breakfast but we ordered room service at night and it was delicious. I loved the technology in the room,the bathtub and the hoodies to go to the gym! Staff was warm and friendly,especially Greg, Mahmood and the floor manager of the mezzanine (can't recall his name). Few minutes walk from Westfield shopping center, so good for shopping. Will surely be back with more friends!

We stopped by here having found the venue on OpenTable (we didn‚Äôt stay but just ate downstairs in the Brasserie/Lounge area). I hoped to have Afternoon Tea but was later told they hadn‚Äôt started their Afternoon Tea menu yet. No problem however, the Front of House spoke with the Chef who said he would of course provide.We arrived to a beautifully presented venue, clean and simple decor but with an air of occasion and understated elegance. The level of service was sublime and surpasses anything I have experienced in some time. Not just from one member of staff but every member of staff I encountered. Every aspect of the visit was perfect and I will absolutely be returning as a guest / to wine and dine further here. Highly highly recommend.

column9: Fantastic Hotel complemented by lovely attentive staff
column10: My hubby and I had an amazing 2 night stay last weekend. It is beautifully designed modern hotel that has some neat with gadgets and tech. The hotel us ideally located for pretty much anything with the added bonus if Westfield bring on your doorstep. The staff really made you feel special, their attentiveness and attention to detail, made such a difference. From what I could tell they were consistent in apply this level of hospitality to all guests. Given that the hotel hasn‚Äôt been open for very long, yes they had one or two around the hotel things to correct but they were up front about it so that‚Äôs fair. We ate in the brasserie the second night and oh how I wish I ate there on the first night, the whole chicken to share  was exceptionally cooked and wonderfully seasoned, the hassleback potatoes came a close second in the ‚Äúhow yummy was that‚Äù statement. The breakfasts were also delicious and if I were picky I‚Äôd say this is the one area where things  could be improved. Tea needs to brew before pouring, staff were a bit quick of the mark on that . Bread really needs a bit longer under the grill to be called toast, we and other tables had to return ‚Äúthe warm bread‚Äù to be toasted and lastly, warming the pastry‚Äôs first would be a lovely touch and bring out the best in them, it would raise them from being just ok to totally awesome. When most of the service you get is so good it equally can highlight the little things that need a bit more work. Suffice to say before I end up rambling on more than I have already, we would without a doubt be back again if our budget allows. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so lovely.

I was so very impressed with this lovely new hotel and the warmth and helpfullness of all the staff. Our room was beautiful, spacious and comfortable. The bed was fantasticly comfy. Big bathroom with deep free-standing bath and separate shower. Separate WC room. On top of all this, the management had left us with a wonderful welcome surpise of a cheeseboard and a bottle of delicious red wine. The reception staff were always helpful and polite and the front-of-house manager was extremely knowledgeble about the local area. Couldn't ask for more.

This is a great hotel. From the moment you walk in the professional staff are excellent. The rooms are spacious and clean and the lounge bar area is really chilled. Couldn‚Äôt ask for more in terms of location - right next to DLR/tube/Eurostar and also next door to Westfield Centre. WiFi works really well and car parking is literally next door (¬£6.30 for 24hrs). We‚Äôre vegan and the breakfast options were really good. A special mention to Anna on reception who is truly one of the most helpful and friendly people we‚Äôve encountered in a hotel. Thank you - we‚Äôll be back!

I stayed at the Stratford in mid-June, when the hotel was not officially open yet, which was a surprise to me. The lobby was essentially a construction site, and I walked back and forth multiple times before deciding to ask for directions at what looked like an entrance for residents. It turns out that that was the "reception".The room turned out to be a newly furnished one-bedroom apartment with amazing views. There was even a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for me. So far, so good.But: there were not bathroom amenities. There was no hairdryer. There was not even a power outlet in the bathroom. There was no reasonably placed power outlet in the kitchen. Surprisingly, there was a water cooker, which I had to operate on the floor. There was no TV. Now, none of this would be reason for me to complain, except that I paid >225 pounds per night and I do expect a fully operational hotel and a fully equipped room at this price.And worst of all, on the morning of my departure, there was no hot water, which is really bad when you have very long hair and were in need of washing it.Given this experience, I'd expect some sort of refund or compensation. But all the hotel staff told me was that they were pleased to let me know that the hotel opened two days after my departure and that they would love to welcome me back to deliver a different experience, supposedly at a preferable rate, a free breakfast and a free upgrade.Thanks, but no thanks. Why would I go back after such an experience?

column9: Top class hotel, friendly staff, breakfast a bit of a let down
column10: Booked this on Secret Escapes and was really impressed with this newly opened hotel.  Interior is beautifully designed and all the furnishings and equipment top quality including the lovely REN toiletries.  Reception staff were great and nothing was a problem.  Really great sleep and great quality bedding and towels.  Located a few steps from Stratford International station, and next door to Westfield shopping centre and the olympic park.  At breakfast there were a lot of very frinedly staff but the orders were really slow coming - like 40 mins.  We tried the stratford beans on toast which was the worst looking hotel breakfast i've ever seen - please Chefs have a re-think!Top tip nearby - you can book a swim in the Olympic pool for ¬£5 ( 15 mins walk).

We came very late in the evening but the staff in the reception was very helpful and very nice. We got our rooms at once all 16 of us on the 6th floor. The only thing I was a bit disappointed about was the waiting in the breakfast room in the morning.  One morning we were 4 guests there, but we waited much too long, I think - we didn't order a full English breakfast ... just 2 bowls of yogurt and coffee, but still it took ¬Ω hour to get it. Otherwise I wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying at this lovely the hotel.

Arrived early to watch event at the Olympic stadium expecting to leave bags as it was only 9.30am but given a room on arrival. New hotel. Fantastic room. Convenient for Olympic stadium and directly next to Westfield shopping centre and Stratford railway station. The Room was well equipped, comfortable bed and quiet rooms. Great night sleep. Having stayed at many 4/5* hotels I have to genuinely say it‚Äôs one of the best hotels I‚Äôve stayed at.

For a brand new hotel, everything seemed to run relatively efficiently but on this occasion the service we received elevated our experience from a standard stay to one myself and my partner will remember for a long time. Rita was exceptional - she was not only very personable but really went out of our way to make sure that we felt comfortable and the added extras (e.g. the drinks at breakfast, and a ‚Äúhappy birthday‚Äù fruit plate for my partner) really left a lasting impression! The room itself was comfortable enough, and having Westfield next door really came in handy! We will certainly be back.

Stayed in this new hotel over the weekend and was really impressed - I would definitely recommend staying. The attention to detail is second to none, the staff are extremely friendly and really make you feel welcome. The standard of the hotel is luxurious and the rooms offer an incredible view. Will be going back!

Most beautiful hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in! Staff so friendly and every little detail has been though of! Perfect location for all the activities we were doing and can‚Äôt wait to go back and stay again soon.

column9: Fantastic hotel near the Olympic Park and Westfield
column10: I stayed here for two nights in Mid July. The hotel had only been open for 3 weeks so everything was glossy and new. I stayed in a medium room which had a good sized desk space for me to work from as well as a really nice arm chair. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I slept really well.  The bathroom was a good size with a lovely walk in shower. In room facitilities included a well stocked mini bar, a big TV with free movies and the capability to connect your own devices and fast, free WIFI which worked without a glitch.  Room services was available to order via the tablet provided.The location couldn't be better: it's next to Stratford International and a short walk to Stratford Station although if you have heavy bags you can take the DLR one stop. The hotel is within the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and a 1 mnute walk to the huge Westfield shopping mall.  As a solo female traveller I felt extremely safe as there are seurity at the entrance and you have to use your room key to use the lift. The  reason I didn't give my stay 5 stars was due to the construction noise which was going on during the day through out my stay and a few little missing touches from the room which I'd expect such as a bottle opener, a kettle (The coffee machine was a nice touch but if you just want hot water for tea it's a bit of a pain!) and a little guide to the room would have been appreciated as I didn't realise some of the cool features until the day I was leaving!  Also there is a light outside of the bathroom which is motion sensitive and stays on for ages which I felt was uneccesary and rather annoying in the middle of the night!  The staff I met were lovely and welcoming and couldn't be more helpful. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and the rooms and hotel is impeccably designed.  I need to stay in the area again later this summer and I won't hestitate to book into The Stratford again.

I Chose the Stratford because of its excellent position with quick access into London's West end and also Shoreditch. Was expecting some teething problems as with all new openings but they were unfounded from the moment we stepped in the hotel we felt very comfortable like a home away from home albeit more classy! ;) the mezzanine bar team were amazing and a special mention to Anthony on concierge who was very knowledgeable of the local area and gave us some great places a stone's throw from the hotel. We'll be back soon!

We were amazed by the stunning design of this cool hotel in up-and-coming Stratford! It is well located opposite Stratford Intl station and right next door to Westfield. The rooms are really well thought out, extremely comfortable, with the latest modern technology.The whole experience was memorable for all the right reasons and every member of the hotel team made us feel hugely welcome.I would highly recommend staying here.

Although only open a short time staff were working together well as a team to go out of their way to welcome you and make sure you enjoyed your stay. Although the hotel roof garden was not ready they made a point of taking us up to the Lofts roof garden which was . Fabulous building and location on edge of East Village with its large green spaces made it feel very relaxed while being only a short journey from the West End.

Good location 30 min from central, further out than usual but easy to access via the tube. Clean, brand new rooms. Can be small so go for the larger rooms. Fantastic facilities gym, rooftop, food and bar.

Wow! First of all the building is so impressive then you enter to a warm and polite welcome. Your bags are carried to your room which was a great relief after 12 hours day working before hand. I was shown to the room with great excitement which was lovely to see the staff so excited to show off their wonderful new hotel. Now the room it was so peaceful. I stayed in a standard room but no way did it feel standard. I was shown how everything worked and told if I needed anything at any time just ask. The view outside the window was onto an incredible piece of swirling water art, truly mesmerising! I‚Äôve slept in many cities so I expected a certain level of noise outside but this didn‚Äôt happen it was so quiet! The room had everything I needed, super clean and the perfect temperature. I loved the little cakes on arrival. I slept so well! The next morning I had breakfast which was delicious and was offered more drinks if needed. The staff were so polite and attentive. Overall a brilliant hotel in a vibrant area of London. Well done everyone involved!

column9: Outstanding Service, Hospitality and a Great vision for the future
column10: We visited this Hotel last evening.  From the outset, nothing was too much trouble.  From valet parking, to concierge, through to the mezzanine club/bar area.  It was a smooth transition from a long journey to relaxation.The hotel may well be new, modern and open but its values are very much classical.  5 star Mayfair service, with outstanding attention to detail, excellent wine list with sublime food offerings to match.The staff are all highly experienced and very competent in what they do.  They do everything to put the guest at ease so that the enjoy their stay to the maximum.  There are many additional offerings planned by the Hotel, so there is a need to return soon.The rooms were nicely spaced, well designed and met all of our needs.This was our first time outside of the West End and it was a delight.  We like quality and have high standards, all of these were met and exceeded.  We look forward to returning soon.

column9: Brand new hotel, roomy by Euro standards, good location, friendly staff
column10: We had the fortune of staying at this hotel last weekend. It's located on London's east end right by Olympic park, Stratford station, and a huge Westfield mall.Despite the fact it's an hour from Heathrow, it's actually in a great location. It's situated right next to the Stratford station, which puts all of London in reach. The Jubilee underground line takes you to London Bridge station about 15 minutes! The line runs every few minutes. As a bonus, due to it being perhaps a little farther out, it was a very reasonable rate.The hotel itself is quite new, and you can tell because some of it is still under construction. This was not a problem, the only thing we noticed were that the elevator interiors were unfinished so they were covered up, but fully functional.The room was quite roomy by European standards. During our previous stay in London we had stayed at a hotel near Buckingham palace that was not much bigger than a dollhouse. This hotel was a palace in comparison. "Big and tall" folks should heed this notice. Lastly, the staff were super-friendly and helpful. I failed to catch their names, but I would want to thank them again for being very patient with jet-lagged foreigners.

Fabulous new hotel.The rooms were stunning. Could not recommend enough. From start to finish the experience was exceptional. Stratford was so accessible to central London too - a 7minute train and we were in Kings Cross!. Really excited to come back and try more.

I stayed in this hotel with my credit card points as it‚Äôs way out of my price range. Unbelievable customer service. I can not fault this hotel in anyway. Clean, stylish and really comfortable. I only wish I could stay again.

Beautiful, comfortable room, great decor very stylish. Great location for shopping as it‚Äôs right next to the Westfield shopping centre and great transport link. The views are to die for, What sets The Stratford apart is the staff-- wonderful, friendly, knowledgable and accommodating. The hotel defiantly has the wow factor. Could not recommend enough.

We booked at The Stratford for a little weekend away in London as we had tickets to an event nearby and we saw that the hotel was new and were keen to check it out. From start to finish the experience was exceptional. We felt like every one of the staff we met were old friends the way they greeted us and chatted to us. The rooms were stunning - every tiny detail is beautiful and I wished we could‚Äôve stayed longer so I could take more baths - I couldn‚Äôt get enough of the bathroom! Also loved the sculpture in the centre of the hotel - so cool.We had coffee and snacks in the lounge on the ground floor and Federica was so super friendly and gave us some great ideas on what to do during our stay plus she recommended what to pick from the menu when we eat in the brasserie and all the recommendations were delicious. Really excited to come back and try more.Had no idea that Stratford was so accessible to central London too - a 7minute train and we were in Kings Cross!

Looking for a luxury/ special hotel experience for a couple's weekend near East London was, at first, difficult, but I'm so glad we found The Stratford. It's 5 star all the way. The Breakfast in the Brasserie was beautiful, amazing portions and they were able to accommodate all of our dietary requirements. In the mezzanine, Margherita was the perfect hostess and Lena (one of the managers) took the time to tell us about the concepts they were going for in the hotel. She was charming, very sweet and made the whole experience something really special. You can't go wrong with this place and for what we paid, it was a bargain. I'm definitely coming back as often as I can.

column9: nice hotel , nice place , will go back
column10: people are very friendly and thy help us a lot looking and finding what we needed.even is far away from center , good connected with metro , station is near and a lot of shops around , 30 minutes and you arrive to the center of London

column9: Weekend shopping trip and birthday treat
column10: Fantastic hotel. Arrival just week after official opening. Has booked a double double room as mum and two adult daughters on a celebratory trip and given an upgrade to the Manhattan Suite. Wow!! Mentioned it was also a birthday treat for one of my daughters and on arrival to room found a mini birthday cake awaiting her - such a thoughtful gesture. Delicious too!!! Really helpful and cheerful staff throughout the hotel. Nice open atrium bar and restaurant. You will enjoy your stay. Just half an hour from the madness of inner city - it‚Äôs a welcome haven!

column9: Highly recommended‚Äîa must whilst in East London
column10: Amazing service. Amazing dining area and bar. Eco friendly staff uniform. A hotel with a clear vision and ambition to transform the industry and shake things up. Highly recommended. Do not miss out. A special thank you to the Manager for being so accommodating‚Äîwe hope your hard work pays off.

column9: An Oasis of Relax and Sleep
column10: This new beautifully designed hotel is brimming with everything you want from a stop in Stratford without feeling like you are staying in the Westfield shopping centre. The staff are effortlessly efficient and engaging and exude the vibe that this is the place to be without being too cool for school. Away from home and after way too long a day at work I arrived late and exhausted, to my delight it felt like this place scooped me up, enveloped me and took care of exactly what I needed. My room catered for everything I needed and beyond....if I had  forgotten my charger and needed to buy a new one I could have....along with slippers and a robe there was also a comfy Stratford hoodie. A deep sleep in a fantastically comfortable bed was followed by a delicious breakfast of avocado smash on toast with poached eggs washed down with very good cappuccino. I would definitely stay again. In fact I‚Äôm going again tonight for my 4the stay in a week. Bravo to The Stratford - a truly enjoyable stay and head and shoulders above anything else in the vicinity!

The Stratford was an amazing experience from start to finish.All the staff were welcoming and very attentive. The general manager Ashley was a delight full of knowledge and always happy to help in any way.The chef in the open plan kitchen made the food into a calm and relaxing experience like no other. Lead by chef Ben they created food that what outstanding and very fresh. The Stratford provided little extras that has set them apart from any other hotel i have stayed in from the amazing view to room service tablets in each room. Worth every second will definitely be back again soon.

Brand new hotel. Work still in progress which is a bit disturbing. But rooms very cosy, employees friendly. Casual style a little weird (outfits ugly) Perfectely located, 7mn from St Pancras with the train.

column9: Perfect stay for the MLB London Series!!
column10: Beautiful hotel!! Staff was polite and very welcoming. Rooms were comfortable, views were great and multiple outlets available. Walking distance from Stratford International, Westfield Stratford City mall and London stadium.

The team at the Stratford went above and beyond and the accommodations were beautiful.  We were traveling in from the US and they made sure we were comfortable and assisted in all our questions and needs.  Our room, food, drink and overall atmosphere will certainly bring us back to the Stratford.  Well done!!

Recently stayed here on a business trip. I only stayed one night but I will definitely be coming back. Located very conveniently near Stratford International station (very hand from London City Airport) I was greeted in the lobby by a friendly staff member, who directed me to reception. The room was well appointed and the wifi was excellent. I had a great sleep and the staff were very helpful the next day in looking after my luggage while I went to my meetings.

column9: The hotel was a lovely 5* stay
column10: As picky seasoned travellers we are always sceptical when it comes to a fairly new hotel, however, I think this hotel has really nailed it....Check in was quick and easy and our room upgraded, our early check in (11am) therefore granted. Lovely comfy bed, ambient temperature, nice bathroom products and a coffee machine. We were shown to the room by hotel concierge and a lift attendee assured you don‚Äôt even have to press a button! Breakfast was delish and given that there is plenty of choice around I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worthwhile. Car parking next door at the Stratford Int car parking was easy and seamless! It‚Äôs 1 min walk to the Westfields and the stations, what more could you ask for.

column9: Lovely hotel, a break from the hustle
column10: We stayed a day after opening, after checking out of a more expensive higher class hotel due to numerous issues and that was after room change.Booking a larger room we were delighted!Nearby parking, on the doorstep of the shopping centre, staff couldn't do enough.A lovely breakfast.Of course there will be teething issues in a new hotel- the water pressure was a bit poor but there is ongoing building works so expected.Also the bathroom light is annoying but not sleep disgustingly so (that i found anyway)It has a plush luxurious feel which i am sure it will deliver on once fully completed- I actually checked the prices a for in few months time as I believed they must be discounting the current stays to accommodate the works. I am happy to have paid what I did for the stay i recieved and will be returning on future visits to London time and time again. Hopefully with better water pressure!

What a place, fantastic staff and top of the range rooms, definitely will stay again, ideal location for any events at the Olympic stadium and the links to central London a stones throw away cannot recommend this place enough, amazing.

Stayed here for 1 night for the baseball game at Olympic stadium, close to Stratford International Station and a short walk from Stratford under ground.Upon arrival we were welcomed and guided to check in. The staff were very professional and friendly, we were guided to our room and shown how to use the tablet system and where to find anything we may of needed.The room was just beautiful, clean and modern with the comfiest bed and pillows.Room service breakfast was cooked beautifully and during the whole stay the staff couldn‚Äôt be more helpful and were happy to have a conversation with you.Would love to stay again and would recommend  to anyone.

column9: Will be a nice hotel when finished.
column10: I booked two nights at the Stratford hotel whilst staying in London for a work conference. I'd requested a quiet room, which are internal facing so unfortunately do not come with a view but do offer quiet.The rooms offer comfy beds, nice toiletries and cool in-room technology, however several aspects of the room were not working yet, for example; large rain shower offers little to no pressure and temperature cold, and a light comes on in room when there is movement and which cannot be switched off (annoying when you've got up in the middle of the night).The hotel offers a 24-hour gym but this wasn't ready when I stayed. Frustratingly, staff could not communicate when it would be available, with guidance ranging from within next 24 hours to one more week. Staff did book me into a Better Gym about 3 mins walkaway as an alternative, however this took about 30 mins to process which eroded my workout time.Staff were nice and worked hard to make it up to guests, however this hotel was not ready to be open yet.Restaurant and bar area are nice. Food is decent. Location is right next to Stratford International station and Westfield shopping centre (about 10 mins walk through Westfield to Stratford tube).

I‚Äôm usually a premier inn/ibis kind of girl (to be honest a caravan works good for me) but this weekend I was in London for a special occasion so thought I‚Äôd choose a ‚Äòproper‚Äô hotel.I booked my room at the Stratford on 19th November 2018, for a stay on 29th June 2019. At no point during the 7 months between booking, and arriving, did anybody inform me the hotel wasn‚Äôt even open. It didn‚Äôt officially open until the day after I checked out, but had unofficially opened 5 days prior to my arrival. Had I known before I was paying full price for a room in a hotel that was operating at only 70/80% efficiency, and who were basically using me as a guinea pig to pick up any issues before their grand opening, I most certainly would have looked elsewhere. Leading up to my stay I received numerous emails, many of which told me I had just 24 (or 48) hours to confirm the information requested or my booking would not be confirmed - this was after I‚Äôd already had emails telling me my room was confirmed (one was asking for my home address, which they still managed to get wrong - I live on the south coast of the UK, yet the address they put for me was somewhere in NYC - I love the states but don‚Äôt fancy living in New York). I did enjoy the email though which asked me for my email address (I‚Äôll let you think about that one).Before I booked I read through the reviews to see what people were saying - oddly all of those have now disappeared and they are only showing ones from June of this year. Of the many I read (which I now think were taken from the reviews of the Stratford Loft Apartments (their sister building)) 90% of them mentioned the ‚ÄúAmazing views‚Äù. I guess if you like train tracks, multi storey car parks and warehouse/storage entrances, then ‚Äòyes‚Äô you‚Äôd think the view amazing. My brother-in-law travels a lot for work and is a member of a group who share their worst hotel views; even he said I was ‚Äúonto a winner‚Äù with ours. Even now a section for reviews of the hotel states people love it for it‚Äôs ‚ÄúFab Views‚Äù.The reception desk is in the most ridiculously inconvenient area it could have been. Tucked around the corner from the main entrance (I had to ask a surly looking security guard where it was who just pointed at a lady coming my way (she was lovely and could not have been more helpful)) I was then directed to a desk in front of the 3 lifts with very little room in between. When all 3 computers are being used at the desk whoever is on the right hand end will have to stand slightly away from the counter as there is not enough room. If you then get a couple more people wanting to get to the desk, you have no hope of exiting/entering the furthest of the 3 lifts as this is where people will be queueing to check out (during my stay this was also the only lift working). Luckily when I checked in I was the only person, but if there were more than 4 wanting to at the same time and they queued the other end (which would be most logical) none of the lifts would be accessible. During my stay the staff also had to use the same lift and I felt quite sorry for the poor lady who had 2 trolleys of leftover room service food she had to get back to the kitchen for she was unable to squeeze in with guests and had to keep waiting until she could get in with guests, or just hang around until it was empty.I booked a twin room as I was originally sharing with a male cousin of mine; I‚Äôm now quite glad he had to cancel and I drafted my Mum in last minute as the twin setup is basically a double bed with 2 single mattresses either side with your own sheet/quilt. I‚Äôm not someone who has intimacy issues but even I would have felt uncomfortable being quite-so-close to someone I don‚Äôt normally share with. Unless you (or whomever you share with) are people who lay straight and don‚Äôt move then you will (at-some-point) come into contact with your roommate during the night. They were, however, extremely comfortable and I could happily have taken the pillows home with me. You could tell the room was new; the smell of the paint still hung in the air. This was fine to begin with but after a while was quite headache inducing and as there are no windows to open (not such a bad thing with the train station outside) there was no way to remove it or help to disperse it a little. The bathroom (being so new) is lovely, although whoever thought it a good idea to put the toilet roll holder directly next to the toilet itself on the same level really needs to try using it. Anyone over a size 12 is going to find it digs in to your leg and is in the most ridiculous place to try to pull some off. We took ours off (the paper, not the holder) and popped it onto the edge of the sink. The walk in shower was lovely except the water pressure was quite low and the shower head (although fabulously large) only produced water from one side; these were slow, huge drops. The additional spray attachment is pretty much useless for anything other than rinsing off your feet; it never quite made it to trickle, choosing instead to stay at the dribble stage. The shower gels, shampoos and conditioner are-what-they-are.The aircon was ok; we set ours to the minimum of 18, yet the room temperature never dropped under 22. Tucking the coffee machine into the cupboard is a great idea (to keep the desk area tidy and uncluttered) right up until the point when you go to use it. To pop a pod in for coffee you need to lift the handle up high; this cannot be done unless you drag the machine to the very edge of the shelf, therefore having to balance it a little. The cups (which in themselves are tiny) then don‚Äôt sit quite right on the ledge under the water spout, so you have to keep hold of them at all times or else they run the risk of sliding off and spilling everywhere. 4 coffee pods, 3 different teas (2 of each variety) is a nice touch but just 2 of the silly little milk pod things doesn‚Äôt quite work. I assume this is to encourage you to then purchase a cup of tea from either room service, or downstairs; at ¬£3 per cup I stuck to water (of which you do get one complimentary jug left in your room).There are plenty of plug sockets to use, all of which have usb charging which is great and the TV is huge ( be aware though some channels only give you sound and not the picture). If you are on the train station side of the hotel you will hear the tannoy announcements word-for-word and trains do run from 5am until well after midnight.My biggest bug bear though was the light in the little cubby area outside the bathroom. This had no on/off switch and it appeared to work either on a sensor or timer of some kind. If, like me, you like a dark room to sleep in make sure you do not enter the bathroom or this little area for at least half-an-hour before you want to go to sleep and whatever you do, do not get up in the night to use the bathroom, for this light comes on, and stays on. What makes is worse is that it is opposite a full length mirror so the light is reflected all around the room. Great for someone who doesn‚Äôt like sleeping in the dark but really should be optional for those of us who do. Maybe once their teething problems are sorted it will be better for people staying, for the location is great if you‚Äôre visiting Westfield, or the London Stadium, but for me, and my stay, I can honestly say it was not worth the cost and in future I‚Äôll stick to the premier‚Äôs; at least with those you get-what-you-pay-for.The one thing I cannot fault though (other than the security guard) is the staff. From the lovely girl who lead us around to the reception, to the lift guys, the luggage guys and even the girl shifting the food trolleys around, nothing was too-much-trouble and they were all extremely courteous and friendly. In fact the girl who guided us to the reception area (I believe her name was Emma?  very pretty girl with long braided hair) was the most courteous and friendly member of staff I have come across anywhere, in any business.I'm sure once officially opened and operating as should be things will improve but for me I personally won't be recommending, or booking to stay again any time soon.

Me and my wife booked this hotel as it was one of the closest to the venue (London Stadium) for the weekends Baseball. Welcomed immediately. Friendly, efficient staff in all areas we encountered! The room we had was clean, modern and very comfortable. A well stocked mini bar and snacks tray.  There‚Äôs a pleasant bar/restaurant as you walk in. All the staff here were very friendly and courteous. Large car park (reasonably priced too) next door. Stratford station is across the road. Just a few mins walk is the huge Westfield shopping centre and the London Stadium is only a short walk away. This hotel is perfect if you‚Äôre attending an event and fancy a stay-over!

I would highly recommend this hotel! Brand new and really modern. Great location. The staff really make this place! The service was absolutely second to none. We were given a complimentary dinner and the chefs were just brilliant. The head chef went out his was to make sure everything was perfect for us and we really got that VIP feeling.  Really friendly place. I have every faith that it will be a complete success. Was actually sad to leave. Will definitely be back!  5 star!

We really enjoyed our stay at the Stratford. Although parts of the hotel were not finished, it did not change our experience. All of the staff were fantastic and could not do enough for you. Would highly recommend. We will definitely visit again as the location is perfect for the Olympic park.

My partner and I stayed for 2 nights, arriving the day after the hotel opened. We had been following the hotel on Instagram for a while since booking and were really looking forward to our stay. On arrival, the staff were lovely and the hotel was on its way to looking incredible - however unfinished. Our room was perfect, but the water pressure in the shower was poor. My partner runs every morning, so our only filter when looking for a hotel is a gym. The gym was made to sound fantastic and with great equipment. This meant it was really disappointing when we arrived and the gym was not open yet. We were initially told it would be open the following day, however when we asked the following day, were then told it would not be until the following week. It was only then that we were offered use of a nearby gym should we wish to use it, the hotel would refund us. Communication seemed poor and a lot of mixed messages. We were given complimentary dinner at The Stratford Brasserie which was delicious. No offer of breakfast, we weren‚Äôt sure if dining was an option at breakfast or only room service. We felt there was a lot of staff however assume this is due to it being a new open. We would be delighted to stay again once all facilities are available - one of the most comfortable sleeps I‚Äôve had in a long time - just wish we had an outwards facing window!

I stayed here for a couple of nights with my partner after the hotel had recently opened. The hotel and the staff were great, we had a complimentary dinner on our first night which was also delicious. Only downside I would say was the gym not being open to use. One of the reasons I booked the hotel was because of the new - 24 hour gym it had boasted about, I felt slightly mislead when I arrived and was told it wasn‚Äôt open yet. I would however stay again- hopefully with all facilities available!

We had the pleasure to be one of the first guests at this new hotel. What a great place not only the design of the building but more importantly the staff are friendly, polite and very professional. The hotel has a great feel about it, So looking forward to going back when the place if fully open full and buzzing. This hotel will win awards you can see that a mile away, get yourself booked in

Really enjoyed my stay here. Beautiful hotel and the staff were really friendly and helpful. My room was lovely, everything finished to a very high standard and breakfast was very good. Only downside was the gym wasn‚Äôt open yet (I arrived the first day the hotel opened!!) and I do really need a gym when on business trips so I was a bit disappointed. I would definitely stay here again when it has been open a little longer. Love the hotel branded hoodies, I would have happily brought mine home!

column9: Such a rude behavior of a company...
column10: First, there is a unable stuff in the reception, which dont know their booking system.  We got charged once via web checking before the arrival. The lady said, the amount is still to pay. So we payed again at the reception with a different Card because us was told the payment is not done yet.
