Next day i double checked with my bank and as i told to the lady at the arrival, the first Credit Card was already blocked during the web checkin before. So we went to the reception and told that, the guy double checked it and saw the mistake too (double charging). He said he will release the amount of at the Card from the web checkin and it will be available soon.So far, no problem, that can happen... but the support after.... After we left i checked three days later again, the amaount was still not availble. My Bank told me it is still blocked. I called the Hotel and the lady told me, she cant help, i should write a email to the invoice department. I wrote that problem to the email adress i got. Days later no answer. Then i got a answer, then i thought it is a joke, they even didnt read my email and send me a copy of the invoice. So i answered again, and no Answer yet. It is 10 Days now and nothing happend, the money is still blocked. We as customer, need to care about the mistakes of them. No Support at the phone, nobody answer days long to your E-Mails. I have never seen such a bad customer service. what a shame to deal with guests like that.

The hotel is in a great location - close to Westfield, Olympic park and the station.The hotel is very modern, it consists of nice decorations and designs within the rooms and reception. Only problem seemed to be noise, from the rooms above and around us. for example, hearing doors close and people walking around. But this could be the same in all hotels I would recommend this hotel if it‚Äôs in a good location and you‚Äôre staying 1-2 nights as there isn‚Äôt much room for luggage (clothes etc) to be stored.

column9: 2 Night stay - Hotel internal temperature too warm-  no temperature control.
column10: Stayed at The Moxy for an event at the Olympic village.    This Hotel is perfect location for walking distance for the train stations and the Westfield shopping centre. The hotel is relatively new, several floors, you check in at the bar.The lift to the floors require you to tap your key card to use them. I was in a queen room, adequate size, but the bathroom is very small, but i`m not dancing in there, shower good and hot.The room does not have any beverage facilities at all, but it has a hair dryer lol.It you want a brew you have to go down stairs to use the kettle at the end of the bar. TV - mine stopped working, had to get one of the maids nearby who was brilliant and fixed it....It appears the tv is connected by the internet.  You pull the surround away from the tv at its base and just unplug and re plug to the power and Lan line re-boot. BAD POINT - this hotel is boiling.  You are unable to change the room temperature using the wall thermostat.  Mine was set at 24.5 decrees c throughout.  When I tried to get the air con working it actually went hotter.  Apparently the whole hotel is set at this temp. IF you want the room cooling you have to open the window for the whole day...bring your ear plugs.Bed is comfortable.I didnt eat here but from what I could see its continental breakfast only for a premium price.The hotel is spotless, but you cannot have a hotel this warm without being able to control the temperature, especially when outside is 8 degrees. It is very uncomfortable hot, the poor maids are dripping in sweat because of the heat but they cannot do or say anything about it.   Therefore 3 stars is the best I can give.

My wife and I stayed at the moxy for one night. Check in was quick and easy, but the bar had staff shortages. Service for drinks was slow and they were not serving any food. Our queen room was relatively small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom couldn‚Äôt have been any smaller but was functional. The main problem is the temperature in the room. It was 24.5 degrees with no way of making it any cooler apart from opening the window onto a very noisy street. There was nowhere to hang clothes and the television didn‚Äôt work. There are no drink making facilities in the bedrooms. The breakfast was also rather odd - cold bacon sandwich anyone?

The hotel is in fair condition even after just two years of opening; with carpets and bar already looking rather sketchy.As a Marriott Titanium Member we were given an interior courtyard view room: so much for the best available room guarantee.One night there was a 10 minute procedure before we could actually pay for two bottles of water and put it on our room as we ‚Äúweren‚Äôt registered‚Äù (we had checked in online). On the day of departure maid service started knocking on the door at 09:30 - with the DND on.Wordt though - with an outside temperature of 8C in December the lowest we temperature we could achieve in the room was 23C (that was after 3 days with the window open); that is just not acceptable for a fairly newly constructed building - where is the sustainability and guest comfort in that: complaining to the front desk didn‚Äôt help either.The location is pretty good; but if this issue is not solved (I can‚Äôt imagine what it would be like in summer!) I would not return anytime soon....

Although its modern,clean and well located next to Stratford tube station,it was way too hot for us. Our room air con display said 29¬∞. Reception claimed nothing could be done,however the following day it read 22.5¬∞,which was still a little uncomfortable.

First of all - we spent minimal time in the hotel except for sleeping and chilling but when we were there, a few important points worth mentioning. We were placed on the 5th floor to the front of the building - very noisy with traffic and unfortunately there were nightshift roadworks the whole night on our first evening. Not the hotels fault I completely understand but brings me on to my next point. The rooms were absolutely roasting - they had no air con facilities as it was set hotel wide to ‚Äúwinter mode‚Äù. Our room was measuring 26C for our 4 night stay and we couldn‚Äôt open the window to sleep because of the noise outside, giving us 4 pretty sleepless nights and feeling ill with the heat most mornings. We asked on 2 occasions at reception on 2 separate days if could this be put down but nothing changed. The smoke alarm - albeit for our safety (and we were grateful) had 2 bright lights flashing from it and when dark in the room lit up the entire place every 60 seconds - very off putting when you‚Äôre roasting hot, trying to fall asleep, too much traffic noise outside to open the window. It just made a difficult situation more difficult. We asked about this again but nothing changed. The TV only worked intermittently. It worked on the first evening and then not after that at all. We tried all channels and nothing worked. We couldn‚Äôt even connect our phones to watch films as this didn‚Äôt work either. The USB socket at the bed side didn‚Äôt work so we had to share one plug - we didn‚Äôt bring more as hotel specifically advertised USB plugs. The tea, coffee and water is down at reception which is a bit off putting having to traipse all the way down to reception for a tea / coffee early morning if you‚Äôre in your pjs etc. The ironing rooms on each floor is a great idea, but only great when they work. We had to go up and down to use the iron as the one on our floor didn‚Äôt work. There was a ticking in our room for 4 nights - no idea where this came from but it was driving us ballistic! We couldn‚Äôt find out the source! These probably seem like very minor issues but lots of minor issues lead up to a bigger issue and while the Moxy costs pale in insignificance to other hotels in the area and in wider London we still paid a substantial amount of money for our stay and it just wasn‚Äôt at the standard we would have expected. HOWEVER - the Moxy concept is fantastic and we would definitely stay again but we would expect a better standard of service next time around, especially being a member of the Marriot Club. PROS - Great break out areas, facilities clean, hotel smells FANTASTIC - I need to know what it is! Rooms spotless and modern, trendy and cool, great selection of food and drinks, staff so friendly, relaxed vibes!! it‚Äôs right up our street without all the teething problems! AS A SMALL BUSINESS OWNER I AM AWARE OF THE REPERCUSSIONS OF LOW SCORES ON TA HENCE THE 5 STARS BUT MOXY - PLEASE UP YOUR GAME.

The hotel has air conditioning, however advised that in winter does not give out cold air!  The bedroom was 24 degrees, and switching on the air con increased the temperature!!  Despite maintenance attending, advised nothing could be done!Unable to sleep.  The bed is also not very comfortable either.

My friend and I were staying here for 3 nights and the staff was more than welcoming. Even tho the last night we had some troubles with the tv, the girls at the reception helped us immediately and changed the rooms, we‚Äôre not sure about the names but Jessica, Martyna, Maria and Sahifa we‚Äôre very nice. And Morgan at the bar was such a sweetheart, she was very helpful and friendly. Over all we would recommend the hotel, it is very modern and the location is great. Gonna stay the next time visiting London.

Have stayed at the Moxy hotel at London Excel which has always been very good. Decided to stay at Stratford as the other was booked up. Upon arrival, I showed the booking confirmation of which she saw the price and instantly said that was wrong. There was no welcome, no welcome drink, nothing. Straight to pointing out the price for the room on my booking was wrong. And then she plucked a figure out of thin air to charge, of which I refused. I asked if we could be given a higher room as feels like the people walking by can see in the window, she instantly denied and said it‚Äôs 1st floor only. There had been 2/3 rooms already checked in beside us whilst we had still been seen, all had also been offered a welcome drink. Once she had located our booking, she proceeded to take payment at the higher price of which I refused as my booking showed the price I booked for. The manager came and said it was no issue and charged me the price I had booked for. As I paid cash, she instantly demanded another ¬£50 deposit of which I had no problem providing. But her manner in which she was asking, it made us feel very unwelcome. The worst service I have ever received at a hotel. Probably took around 25 minutes to check in, in contrast to the other Excel hotel which took 5 minutes every time. Upon checking out, I asked for my deposit back of which they could not find. I waited a further 15 minutes. I mentioned to a colleague it was probably in the till but she did not tell the person I was dealing with and let her rummage around in the back wasting my time yet again. Then she looked in the till and found it. Very unprofessional, no people skills and very unwelcoming. Will never be returning to this hotel again

column9: Do NOT stay at this hotel!!!!!!
column10: We travelled 4 hours on a train from Norfolk to see a concert and had booked a stay at Moxy 2 months prior for 2 couples. We went in and they told us that under 18‚Äôs cannot stay, even though there was two 19 year olds (with two 17 year olds) and this was NOT specified on the website as you can book 1 adult and 1 child rooms. We then were told that is only applicable if it‚Äôs parent and child- leaving us with no where to stay. They refunded one of us- which wouldnt come for 3/5 days so when we said we literally had no where to go the ‚Äòsupervisor‚Äô told us that ‚Äòwe have parents and they can send you the money‚Äô- like we hadn‚Äôt already spent ¬£150 on the hotel! They wouldn‚Äôt refund the other room as apparently it was cancelled, even though the money came out of our bank. I respect the managers patience but the fact moxy hotel were willing to make four young adults homeless for a night is ludicrous.

column9: Great, hip, business hotel within easy 3-4 minutes walk to the subway (Underground).
column10: I really enjoyed my week's stay at the Moxy London Stratford.  It's a very short walk to the Stratford Undergound station, so you can easily get from there to downtown and other parts of Greater London.  There are two major shopping malls, one directly accessible from the Station and the other just a bridge walk away.  Tip:  there's a grocery store in the mall so you can stock up on water, snacks, and fruits!I love the common spaces in the lobby.  It's "repurposed" based on the time of day.  Breakfast was a semi buffet setup.  After dinner and way into the evening the main bar is popular!  I played foosball with a TV crew on location around 2:00 AM!  The front part of the lobby doubles as a sitting and meeting area, and just adjacent is a community work table with a couple of computers.Finally, very friendly staff upon check-in (also at the bar), breakfast, evening drinks, and very early (4:30 AM) check-out.  Thanks for a great stay!

Great location, easy walking from Stratford train station once I figured out the way to go. Checkin was friendly and quick. Room was clean and fine for one night. Only reason not five star is that I couldn‚Äôt cool the room temp down enough and window only opened a tiny bit which also created too much noise to sleep.

Found this hotel via Booking.com, needed somewhere close to Stratford station. Very reasonable for a twin bed room that was only 5 minutes walk from Stratford station and onward travel into London.Rooms were modern, comfortable and clean. Not sure I got the hang of the aircon controls, though the temperature was OK.Breakfast is self-service, not the best if you look forward to a good "Full English". That aside, the food was good. Staff were helpful and polite and there are lockers available if you wish to leave your luggage for a while.

I have stayed in far better hostels than this ‚Äúhotel‚Äù. Pros: Big fluffy towels.Gloria at the front desk was very helpful.Decent room and bathroom lighting that could be dimmed/brightened.Cons:WiFi never worked once over the course of my two days/two nights stay.No rubbish bin in my room except one tiny one in bathroom.No phone to reception.Water flooded entire room.No safe/locker in room. Cheap looking lockers available by the reception/bar. Not a good location for valuable items to be stored in a heavy traffic area.No closet in room.The shower flooded out of the bathroom onto the carpeting in my room. Created a disaster. Spoke with Gloria at the front desk who explained the points would be refunded back to my Marriott account due to this issue. Gloria assured me that the manager would approve the points being refunded within then next 3 business days. This was almost 10 days ago.The points were never refunded. Reached out multiple times via phone with no answer and no ability to leave a voicemail. Each call I spent 25+ minutes waiting on the line while it was trying to connect me to the front desk.

I stayed at the Moxy Stratford on the evening of 9/11/2019, departing the next morning. This was not my choice of hotel but rather booked by Sports Interactive, who‚Äôs event I attended.A few of my colleagues, tried to check in early as we got told were able to, but this wasn‚Äôt possible, however we have been told this was a SEGA fault not the hotel.When we finally checked in at 9:30pmish, there was a few issues with our rooms, namely instead of 6 rooms they have booked 12 rooms, however, once again, we are not sure whether this is a hotel mistake or a SEGA mistake.The hotel bar was used to socialise in the evening and the prices were reasonable; for London prices anyway; we were a bit disappointed by the lack of a proper food menu though.The breakfast was included, and was congenial which was lovely, and serve as you want - however it is normally ¬£12, and I‚Äôm not sure if I would be willing to pay that price if not included in my booking.A few things though - my TV in my room was playing up & there was no bin in my room.Decent hotel though - would visit again.

If you have to be outside of Central London for work it is a good spot.  Right near the Stratford station, easy to catch the tube anywhere.  Short walk to London Stadium and very close to a massive shopping complex.  Nothing charming or cultural about the area but it is convenient enough if staying out there.  Rooms are small and clean but very adequate.  No drawers or closet but hooks to hang things.  The bar doubles as the check-in desk, young, hip feel.  Would ask for a room facing the interior courtyard for a quiet sleep.  1hour 20 tube ride from Heathrow, one change at Holborn...it's a long ride but easy and MUCH cheaper than a taxi.

Paid ¬£93 for a Saturday night, pretty good value for a modern hotel with bar, conveniently located. I couldn‚Äôt connect to the WiFi though! No station or guest noise in room 544. Bar / hang out / workspace area was really chilly at night, shame. Pillow had a stain on it and we needed an extra duvet, this was rectified promptly. Hotel is run by young staff and styled to appeal to teens and young 20‚Äôs. No iron or tea and coffee in room. Like the on the go food and drink offerings in the lobby, but we didn‚Äôt use as so close to shops.

column9: Great location outside of Central London, Horrible WiFi
column10: This is a MOXY through and through.  Expect very limited room amenities (no lotion, desk, closet or dresser NO SAFE for example) however overall, a great stay.  It has everything you need, was clean and is in a great location.Minutes walk to the Stratford station which provides quick access to Central London and it‚Äôs right next to the ridiculously large Westfield shopping mall.Breakfast is the same everyday and provides good options and is fresh.The bigggggest issue, the WiFi.  Because it is open to anyone and doesn‚Äôt require a password it drops you every time you are not actively using.  You must sign back in every time you pick back up any device you are using.  Seems small but can assure it gets old really fast.

column9: Perfect place for my short vacation in London
column10: I was staying there in October during my short vacation in London.Staff at the reception were friendly and quick, they guided me through all the basic stuff I need to know about the hotel.Room was OK. Even though none of three USB ports showed sings of life, at least the only socket for europlug did work properly which is pretty convenient because I forgot to buy British adapter.Housekeeping also did a good job, it felt pretty nice to get into well made bed after a long day of doing touristy stuff in the city.Location is also pretty good. The closest underground station is literally in 1 minute walking distance from the hotel. There are a bunch of shops and stores around, some of them are open 24 hours.At the check-out, two girls at the front desk took me by surprise by thanking me at the same time, haha. I don't know, I still remember that little moment for some reason.I will definitely choose this hotel for my next trip to London!

This hotel tries to hide the fact that it only offers the basics (and it doesn‚Äôt do that very well) by providing a bit of funky decor. Small room. Very small en-suite. Slow WiFi (8mbs) despite the fact that they promote it a ‚ÄòFuriously Fast WiFi‚Äô. WiFi doesn‚Äôt auto connect your devices. TV didn‚Äôt work in the morning. No tea or coffee. No water. No wardrobe. No parking. Noisy railway outside my room 327. All for ¬£283 for the night excluding overnight parking costs off site. You‚Äôve guessed, I won‚Äôt be back!

This hotel is very funky.  It‚Äôs modern and the staff was young and energized.  It was cool to hangout and talk with the staff.  The rooms were compact but the bed was comfortable and the showers hot.  You have ironing rooms instead of ironing boards.  Had tea makers no coffee makers in the room and the lobby coffee machine never worked.  It was convenient to Stratford station and lots of eating spots.

We only wanted to stay for one night before a shopping trip at Westfield and it was fit for purpose but I don't think we would return to stay here (myself and my Mum had a twin room)The positives+ Very close to Westfield and restaurants - only a few minutes walk away+ Food at the bar was fairly priced - recommend the omelette for breakfast only ¬£4.50 and avoid paying ¬£12 for the full continental. + Tea and coffee in the bar is free+ Clean rooms with comfy beds Negatives- Check in took quite a long time - I'd recommend using the check in online option - No tea and coffee making facilities in the room which when you are on the 7th floor is a let down - The lifts were a bit of a nightmare, it seemed at busy times it was hard to get up to the 7th without someone else pressing you to go down or the lift not working at all - Our shower head didn't fit on to the shower properly, not sure why this was the case so we had to balance it to use the showerAlso a final point, having table football in the restaurant/bar area was noisy; you can't really have a proper conversation when all you can hear is banging directly behind you from people playing it. It's a nice idea but maybe it should be in the other area away from the restaurant. Overall it did the job but we wouldn't return to a Moxy hotel.

Planning on going back to this hotel this year for Christmas as I stayed in Late January this year - Hotel was in a really good location only a 5 min walk max from Westfield shopping centre, tube station right outside the hotel took 15 mins max to get into central London by tube which was really great I want to say a massive Thank you to Tomas who was really kind and put a few extra touches to our room making it even more special ! Helped us with getting on the right tube etc via Instagram with directions which was a really great help. Hotel is lively and funky with quotes on the mirrors daily in the lift which was a nice touch someone is always available to help and is in a really great location and reasonable price planning today to book for end of this month for winter wonderland :) !

column9: Not a hotel for business travellers.
column10: Entered the hotel and first impressions were that is very different to a traditional Marriott hotel, it was young and fun. Very different. We waited to be checked in for a few minutes which was fine. On check in the crew member explained we were on a corporate prepaid rate with ¬£10 breakfast allowance and ¬£23 dinner allowance and that was it. No explanation of how breakfast works, where the rooms were allocated or where parking was. Just pointed to across the road. We were allocated first floor rooms. On arrival at the room I was impressed, it‚Äôs modern and relatively clean - the glass side tables looked terrible. We went to the bar and the Stella was off for both nights we stayed. With only one lager on tap and bottled beers. After a drink we went back to our room, where I found there was no bin in the room except for the one in the bathroom. Not sure why. My welcome message on the TV said ‚ÄúHello Michael‚Äù - again not sure why? The bed when you got into it was strangely crinkly... I laid in bed for 5 minutes and could hear music from the lobby. I tried to play a podcast to cover the bass noise coming through the floor but it did not work. What was so irritating was the fact I had no telephone in my room to call downstairs as ‚Äúwe‚Äôd love to see you‚Äù so I had to get dressed and head into the lobby. I waited a few minutes while the person looking after the desk/bar finished with the person he was serving before coming to me. He did tell me he wouldn‚Äôt be too long so I was fine with that. When he got to me I said I‚Äôd been put in a room above the lobby speaker and could I be changed rooms as I wouldn‚Äôt be able to sleep. He said that the music would be turned down now so he could do that for me. I said well what time will it be turned down as I was here on a business trip so needed to sleep. It was 1am already and I had travelled down that evening so would have liked to have been asleep by now. The crew member explained that the music is turned off around now. So I said tomorrow that doesn‚Äôt help me as I don‚Äôt want to be awake until 1am again so could I just move rooms. He genuinely seemed as if this was a massive issue, I wasn‚Äôt happy with my room so why could he not have just changed it for me?? I left the desk feeling more agitated than when I went down. Why should I have to fight my case to be given a peaceful room when the room was booked through a business code? Is it completely ridiculous to want a good night‚Äôs sleep at a hotel? Because that is how I was made to feel. This is clearly not a business travellers hotel and aimed at a party culture. The second night‚Äôs sleep was amazing - but I imagine that being so tired from the previous night is the reason why. The shower in the room is amazing. It was refreshing to wake up to. We didn‚Äôt have breakfast on either days as we didn‚Äôt understand how it worked and as there was no breakfast instructions given on check in saved the embarrassment and paid for breakfast at work. Surely a ‚Äúhave you stayed with us before‚Äù would have been helpful on check in so these things could have been explained. This hotel is a million miles away from the traditional Marriott which is just so welcoming and user friendly, I felt like the Moxy was not and the crew members did not do their best to help guests have the best stay they could. On check out the crew member attempted to charge us for the stay, if another crew member had come along I‚Äôm not sure what would have happened as we hadn‚Äôt been asked to swipe an authorising card so clearly it was a prepaid room. It was another issue that didn‚Äôt make the stay go smoothly. In reflection I‚Äôd choose to stay with another hotel instead of the Moxy when I have to book travel with work - there were some positives however the negatives felt like real challenges for basic service needs. Putting business travellers on the first floor is a stupid idea when lobby music is played until at least 1am.

I would have expected far better for a hotel owned by the Marriott chain. Quite frankly i was shocked. This is NOT a hotel for business, everything from the inappropriate TV advertisements in the room, to the USED CONDOM WRAPPER found on the floor of the room. The room was filthy with hairs all over the bed, and clearly not checked at all. The only positive thing about this hotel was the reception staff who were lovely. Would absolutely not recommend especially not for business travellers. Shocking experience.

So I have a night here for a quick stopover, which is pretty convenient if you land in Stansted airport or gonna catch a early fight next morning, the coach stop just around 10 mins from hotel. And London City airport is even closer. So the hotel itself is small but in hip style, it's like a budget version of W. And the highlight of this hotel is it's next to the big shopping mall, Westfield. And you can keep the luggage overnight, if you are doing a weekend getaway like me, then you can always pick up the luggage when you on the way back. You can do the last minute shopping here, you can find all the major UK brand here, like a huge Primark. So I will say just stay here if you don't have much time in London and all you want is a bit shopping. If you have more time, I will say stay in town.

Public areas are very smart and offer a comfortable place to work or drink. Rooms are fine and have everything expected of a modern business hotel.  Service was friendly throughout and they were very accommodating when I asked to be moved and on that topic I would be cautious of bedrooms on the lower floors on the rear of the property as they overlook rail lines heading in to a very busy Stratford station especially if you are a light sleeper like me . Not an extensive bar menu and the food was average Good value but caution regarding bedroom choice , ask for courtyard or front of hotel and I would eat out

column9: Good value hotel for East London
column10: We stayed one night for a family wedding nearby. We had two family rooms and a twin. The family rooms were large and easily accommodated two adults and two children. The standard double was much smaller. Beds comfortable. Not ideal for a long business stay due to lack of desk in room. Breakfast was much better than expected with omelettes and bacon as well as a good range of cold items and therefore good value.

To be honest reading half the reviews in here i didn‚Äôt know what to expect when i arrived at this hotel. However i was pleasantly surprised. The checkin desk doubles up as the bar n the middle of what feels like a bit of a night club or entertainment bar. The atmosphere was nice and welcoming. I did see a few older patrons sitting at the bat looking a bit disgusted but i gather they were expecting traditional for a Marriott branded hotel. The rooms Are an ok size and exceptionally clean which is a bonus. Bathroom is quite small but it works as a single occupant. They don‚Äôt have draws just some hooks, but again for a one night business trip was fine for me. I could even do two nights here and that would be ok. Room temperature was easy to adjust and there is a light under the bed so that if you get up in the middle of the night it lights your path which is super cool. The only downside for me because i was super tired was that the couple in the room next door was SUPER LOUD and i don‚Äôt mean talking either, so that showed me the walls are quite thin. I would book this again for overnight stays when i need to be in my London office. Great location too.

My first time at this hotel, picked it by price but the closeness to Statford station makes it a great choice as there are many different train/underground lines running thru here. Hotel is luxury for budget range IMHO and well organised, room is decent size (certainly for London) only bathroom is a touch small. Stayed for 2 nights.

So we arrived at the moxy a hour after the official check in time, I was told I would need to wait longer to check in. After waiting half a hour I chased the staff about our room, still apparently unable to find our room (even though the women next to me who had just turned up hoping for a room, had been given one. I booked 4 weeks in advance!). It appeared as if the 2 staff finding my room didnt have much of a clue why it wasnt ready. Eventually we got our key and the room was fine, iv stayed in a moxy before in Amsterdam so I knew what the rooms were like, and I enjoy the layout. The only issues was the shower filled up so if you were in there for a half decent amount of time you panicked it would overflow onto the floor. The bed sheet isn't fitted so that kept coming off the mattress during the night which is pretty irritating. Other then these issues the room was clean, the location of the hotel is perfect, I couldn't hear the trains go by. I just think customer service could have been improved especially when I booked in advance and travelled 3 hours to the hotel, yet a person stood right next to me got a room right away.

column9: Excellent customer service in an Excellent location!
column10: I had the pleasure of staying at the Moxy Stratford for 5 nights last week. The location is great. Steps away from Stratford station and Mall, with all types of shops and restaurants.  Initially I was a little surprised at the minimalist, edgy presentation of the hotel. But it is quite charming and very satisfying. The rooms are clean with great showers. The breakfast is good and filling for a 4 star hotel. But I must Say, The service was exceptional! The management and staff that I interacted with throughout my stay were 5 Star. Luca the manager, was so helpful and responsive. It seemed like he was there in the lobby 24/7 but he was always delightful to see and eager to assist with questions, directions, suggestions. Efficiently responding to any concern.Clearly, Guest satisfaction is important to him. And the team definitely takes a cue from Luca. Gloria who checked me in was sparkling and attentive. I enjoyed the welcome drink, and she took the time to explain all the amenities and breakfast selection. I highly recommend The Moxy Stratford and will definitely return because of the excellent guest service. Hopefully next time a room with the lovely little balcony will be available. I am a Marriot  Bonovoy loyalist will be looking for Moxy hotels at home in the U.S.  Thank you for a wonderful stay in the UK. Luca!Theresa B

This hotel is cute but small. It does not have the amenities of other Marriott hotels. They don‚Äôt have ironing boards/ irons, no face towels and community soap which the y refill the container. No garbage can in the room but 1 tiny trash can in bathroom. Thin comforter in bed with flimsy pillows. No safety bar on the door to keep people out even if they‚Äôre able to unlock the door. Most importantly no room safe. My credit card was stolen from my purse that was left inside my luggage. I used the card to check into the hotel and put it back in my wallet with all the other cards. The next day I took my debit card and my 2 credit cards out of my wallet and left all my department store cards and that Marriott card in the wallet inside the purse. I was going to a NFL game so I only took a small clear purse with me. After returning from the game I wanted place everything back in my other purse and noticed every department store card was there and Marriott card was missing. My husband and I looked around the room to make sure it wasn‚Äôt there. I did not report it to the front desk because I have no proof. I only used this card to pay for our room at checkin. I swiped the card in the machine myself and placed it back into my wallet. After that we went straight up stairs to our room. In my opinion this is not a safe hotel. We had about 25 people with us at this hotel. Our friends were afraid to leave their two 15 year old and 19 year old in the room for a few hours by themselves even though the grandmother was on the same floor. I was definitely a bit nervous at night because there is no safety latch on the door. Of course the door locks but anyone could gain fool access with a key card. We stayed there 3 nights but were gone all day during the day. My friend recommended this hotel because she stayed at one in New York. I would not ever stay in this hotel again. By the way, I cancelled the credit card before I left London. I believe the person was waiting to use it when I checked out the hotel. This way,  I wouldn‚Äôt accuse the hotel staff. Better luck next time!

As soon as you walked into the hotel, the decoration was playful and information are written on wall decorations. Hotel offer hopon bus to the airport which is convenieint, close to the shop and even has bus stop right outside the hotel if prefer public transport. But what was more pleasing is that the hotel offer free coffee in the lounge, it has gym, table tennis, foosball table (if that's how you spell it, pool table and even private lounge you can sit in.

My room overlooked Stratford station so until 12-30 at night and from 6am I could hear trains and also the platform announcements! Impossible to sleep until after trains stop. Room is fine and what you would expect for the price but if you stay here make sure you request a room not on the train side as it will wake you up/keep you up

Overall this is a decent hotel, and I can see it would be perfect if you need a quick place to crash. The hotel is right next to the station and Westfield so is super easy to travel, go out for food, and buy anything you need. Complimentary drink on arrival is a nice touch, with clean room and nice communal areas. However, I feel overall the hotel is overpriced, I got a discounted rate and still felt that was too much for what was on offer. The room was extremely basic, with no tea or coffee, very small space and not even a bin. Didn't feel like we could relax in the space, so tried to stay out as late as possible. The breakfast is ¬£12 which we decided was excessive considering what was on offer (nothing cooked and very little choice). The staff were friendly but there was only ever one member on the front desk, which left queues when it came to check in and out, annoying when you need to catch a train. So overall it was fine, but we would unfortunately not stay again.

I stayed here for 3 nights for work and the hotel instantly made me forget work each evening I entered the crowdy bar/reception area. Good music, good looking crew and good vibes.The room was very comfortable except very little space to put your stuff away (no closets).Breakfast is varied and fresh. I will be back in one of the Moxy‚Äôs.

column9: You can not control the temperature of your room, my room was about 23¬∫ C (73¬∫ F)
column10: You can not control the temperature of your room, I had to open the window my room was about 23¬∫ C (73¬∫ F). It's impossible to cool the room down! I had to sleep with the curtains open to have a lower temperature, but it was still hot. Moreover, we pretty much had a few sleepless nights because of it.Attempting to build an affordable hotel, reducing costs by removing phones from rooms, clothing space and a locker, which is good. They sinned on something essential: temperature control.The hotel is clean and has a decent location, 3 min to Stratford Station. Based on my internet speed tests: 10 Mbps (download speed), 8 Mbps (upload speed). The room was clean, modern and quiet. A cool thing is, you can use Google chrome cast on the tv of this hotel. No phone, you have to go back down to reception. The hotel is beautiful, but the Air Conditioner (AC) is a basic that I expect for a room with this price.

Stayed here as attending the Para-Swimming World Championships at the National Aquatics Centre.  A great modern hotel, lots of socialising space on the ground floor, was very popular.  Minimalist rooms, but less opportunity to leave something behind if there is nowhere to put it!  Lovely fluffy towels, toiletries supplied.  Only thing I was surprised about was that a kettle seemed not to be standard - on arrival I was told that I had been upgraded to a room with a kettle, and even so it came with paper cups, but that was the only difference between the Moxy and other much more expensive places to stay.  Will definitely stay here again if in the area.  Thanks for a lovely stay.

Having stayed in hotels in London at ¬£300 a night I didn‚Äôt hold out much hope for Moxy but my goodness was I wrong. This hotel has absolutely everything - and more - that you could need or want for a couple of nights in London. We were over for the Radio 2 Hyde Park concert so just needed a base and this hotel was just perfect. Welcoming check in staff. Spotlessly clean rooms - which were a really good size and a perfectly adequate, modern, clean bathroom with good comfy bed, I‚Äôd struggle to find criticism!!Would have liked a bin (spent at least 20 mins looking for one in room!) and the flashing smoke detectors were beyond annoying but could be easily rectified. Fantastic hotel and will definitely be back. No hesitations in recommending - in fact I thoroughly recommend you make the booking!

A lovely hotel. Visited recently with my boyfriend. Lovely comfortable foyer/lobby area which smelled amazing as soon as you walked through the doors! The bar was adjoined with the reception which was a unique feature. Plenty of staff who were all very helpful. No restaurant but you could order food from the bar which looked delicious. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. bed was the comfiest bed we have ever slept in! Powerful, gorgeous shower and clean bathroom. The only issue we experienced was that the chromecast device connected to our tv would not work and neither would the Internet Tv but the staff did try to fix it and it wasn't a feature we were expecting anyway so we weren't too disappointed. The room was soundproof so we slept great.Located right beside Stratford station and Westfield shopping centre and a 5 minute walk from London Stadium.We will definitely be back!

Very close to the train station, the hotel looks pretty modern and young. The reception is the bar of the hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. It‚Äôs just between two big shopping malls. One of the cheapest hotel in the area but still very nice.

Overall a good hotel.Decent location, near to Stratford Station. External rooms either over look a car park and road or the train lines. I did not find it noisy, however reception do ask if you would like an inner facing room which they say is quieter. Rooms are simply but nicely furnished. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Which is a good cost saving.This is compensated by a large reception area and ground floor seating where you can make your own tea or coffee. Decent wi-fi and en-suite.

The staff was so friendly, aspecialy Gloria.Good service, clean rooms.The food in the morning was also great.Houskeeping refeshed the room evry day.The style of the hotel was very trendy.I also loves the small detaill, like the wrings on the mirrors with a funny text written on it.

column9: Cheap stop over while visiting London
column10: Excellent location with great transport links to the centre, right in the heart of Stratford. It was such good value for money, we knew to expect the basics but were pleasantly surprised. Hotel was a little dirty in the communal areas, the quirky lift writing we've seen in pictures were all rubbed off and we didn't feel very welcomed when we checked in. But as expected for the price. We had a deal on Moxy website where we got free breakfast (they tried it charge us at check in, but easily rectified). Being coeliac i didn't expect to be able to have much apart from the usual yoghurt and coffee, but they had gluten free rolls, gluten free cereal, fruits, ham, cheese... the list goes on. Possibly the best choice of gluten free breakfasts I have ever hat, great detail Moxy! I did have one negative however, it was our anniversary and I had been emailing them on and off for a few weeks, trying to organise one of their quirky room decorations that Ive seen on instagram, they are brilliant! The guy I was chatting with said he can do small ones free of charge or larger paid ones. So we agreed on a small something to surprise my husband. We also requested a high floor (we're on the older side now and like our sleep!). We arrived to our room on the first floor and no decoration at all. Wasn't as issue as like I said, it was such a good deal, just would have been nice as those touches were what made us choose the hotel. Overall, great budget hotel to stay if your in London and are prepared to get the tube. I would stay again, but maybe not expect too much.

column9: Good value for money, but still below expectations.
column10: Just came back from a 2 nights stay and I am not impressed. I knew it was going to be basic (I picked it only because I needed a Bonvoy hotel last minute and this was cheap), but I was expecting something better.The hotel style is minimal and modern, this meant no wardrobe and no desk in the room, plus close to zero space in the bathroom. No amenities at all (e.g. no toothbrush, no shower-cap, etc.). Anyway, if you know this in advance, it's not the end of the world. PROs: 3min walk from Stratford tube, the entrance/lounge areas look very modern/trendy, bed is ok, very good shower, wi-fi is good both in the lounge and in the rooms (or at least in the 613 where I stayed).  The complimentary glass of sweet alcoholic or non-alcoholic drink upon arrival as nice too.CONs: breakfast (¬£12) is probably the worst hotel breakfast I ever had. Just filter coffee, almost no fruits selection, low quality charcuterie/cheese and there was also no juice at all, at least on Friday morning between 8:20-8:45am.Moxy doesn't offer all normal benefits for Platinum members (e.g. no free breakfast), however they also did nothing to make the Platinum experience nice. I got the $10 + $10 Food & Beverage credit (a tenner for each guest) and used part of it to pay for breakfast on day 1, leaving ¬£4-5 of credit. My Gf was then going to use it for a drink and I had to argue 5min over the phone (I had to leave early that day) with the manager Luca in order to make this happen, as apparently you cannot use the credit on the day you check out. Non-sense, as till you check out you're still an hotel guest. It was not about the money, it was about the principle and customer service in general. Also, on my first night I arrived at 11:10pm and asked confirmation about the water bottle in the room (99% of hotels in the Bonvoy programme give you 1 or 2 per day). Well, Moxy is in that 1% that provides absolutely nothing. you have to buy one.

Visited this hotel for 2 nights whilst on a course in London. Really friendly staff who were more than happy to help, welcoming and polite. The hotel is really modern and the room was lovely and clean with air con at no extra cost. Towels were changed daily, there is a hair dryer in the room. There is also a room where you can iron your clothes I didn‚Äôt need to use it but was made aware it was available to use. My room was at the front near a busy road but I had no problems with noise. Stratford station is a 2 minute walk away so good for commuting. The only reason I haven‚Äôt given full marks is the food, don‚Äôt get me wrong the food I did eat was lovely but there is not a huge selection and they don‚Äôt have something as simple as a burger and chips. There are hotdogs on the menus and wedges but you need to buy both separately which then becomes too big a portion. The same with you can get lasagne and wedges separate but i found it too much and wasted some. Breakfast was included I had no complaints with breakfast  as it filled my needs I would normally just have toast, fruit and a yoghurt all were available however if you want a big fry up for breakfast you won‚Äôt get it here. The coffee from the machine also isn‚Äôt great but boiling water is available if you wanted to take your own. Overall I would stay here again as the cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff is perfect.

The air con wouldn't turn up in temperature the bed was like a massive pillow in the way you sank in. Loved the complimentary drink upon check in and staff where very helpful. With abit of work on the rooms I feel this could he an above par hotel and I'd like to return one day to see so

Let‚Äôs start with the positives! The location of the Moxy is great, being a very short walk from Stratford station. I lived in London for nearly 20 years and was catching up with friends in the East End, so the location was perfect. Other positives are that the bed was fairly comfy and both the shower and hairdryer were powerful (rare to find in many hotels these days). Oh, one really good thing is the light under the bed that comes on automatically when you get up to go to the loo in the night. What a great idea!  I think most of the reviews on here have picked up on most of the negatives - the size of the room and bathroom being the first thing. At least Travelodge rooms have space to swing a cat. I had a young child with me and there was nowhere for us to ‚Äòchill out‚Äô on a seat with there only being one chair in the room. Although the bed was comfy, after 10 minutes in it, the bed sheet became untucked and was rolled up under us which didn‚Äôt make for the best night‚Äôs sleep. And sleeping became even more difficult with trains trundling past at all hours. Another issue with the room is the lack of tea and coffee. We were told that this was unlimited and available downstairs, but when you have a young child in tow, it‚Äôs impossible to pop down and make a brew after putting him to bed!Aside from the room, there is the trendy bar area which doubles as a Reception. We didn‚Äôt get the warmest welcome in all honesty when we arrived to check in. The staff all seemed very ‚Äòcasual‚Äô and not too concerned about good customer service. We had breakfast included in our stay, which was basically a continental breakfast. The only hot choices were omelettes and baked beans. It was ok - nothing special! Definitely would not have paid for it. Overall, the hotel is functional and well-located. A few touches would make this better such as tea and coffee facilities in rooms, greater professionalism from the staff and more seating options in the bedrooms.

column9: OK- Housekeeping woke us up 3 times before the checkout !!
column10: Few good points, It is a basic/budget good looking hotel with very basic facilities. Rooms are clean.Smart Tv which is good. No phone in the room so if there is anything you need to ask reception you have to go down all the way or call from your mobile, no info cards about hotel or services if any available in hotel, no tea, coffee,etc which now a days is quite basic in budget hotels as well. Checkout was supposed to be at 12pm according to our confirmation, Housekeeping walked into our room 3 times, 9.15am, 10.30am, 11.15am and we ended up just getting up and leaving. Very Very annoying. Not sure about staying back here again. Considering its a Marriott name it can be better with adding little more basics to basics.

My partner booked this hotel when we decided a weekend away was needed and London was our destination. The hotel is clean, tidy, respectful and quirky. Check in was quick and easy and the hotel is in a great location right next to the Westfield shopping centre, across the road from a small food shopping area and next to the train and tube station. All within very short walking distance. Sadly there were a few things that let the experience down for us. There‚Äôs no parking at the hotel however we parked at Westfield shopping centre for 24hours at ¬£15. Great price. On to the room: - It was very cold when we arrived in the room and had to change the air con drastically. - No phone in the rooms you‚Äôll have to go downstairs if you need anything- There‚Äôs no wardrobe in the room. - Bathroom is very small and tight. Two people in there would be very personal. - Only two pillows on the bed that were extremely flat so had to request another two pillows. Also had to request a second duvet as, again, it was cold. - The request for extra pillows and the duvet had to be done twice as the first request didn‚Äôt seem to go through to the right person. (Having to go downstairs twice) - No tea/ coffee, kettle, glasses or cups -WiFi wouldn‚Äôt connect to the laptop. One thing I did really like and thought was different, you need to tap your room key in the lift and then press the floor number in order to access the room. If it‚Äôs just a quick stay and you‚Äôre not too fussy about the room then this is a great hotel for location, transport and amenities within the area.
